description:
Wow. Ok, so we waited over an hour on a Friday afternoon arriving at ~2:30pm.  I guess Friday afternoon is starting to get into the weekend territory and the turnover was very slow for some reason.  We almost gave up, but are glad we waited it out!

It's hard to describe the Swan Oyster Depot experience.  The menu and service is simple. They serve great seafood!  They're an institution!  

Hubs and I had: clam chowder (slightly briny, but not too fishy), smoked salmon (on French bread, with some shrimp salad on the side), combo salad (comes with small shrimp, prawns, and crab).  Oh, and don't forget the Anchor Steam cause this is the kind of food that goes great with a beer.  We were stuffed so the food was generously portioned. 

The food is just GOOD and such a joy and delight. There's no pretension here.  On the surface, it's hard to say why this place is so great, but it is such a joy to here. And I say that having been to other great SF places like Tadich Grill, Hog Island, Waterbar.  

Worth the wait. Though, we'll def try to come back in a weekday!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
The worst service we've ever had. The guys that work here hate their job.  Yes, there may be a line out front, but that's because it's tiny inside.

We won't be back. Customers should not be treated so poorly.  There's tons of other places for us to spend our $ in the city.
author: Vi Y.

description:
Food Poisoning!!
I got severe food poisoning from them. I call to tell them that to have them change their stock and they were very rude and unprofessional. They took a defensive stance immediately which means they are used to this.

Don't eat there!
author: Bassel F.

description:
I am backkkkk after two years! And it's been too damn long!!! 
Tried some new dishes and had some old favorites. All are astounding, mind-blowing, and brilliant. 

Pro tips: this place is cash only and prepare to wait at least an hour. 

Ambience: old fashioned interior made me feels like travel back to 1950s. Especially the sound of the cash machine. "Ding--"

Food: 
Clam chowder: unlike other place, it has more clam flavors rather than just creamy taste
Shrimp cocktail: unbeatable! fresh and delicious. 
Oyster (6 shigoku & 6 N/A) : I like the clean and creamy taste of the oysters. They had the freshest oysters in San Francisco Bay Area. 
Combination Cocktail: still incredible, although the oyster in the combination are too fatty. 
Half Moon Bay Sea Urchin: can't go wrong with the fresh uni, the uni still alive while delivering to the table. 

Drinks:
A glass of sauvignon Blanc is the best company for this amazing seafood feast.

The best place for raw seafood in San Francisco!!Highly recommend to all the seafood lovers.
author: Regina W.

description:
Fantastic seafood blessed by Bourdain. What's not to love? And the hype is strong because you will wait an hour to 1.5 hours, especially on the weekend. Fortunately, unless you have a soft spot for the sit down experience, the take out line is 5 min. There are two lines but the door - the one on left closer to counter is to order take out. While in line, you may see them bring out some fresh uni!

The Sicilian sashimi is fresh and delicious. Some may feel the olive oil and capers ruins the sashimi, but it does add a different take and feel to it that I appreciate. And for the $,  you get a solid amount. The oysters here and so good and fresh too. 

Will have to be back and get more.
author: Will X.

description:
So close and yet so far. Came here late Saturday afternoon - following the Fleetweek airshow. Line was not too long... all looked good. Closing time was 5:30, so there seemed plenty of time to make it in. 

At 4:30 one of the servers stuck his head out and declared that the last seating would be at 4:45. He looked at the line and said... I don't like your chances. None of us made it. As Colonel Kurtz said... "the horror. The horror..."

Sure enough: at 4:45 he waved us all off (unless ordering takeout). 

Better luck tomorrow.
author: Richard L.

description:
I had to check out this place after seeing The reviews and knowing Anthony Bourdain loved it. Yes, it may be a tourist stop after he aired it on his show, but it is definitely worth the visit.

It's cash only and often has a hour long line, but I lucked out by taking cash out prior and for some reason there was only two people ahead of me at 1PM.

The seafood was fresh and the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. I honestly wish I had this place around the corner from home, but I'm lucky I don't because I would be poor.

This place is super authentic and is a stop you must take while in San Fran!
author: Christie N.

description:
If you like seafood, this place is an absolute must!  The oysters are super freshly shucked, their sashimi place is very delicious, and their crab meat salad was amazing!

If they have the crab back, you should definitely get it! The only bad thing is that crab backs are seldomly available and when they are, they're sold out very quickly!

There's always a long line here so get there early before they open!
author: Jang N.

description:
Been dreaming to come here for quite some time.  Knew the place was super small, so wanted to avoid a weekend.  Finally found a weekday to come try out SOD for my wife's bday -- a true seafood lover.

Place has a classic SF seafood feel to it.  The service matches the look, giving you a truly memorable experience. Great attention to detail, with generous portions of fresh lemon wedges, bowls of crisp oyster crackers, some excellent, crusty sourdough bread.

Seafood was good, not amazing but enjoyable.  However on this day, there were more negatives than I'd like to have encountered.

Fist off as we stood in line, we watched them make the crab salads through the window.  Instead of using tongs or gloves, they just use their bare hands to scoop handfuls onto your salad.  My wife noticed one guy had dirty fingernails.  I didn't see it, but I know she was instantly turned off.  Mind you... I'm trying to take her somewhere special for her birthday, and she's sensitive to cleanliness.

Upon sitting, I order fresh uni, crab back, chowder, crab salad, and a dozen oysters / clams on the half shell.  

First thing he tells me is he recommends we save the uni for last, since it's best that way.  Hey... you're the expert, whatever you recommend,
I'm down!  My wife loves seafood, but never had uni, so this was a huge part of our trip.

Next he said there's no more crab back, can only get it if we order a half crab, so once again I said... No Prob!  He brought us the crab shell and my wife ate it up.

The chowder was so so sadly.  Next be brought the crab salad and oysters / clams.  I asked if he had any cocktail sauce, he said that he did, but that he didn't recommend it on the salad, but I told him it was for the oysters.  Got a little puzzled after that advice... then things got more weird. (Btw the crab leg meat on our salad was so skimpy, not at all like these photos we saw on Yelp)

I told him we were ready for the uni.  He went to go get it, came back and told us someone had just ordered the last one!  We came here specifically for that for my wife's birthday, but due to your recommendation, now we can't get it??

OK... so from there I asked if he was still bringing the half crab.  He said "you ordered that?"  I said "yeah, you told me I had to."  Surprised, he goes and gets it, and the claws and legs are SO small, but I just figured that's how they are.  But then the guys next to me get theirs and it's SO much bigger!  Mind you we are not paying by the pound, so we are just getting hosed.  Not to mention, it would have been a nice gesture to hook us up after screwing us over on the uni.

By now I'm just in SMH mode and just can't believe this place.  It went from so cool and amazing, to this really sucks in about 5 minutes.  I was still really hungry, but there really wasn't anything left on the menu that was going to fill me up -- not a place to come and get your stomachs filled.

So as my tip says, if you're going to come here, try to get one of the older, more seasoned servers.  We had one of the young guys, who was really trying, but just couldn't deliver us the type of experience we deserved sadly.

I had to go eat a real lunch elsewhere after we left.  So this was like $150 in appetizers for 3.  And then they take cash only!!!

To be honest, their rating is hovering just above 2 stars for the experience, but I'm giving them benefit of the doubt and believing it's at least 3 stars on most other days.  They are all nice guys after all.... but cmon fellas, I was baited.
author: Rustin L.

description:
This place is sprinkled with Anthony Bourdains legacy, from the line, preservation of its originality, friendly personable employees, to the quality of the grub. 

It's nothing short of a fun dining experience as you sit there on a seafood bar shoulder to shoulder with a dozen other folks. There are 4-5 people working the kitchen in front of you, and you just watch them work in full efficiency and speed prepare your food. They're best known for the smoked salmon which we got to sample, but other items don't disappoint. My BF and I got a crab, bowl of chowder, and a dozen variety oysters. Absolutely divine!! The best was the chowder, surprisingly. Super home-tasting, not that heavy with cream, and not overpowering with a fishy flavor. 

This is a must have foodie experience in your time at SF!!!
author: Shirley S.

description:
What a great lunch! Started with Anchor Steam on tap. Crusty sourdough bread always a must in SF. The chowder is a little less milky than most but had a lot of clam flavor. 

The young woman sitting next to us had a plate of delicious looking sashimi. It was on their secret menu. Since she was closing her eyes in perfect happiness we had to try it. Our server gave us two each of his recommended choices. Our favorite were the scallops but they were all mouth watering. We ordered half dozen oysters, all were delectable and tasted clean of the sea. 

Finally we ordered their crab salad w Louie dressing. Indescribable!

Five enthusiastic stars!
author: Brian O.

description:
So happy I finally got to try this place!! We had to wait a little over an hour but it was well worth it. The fish was so fresh and tasty.  The clam chowder wasn't very thick but was full of flavor. The sashimi was great. (saw it on the secret menu in the bathroom) We had tuna, salmon, hamachi and scallops. I've never had raw scallops before. They were probably my favorite thing on the plate. We also tried a variety of oysters. They were really fresh too. The service was amazing. The staff were all friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. They really make your experience stand out. Don't forget that this place is a fish market! Instead of waiting you can always order fish by the pound and walk out. 

This place is cash only!! You can leave a friend in line and go find an ATM while you wait for a seat.
author: Erin S.

description:
Getting a coveted bar seat at Swan Oyster Depot usually requires some time in line. I came early to make the first round and it was completely worth the wait. Those peeking in from the door were able to place some drink orders while they waited to pass the time.

I knew immediately I'd order a bowl of clam chowder. Their chowder isn't full of cream so it's much lighter and you can really taste the clams. There are big bowls of crackers on the bar table to scoop in but I prefer dipping bread in it.

The smoked salmon on bread here is the best I've ever had. Slices of salmon over sourdough and just a little bit of diced red onions is heavenly. The side salad of chopped iceberg lettuce with shrimp and  sauce was a nice palate refresher.

Some oysters and a prawn cocktail were inhaled in between. Good though nothing out of ordinary. We finished the meal with a spoon and crab back... I call it crab butter. Spooning mouthfuls is indulgent! Delicious when soaked up with some more bread though.

C A S H only. I made sure to bring plenty along with my appetite.
author: Samantha L.

description:
It's exactly as you have seen from Anthony Bourdain or other reviews.
Super long wait (1.5 hr for us)
Very friendly staff who will explain and help you with anything you ask
Very fresh seafood

Tips:
The Crab back may not amazing for those who are not into crab brains and juices.
Very very cramped space but there are hangers in the walls for bags and coats
Staff takes their time to help customers and such so...be prepared to wait
author: Philemon W.

description:
Every time I run past this place, I see a line casually going all the way down the street. I figured if I showed up 5 minutes after opening at 10:30am on a Thursday, I'd be able to get seated immediately. WRONG. Every seat at their bar was taken, and there was another group waiting for the next round of seating. 10 minutes later, the line behind us had grown longer. Apparently people don't need to work around here.

This place gives off a great neighborhood feel, and it is no frills seafood that is fresh and delicious. You see the seafood heaped in the window and the servers scooping it into cups and bowls. We ordered the crab back, prawn cocktail, crab cocktail, and clam chowder. The clam chowder looks grainy and tastes like it was actually made of clam. The crab back was chilled and had unidentifiable pieces of crab that tasted almost like tofu. My favorite was the prawn cocktail, which comprised of jumbo prawns that were fat and juicy in a sweet ketchupy sauce. 

The servers are friendly but efficient. The total was around $50. It's cash only, which makes sense once you look at the old-school register they use, which has probably been there since this restaurant opened. I'll be back to try their salads and sashimi, and next time I'll make sure to show up before opening!
author: Sophie W.

description:
Sometimes I hate when people complain about waits. I mean, maybe I just over-prepare by reading up on the restaurant. As such, my coworkers and I left work at 10:45am on a Tuesday to head over to Swan Oyster before it opened, knowing the restaurant is v small. Ta da, no wait for us! 

What an experience. I love the casual diner vibe. I got the crab salad which was phenomenal. I would love to come back and try other things but will have to wait for a day when I can leave work at 11am.
author: Sophia L.

description:
This place does not need another five star review, but being that it's practically a San Francisco legend, I couldn't resist. 
Like many other people, I heard about this place from Anthony Bourdain's show Parts Unknown. I specifically planned this to be my very first stop to San Francisco straight from the airport. We were arriving on a Friday, and I knew that it opens at 10:30 and that people start lining up way before that, so I was concerned that we would have to wait. 

Our flight landed at SFO around 8:15, but by the time we got our rental car and came into the city, it was 10:15. After parking in the garage around the corner we made our way to the door in line. We were very fortunate to be part of the first group that was seated, otherwise we would have been hungry grumpy customers after an early flight. 

Onto the food: the oysters were fresh and everything we expected. We pretty much let the guy behind the counter decide for us, seeing that they're very old school without an online presence or menu to choose in advance. We also got the crab cocktail, sashimi, sea urchin, and two cups of clam chowder. The total cost came out to $104. Very pricey and they only accept cash, so come prepared to pay! 

Side tip: do not come here wearing anything LA on it. We're from San Diego, and my husband was wearing a Padres cap. That also happened to be the weekend the Padres were in town, and the young guys behind the counter were playfully calling us out. But at least we weren't Dodger fans, they told us! Hahaha. I love this city :)

Until next time, San Francisco!
author: Ashley L.

description:
Two hour wait at 12:30 on Friday.  Not gonna do it.  Go to the ferry bldg and get fresh shucked in 15 seconds.   Went to restaurant next door.  Sad but not gonna wait in the street in the sun 

Update.  Just went there 9/23.  Got there 1/2 hr before opening.  Good call.  Best thing there is actually their clam chowder.  Best I've ever had.
author: Hmmmmm O.

description:
Other worldly delicious. The freshest seafood, great diner ambiance with the jukebox tunes playing loudly. Id wait in line any day of the week for this food, albeit not if I had to go back to work....

Uni, female crab, oysters, shrimp, my gawd I could keep going. I could stay here for hours.

Family owned business too, owned by a family of brothers who work behind the counter every day. I found this via Bourdain, may he Rest In Peace for his kindness of sharing this with the world.

The Sicilian sashimi and the female crab were the highlights. The fish is just so fresh, the scallops were sweet almost tasted sugary (in the best of ways), and the female crab back mmm dunk fresh sourdough bread into it - tasted like uni bursting with the sea!
author: Emily M.

description:
Arrived at 10AM on a Monday while they were still setting up (they open at 10:30). We came back at 10:20 and there was already a long line wrapped around the front of the building! 

Needless to say, the wait was totally worth it-- our server was very cheerful and gave us a tasty selection of seafood. PRO TIP: Order "sashimi" -- it's their spin on it, where they serve you slices of their fresh fish drizzled with olive oil, capers, red onions and cracked black pepper. (I'll upload a picture) It was hands down my favorite meal, and I'm still thinking about it now that I'm back in the east coast. 

The crab back and the combination seafood salad is also great. Dip that bread in the crab back with some buttah ~~
author: Justina E.

description:
Yes, it's worth the wait. You get the old school yet hipster vibe eating seafood in an old school joint with a secret menu highlighted by Anthony Bordain. 

Everything we had was delicious and I'd order everything again and more. 

The crab back with sourdough bread is delish, I wish it was served warm but it's good nevertheless.

The Sicilian sashimi plate (not on the menu) is equal or beats most Japanese restaurants in the US. It's thinly sliced sashimi with olive oil, black pepper and capers.

Crabsantheum is a plate of crab legs served with a dress like Louie or even a crab fat dressing

Scallop sashimi aka "dozen eggs" is a plate of thin, raw scallops on top of ponzu and with a dollop of sriracha.

New England clam chowder is also great but a little different. It's not as thick as your usual chowder but I love it.
author: Rey L.

description: We didn't want to wait 4 hours in line so we got our food to-go. We ordered half a dozen oysters, sashimi plate, and the clam chowder. I was a little sad that they didn't include bread with the clam chowder, like you would get if you were to dine in. The oysters were super fresh and delicious, and their mignonette is great as well. The sashimi plate was good too, but nothing too memorable. The capers added a nice touch. And lastly, the clam chowder...I'm not sure if this is a polarizing opinion but we personally didn't like it. My friend thought it was too runny/soupy and fishy-tasting. But to each their own...I know plenty of other people love their clam chowder. It's cash-only and service is quick if not a little gruff & matter-of-fact.
author: Jen L.

description: Delicious oysters and fresh (mostly raw) fish in a tiny space - maybe 15 counter seats. We went on a holiday Monday at 10.30 am and the wait was still 75 minutes. Try the "dozen eggs" (scallops with sriracha) and the sashimi with capers. So good. Service is casual, but friendly and efficient. Two adults with no alcohol easily ran north of $125 before tip (for lunch).
author: christine f.

description:
This place is overhyped and is not worth the wait. If you want to try this place just order to-go instead of waiting in line. When a place has their menu up with a list of items and prices you assume they would have those items available. I first tried ordering a crab cocktail by asking "may I have an order of crab cocktail?" and the server replied "no, you may not" not jokingly but sternly with a straight face. It was so offputting. Instead, he should have simply said they do not have crab. Well, lesson learned- ask what they do have instead of trying to order something that is posted on the menu. Ended up with a dozen mixed oysters and small plate of sicilian sashimi (off menu). Everything tasted fresh however flies kept flying around the oysters. Our server disappeared at the end but luckily another server noticed and was able to assist. 

I learned uni is usually available on Tuesday's and Friday's, but it is hit or miss and if they don't have an item on display in their window then they don't have it. They have bar seating only and they take one order from you at a time. When you're ready to pay they ask you what you ordered and they verbally tell you how much you owe.
author: Donna M.

description:
Go early and stand in the already forming line.  The place seems like an institution and the gents behind the counter are friendly and helpful with their great service.  

I'm not an oyster guy but the smoked salmon was as good as I've had anywhere.  I feel safe saying it's the best.  Comes with wonderful sourdough bread and capers and onions, and there's also a onion vinegarette and Thai chili oil that makes wonderful accompaniment.

Would gladly come back for the salmon!
author: Shourjo D.

description:
Hey. Anthony Bourdain loved this place. I should too! After multiple trips and missing out since they are closed on Sunday's and evenings and during the week of July 4th I finally got to try it during Semicon week. 

The line took about 45 minutes before we got seated. I was super excited watching them make seafood parfaits as I was standing in line. Although I noticed that they were not all made equally. Some of the staff would pick though and grab the big chunks of crab meat. Others would just grab it. When we were seated, I was disappointed that the staff served people out of order. Why were the three people after us in line served first??!! They already had their food before our order was taken. 

Ordered: seafood combo salad, combo cocktail, clam chowder, beer.

Unfortunately it was a few days after dungeness crab season was over so they were using east coast rock crab in the dishes. The bay shrimp wasn't anything to write home about but the prawns were delicious. They were the highlight of our trip. Clam chowder was also solid and the salad was crisp and delicious. I think timing makes a big difference when visiting.
author: Vicky L.

description:
I told a friend we were heading to San Francisco and she insisted we come here. We showed up around 11:30 or so and waited about an hour, maybe a little more to be seated. The guys at the bar were just excellent, they were so friendly and courteous and efficient but it didn't feel like they were rushing anyone at all despite the line out the door.

The fish was so fresh and prepared so well. Loved everything we had, but it is a little pricey. I still would pay it again because of the quality of food and the service.

Next time I think I'd prefer doing take out and heading over to a park to enjoy the meal instead of waiting in line. Definitely worth the experience once though!
author: Sunita T.

description:
We came on a Sunday around 11:30am thinking we were early (their diner opens at 10:30am) enough to grab a seat. LOL nope. At this time, the line was half a block long. I asked the couple waiting in front how long they've been waiting and they said an hour.... lol so we opted to have our oyster to-go! 

The PROS:
- I'll agree with Anthony Bourdain on the freshness of their seafood and the friendliness of their staff. We hope to come back and sit down one day :)
- The to-go wrapping was great! They layer a plastic plate with parchment paper, put your goodies on it, and then put another layer of parchment/regular paper to top off the goodies. They also tape the sides for you and remind you to not move it around a lot so all the oyster juices can stay!
- PRO-TIP: Bring it to a bubble tea shop with seating and open it up/ eat it there! LOLOL.

The MEH: 
- The wait. 
- The sad looks on the face of the people waiting in line after they realized that they could have just done a take-out/dine out order like us 8)
author: Vy T.

description:
First things first they open at 10 not 10:30 as listed so Yelp should look into getting that updated as folks need to start lining up before 9:30 to have any hope of getting in the first seating (for context I got there at 10 on a Saturday and didn't get seated until noon for 2 people). 

Pro-tips: They're cash only and not cheap so remember to have cash!  While in line you can hop inside any time and order beers or red-eyes (essentially a bloody beer that incorporates the juice from fresh oysters yum!) to help pass what will be a very long wait.

Once inside it is a no frills joint but everyone is super friendly and helpful if you have any questions.  I think our server was the owner's son and he was awesome in just deciding portions of things that seemed right for the two of us after we told him everything we wanted to order:

- Crab back - A must get. So briny and rich and really just the essence of the crab.  Served with a side of sourdough bread which is perfect for just sopping up all that delicious juice.

- Cherrystone clams - These are a personal favorite of mine and theirs were very fresh, meaty and briny.   Add the table side hot sauce for a kick!

- Crabsanthemum - Straight up plate of all crab legs arranged in a flower pattern served with either Louie dressing or, my favorite, a side of their olive oil vinaigrette (equal parts Dijon mustard and crab fat!).  I could've eaten 3 plates of these.

Sicilian Sashimi - Assorted sashimi (today there was ahi, salmon, hamachi, scallop and mackerel) drizzled in olive oil and topped with red onions and capers.  This one was actually not my favorite.  The oil dressing was a bit bland; eating together with capers added some much needed pop but overall not something I'd order again

Dozen Eggs - Thin sliced scallops sitting in a pool of ponzu and topped with drops of sriracha.  This was very tasty as the very thin slices made the scallops just melt in your mouth and the ponzu and sriracha created a really nice sweet and spicy flavor.

Santa Barbara Uni - If you like uni and they haven't run out you know this is a must get.  Super fresh and so creamy and rich as any good uni should be, this was actually also a great bargain at $28 as it came with around 5-6 huge roe sacs.

All told we dropped around $100 per person for all of the above plus 3 drinks, tax and tip so not cheap but absolutely worth it for the quality and freshness of everything we ate.

Hard to say when I'll be back again just due to the insane lines but absolutely worth a try for anyone who hasn't.
author: Aaron K.

description:
For lunch I ordered a half-dozen raw oysters, crab cocktail, a half-smoked salmon and trout plate, half-dozen raw clams, crab back, and clam chowder. All this totaled $77. I ate neither breakfast nor dinner given the amount I ate for lunch.

The raw oysters and clams, as expected, tasted extremely fresh and carried a reasonable price point at ~$3/ea.

The crab cocktail also tasted quite fresh and came with a large, satisfying portion.

The smoked salmon and trout's smokiness seemed understated, allowing the salmon's flavor to rise forward in the palate.

The crab back, as Anthony Bourdain described, was "... like unicorn juice." I wholeheartedly agree. Gulping it all down while holding the crab shell was quite satisfying.

The clam chowder carried quite a lot of clam flavor, unlike other, more disappointing chowder. It did not have too much cream.

In summary, this place represent my seafood paradise.

Note that I arrived at 11AM on Monday and waited 35 minutes for a seat. Once seated, the wait staff, albeit swamped with work, remained cordial and upbeat. Additionally, this establishment only accepts cash payment.
author: Justin S.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but it's over hyped. 

Food was typical seafood dishes with seating very limited. 
Price is definitely  $$$ . I don't mind paying for what it's worth but definitely not worth $$$.

Staff are great even when busy they have a smile on their face. 

Expect to wait for seats since there's only maybe 15 to 20 bar stool seats and the line gets pretty long.
author: Thomas N.

description:
Saw this place on the Zimmern List and had to make a visit while in San Fran. It did not disappoint as it was my favorite meal in the city.

I will say - the line IS long. It just is what it is. When we arrived around 1pm, I asked one of the women at the front how long she had been waiting so far and she said almost 2 hours. I remembered seeing on a Yelp review that they allow to-go orders so that's what we did. I called and placed an order for pickup and it was ready in 20 minutes. I went to the front of the line, squeezed my way in and happily departed with my bag of treasures. We walked one block to a nearby coffee shop and ate it there. I know we missed out on the ambiance and environment of the shop but the food was still good and that's my main concern.

The combination salad with louie dressing is to die for. Very generous portion of super fresh seafood piled on top and the dressing is amazingly creamy. We also had a small order of the Sicilian Sashimi which was excellent. The scallops were my favorite of the plate. Next time I'd want an order of just those! The crab back with bread was just okay. I didn't love it but I didn't hate it - probably wouldn't order it again. I wish the butter/fat was warm.

Looooved the meal overall. I will come here again and again as long as ordering to-go is still an option. However, I will say that I would never wait in a 2+ hour line to eat this food. I'm not sure I would wait in a 2+ hour line to eat any type of food haha.

PS - They accept cash only!
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Got in line at 4:30. Waited for 30 minutes before they told us at 5pm (30 minutes before closing) that the only service thereafter would be takeout. 
Lame.
author: Graham C.

description:
I know I've written countless reviews about Swan Oyster Depot but, every time I leave this place the first thing i want to do is write about how amazing of an experience it is. In my most recent visit, it was just as I left it...perfection. 

I went on a Friday and the wait was about 45 minutes (which isn't terrible for a Friday) but, it was worth it. At this point I have the perfect order and if you'd like to copy (see below). 

- Crab cocktail - make sure to order the cocktail sauce on the side so you can mix in the house made horseradish and dip. 
- Smoked Salmon - easily the best item on the menu
- 1/2 dozen west coast little neck clams
- Crab back and sourdough

Make sure to get a couple Anchor Steam beers alongside as they are the coldest in town and delicious. Heaven on earth.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
This place has the freshest seafood in SF! Got in line at 11 on a Tuesday and we were seated by 12. Expect a line on whatever day of the week you are going. 

Once we got seated our service was excellent! He was able to customize our order to be perfectly portioned for three people. We order two mixed dozens of oysters, two plates of smoked salmon, one sashimi plate, and a bottle of rosé. Bill came out to be a bit over $200.

We loved 3 of the six types of oysters we ordered. I remember the drakes and humboldt bay being standouts. We also were obsessed with how the smoked salmon melted in your mouth on a sliver of fresh sourdough. This place is a SF must!!
author: Sonali M.

description:
Went made it in last night just in the knick of time for my mom's birthday and it was everything we could have hoped for. Our only regret was that we didn't have more time to order one of everything on the menu. (Thanks to the two hour traffic it took us to get in on a Friday eve, we barely got there before they closed. Our fault, not theirs of course.)

My mom's favorite food in the world is crab. Everyone jokes if crab is on the menu, she will be there. We have been meaning to check out Swan Depot for ages. I know, I know how can I be from the Bay Area and have missed one of the most go iconic seafood spots?! So many places, so little time... Well, I'm here to say drop everything and high tail it to Swan Oyster Depot.

The seafood was out of this world. We just got back from two weeks in Alaska and Seattle and let me tell you, they have nothing on Swan Oyster. My son got the clam chowder. With oyster crackers and bread and butter, heavenly. I must note that the bread was the old school sf sourdough bread. Crunchy on the outside with the perfect amount of sour on the soft inside. Perfect combination. My mom ordered the crab cocktail, and when I say she is a crab expert, I'm not kidding. She said it was the best crab she has ever had. I had the prawn cocktail with their cocktail sauce and a touch of horseradish. It was hands down the best prawn cocktail I've ever had. 

As I said we got there just before closing time, so didn't have time to order more. But saw the couple beside us devour trays of oysters and scallops that looked divine. We cannot wait to go back to try the crab back, as well as the crab and lobster in butter. Rumor has it they also have an amazing Cobb salad. Hmmmm, I'm already hungry for more seafood. I cannot wait to add Swan Oyster Depot to my regular restaurant rotation.
author: Victoria O.

description:
I had a weird first time experience so this review is a little wishy-washy. I came around 9:50 and didn't make the cut for the first round. There was a lot going on while we waited for our turn. The workers usually go onto the street and into this basement where they probably store their alcohol. Usually they're cautious of putting orange cones to notify dumb people to watch where they're going but apparently they didn't and some guy fell into the basement and hurt his leg. Chaos ensued and everything was just going nuts but the employees were still making sure their customers were happy.

We ordered: 
1. Clam chowder (with bread n butter)
2. Crab Back
3. Half dozen oysters and half dozen cherry stone clams
4. Medium Sicilian Sashimi plate
5. Uni 

Everything was delicious. What stood out was the uni and the scallops in the sashimi plate. Total came out to $101 before tip.

One thing that grosses me out is that they don't wear gloves.... granted I'm sure a bunch of dirty shit happens in restaurants when I'm not watching but honestly, it's was bit unappetizing to see them handle the food.

Now that I've tried it, my verdict is a solid 4. I wouldn't wait hours for this place though.
author: Catherine T.

description:
I have not been back to Swan's in probably 20 years. Go It is still Awesome!!!! 

Before food channels and the like I used to eat here once a month. Yes a certain tall New Yorker outed this place and forever changed the wait time! 

And one thing I can certainly say is, things have not changed one bit....cept for the insane line out the door ( the place only has 12 counter seats)

Yeah the owners are a bit older but they are still super friendly and hard working.

The seafood is still on point and absolutely  perfect. Everything is super fresh and prepared with true love and respect. Amazing 

If you are visiting San Francisco go and bear the lines. Rejoice in scoring one of the coveted counter seats! 

Their Louie's are legendary chocked full of fresh seafood. 

Their simple Sicilian Sashimi plate (thinly sliced raw salmon, tuna and scallops are served simply with a drizzle of olive oil, freshly cracked black pepper and some capers on top)   is pure perfection. 

A dozen mixed oysters on ice is a rite of passage!!! Try the garlic sauce on the counter with it.

Order their Uni...although it is not on the menu!

Finally, and the dish that put  them on the international food scene:  The legendary Crab Back  an open crab filled with broth, fat, and bits....just order it....you will be blown away. Sop it up with their yummy French Bread....drooooollllll

or even try their secret menu items:

If you are there Saturday morning...ouch....order one of their Red Eye's....a mix of Bud Light with cocktail sauce, lemon juice, Tabasco, Worcestershire, pepper and oyster juice....HELLO WEEKEND!!!!

Supreme Cocktail:  served in a large chowder bowl. It amounts to roughly the size of 3 1/2 normal cocktails... You Baller Diamond Jim Brady!!!

The "dozen eggs" is a plate of thinly sliced raw scallop with ponzu sauce and dotted with sriracha.

Swans makes living in San Francisco so much better!!!
author: David G.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is a San Francisco gem. For seafood lovers out there, this is the place to go for the most fresh and unique experience you'll ever find in the city. I had been wanting to go to SOD for years, but never had the time or opportunity to do so knowing the wait line was also going to be long. I am so glad that I finally visited it today. On a Tuesday morning, I arrived around 10:30 and the first 19 people (there are only 19 seats) were already being served. I was 3rd in line for the second batch. Not bad. The wait was around 30 mins before I was finally seated. I thought I was lucky. 

I immediately ordered the items that I have been dreaming to eat for years. Crab back (with bread and butter), fresh oysters on half shell, and crab salad. The Crab back was delicious. I slurped up that golden fatty soup like it was my last meal. Come to think of it, this trio would probably be my last meal if I had to choose. The crab meat was generous. Enough for two hungry people. The oyster selection was impressive. They were the freshest and tastiest oysters I've had in the Bay Area. I've had great oysters up in Tomales Bay and Humboldt too.  But if you wanna eat their famous oysters in one place (and for less $), you should have them here at SOD. 

The service was great as well. The guys there love what they're doing and proud of their offerings. People seem to really enjoy their time here. It's a bit expensive. But I think if you're gonna splurge on seafood, this is where you should spend it. It's worth it. Seafood should be enjoyed as is anyway. There's no fancy fluffy preparation here. You're not paying for them to add a million ingredients to mask the fish's true taste. Here you really taste the ocean. And it's gooood.
author: Diana M.

description: Second visit. Still great!  Still don't see it as 5 stars.  Almost but not quite. Freshest seafood you will find. The only Italian sashimi I have ever seen. Super friendly workers ( seems like they're all family or at the least great friends).  This time has the clam chowder and crab back.  Both really good. But the wait is still a bit too long. And it's quite pricey.
author: Gerald L.

description:
For a Tuesday afternoon during summer, I waited about 30 minutes for 2 seats. The seats are aligned in a row at a counter. It looks really cramped for people in the center, so my boyfriend and I were lucky to be at the edge close to the door. We had already checked recommendations for food and were ready to order. We decided on the crab back, the half cracked crab, half dozen of cherry stone clams, half dozen of kumamoto oysters, and a large sashimi platter (consists of 20ish pieces of their fresh sashimi of the day for $32 and was not on the menu). All orders came out in a timely manner. First was the crab back, for $8. For those who are familiar with the crab back when they cook crab at home, it tastes the same. Not sure if they add anything to the contents. Nonetheless, it was tasty dipping with the bread that is provided. Next cane the oysters and clams. Being a fan of Kumamoto oysters, it did not disappoint. Their red hot sauce was delicious! I don't think I've ever had raw clams, but these clams were also very good. I wanted more of them as we scarfed them down. Next was the half cracked crab. Super meaty and super good. I just ate it plain and enjoyed it. My boyfriend ate most of it though since crab is his favorite. Lastly, we got the sashimi platter. It was smaller than I thought! I'm used to sashimi at Japanese restaurants. This one is drizzled with olive oil, chopped red onions, and capers. It's definitely got a unique taste in comparison to Japanese sashimi. I'll be honest though, I don't think I'd order it again. Maybe I didn't realize how much I don't like capers. My boyfriend and I eat pretty quick, so we sat and paid in about 30ish minutes time. I'd wait in line again for this seafood heaven, and I hate lines! Probably try the combination seafood salad since it looked like a lot of people were ordering that.

This place is cash only by the way. We totally did not check that before we got in line but there's a Chase across the street and a Bank of America around the block!

Service - 5 / Ambiance - 3 / Food - 5 / Price - 4
author: Veronica N.

description:
Anthony Bourdain does not disappoint! I've been dying to come here ever since I saw the episode on Parts Unknown but the stars never aligned and I could never make it work with my schedule. That was until today. Arrived at 3.40pm and waited about 30 minutes before I set foot into this magical seafood heaven.

I had the Boston chowder, a dozen oysters, the Sicilian sashimi platter and the combination salad. The chowder was super flavorful and light, yet creamy. I have no complaints, especially at $2.75 a bowl! The oysters were an assortment of Miyagi, Kumamoto, and Blue Point. They were easily the freshest oysters I've ever had - not briny, not gritty, and very meaty. I could probably down two dozen on my own. Next up was the sashimi platter. I opted for the small size given the amount of food I ordered but in hindsight, I should've gone with medium. I don't know why I underestimate my own eating abilities sometimes. Anyway, it came with 2 pieces of tuna, scallop, salmon, and hamachi each, topped with olive oil, shallots, capers, and peppers. While I enjoyed every piece, to me the scallop was exceptional. I mean wow. It was sweet and literally melted in your mouth and I usually hate raw scallops. Last was the combination salad - it came with bay shrimp, prawns, a ton of crab meat atop a bed of iceberg lettuce with a side of Louie sauce. Again, it was super fresh and da bomb.

All in all, it was a superb experience, worth every penny. Will be back!

P.S. The guys behind the counter were super nice! The lady next to us didn't have cash on her and they actually let her leave to go to the nearest ATM.
author: Christine D.

description:
I've wanted to go here for years, but I don't like to wait in line, for anything! My father in law loved this place and used to go solo for the same reason. It was one of Bourdain's favorites and used to go solo too. So while back in SF recently to meet up with my son, I headed down there at 3pm, maybe the line wouldn't be so bad, right?
There was a nice couple ahead of me and an attractive lady behind me. The wait was about 45 minutes. I got in and the place is a little rough around uh and the edges, compared to Hog Island, but it's got character you only get from being a classic for years.
The oysters were very good but I'm from Seattle as Nd I think they're a bit fresher. The chowder was outstanding, as was the crab Louis. I thought I was done but the pretty girl next to me got a mixed crisp plate so I ordered that and another Anchor Steam. A moment of near perfect happiness!
author: Sergio L.

description:
The hype is real!  The seafood here was amazing.  However, I would not wait in line to dine in. I highly recommend waiting in line for the take out, which cuts the wait time in half.  You can grab your food and enjoy it elsewhere.  I ended up at the park with my to go order.

I got the half dozen eggs (scallop sashimi with a side of ponzu sauce), a small Sicilian sashimi, crab cocktail and a crab back.  That was about $56.  Every penny spent was worth it - especially the scallops! 

The seafood tastes fresh.  The scallops were almost like butter.  The crab cocktail was light and plump!  The crab back was very delicious.  I enjoyed it with the bread and butter.  

**The sad news was that the SF wind blew over my almost-finished cup of crab back.  
RIP crab back.  

Don't forget to bring cash - it is on the pricey side!
author: Hien N.

description:
Worth the wait! There is a reason why this place is so popular, it's simply fantastic.
The oysters were fresh and delicious! Quite the variety to choose from as well. We seriously loved the crab and octopus cocktail. But if you dine here, you MUST try the smoked (cold smoked) salmon. It's quite possibly the best I've ever had. So happy to have finally been able to check out this hot spot.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Will you wait for 2hrs? Yes
Is it cash only? Yes
As fresh as possible? YES
Worth it? You betcha!

Standouts - scallops, uni, crab, crab back 

Overall Thoughts

You truly feel like you have stepped back in time when dining at Swan Oyster Depot. They are clearly doing something right and hope they never change
author: Eddie W.

description:
Long time San Franciscan and Ive never been, Ive even lived off Polk for years, and the line (I admit which looked touristy to me) just always averted me.

Now I know.  I was a fool.  No longer shall I mock the line.

Even if the quintessential crab is out of season, everything else is just superb. The experience is authentic, neighborhood focused (locals come in to buy fresh and will squeeze in next to the front counter seats), and service is great.

Worth the wait in line, but come early and bring a hat and maybe a bottle of water if its sunny.
author: Kitty O.

description:
This place was quite the hype and rightfully so. This is my favorite seafood place in San Fran, this is the only city I've visited more than once, 5 times now, and every time I find something new. I'm so glad I came here this time. The wait is long but you probably already know that since  it's so popular. We told ourselves we would come before they open but then though how long could the line really be before they even open? Long! We waited about 1.5 hours from arriving there a little before opening. 

It's good to know what you want cause it's really quick pace but the staffs are really friendly. We ordered a couple of things to try and everything was fresh and just pure seafood goodness. We got the 

Crab back- I thought it would be really heavy and fatty but it wasn't at all. It was actually refreshing and it so glad I got it. 

Oyster samples- again fresh and flavorful. 

Fish Carpaccio sample- I've not have Italian sashimi before, only Japanese sashimi. I thought it would be the same but it wasn't. I'm glad it wasn't. This is just as fresh and with the mix of olive oil and the salty green thing. 

You have to try it!
author: Shell N.

description:
What a cool find thanks to yelp. Swan Oyster is a place you should checkout if you like fresh seafood.  They are located in Nob Hill on Polk.  You will immediately notice them when you see a line forming out the door regardless of the time of day.  This small seafood diner seats 19 on a long counter and has been amazing around for over a 100 years.  Swan Oyster must been doing something right since it is popular with locals, tourists, and Anthony Bourdain.  

It is best to come before they open or expect a long wait.  The last seating is at 4:45pm.  If you are not seated by that time, do not be disappointed.  Take out is your only option till 5:30pm.

I ordered a dozen oysters and the crab salad.  There were three different types of oysters that were served to me. If I wasn't full, I would have ordered the uni which is not always on the menu. You'll know whether they have it or not if you see it in the window.  On my next visit I'll order off their secret menu and get a dozen eggs ( fresh scallops dotted with sriracha in ponzu sauce).

Stop by the atm and bring cash before coming here.  I overheard them saying they accept checks.... Lol.
author: Peter C.

description:
Best spot for some of the freshest and tastiest seafood you can get in San Francisco. Beware, there's always a super long line to eat here. The place is super small and narrow and there's very limited bar seating which is why the wait can get pretty long. 

If you don't want to wait in line for an hour or more you can order your food to go. It takes them a while to prepare the food to go though so I would suggest calling them ahead of time for pickup. I ended getting my food to go since I came during a holiday weekend and didn't want to wait in line for over an hour. 

You have to come early if you want uni though. I came past noon and they were already out of uni for the day. Super disappointing, but the rest of the food I had was really good. You can also walk up and tell one of the chefs that you want to prepay and claim whatever uni is still there and they will save it for you. I saw someone else do this and they put his name on it so no one else could order the last uni. 

Things to get include oysters, shrimp salad, and the Sicilian sashimi platter. The raw scallops in the sashimi platter were BOMB!! Oysters were also really fresh and delicious.
author: Mai Y.

description:
As Anthony Bourdaim said "If I died at the counter of Swans then I would die a happy man". These are wise words when it comes to this place. 

First thing to know is he prepared to wait in line. Luckily it was not a long wait for us and was part of the experience. Looking at the fresh seafood in the window and then when coming in the doors the waiter at the counter asked if we wanted a beer. Of course we ordered an Anchor Steam ale as we finished waiting for a seat to open up.

Then foodporn occurred. Started with slurping down some local oysters. Then had some sea urchin. Ordering that was quite an amazing experience. Watched the process of preparation and it was still moving in front of us. So cool. The taste was alright and a different consistency. Didn't seem to have a ton of flavor but enjoyed it. 

The highlight was the crab back and that was just yummy goodness. The staff was so attentive and had us some fresh bread to soak up the buttery deliciousness. Can't beat it for the price. If I am ever back in the area will order this multiple times .
author: Zach W.

description:
Easily a top 3 seafood spot for me. Got here about 30 min. prior to opening on a Tuesday and we were 5th in line. The line was about 20-30 deep by opening. I loved the cozy feeling at the exclusive bar of only maybe 15 seats. The personal oyster shucker/server was intimate like it was just me, my oysters, recommendations, and whatever else I needed at my finger tips. We started out with the tray of 3 different oysters and the off menu sashimi platter drizzled with olive oil, capers, and onions. Everything was super fresh. I was a huge fan of the thai chili sauce with the oysters. (MIND BLOWN). The house cocktail sauce was a little off though as it tasted mostly of ketchup which was my only knock on the place. We ended up ordering more of our favorite oysters. Best oysters in SF...get em!!!

#RefereEats
"I call it like I eat it."
author: Daniel W.

description: Great casual place for basic American seafood that you would typically find in a New England seafood shack.  They do a nice job with fresh-shucked oysters, Dungeness crab salad, and clam chowder.  Very tiny, counter/stool seating only, so don't come with a large group.  The big downside here is that there's often a fairly long wait, considering the limited seating available.
author: Sel C.

description: Walked by several times but the lines deterred me from trying this place out.  Today I decided to endure the wait as homage to the late Anthony Bourdain, who introduced us to Swan Oyster.  The wait was worth it.  The combination cocktail had a little bit of everything and was DELICIOUS.  The seafood was fresh and did not disappoint.  We also had the crab salad.  The crab meat was super sweet. This is definitely a seafood lovers paradise.
author: Carmen N.

description:
Honestly, f-ing AMAZING. The line out the door is well worth it for your oyster and dungeness crab fix. While you wait in line you can grab a glass of wine or a beer. The seafood is so fresh and in such abundance, it was so worth it. It's cash only so be prepared. The service is very old school and no frills and we enjoyed that. Too many restaurants try too hard and this place just gets it. 

While waiting in line, my girlfriend and I saw some lady steal a bunch of stuff from the CVS across the street and run out the door and it was so hilarious we laughed for like twenty minutes. The restaurant is nothing fancy and isn't in a "trendy" area but I think that's kind of the beauty of it. My girlfriend used to live in Palo Alto and she said a good rule of thumb is always assume it's human shit on the street. You'll definitely see a lot of typical San Francisco riff-raff but it's fun. We'll be back over and over.
author: Leigh A.

description:
Old-school, no frills, just good good seafood at a counter in very tiny space! I love coming here solo, or occasionally with a friend, this place is not for groups or lingering, expect to literally rub elbows with your neighbors. 

The fish always tastes fresh, but the crab is their money-maker! Unfortunately last visit they were actually OUT of crab so I couldn't order my usual crab cocktail with cold crab back (the most sinful and delicious combo). No worries, I got a small order (2pcs each) of the Sicilian sashimi (their not-so-secret off-menu special) which comes with different types of fish - normally ahi tuna, salmon, yellowtail, scallops - drizzled with olive oil and capers, and afterward I got a cup of chowder. $20 well spent!

It's also a bit charming listening to the folks behind the counter banter as they slice, clean, and shuck. They're all super knowledgeable and will be happy to describe what's on your plate when they come around. 

It's worth noting everything here is served fresh and cold, which is pretty normal but I've overheard a few out-of-towners complain.

Come early, prepare to wait in line, don't mess around when it's your turn to order (though if they're feeling generous they might get you started with bread and butter). And for God's sake, don't ask for melted butter!
author: Faith C.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is a wonderful hole in the wall that sits roughly 15 people at a time. We (a group of 5) came around 11 am on Thursday and didn't have to wait long. We told them that we can separate into a group of 2 and 3 if it makes it easier. After about 10 minutes they told us that they can seat 3 now and the other seats will be available shortly, but we could stand around and get started with some drinks. We actually didn't have to stand around at all. The owner was kind enough to shuffle a couple people around so we were able to sit together all at once. 

Once we got to the counter we were greeted again and started off with some beer. After taking a look at the menu, we ordered 2 bowls of clam chowder, 3 combination seafood cocktails, 2 crab salads, a dozen little neck clams, smoked salmon, and 4 crab backs. This was the perfect amount for us and we cleaned our plates. The clam chowder is more on the runny side, but had a lot of clammy goodness! I was especially impressed by the smoked salmon. Smoked salmon tends to be salty and... salty. Not here! It had a subtle saltiness and it was extremely buttery. I've never had smoked salmon like that and I wished I didn't because it'll be hard to top going forward. 

The restaurant was extremely clean and I loved the atmosphere. The entire staff was friendly and accommodating. The owner made us crab back sauce to go with our crab salad. He really made sure we had everything we needed. I absolutely loved our dining experience here and will come again.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
This is the place for the BEST seafood in the West Coast, hands down. Anthony Bourdain goes here every time he visits SF. It is a cash only establishment. Be prepared to wait for at least an hour, but if you get there around 10:30-11, you won't have to wait as long. I would highly recommend the Sicilian Sashimi, comes in S, M, or L; any salad and get the vinaigrette; and oysters. I wish I had two stomachs so I could have tried the chowder. 

I have never had better customer service than at Swan Oyster Depot. The boys make you feel a part of their family, always making sure you have enough to drink and eat. I know that any time I visit SF, this will be my first stop.
author: Diana N.

description:
Oh lawdy! I just died  and went to seafood heaven and back. Hhmmm...... let me wipe  my silly smile first before proceeding....

.... I think I just had an orgasm in plain public view after that meal!No... im not exagerrating, my husband is getting  annoyed with me right now coz I can't stop gushing over the food like i just spent the night with Anthony Bourdain. Okay now... here 's what we ordered:

Combination seafood salad
 1 doz Mixed oysters - 6 varieties
 Sicilian Sashimi plate (not on menu)
 2 ice cold Stella Artois to wash it down
 And complimentary bread and butter 

We went at lunch time on a tuesday and waited 30mins. No let up with the lines,  I can't imagine how long you have to wait on the weekends 
 
Anyway peeps, if youre in for fresh, no fuss, uber quality seafood, come on over to Swan depot!
author: jette V.

description:
This place is truly amazing.

But don't take my word for it, go see for yourself. The whole idea of this restaurant is pure genius. Every server or "seafood bartender" prepares all salads and cocktails for you, because of that, that not only cuts out the prep cooks and all front of house support staff. The size permits this style restaurant and I absolutely love it.

You must get there before noon or else its a guaranteed hour wait at least. But it is so worth the wait because once you finally sit down, you're immediately welcomed with a beer and some bread and butter.

The menu is on the wall with some secret items I never saw on the menu and only saw in pictures here on yelp.

I highly recommend the Sicilian sashimi and crab back.

Sicilian sashimi is truly delectable fish with olive oil red onions and capers, just pure fresh fish with some saltiness coming from the capers. It was salmon, tuna, hamachi and scallop...I could've eaten about two more plates by myself.

The crab back was something different that id never seen anywhere, the cold stock of crab with some of the yellow fat that comes from the guts of the crab, the only people that don't regularly mess with this stuff is Americans, if you know about the yellow fat chances are you aren't American or you come from a third world country. They served it with a little bread and butter and it was great on the buttered bread.

side note; The yellow fat is amazing when sautéed with onions, garlic and shelled crab.

This place is really special, definitely worth checking out at least once in your life.
author: Megan K.

description:
I got in line around 10 am on Friday and was one of the first 15 people in line.  We were seated around 11 am.  

I ordered a crab back, Sicilian sashimi and uni.

The crab back was much too rich for me - I could only finish about half of it.  Its definitely an acquired taste and I probably wouldn't get it again.  

The Sicilian sashimi (scallop, salmon and tuna drizzled with olive oil, capes, red onion and cracked black pepper) was delicious and perfect in every way.  I highly recommend this.

The uni was also delicious, although it was also a lot.  I'd get it again but probably share with a friend.  

The food was high quality and very fresh.  customer service was very good also - guys working the counter were friendly and attentive, and the food came out quickly.

Looking forward to coming back.
author: Holly P.

description:
There really aren't enough ways to describe how good this place is! Everything is so fresh and delicious with little human manipulation, served with crusty real bread you can hear when it's cut into  It has that romantic old school city feel that's efficient and simple in the best way. The male serving staff was a unique refreshing change to the usual dining experience, they're super attentive but down to earth making you feel welcome and taken care of while letting you enjoy your food . Worth the wait (very small dining bar) and every dollar spent (cash only) 
Sincerely,
Wishilivedcloser
author: Monica J.

description:
If you don't know anything about this restaurant then at first glance, you'd probably think it was just some tiny tackily decorated raw bar. But in reality it's one of the best and the oldest raw bar in town! 

My boyfriend and I tried this restaurant out on a Wednesday afternoon so our wait was only 30 minutes long. It felt like the longest 30 minutes of my life but boy, was it worth it!

Between the two of us, we shared the large seafood combination, the medium Sicilian style sashimi, seafood salad (forgot what size), as well as half a dozen blue point oysters and half a dozen cherry stone clams. 

The clams and the oysters were some of the best we have ever had. Both were extremely fresh, meaty and not too briny. Everything else was super fresh too. Best $130 (before tip) I ever spent.
author: Sara J.

description: Oyster lovers unite! For a great selection of fresh fish and oysters, clams, and everything else under the sun, Swan's is the place to be! Despite the hour long wait in line, if you're a fish lover, you'll do the time! The place holds about 15 people at a counter, so definitely, be prepared to wait. The catches of the day are displayed on ice in the window, so you can make some of your choices ahead of time.  Clam Chowder was okay, not the best we've had, but my prawn cocktail rocked it! Remember to bring cash, and lots of it, because it gets pricey ordering up all these fresh fish!
author: Karen L.

description:
My homage to @anthonybourdain who made the #swanoysterdepot famous and rightly so, it is a jewel of a find. (We miss you buddy) The staff were so genuinely jolly and happy to be there, it was pure joy to watch them work. The seafood is of course amazing as well. The #secretmenu #siciliansashimi was awesome 
Unfortunately there was no sea urchin today, but I will come back and get some next Time!
author: Jana S.

description: Had really high expectation of the place before going.  Waited in line for some good two hours and pondered on just what to order when it comes to my turn.  The food came and mediocre they were.  The clam chowder was very floury and the crab miso was fishy.  The one saving grace was the Sicilian sashimi.  It was fresh and lightly seasoned so that you actually taste the fish. The price I paid and the quality of seafood I received simply did not match.  Repeat?  Probably not
author: Ken L.

description:
After seeing Layover from the infamous Anthony Bourdain, my husband and I made a trip there and waited for approx 45 mins. We tried the following:

1. Clam chowder
2. Combination cocktail (oyster, clam, shrimps and crabs)
3. Oysters
4. Sicilian sashimi
5. Octopus salad
6. Smoked salmon
7. Clams

All were above our expectations! The food were fresh! The service was great! Totally worth the wait!
author: Jessica C.

description:
I'm a fan of this restaurant, but going on a Friday at noon was a bad choice. Waited in line for two hours before being seated, which was sheer torture. I was more than borderline hangry by the time we got seated. 

We ended up ordering the mixed dozen oysters, crab cocktail, clam chowder, and smoked salmon platter. 

The oysters are nothing less than heavenly. The mixed oysters included mostly West-coast oysters and one variety from the East Coast, which were much bigger in size and less in flavor than the West-Coast ones. 

The salmon platter was everything... the perfectly smoked and served with capers, onions and bread. 

And at only $3, the cup of clam chowder is the best deal on the menu and the perfect consistency (not too creamy but not too watery). 

The vibe of Swan Oyster Depot is something of old-school nostalgia. And in a tech-forward city where every taxi driver is using Square and every small business is using an iPad for payment processing, it's refreshing to go to a restaurant that's still using an old-school cash register from the 1940s. 

Overall, the food at Swan Oyster amazing flavor and quality, the restaurant vibe is the perfect amount of nostalgia, but the wait... the wait is a killer.
author: Liz S.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is a small fresh seafood restaurant. They have one row of counter seating with a narrow walkway. Since it is small, the wait is definitely long with such a popular and small locale, but I found it worth the wait. We waited 2 hours on a Saturday, arriving a little before opening. At the window of the restaurant are trays of seafood and they look delectable and fresh! 

The seafood here is fantastic! It's not an upscale restaurant but it seems fresh and reminiscent of a fish market. The menu is on the wall and seems pretty basic, though it helped that we looked on Yelp for tips and pictures. (They're also rather flexible on sizes that you can order. We were full and wanted to try the smoked salmon so they were able to give us a half order.)

+CRAB BACK: This is delicious and I haven't had this anywhere else. They give you bread with it, which goes nicely with the seafoody and pleasant bitter flavor of the crab.
+SICILIAN SASHIMI: Various types of seafood that are topped with capers and onions, and with what seems to be olive oil. This is delicious and goes so well with each of the five types of sashimi. 
+SCALLOP SASHIMI: We loved the scallop sashimi so much that we ordered an extra small order, and it was delicious! It's soft and similar to butter. 
+OYSTERS & CHERRY CLAMS: We were able to split getting half a dozen of each, and they were amazing. There's a little tray of mignonette and sauces, as well as lemons, and they were great. First time having raw clams and these were large and great!
+CLAM CHOWDER: There are a good amount of clams and it's quite delicious! Great compliment to all the other cold seafood.

All in all, the seafood here is quite delicious. After the meal, they asked us what we got and added it up on a napkin. Kind of seems like they take it by honor system since they just ask you what you got. Be aware that they're cash only so bring enough! We were a little sad that they ran out of uni, and there's still so much to try there (like the crab salad) so I hope to return to have their delicious seafood!
author: Mimi T.

description:
Exceptional:

If you want delicious fresh oysters this is the place for you..
Oysters taste like they have came directly fresh from the ocean .. I have tried a couple of things on the menu and they were all exceptional..

The only downside of this places is that they closed way too early..
author: Head Chef F.

description:
I like Japanese food but I usually stick with ordering just sashimi.  It's light, its tasty, its visually appealing.  Ever since seeing the sashimi platter here, I knew I had to make a visit.  This place closes at 5:30pm and I hear the lines can get really long on the weekends.  I finally had time to venture out here on a weekday and luckily, there wasn't a wait.

Sicilian Sashimi (small) - 6 different types of fish x2 totaling $17.  FRESH.  I usually eat sashimi without any sauce but the drizzled oil and capers gave it more flavor

I would've ordered more dishes but it's CASH ONLY.  The guys were super nice about me not having cash and told me to enjoy my meal first and pull out cash later using the ATM across the street.  I will have to come back and try the oysters.
author: Linda N.

description:
This is my husbands favorite spot in the city for crab and smoked salmon.  Kevin and the family will take good care of you to ensure your stay is worth it.  I often order the crab Louie and always steal some of the smoked salmon from my husband.  

If you want to take it home, make sure to call ahead.  The line for takeout may take as long as the line to wait for service.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is THE oyster bar in San Francisco. It's been at this location for over 100 years, so you know that they've got it down. Everything here is sooooo good, just remember to bring enough cash because you'll be tempted to try everything!! It's probably best to arrive here before they open to make sure you're one of the first ones to sit down. If you show up later, it's guaranteed that they will run out of Uni, Blue Point Oysters or the Crab Back. 

WAIT/LINE - Arrived here at 11am on a Saturday and the line was already pretty long. I assumed it would be around an hour or so, but we waited 2.5 hours for a group of 4. We ended up sitting separately because it was easier to seat groups of 2 than 4. 

OYSTERS - The first thing that I highly recommend trying is their Miyagi, Shigoku oysters. We didn't get to sample the Blue Points because they ran out. However, the Miyagi and Shigoku were both sweet and meaty. The Kumamotos were honestly not worth it. At $18 for half a dozen, they were the size of quarters. The guy gave us an extra one because of the size, but I'd rather have the larger ones instead. 

SASHIMI - Something that isn't on their menu is their sashimi platter. You can order a small, medium or large portion with two, three or four slices of fish respectively. The sashimi was super fresh and had yellowtail, salmon, tuna, scallops and halibut. It arrived drizzled with olive oil, topped with capers and red onions. This by far was one of my favorite things to order here.

SALAD - SOD has an assortment of salads you can order from shrimp, prawns, crab and lobster. You can even opt for the combination, but I preferred sampling their crab salad. At a hefty price of $30, this salad was not cheap, but it was very delicious. The crab on the salad was not only abundant, but it was buttery and flaky at the same time. And their signature Louie Sauce was just perfection.

CLAMS - Cherry stone clams on the half shell are a must-try too, half a dozen for $14. Add a little horseradish and their mignonette, and it's got quite the kick. Or eat them as is with a splash of lemon, it's very meaty and delectable. 

CLAM CHOWDER - Boston Clam Chowder here does not come with potatoes or clams, but it's packed with a ton of flavor. It's the perfect consistency to dip your bread in, not too heavy, it's just right. I personally prefer it this way more than anything else. 

If I had one bad thing to say about SOD is that the workers handled money and seafood, hand in hand. without washing their hands in between. I wish they would just wear gloves or use utensils to serve, but that's just not the case here. 

When I come here again in the future, I do plan on arriving earlier than I did so that I wouldn't have to wait as long. Also, I would be able to try other items before they run out. Love this place, can't wait to visit again!
author: Nancy L.

description:
CASH ONLY.

That said, fresh seafood prepared in front of you in a cramped diner with all bar stools. The wait is insane so come when they open or during off hours and you won't have any issues. The order:

Bowl of clam chowder - $6
2x dozen oysters - $32 per dozen 
Crab salad - $29
Trout + shrimp: ~$20

The oysters are the star of the show; fresh, juicy, tasty, and accompanied with lemon, horseradish, and hot sauce. The clam chowder is also good but I prefer Fog Harbor's clam chowder because it's creamier. It's fairly pricey ($50 per person) but worth a visit if you're in the area.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Came by on a Friday around noon for a quick lunch. I was very wrong. The line stretched down the block and the restaurant only has one long counter for seating. It took about two hours before I got seated. It is possible to order online and one woman did eventually do that instead of waiting for the line though it looks like online order still take a good 20 to 30 minutes to prepare. If you do online and order it looks like you're able to just cut the line and pick up the food tho you will definitely get a few angry stares.

The restaurant is cash only and the prices aren't as cheap as I expected so definitely make sure to withdraw enough money (I wasn't very hungry but still managed to spend about $50). The biggest positive about this place was definitely the service. Everyone was so sweet though also busy enough where it was a bit hard to get their attention if I need anything.

For my meal I got the following:
-Cup of Clam Chowder w/ bread: Definitely full of clams but the soup itself was very average. It's very light (which I don't mind) but a bit watery. I really wish the bread was toasted or a bit more acidic. It was pretty dense and a bit tough. It wasn't quite good enough to eat alone and the chowder wasn't flavorful enough to work with the bread (2/5)

-Oysters: I asked for 2 of each of the oysters they had (the menu was a bit confusing, they had 3 more clearly listed varieties so I thought I was getting 6 but in reality they had like 5-6 varieties but I got 4? I was fine with this but definitely confused). I got the blue points from Tomales, blue points from the east coast, miyagis from british columbia, and kumamoto oysters. Definitely the best item of the meal. Every type was so unique and fresh. If I came back this would definitely be my go to. Still pricy but worth it. (4.5/5)

-Half Cracked Crab: A delicious and sweet crab that was very skillfully cracked. Never had such an easier time eating crab. But tastewise it's just a fresh crab. Not worth $22 for just half. It comes with bread but honestly the bread just takes away from the delicate flavors and texture. (3/5)

Overall, I have to admit I'm more than a bit disappointed. Between the popularity and the wonderful service I really had high hopes. The items are all very fresh but it's not better than places where I don't have to wait 2 hours and it's not cheaper either. Plus I can use card at other spots. I'd consider coming back if I was in the area and there's no line but otherwise, there's better options out there.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I gave this place a 4 star instead of a 5 star purely because of the wait time. We waited in line for about 1.5 hrs on a Thursday afternoon. Throughout the time of waiting in line, patrons raved about how good this place is and that it is worth the wait. Thus, my friend and I made the decision to commit to standing in this long line. 

Unfortunately, they did not have sea urchin the day we went. We did order oysters, clams, crab back, clam chowder, and sashimi. All so fresh and good! The sashimi was different than what I expected because I'm use to eating sashimi plain with a little wasabi and soy sauce. 

Overall, great seafood and staffs were very attentive. But I don't think I will stand in that long line again.

As a side note, it is a small seafood restaurant. There is about 18 seats at the counter. This place should consider expanding their space as they seem to be busy all the time.
author: Yun Chi C.

description:
As one of the oldest seafood restaurants in SF, I can see the fuss in waiting in line for who knows how long just to experience those old school vibes - 10 stools, cash only, and seafood as fresh as they can be. 

We arrived at 11:45 and were discouraged when we saw a line that took up 3/4 of the block. When asking a couple of people in front of us how long the wait would be, we received shrugs and laughs as they didn't seem to care. As a hangry New Yorker, I unfortunately don't have the patience to stand in line for an hour+, especially not knowing how long I'd be waiting for. Luckily, I read that you can order take out, so I skipped the line and went to order my food to go. 

Ordering take out is confusing here as there's no clear place to stand to order take out. I went all the way to the back only to be told to go back to the front. Fortunately for me, someone else was placing an order to go, so he directed me to just stand behind him. FYI - it doesn't seem like people really order take out here, so just awkwardly stand next to the first stool and someone will eventually come assist you. Also, just because you're ordering take out doesn't necessarily mean that you'll be helped quicker - I waited around 20 minutes before I was acknowledged and helped (I think they felt bad for me standing there alone, as the guy before me said he waited a good 45 minutes before being helped). 

For two people, I ordered a medium sashimi (not listed on the board above, but it's available), a dozen mixed oysters, a cup of clam chowder, and bread and butter. All this will run you $59. I also tried to order the crab back, but they're not in season / available in August. 

A medium sashimi comes with 15 pieces soaked in olive oil and capers. I had no idea that sashimi can be prepared this way as I'm used to Japanese sashimi. Mind blown as this preparation was delicious. Our favorite fish was the scallop, but all the pieces were oh so tender. The oysters were probably one of the best oysters I've had as they were all sweet and large. I loved how the guy labeled each oyster for me on the plates! The clam chowder isn't your typical clam chowder as it's super watery, but definitely does not lack in flavor. I wish I had ordered a bowl instead of a cup because the guy gave us SO much bread (which was delicious btw because it's Boudin's sourdough bread - definitely worth the $1). 

Long story short, the food is absolutely amazing here. Yes it's pricy, but if you're coming here, you're 99% a tourist, so hey you'll be dropping $$$$ when on vacation. Go early (10:30 I read was the magical time to get first round of seating) or just order take out! There's a park nearby where you can feast with no shame.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Fresh seafood however crowded and poor service. I'd rather go to hog oyster.
Our waiter was rude and literally disappeared during our meal without telling us. The other servers were great but that one server definitely put a damper to the experience . 
I live around the corner but won't be back.
author: Lai S.

description:
Living in SF for 7 years this was my first time visiting Swan Oyster. I've always been turned away by the line, but with relatives visiting I thought we could wait and see what the hype was about. 

Going on a Saturday and arriving at 10:15 (which was 15 minutes before they opened) we ended up being seated at 12:30. I was trying to read prior reviews to see how long the wait would've and I was expecting closer to 1.5 hours. Was the wait worth it? Probably not, but to me no restaurant is worth an over 2 hour wait in my opinion. It's been overly hyped and is now a very popular tourist location. 

A review of the food:
-Combination Salad: include some lettuce with shrimp, prawns, and crab meat on top. It's about 70% seafood and 30% lettuce but compared to the other dishes it was a little bland for my taste. 
-Clam Chowder: more on the thinner side, but definitely one of my favorite dishes. I love Seattle clam chowder, so hard to say this is better.
