-Sashimi platter: this was by far my favorite dish. The pictures make it look a lot bigger than the pieces are, but the flavor and capers added an extra taste that was different than a Japanese restaurant. 
-Kumamoto oysters: small but delicious! 

Last but not least CASH ONLY.
author: Justin Y.

description: The absolute best place for seafood in SF.  Fresh fish, oysters, sashimi. clams, shelled crabs, chowder and more.  This place is only open 10:30am-5:30p and people start to line up at 10:00am just to get included in the first seating.  Friendly staff and great service. Swan is a must if you are visiting the Bay Area.
author: JP M.

description:
I love oysters and this place definitely hits the spot! Fresh and delicious! I feel like their pricing is a bit on the pricey side, but it's worth it because this restaurant is more specialized in seafood and their quality is on par. 

- Mixed Dozen (Blue Point, Miyagi, Kumamoto) - All 3 are so yummy and fresh, but I gotta say, the Miyagis are my favorite!

- West Coast Little Neck Clams - I thought I'd give these a go, but now I can positively say that I am not a fan of raw clams lol! 

- Boston Clam Chowder (Cup) - I was surprised at how buttery and light their clam chowder is compared to the usual ones you get from other restaurants. Definitely getting the bowl next time!

TIP:
- They do not take reservations and the place is very small, so I would definitely come when they're not as busy or call ahead to make sure it isn't too long of a wait. 
- They also stop seating customers about 30-45 mins before they close, but they'll still accept to-go orders, so do plan accordingly!
author: Evonne C.

description:
If only you knew how much I love seafood 

Then you would understand why we waited in a long ass line.  We knew coming here that this seafood spot only sits 19 people at a time.  We thought the wait would be an hour but it ended up to be three hours long!  Good thing I was with good company who also made donut runs for us so it wasn't too bad.  While our wait, we were given samples of smoked salmon deviled eggs and other goods on crackers.  About after one hour in of our wait at 2pm, they told us that they had run out of crab.  What a bummer...    

My party was five people.  When we got to the front of the line there were three open seats so they had three of us eat first.  About 10 minutes later the two seats next to us was available so it wasn't such a big deal.  If you go in a big group, just expect that you might have to split up since it is only booth sitting and they have to be courtesy to those still in line.  

The owner served us personally.  He was extra friendly and very sweet.  We were instantly given complementary bread and butter.  We all shared four different types of oysters that were all amazing.  I also tried their calm chowder which I liked but the others didn't.  I like that it wasn't too creamy and didn't contain too much potatoes.  Those who came with me thought it tasted too oceany.  The oyster crackers though were awfully stale.  Probably because they just leave it out for whoever to use.  We also shared a large size of sashimi.  You get a choice of four different types for a large.  We got tuna, scallops, salmon, and yellowtail.  All were amazing and super fresh.  They were topped with capers and some oil.  My only complaint was how small a large size it and how thin they were.  I also tried some of their cocktail prawns.  An order was about 4-5 prawns.  They were pretty good.  For drinks, I stuck with their delicious michelada that was made perfectly.

Our total was about $120.  I thought pricing was alright.  The service was fast and excellent.  Everything is made right in front of you and it was quite an experience.  I was glad I came with people I enjoy hanging out with and talking to because I'm not sure if it would be worth the three hour wait we did.  I was also sad that they had run out of crab and that was something I was anticipating before coming.  Oh well.  Next time I heard we can just order and pick up.  I want to try that the next time we are eating here.
author: Cat N.

description:
One of my favorite places in San Francisco.  Sea to table.  Super fresh seafood, great bread with good quality butter.  Rich clam chowders.
Friendly guys behind the counter.  If you are interested in ordering to go you don't have to wait in the line outside that is waiting for seats---just go to the front and place your order.   Fish doesn't come fresher or tastier--impeccable quality--and the plates are generous.  If you have the patience wait in line---if not---go with the to go.   The food is the best.
author: Portia S.

description:
Okay.  

Thumbs up:  I'm staying on California and Larkin which is within walking distance.  So I get there super early to where i managed to snag one of the seats.  I didn't care about the wait because, come on, i got nowhere else to be at 10 in the morning.  I order the crab back, crab salad, and prawn cocktail.  My friends literally said that I had eaten for four people, but who cares.  All were really delicious.

Thumbs down:  I had not consumed crab since I was a kid and found out about an hour later that I had developed hives and among other symptoms that involve using the toilet.  Turns out I was allergic.  Nothing too serious, just resembled the Michelin Tire Man.  Took Benadryl and a nap and I was brand new again.

I would still come back to this place, but maybe order something different like their oysters, uni or their sashimi.
author: Conrad B.

description:
Talk about seafood! This is the best seafood place in Whole San Francisco hands down!! I went their at 9am and had to stay in line for 2 hours to go inside the restaurant. And if you're planning on coming after that, bring enough snacks to hold you for 3+ hours. There's a really good hummus and baked pita place next to it. I would def recommend to have that while waiting in line. 

I tried their Sea Urchin (Uni), crab, crab butter with bread, oysters and clam chowder. 
Start with Clam Chowder: super creamy and delicious but it makes you feel full so I wouldn't recommend it if you're planning on ordering a lot of fishes. 
Then they served Crab butter with bread and some sauces in it and crab meat. Ohhh sooooo good. Super fresh and super easy to eat. They crack it open very well. Highly recommended 
Then they served 3 different types of oysters. I was not a big oyster fan, but after trying this I fell in love with it to the point where I drove 2 hours to the place where they get those oysters from and had dozen oysters ALL BY MYSELF. yes they are gooood have it and don't think about it. 
Let's talk about uni. They crack open the sea urchin and serve it super fresh.  You can even see the moving legs of sea urchin. My conversation with sea urchin. Hey Sea Urchin! I'm feeling bad for you because they cracked you open live but damn you taste so good 

Nice people. Service is good but I think they should start taking reservations or atleast the write down the name system.
author: Sumbal A.

description: Amazing! This place was delicious. Had the sashimi, combination seafood salad, and oysters of course. Everything was super fresh and tasty. Authentic SF feel. It is a small place with a line always but worth the wait and every penny. Cash only.
author: Catherine T.

description:
My friend and I have been wanting to try this place for a long time. We had 6 hours in San Francisco to hit all the places so we went to Swan Oyster Depot for our first stop. The line was already long 15 minutes before opening. When the door opened, we just happened to miss the first group to get seats. While we waited, we got to look at the menu and checked out what everyone was ordering. After waiting for 30 minutes, we sat down and ordered the following items from the menu:
1. Combination salad
2. Half dozen oysters and half dozen clams
3. Clam chowder 
4. Crab back- only my friend ate it. 

So I was hoping to give this place for 4 stars because the service was good but... it really didn't live up its hype. The seafood looks fresh but lacks the fresh taste. Oysters were quite disappointing. Clams were probably my favorite. Clam chowder was watery and salty. I didn't try crab back.  

Overall, I was glad to finally check out this place and I didn't have to wait for a long time. I don't think I will come back to this place for my SF foodie trip next time.
author: Marianne H.

description: I appreciate the freshness of the seafood but I don't understand why people are willing to wait in line for more than an hour for it. I waited over an hour because it was my first time and I had to try it and I admit that all the seafood was extremely fresh. The crab salad had chunks of lump crab but it was over a bed of iceberg lettuce and costs $29. The dozen oysters were $32 and the Sicilian Sashimi had a combination of 5 types of fish for around $30 as well. All dishes were made by the servers behind the counter and take time to assemble the dishes. The least appealing was the Clam Chowder. It was extremely fishy and the cream didn't combine well that it felt like the cream broke. The clam flavor wasn't also great. Regardless of the freshness, it was not worth the wait and the price. I enjoy the family feeling but for that price, I think there are better options.
author: Kevin L.

description: A Mermaids paradise for sure!! Everything was fresh and delicious but the Scallop Susimi was melt in your mouth PERFECTION!!! I can NOT wait to go back for MORE!!!
author: Denine J.

description:
BEST. SEAFOOD.EVER.
The wait was about a half hour, which is to be expected. After a referral from a cool dude I met, my girlfriend and I decided to check it out. The space was pretty small, but it definitely had that 'hidden gem' quality to it. The oysters were fresh, clams were delicious. The beer was the cherry on top. Great spot in the Nob Hill neighborhood of San Francisco. Highly recommend the clam chowder. Best I've ever had. Hands down.
author: Eric B.

description:
Ordered clam chowder, cocktail shrimp, and the cherry stone clams.

The cherry stone clams were incredible. They cost $14, and I got 6 of them- I thought it was a pretty good deal considering how good they were. You can have them with either their rice vinegar or the thai chili sauce, both are very good, simple choices that compliment the clams excellently.

The other dishes however were a little meh. The clam chowder was a lot more watery than most of the clam chowders I'm used to having when I'm in boston, and I'm actually a fan of the heavier kind. 

The cocktail shrimp was the most... interesting by far. Typically, my understanding of cocktail shrimp is that you have 3 or 4 large shrimps hanging over a cocktail glass, with cocktail sauce on the inside for dipping. However, at Swan Oyster, they actually serve you mini shrimp which has been mixed into the cocktail sauce. It's an interesting take that i've never seen before, but I wasn't crazy about it because each shrimp was completely doused in way too much sauce, almost like a cocktail soup with shrimp mixed into it. In addition, I felt like the shrimp was too small, and struggled to taste them through the overwhelming flavor of the sauce.

So, some good, some bad. The hours here are not actually correct, but I'm not going to bother to post them because tourists will continue to be confused that way. I will have to come back to try again, but this first experience was mostly a miss.

CASH ONLY
author: Matt L.

description:
This was the best seafood I've had and I wouldn't hesitate to say it was one of the best meals I've ever had.

I came here with a friend and we decided on a dozen oysters, the crab back, and Sicilian sashimi.

The oysters were amazing.  The gentleman serving us took the time to point out the different varieties, and I loved each one. The price was also good.  It was $30 for the dozen, I believe, which is the same price I've payed at multiple other restaurants whose quality was far below what I had here.

The crab back was great as well. Served cold, and very salty, it was great with the beer I was drinking along with bread for dipping.

The Sicilian sashimi was an awesome close to the meal. I had never had sashimi served this way before -- with capers, onions, pepper and olive oil. Super interesting and flavorful.

In addition to the good food here, the staff was very friendly. It made for a great experience and I can't wait to come back here.
author: Nathan G.

description:
Driving up Polk at 10:30 am, saw 15 people lined up. Turned left on Sacramento is parked in a lot walked around the block & got in line. We missed the 1st seating by 4 people but had a great time talking. The 45 min. wait went quickly.
As we were seated, the pace slowed as we had ample time to ask questions and order. We had crab salad, 1/2 doz. oysters, medium Sicilian sashimi, cup of chowder & a Uni (sea urchin). Seafood was all fresh, tasty & delicious. Not cheap, they only take cash (Chase Bank is across the street), wait staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Great meal.
author: Lou G.

description:
Ever since I attended school here back in 2014, I've always enjoyed SF in part due to it being one of the foodiest cities in the US. Subsequent visits post-graduation I'm always on the lookout for great food. Unfortunately as with many of the "best" places the Bay Area has to offer, restaurants have to be reserved at least a week in advance or longer and/or have at least 30+ minutes wait time for non-peak times. Swan Oyster Depot is of the latter but for good reason - it's considered one of the best places in the City for seafood by tourists AND locals alike.

CONCEPT: Swan Oyster Depot is a SF institution. It has been in its present location since 1912 (over 100 years) and its reputation for seafood is as good as the House of Prime Rib for meat. Part of its charm is that it's family owned-operated as the staff span 3 generations. When I went in Tom and Steve as well as three of his sons were working the counter.

A sign near the entrance denotes the lack of official website for the restaurant, but due to its solid reputation it hardly needs it as the people will gladly sing praises about this place.

VENUE: Quite a small space with a bar seating ONLY 19 people. See the line out back? That's the reason for the line. I came here on a Monday morning at 11. Took me almost an hour wait, though a local said to me compared to some days and times, this is the closest to the ideal wait. There's hooks on the other side to hang coats and large bags.

SERVICE: Maybe I sat myself a little too early as it took me a little while to be served, but the staff more than made up for it when I was finally asked what I wanted. Sorry if I broke some unwritten rule, I'll be a better person! 

Eating here solo and not being super hungry limited my options, hence no seafood salad with their famous Louie sauce or their oysters, seafood cocktails or Dungeness crab even though it's in season as of this writing. Taking into consideration what's offered in the window, I ordered the following.
- Cup of chowder, $3. This is actually my least favorite item because of the soup/clam ratio, which is a little on the runny side. However this can be easily overlooked because of how wonderful everything else is. Oyster crackers are offered in a communal bowl.
- Crab back, $8. I'm a HUGE fan of crabs and when I'm served whole crab I try to eat almost anything edible. Usually the head of the crab contains the crab innards and "fat". They offer this here though instead the crab fat is soaked in butter. In lieu of rice I soaked that crab fat in some bread, though I can easily spoon this by itself. The only other time I can have crab fat is when my parents bring home crab to steam!
- Small order of Sicilian sashimi. They actually have this served small, medium or large with the the difference being the amount and type of fish served. A small plate got me 12 servings of 4 fish: hamachi, salmon, ahi tuna and scallops soaked in olive oil and topped with onions and capers. This is the best sashimi I've ever consumed outside Japan. You can taste the freshness of the fish and the capers and onions add a little bite to the fish. 
- Uni, about $20. This is not usually offered, though when it is you'll see it in the window. The uni is cracked for you and served in its shell. Uni wasn't too big so I was able to squeeze this in. Before this I though I would never liked uni, but only because I never had it just cracked. The uni served here is actually quite "meaty" and does not have that super fishy or slimy texture I find with uni sushi/sashimi. To this date this is the ONLY place that served uni I actually liked! Maybe I'm just super particular about this shellfish.
- Anchor Steam beer. Beer was ok though it helped wash out the fishiness aftertaste when you eat a lot of seafood in one sitting.

When you ask for your check at the end you'll tell them what you ordered. Remember this is a CASH ONLY establishment, though there is a Chase across the street and a Wells Fargo nearby. My total came to about a little over $50.

After eating here I can definitely justify the many accolades it gets from James Beard, Anthony Bourdain, the Eater 38 and Bauer's SF 100 list. Even the No1DP was jealous of me eating here and this is considering he lives in Japan, where good seafood can easily be found. I will consider this one of my fond moments of eating seafood, and I look forward to eating here again, either solo or with friends who are willing to wait in line for a good meal!
author: Isabella B.

description: Got here at 4pm, after a 40 minute walk.... they are open to 5:30pm.... but turned us away by having the people ahead of us tell us the are accepting no more customers. I tried calling but no answer. I guess they don't need customers here.
author: Josh C.

description:
There are a few iconic SF restaurants. HOP is one, this is the other. The rating of this place will be highly subjective based on your own preferences. Its not the kind of place I think everyone can go and have the same amazing experience, so I caution you to read the below and see if it hits your preference set.

1 - the line can be an enormous chore. I came in when it wasn't super super busy and it still turned into a 1.5 hour wait in the sun. For some - that's no big deal. For me(Who was super hungry) it was. But I was determined to visit this iconic place so I stayed the course. Knowing what I know now, I would have grabbed a slice of pizza.

2 - its pricier than you think. Remember, its seafood and not nearly as filling as a steak. Yes, you can gorge yourself on the bread if you like to make up the difference, but at least be upfront in knowing that its quite expensive to fill yourself on actual seafood. I ended up spending 60 bucks to get moderately full(and I am not a massive eater - I did avoid most of the bread). 

3- It only accepts cash. Meh, this one I came prepared for.

4 - I did not order the one thing everyone comes for - Oysters. I had just come from Washington and gorged myself on oysters before so I decided to skip it. Probably a dumb idea given I was going to review the restaurant, but whatever - if you are in the mood for oysters, ignore the rest of the review. 


5 - they are pretty stripped down in what they offer. Fresh seafood, particularly shellfish, with no frills. I find this charming in a way. You want fresh crab? Its there. You want fresh scallops or clams? Yep, there too. Absolutely peak seafood ingredients with really nothing much else besides a few garnishes, some delicious louis sauce, and little else. If you order the crab, its a bit messy but that comes with the territory. I ordered a scallop carpaccio dish. It was really good. The scallops were very fresh, but I wish they had paired it with a nice vinaigrette to bring out some more interesting flavors. The crab back was just ok. When I've made crab back, its usually with hot cooked crab. This was just lukewarm. Ok I suppose. Not terrible. 

6 - Servers and staff were charming and it has a very lively feel. Definitely brings out the iconic history of SF and the restaurant.

Overall, a good place. I think in a vacuum, I would come here again but the prospect of the wait, cash requirements and general cost puts it right on the edge.
author: Ajit K.

description:
We went on a Friday morning around 10-10:15am before they open and the line was pretty long. We were the 10th people in line. 

As soon as the restaurant open, we were seated right away. We sit shoulder to shoulder with other foodie. It's kind of fun and interesting. You get to know the people around you. Lol

We immediately get assigned a waiter (all men, it seems). We ordered what we want one by one. 

We started with mix oysters and clam chowder. The chowder was just ok. I was not impressed. Then we got uni, crab brain/juices (forgot the name), and seafood combo salad. All the food was amazing except the chowder. 

We spent $90ish for 2 people. 
As we left the restaurant, the line got, of course, longer.  

My tip is come 30 mins before the place open. Bring cash. And expect to sit next to a stranger.
author: Christina J.

description:
We got recommended this place by a local friend, stating this one is more like a local l, authentic San Francisco ouster spot compared to the tourist taste Hog Island. We arrived at the place at 11:04, which was 30 mins after they open, yet we saw a long line of people queuing in front of the store. This place is an extremely small oyster bar with only 19 seats at the bar, with no table. We waited in line for 1.5 hours to finally get seated, at this point I truly hoped the food worth the wait otherwise I would be so pissed. 
They brought us some sour dough with butter before taking order, which is great as we were super hungry after 1.5 hours waiting in line.  We ordered a clam chowder, an octopus salad ($14, came in a small glass), half a dozen mixed oyster ($16), a combination seafood cocktail ($15, shrimp, prawn, crab meat), and a large combination sashimi tray (tuna, hamachi, scallop, sardine, and salmon, 6 slices each, forgot the price). Octopus salad was mediocre, mostly because they came with chopped celery, which I can't eat, but squeezed in a couple of lemon slices and it tasted much better. The sashimi was amazing, I love sardine, tuna, and Hamachi. Scallops weren't that good tho, coz its texture was kinda like butter, while i expected it to be chewy. The seafood cocktail tasted good too. The best part is the oyster, very fresh and tasty. I squeezed lemon, hot sauce (their hot sauce is bomb, trust me), and a bit of cocktail sauce, and sucked the whole thing. Seriously, this place served the best oysters I've ever had. The only negative point is the clam chowder. It had a really strong taste of clam, which left you a bitter after taste, yet they cut up the clam extremely tiny, I couldn't find any pieces of clam big enough to enjoy its chewy texture. Anyway, I will come back next time, and for sure, come in like 20 minutes before they open to avoid waiting in line.
author: Quynh N.

description:
Really enjoyed this oyster bar on a Wed afternoon (with no crowd and open seats!). Accept that a bar is all it is and you will enjoy it too. Some of the negative reviews talk about how dated this place is, but it kind of adds to the experience. Cash only and no menus, but there's a menu on the wall. A lady asked for a menu to take with her. The guy at the bar asked if she had a camera. She said yes and he told her to take a picture. Not sarcastically, but sincerely trying to help. She said its not the same and walked out. Really? So set your expectations accordingly and you will not be disappointed. 

Oysters were super fresh and tasty. The Thai hot sauce on the bar added a great kick. That and a squeeze of lemon was all I needed. Pair with some bread and a glass of Pinot Gris and I was set. Also tried the clam chowder. It was on the soupy side, but tasty. More potatoes than clams though. But still good. I'd recommend and I will return.
author: Efren S.

description:
Seafood definitely FRESH, OVERPRICED, and OVERRATED.... can find better seafood elsewhere!

Clam Chowder soup - clams were definitely fresh & not your typical canned clams, but toooooo bad the chowder was runny not thick!

Cherry stone clams - Fresh & not bad

Blue Point Oysters - Yum

Uni - decent
author: Katy N.

description: Been on my bookmark for the longest time. Been living in the Bay Area for years I finally had a chance to check this off my list. Came in on a Friday late afternoon 2ish and line was about 1hr to get in. Very informal limited bar seating. Get cozy with the person next to you. Overall what a tasty and fresh sea experience. I highly recommend the crab back and dip it in your bread, Sicilian sashimi platter (must try the hamachi!), oysters (ask them for recs!). Skip the chowder. Overall pleasant experience
author: Danica V.

description:
If you can't make it on a weekday, you better bring some DAMN good company to accompany you for the inevitably excruciatingly long line during the weekend. My boyfriend and I arrived 10 minutes before opening on a Saturday, and we still waited nearly 2 hours. I was pretty hangry by the time I got to the front, but as you can probably tell from my 4 stars, the food made it difficult to stay unhappy (though by no means would I ever go back again on a weekend).

With the amount of time we waited, we knew exactly what we wanted to order and were ready to feast by the time we sat down:

- Half dozen oysters: We had 3 different varieties. I know one type was from Tomales Bay, but I don't remember the others. Doesn't matter though because they were all AMAZING. Some of the best oysters I've had in SF, by far.

- Large Sicilian sashimi: This was the most expensive dish ($32), but I thought it was well worth it. The red onions, capers, and olive oil was unique but complimented the fish really nicely. And all the fish (ahi tuna, salmon, scallops, & yellowtail) was very fresh.

- Combination cocktail: Came with crab, shrimp, prawn, and oysters. I recommend putting some of the crab into the crab back and eating it with the bread!

- Crab back: For $6, you get all the delicious soupy guts and fat from the crab, served up with bread to soak it all up. Important to note that it's cold, but it still tastes great.

- Combination seafood salad: This was kind of an attempt to get some fiber in our meal, but we were impressed with the large amount of seafood that came with it. Included shrimp, prawns, crab, and crawfish. Highly recommend getting it with the louie dressing.

- Uni: I know they don't always have this, so we were lucky! Not the best uni I've had (Hokkaido uni lovers, you know what I'm talking about), but super fresh and rich.

Hard to pick one favorite because all of them were so good, but the oysters and sashimi were probably the most memorable for me, if I had to pick. Not a cheap meal, but absolutely worth the money.

Service was very friendly and efficient too! I may be back...though probably not on a weekend.
author: Sara L.

description:
Very good seafood but I don't think it's worth a wait longer than 45 mins-1hr. 

Parking may be hard around here. Luckily I found parking on California with almost 2 hours of time in the meter! To feed the meter you can pay through the app which is nice.

Came with a group of 4 which may be bit difficult when doing bar seating but luckily another group of 4 left when we were getting seated. We waited probably almost 1.5 hours and the time went fairly fast because we had our out of town guest to talk to. When we got near the front they offered beer or wine because of the wait (I can't be sure if it was free or not, since we didn't see the bill). I did notice that 4-5 parties left around us because of the wait and I wonder what still took so long. 

After being seated, we immediately got bread and got samples of the giant smoked salmon that was in front of us. We ordered crab back, a dozen assorted raw oysters, combo salad, shrimp cocktail, crab cocktail, and a full order of smoked salmon. All the food items were really good, even the crab back. This was my first time trying it and it didn't taste as strong as I thought it would. It was buttery. I liked the kumamoto the best, then I think it was called golden point, and liked the miyagi the least. The condiments also complimented the dishes well.

The service was great too. They all like to banter with one another and are very friendly. Always serving more bread (which is a special recipe from Boudin only avail to very few restaurants in SF). CASH ONLY! We didn't know but luckily our guest knew and had lots of cash. Seafood isn't cheap!

When we were leaving we saw a couple of parties that were ahead of us in line still eating (probably sat 15-20mins before us). Not sure if we ate really fast or what. If you don't want to wait in line but want to eat the seafood from here, I would suggest just walking in and ordering to go.
author: Avita S.

description:
Hello Anthony Bourdain!

So I arrived about 15 minutes before opening. My party of two was sat about 45 minutes after opening during the second rotation. I ordered almost everything on the menu...

Chowder 
Crab back 
Sicilian carpaccio (off menu)
A dzn assorted oysters
Assorted cocktail 
Fresh uni

Everything tasted as expected. It was cool to try once, but I wouldn't wait for it again. The service was beyond slow. They can increase their amount of turnovers but they work at a sluggish pace. I guess it is all a part of the experience.
author: Tracy V.

description:
First time here and fall in love with this restaurant. Fresh seafood, Didn't get myself diarrhea  did line up for about half an hour, it was Tuesday 11am+. Many items do not have a clear price tag presented. We were afraid that we will end up paying hundred bucks so we did not order a lot. But the final check was $60 + tips, which seems to be fair. 
We got a whole sea urchin (Uni), crab back $8 (this was clearly priced), clam chowder, half dozen of oysters (a dozen was $30). The clam chowder is my least favorite, I am fine with the texture but it's too salty to me. The rest was awesome. Uni and crab back are must since you can always get oysters at many places. 
I regretted for not ordering the half cracked crab $22. Because later I went to fisherman's wharf and it cost $50 for half crab and it's not even cracked for you. I'll be back soon hopefully
author: YingTung W.

description:
Very old school establishment where the phone rings and the employees serve the customers who are there in person prior to picking up the phone for customers who are not.  

Good fresh seafood.  Cash only (ATM across the street if your forget your $$$).  

Our favorite is the fresh crab, and urchin.  

Get there early, and plan accordingly- this place gets busy!
author: Jared J.

description:
Ah this is the typical SF institution you'd be kicking yourself for not trying if you don't try it at least once. Yes - do the Saturday morning line-up and pick a good buddy to go with you so you can split. We waited about 45 minutes before opening time and were conveniently the second group in line. 

We ordered a large selection -- clams, uni (delicious but ouch on your wallet), the sicilian platter -- the only must get in my opinion because it is not only beautiful but you get to try everything! And the chowder (would skip... tastes like every other chowder I've tried).

The guys here are top notch. They know they're a hit but aren't super pretentious about it. They're quick and efficient without making you feel rushed. Loved the old SF dining vibe here and the top notch service. One guy serves you at a time and isn't focused on other people so the attention is great and not overdone either!

It's gonna take a hit on your wallet so I say go big or go home. Order to your heart's content.

Not a good group spot but I think you know that :)
author: Cindy W.

description:
Get there 2 hours before they open! It's not a joke, there's a line that starts forming way before they open.  All and all, it's worth the wait.  The entire staff and family are great people, very friendly and welcoming with everyone's orders.  They are always busy and running around but they always have a smile on there faces and ready to serve. If your looking for good quality fresh seafood and a fun atmosphere definitely come to Swan Oyster Depot, you'll see why the wait is well worth it. You can;t go wrong with anything you order, everything is delicious and great quality!  

Btw - It's Cash ONLY.  :)
author: Abby C.

description:
So worth it!!! We are definitely coming back to this spot next time we go to San Francisco! 

We waited around 2 hours in line to get in as it is such a tiny place but to be honest the wait was so worth it! The food was amazing! We ordered the sampler oysters as we wanted to try different kinds and our favorite ones were the ones from Baja, so we ordered some more of those! They also have champagne if you wanna go the extra mile!

We also got clam chowder and sea urchin. It's so interesting to see how they open the sea urchin since hey cut it in front of you! By the way, it was delicious! 

Definitely recommend to stop by this spot as it probably was our favorite part from our trip to SF!
author: Karen O.

description: Best raw seafood I have ever had!! We got an array of things and asked for suggestion and it was all delicious. We tried their clams, oysters, sicilian sashimi and crab- it was all so fresh and amazing. We came here during a weekday so it wasnt too crowded. Later in the day the line was starting up. The staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions. The prices were high, but on point for fresh seafood. If you come to San Francisco this has to be one of your top places to come!
author: Theresa B.

description:
Waited for many years before I finally made up my mind to just stand in line by myself for as long as it took to get in. That turned out to be about an hour on a Monday afternoon I happened to have off from work. 

I wanted the crab back but they wouldn't serve it this day unless I ordered the whole crab. They didn't say this until after I'd ordered it and six cherry stone clams. I ended up getting an order of the sliced scallops in olive oil instead. The scallops were incredible so I had a second order. Probably too much.

When it was time to settle they just scribbled some numbers on a napkin which added up to $61.  I was surprised by that amount. They had to consult two different guys at that point, and then decided that it was really $48.  

It was exceptional in terms of quality but still a bit pricey.  It was a big splurge by my standards. 

I got the impression that most of the people eating here were tourists or business travelers.

It may be many years before I return. I might be an out of town visitor at that point as well.  I guess if I do make it back here I'll just get the whole crab with the crab back and call it a day.
author: Gopal R.

description: The long wait was worth it best oysters in town indeed. I would say top 5 places to get oysters in the US.
author: Manouk B.

description:
Was happy that on a Tuesday 11am the wait was only 30 minutes, but sad there was no crab today.
Counter seating is very close together- can be uncomfortably close.  
Metered parking can be difficult, especially since you don't know how long you'll be.  I parked around the corner at the 1725 Sacramento garage.
I can understand coming back for fresh oysters but I will call to make sure there is crab next time.  Wouldn't wait 2 hours though.  I normally wouldn't pay this much to wait long and sit uncomfortably.

BTW, they have a sign that says they don't have a website, so the link on Yelp is bogus.
author: Lynn M.

description: This is probably the only restaurant that has exceeded my expectations.  When looking at reviews, it's quite difficult to build certain expectations in your mind.  Swan Oyster meets them all.  We tried the Sicilian sashimi plate with scallop, tuna, and salmon. They provided wasabi and soy sauce on the side in case you need a little kick.  We also had smoked salmon on sour dough bread (I think).  It was the most perfect way to have lox.  I have never and will never have lox this good again.  I squeezed a bit of lemon on the salmon but it totally did not need it.  Every bit just melts in your mouth.  If it weren't for a local that persuaded us to try it, it would have been a lost opportunity.  They were out of many of the local favorites but I'm glad to know that they serve what's been caught that day.  Love the concept, the people, and most definitely the food.
author: Cindy S.

description:
What could I say about this remarkable SF establishment that hasn't already been said?  Probably very little but here goes... 

First off on foot you could probably find this place blindfolded if you followed the scent of fresh seafood that permeates about a 2-3 block radius.  

Second you could find it without a map of you looked for the line of seafood hungry patrons that line up for their chance at a classic SF seafood experience.  

Friendly staff behind the counter welcome you to first come first serve bar seating.  The place is bustling but we took our time and the staff, though busy, still stopped to chat us up, introduce themselves, ask for our names, and make casual small talk.  

We ordered a plethora of seafood as follows: clam chowder, crab back, seafood cocktail, and raw little neck razor clams.  I had never had raw clams before but now I'll only eat them raw.  The only was to get fresher tasting seafood would be to go down to torpedo wharf, catch it yourself, and eat it right there on the pier. 

Overall a 5 star establishment here and a true SF gem.
author: Dan O.

description: Despite the 2hrs wait... it was totally worth it. The seafood it's amazing !!!  Make sure to order the scallops and sea urchin
author: Santo P.

description:
I'll just start off by saying... The line is worth it!
We waited about 1 hour. The line was shorter than it usually is (so we heard).
It is a bit chaotic once you've sat down but understandable given the demand. Patience is needed on your part.
It took a while for them to clean the counter and realize we haven't ordered yet.

We tried the dungess crab salad, oysters, salmon and scallops.
-The dungess crab salad is literally the crab and chopped up lettuce. I would've like some more on it but... it was still good.
-The salmon and scallops had oil, kapers, and onions. The scallops ... were ... DELICIOUS!? It practically melted in our mouths.
-We ordered half a dozen oysters but never got them and cancelled. So one of the guys gave us 2 just for the heck of it. And I'll say ... these were the most fresh tasting oysters I've ever had. They were cold and had such a refreshing taste.
author: Sung H.

description:
Over-hyped. I'm sorry to be Mr. Negative here but the employees were very rude to us today. We came here very excited to try the seafood since there were so much positive reviews from Yelp. Sadly, service is worth just as much as the quality and flavor of the food.

We arrived 40 mins before they closed and there were 3 stools available (enough for our party) but 3 of their employees repeatedly kept informing us with a rude tone that the bar was closed for seating and they were only available for taking orders.

Ok, so we were fine with taking our food to-go but no need for the attitude! Additionally, we noticed how the employees were practicing UNSANITARY methods of handling food. From touching money and the grabbing seafood from their ice tray in the front of the store with their BARE HANDS! Gross. 

Thank you but I will take my money and appetite somewhere else. The chowder wasn't very good either (was curdling) & the uni had a very off-putting bitter flavor. As for the seafood combo cocktail, it had a fishy flavor that I wasn't fond of. Good waste of $50. They didn't even say "thank you" or "have a good day" after giving me my to-go bag. I felt like they just wanted us to leave. At least I didn't have to tip them for such awful service.
author: Ralph N.

description: 1, Seafood could be a little more fresh. Sea urchin has a bit of the bitter taste and not that sweet. Crab was okay, but very plain, basically boiled and extracted into a pile of meat. The salmon is not very fresh. The crab salad is not that much more meat than the cocktail btw. 2, There's waiting, the staff could be a little nicer, maybe not my style of serving.
author: Shang L.

description:
Comments are pretty much the same as everyone says.  And if you think it's expensive, think about not having to catch the seafood yourself, cook, shell, or gut anything, and still get fresh, delicious seafood.  We had the crab cocktail, Italian sashimi, 1/2 a seafood salad and scallops and we loved it all.  
Great service from our primary guy, but everyone was friendly and happily answered questions and checked on us to make sure we could add more food if we wanted.
author: marie h.

description: Meh, seafood is fresh looking and has not been sitting long. I've only tried the clam chowder since the line is so long. It barley had clams and was mostly just broth. High price for so little, I may have to go back to check out their oysters and fish.
author: Dani A.

description:
After reading all these great reviews on yelp I was so excited to try them out. I heard the wait can be up to 3 hours so I make sure to arrive early Sunday morning before they even open. Yelp says they open at 1030. I arrived around 1015 and there was already over 20 people in line and it looked like they were already open serving people. As I waited in line I over heard a employee telling someone hey actually open earlier depending how quick they get set up. My wife and I ended existing for about an hour and half. This place is bar seating and seats less than 20 at a time. 

We ordered the following items

1. Crab cocktail - can't go wrong with fresh crab already cracked and ready to eat. 
2. Clam chowder- very different then your typical chowder. I wouldn't say it bad or good. Just ok. Very watery and strong clam broth taste.
3. 1/2 dozen cherry stone clams & 1/2 dozen oysters. Both were very fresh but nothing too special than any other fresh oyster spot.
 4. Fresh live sea urchin - actually had a fishy taste at the end. I've had much better quality elsewhere 
5. Italian sashimi- no flavor and it was warm. Not used to sashimi being served that way. They offer soy sauce and wasabi which helped.

Service was on point. Our server was very friendly and full of smiles. I personally don't Think this place is worth the wait. It's really over priced and you can get much better quality tasting food elsewhere.
author: Crystal N.

description:
I have lived near this place for 4 years and never been able to avoid the long line to dine here. Finally, a staycation, and I manage to beat the line on a Friday morning! I recommend visiting on a non-Friday weekday to avoid any wait. We still had to wait around an hour to get seated, and we got there before opening. There was already a line, so we missed the first seating batch. The hack for locals though: order ahead and make a to-go order. You can skip the line!

In terms of the food and service, it was a 5 star experience. The reason I am knocking one star off was the wait. What to order?? The question is what NOT to order. Here is what we ordered:

- House Wine: Cuz WINE not, recommend it if you like your white wine with your seafood. $9 a glass.
- Crab back: Yes. Just yes. It was my husband's favorite! I grew up in Maryland with blue crabs, and was not a fan of it. But this was delicioussss. Something about the creamy deliciousness that dungeness crab backs offer. Definitely use the bread to sop up it all up.
- Combo salad: Both crab and shrimp on a bed of shredded lettuce. Option to dress with either a Crab Louie (cream based) sauce or lemon/olive oil.
- Sicilian sashimi: My favorite! So light, so delicate, yet filling! The main star of this dish was the fish, not a lot of distracting sauces and toppings to take away from it.
- Uni (sea urchin): My second favorite! Not for the faint of heart. If you don't like uni, don't bother. This is the purest form of it. We saw a group order one and ate two bites before giving up on its weirdness. If you love it, definitely order it. Lots of sea urchin come in that bad boy.

Overall, would recommend the Sicilian sashimi, uni, and crab back. Everything was delicious, but those were the standout dishes. Also, great staff here and wonderful service. Even though there was a long line, it is accurate to say that they treated each customer like they were the most important customer to them =)
author: Frances P.

description:
Yes, Swan Oyster Depot is amazing... afterall, it's a restaurant that's been running strong for over 100+ years! The line has always deterred me from eating here, but I finally decided to try it. With a random weekday off, I came here and still waited 1.5 hours! The sad part was, my fiance was waiting with me but had to leave for a meeting so there I was... waiting in line alone and then eating alone at the counter.

But it was worth it! I hate waiting for food, so I probably wouldn't come back for awhile. The guys working at the counter are super sweet and friendly. I don't know the name of the guy who helped me, but he was kind enough to do half orders and was super accommodating. 

I recommend:
- Crab legs
- Sicilian sashimi
- Smoked salmon

I was not a huge fan of the clam chowder... I think I had the tail end of the soup so there was not much clam and just only soup. sad.

I can't believe I waited 1.5 hours on a Thursday. Do people not work?
author: Janet H.

description: These guys know how to treat a customer! We really enjoyed our experience here. We ordered The Sicilian Sashimi, dozen mixed oysters, and Clam chowder. They keep you busy with the bread and butter while they prepare your fresh dish. I love this place!
author: Irene D.

description:
I'm sad that Anthony Bourdain did me wrong.

I was watching CNN: Parts Unknown (SF edition) and Swan Oyster was one of the spots that Tony stopped by. He kept saying amazing things about it and said it was a must if you're in San Fran - you know, the typical spiel. But he usually easily convinces me and whenever I watch his show about destinations I'll be going to, I always make a note to check out those places.

So my friend and I (more so me), decided to get some oysters here during our weekend trip to the City by the Bay. We first went on a Sunday afternoon, not knowing that it was closed on Sundays. But that's on me. I knew they closed at 5 pm in general, I just didn't know they weren't open everyday. Maybe that was a warning sign of what a bad experience it would be. But alas, this premonition was no match for our persistence, for we trekked all the way back there again on Monday.

The place is just one long bar, that fits probably 20 people. We waited about 20 minutes before we were seated. Once we were, it did take a bit of time for them to clean up our area. We ordered the crab back, half a dozen oysters, and half a dozen clams. The crab back (which was GREAT) and the oysters came out quickly, but our clams were nowhere to be found. It must have gotten lost with our server because he too was nowhere to be found. After we got our crab back and oysters, he never came back to check on us. It seems he was too busy on the other end, shucking clams for everybody but us. When we were finally able to flag down a different server, we just asked for the check because we were already in a rush, after waiting 20 minutes for our non-existent clams.

I guess that saying rings true - "Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me."
author: Mel T.

description: No better place to start off your Saturday! Or any day. Go early, get a cup of coffee and be ready to stand in line for awhile. The setting hasn't changed much since its opening days and I hope it never will. Staff is friendly and helpful. Place is small, I believe all the seating was by the bar, and you are made to feel right at home. Once you sit down there's no rush. We tried oyster, sea urchin, and a few other great things that I cannot quite remember anymore what, but everything was delightful. I don't think you can go wrong here. Sea urchin I might not feel tempted to try again. It was interesting and maybe more like gotta try it once kind of a thing.
author: Outi G.

description: It's a small place with only bar seating and there is ~30 mins wait during lunch hours even on weekdays! Be here early if you want to try fresh sea urchin (it was already sold out by the time we were seated around noon). Oyster is very fresh.
author: Mendy H.

description: This place was mentioned by many locals.  They told me the address and said it'll be the place with a line out the door.  I had no trouble identifying this place because just as I was told the line was out of the door.  Get a book and get in line for this authentic dive.  Don't forget your cash.  Wow it's hard to put into words how fresh the seafood tastes.  You have to experience this location.  I can't wait to return. The staff's main concern is serving their customers.  The seats are kinda small but once you finish eating you need to leave to give the next customer in line their turn to feast.
author: Jessica B.

description:
I'll get the negatives out of the way first: this place is way too small for the popularity, and it's expensive.

Now that that's done, wow, this place is amazing. I mean that in so many ways, because it's not just the fresh seafood, but also the ambiance and the service. I've been here for weekend brunch numerous times and it's been universally excellent.

The food of course is the big draw, as it should be. They serve fresh seafood here and it rivals any sushi spot in the city as far as quality goes. I'm a raw fish fan, and I've literally never had a single piece of fish here that wasn't high quality.

Oysters and clams on the half-shell are always a solid bet, but more than that I would also recommend trying the various fish and crab dishes too. When I've gotten fish, they slice it sort of like sashimi, but with more European-American toppings like olive oil and capers. It's cool to me to see something that I typically look at as Japanese being done through the lens of a different culture.

The ambiance here is also a big draw, as the decor is pleasantly kitschy but not overdone. There's a nautical/seafood theme which matches the food perfectly. I also like that despite the restaurant being pretty tiny, it's fun to be in and the noise level is lively but not cacophonous. I will say, the chairs are not super comfortable, but maybe that's their subtle way of saying "hey there's like 50 people who want your seat, don't just sit around after you eat".

Finally, the service. The people who run Swan Oyster Depot clearly care about their customers, and it shows in a number of ways. First, they take pride in keeping the line managed and pleasant, which is nice considering Polk street in the morning is a little nasty. From giving Anchor Steam to people waiting for a table to cleaning the sidewalk to shooing off panhandlers, the guys running this establishment don't just treat the customers inside well, they take care of the ones waiting too.

Inside the great service continues. The guys behind the counter are energetic, happy to talk, and full of great recommendations. If you aren't sure what to order they are happy to explain your options and they've never led me astray.

To reiterate, this place is amazing. Yes it's too small to meet the demand, and yes I often spend $60/person here. But it's still amazing and a real San Francisco culinary landmark, and everyone should go at least once if not every week. Hey, maybe if everyone goes more often, they can expand?
author: Sm L.

description:
I didn't know that this place was a local celebrity until I stopped by. I can see why. The family atmosphere is lovely. The counter seating is smart. These folks know what they are doing. I had the oysters and a bowl of clam chowder. The oysters were fresh. The local oysters were an eye opening mouthful. They reminded me of all the summers I spent on the San Francisco beaches. Infused with flavor. The chowder was perfect. The broth was light, filling and savoury NOT thick and over done like many joints. You could tell some thought and love went into the soup.
I don't eat much because of an autoimmune deal but I can tell you I shall return for the salad and oysters and the passion these hardworking folks have. This is exactly what food should be about: Hospitality and of course amazing and mind opening food.
author: Natalia T.

description: Can't beat this place! HOWEVER, you must be patient enough to wait in line as it is SO well known and referred to tourists that the locals have to be patient as well!  We get the combo salad, french bread and a glass of Honig. Perfect lunch on a nice day in SF! Get there WAY before they open!
author: E. Lynn D.

description: I like this place however I really this that this place got hyped up. I like how you get to see most of the seafood through their window. We got six oysters, six clams, and their sea urchin. The sea urchin was by far the best thing on their menu and worth the price. The urchin melted like butter and had a slight briny taste to it.
author: Jackie N.

description:
Be ready to stand in line for an hour. The line out front is just part of the process, unless you get there @10:30 when they open. The wait is worth it. 

The food is amazing. If you love seafood, this is Mecca. There is nothing new I can say about the food that hasn't already been said. 

But here is what really surprised me about the place. For all the waiting in line, I really expected this place to be the kind of place that rushes you in and out so they can seat the next people. It's not the case. Once you get a seat, they really let you take your time and relax. They are so welcoming and friendly. 

This is one of my favorite places on earth!
author: Chris S.

description: The line out the door on a weekday speaks for itself.  Granted, the bar only accommodates 15 or so patrons, the 30 minute wait was totally worth it.  Once seated, simply order away and the servers will shuck and slice to your hearts desire.  The crab fat was smooth melt in your mouth awesomeness.  Coupled with a variety of daily clams, oysters, sashimi w/ capers and olive oil, raw scallops, squid, and crab cocktail, we soon succumb to food coma.  Worth the wait, and definitely a must eat when in San Fran!
author: Ken W.

description: This place is bomb!!!!! I went on a crowded Saturday afternoon, but thanks to a local lady's tip, ordered our seafood salad, clam chowder, and smoked salmon to go. Definitely the right call!!! We got our food in less than ten minutes when the line would have taken at least an hour / hour and a half, and just ate nearby enjoying the beautiful afternoon. The seafood salad was my favorite, so fresh and honestly a lot of crab/shrimp for the price. If you are a local (or even a tourist), grabbing the food to go back home or eat elsewhere is so clutch! Highly recommend for a delicious seafood bite. Need to go back to do the sit-down on a less crowded day!
author: Christine H.

description: Heaping amounts of seafood with some great sauces and friendly service. Be prepared to wait at least thirty minutes for a cramped counter seat but this place is a staple for a reason. The Sicilian sashimi and crab cocktail were both chocked full of seafood. Great meal
author: Ian C.

description:
Been wanting to eat here for years and finally had the opportunity to try it for the first time two months ago!

We came right when they opened their doors to customers and there was no wait. By the time we finished eating, a line was forming.  Please note that it's only bar seating up to about 10 people, so expect long waits.

We had a variety of oysters, fresh! We had the sashimi sampler, so fresh and amazing! I could've eaten a medium plate all by myself! We had the smoked salmon, fresh and they carve it right in front of you! The clam chowder was okay, but Sotto Mares still best.  Had the crab soup and it was good, but would've been even better warm rather than cold. 

Will be returning here for fresh seafood!
author: Lyn N.

description:
I decided to try some fresh SF seafood, specifically oysters, and after doing some research settled on Swan after reading all the amazing reviews. We first attempted to go for lunch on a Friday but there were at least 30-40 people waiting in line and being that there are limited seats we decided to come back when they opened at 10:30 AM. The next day (Saturday) we arrived at 9:45 AM to find 20 people already in line!!! When they opened the first wave settled in and we then stood and waited while they ate before a spot would open up. Overall we waited nearly 2 hours before sitting down. Luckily they were serving beers to the people in the front of the line, total lifesaver.

Once you get inside you realize how tight it is in there. You're literally rubbing elbows with the people sitting next to you. Our server was a younger guy that was truly awesome. We order 1.5 dozen of mixed oysters, 2 cups of clam chowder, 1 octopus salad, and 1 prawn cocktail plus we had 2 beers and 2 bloody beers (like micheladas). The service again was fantastic, they were friendly and they took the time to explain what you were eating. The food itself was very fresh but I'd have to say a little underwhelming and it failed to live up to the (possibly unfairly high) expectations. The bloody beers weren't really my cup of tea at all but I had to try it. Overall the meal cost $122 not including tip for two people and if I'm being honest I wasn't at all full.

It was definitely an experience and worth checking out. If the wait wasn't so brutal and the price was lower it would be worth repeating but I'll continue trying other places in the city. Probably won't return.
author: Michael L.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is seriously legit and seriously tiny. No wonder it's one of Anthony Bourdain's favorite seafood spots in the city. 

People start lining up before the place opens for the 15 or so seats inside, so if you miss the initial seating, you're in for a wait. Boyfriend and I came here mid-week, and the place was slammed at 11:00am. We waited about an hour before we could indulge in some simple, pure, and delicious seafood. 

The service is quick, friendly, and there aren't a ton of items to choose from. The oysters were fresh, and the crab back was SO good, we ate two. Nothing like dipping bread into that rich, liquid crab gold. Skip the chowder (it was broken when we had it), and stick with the day's fresh delivery. 

Oh yeah, they're cash only. You've been warned!
author: Jonelle T.

description: Found this little gem on Yelp. There was a wait. We ordered oysters- absolutely perfect! They did not need any salt, lemon, or cocktail sauce. The combination salad was DELICIOUS. The Louie dressing was life. We tried buying the sauce but we are traveling so we have nowhere to store it. The clam chowder wasn't as dense as traditional clam chowder, but it was good. They even gave us dinner recommendations.
author: Frances R.

description:
Really good shellfish and seafood----BUT----definitely not worth the 45-minute wait on the sidewalk outside, then the super-cramped counter inside.   Basically a farm-type feeding station with good food.
But I'll be back---for take-out!
author: R.C. O.

description: Clam chowder is broke, But, NOOO they wouldn't hear about it.  As a James Beard awarded chef two times, I tried to be kind when asked how everything was..told the truth, fat separation in soup=broke.   I know it's an institution, but need to listen to changing times....no wonder why their business has slowed down so much over the decade....they don't care anymore.
author: Mr W.

description: It was just as expected. The shrimp, the crab, the oysters and all the seafood was exceptional. The bread was crusty and buttery. The service efficient and friendly. The clam chowder was exceptional. I did not appreciate the clam chowder until I had others that were so thick I could hardly swallow it. We went early and arrived at 10:30 and was able to sit without issue
author: Milka C.

description:
Love the seafood, so fresh and tasty!
The wait tho was insane, but if you've got time, it's worth it.
This place is definitely very old school, family run and it's very straight forward. CASH ONLY.
Oysters, seafood cocktail, sashimi, all were great.
author: Vanlang M.

description: I like this place.  I am just unhappy hat I've waited for an hour and a half to NOT GET SEATED.  this blows.  Don't ever come here after 3:30 because you will not get seated.  Maybe try again in the morning because people like to eat seafood for breakfast NOT.  Hella stupid just because the hype is mad doesn't mean it worth it.  Go get your oysters from Tomales Bay and shuck that shit yourself without the 2 hr fucking worthless wait.
author: Peggy L.

description:
Classic San Francisco spot, and you have to get oysters. I would highly recommend coming here on a San Francisco visit for lunch or dinner. There will be a line, but it is definitely worth the wait. Wonderful, fresh seafood at a (well-known) divey spot. 

It's also fun to walk along Polk street after to work off all the calories!
author: Lauren A.

description: Best seafood of my life. Worth the wait. Staff is so cute too. Sadly they ran out of uni. Crab and sashimi plate was to die for
author: Natasha F.

description:
It's a toss up what I love more-the offerings, the decades of consistency, the snug counter and great on point service or random opportunity to sit next to some fellow bivalve worshipping biped..
I love the decor here from the old school front window tease and gold leaf letters, burnished walls and even right down to the ah ma gd floor.
Uni, Dungy, Clammy, Smoked Salmon um hmm.
Like a hungry beach bird, the sensational aroma of ocean DMS draws you in.
Friendly efficient aproned Staff stay on top of things to fill your plate and mouth with the best tastes of the Sea. No less impressive is the end of day cleaning ritual- a sight to behold as Swans Hygiene Fairies scrub and sterilize with buckets of soap and scalding hot water.
author: Karen W.

description:
Judging by the three parties ahead of us at 2:30pm, midweek, I assume there isn't a day or time when Swan Oyster Depot doesn't have a line. We spent our 20-minute wait doing what passersby do -- ogling the window display of their daily offerings. 

This Polk Street eatery has 20 coveted counter seats, putting you in the thick of all the action: smoked salmon being sliced off the skin in front of you; sea urchin expertly cleaned & prepped; five workers constantly hustling to deliver orders & checking to make sure "you're all set." 

We ordered crab and prawn cocktails, both fresh & plump but also both lacking a sweetness I've come to expect of San Francisco seafood. Disappointed that their clam chowder had a watery consistency; creamy butteriness was non existent. Smoked salmon was no better, no worse than any other place. Absolutely middle of the road (though their sourdough, which comes from Boudin, is phenomenal.) $58 (not including tip) for the meal & two sodas. Cash only. 

Swan Oyster Depot has that old school charm that SF restaurants over a certain age possess; plus they've got Anthony Bourdain's endorsement which is no small feat. The experience & atmosphere is fantastic, as far as authentic seafood markets go. Their food is no frills, probably done the way it's always been done; I'm looking for a couple more bells & whistles.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I dont understand how i havent posted a review yet. My husband and I have been coming here for around 4-5 yrs now and have brought various friends and family from all over the world here. We are just that proud of this place. Its always a fine treat! Heaven on earth!!! Before Swan, i have never eaten raw oysters, or raw anything, but the moment I saw our friend Anthony Bourdain indulging on the goods on his show, aaw man i was enticed! We made the trip and have been hooked since!

After venturing into the world of raw seafood thanks to Swan, we have tried to get our oyster fixes closer to home in SJ, but nothing compares! I swear to Gawd, i get a tiny orgasm whenever i get my first oyster here! I dont know how they do it but this has to be the freshest stuff on earth! 

The guys here are characters and I love how they make me feel like taking a step back in time, to the good old days. Nothing will ever stop me from coming back here. You guys are amazing!!! I always leave this place high on seafood lol Pure euphoria.
author: Ark Aimee S.

description:
Saw this featured on Anthony Bourdain's show and knew I had to come here!

I read reviews and listened to their advice in coming early.  I was there about 30 minutes before it opened and I must've gotten lucky because there were only about 5 or 6 people in line. Closer to opening, the line was about 20 people long.  The doors opened and they took the first 16 people or so (however many bar seats they have).  The workers have been working together for a long time and you can tell by the way they work with each other and they way they talk to each other.

My boyfriend and I sat down and looked at the old school menu board behind the bar.  We knew what we wanted before we got there since we seen everything on yelp! :)

Unfortunately, they were out of one of the items I was really looking forward to...Uni in it's shell!

But everything else they had.  Got the crab back fat and dipped some bread it in.  Got the Sicilian sashimi which I really enjoyed since it had a citrus twist to it.  Very different than regular sashimi, but I liked it!  And we got the crab cocktail.  Already cooked and cracked crab in a small dessert dish.  Dip that in the crab back fat and you got yourself some tasty goodness!

I will definitely come back next time i"m in SF and can stand in line before it opens :)
author: Dayneen M.

description: One of the smallest restaurants we went to, which only seats twenty or so people. The Sicilian-style sashimi is different than what I'm used to, but I really liked it! The scallops were probably my favorite part of it. This dish is off-the-menu but it's very popular! It's not good for big crowds, so a party of 1-2 would probably be ideal.
author: Sherry V.

description:
WORST FOOD EVER
4 of us ate here a few days ago and we ALL GOT SICK!!!!

We were so excited and didn't mind waiting half an hour....

It may have been ok once but we will NEVER NEVER eat there again or recommend this horrible place
author: Lili D.

description:
In A Nutshell:

-Swan Oyster Depot is honestly nothing real special.
-It's basically an old school raw bar w/ 2+ hour wait.
-Seating is limited around 20 stools.
-The oyster selection is very limited, just a couple varieties of miyagi & kumomoto.
-Sorry Bourdain you failed on this one.

Overall, the best oyster spot IMO is Elliot's Oyster House in Seattle.  They have at least 35 different oyster varieties plus their special sorbet.
author: Romeo K.

description:
I do love Swan Oyster Depot, but I will probably NEVER come back. In order to not wait 1-2 hours, you literally have to eat raw seafood at 10:30am....not the worst thing ever, but still a little too early for my taste. I just really hate waiting and in SF, you wait for everything.

They open at 10:30am and my bf and I got there at 10am. There was no one lined up outside yet, so we were the first ones there, but literally ~2 minutes later....BAM.....the line begins and does not end. I feel bad for the folks that just miss the first seating (18 stools in the restaurant only) because if you miss the first seating, you'll wait at least 45 minutes until people finish up / pay / leave. I liked being the first ones in because you sit near the end where all the shucking and sashimi cutting action is!

I love the family feel you get from everyone working. They joke with each other and you see them constantly laughing. They really treat the folks eating like family as well. Although there is a long line, they never rush you and actually told me to take my time finishing up my beer before leaving. One thing to note, if you're a germaphobe then you might get a little grossed out that they handle things there with their bare hands.

Food:
- Oysters: get the combo so you can try them all....the blue points are creamy deliciousness and kumamoto oysters are always a fan fave. They had 2 different kumamoto's in the combo platter and one was so small and cute.
- Uni: oh man.....this was like heaven.....
- Crab Cocktail: they give you large chunks of crab!
- Scallops in Ponzu: this was one of my fave things we ordered....it was light and fresh and oh so delish :)
- Smoke Salmon (cold): GET THIS!!! We really weren't going to get this because 1. we were stuffed and 2. smoked salmon is whatevers to me, but a local stopping in to say hi to everyone working told us that if we went to Swan Oyster and didn't get the smoked salmon, then we didn't get the whole Swan Oyster experience. I am SO GLAD we listened because it was REALLY good. We got a small plate and contemplated getting a half order on top of that because it was THAT good, but we were so stuffed.

TIP(S): Call at 10am and place a take-out order! If you do eat there then know you don't have to get the full size of things, you can do quarter / half orders.

CASH ONLY!!! There is a Chase ATM across the street.
author: Jennifer T.

description: This place is pure hype.  Nothing special about their seafood.  However, they need to really improve on their hygiene.  The worker scoops up the cooked crab with his hands.  He collects money with the same hands, touches and plays with his head, and goes back to serving fish with his bare hands.  I was there for an hour, not once did he wash those hands.  Please wash hands or use serving gloves.
author: susan g.

description: Great spot. The food is fresh and the staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Everyone behind the counter makes you feel right at home. Simple food, done right. I started with the clam chowder while I waited for my oysters to be shucked. The chowder has big pieces of meat swimming in a creamy broth. The oysters were very fresh and delicious. The crab cocktail was solid. I highly recommend the Sicilian Sashimi plate. It's not on the menu but they'll happily make it for you and comes in a few sizes. This was my favorite dish! You get to try 6 different pieces of raw fish and the EVOO and capers on top ties it all together. You will have to wait but it's worth it.
author: Joe U.

description:
This was will worth our 2 hours wait in line.
Best Oysters and the Seafood is always so fresh.
author: Lorie C.

description:
Man, they just really know seafood here. And the variety is just astounding. Came on a random Tuesday, about 30 minutes before opening, and there was already a line. Thankfully, I was able to make it inside for the first wave. There's only a row of seats at the counter, which made it a little cramped, but it's all worth it for the product, and that product is delicious seafood.

Ordered a bunch of stuff including the crab back, a small sashimi, and the crab salad. The crab back was really interesting, because I initially assumed that it would be served hot, but was actually served cold. However, if you dip a bunch of bread into that stuff, there's not much better than that salty, rich, and slightly fishy taste. Not to mention, it's pretty cheap at $6. The crab salad was really great, despite consisting mostly of a pile of iceberg lettuce. However, the dressing it came with was delicious, and they really do load up the crab in the salad. The sashimi included hamachi, salmon, and tuna, which all were great with the olive oil and capers. 

I really enjoyed the old-school vibe here. No website, no frills, just good, clean flavors. The people behind the counter are very knowledgeable and patient. The value is pretty solid for fresh seafood, so while you may spend a lot (our bill was about $80 for lunch), you know you're getting some of the best stuff around.

Will be back for sure for their other dishes, just gotta find a time when I have enough free time to get there early enough. The quality speaks for itself, and while you might be a bit miffed at the wait, it'll all melt away once you get your hands on that seafood.
author: Eric J.

description: Yes, you need to stand in line for awhile, but it worth it. Bar seating only. Seafood bought fresh 6 days a week. Excellent clam chowder. Combination seafood salad was amazing with their secret salad dressing. Smoke sampler was over the top. Servings are enough to share. This place is a must.
author: Maureen K.

description: The guys that work here are great! Such a homey hole in the wall type place. Oysters were yummy. Crab back was flavorful. Italian sashimi was good but I'd prefer Japanese style any day. Seating was not as comfortable because we sat where your legs were up against the counter.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Yesterday was our 3rd visit to Swan Oyster Depot. It's now on the list of "must do" places whenever we visit San Francisco. We live in Brooklyn in an old school Italian neighborhood and Swan's would fit in just perfectly back home. 
The line wasn't too bad yesterday but we showed up early around 11:15/11:30. We ordered a feast as usual including a couple things off the official menu that we had seen people have in the past and copied! 
-Anchor Steam Beer
-half dozen oysters 
-Sicilian sashimi 
-scallops ("eggs") in a ponzu sauce with siracha
-crab cocktail
-bread and butter

Our particular server was pleasant but seemed to stay at the other end of the bar from us so not that attentive but one of the other guys we remember from prior visits was really awesome and funny and attentive. We weren't sure if they pool tips but ended up asking him a few things and he was terrific and we had a great conversation when we were checking out with him. 
There was no one working the door yesterday like in prior visits so we saw individual stools remain empty since no one was at the door shouting out available seats. That didn't seem to effect us but I felt bad if here were some individual diners in line who could have sat down much sooner! 
All in al didn't disappoint and of course the food was fresh and amazing! The vibe is also super welcoming and despite the long line they never make you feel rushed and tell you to take your time. We love Swan's and hope it stays around for another 100 years!
author: Heather B.

description:
An SF institution and finally off my list to after living 10 years in the Bay!  Friends showed up at 10:45am and waited a few minutes before being seated.  Once I showed up at 11:10am there was already 10 people lined up out the door.  The line never stopped even after we left.  It's counter space so very limited.  The vibe at this place is so awesome and old school.  CASH ONLY (there's a bank across the street.) Definitely feels like all the men taking orders have been there for a long time. 

Things we ordered and enjoyed (or could do without.) 
- Crudo (salmon, scallop, tuna) - super tasty 
- Half Crab (cold/fresh - tasty with cocktail sauce) 
- Crab cocktail 
- Back Crab (dipped with bread - tasty/rich and cold - not sure why I was expecting this to be warm) 
- Clam chowder (kind of water so I could have skipped this) 
- Dozen mixed oysters (kumamotos, blue point, etc) so fresh and tasty with the vinagrette 

Also pleasant surprise to get a bowl of hot water and lemon to get the seafood smell off your fingers! Oh and the postcard and dip to get a sponge postcard. Super cute.
author: Anya R.

description: One of our must-haves whenever we are in the city!  We love love love the fresh seafood and awesome service.  This spot is tiny with about 10-12 bar seats so the wait can be long but definitely worth it! During our last visit we had mixed oysters, cherry stone clams, scallop sashimi Asian-styled, Sicilian sashimi, and smoked salmon.  All amazing! Can't wait to come back and eat more delicious seafood!
author: Duyen V.

description:
Come early. Like really really early.

Sashimi uses good quality fish, but the knife skills are a bit lacking.
author: S F.

description:
Would be a 5 star if I didn't have to wait for over 2 hours to eat lunch, especially when I planned accordingly (or so I thought) and showed up at 10:30am. That being said, this was a pleasurable and unique dining experience; one that I will remember for a long time.

Swan Oyster is old-school, in all of the good ways, and none of the bad (except maybe being cash only). The menu is limited because they do a few things, and they do them well. They only serve what is fresh and available.

The Italian Sashimi (off-menu) met the lofty expectations. The gentlemen behind the counter had us pick the trio of fish, and he did the rest. There were many offerings of oysters, all with unique flavor profiles. The crab salad was also a star; the workers crack the crab right in front of you to assemble. I admittedly shied away from the crab back, only because its served cold (as is everything else), but for me, I like my fat hot. 

Oh, they also have uni by the boatload. The staff showed us how to properly extract it from the sea urchin; it was super interesting. On that note, the staff here is A+. Its nice to see people who are passionate about what they do, and have integrity in the food business. 

Swan Oyster has existed for over 100 years, and its obvious why. They don't make restaurants like this anymore.
author: J. B.

description: There is not enough to say about Swan.  I've been here at least 10 times, twice during my last visit and it never gets old.  When waiting in line, remember, good things come to those who wait !!!  Once inside  here is what to do....introduce yourself to the server, he's your captain and will take you on your seafood journey....start off with a glass of white wine and some oysters, then go for a cup of clam chowder.  Time for glass of wine number two. Don't eat too much bread or you won't have enough room for the good stuff.  From the chowder hit the salmon, capers, and onion on sour dough.  Have your third cup of wine.  Go for a crab and prawn cocktail, drizzle it with the louie dressing. Take a breather, digest.  Time for glass o wine number four.  Order the 1/2 crab back and have them stuff it with crabmeat.  At this point if you are still hungry, the smoked salmon, whitefish and trout plate will put you over the top.  Bring a couple of hundies as they only accept cash.
author: Andrew S.

description:
First time there (Anthony Bourdain said whenever he's in SF, he has to stop by here), so we have to try it out. I'd have to say, I love the vibes here just as much as the seafoods here! We probably waited in line for half an hour, but worth the wait! 

I'd recommend the prawn cocktail over the shrimp cocktails, because shrimp cocktail has very small size shrimp ...still, sweet, fresh and good. But prawn cocktail comes with huge, fresh prawns!  cocktail sauce is classic and well balanced. Gotta try their spicy horseradish, pow! And clam chowder if pretty good, but the day we went, the milk curdled a bit, doesn't affect the taste though. Fresh clams...so good!
