Also, don't forget to order their fresh oysters from so many regions. Their oyster dressing/sauces are so delicious!! Their local oysters are so fresh, they got them that very morning around 4am and has a mild, buttery and tasty flavors. 

Staff is so friendly and service was great! Seafoods were delicious and so fresh, we're really impressed and would have stayed and ordered more if we didn't already have other things planned that day  we parted with little fun gifts from our waiter. 
Cheers!
author: Issy M.

description:
I walked by this place countless times thinking "wow, look at that line, this place must be amazing."

Finally, I found a day in my schedule with lots of time and decided to give this place a shot. A friend and I showed up here at 12pm on a Tuesday, and stood and waited to get to the front of the line until 2:15pm. Yes 2 hours and 15 minutes.... 

Finally, we got a seat at the tiny counter, and were approached by one of the waiters. We ordered a bottle of chardonnay for $36 (retail $11 according to google), which was probably my favorite part of the meal. We then each got a cup of clam chowder with bread that was very average. Following the soup, we got a dozen oysters ($36), which were beyond sub-par compared to paying the same amount at Hog Island. We then went on to get a combination cocktail, which was pretty much your neighborhood grocery store's cocktail sauce smothered over a tiny serving of mini shrimp, 1 large shrimp, 2 raw oysters, and a sprinkle of crab. Following this dish we got the sashimi platter (unknown price), which was fish smothered in oil and capers --- effectively ruining the taste of the fish (unless it was already bad, at which case maybe helping its case). Finally, I saw everyone getting the sea urchin, and was feeling rather adventurous, so we got the sea urchin. I have tried uni 3 times in my life, so I am far from an expert. The first time I found it ok, the second time I absolutely loved it, and this time I barley was able to swallow it.

At the end of the meal, we were ringed up $140. I am not sure for what exactly, but we paid our bill and left this place as quickly as we could. I am someone who has a lot of experience with seafood, and there was nothing good about this place.

Now, when I pass the long line, I will just turn and laugh.
author: Nikita K.

description: Awesome customer service! Kevin greeted me the moment I stepped inside. I've been wanting to come here for some time but heard about all the long lines. So I decided to stop in on my way to a couple of business meetings. Got here at 9:45am but they don't open til 10am and lunch starts at 10:30am. Kevin was cool, I ordered 4 Kumamoto Oysters and a cup of clam chowder. Asked him to give me 4 more Oysters of his choice and explained I didn't want the strong Mercury after taste. I don't remember what he gave me but they were clean and good! I suggest coming in right when they open and during the week day. The clam chowder was alright - watery and there wasn't much clams. It it warmed me up after the 8 Oysters. Just under $25 but expected since I'm in the city and this place is a SF institution, a must visit! I'll be back!!!
author: Frank T.

description:
Make the effort and take the time to go here. Unless you're a bigger group (4+) then I'd say try somewhere else. We went on a Thursday and waited behind about 15 people for 45 minutes. When we left about 1/1:15, there were only 5 or 6 people in line. 
All the reviews have it right: friendly service, delicious seafood. We each had a cold beer and seafood combination salad...although it's a tiny counter only seating, we were warmly welcomed and weren't rushed.
author: Susan H.

description: What a huge disappointment. Their clam chowder wasn't even a chowder, but rather watery milk soup with a couple pieces of clams and potatoes. The potatoes tasted like the kind you'd get out of a can of soup. I've had better clam chowder from Trader Joe's. Our "chowders" were barely warm. The oysters were very fresh. Just eat them out of the shell, don't ruin them with lemon, hot sauce, cocktail sauce or mignonette, they were all disappointing. We wanted to order their crab salad, but couldn't swallow the whopping $29 price for crab over iceberg lettuce. Just be prepared to have deep pockets when you eat here. Service was good. We waited only 15 minutes at 11AM on a Wednesday.
author: Siew Leng P.

description: A San Francisco institution and an experience worth putting on your restaurant bucket list. Fresh seafood, simply served in an intimate environment.
author: Lauren B.

description: My boyfriend and I were riding on the cable car for fun and I spotted this place because I remembered it was recommended on TV. Place is limited seating but luckily it wasn't busy when we came. I was excited to try this place out because I'm a big seafood lover. We tried the dozen oysters containing a variety of different kinds. I believe it was $32 for the variety of oysters for a dozen. The oysters were good. Our favorite was the smallest oyster. My boyfriend ordered a beer and he barely touched the beer he said it wasn't cold enough. They do give you some bread. My boyfriend wanted to try a cup of clam chowder. It was not good at all. It was watery and not flavorful. I was kinda disappointed with my experience here. Guess it's not for me.
author: Donna P.

description: Not sure what is wrong with everyone but I will never wait in line for an hour with the other lemmings. But if you must try this place, do yourself a favor and skip the wait and get your overpriced food to go.
author: Tommy C.

description: If you're visiting San Francisco you have to start at the Swan. It's atmosphere is just what you need when you visit he city. Ask for the sea urchin and order more then you think you will need, trust me! Also the shallot vinegar sauce is just perfect, you could drink it!
author: Harry J.

description: Such an amazing place! We usually go over to the Ferry Building to eat at Hog Island, wait for 2 hours and find out some of the items we want are sold out. Today though, we flew in from LA and we went straight to Swan Oyster Depot. There was a line already, and it took about an hour to be seated. Once we got seated we ordered, ate and it was great. Little neck clams were the best, sashimi was so good too. Loved every item we ordered. Now, we are thinking about going back early in the AM just to get our clam fix and fly back home
author: Loana U.

description: This place is an SF institution and when I finally had the chance to eat lunch here, it didn't disappoint. The seafood is really fresh. I tried a sampler of sashimi, smoked fish, seafood cocktail and the clam chowder. Everything was great. The wait around 2 pm on a Tuesday was not bad (30 minutes). Service at the counter was really nice and attentive.  Cash only and no reservations but well worth it.
author: Andrew S.

description:
You can redefine taste of Oyster here. I mean it
If you are into spicy sauce try their spicy sauce or their Louie sauce if you are more into authentic stuff.
author: Praveen G.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is for people who appreciate fresh seafood in its pure form, opposed to deep fried and served along French fries. If it's local fresh seafood you're looking for, get in line, make sure you packed a snack, a bottle of water and a good attitude, and be ready to enjoy some of the finest ocean delights!

Things I have had during my visits here:

Clam chowder: The first couple times, it was so good, I ordered more. This last trip, it was off, and not as flavorful. I'm giving them a pass because it was only this one time, and maybe someone was just light on the salt when preparing it or something. But definitely get it. It's so tasty. 

Crab salad: Basically just lumps and lumps of glorious crab on a bed of fresh lettuce. Like I said, this isn't where you come for gimmicks or fancy sauces. They aren't trying to hide the seafood. The crab is the star of the show, and they let it shine. 

Seafood cocktail: If you love all seafood, and this is your first visit, I highly suggest getting this, because you get a little taste of everything. Crab, oyster, prawns, shrimp, and I think a mussel. Like a sampler platter of almost everything they have

Crab back/fat: I finally decided to try this the last time I went, and I honestly couldn't decide whether I really liked it or just kind of liked it. First, I thought it was served warm, but it's cold. I'm not a fan of cold soups, and this reminded me of soup. However, dipping the fabulous bread into it takes it to an interesting level that I really liked. But without bread, I wouldn't want to spoon that into my mouth like a soup. Maybe you aren't even supposed to. I don't know. But I would say this definitely is not a dish for the squeamish. I will say that I dipped the lumps of crab meat from my seafood cocktail into the crab fat, and THAT was genius, if I do say so myself!

Mussels: Fresh, perfect.

The service is cool there, the guys behind the counter are all really nice and upbeat. They remind me of east coast people, I don't know why... maybe it's their no non-sense ways. Watching them joke around with each other and hustle back there is fun to watch.

I don't need to encourage you to go to Swan Oyster Depot, the place speaks for itself!
author: Liz M.

description: The only drawback is the space and amount of seating. Do not come with a large group! Other than that the service is amazing, the food is great, and the options are numerous! The clam chowder followed by a crab back order is the way to go, to get the best they have and at a good price. Worth the visit if you're in San Francisco.
author: Lidia D.

description:
Looking for a charming SF experience? Delicious seafood? Good brunch/lunch spot?

Swan Oyster Depot was everything the reviews said it would be and more! When I went I was hungover, so unfortunately didn't eat that much.

Between two people:
split a dozen mixed oysters: an oyster flight, basically, it  cool that you got 6 different kinds of oysters (2 of each) and you could compare and contrast; so fresh & delicious
bowl of clam chowder: seemingly grainy (would not describe as creamy or thick) consistency, but so so delicious; the clam flavor is strong and i really enjoyed the soup!
combination cocktail: we wanted to try everything, but my bf and i kinda didn't like some of the things included (mussels/clams), so next time we'll probably opt for just a shrimp (SO FRESH & DELICIOUS) or crab cocktail
bread + butter: just okay

Ya, I described the food as 'delicious' too many times in this review, but this place is legit. Really want to come back and try other items on the menu!

Side note: got there around 10AM on a Saturday, they opened 15 minutes early, and we waited about an hour to be seated. imho worth the wait and worth coming before opening time to be in the first batch of the seated
author: Mimi T.

description:
Excellent fresh seafood and fun atmosphere. That said - one experience waiting 1.5 hours in line (and this is after arriving 30 min prior to opening on a weekday!) was enough for me.

Highlights: 
--Crab salad - SO much fresh Dungeness crab meat topped on a pile of shredded iceberg lettuce and special Louie dressing.  
-- Oysters - so fresh! Especially loved the Kumamoto - SO good. 
-- Sicilian Sashimi - delicious slices of fresh scallops, tuna and salmon topped with olive oil and capers.

So impressed with the service once we were finally seated - our guy remembered our order without taking any notes. He didn't stop for a moment to catch his breath before preparing our order (he made the salad, shucked the oysters and sliced the sashimi) and taking care of the next order.
author: Jen H.

description:
My six year old had seen Anthony Bourdain and Andrew Zimmerman eat here and insisted we wait in line. It was around 2:30 and we waited an hour and a half which was more than we wanted to wait, especially since my daughter is only 2 and we had to take turns walking her around the block.
When we got inside we were like give us everything we've been waiting forever.  But they were calm and like chill out and have some bread and a glass of wine. You realize that is why you were waiting forever and why it was worth the wait. 
The clam chowder was kind of thin and salty unfortunately. But the smoked fish (both kinds) were amazing. The shrimp was great and I want a vat of the amazing dressing for the salad. 
My husband had 6 oysters, 2 of each kind. He thought they were all fresh and delicious. 
Disappointment was no crab left.  
I would give 4.5 but am rounding up for the outstanding service and respect for my children, the only ones we saw the whole time.  
Btw, remember to bring cash. Like $100+ if you are going to have a couple drinks.  Also this is cold seafood and bread. This is not a full service restaurant. 
Finally, the website you see if you google is fake and clickbait!!!
author: Sarah B.

description: SF Classic. Cash only though, so go by the ATM beforehand. Fresh seafood in the daily, you can really tell by the volume of business they do everyday, there are lines down the block for this place. You get a healthy serving of each order and the guys behind the bar are very helpful and informative about their inventory. Make a stop if you have time on your list, you won't regret it
author: J Y.

description: Hamachi was really good. Highly suggest the "eggs" (scallops w/ sriracha and ponzu sauce). Workers were very personable, great place to eat and hangout with friends.
author: Quintin C.

description:
I came here with the BF we waited pretty much 45mins to an hour. We arrived right before lunch, still waited and made new friends in line. Is it worth the wait.??? I don't know. I rather just go to pier whatever number I think it's 79 or 89 something like that. Everything here is FRESH. Yes! I give you that. Was the food tasty? Yes! It was delicious in opinion. The BF didn't care to much. He's a Safeway chicken kind of guy with 2 sides. 

I'm giving a 3 star bc I came in and No Uni. *Whomp Whomp! Uni is my foie gras of the sea. But I did get crab guts! So I'll give back half of a star. I LOVE crab Guts! 

Will I come back.?? Maybe for pick up.  : / And have picnic at the park. I did see people order for take out. Would i recommend this place? Yes! This place is older than our grandma! So, Yasss GO! For the experiences and if you have an hour to wastes. Then do it! Other than that. Call in your order. Go have a picnic or get there an hour before they open.  

The whole entire staff here is genuinely kind, attentive and well trained. They keep it old school/ traditional. They really take the time to explain each item to you. They let you take your time. No rushing. Which I like knowing they have less than 20 bar seats and freakin line outside on a random Monday. No rush! Take your time! As for that I'll give back the other half star. 

BRING CASH!!! Cash only.
author: Kathy K.

description: Seriously THE BEST fresh seafood!!! We've come a couple of times while in town, and EVERYTHING is AMAZING!!! Crab back, fresh oysters, sashimi plate, cocktails...you name it, it's delicious!!
author: brittany d.

description: I have been to a lot of seafood places, but SOD is clearly the best seafood in the world.  You cannot get any fresher - literally from the boat to the counter!  During the day you will see a line forming on a nonchalant street in San Francisco - you walk by the window and you realize this is not your everyday seafood raw bar!  SOD is a family owned business with a really rough edge that delivers the best seafood I have ever had.  The entire experience should be considered a "bucket list" item on all levels - check this one off and now anyplace I go for seafood will never measure up to this gem.  As an East Coaster, we can not touch this...we should, but so far not even close with the exception of Crisfield in Silver Spring.  Oh yea...have the Seafood Sundae!  YUM!
author: Peter L.

description: Freshest fish in the bay. Anthony Bourdain was right in praising this restaurant. Definitely get the crab-back.
author: Rich D.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is a seafood bar that has been featured on Anthony Bourdain's Parts Unknown. It's located in Nob Hill in San Francisco and is a tiny little restaurant marked unobtrusively by a blue awning outside and more conspicuously, by the long line of people waiting outside. 

   Once seated, you'll quickly realize that Swan Oyster Depot is a very special and unique Bay Area establishment.. Everyone working there is a complete character and  all incredibly warm and inviting. The best way we can describe what it feels like in Swan Oyster Depot is feeling like you're in your uncle's garage that got transformed into an oyster bar with all your uncles and cousins just hanging out, jammin' out to 50s surf rock and preparing you a feast.  It's organized chaos behind the bar--all you see are orange t-shirts weaving in and around each other, never missing a beat of refilling drinks or asking customers what else they need. 

   We started off with a cup of clam chowder. When in the bay, you must indulge yourself in some clam chowder, always.  The chowder at Swan Oyster Depot is very special. It isn't very thick and is more on the soupy-side. The cream wasn't overpowering at all, which allows the fresh clam flavor to come through with each spoonful. Of course, we had to throw in some oyster crackers from the giant communal bowl placed in front of us. No clam chowder is complete without a spoon full of those bad boys! The cup of clam chowder was the perfect start to the decadence we were about to experience.

   Next, we had a combo platter of two-dozen oysters. Every single oyster was so delicious and the flavors were so distinctly different. Some sweet, some more buttery and some more ocean-y. Each one was so delightfully fresh and didn't have that overpowering salty and sandy, gritty taste and texture. These oysters were so delicate in their flavor and with each slurp of the oyster, we were greeted by the slightest hint of that yummy ocean flavor. We mostly stuck with lemon and Tabasco  for our condiments, but mignonette sauce and their house-made hot sauce are also available to top your oysters with. 

   Next up was the Sea Urchin. It's no surprise that Boss and Boss are huge fans of Uni, so naturally, when we saw a few Sea Urchins just chillin on top of ice in the storefront, we knew what we had to do. Everytime we've had Uni, it's always been at a sushi restaurant. This time was our first time having Uni prepared in a non-Japanese style. When they brought the Sea Urchin out, it came in it's own shell. It was a very impressive way of plating the uni, but on top of that, it was so fascinating to look at because each of the spines on the Sea Urchin shell were still moving and doing a little dance. The taste of the uni was very interesting because we're used to that oceany taste which we love in Uni. However, this Sea Urchin didn't have that oceany flavor but it still retained that buttery texture that we all love so much. We still loved it, but it had us scratching our heads.

   The shrimp cocktail was next. It was no surprise that this was just as amazing as the rest of our meal. The prawns were very fresh and very meaty. The shrimp cocktail sauce was also very tasty and with some added freshly grated horseradish, it was heavenly.   when you add some of their horseradish in there, it adds that extra kick. 

   As if we hadn't eaten enough, we ordered their Sicilian Sashimi. It was an assortment of Yellowtail, Salmon, Tuna, Mackerel, and Scallop splashed with olive oil and topped with capers and finely diced red onion. The dish was tasty, but being two sushi lovers, we felt that perhaps the olive oil, capers and onion distracted from the taste of the fish. Tasty, but would probably explore the other items on their menu before ordering this again. If you are, however, interested in trying out this menu item, be sure to ask for it because it doesn't make an appearance on their menu board.

   We ended our lunch with their infamous Crab Back. It's the shell of the crab, cracked away from the body while retaining that "crab butter" and fat that is so often neglected. The taste of the crab butter is... well, buttery, and oh-so-delicious. It's a little jarring at first when you dip your bread into it, because you'd expect the juices to be warm but they are in fact cold. Once you get past that, it's a super tasty end of the meal treat and a perfect use of the sourdough loaf you're served at the beginning of your meal. 

   This lunch was one of the most decadent lunches that we've ever had. Everything we ordered was so amazing and the oysters blew us away. The lunch itself was not for the faint of heart, as it put us back three bones. So if you're down to ball out, this is the place to do it. Anthony Bourdain once said about eating at Swan Oyster Depot, "If I read about myself dying at this counter, I'd say to myself, 'that was one lucky guy.'" We finally understand what he meant and agree wholeheartedly.
author: Boss And Boss E.

description: This place is gross. The oysters I was served were warm. The second one I ate was bad and I had to immediately spit it out. The clam chowder was super watery and separated, I had one bite and threw it away ( tasted sour). The REAL disgusting thing I saw was one of the employees stick his BARE HANDS into the Dungeness crab container ( all the crab was cracked and out of the shell) and fill a to go container full of it. I was shocked, I did not see him wash his hands and he had been touching things all over the restaurant. What kind of a dump is this!? Are they trying to make people sick?! DISSAPOINTING TO SAY THE LEAST!!!
author: A C.

description: Everyone sits at a long bar to eat their food here, and the wait is (ridiculously) long, since they could maybe fit 12-16 people at a time. It's fresh, and really, really expensive. I'm not an oyster person, so I opted out of the oysters, but my group thought they were delicious. The combination salad was alright, but honestly, it was alot of filler, unremarkable lettuce. The best thing I tried here was the scallop sashimi. I never had it before, but boy was it good. It was so soft, tender, and melted in your mouth. Definitely a must get. I also tried a bit of the smoked salmon, and it was really, really good as well.
author: Ke C.

description:
These guys are such a fun bunch. This creates the atmosphere of Swan Oyster Depot.

Their seafood is just phenomenal. I've been twice already and have had various items, but the items I tend to go crawling back for are the:
- Crab Backs (FOR SURE)
- Oysters on the halfshell - I had ones from British Columbia, Washington State, Miyagi, and Local Kumamoto Oysters
- Shrimp & Crab Cocktails
- Cherrystone Clams (so good...)

These are my top 4 picks. If anything just get the crab backs and you won't regret it! Your cholesterol level may regret it but that's ok, yolo.
author: Alan T.

description:
Had to try this place after having scene it on Anthony Bordaine.  Waited about an hour and 15 mins and had it not been freezing, it wasn't that bad. I think packing some hidden alcohol for the wait would be a smart idea.

I started at the end of the line with a delicious chorizo breakfast burrito in hand, channeling one of my friends who is a serious eater. No shame, I had walked into a small Mexican joint earlier to warm up thinking I would get a small snack and walked out with a forearm sized burrito. The owner said she hasn't been open 30 years because the food sucked and I figured, she had a point.

By the time we made our way into our seats, I was ready for some seafood.  Started with oysters, bread and butter, a red eye, a bowl of chowder, Dungeness crab cocktail.

Finished with an anchor steam, sashimi platter, and the grand finale...Uni!

The service is awesome and I loved the old school service and personalities. Cute Italian boys behind the counter too, not hard on the eyes.

Get the crab cocktail and Uni! Oh and you can order to go, beats the line, but you need to experience eating there at least once. I'd skip the red eye unless you really love cocktail sauce in your bud light.  The bread is also delicious.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
This was my favorite place in San Francisco to get seafood. Various kinds of oysters from coast to coast; clams to die for; Did I mention the crab back?

One recent visit, turns out to be, not so good. They tried to offer your chopsticks because you look Asian? And offer the sea urchins that is bitter and of completely different grade visible to you while hearing I don't want bring all the good stuff. And because the waiter welcomes is off-shift during eating. Then you could not get anyone to bring check to you. You asked the Asian lady for check and she wipes towel and saying," I am not the waiter. You will have to ask someone else to bring you the check.WTH
author: Frederick W.

description:
The food sucks. The high star reviews are for customer service which we admit is good. But we came here thinking the food was good and it was terrible. The soup was grainy... we got the clam chowder and to describe it simply it was just flour not properly mixed with hot water. Like miso soup! But miso soup tastes better.

O ya, the oyster.... THE FREAKIN OYSTER was contaminated with shell pieces so when you took a bite it you get crunchy shell bits along with it! 

Unsanitary. They put the water water pitcher on the table while they were serving them. Then they moved it back and put it on the same tray as fish... 

At the end of it all it was super expensive. Not worth it. I got your back fellow foodies. You're welcome.
author: Tina T.

description:
I think this is another place yelp reviews and the long line in front of this place fool me. Try the sashimi, mixed oysters, cherry clams and clam chowder. Really, nothing special, like another other seafood place except with a very very expensive bill. I really hate to say bad things about this place becoz service is very nice, but be aware, not the best or freshest but the most expensive given the food ordered.  
I can say, a nice decent Japanese sushi place will offer same quality of seafood with much less of the price. If this restaurant was located in a overcrowded tourists pier overseeing the ocean, the hype may be justified.
author: Natalie W.

description:
The best no-frills seafood depot.  We were looking for a taste of everything so the half orders were perfect! We ordered sashimi Sicilian style, the best looking uni (equal to if not better than Japan's fish market!), a dozen local oysters, smoked trout and salmon, and scallop sashimi with ponzu/siracha.  Personally, I would opt for the Sicilian style again as the soy ponzu siracha can overpower the delicate flavors.

We went on a weekday afternoon where the wait was around 30 minutes during an off-peak time, so be ready to wait if you select more popular times/the weekend!  

The staff was friendly, welcoming and extremely attentive.  One of best service staff that I've experienced in a while.
author: Tonya S.

description:
This place is hella old school. No website, no menus online, no credit cards, no reservations.

I was excited to try this place ever since I moved to Russian hill. I've been keeping an eye out for sea urchin for a while. I called about it and it turns out they're caught fresh at half moon bay. Some days they have it, some days they don't. 

To be honest, I enjoyed some of the food here. 

However, I'm extremely displeased with their service and shady way of doing business. 

I arrived around 10:20 after calling in about the sea urchin, the employee on the phone said as long as I get there before 10:30 there shouldn't be a wait. LIES. I waited about 40 minutes. 

The place is pretty cramped and the service is painfully slow. It'll be fast if you're a charismatic single girl or if you somehow know the people who work there.

The place is certainly a hole in a wall, but the prices are definitely not hole in a wall prices. 

We shared two live sea urchins, a crab cocktail, prawn cocktail and the Italian sashimi platter.

The cocktails were pretty tiny and the prawns only came with 6 pieces for $14. 

The Italian sashimi platter was interesting but I prefer Japanese sashimi. The hamachi and yellowtail was too briny for me and the fish wasn't the best quality, it tasted cheap. This was also an off menu item so the price wasn't listed. 

The live sea urchin was the best dish out of all, I've never had live fresh sea urchin before so this was quite an experience to say the least. The shell was still moving. The shucking wasn't consistent though. The first one was shucked quite well without any guts or gunk on the sea urchin but the second one had all this black gunk which I had to clean out myself in order to eat it. 

Now on to the shady and shitty service. 

Our waters were never filled. We had to ask for more water a few times.

He forgot our second order of sea urchin. We had to remind him for another order of sea urchin. 

He did a poor job cleaning the second sea urchin. 
Each order apparently comes with bread but we only got one order of bread.

It took forever to get the bill and he got someone else's bill first even though we asked before them. 

So what was the last straw? Our bill was miscalculated by $17 - $24. 

There was a party next to us where he kept flirting with the girl. They just met and she was eating lunch with her mom. She apparently went to the same highschool as our server in Oakland. They chatted up and got pretty cozy talking about underground clubs. Our server was WAY more friendly with her than he was with us. He gave her two free pieces of sashimi. He offered her more bread, kept their waters filled and asked her if she wanted more beer. On top of that, he brought out their bill first even though we asked for ours first and she was seated after we were midway through our meal yet she left before our bill even came. The billing system here is a complete scam. There's no transparency and sometimes verbally expressed with or without paperwork. I thought it was really strange when her bill was $66 yet she had a combination salad, two soups, a beer, a crab back and a dozen oysters. Just judging from the menu alone her bill was basically granted a 30% - 40% discount. 

But when we got our bill it was $134.. I had a feeling it was off but I gave them benefit of the doubt as I had already spent over 2 hours there including the wait and I had to leave. After I left I thought about it and realized it was definitely way off. I called back to clarify the prices and I was right - they padded our bill. Probably to cover the girl's discounted bill. 

It all made sense now. They exchanged numbers before she left and he gave her a bunch of postcards. What a scummy way of doing business huh? 

It's unfortunate not everyone is treated the same. Unless you know the employees here, forget about eating here without being robbed. 

On the bright side I hope I saved another poor soul from getting ripped off the way I did.

TLDR- avoid unless you like getting scammed for mostly overpriced seafood
author: Virginia Y.

description:
We arrived at 10am and we were the 2nd wave to get into the restaurant. 
I suggest you arrive 9:45am and stand in line. Restaurant opens 10:30am sharp! It's worth the wait. Plus you can order beer or wine inside and wait in line having a drink! They will pour in plastic cup.
This restaurant is by honor system. When you ask for check you will have to tell them what was ordered. 
We had the smoked salmon! Omg! Amazing !!! Combination seafood salad was great too! Sicilian sashimi was soooo fresh! Soooo good! Clam chowder was awesome ! And oysters of course was excellent!!! 
I can't wait to go back!!!!! 
Hopefully next time they will have dungeoness crab and uni!!!
author: Soyeon J.

description:
Review #400! Must try spot!

This little gem in the city is amazing and worth the wait in the cold. Anytime you find a place with a line, you must try it right? Especially if the spot has been around since 1912! I was referred to this spot by a fellow Yeep and I'm so happy that I came here. This place is legit. I love how they do things old school and that they provide excellent service to everyone. They only have counter seating but it provides for an intimate setting. You'll notice that they collect currency from all over the world and I noticed they didn't have any Baht from Thailand. Luckily I had some in my wallet so I gave it to them to add to their collection. 

Being that this was my first time here, I had to order as much as I could. My eyes couldn't be bigger than my stomach. At least, that was what I was hoping for. We ordered the a dozen Clams, 1/2 dozen Oysters, a Combination Seafood Cocktail, Crab Fat with Sourdough Bread, Boston Clam Chowder and of course wine! Too bad they didn't have Uni that day! Everything was so fresh and mouth watering good. Their house hot sauce goes perfectly with the clams and oysters. I can't wait to come back here again during my next trip. Keep in mind that they keep it old school so they accept cash only. I highly recommend this spot for locals and tourist alike.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I was there at 10:30am during weekday and there was a line already. I waited about 20 minutes. CASH ONLY. There is a Chase back across the street, if you go to Walgreen, it only allows $20 cask back. Bring a lot of CASH.
Sashimi is not on the menu, you need to ask them for the price and portion. It comes small, medium and large plates. (If I remember correctly)
author: Diana L.

description:
My boy Danny brought me here, and I'm still thinking about those amazing oysters and that an insane seafood salad. 

If you're seafood lover and heading to San Francisco, bookmark this place and get here early because the line starts to form right when they open at 10:30 am. We got here shortly after and the line was already eight people deep. We finally got in and immediately ordered shrimp cocktail, clams and oysters on the half-shell, and a combination seafood salad. 

The shrimp cocktail served here looks basic and not fancy at all, but it was delicious. This small bowl was overflowing with insanely fresh tasting shrimp and showered in tangy cocktail sauce that will get your palate ready for the seafood assault that's coming your way. The oysters and clams come freshly opened and with a brief description of their points of origin. Some of these came from Mexico and others from the surrounding area; I honestly can't remember because I was hypnotized by the creaminess and sweetness of these ocean floor delicacies.The only thing that was off-putting was the shucker's fingernails, while he pointed and described the tray of food, we could both see that they were brown and black, pretty gross. 

The combination salad is a mountain of crab, lobster, shrimp, and prawns. This is a gluttonous amount of fresh seafood, and I wouldn't have it any other way. All this is covered in a mystery dressing, thousand island?,  that I could have done without. I mean the seafood alone is super fresh, and a little hot sauce and lemon juice would have been much better that the thick mayonnaise based topping. 

This place is a little pricey, and they are a cash only business so make sure to hit up the ATM before coming in.
author: Nate M.

description: It's been a while since I've been here, but I've been having a HUGE craving for the fresh scallop that I had previously. Line can be very long, but if you come a little before they open, you should be fine. Highly recommend the crab back and chowder. The sashimi platter was ok. Not sure if I would order again
author: Erinn P.

description:
Fabulous experience, despite the wait and not much elbow space :)
Seafood salad and soup were delicious!
author: Sunshine H.

description:
Note: cash only. 

Be prepared to wait in line to grab a seat at the counter of about 16 seats. My husband and I came here at noon on a Thursday and only waited about 10 minutes. Once seated, one of the friendly owners or younger guys greet you and are happy to answer any questions about the menu. Here's what we got:

Dozen mixed oysters (Kumamoto, Miyagi, Blue Point,):
These were all big, meaty and sweet oysters that are shucked well. I didn't find a single piece of broken shell in any of the oysters, and the classic mignonette sauce paired perfectly with each one. 

Crab salad:
Literally a pile of crab meat on top of a pile of lettuce. Squeeze some lemon juice on top and spread some Louie sauce over the plate and you'll find yourself delighted with this light, yet largely portioned plate.

Clam chowder:
Probably one of the best bowls of clam chowder I've had! While I didn't think there was enough clam meat in the bowl, it was rich, creamy and tasted so good with some Boudin bread. 

Sea urchin:
These were from Half Moon Bay, which weren't as buttery and sweet tasting as those from Santa Barbara. However, the meat is large and plentiful in each one. 

Smoked salmon:
We sat right in front of a large piece of smoked salmon but didn't order any. However, one of the owners sliced off small pieces and handed them to us to try. OMFG. I regretted not ordering it. It is insanely delicious, buttery, smokey, and melt-in-your-mouth goodness that blew my mind. We both couldn't stop dreaming about it the rest of the day and decided that we should return to order some, which is thinly sliced and served on slices of Boudin bread. 

All of the employees and two owners are so incredibly friendly, upbeat, and happy to serve you. Customer service here is outstanding, which I find so rare in older establishments that refuse to expand, add more seats or upgrade in anyway. Aside from that, the seafood they select is sublime, and the way they prepare every plate is wonderful.
author: Nina V.

description: I love oysters, and I love fresh seafood. This place was okay. We waited about half an hour to get in (not bad) and when we sat down, we ordered as many oysters as we could afford. It's cash only, and we only had $50 to spend between the two of us, so we were budgeting. The staff weren't particularly helpful or friendly in helping us decide what to order, which is fine - it's a blue collar counter joint. I thought it was kind of weird that our server told us a long story about Oklahoma in a fake southern accent (we're from Texas but he didn't know that) and that he stuck his finger in our oyster to pick out a piece of shell, but so it goes. The oysters were pretty tasty, but they definitely weren't the best I've had or the most reasonably priced.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Awesome seafood, be prepared to wait!
It's been a few years since we visited Swan Oyster Depot; it's as good as I remembered!!  We got there at 10:30 when they opened on a Monday and waited about an hour and half (the line got longer when we left).  The Restaurant is small, all the seating is along the counter/bar.  The customer service is amazing; all the guys were attentive and helpful.  Despite the long line outside, they don't rush you at all.  Very causal atmosphere.

The food...  everything was very fresh!  We got clam chowder, combination seafood salad, combo seafood cocktail, smoked salmon, and sashimi plate.  The seafood salad was amazing!!  So much fresh crab meat, bay shrimp and a few good size shrimp; as far as I am concerned, this is the best deal and a must!  For the seafood cocktail, you get a little bowl of crab, shrimp w an oyster on top and you get a little bowl of cocktail sauce which you season to your liking and dip the seafood in.  The smoked salmon plate was very good, just seemed a little over-priced for four slices of bread w single layer of smoked salmon on top.  I am glad we tried their mixed sashimi plate; loved the olive oil and the capers.  But if you have a good sushi place....  I wasn't too impressed w the clam chowder.  It was flavorful and wasn't full of big chunks of vegetables which I can't stand, clam pieces were small and hard to find, but it was a bit running and oily on top (I don't know if the soup was cooked too hot where the oil and milk solid separated or they splashed oil on top?). Good cheap filler food for kids.

It was a wonderful meal!!  We will definitely come back!!  Get there early, be prepared to wait at least an hour, but it's totally worth it !!!  Oh, they do take-out!!  The line for takeout is on the left side of the door and very short!

They do not have a website!!!  The one listed on Yelp is not theirs!!!
author: Kathy H.

description:
I really wanted to be blown away but sadly I was not. The food is fresh and nothing was bad, I just expected something a little more considering the hype. 

We shared the small Sicilian sashimi, cup of clam chowder, 6 raw oysters, and crab salad. The star of the meal was definitely the oysters. They were meaty and tasted very fresh. The crab salad had a generous amount of crab in the plate, however, the dish got a little old very fast. It's a lot of crab with a little bit of sauce to give it some flavor. Would recommend sharing the salad for sure! The Sicilian sashimi was thinly sliced and smaller than anticipated but it's fresh and topped with oil and capers. It's a different style of raw fish than what I'm used to but I think I prefer Japanese sashimi instead. The clam chowder was strangely liquidy and tasted more like clam broth. But it was good to dip the bread

Worth trying but I'm not running to come back soon to eat again, considering how they do have a wait.
author: Carissa G.

description:
I will say...the food was good, but the wait was extremely long. I only give it 3 stars because of the wait. A total of three and a half hours to seat a party of two. It is a small place and does not seat many. We got there on a Tuesday at 11:30 am and was not seated till a little passed 3:00 pm. I will never stand in line again but it is a good place to try at least once or if the line is short. Also, please note this place is CASH ONLY. 

We ordered the combination salad, crab back, combination of oysters (half dozen), clam chowder, and a lobster. The crab back was not for us. It was too fatty and chunky. The lobster was a bit overcooked. The claw meat was tender but the tail was overcooked. Everything else was great. Be sure not to take much with you there is not much space to put your bags. We didn't know it was cash only but luckily had enough to pay our bill. It came to be $115 for two of us (including a beer).
author: Linda H.

description:
Been waiting my whole adult life to eat here and finally had a weekday off. Still waited 30min on a Tuesday 1pm but well worth the wait! Sicilian sashimi was the star dish and surprisingly a huge fan of the blue point oysters.

Ordered the combo salad but will stick with just crab only next time. Will come back next weekday off and gladly wait another 30min.
author: Eddie L.

description:
Blessed to live next to this gem! Watched Anthony Bourdain eat here and had to put it on my bucket list.

Owner, Tony was great in making me feel welcomed for my Birthday lunch. Come in early to beat the tourist crowd. I ordered small portions of everything to try it all.

1. Cup of Clam Chowder $3 good
2. Oysters - freshest I've eaten, not sure how much I paid. I loved the hybrid one
3. Ladies plate of Italian Sashimi - amazing melts in my mouth
4. Sample taste of smoked salmon. You can literally taste the smokiness 
5. Crab leg cocktail - IVE GONE TO HEAVEN

hopefully next time they have Uni
author: Joy M.

description: so we went here on a friends recommendation. wow this place was worth it. all the staff was great and the food was better. we were able to get wine while waiting and that was cool. the salmon was so good.
author: Havalah W.

description: My first time here and everything was fresh and unforgettable! Great customer service and depending on what time you go the wait is about 20min to 1hr roughly maybe more. But so worth it! Cash only! So swing by the ATM.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Knowing the hype surrounding this place, my group of six arrived on an early Saturday morning at 10am to a long line of customers, and after just over an hour, we were seated at the end of the bar! Even though the seating arrangement is very cramped, the food and the service here were unbelievable, and the experience was totally worth the wait!

Let's start with the service--all of the servers here were so genuinely kind and helpful when we made our selections. They were extremely attentive and made sure we always had everything we needed--starting, of course, with plenty of bread and butter. And then there's the food. Our group started with a dozen oysters (coming from Washington, British Columbia, and California)--on the side were the typical lemon and horseradish, but also a delicious spicy Thai chili sauce that was so hot and unique. These were literally the best oysters I've had in my life--they were so fresh and complex in flavor (not just salty brine).

And then came my favorite dish of all: the smoked salmon, which was served over slices of bread and topped with capers and onions. The smoked salmon was savory, smokey, and, by far, the creamiest smoked salmon I've had in my life--this dish was literally to die for! We also had the combination Louie salad, which included plenty of cooked seafood like crab and shrimp over a bed of simple lettuce and a creamy dressing. While the seafood was good, I didn't find this dish wasn't all that flavorful or special. We also had the calamari salad, which was a small dish of cooked calamari along with simple onions and garnish, but this also wasn't all that memorable.

We ended with an order of the large Sicilian sashimi platter, which came with raw slices of salmon, scallops, ahi tuna, yellowtail, among some other fish I can't remember--everything was dressed in plenty of olive oil and topped with capers and onions. This dish had plenty of great flavorful (and again, the seafood was so fresh!), and the remaining olive oil on the plate was perfect for dipping with the bread!
author: David K.

description:
Once again, this placed lived up to my expectations.  Great staff all around. Fun and easy going group of men.  We were one of the first ones there on a Friday morning, stood in line little before they opened and made the first cut!

Clam Chowder was phenomenal.  One of the best I've had.
Crab back -  Buttery goodness. I'm used to having this warm and eaten right after the crab is steamed, but this crab back was cold.  Took some time to get used too, but still good!
Smoked Salmon - Excellent.
Oysters & clams - Awesome.

Can't believe it's been 3 years since I've been back, but I'm glad I did :)

Cash only.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Worst experience. We heard such great things about this place and decided it was worth a try. The line was long but it was expected, we knew ahead of time it would be. It took them a long time to take our order but we figured how busy it was it was to be expected. People who were seated after us got their food first even though it was the same thing we ordered, clam chowder, so it couldn't have taken longer to prepare ours. The clam chowder had a watery consistency and the taste was pretty bland. We ordered oysters and we saw them open them and then saw them flicking the juices off their hands right on top of the oysters. The shrimp cocktail was pretty good. When we were ready to leave we asked for the check. We waited 20 min and no one brought us a check. We had to ask for a check 3 times and waited a total of 40 minutes before they brought us one. They acted so annoyed about it and made snarky comments about our inability to be patient. I think waiting 40minutes is more than patient enough. It was our first and last time eating here.
author: Kamilla G.

description:
I arrived at Swan's at 10am on a Saturday morning and still waited an hour to get seated (they open at 10:30). I'm not sure what time you have to arrive to get seated in the first seating but the weather was nice and the hour went by quickly so nbd. 

We got the crab back, crab cocktail, oysters, clam chowder, and sashimi. I didn't love the crab back, I think I was expecting more of a bone marrow buttery unctuousness but it was kind of like watery crab juice, so that was disappointing. 

The clam chowder was also more on the watery end of the spectrum and the cream was split like another reviewer noted. Would skip this next time. 

LOVED the sashimi, the onions and capers accentuate the flavors and it was so so good. The scallops were the best. 

They also have a bloody mary type drink with bud-lite instead of vodka which looked super good too. 

I'm not sure I would wait 3 hours to eat here but I would definitely come back. There is equally good sashimi in the city and the oysters were on par with hog island and hog island has better chowder if you don't want to wait.
author: Chelsea J.

description: Waited on hour to get in. Well worth it. Lunch counter. That's all the space there is people. Attentive service. What you must know is they are CASH ONLY. But the other thing is the food is great, except the clam chowder.  Not a fan. Had the Louie seafood salad. Outstanding so much seafood you could split it.   Fresh shucked oysters smoked salmon and trout.
author: Lisa P.

description:
This place is legendary in my book.

My boyfriend and I headed straight to Swan's after dropping our bags off at our Airbnb, and we got there around 2:30. As expected on a Saturday, there was a short line that we reached the front of after about a 30 minute wait.

It was well worth it. As soon as two patrons got up from the counter, one of the guys motioned for us to come sit. I had a Coke in my hand that I bought from Walgreen's across the street (because they only offered Pepsi which I'm firmly against), and he immediately asked if I wanted a cup of ice and offered my boyfriend a beer... From that moment forward, the service just continued to blow me away!

We started by sampling the day's oysters - 3 types of Miyagi (BC, Washington, and a local one) - as well as little necks and Cherrystone's. I ate them all with a little extra salt, lemon juice, and their homemade Thai chili hot sauce. The hot sauce was surprisingly spicy, but I wasn't too fond of their mignette.

Next, we had the crab back and half-cracked crab. I wish the crab back was served warm because I didn't really like it cold... I also wish we had opted to get some warm butter for the half-cracked crab, but the flavor was great nonetheless.

We finished off with a small order of the Sicilian sashimi. I was skeptical of the capers at first, but it was pleasantly interesting, and the fish was fresh. We had hamachi, maguro, sake, scallop, and local halibut. 

Every minute we were at the counter, we felt special and very welcome by two guys especially, who seemed to genuinely want us to enjoy ourselves.

If you like good seafood and good people, you have to come here. It's a must!
author: Niki P.

description:
I'm poor. $50 (cash only) for smoked salmon and half a dozen oysters? PLUS a 1 hour and 15 minute wait? This will be a been there, done that type of ordeal.

The food was good, not out of this world. Definitely not worth everything I went through to obtain it. Perhaps I didn't order correctly, but I just can't see what the craze is about.

Service was cordial. Not super speedy in my case. The only thing was my oysters had a LOT of shell in them. Woulda cracked a tooth if I weren't such a slow chewer.
author: Angela L.

description:
Love this place! Opens at 10:30am, and we arrived a little before 9:45am on a Monday morning. We were the 3rd people in line. But within 10 minutes, a crowd had arrived! So please, either make sure you go early or just know that there will absolutely be a wait. 

Ordered the combo seafood salad with the Louie dressing on the side. A lot of people just order the crab salad. In retrospect, would have preferred just the crab though. Sicilian sashimi is a must. The crab back looks totally gross, but is actually delicious. The only thing I didn't really care for was the smoked trout. I originally came here looking for uni on the half shell, but unfortunately they didn't have any that day. 

Swan Oyster is a no fuss joint, they're ready to take your orders right when you sit down. You can tell right away that all the guys who work there are very close and treat each other like family. They know they have a lot of people waiting, so service is fast. Please be considerate of others and don't dilly dally after you've eaten. Get in, get out, and enjoy the day after a great meal here.
author: Lisa L.

description:
This place is incredible! Steve and his team are great. Ask them about how many beers Wade Boggs can drink. Trust me!

There are no pictures because I ate it all too quickly! 

There will be a wait. Don't complain. That's just how it is. This place rocks! You can skip the line by ordering to go (but you won't get to hang out with these incredible guys so don't do that). Even if you can get there prior to opening, someone will have beaten you there. 

Don't worry. Grab a coffee (or fill your favorite mug with beer or bring your growler and share) and enjoy the wait. Now on to the food!

My favorite dish is the crabsanthymum; a huge plate of crab claws served with cocktail. Pro tip: ask for the "oil and vinegar"! It's crab fat mixed with some Dijon mustard, vinegar, and black pepper. It's life changing! Steve made us some today and I miss it already. My mouth is literally watering right now!

Then get the scallop sashimi with olive oil, capers, and red onion. Incredible! The fresh, sweet scallop is he best scallop I've ever had (sorry, Thomas Keller). 

Then get the uni! It's so fresh the spines of the recently dispatched echinoderm (it is served in the body) are still moving as you eat it! Spectacular! 

The array of oysters and clams available is staggering. They are great! That Thai chile hot sauce will make you wanna slap your mama, but don't use too much or you will lose the oyster!

The smoked fish are to die for (they will make a sampler if you ask... no need to pick one. I loved the Nova Scotia style salmon though the hot smoked salmon was great. The white fish was excellent and I thought the trout was fabulous!

The crab salad is incredible as well. It's a generous eloping of crab served with an incredible mayo based dressing... wonderful! 

The chowder was not my favorite, but to each his own (i'm there for the seafood in its truest form). 

The Sicilian sashimi is also incredible! 

I could go on, but this is one of my favorite places ALL TIME because the employees are fantastic and the seafood is fresher than any you can find anywhere!
author: Paul S.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot opens at 10:30 AM so at 9:50 AM, we were the 5th and 6th person on line.  The crowd came right after us.  So hopefully this gives you a picture of the wait.  We still had to wait 40 minutes before we got seated, but that is 50% less than what most people have to endure.  This place is basically a fish market with one clear row of seating.  Despite being the first ones in, we weren't lucky enough to get a taste of the uni on shell.  The menu on the wall kept us busy for a long time and we were able to see what our neighbors ordered.

Recommended:
1. Crab back:  If you love crab juice and junk, you will not be able to stop yourself
2. Sicilian Sashmi:  I've seen pictures of this on Yelp plenty, but it really is damn good (and so fresh).  I am going to start putting capers and onion on my sashimi.
3. The bread!!!  I just have to throw this in here.  Soak it in the crab back.

Others:
1. Smoked Trout:  On the dry side, not what I expected.  The smoked salmon looks better (The salmon was also laid right in front of me.  I don't know how I chose Trout over Salmon but I did).
2. Combination salad:  I would skip it and order the crab salad.  The combination salad has too many baby shrimps.  My friend raved about the sauce, but I went without it and still loved it.

I would try again for a chance at Uni.  Maybe next time.
author: Carrie L.

description: My favorite seafood spot in the city.  I come every single time in the city.  Waited for 2.5 hrs to get in this time but all worth it
author: Chris J.

description: No crab during our visit. Over rated! Shrimp was NJ nothing special.  Not worth the 20 minute wait.
author: Patrick M.

description: I took a weekend trip to visit San Francisco and made it a personal goal of mine to visit Swan. I was in line for about 2-3 hours unfortunately... BUT! On the plus side! You can get beers from the restaurant and drink them while you're waiting. The clam chowder, oysters, crab Louie salad, and uni were amazing!!! The crab back with the roe and innards - OMG... The wait was a bit long but I would definitely still visit again.
author: Lisa C.

description: Took an hour to get seated but the wait was well worth it. We got the Assorted Dozen Oyster with local Miyagi, Shigoyu, and something else. Miyagi tasted slightly saltier but there's more of the seafood flavor, whereas the Shigoyu was very meaty. All three of them were great but I'd prefer the Shigoyu. We also got the sashimi (comes in 3 sizes, $16, $26, $32), the half cracked crab, combination cocktail, and some clam chowder for about $55 per person. I'd come back any day for a taste of heaven.
author: Jensen K.

description:
In the last 3 years, I've visited San Francisco 3 times and have been to Swan Oyster Depot 3 times. There's a running joke with many of my friends that I'll eventually eat all the oysters in the ocean. I just love them so much. And something about Swan Oyster Depot's divey counter of seafood goodness just speaks to me. I don't know how their oysters taste so much better than anywhere else I've had, but I would like to meet their oyster man. And marry him.

This was the last meal of my SF trip over Labor Day and probably the best (Gary Danko was a close second). It was Tuesday morning at 10:25 AM. They had just opened up so there wasn't a line (cue angels singing). We got 2 dozen oysters (they were out of Pacific so we got Kumamoto which were just as good), the sashimi platter (incredible), and the crab cocktail (literally ALL crab). Add 2 glasses of their house wine plus tip and the total was around $150. It definitely adds up quickly so make sure you leave yourself plenty of wiggle room. I made sure not to make the same mistake as last time when I almost didn't have enough cash and brought $300 with me juuuust in case we decided to go balls to the wall. The experience was worth every penny.

Anthony Bourdain said it best: "If i died eating at Swan's counter, I would die a happy man."
author: Shelly G.

description:
This place has been on my radar since I've seen it on Anthony Bordain's... one of his shows! I think it was the Bay Area episode of Layover. Anyway, I finally got to visit this spot yesterday. Perfect timing, too, because it was midday on a Tuesday, with a short line. This is a tiny spot, very old school, only the counter space for guests. 

It is a raw bar. If you want hot food, this is not the place for you, save the clam chowder. Our party got an assortment of dishes and shared everything, so here goes: 

- We started with the crab salad. Nothing fancy. Sliced up iceberg lettuce under heaps of dungenous crab legs. All the fixings were on the counter including the dressing, cocktail sauce, lemons, and chili. 
- the clam chowder is rich, and full of clam flavor. My dad says it's the best he's ever had, but we have different tastes. I saw that the cream sauce was broken, and it wasn't the best clam chowder experience I've ever had. I wish there was more cream, but it was good. 
- the Italian sashimi plate was interesting. Delicious and fresh, but my personal preference is getting in the way here. There was olive oil, some chopped up red onion, capers, and fresh crushed pepper strewn over the raw fish. The assortment included salmon, hamachi, ahi tuna, atlantic salmon, and then the scallop. The Italian seasoning took away from the fish. The scallop was the best, buttery thing on the plate. LOVED it. In fact, ordered a whole plate of that: 
- the scallop was melt in your mouth delicious, sweet, buttery. Ugh!!!!! 'nough said. 
- In addition to the salad, we got a crab cocktail. Clean and delicious. 
- Finally we got two dozen raw oysters. Delicious flavor. Best in a while. 

Bill was $206 including the above, a beer and a half, and the crab tamale. Not cheap. The place has been around for 100 years or so, but come on. It is a bit overpriced with no cooking involved. What makes up for this? Ultimately, it is their excellent product, history and the traditional ambiance that is worth the trip. Mmmm!
author: Alicia C.

description: The seafood is so fresh and the staff is great. The only thing is the line was extremely long. My boyfriend and I were in line for 2.5 hours when we finally got our food.
author: Adelisa L.

description:
If you're looking for pure, simple, fresh, and amazing seafood THIS IS THE PLACE. Everything was freshly prepared in front of your face, so you see everything cracked and sliced on the spot, its mesmerizing. 

We got there around 12:30/1:00pm on a Thursday and we waited for about 5 minutes before a couple left and we snagged the seats. Bar Seats only so its very limited. 

- Half Cracked Crabs: Comes out nicely cracked and ready to devour. The pieces pulled way from the shell so easily providing you a piece of fatty crab to enjoy. 

- Crab Back: Served cold, amazing when dipped with the bread with a sprinkle of pepper. 

- Dozen mixed Oysters: Chefs choice, didn't have a bad piece. Not too small, not too fatty. 

- Sicilian Sashimi: Drizzled with olive oil with capers and freshly cracked peppers. The Sashimi melted in your mouth with the perfect sliced to the perfect size .

- Uni: Cracked and cleaned in front of our faces. Melt in your mouth buttery amazingness. It is an acquired taste, so if you're a sucker for uni, you HAVE to try some. We got lucky and got the 2nd to the last one they had for the day. So the earlier you go the better chances of you being able to get some. By the time we left around 3ish there was only 1 left. 

AMAZING AND FRIENDLY STAFF. Even with just a limited amount of seating, we were never rushed. 

On top of all the food listed above, we both ordered 2 beers and our bill came out to $127, we were both surprised and expected us to do so so so much more damage. We are most definitely making this joint a go to whenever we are in the area.
author: Jacquelynn N.

description:
Le bf and I have been wanting to try this place for YEARS but the lines have always discouraged us.

We went on a rainy Saturday morning. We thought that by arriving 15 minutes before the place opened, we would likely made the first seating. Boy were we wrong. We ended up waiting in the rain for over an hour. Le bf was nice enough and ran to a doughnut shop up the street to get me some food.

We got:
1. Anchor Steam
2. Shrimp cocktail
3. Crab Back
4. Bowl of Clam Chowder
5. A dozen oysters
6. Sicilian style sashimi

All the seafood was very, very fresh. The people working behind the counter were super nice too. You never felt rushed to finish your food and vacate your seat. The chowder, was good, but there are better chowders in the city. It was the thicker kind of chowder, which I like. We got the sashimi after reading so many Yelp reviews. You should definitely order it if you come. The bf really enjoyed his Crab Back.  

We were very full after meal. It is on the tad expensive, but we would come back for the experience. Swan Oyster Depot is one of those SF institutions that you must visit at some point, especially if you live in the Bay Area. The line are definitely shorter on the weekdays. So if possible, come then. If not, come as early as you can. The line, when we left, was way longer than when we arrived.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
I'm a native San Francisco in and I've never been here but since I was in the neighborhood and it appeared to be a short line I decided to drop in by myself and grab a seat. It was around 3:30 in the afternoon 3 people ahead of me in line total wait time 20 minutes. Once I got seated,  I ordered a half dozen assorted clams, a cup of chowder and the crab salad along with an anchor steam. It was basically  average chowder, a bit watery, french bread and butter was a bit hard for my taste.The crab salad was excellent full of crab meat over a bed of lettuce but I found a strand of hair in it. I thought food preparers had to wear hair nets. Got my beer and oyster in five minutes. The reason why I giving this place a low rating is because of the service. While the person sitting next to me arrived at the same time, she received her chowder in no time. I had a different server waited an additional ten minutes before catching his attention to inquired about the chowder. Finished everything and patiently waited another ten minutes for the crab salad that never came. I felt like he was ignoring me even while he walked pass me without so much looking at my direction a dozen times.   So finally asked him about the crab salad, he said sorry I forgot it. After finishing the salad and everything else he never came back to check whether I need it more bread or another beer, it seem like he would go on ignoring  me. I finally wanted to pay my bill another five minute passes by and I finally had to flag him down once more and to add insult to injury he told the other server to tally up the bill for me.  I've worked in restaurants before and believe tipping the help at least 20% 
 which I did but when I got home I thought to myself he didn't deserve a tip at all for the shitty service.   Total bill with tip $73.  There is no excuse for forgetting two of my orders and not so much as looking my way to check whether I needed more bread or beer!   I'm guessing he prefers not to serve middle age Asian males.
author: Ray H.

description:
Aw yeah!
My SF super picky restaurateur friend took me here - it's down the street from where he lives and there's ALWAYS a line out the door - even before they open - which sucks, but it a good sign.  Their scallops - done multiple ways, are just breathtakingly oceany salty.  I can't wait till they enter my mouth again.  Every thing was 5 starts.  It's  an old counter, no white tablecloths, but I prefer to eat this way since I can be the real, unrestrained ME.  I love my food.  
Thank you!
author: Blythe B.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is a San Francisco institution. It's on the 25 Classic Restaurants to eat in S, 7x7's SF Best Old School Restaurant list, a SF Landmark, It's over 104 years old and even Anthony Bourdain couldn't pass it up. If you have not been, bookmark and make sure you show up with a little patience, an appetite and cash. No credit cards accepted. 

There's a line every day trailing outside to sit at a counter that boasts a total of about 12 seats. If you ever wonder why, you should take a peek at the fresh seafood they offer - sitting in the window. Clam Chowder, Fresh Oysters, Dungeness Crab, Crab and Shrimp Cocktail and much more. 

There is speculation online about what time of the day is best to stop by, which I think is funny. I work in the neighborhood, so I see the line start around 10:30 a.m. pushing on to the afternoon. Funny thing is each time that I have been, I have not waited longer than 15 minutes to sit. Guess I'm a lucky girl! 

Don't wanna wait? Order to go! Call or stop by and just place a Togo order. You know you can picnic that seafood anywhere, it's so good.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Totally worth waking up early and waiting in line! The family that owns this joint is hands down "amazing"! We enjoyed our seafood brunch so much! It also helped our server was very good looking!
author: Denise T.

description: Classic SF joint that hasn't changed much since it opened. The smoked salmon on SF sour dough is out of this world. Worth the wait, go early and during the week
author: Claus F.

description: Hands down the best oysters I've ever had! The freshness of their seafood cannot be beat. Service isn't too shabby as well:) It's always so nice when the staff are genuinely happy and enjoy what they do. If you are strapped for time, which I often am, consider calling in for a to go order. As others have noted, it is cash only. Bring extra $$$! Once you see and taste what they have to offer, you'll want more!
author: K. P.

description:
I have been coming to Swan Oyster Depot going on twenty five years now. This simple seafood counter diner has consistently churned out quality food with a happy loving attitude, an attitude you can taste. 
Really!

There is not a whole lot of moving parts here:
*Get in line, there's always a line - period
*Wait for your turn for a seat at the cramped counter on rickety stools
*Choose your food from the not very diverse menu
*Then wait for the joy to happen - and it will - guaranteed

Swans is about seafood!
Possibly the freshest seafood you will find anywhere. There is not a frozen ounce of protein in the house. Every morsel of food tastes like the ocean and that's a very good thing. Shrimp, crab, lobster cocktails and salads, salmon, uni (when available) and a few other varieties of fish are here for your taking.

Their clam chowder rivals any cup you'll find in Boston.

This family run biz has been doing lunches (only) for over 100 years, so they really got their act together. You'll never feel rushed and you can banter back and forth with these seafood savants who serve you. This is fun, informative and engaging.

Whenever I come back home to S.F., I make sure there is always room in my schedule for that hour wait in line at Swans.
author: Sidney Z.

description:
Hmmm.. not sure what the hype is, but maybe we just ordered the wrong things? Was so excited to try this place considering the reviews, made the effort to drive here in traffic first thing in the morning, and left unsatisfied and a little broke.

Wait: We got here at 9:45am on a monday, was first in line... yay!

Service: Most of the people working there were helpful and nice. The person helping us was a bit grumpy and not inviting, but he got the job done.

Clam Chowder: watery, barely any clams, no flavor. We kind of forced ourselves to finish it so it wouldn't go to waste.

Sashimi Plate: Drizzled with olive oil and topped with capers. Somewhat bland, but halfway through we squeezed lemon on top and it tasted much better.

Crab Back: Good, but the piece we got was lacking on the portion, wasn't much to dip or scrap off :(. Nothing compared to the pictures I see others posted. But I know this isn't their fault, luck of the draw on the crab you get.

Prawn Cocktail: Fresh and firm texture. My boyfriend enjoyed it.

Oysters: We got a half dozen of Kumamotos, and they were fresh and good. Hard to go wrong with those.

We actually came here excited to get sea urchin, but they didn't have any. Overall, after  $95, none of the items were memorable, and we probably won't be returning.
author: Sony V.

description: Simply the best fresh shellfish experience on the west coast! Friendly attentive staff, amazing clam chowder and a crab Louie to die for. A true SF institution that NEVER disappoints!
author: john d.

description: YUM! This place is absolutely worth the wait. Everything tastes so fresh and juicy and amazing. I came at an odd hour and there was still a huge line out the door! I think it was about a 1.5 hour wait. I've never had clams as big as the ones here... everything had me drooling. I would eat these oysters all day long if I could.
author: Chelsea W.

description: Seafood doesn't get any better! Fresh and high-quality. I would recommend the oysters, crab cocktail, and the decadent crab fat! There's not a lot of seating usually, but that's ok because orders can be made to-go. The staff is super friendly and jovial.
author: Eric S.

description:
We arrived around 11:30am and were seated at 2pm. The guy was really attentive, even helped us portion our food so we get to try many things. Their Sicilian sashimi and smoke salmon were so amazing that we came back the next day to have it for breakfast. 
It was a great experience talking to every one serving the food and just being in the restaurant in general. The very limited seatings definitely contribute to the close relationships between all the waiters and the consumers.
author: Chelsea L.

description: I rode by here the other day. I had not been there in years. There was a line out the door. I called in and ordered a Crab Louis to go. It did not disappoint, same wonderful people, wonderful service and if you are interested in a Louis you will never get more crab in your plate then this place!  Check them out. I'm so glad I went!!!!
author: Karen L.

description: There's always a long wait for Swan and food good reason. You'll swanna come back here multiple times after one visit. We had delicious oysters and a ceviche that is not to be missed. It's both white swan and black swan here as some things are just purely delicious like the oysters with their sweetness and smooth finish. But you've also got the edge with their uni, crab, and scallops. You'll also be on edge for having to wait 2 hours at noon to sit at the cramped bar. But it's worth it. Don't forget to warm up with some chowder. Don't forget your dolla bills y'all it's cash only.
author: Matthew T.

description: This place has very bad service.  Showed up an hour before they closed on a Saturday.  Waited in line and then they told me they couldn't serve me food and that I could only take food home .  What a waste of time don't come here.
author: dan d.

description:
Literally one of the best seafood experiences I've ever had. Came at 10:10am on a Friday and still had to wait until 11:30am to sit down (opens at 10:30am) but so worth it 

1. Crab back - basically the fat in the body of a crab in a soup like consistency. so so so good. It's amazing dipped in bread or on its own 

1. Oysters - I tried all of them but Kumamoto was the best 

1. Smoked salmon w capers and onions on bread - best smoked salmon Ive ever had. Such a good depth of taste

2. Sashimi with capers - scallops. Three types of tuna. King salmon 

3. Boston clam chowder - decent but definitely overshadowed by everything else 

3. Combination seafood cocktail of shrimp and crab - good but also overshadowed by other dishes
author: Genevieve C.

description:
Get here early!! My parents and I got there 15 minutes before the doors opened and there were already 8 people in line. Luckily we were able to get in for the first seating! My mom and I always go for their crab cocktail with the cocktail sauce on the side and my dad likes the crab back and oysters. This time he got a mixed dozen with Kumamoto, Blue Point, Miyagi, and something else. And we also shared a dozen of the Cherry Stone clams. The three of us racked up a bill of $122.75, but it was soooo worth it! The bill included four draft Anchor Steams. The guys behind the counter are incredibly friendly and attentive.

Note: This casual spot is cash only!! There's less than 15 seats in the total place so keep in mind that there will most likely be a line. After brunch at 1030AM we walked around the city. On our way back to the hotel at 3PM there was still a line of two people.
author: Aimee I.

description: The servers are very friendly (ours was easy on the eyes, too!) , the place is very old school, but it's a bit cramped in terms of seating. That being said, the oysters are well worth the hour long wait. They were fresh, plump, and tasted like the sea. However, I don't think the seafood salad is worth it in terms of cost benefit. It was good, but nothing out of this world. I think I expected more, especially in flavor, for the price.
author: Audrey L.

description:
The experience was awesome but the food is hyped wayyy too much. Luckily we went early (10:20 on Friday morning) and only waited for like 20 minutes. The staff are all incredibly friendly (they're probably the best part of the experience to be honest) and the place itself is charming.

The food, though. The only thing that blew me away was the Sicilian sashimi platter. But, I've definitely had comparable sashimi at my local sushi place that doesn't have bones in it. I know how to eat around bones, but that doesn't mean I want it in my sashimi, and sushi chefs know how to prep sashimi sans bones.

I was told the crab back was amazing but I did not partake.

The clam chowder was flavorful, but less creamy than your standard chowder.

They're very accommodating to mixing and matching for cocktails. I got the crab and prawn. The prawn was plump and fresh, might've been the best I've ever had. Just a smidge better than Mastro's. The crab was ok, not amazing. To be fair, once you've had crab at a Chinese restaurant that was alive just minutes ago in a tank before being boiled and cooked with garlic, everything else pales in comparison.

If you're not going at 10-10:30, I wouldn't recommend going. I know it has the Bourdain seal of approval but it's not worth a 1 hour wait.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Best oyster ever ate! 
I ordered three oysters and a bunch of crab leg!
Three around $8 and crabs are weighed according to the pounds
Altogether $20. The staff there was very nice as they gave me three kinds of oysters. One from local, one 巴哈 one Washington! The minute I arrived the Caltrain station, I ate them all. For oyster, I just squeezed a little bit lemon on it. For crab legs, the sauce with wasabi is the best to dip into! 
I'll definitely come back and takeout again haha! Actually I hope I could sit in and enjoy their soup for once! And more oyster!!!
author: Shi Ya Z.

description: Thank you Anthony Bourdain! Drove 2 hours, waited 2 hours. Ate for about 2 hours. Worth. Sounds crazy but I consider myself a foodie and experiences like this is only once in a life time or maybe I'll revisit because it was so good! Made friends in line while anticipating this delicious seafood I kept reading and looking at photos of. 19 seat bar. That's it. Very friendly, they're all related or got married into the family and they make you feel comfortable because of that. My boyfriend and I shared a medium sashimi plate, ou la la, it melted in my mouth. Next was a mix dozen of oysters, they told us all the names but we remembers the east coast oyster was our favorite. I had him try crab back (it's cold) for the first time and surprisingly he liked it! They give you sourdough bread to dip. We also had crab salad, their sauce was yummy! And before we wrapped it up I had to have more scallops because they were big as a large marshmallow (not exaggerating).  All that about $100 ish. Again worth.
author: Cindy H.

description: This place has really gone downhill. The crab and local shrimp were ok but you could buy this at s decent fish market and any seasoning you put on them would be better than the adulterated catsup they throw on everything. Sitting on the stools is fun but the food is really marginal. I used to think of this place as special .
author: Michael F.

description:
I am very pleased to have finally tried this old San Franciscan establishment dated back to 1912. I was told by Natalie, one of the grandchildren of the first owners, the restaurant was bought and held in the family since 1946.
