Seafood is unmatched in freshness. I enjoyed a cup of clam chowder (not thick and more soupy with strong flavor of clams), medium sashimi plate, and half of dozen (3/each of Cherry stone clams and 3 kumamoto oysters). 
The wait is crazy even for SF standards. about 1-1.25 hours. Owner suggested arriving once they open.
author: Andrew E.

description: Holy delicious! The line down the street is worth the wait... we promise. Once you're inside it's a totally different world- service was spectacular. Loved the "old school" / "mom and pop" feel. A must in San Francisco!
author: Alyssa B.

description: One of the best seafood dives in the world. Nuff said. You can get some classy wines by the glass. Counter service, amazing fresh seafood from up and down the west coast. It is a must every time we are in San Fran. Be forewarned you will wait in a line around the block.
author: Josh P.

description:
Food: Loved every item we ordered! Oysters are a must of course! Make sure to check if they have the assorted sashimi platter which is not on the menu. Worth the price, the scallops were my favorite of the 5 raw seafood types on the platter. 

Service: high quality service. You are never rushed, asked to scoot down or waiting to order your next item. These folks know what they're doing, and will take care of you. 

Wait: as someone who lives in the neighborhood, there is ALWAYS a wait. You just live with it. If you're at the door of the SOFA store located next door, you're looking at roughly a 1 hour wait (I timed it). 

When you can't wait: Go for take out! Everything on the menus is available to go, oysters included! Go up to the register right next to the door and place your order. Be respectful to the people sitting at the counter, and know what you're ordering before you get there (it's a tight squeeze). Best way to go if you're in a time crunch.
author: Angelina G.

description: Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon. Fed the 2 hr meter. Stood in line and 1 1/2 hrs and made it in. Lots of time to mull over the menu. Ordered the crab salad, dozen oysters, a bowl of clam chowder, anchor steam beer and a glass of red wine. I didn't want to admit it was good. I have to admit it was beyond good. We ordered an additional 1/2 dozen oysters. The crab salad was simple but so fresh and they didn't skimp on the crab. Mounds of fresh sweet crab. Cash Only so bring plenty. $30 crab salad and $30 for a dozen oysters.
author: Dan C.

description: Anthony Bourdain recommended so I put it top of my list. Went on a Friday and know the reputation for lines as all they have is a small counter. Was first!!! in line by getting there 1 hour before opening (don't laugh, it worked). Great spot, great service, great fresh seafood. Had a shrimp cocktail to kick off, then my friend and I shared a dozen oysters, then fresh sashimi - scallops, salmon, tuna, etc. We got 4 more oysters and were good. Highly recommended. By the time we left, line was well down the block. Get there early or be prepared to wait a couple hours. A true SF treat!
author: mark w.

description:
Not often you get to try a 100 year old establishment, especially one that was featured by Anthony Bourdain...

I had the combination salad, cherry clams, mix oysters, clam chowder, and off the menu sashimi platter...

Honestly this place is overhyped... the food is good, but not amazing...the combination salad had big and small shrimp with no crab but substitute smoked salmon since they didn't have crabs that day with a thousand island dressing... the mix oysters are your basic fresh oysters... the clam chowder was more on the soupy side, with lots of clams juice...the sashimi was probably my least favorite... it looks amazing on picture, but is overdressed with olive oil... the sashimi grade fish is nowhere near your sushi restaurant quality...

Mehhh something to try once, but not worth a second try
author: Peter N.

description: Old school at its finest! Man I have to say I love this place. It definitely gives me that old east coast feel. Swan's is a very famous oyster spot located on Polk. Ok just so you know this place has long lines an hour before opening. They also are cash only but there is a chase bank across the street. Ok so this is how it works. They don't seat you have to find a spot that's open for you and your party. But don't be that person trying to cut the line they will let you know. Once in you take a seat at the bar. If you sit and it's food at the base no worries they are quick with the clean up. The place is super small so you will get to know your neighbor real well. Ok now it's time to order and you most try the oysters. They come out so freaking fresh make sure you get a variety. Next up is the crab damn it's like they just ran out to the water and snatched them up. Everything I had was amazing definitely will be back. Plus the staff here is awesome they treat you real well. Oh yeah if you don't want to dine in you can always do a take out. They do take those orders right at the door and it's fast. So if you're looking for oysters and crab definitely check this place out.
author: Tony B.

description:
Straight forward and extremely fresh seafood mostly consisting of shellfish. Been wanting to come here for a long time and finally decided to give it a go on my most recent visit to the city. 

We waited about 20 minutes and when we got closer to the doorway, the gentleman working offered us a beer which we certainly couldn't resist. 

We went with a mixed dozen of oysters and they were all delicious. All medium in size which is what I prefer and described perfectly by the man helping us on our journey. Probably one of the best dozens I've had in some time. 

We also got the chowder which is real deal and you can scoop on as many oysters crackers from the various bowls on the bar as you could want. 

This place is no frills, just very good and very fresh seafood plus kind service, which truthfully I wasn't expecting. I can't wait to get back with a bigger appetite so I can explore the menu a bit more.
author: Nick M.

description: At Swan Oyster Depot, you come for the fresh seafood and the atmosphere. This place has been left unchanged over the decades and that's something truly special to behold in SF. They always have a large selection of fresh seafood and this means everything from fresh sea urchin to crab back to Sicilian sashimi. I've deducted the 1 star because to be honest, prices are double what they should be and portions (especially for the Sicilian sashimi) are extremely small. That said, this place has become a mecca for those visiting SF, so they can get away with their pricing.
author: Daniel F.

description: Very delicious  seafood and a really cool experience in San Francisco. Long wait was worth it. We had the clam chowder, oysters and the combo shrimp and crab salad which all were amazing, the scallop sashimi/ carpaccio was my favorite. I can't wait to go back again soon.
author: Erin K.

description:
Last time, I got here at 10:10am and waited 20 mins. This time, I got here at 10am and waited an hour.

I was able to try a few new items:

-Clam chowder: More clammy and less creamy. It's nice to have a hot item to eat/drink here.
-Sicilian sashimi: SO good. The olive oil, cracked pepper, and capers complement the fresh fish well. The scallops were amazing.
-Smoked salmon: So I technically didn't order this but got two samples from the guys behind the counter. I didn't order this because I figured it would taste like the smoked salmon I've had from the box--why I thought that I have no idea. This had a rich, woody flavor and sliced thin so you get just the right amount of saltiness. 

Because I loved the cherry stone clams so much last time, I got them again. While they were good, they weren't as smooth and creamy as last time. I know this is out of Swan's control but the meat was slightly more chewy. 

After trying all the "popular" items, these are the must-order items for me:

-Sicilian sashimi
-Smoked salmon
-Combo salad with Louie dressing
-Cherry stone clams

Swan Oyster Depot is such a special place. It's a no-nonsense establishment serving food with minimal fixings. It's just fresh stuff that tastes good as is.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I came six minutes after they open on a weekday and to my surprise the line wasn't as long as i was anticipating. The wait was only 15 minutes and in comparison to the usual hour that's not bad at all. 

Ordered half a dozen of assorted oysters, cup of clam chowder with bread and butter, as well as the cocktail crab with opting out of the cocktail sauce option and instead asked for the Louie dressing which is literally crack sauce. 

Their service is prompt and genuine while their food is fresh and of quality, you can certainly taste the difference here in comparison to the majority of seafood based establishments. It's definitely not a cheap lunch but for what you're getting.. it's certainly a hell of a deal.
author: Kevin L.

description: To be fair, I am ONLY giving this a 3 because I ONLY tried the the clam chowder.  As a New Englander (born and raised), I am a "Chowdah-head" and a clam chowder snob.  This IS NOT great chowder.  At best, it is OK.  It is thin, and there are very few clams.  I did not try the oysters, so this is a limited review. But most people RAVE about the chowder, so I had to try and make a review.  I WOULD NOT go out of my way for this clam chowder.
author: David L.

description: There's no better place for fresh oysters, crab, lobster, etc in San Francisco or maybe on the west coast. The place is tiny, and the line outside can be long but it's worth the wait. The activity behind the counter is always fun & interesting so it's almost like having dinner & a show. Bring cash & an empty stomach.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Oh the wait is so worth it! My friend and I arrived at around 12 and we're seated roughly 1.5 hours later (on a Friday). 

Swan Oyster Depot only has bar seating for maybe 18 people max. The seating area itself is a bit cramped, but no big deal. The restaurant is very hole-in-the-wall, but it's great. They have amusing signs on the wall such as, "$5 for whining, and for melted butter -- seriously." The menu is displayed on the wall, but there are some things (scallops sashimi) that aren't listed so I'd ask or just run through some Yelp pics/reviews. 

Let's get to the food:
Cup of chowder - tasty and flavorful, but more watery than what you'd expect of a chowder. 
Kumamoto oysters - yum, so fresh! And not too briney either, which is great. 
Scallop sashimi, Sicilian style - YUMYUMYUM. Definitely highlight of the meal. Please do yourself a favor and order this! 
Prawn cocktail - can't ever go wrong with a cocktail! The prawns were perfectly cooked. 
Half-cracked crab - delicious. Mix some horse radish into cocktail sauce and dip your crab meat in it. Do it. The Louie sauce was good, but it's more mild in flavor so if you like your sauces with more punch, pass on it. 

Service was great. The man helping us out was super sweet and kept winking haha 

Expect to drop at least $80 for a meal for two. Of course this will depend on if you're getting a full meal vs. just a snack. 

If you like seafood of all types, give this a try. The wait is forgotten as soon as you take your first bite of food.
author: Doris K.

description: Probably my favorite restaurant in the city! The freshest seafood I've ever had however, the menu is a bit pricey. Also I'd recommend getting here early as they always have a line waiting to get in their doors. It is worth the wait though!
author: Jonah J.

description: This place is delicious! A must try when you visits San Francisco. There's a line but it's worth it. If you like seafood you'll want to visit again.
author: Pa H.

description: They have the best oysters in a funky old fashioned setting. Anchor Steam plus oysters, it doesn't get better than this.
author: john c.

description:
Honestly, if you love seafood, then this place is for you. If you don't like seafood, this place can convert you. They only serve the freshest and best quality of seafood selection everyday. It was no different today. 

I had the following:
1) Clam Chowder
2) Sicilian Sashimi (Large Portion)
3) Crab Back
4) 1/2 Dozen Clams

Everyday dish was amazing! Most likely you haven't had seafood served like this before and the service from the people behind the counter just makes this place that much more charming. 

Total: $46 (before tip)

Recommendation: Come early, like wait in line before they open, or you will definitely be waiting for awhile. Read other reviews. I came at 10:15am and was in by 10:45.
author: Danny W.

description:
This has been on my list of places to try in San Francisco for 2 years. Huge thanks to Adam S. for the recommendation!!  Swan Oyster Depot is a tiny restaurant with bar only seating, so the line can get long real fast. It's well worth the wait & you can't go wrong with anything that you order, so don't be shy.  I had the clam chowder, crab back and half cracked crab. I'm told most people dip bread into the crab back, but I'm from New Orleans so I dumped all the crab meat from the half cracked crab into the crab back. They should make a new menu item and just fill the crab backs with the meat and call it crab back cocktail. I think the regulars might look at them crazy, but trust me they are missing out!  
I noticed most people ordered the Sicilian sashimi, and oysters. I'm definitely going to have to go back and try those items. My bar tender also let me sample the smoked salmon. It was the best bite of smoked salmon I have ever eaten! I'm most definitely ordering that item on my next visit. I'm already trying to figure out how to get back to San Francisco as soon as possible to eat here again. I love that this is a family owned and run restaurant that it has been around for over 100 years. These are the types of places I love to frequent when I travel. It's such a huge treat. I'll be back until I've tried everything they have to offer, and then I'll keep coming back because it's just that awesome!!
author: Kate D.

description:
I was finally able to make it to this place for lunch on a Saturday. Make sure you come here about an hour before they open if you want to get seated when they open. I arrived here about 30 minutes before opening and we didn't get seated until 1. We ordered the large Sicilian sashimi, Kumamoto oysters, clam chowder and the smoked salmon. Everything we ordered here was fantastic. ***The clam chowder here is not a thick creamy clam chowder*** 
If you don't want to wait in the long line, you can always order takeout. I didn't know that this was an option until I got to the front and someone that was picking up food told us about it. If you want to try the crab back and cherry stone clams, you need to come as early as possible. They do run out.
author: Jeffery S.

description:
Shoutout to Anthony Bourdain for introducing this neighborhood gem to us. I have never waited so long to eat at any food establishment, but that is the only downside to Swan. I went on a Saturday morning, about 30 minutes after they opened. Got seated 2.5 hours later. On a rainy Friday afternoon, the wait was still an hour. This is really due to the fact that the restaurant is tiny, with one long bar. 

On the bright side, Swan makes up for the wait with the food and the service. Once you get inside and get seated, one of the many servers takes your order and you can watch your food being prepared on the other side of the bar. 

They've got the best clam chowder I've ever had. We alternate between dipping loaves of bread in the chowder and the crab back (it's only $6!!). The combination Louie salad is also amazing. It's really more like more like mounds of crab and shrimp with some lettuce and dressing. The combination seafood cocktail is pretty much the same variety of seafood with some sauce and an added raw oyster. The sashimi plate with capers and onions is also quite tasty. 

Prices are pretty reasonable considering the quality you get. The environment is also very welcoming. I believe the restaurant is family run, and everyone provides equally amazing service. The first time I went, one of the employees saw me watching him slice smoked salmon and cut me off a chunk to try. 

It is cash only, but for anyone that uses Chase, there's a branch right across the street. Definitely worth trying (the wait is actually worth it!)
author: Kimberly O.

description:
I see where a number of people have cited Anthony Bourdain's fondness for this place. I am a native SFranciscan and have eaten here a number of times and it is excellent. But I will say I would never eat somewhere solely on Bourdain's recommendation. I think he is a foodie fraud
In love with himself
author: Barry V.

description:
Anthony Anthony Anthony Bourdain!! You have not done me wrong so far. Loved this placed!! 
I work close by and decided to give it a try. Long wait but so worth it. I decided to get just a crab cocktail and this is no ordinary crab cocktail. Just chunks and chunks of it, I have my list of things I am going to try next time I stop in. 
I will be back and will sit down next time. I had to take to go. 
Give it a try people.
author: A C.

description:
Get the crab cocktail and the crab back. Dump crab cocktail into crab back. Eat.

Amazing.
author: Anna M.

description: My favorite seafood place!! Menu is small but the quality of the food makes up for it. Everything is fresh & yummy!!! The service is great. If you don't know what to order u can always ask for advice. Don't be shy!! They are great! Thank you guys for a great sf experience!!
author: R Z.

description:
This was our very first stop in SF! A Bay Area native I'd met prior to our trip said this joint made his favorite clam chowder in the city, so of course, I had to try it! 

There was a line out the door, which I anticipated, but the line moved quickly as people left. The restaurant is just one long bar, so this may not be the best place for large groups that want to sit together. As soon as we were seated, we were greeted by some of the friendliest guys ever, and despite how hectic it was, we were treated well and served quickly! 

We ordered two bowls of their Boston Clam Chowder and some bread on the side. The chowder was fantastic, and better than any bowl of Boston Clam Chowder I've had anywhere else! It had a strong clam flavor which I love love love. It isn't the thick chowder you expect, but it was delicious nonetheless. The bread was cold and a little dry, but obviously people don't come here for the bread, haha. We didn't try any of the seafood this time around, but we could hear people raving about it all around us! Hopefully I'll be able to update this review the next time in the city. All I can say is that it's all very, very fresh! The sashimi was sliced right off the fish in front of us!
author: Krystyl C.

description: This is a San Fran tradition. The wait wasn't to bad, but definitely pricey. The quality of the seafood was great but I felt I was paying for the tradition rather than the product itself. Will definitely be back for that damn Italian sashimi
author: Andrew M.

description:
Not worth the 2 hr wait! My coworker saw this place on one of Anthony Bourdain's television episodes. She sold me on the pictures on Yelp! What a disappointment. Over hyped.

What We Ordered
- Crab Back
- Small Sashimi
- Crab Cocktail
- A Dozen Oysters

The Crab Back was COLD. You would think it would come warm/hot? Odd. I still ate it all seeing how it was the last one they had when we were seated. (There were more after the fact...I wonder what temperature those were lol.) Anywho, the Small Sashimi came with scallops, tuna and salmon. The tuna and salmon were NOT fresh!! It tasted weird and fishy. The scallop sashimi was on point! The Crab Cocktail was okay. Basic. The oysters were a tad small and not as fresh as the ones we had the day before at Hog Island Oyster. I won't be back! :(
author: Pauline C.

description: Nice place, fresh food but come on, learn how to run your freaking business. Stood in line for a little over 3 hours, yes, 3 hours! Just to observe that they allow some of their customers sit in that tiny place for hours!!! It's not a sit down restaurant, it's a tiny hole in a wall 10-15 seats at a bar kinda place. As much as I love seafood, I will never come here again.
author: Victoria N.

description: Amazing combination salad and combination cocktail, with the quintessential San Francisco sourdough bread. Worth the wait!
author: Lyndsey H.

description:
I finally bit the bullet and came to Swan Oyster Depot on a Friday.  With this joint opening at 10:30 AM, my wife & I showed up at 9:50 and found a line about 20 deep long already.  We did not get in during the first wave, but were near the front of the line after the initial seating.  A spot at the counter opened up around 11:10, so the wait was about 80 minutes.  But it was totally worth the wait!

We started out with 2 large bowls of clam chowder.  The chowder was "New England" style, but not as creamy as you'd normally get from other seafood places.  The chowder was a little thinner than usual, but full of clams and potatoes.  Plus, there were bowls of oyster crackers on the counter for your dipping or soaking pleasure.  And the sourdough bread served was fresh and delicious; the offered butter was not needed.

Our next course was a half dozen clams and half dozen mixed oysters (from different regions).  Again, super fresh, with only a spritz of lemon juice and some tabasco were needed (also, both already on the counter).  You can also get some cocktail sauce, horseradish or any of the other dozen brands of hot sauce to spice up your shellfish.

Finally, we put in an order of the smoked trout and another order of the cold smoked salmon.  The smoked trout was served as is, with a small shrimp salad.  The trout was sweet and flaky, not too fishy or smoky.  This was, by far, our favorite dish of the meal.  The salad had their louie dressing and provided a nice counter-balance to all the seafood (Mom always said to eat my greens).  The cold smoked salmon (as opposed to their hot-smoked salmon) was served on thin slices of french bread, with a smattering of olive oil, cracked pepper, chopped onion and capers covering the thinly-sliced salmon.  While this restaurant is owned and operated by Italian Catholics, the smoked salmon would make any Jew proud.

By the time we walked out a little after 12 noon, the line was at least 50 people deep (at least a 2 hour wait).  But you can bide the time and order a draft beer while you dream of shrimp cocktails and oysters on the half-shell.  Just walk to the front and order beers at the counter.

Unfortunately, we came here just short of the opening of crab season, so we'll need to brave the long lines to try the cracked crab and crab back.  But I know that will be worth it, too.  (Also, make sure you bring cash, since they don't take credit cards.  You can always go to the Chase ATM across the street).

If you are an OG seafood purist, you must make the pilgrimage to Swan Oyster Depot.  Use the wait time to contemplate how much you love the fruits of the water (and maybe down a beer or two).  Your stomach and your soul will thank you.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Poor customer service. Closes at irregular times in the day even though advertised business times say 5:30 pm. Very rude staff
author: Ken C.

description: The seafood was really fresh and delicious and the staff was more than friendly. They would tell you all the stories about the place you ask for. Queuing for more than 2 hours with a pregnant friend was not that nice though...
author: Kristina T.

description:
Their food is amazing. I don't even like seafood that much but everything we got was amazing. 

We had to wait in line but it was totally worth it.
author: Dani T.

description:
I have read a lot of reviews on Yelp before I went into this place. I gotta say I LOVE THE WHOLE EXPERIENCE.

We were a group of 4, waited in line at the doorway for like 20mins. Not a bad wait I would say. From time to time, one of the staff made small talks with us. Be careful of their closing time as they stop serving like 30-45mins ahead of closing. They certainly have what it take to turn people down given how popular and busy they are.

Our sever served us bread and did not rush us to eat/order at all. He was taking each order, serve and then take another order. Its not like most other restaurant you just place all your orders at once.

2 Clam Chowder: Unlike other places, not creamy, liquid but FULL OF CLAM flavor
4 Cherry Stones: Fresh, no shells, very good
1 half-cracked crab: Very flavorful and full of meat in crab legs, limited served per day
2 Crab cocktail: Loved it cos it is fresh and I did not need to get my hands dirty, good seafood sauce
2 beers
Everything $100
 
I will def come back if I am in San Fran again. Loved the whole dining experience. Servers are nice in their own way. They are not rude, they just got their unique personalities.
author: Vivian C.

description: Two hours in line for very overrated and extremely overpriced seafood (most of the items on the wall menu don't even have prices listed either).  Tried the sea urchin, clam chowder, half-dozen oysters, and clams.  Nothing made me think wow, except the fact that they still use an old-school cash register and don't give you a receipt.
author: Chinito G.

description: Great place to have fresh seafood. Crab back, crab salad, and sashimi highly recommended. All around very friendly people and always enjoy the meal here
author: Hummus P.

description:
We arrived at this place at 10:45 AM (15 minutes after they opened) and there was already a line outside. We ended up waiting over an hour to get in. Now it's not that this place is super busy, it's just super small inside. There are approximately 12-14 bar seats inside. That's it. It was so small in there, we had to leave our stroller outside. As for a child seat, don't even ask. Where the hell would they store it?? 

The wait isn't too bad...funny story... we were waiting behind these two men in their mid-sixties who were talking about world traveling and big game hunting. All of a sudden one of the older dudes begins talking about wanting to "bang" some lady... Dude really? You're that loud and obnoxious? His words verbatim were: "well I want to straighten her out, but the opportunity hasn't presented itself yet." I'm getting irritated at this point telling myself: "there's no restaurant in the world that's good enough to wait in line next to these two shepherds for the devil..."  At that point the vomit started to come back down my throat back into my stomach and we were seated, so I couldn't back out. I hope those old farts read my review and I hope some pimp with hepatitis spits in their foul mouths. 

The food was definitely worth the wait. Very fresh seafood; we ordered the combination salad, crab back (to dip our bread into), bowl of clam chowder and a plate of sashimi (I think that's what they called it). Everything was super fresh and tasty. Very minimal seasoning as, they want the seafood to shine here. I understand that. Only feedback I can give is that the crab back needed to be heated up instead of being served cold. The combination salad is like any seafood salad but with baby shrimp, lump crab, and prawns. The chowder was hot and had great flavor. The crab back was good with the bread and the sashimi was delicious. Next time I would probably get a large sashimi. BTW, that was the first time I ever had raw scallops and boy were they excellent!! 

This place only accepts cash, so I was very conservative on ordering because I didn't know how much the bill was going to be and I only had $120 cash. If they accepted credit cards, I would have just told the guy to put food in front of me until I said stop. I totally mis-judged my total bill as it was only $58 for what I mentioned above. I was so conservative that I didn't even order beer or oysters... Quite disappointed about that, but I didn't want to be short when the bill arrived. Next time I come here it's ON! Hopefully those two old humps aren't in line again.

Lastly, I must mention that the staff and owner were so welcoming and friendly. They made my daughter a little plate of bread and made us feel at home. I really appreciated that. 

Kudos Swan Oyster Depot! We will be back!
author: Alan Y.

description:
This has some of the freshest seafood you'll find in San Francisco. The long line may turn you off a bit, but it is well worth the wait. As soon as you walk you can smell the seafood, because the only seating that is there is right along side the counter. If you're not sure what to get, the good guys there will set you up properly.
I recommend the crab back, and a cold beer.
author: Joel G.

description:
The line to get in may be discouraging, but it is worth being patient.
The quirky interior, the entertaining staff and the delicious sea food, is a must have in San Francisco.
We had the cherry stone clams, cracked crab, combo cocktail, and more all excellent.
Do not forget a glass of white wine.
Cash only.
author: Madeline M.

description: Came here on the recommendation of Anthony Bourdain. The service was impeccable! I had the clam chowder & it was decent. The place is a bit cramped. Just not my scene.
author: Narie L.

description: Excellent fresh fish.  Got the off-menu Sicilian Sashimi.  Raw salmon, tuna, and scallops, served with olive oil, capers and red onion.  OMG those were the BEST SCALLOPS EVER!  Add to that some fresh sourdough and you've got yourself one satisfying meal.
author: Charleen R.

description:
My favorite seafood restaurant in the world (and I've had some dank seafood). 

You can't go wrong with anything here. I usually get the sashimi platter, the combo salad with the mayo dressing on the side (unless you REALLY like mayo) + the Dijon vinaigrette that's not on the menu (they mix in some crab fat into it and it's insane), the crab legs, clam chowder, crab cocktail, uní.... seriously everything is good. 

Get there at 930am on saturdays for brunch. If not, expect to wait an hour in line. But it is so, so worth it.
author: Myrna P.

description:
That's it. I have to keep him. The old man likes to see me squirm and get antsy when he won't tell me where he's taking me. May be a plan to take me somewhere and hope I can't find my way back? 

So when we strolled up to this iconic establishment, I pretty much died and thought this place must be the gate to heaven. 
At 10:30 am there was already a long, long line halfway down the block. I didn't care. I was so giddy about finally getting to try this place. Old man had already did his homework and knew we'd be in line for a good 2 hours! So, he took off down the street to get us some breakfast to eat while waiting. Turns out this is the thing to do. Met a nice lady in line, from Texas. It was her 2nd time there, and her husband was off getting their breakfast too. 

And yes, we waited a full 2 hours to get two stools at the counter that seats about 12 to 15. It really didn't feel like 2 hours because coffee. And also meeting a nice couple we were able to chat with. I certainly picked her brain about what they enjoyed on their last visit. She loved their salad. And the crab fat. As you get closer to the pearly gates, you can fawn over all of the beautiful fresh seafood displayed in the front window., and watch the men behind the counter making up dishes. This also helped me in making my decision on what to order. 

Was really hoping to try the crab fat, but I had overheard that they were out. I ended up getting the Crab Louie salad with dressing and cocktail sauce on the side. TONS of crab meat on this salad. So, I pretty much had a salad and crab cocktail in one dish. I also got a half dozen oysters, that were so fresh and delicious. The oysters come with two sauces, a mignonette and spicy Thai sauce. Both were excellent. I was in heaven alright! 

I definitely want to come back after November 5th, so I can enjoy some of that crab fat! And, I want to try the Sicilian sushi. I watched these guys preparing several plates, and my wished I had more room in my belly. Oh, and the sourdough bread they serve, is the best sourdough I can ever remember trying. 

Three things to remember: cash only! Don't be afraid of the wait, and you can always call in an order To-Go.

P.S. I love you so much, old man! Definitely a keeper.
author: Kara B.

description:
I want to know who gave this place less than 5 stars?! Because they are a dumb person.

My boyfriend and I stopped by this place for lunch on a Wednesday during our stay here in SF. Waited an hour, but had to try it according to Anthony Bourdain. 

We were seated at the packed counter, which features only 18 stools, and were entertained by the friendly employees who were shucking fresh oysters and slicing salmon. 

We got the seafood combination cocktail, which has crab, shrimp, mussel and oyster with fresh cocktail sauce. We also had crab back and it is a must! So so good. Definitely something I would not have ordered regularly, but I love trying new things. Along with fresh sourdough, clam chowder and a mixed dozen of oysters, our lunch was insanely delicious. Looking forward to my next trip to SF and the must of the all future trips...Swan Oyster Depot!
author: Catie B.

description:
Don't be fooled by the lines outside, their food is poor quality and over priced. The service is terrible too.
After waiting in line for a ridiculous amount of time, we tell the waiter what we'd like, a simple order, and he gets pissed and tells us he'll come back later.
They don't have many of the items on their menu, using the excuse "the fishermen just bring whatever". He hands me a whole sheet of paper towel, I tell him I bring my own napkin to reduce paper waste and to please use it on the next guest, he gets pissed and throws the unused paper towel out.
The oysters were nasty, the clam chowder was gross, you can find better, fresher seafood at any of the other restaurants in town - even ones that don't specialize in fish. So expensive too, I can't believe I waited in a line for this catastrophe.
I feel compelled to warn people that this place is a trap, don't fall for it! Their attitude is crabby, their food is shabby!
author: James L.

description: When in SF, you must eat here.  Period.  Do not question me.  Just thank me.  Freshest seafood there is, friendliest service ever.  Be prepared to wait, but it's worth it.  Order everything, bring cash, lots of it!
author: Kanilehua K.

description:
Mmm good stuff. In my hunt for the best oysters in the city, I inevitably had to give Swan Oyster a try. After reading reviews about a horrible 2 hour wait, that was enough to convince me to come on a random Tuesday at 11 am for lunch. Even at the hour, we had to wait about 15 minutes or so, which wasn't too bad, because once you get in and served, food comes out pretty quickly.

Swan is set up as a long counter down the restaurant. You sit on janky stools and eat off the bar as really nice chefs basically chat with you throughout your meal. The place screams of character -- from the handwritten menu on the wall to the old school jazz playing in the background to the variety of seafood that you're surrounded by to bumping elbows with strangers, It's a tiny space that maybe seats about 20 people or so. Also cash only! Though there is a Chase right across the street which is really convenient.

My friend and I got a mixed dozen oysters (Miyagis, Kumamotos, Atlantic brine-y stuff, and something else), smoked salmon served on French bread with shrimp salad, and a bowl of clam chowder which was actually quite a bit of food for the two of us

The oysters are quite good -- I've only been to Hog Island in the city besides here and I think they taste fresher here. Smoked salmon was pretty good as well, as was the shrimp salad. Super fresh and super delicious, and really generous portions of fish. 

Final total was $70 post tip for the two of us which isn't super egregious given that we were basically only eating seafood and both of us were pretty stuffed at the end. 

tldr; probably one of the best places for fresh seafood in the city
author: Jasmine X.

description:
Ending 2015 with one of my favorite spots in SF. As a general life rule for me and one of my best friends, if the line to Swan Oyster Depot isn't to the furniture store yet, get in it quick. Even if you weren't planning on going there. 

Seafood is the name of the game obviously. Love almost everything here but highlights include the seafood cocktail salad, the fresh shucked oysters, and the underrated sashimi which is served more like a crudo with olive oil and capers. The latter in particular is just so amazing especially the scallop sashimi. I can still taste those scallops from memory. Other goodies include chowder and smoked fish plus other seafood salads if you just want jumbo shrimp for example. They also have a chowder, shrimp cocktail, beer combo too but you're probably gonna want to upgrade to the mix seafood salad because it's totally worth it. 

Folks here have been doing it for ages and it's great to tap into their expertise and enjoy their hospitality. Lighthearted, cozy, and all around fun atmosphere to enjoy some seafood and beer in a San Francisco institution. 

Also, contrary to what you see on Bourdain's travels, you can hardly ever just walk-in to Swan Oyster Depot so prepare for a line.
author: Jon L.

description:
I finally made it !!!!! 
I've been trying to make it here for quite a while and the discouraging long lines always kept me from coming, however today (wednesday morning) the line was pretty light (about a 20 min wait) so I was able to get sitted in a timely manner.

I sat down, the people behind the counter were very friendly,  I ordered a small plate of mixed fish shashimi style and marinated, I also got a half dozen mixed oysters.  In the sashimi the fish that stood out the most was the hamachi which was exquisite, the rest of the fish was great also. The oysters were out of this world, definitely some of the best oysters I ever had.

If your visiting or live here, make sure you go to swan, the quality of the fish is impeccable, definitely some of the freshest fish. 
I just have 1 tip, make sure you bring cash.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Fresh Oysters, Fresh Sashimi, and lovely Clam Chowder. This is even fresher than the sashimi in Fish Market in Tokyo. Lovely place. But prepare to wait in line.
author: Aaron C.

description:
After a 90 minute wait it was worth every minute waiting. If you don't want to wait you can come to the door and order to go or call to place an order it only takes about 15-30 minute.  
As soon as you walk in you will instantly feel the history of the place along with how friendly and genuine the owners are (son, dad, brother, uncle). 
We were party of 6 and wanted to try everything. So we ordered everything that was on the wall :) sashimi, clam cocktail and the clam chowder soup was to die for. 
Must go and enjoy some good, fresh seafood.
author: Ani O.

description: This review is for pointing out that they were closed with both yelp and voice mail at restaurant indicated they were open. I drove 30min to come eat hear for first time and am very disappointed.
author: Jessica R.

description: The wait this Friday morning was crazzyyyy. We waited about 4 hours to get seats at the counter. There are only about 15 seats in the restaurant. The oysters and clams were delectable (15/14 for half a dozen) and the crab back was definately worth it at 6 bucks a pop. The clam chowder was soupy and thin, not my favorite type of chowder. The sashimi plate was definately not what I am accustomed to with olive oil and capers, but everything tasted fine. The men behind the counter were hilarious abd personable. All in all, not worth a 4 hour wait though. The food was awesome and I would definately come back for take out! It is cash only!!!
author: Angela J.

description:
You know I think I have come to realize after many years of trying it = I do not like seafood 
It reminds me of eating sunflower seeds a lot of work for such a little reward

 Now I know you are going to say you just have not had good seafood yet , but I tell you I have tried a lot , everywhere that everyone tells me (oh you have to try this)
 I usually just end up eating soon after somewhere else because I am still hungry and always with fishy smelling hands 

I read a few people bitching about the price but the price is what it is with seafood DUH
your not eating at McDonald or fish and chips at some fried food place
YOU ARE EATING FRESH SEAFOOD DUMMY

pros= employees were friendly 
          concept was cool
          seafood seemed fresh
cons= cash only
           seating was few
theory I have is they get the bread from same place as Molinari Delicatessen = the wife and I had a game of tug of war to get a piece = like chewing on a old leather belt
author: Eric B.

description: I like this place a lot as a classic, a hole in the wall, a San Francisco landmark.  Seafood is absolutely fresh.  Bloody beer is eye-opening to pair with oyster.  Seafood cocktail combo - must eat all together for fulfillment!  And its crab leg: no bone, no shell -- pure pleasure to enjoy local dungeness crab!  It does not get 5-star from me because of its ambience -- it's fun, always has a line, but also a rush to leave knowing that you want to share this experience with other lining outside!
author: C.P. C.

description:
Came on a weekday morning when I was off work. There was not a wait around 10:00am and was immediately seated. Enjoyed the crab backs as well as a seasonal spread of a dozen oysters. Had the crab cocktail that was pretty sauce-y, but yummy. Never too early to have an Anchor Steam  with your meal...


The bad part to this story... Vomited my guts out the morning after. The rawness can get ya if you have a weak stomach.
author: Huy N.

description: very nice historical restaurant to try. Wanted to try it for a few years but always moved on due to long line to get in. Totally worth it and a great experience of historical San Francisco. Owner was kind enough to take our order and told us many of his old stories about the place.
author: Reza F.

description:
And it comes full circle! 

We become foodies for different reasons. We love to cook or we love to eat. I became a foodie because I would watch shows like Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations and say to myself, "Hey, I could be doing that right now!" I don't have the camera crew, but that hasn't stopped me from eating my heart out. 

One of Bourdain's go-to spots in SF is Swan Oyster Depot. Unfortunately for me, I went to SOD on a nice day, so the line was horrendous (2 hours). The place is small, but the dreams (and patience) of those waiting in line were big. 

Then I found out about the to-go/pick-up line. I wasn't keen on a feast, so I waited 20 minutes or so for a bowl of clam chowder. I chatted with a couple enjoying their meal, and drooled as I waited. 

The clam chowder was alright. The broth was delicious, but it was too soupy. It was all broth. And the restaurant was so busy, they forgot my oyster crackers. My appetite was not saturated. 

But mark my words, I will be back and sitting at that counter. I will bring with me an empty belly and a full heart. I will feast!
author: Joanna S.

description: Swan oyster bar wait was 1 hour and so worth the wait!  Darin so cool and has aloha ties which made our visit that much more awesome! The crab cocktail and the kumamoto are to die for, omg!
author: Tammy C.

description:
If the following floats your boat, then this place is totally for you...

Super fresh seafood.  

More specifically, if any of the following floats your boat, then you'll love it here...

Oysters.
Clams.
Shrimp.
Prawns.
Smoked salmon.
Clam chowder.

Even more specifically, if any of the following floats your boat, then this place really needs to be in your life...

Crab.
Lobster.
Uni.
Sashimi.

It would be remiss of me not to mention the Sicilian sashimi.  Delicate, silky, clean, & fresh.  They do olive oil, onion, & capers w it...utterly simple, but utterly divine.

I'm a crab lover...oh, the crab.  So tender, so delectable.  And so fresh!  The crab cocktail & the crab salad are fabulous.

If you love uni, 18 bucks here will get you a serving of heaven.

It's counter seating only.  Get here when it opens.  This is the only hope you have of getting a seat.  

An institution forever.  So old school.  You can feel the nostalgia when you walk in.  

I love that aspect almost as much as the crab salad.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Before you head to this place, make sure you wear something comfortable and bring a light jacket because you will be standing in line for at least 1 hour plus. 

Though the lines may look short, but it is deceiving!! This place is very small and there are only 19 seats in the house. These 19 seats are stools that have no back support. Be prepared to be elbow to elbow with strangers you have waited in line with, who are just as hungry as you are! On this occasion we got there at 2:30 and didn't get sat until 4:20. Luckily we got there in time because the couple behind us got a lucky ticket saying they were the last person to be guaranteed a seat. It was like the golden ticket. They open till 5:30, but stop seating at 4:45. If you are not in a stool by 4:45, you have the option of taking Togo, but they will not seat you. 

Enough about the wait, on to the food! I enjoyed their fresh variety of seafood. We got 12 mixed variety oysters which included (blue point, miagya, Kumamoto, and another one I can't remember). All the oysters were fresh and the brine was perfect. They give you a red rice whine vinegrette, or a Thai chili sauce to go with your oysters. If you're like me, Tabasco and horseradish will do! We had a combination salad which consisted of lettuce, a heaping amount of crab, small shrimp, and 3 jumbo shrimp! We asked for their famous Louise sauce on the side. The dressing taste like a fancier thousand island. Then we had a sashimi plate with just tuna and salmon. They top it off with pepper, olive oil, and some type of green pea. Not sure what it was but it was a little spicy. 

Service was great too. I felt like I was in a small diner, and the staff treated you like you were family. The person who took our order made sure we knew what he was dropping off. I love that, because sometimes when you order, you don't know what the hell it is. But luckily for yelp, after waiting in line for so long, we knew what we wanted when we got sat. 

Overall, I would not come back unless I am the first person in line! Oh and cash only please!!
author: Nga P.

description: Crab Louis salad is perfect. Oysters - as fresh as they; the Kumamoto are the BEST. Excellent clam chowder. Crab back - very, very good (if you're into that kind of thing). Crawfish was just okay - I've had better.
author: Richard M.

description: I had an amazing time here. Dungeness crabs everywhere, delicious oysters, and everyone who works here are super friendly and generous. Definitely a must every time I visit the city.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Swan's Oyster Depot has always been a great place to take Lived Ones as well as Out-Of-Town guest's!
Everything on the menu is appealing & delicious .
I usually order the Combo Salad, Clam Chowder, Oysters,
and sometimes the whole crab!
This is a must for anybody looking  for a great Seafood Joint!
author: Russell H.

description: Had a great dinner here. Line is long takes about an hour and a half. We even went during an odd hour. They do allow you to drink in line ... so enjoy. We had bread and butter, Kumamoto oysters, smoked salmon( my favorite), crab back( I heard was good but was not for me), a cup of clam chowder for the hubby( said it was ok) , and scallop (eggs) half dozen(very good). Food was good and fresh but portions were small and hard to get full off of.
author: Jamela B.

description: Came here on a Saturday and waited in line for around an hour to an hour and a half which I expected. We ordered oysters, the combination salad, Italian sashimi and clams. I liked everything except the clams. The taste and texture weren't my favorite. I was most excited to try the crab back but they ran out by the time we got seated. Will have to come back to try it.
author: Dana T.

description:
Part of what makes this the "best place in America to eat food"* is its quirkiness, and if you're not saddled up for a unique customer service experience, you might not enjoy yourself at Swan. 

There are other places to purchase fresh fish and oysters in San Francisco. There are places with better parking, and there's no such thing as a place like this that would live up to the title of "best place in America to eat food," so leave your high expectations behind and accept the experience for what it is.

As someone who lives in the neighborhood and eats here frequently, nothing would make me more grateful than an end to the long lines filled with international and domestic front-runners that make our local oyster bar an international tourist destination, so -- if it helps to achieve that end -- then I'll tell you that the food is merely average and the service is less than solicitous. It's a family run joint, and no one gets fired from the family for not kissing your ass at the payment counter, and you can't make seafood any better than the ocean gives it to you. 

Seriously, if this isn't your thing, then get lost.
author: West R.

description:
That smoked salmon though!!!!! If you're gonna wait in the drastically long Saturday morning line for over an hour, you definitely have to try the smoked salmon here. It's melt in yo mouth creamy gooood. It is by far the best smoked salmon I've ever had.

I came here with a group of six on a Saturday morning and had to wait for a good while before getting some seats at the far end of the counter. It was a bliss to be seated in front of all the fish and cutting boards where I get to watch the multitude of workers here slicing away at all kinds of fish and shellfish. The service is exceptionally friendly here as they happily assist in choosing what to order and are glad to engage in conversation as they work behind the counter. They also consistently fill up the water cups and provide bread whenever desired.

We started off with the dozen oysters which came with three different varieties being from British Columbia, Marin County, and Washington. They're fresh and delicious but not outstandingly superb compared to raw oysters you might get elsewhere. However, they have some great add ons such as their homemade spicy sauce and horseradish that compliment the shellfish very well. We also tried the combination Louie salad which came with two types of shrimp and crab over lettuce which was pretty decent. The best part of it has to be the crab which comes in shredded pieces and a couple of fat pieces presumably from the claws. We ordered a cup of calamari as well which wasn't anything special, but definitely not bad.

Other than the amazing smoked salmon dish that comes on bread with some chopped onions and capers, the other dish that I found very enjoyable was the Sicilian sashimi platter. It comes with a variety of raw seafood including scallops, tuna, salmon, and others. The raw fish is dressed in olive oil and comes with capers as well. The sashimi tasted very fresh and is something I would highly recommend!
author: Joshua M.

description:
A must go, but once is enough (because of the long wait)!

Pros:
1. Really good seafood. The crab santhemum was awesome. Oyster sampler was also great.
2. Very friendly and comical staff, once you get in. They don't rush you at all.

Cons:
1. Very looooonnnggg wait. We waited for over two hours just to get in.
2. Wish they took reservations. But they appear to be so tech averse, they don't even have a website. A bit less cockiness and a bit more compassion for customer wouldn't hurt.
3. Wish didn't have to wait in cold to get such awesome food.
author: Aashish J.

description:
We waited in the rain for two hours to get into this place. It was hard and it took determination but we had heard so much about this place that we stuck it out. So was it worth it? Let's say that I wouldn't stand 2 hrs again but all in all, it was a good experience. Here's what we ordered:
- Crab back: it's great! I would definitely reorder
- Sashimi combo plate: it was okay, nothing great. The fish was cut too thick and uneven. 
- Oysters: Wonderful, very fresh and absolutely getting them again. 
- Chowder: it's tasty but not the usual chunky type you may be used to. It's thin but has flavor. I appreciated it especially because of the cold, rainy day. 
- Crab cocktail: decent amount of crab but drenched in cocktail sauce. So much so that it masks the taste of the crab. I am asking for the sauce on the side next time. 
They didn't have Uni on the day we went, oh well! 

One last thing, the people who run this place are warm and friendly and make you feel really welcome. It seems to be a family business and there are a ton of photos on the walls that you can peruse. Despite the lines, no one rushes you and you can eat to your hearts content.
author: Seema K.

description: This place definitely lives up to the hype! Come prepared to wait outside in line. For a long time. But once you get in, you'll forget all about the 1-2 hour wait and be SO happy you did it. The people that work here are the nicest and understand that you waiting a long time so are super accommodating. Everything we had was DELICIOUS! Crab back, half crab, oysters (of course), clam chowder, smoked salmon. But the best thing we ate was by far the sashimi. So unexpected at an oyster bar, but wow was it good!
author: Kristi B.

description: I used to come to this place back in the 80s Before the Internet and online reviews  made the lines unbearably long.   As an actual real San Franciscan I refuse to stand for more than, say 5 minutes, in line to pay an establishment for the privilege  of eating  their food.  I was walking by this past week at like 11am and saw that there was, holy cow, no line!  Sat down and was quickly taken care of the by friendly and awesome staff, some of whom were working there the last time I was there in 1988.  The food is as fresh and tasty as ever.  Just a simple lunch counter with simple but high quality fresh seafood.   Really good, of course.  A little bit on the expensive side, and obviously, no food on earth is worth waiting in these kind of lines for.  But if you go early in the day you may be able to avoid all the tourists and their lines.  You can always call it in for take out too.
author: H K.

description:
I was the first customer to be seated as I arrived at 10am and was the first in line. Turned out I could have arrived at 10:30am and still be able to be seated right away because the store was still half empty at the time( I went on a weekday in mid-January). 
The staff were all very nice and helpful.

Food: 
Oysters(one of each kind): all very fresh, but one of them had cracked oyster shell bits in it.
Crab cocktail: delicious, but once again, why were there crab shell bits hidden in the crabmeat?
Prawn cocktail: I have had fresher ones
Boston clam chowder: It was not too creamy or thick. Slightly on the salty side but delicious nonetheless. 
I will be sure to return to try out their sea urchin( wasn't available today) and crab fat next time! 

Total bill: $51

Tip: Remember to bring cash!
author: I L.

description: Expensive, I was not prepared. However the clam chowder and combination seafood cocktail was so good that I didn't even look at my phone! The size of the cocktail was pretty dainty though and I think it should have been a much larger portion. Very nice and friendly staff. Everything I had was super fresh and delicious!
author: Mel B.

description:
This has been on my bucketlist from watching Anthony Bourdain........The past couple times of trying to come down here they have been closed due to holidays... but I finally made it!
 
Here are my recommendations:
-Arrive EARLY! And by early I mean, it opens at 10:30, to get within the first wave of seats you need to be there by 9am!
-Do not miss the crab back!!!! It is a MUST!! It is a shell full of the tamale of the crab, served warm, with oil (maybe butter) and you spread that all over bread. The crab's "bone marrow" if you will. I died of happiness.
 
The line starts forming around 9am.... And the restaurant only holds roughly 16 seats. We got there around 9:30, and had to wait 45 mins for the 2nd wave of people. The best thing about the line is you can order beers as you wait :D! The whole ambiance of this place is very special, and exactly what you think of when you watch No Reservations. Small hole in the wall with great food, and the people/service is old school - EXCELLENT and fun!
 
Tried the littleneck clams, 2 kinds, crab Louie (basically so much crab with a side of salad), the crab back and a clam chowder. Everything was wonderful and fresh, and if you are a crab enthusiast like I am, you will enjoy the simplicity of the crab itself.
author: Amanda N.

description:
I grew up in Seattle eating the best, most fresh seafood around and I am very pleased with Swan Oyster Depot.  Their clam chowder has the perfect consistency - paired with a glass of white wine, fresh crab and bread and BOOM, a delightful lunch. 

Highly recommend.  Great ambiance as well as the family still runs the business and the counter top makes for a fun restaurant experience.
author: Christine N.

description: I was recommended by my cousin to come and try out the seafood salad. When we got to the store, there was a long line for dining in the restaurant. Instead of dining in, me and my cousin ordered it to go. They gave a very good portion of seafood for the salad and the dressing that came with the salad did not overpower the flavor of the seafood. The combo came with crab meat, big shrimps and little shrimps. Maybe because it was the first meal of the day, that I got full quickly but I think the salad can feed 2 people. I believe the price was $25. It sounds expensive but the amount of seafood given in the salad makes the $25 worth it. I was also told by my cousin that their seafood is fresh so adding up all the details, that $25 is a good price! Overall, it was an enjoyable experience. Maybe next time, I'll try dining in!
author: Lisa L.

description:
Check your bill/ask for itemized receipt when you get  the bill. Maybe the price that they tell you and your actual receipt doesn't tally! That's what happened to me. Questionable and disappointing

Food though is pretty good.
author: C L.

description:
My friend and I have been wanting to try this place forever. Too bad I geared us towards the completely wrong direction today. First off, she got here around 11:20am. From the reviews, I was expecting around an hour wait, which would've worked out fine since my lunch break is around 12:15. It actually took her maybe half an hour before she was next in line. Unfortunately, I couldn't take my lunch take when she was in front of the line so I made her wait an extra twenty minutes. She's a trooper.

When I finally arrived, we got seated quickly. The workers all seem very friendly. But the worker just standing there in front of us made us feel rushed. I tried to order as quickly as possible. Based off the reviews, we ordered the small Sicilian sashimi plate, half a dozen of oysters, and the crab salad. 

The oysters were the first thing we ate. They were so delicious and fresh! I also loved their unique hot sauce. To be frank, it was my favorite thing I ate the whole meal. Then our crab salad came. So much crab on it! I read the reviews and everyone says to skip the combo salad and just order the crab salad, which is the reason why I ordered it. What a mistake! Maybe I'm crazy to be complaining about too much crab, but man was it too much. A bit overwhelming. Regret not ordering the combo salad. Actually, I could've gone without any salad. Didn't have much flavor. Barely tasted the dressing. In the end, we just tried to finish the crab since that was mostly what we were paying for and ignored the lettuce. Now on to the sashimi plate.. it was so small! Didn't realize how tiny it would be. It was good, but definitely not worth its price. We also decided to order a cup of clam chowder in the end. It was so funky.. very liquidy. Nothing of the clam chowder reminded me of clam chowder lol. 

All I can say is that I'm glad I got to try this place and remove it from my bookmarks. Will I come here again? Probably not for a very very very long time.
author: Annie H.

description: Had to take the sashimi to go because they don't seat anyone after 5pm (they close at 5:30). The fresh fish was worth it!
author: Liz N.

description: I have never eaten inside Swans because I don't ever wait to eat anywhere. But you can cut in front of the line to buy their fresh fish to take out. Don't feel intimidated to do this. The owners are happy to help you right away. Everything is super fresh and ready for your dinner at home..just make sure you look in the window and know exactly what you want. Cutting in line is not acceptable if you are not sure what you want. Order ,pay,get out of the way!
author: Judy B.

description:
This place is so magical. The freshest seafood I have had in a long time. The character in the restaurant and servers is alive and well. I had the luxury of taking some PTO so we arrived around 10:00am (30 minutes before they opened), therefore getting to dine in the first group. It's worth it to arrive a bit earlier to avoid being in a later group and having to wait for people to finish their meals to eat. It seems to only get worse later on and god forbid... they run out of the seafood you wanted most!

My mom was in town so together we got a clam chowder, crab salad (extra legs on the side), crab back, 6 oysters (3 different origins), and a fresh sea urchin (we could not resist when they arrived a bit after opening on a wagon). There are giant bowls of lemons, crackers, butter, hot sauce, etc and a nice loaf of sourdough. 
-If I were to go back: definitely trying the combination sashimi.
-FAVORITES: wish I ordered double Crab Backs and Oysters... Delicious.

I would be dying to go back but unfortunately my schedule will say otherwise but if you happen to have free time in the middle of the week around 10am. GO!
author: Ann Marie L.

description:
Finally tried this place. This was my dine in experience, not to go. I started waiting in line at 2:30pm on a Saturday, but didn't get seated until around 4:45pm. Their line cut off is around 3:15pm on Saturdays. We saw so many people try lining up but got rejected.

On to the service, the servers very direct to the point and one of the servers was extremely nice and should be employee of the month. He made some lemon water for us to wash our hands in and gave us paper towels to wipe off the water after finishing our meal.

Food:
The crab backs were sold out and they supposedly sell out by 4pm on Fridays and Saturdays. 

Miyagi oysters: they also sold out of Kumamotos. The miyagis were fresh and the lemon and sauce they had at the counter went well with the oyster.

Clams: these freshly shucked clams were probably the highlight of the entire meal. They were fresh, had good texture, and tasted sweet... like seafood sweet. 

Half crab: they cracked the legs of the crab and served it with a choice of cocktail sauce, mayo, or Louie. The crab was good but nothing out of this world.

Make sure to bring cash since it's cash only. I gave 3 stars based on the wait, quality of food and service. I won't come back to wait for a seat, but I would just order take out since take out is so much faster.
author: Shu L.

description:
I waited for 3.5 hours in line and I must say, Swan Oyster Depot did not disappoint. The food was so incredibly fresh (which is so delightful for a seafood lover who doesn't have the luxury of living on the coast). 

Started with the chowder which was good. Not the best, but very good. Then I had a half dozen chef's choice oysters. These little guys were succulent and sweet, shucked right in front of me by my own personal seafood attendant, the oysters fresher than I've ever had. Speaking of their staff, the guys of Swan Oyster Depot were great! I had one gentleman who took care of everything for me. Waiter, chef, and local guide all rolled onto one - he took the order, shucked, cracked, sliced and served the entire delicious meal. But back to the meal! 

The best oysters were closely followed with a rich crab back and some of their hearty bread. I could have easily shared that with someone, but my partner in crime couldn't wait in line, so I enjoyed solo. Next was a half cracked crab and they recommended a Dijon, Mayo, lemon, and horseradish house sauce that was amazing. Mixed right in front of me and just for me, it really brought out the flavor of the crab without being overpowering. Last, but not least, was an order of the smoked salmon with rye. It was rich, beautiful color, and sliced to order. 

All of this with a glass of mediocre Chardonnay was about $80 pre tip. They are cash only so come prepared. I wish my friend had been able to stay and dine with me, but I brought the large amount of left over to her at work. 

From the folks I talked to in line and at the counter, the wait is usually not as bad outside of the holidays. There was also a to-go line that I saw once inside that seemed much shorter. However, I had already waited for a seat and wasn't sure if the to go option offered the full menu, so I stayed put in the regular line. Overall I had a great experience and would do it again, but probably not right after Christmas when the city is packed with tourists (including myself) or try the to-go option the next time I'm back in the city. If you love seafood and can appreciate the overall experience of a place, Swan Oyster Depot is a must.
author: Helen R.

description: Be there an hour before if you can. But if you do have to wait in line you can squeeze your way in and order a drink for the wait. The staff are great, friendly and attentive. You can wait for 2 hrs and be done in 30 mins because they are so on top of your order. The seafood is about as fresh as it gets and the beer is cold, cant go wrong.
author: Jared H.

description: Yum just got take out fresh crab to go and it is fabulous. Great to have a local restaurant/market to get fresh crab and seafood as I am local. Need to go in for a meal but happy to have for local seafood pick up! Great service as well :)  I waited to pick up close to closing when they were not as busy.
author: Susan F.

description: I use to love this and had been visiting it for over 20 years.  I  made it my must every time I was in the city.  I was so sad for me to see that the popularity of Swan's has gotten so great that my visit today with over 2 hours till closing was met with a line and instructions not to wait as  they would not  be able to serve me.  The people at the end of the line had already been waiting 40 minutes.  I am happy for Swans they deserve all the success but for me I am sad to find out that one of my favorite places has become so unavailable
author: Luis E.

description:
The Swan oyster depot is a nice experience for a one-time visit. The sea food was fresh, and the service was friendly and fast. The history of hE restaurant itself provides a great story to go along with the meal. Ask any of the employees, and they'll tell you the story of the restaurant. 

The wait is extremely long. I got to the restaurant 30 minutes after it opened, and it took 2.5 hours to get seated. I'm most of the novelty is in the experience of being at a sea food counter and being served by generations of employees who have been there forever. 

Go if you get the chance. It's more on the expensive side $40 per person). Not particularly the ambiance I go for, but it's fun for a one time thing.
author: Jonah R.

description: This is a wonderful legendary seafood place to fall in love with.  The Crab and shrimp salad with thousand island dressing- wow!  They have more off the menu then they have on the menu.  So many varieties of seafood and shell fish. Served so simply yet delicious!  Fantastic
author: R B.

description: This is probably my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Every minute in line is worth the freshness of the seafood, the friendliness of the staff and shear moment of eating somewhere without pretension. The crab back is a must!
author: Rachel T.

description: Really great, simple and fresh seafood. I come here for the food and the experience. There's something about sitting at a cramped seafood bar with brash, take no shit staff that makes my food taste even better. I prefer the raw seafood items and I also get the crab back for bread dipping. I was surprised it was served cold the first time but it's so delicious I really don't care.
author: Jacqueline S.

description: Fun atmosphere but the place didn't live up to the hype or justify the lineup.  Tried an off menu sashimi dish which was just ok.  Oysters were fresh.
author: Alan C.

description:
Why the 2 stars...........

I'm going to keep this short and sweet as you get what Swan Oysters is about after reading a couple of reviews.  

If you love seafood, yes, this is the place to go but be forewarned.........My partner and I got food poisoning  after eating there.  I thought I would be able to handle the way they run their restaurant but I guess my stomach couldn't take it.  Being Asian and eaten at many dirty Asian restaurants I thought I could stomach it.  Asian restaurants cook their food in hot woks so it kills the bacteria, but here at Swan Oyster it's handling of raw food.  It is unsanitary how they run the place.  

The employees multi-task, between being your cashier, your waiter and the bus boy!
I watched them collect money, handle the food with their bare hands, clear the tables of dirty dishes and then use a dirty rag to clean the tables.  And there was no hand washing between all of that.  

And leading to the bathroom is an eyesore!  Unsanitary! 

FYI - Cash Only

Need I say more?
author: H L.

description:
When you hear about a good place and you pass by that place almost every day and consistently see a long line out the door...I don't know about you, but I had to check it out!

The place is very cozy to say the least but it has a lot of character with personable staff, photographs of the history of SOD and the people who run it along with illustrations, posters, and signs of various sea food and their available orders. I had lunch and was able to try the smoked salmon dish, shrimp cocktail, and raw oysters. 

Smoked Salmon - Yummy, but not the juiciness I was looking for. 
Shrimp Cocktail - Good, very fresh and succulent shrimp. I'm not the biggest fan of cocktails though. 
Oysters - Fresh with a good brine. 

Overall, not madly impressed with my order but the quality of the food is there. I need to come back to try their uni and their sashimi!
author: Sofia R.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here 15 minutes before Swan Oyster Depot was to open on Saturday morning hoping there wouldn't be a long wait. Yeah right, we ended up waiting 45 minutes outside before we were finally seated. I of course throughly yelp stalked the restaurant before and knew exactly what to order. 

However, we sat there for an awkward 10 minutes before someone finally took our order. We came here wanting live sea urchin and crab fat. THEY DIDN'T HAVE EITHER THAT DAY. I felt like we waited for nothing. Nevertheless, we decided to just order 2 bowls of clam chowder and a crab salad w/ louie dressing. The clam chowder was sub-par and wasn't as thick as I normally like my clam chowder. However, it is nice that they provide as many oyster crackers as you want. The crab salad was absolutely delicious. There was more than enough crab meat and the salad dressing was so tasty. Like everyone else, I absolutely recommend the salad here. 

Overall, I'm disappointed that we didn't get the 2 things we wanted from this restaurant. Hopefully, next time I come back they will actually have them and I can give this restaurant a better rating.
author: Melanie H.

description: What a disappointment. We were persuaded here by all the publicity this place has been getting from TV. ... wow nothing can be further from the truth... let's see you wait about 1 hour in line (not bad for us since our favorite Ramen) place back home can be 45 minutes wait. My firs clue should have been the not so fresh looking sea food display on the window and then seeing the cooks using that food as they served. Once we sat down we order the clam chowder....the worst chowder I ever had, the cream had curdled and was not tasty at all like when milk goes sour. We figured ok we even have bad cooking days.....so we tried the sea food cocktail mixed and oh my lord it was so fishy strong that we couldn't even eat half of it...... it does not scream fresh. We have rated sea food all over Mexico and this place is not worth the wait, the money or the famed people give it.
author: Hilda G.

description:
Truly, remarkable. A must stop on a trip to San Fran. Go here at an off time if you want to get a seat at the bar.

They do seafood right here, with a focus on oysters. A bottle of wine, oysters, crab, really this place is seafood heaven.

It's no frills entirely. So don't expect a server and a table. Instead, think of it like going to your neighbourhood bar, but for seafood.
author: Imran N.

description: I was lucky to only wait 10 minutes for a seat! This place is justifiably popular. Cash only, old-world SF atmosphere, and fantastic dishes. Started off a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and a small order of the off-menu sashimi, which was positively buttery. Next was a Combination Cocktail, which included a huge variety of seafood. Finally, I got a bowl of Clam Chowder (my least favorite dish of the meal) and a half-dozen clams of various kinds. I would definitely come back here, and better yet, bring friends who were new to SF!
author: Aviah M.

description: Grab a seat at the counter for almost any type of fresh seafood that your stomach desires. The sashimi plate is extremely simple and fresh. Along with the fresh bread, you'll be savoring every last bite and all of the olive oil. Cash only!
author: Julia K.

description:
Overall:  4.27 / 5
---------------

Food - 3.83/5
1) Crab Back - 4/5
2) Mixed Oysters - 4.5/5
3) Clam Chowder - 3/5

Service - 5/5

Cleanliness - 3.5/5

Location - 4/5

Experience - 5/5

------------------
Wait time:  30 mins (morning, weekday)
- was one of the first people there, the line gets really long
author: John V.

description:
The only reason I give this place a two star over a 1 is because some of the workers there were really friendly.

They ran out of crab when we went, yet they failed to announce that before we had already waited half an hour in line. It was the only thing I was looking forward to eating so that was pretty upsetting to me.

Also, one of the girls was wearing nail polish and cutting sashimi without gloves on which I know is a big no-no in other restaurants. I'm not sure if this actually poses health risks but I definitely question the cleanliness of this place.
author: Lin R.

description:
Just confirming everyone's raves about Swan Oyster Depot.  

The previous night we ate at a certain restaurant that provided provisions and has a bird from our state in its name. Our stop at Swan Oyster Depot was what we talked about over and over this week, not the other place.

We're regulars at Hog Island (even buying oysters to shuck at home) and love seafood. That said, This Place is SPECIAL. Got here at about 10:15 Saturday morning and waited about 50 min. Missed first seating by a bit so get here on the weekends around 10. Went to Bob's doughnuts while my wife waited for a snack.

Once inside its warm, inviting and you instantly feel it's history. Everyone is smiling and having a good time, staff are warm and friendly. We were greeted by Tom the owner and he took his time to welcome us, explain everything and made us feel at home. We look like little 20 year old Asian kids (we're actually 34) so even at Michelin Star restaurants service can be hit or miss.   This place was spot on, felt like I was in grandma's kitchen... except better food.

Dozen oysters are sweet and fresh, even the larger oysters to our great surpise. Make sure to try the house made Thai chilli mignonette, awesome. Sicilian sashimi plate was amazing, the olive oil brings out so much flavor. Shrimp cocktail filling. Didn't try smoked salmon but I wish we did after sitting in front it. No crab back or uni today so we'll have to come back.  Don't need to say much about the food since everyone else confirms it.

Absolutely a must visit in SF.
author: Bo C.

description:
I've been wanting to come to this place for quite sometime but never had to the opportunity to go until recently. Came across this place by watching Anthony Bourdain's show. My mom and I were the first ones in line when we arrived! I didn't expect that to happen since I've always heard that they have long lines and the wait can be up to a few hours.  (Side note: if you don't want to dine in or just don't want to wait in line you could just order Togo and get your meal quicker.)  
My mom and I were seated and we quickly ordered the must haves: Clam chowder, combination seafood salad, cherrystone clams, oysters, and the infamous Italian sashimi. All of that was enough to feed the both of us. 
The clam chowder was more soupy than thick and creamy which was ok. It did have a lot of clams which I liked and they had a bowl of oyster crackers and fresh bread for your leisure . The combo salad was humungous and they put a generous portion of various seafood. The house made 1000 island dressing doesn't disappoint either. Now if you are a sashimi lover than I suggest you order the Italian version. Fresh tuna, scallops, yellowtail, and salmon topped with shallots and capers then drizzled with EV olive oil and freshly cracked black pepper. Squeeze some lemon on that and maybe a splash of Tabasco and your taste buds are in heaven. 
Overall my mom and I enjoyed this place and want to come back again. You can't beat fresh seafood and this place takes pride in that. Love the old school feel and that it's family owned. 

I knocked one star for hand hygiene... these guys must be really old school for not using gloves. Not a huge fan of touching money then touching food. But then again these people still have lines out the door...
author: Maggie R.

description: My absolute favorite restaurant in San Fransisco! Everything is amazing well worth the wait in line.
author: Paul M.

description: Oysters here at bomb had two different kinds. Not fishy watery tasting as some oysters from the farm can be. The cocktail sauce with horseradish and Lemon on top...heaven. The finish seating pretty early so if they cans sit you, you can always take a plate to go. Staff super friendly and accommodating.
author: Linda H.

description:
Amazing!!

I'm always baffled by how people can give Swan Oyster Depot anything less than 5 stars, I've always had a great experience here.
