While eating at the counter is the best , today's (9/30) great weather made it a the perfect day for a picnic so we decided to call in our order for takeout. Usually they finish prepping your items as you walk in or you wait a couple minutes which is fine with me &&  I'm always given a snack while I wait for my items , from shrimp with sauce to some smoked salmon  I appreciate their kindness while I wait.

We ordered :
2 Combo Salads w/ Louie dressing
Clam Chowder w/ Bread & Butter
2 Shrimp Cocktail 
1 Crab Cocktail &
1 Combo Cocktail

The salads as always were delicious , my favorite thing about them besides the fresh seafood on it is the face that they use shredded lettuce. I ordered it with some Louie dressing and it made the salad perfect. 

The clam chowder was delicious while I love clam chowder to be on the thicker side the abundance of clams and the fresh flavor definitely makes up for that.  I added the bread and butter and it was a perfect addition to my warm soup.

The shrimp cocktails & combo cocktail were top notch with a squeeze of lemon and some cocktail sauce. By far the shrimp cocktail is one of my favorite items on the whole menu.

My love for crab is infinite which is why I love Swan Oyster Depot and the fresh crab they use for their cocktail. I had it with a little cocktail sauce and a dash of louie dressing , so delicious.

I definitely recommend picking up some food from Swan Oyster Depot and heading over to Precita park for a nice picnic.
author: Glenda A.

description:
Swans was on my bucket list so I just had to go. Arrived pretty much at opening to find a line already. Get there at or before 10 to be first in line.

It's an old fashioned diner set up with stools down a long counter. If you sit at the end, where I did, you get a show of the server preparing their most ordered dish, sashimi platter.  I passed on that to enjoy my crab cocktail and Bluepoint oysters.

It's an interesting paradox that the line outside is so long yet there is no rush to turn the table, eh seat. You can relax and savor your seafood.  This is honest, homestyle food, not fancy.  

The oysters were good but the mignonette sauce was weak, and I'm not sure what the curry flavored sauce was for.  Not a good compliment to the oysters. 

All in all it was an expensive meal (tabs easily run $50-100 cash only) that didn't quite cut it.
author: Dina L.

description:
Hmm.. I think I went into this with too high of an expectation. 

My friends and I waited ~45 minutes for a seat here (5 people --- but we split up, 2 and 3 around 2pm on a Friday). The line is long, and it moves SLOW. The seating is limited with maybe ~20 seats along a counter. 

My bf and I shared a small sashimi plate, kumamoto oysters, and a crab cocktail. The quality of the seafood here is undeniable --- fresh and delicious. 

Kumamoto oysters - sweet, plump, fresh. Coupled with just a splash of lemon, or their vinaigrette if you'd like. I think it was like $16? $18? for half a dozen. 

Crab cocktail - we had the cocktail sauce on the size, so basically, we got a glass full of chunks of crab meat. DELICIOUS. A huge chunk of claw meat, just lots of fresh, pure, sweet, crab meat. 

Sashimi plate (smaller one) - had some tuna, salmon, and.....one other I'm not sure. It's served on a layer of delicious olive oil. Now this is preference, BUT, my bf and I both didn't like this dish. The fish was fresh, but nothing extraordinary or unique from your average slices of sashimi at a sushi restaurant. We found the olive oil to be overpowering and didn't like the fish flavored with it. This small plate of sashimi was ~$24. I'd rather have sashimi at a sushi restaurant, personally. 

The service was okay, we didn't receive that superb service others mentioned. We had this young guy who kinda skipped over us mostly, but when 2 girls sat down next to us, he actually gave them attention and made conversation with them. Go figure. CASH ONLY, which was annoying. When a $5 bowl of something is cash only, I understand. When expensive dishes are cash only, I'm just annoyed. 

So basically, for me, this place was an overpriced, inconvenient (cash only.....), overhyped place. Though the quality of food is undeniably great, you can find comparable stuff elsewhere. For those of you that love it, that's 5 less people who will return and take up space in line!
author: Lisa N.

description:
Ah. The quintessential oyster depot on every food snob and San Franciscan food list. The people of San Francisco seem to love standing queues, and this place is no exception. Due to its unparalleled history, Swan Oyster Depot is a seafood mecca for both outsiders and residents. Being featured by the self righteous Anthony Bourdain himself also inflates this establishment's allure and ego.

Situated in a very small space on Polk Street, there's always a noticeable line forming outside the door. To avoid this, my partner and I called ahead and ordered take out. We were directed that it would be a "few minutes", so we leisurely made our way to Swan Oyster. In order to ensure proper sampling of the menu, we ordered a sashimi platter, crab backs, clam chowder, and crab cocktail. After arriving at Swan Oyster, a "few minutes" turned into quite the ordeal, as they seemed to openly and unapologetically neglect our order. The staff here work at a fairly leisurely pace, as they are an established restaurant who seem to be above the concept of hospitality. We observed the zombielike queue-ers with pity, as the line outside moved at a snail's pace. The people within the restaurant, ate at an intentionally slow speed - to validate their time spent waiting, and to reassure themselves that the meal had been worth it. 

After quite the wait, we finally received our take out and anxiously headed home to check out the spread. After unwrapping all the food, the sashimi platter was noticeably a small size rather than the medium that was ordered (nobody wants to pay $24 for a tiny portion of fish). All in all, the food was unimpressive and underwhelming. While the crab was rather fresh, it lacked that succulent sweetness that I expect when I bite into a crab leg. The cocktail sauce, which typically defines crab cocktails, was lackluster and tasted more like ketchup than anything else. The crab backs and bread were one of the highlights of the meal, as the clam chowder wasn't a singular soup experience. This isn't a place that I would return to, as the queue is already very deterring, and the food didn't inspire. The service had a vintage and old time feel - but sadly, not the old time hospitality.
author: Yuyu S.

description:
I had a really great time at Swan Oyster Depot, but with the full disclosure that I had a full bottle of champagne at 10:30 in the morning when they opened. Don't judge me- I was on vacation.

We lined up around 10:00am on a Tuesday and the line was manageable; we were the third group in line and there were probably a few groups behind us when the place opened. I popped down the street to get some coffee and that made the wait tolerable and me into some sort of a human.

We ordered oysters, the Sicilian carpaccio, split a bowl of clam chowder, the sea urchin and the aforementioned bottle of bubbly. The seafood was excellent and super fresh, still quivering, etc etc etc. Sadly, they were out of crabs that day as I had big plans to dunk my face into one of the crab backs.

What I really love about this place is the DGAF attitude. We were sitting there sipping away our wine and they told us to relax, kick back and take our time, despite the line that was now around the back. They let us order in rounds and when they cracked open our uni they charged us half price because there was not a huge amount of roe. For an old school establishment known for surly service, everyone seemed pretty committed to ensuring we had a good time.
author: Angela C.

description:
Three stars for the food, minus a star for the experience that left a bad taste in my mouth.

BEWARE IF YOU GO FOR DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON

It's prime Dungeness crab season, so we decided to check out this place for their crab. Both the couple in front and behind us were here for the same thing. After we, and everyone around us had waited an hour and 45 min, they waited until our group was basically in front of the door to tell us they were out of crab. Considering most people were there just for the crab, it would be a decent thing to warn the middle of the line that they are close to running out, rather than waiting until the very second that they ran out, so people could make a decision whether or not they want to stay...

The food itself was fine. It was definitely not worth the two hours we ended up waiting. If you do go, the only thing I'd recommend is ordering the seafood combination salad (the seafood is fresh and the Louie sauce is pretty good) and don't bother staying if the line goes up to the sofa store next door (about an hour wait from that point)
author: Kay L.

description: What a waste of a day. First, we waited for almost two hours because I was dying to try the crab back, and by the time we sat down they were out. No cooked crab or crab back. So I can't attest to what those would have tasted like, but I can tell you we ordered like 5 other things and none of them were anything above average. We could have had better seafood at fishermans wharf. I also feel like if you run out of such a popular item and you have a two hour line outside, the decent thing to do is put up a sign or make an announcement that you're out. At any rate, this place is mediocre at best. I definitely won't go back and wouldn't recommend it. My guess is Anthony Bourdain loves it because it's familiar and cozy and he doesn't have to wait for it.
author: S S.

description: Came here with two friends on a week day around 3pm and there was a slight wait, but I've heard that the line can get ridiculous during the weekend. The seafood here is incredibly fresh and I would definitely come visit again the next time I'm in the city. We ordered a seafood salad (really fresh, but could have gone without), Sicilian sashimi (get this!!!), and the scallop sashimi (get this!!!!). Keep in mind that the people who work here aren't professional sushi chefs so the fish isn't cut super pretty, but they're definitely cleaned and deboned properly. It's also a fish market as well, so it's not a super fancy place. Absolute favorite was the scallop sashimi and I'd order this again. Cash only spot so be sure to bring enough cash! Definitely a great spot to visit if you're with a friend or two who aren't afraid of waits and love seafood.
author: Adriane L.

description: Went here on a rainy Monday morning and it was already packed so make sure you go early on weekdays. Loved the crab back. They don't have a good wine list though. When we asked for the bill the guy did his calculation manually so you kinda have to trust that he's good at maths.
author: Trammi N.

description:
This place has very short business hours, which makes it difficult to visit, but luckily I came on a Friday morning. We stood in line at 10am (opens at 10:30a) and there was a shortish line. This place only seats 20 people and we were number 21 and 22. By 11 we got seated with very friendly staff. Their menu is very confusing because it is all on their wall made with posters. There are a couple things that I only know of through Yelp that they didn't have on their menu. So it was a bit confusing as to what is actually on the menu and pricing. Breakdown of my order:

1. Crab back $6 - delicious especially when you dip in the fat with the sour dough bread. I only wish that it was served warm or even better hot. 
2. Sicilian sashimi $32- not displayed on their wall but found out about it on Yelp. This was a huge plate is various sashimi (the scallop was the best) drenched in the best olive oil with capers and red onions. It was absolutely delicious and can definitely be shared with another person. What we didn't know till afterwards was that there was a smaller plate option for this which I wished I knew.
3. Half dozen Kumamoto oysters $18-  fresh meaty oysters

One thing that did bother me is that everyone handling all the fish are using their bare hands and I didn't see them washing their hands between each order so that creeped me out a little.
author: Jami K.

description:
Finally!!! I made it! Was walking down the street, not even planning to have an early lunch or anything but then I saw this place with NOOOO line outside, of course I walked it. I mean, who am I to ignore the fact that there's no line outside this place! So, I thought it's one of the signs your life/destiny/universe/Shiva sending to you once in a lifetime. So I walked it. 
They take only cash, in case if there's anyone who doesn't know it yet, lucky me, I knew. ))
So I god half dozen of daily catch oysters. Delicious! They all taste fresh, juicy, meaty, sweet, just like eating hugs and clouds. Then of course fresh sea urchin. Super fresh, they just got them when I walked in. Yummies! So good! 
Btw, their spicy Thai sauce is bomb! So garlicky, slightly spicy, sweet and savory! Must try! 
Then I got small plate of Sicilian sashimi, yes yes, I ate all of that, and I REGRET NOTHING! Sashimi was good, fresh, just like everything they have. 
The only thing I didn't like, when I asked for the check, guy asked me what I ordered and then said 60+. I mean ok, I get it, it's all fresh and seafood is usually expensive. But why I'm laying same as guy who had almost twice as much?! Hmmm idk maybe I'll go next time and ask for actual check to see why am I paying so much. Cause I didn't see any paper at all
Anyways, food is great, so you decide, if it worth strange checks with prices from the skies or not
author: Asiyat T.

description:
" Yeah. I met this lawyer, we went out to dinner, I had the lobster bisque, we went back to my place, yada yada yada, I never heard from him again."
Elaine, Seinfeld

Good stuff... not buckle your knees, earth shattering, but good.  The off-menu sashimi was my favorite:  sea bass, ahi & scallops were excellent. NO Uni : (  Chowda was Briney, clammy, goodness, bottomless oyster crackers for your bowl is appreciated - doubles as a snack between dishes. Note: PLEASE, use the serving spoon, person next to me dived right in there up to his elbows almost when he got his beer. EEEWWW!! I timed a grab of crackers so he'd see me use the spoon (no I didn't eat them, I had to grab from the bowl next to Kai), and he followed suit, no embarrassing confrontation needed.  

Crab & Combo salads, a crab back,  2 Stella's & a Smoked Salmon plate rounded out the meal... I tossed about half my crab meat into the fatty crab back and went to town (wish it was hot!).  The girls enjoyed their plates as well... a bit pricey, $138 is not crazy for lunch.  I expected more from the Louie salads, not as generous w/ the seafood - $27  for the crab salad & maybe there was 1/2 a crab there, Carla's Combo salad had mostly little bay shrimp, w/ 4 prawns and some crab.  Smoked salmon was really good, came a  top some thin sourdough.

I'd bring out of Towner's for the experience, but I can do crab & prawns almost as good at home... the sashimi though is one to go back for and I'd like to try their Uni when it's back. If you don't wanna steam  crab yourself, this is your spot!
author: Kimo B.

description:
Yelp, SOD does not open at 10:30 am on Saturday. They open earlier!  We came before 10 (after a two hour drive here) to wait in line so we could be the first seated just to find out that the whole place was already filled. It's one thing to wait in line at an empty restaurant waiting for it to open, it's another to have to wait in line and watch people linger over their foods. What started as "It's okay, we're right at the front of the line", and "We have time to figure out what we want and ogle the fresh seafoods," ended up being "If this guy continues to just pick at his crab, I'm going to stab him in the f*ing eye with his fork. I mean eat the food or gtfo!" and "Nope. She sat back down. What a tease. I want to drag her out of here by her hair."

The sashimi is incredible. I wish we ordered 2 extra large plates. 

Everything else was delicious and super fresh but paled to the sashimi (in my opinion). 

We also had the crab bowl, shrimp bowl, bowl of clam chowder, and 6 kumomoto oysters. 

Total came to be $100 plus tip.
author: Walerz B.

description:
Love it! 

I waited 3 hours for this. lol. But totally worth it! My friends and I were visiting from Utah. We heard many good things about this place. We arrived and there were already a line. And we waited and waited and waited. 3 hours passed. lol. Once we got inside, the restaurant was small and had only one bar for about 20 people, that's why the wait was infinity. There were not menu or anything that suggested for my order. I ordered off the pic on Yelp reviews. Everything served cold except the clam chowder. We had the 2 sashimi dishes, 1 with all the fishes, and 1 with just salmon, we had combination salad, a crab fat, oysters and clams! EVERYTHING IS FRESH! SO FRESH! And i love the owner, he helped us with our orders, very friendly. This place remind me of those small town restaurant where everyone knows each other. Did i mention this restaurant is more than 100 years old? It is. 

The foods are quite pricey, but fresh seafoods so that makes sense. I will definitely come back next time i'm in town. Just hope for less wait time!
author: Noon H.

description:
More like 3.5 stars...ish.

The first time I came to visit SF, we were exploring town and randomly walked past this little joint. Saw a little line but to find out the person in front of me already had the "last call" paper. Too bad, so sad.

Finally came back to visit about two weeks ago and this was the number spot on my food itinerary. We waited probably 1.5 hours on a Thursday around 11:30am which was no big deal because I'm a pretty patient person.

Anticipating, anticipating... finally! We get seated! I knew exactly what I wanted to order and went straight for it. The guy who took care of us was friendly and I was quite impressed that he was able to remember everything we ordered on top of getting asked a few questions by other customers. 

Here is what we ordered:
-medium sashimi
-2 crab backs
-1/2 dozen mixed oysters 
-1/2 dozen mixed clams
-cup of chowder 
-Stella and anchor steam

The variety on the sashimi plate was great! You can taste the freshness and how the fish sort of melts on your mouth, but the olive oil, capers and onion didn't flavor the dish at all. Basically tasteless. So I was disappointed. 
I've always had crab backs right after being steamed so eating it cold was pretty different. I think it was the crab I got that was pretty bitter. I tried my significant otter's (haha) crab back and it was decent but salty. 
I expected a lot from the chowder.. but it was just ok.
All my stars go to the clams and oysters!! As fresh as it gets!! Along with the beer.

Was ultra stuffed by the end of our meal. Tab ended up being about $80 which I don't find it bad at all considering it being super fresh seafood.
author: Annie L.

description:
Expect at least an hour wait or longer before they open! 

The fresh seafood awaits ! This is a must try! It was worth the wait!

We ordered a dozen of mix oysters & I cannot remember of the names but it was all very good. We got a bowl of clam chowder which was tasty and creamy w/ potatoes but I didn't see any clams. The crab salad was so fresh and crisp, the dressing was on the side but it's a must order. The sashimi was a mix of salmon, ahi tuna, hamachi & scallops over like a olive oil, onions and capers.

The only thing i really wanted to try was out of season so maybe again in October !
author: Winnie L.

description: Fresh and delicious! Even I spent 1.5 hours to wait in line, it was deserved! Giant clams and little neck clams are very good! If you order a cocktail prawn, I would suggest you show pictures from yelp, then it's easier to get what you want. I got a cocktail prawn, it was different from the picture I saw on yelp. Probably I ordered in a incorrect wa. LOL
author: Lao P.

description: The seafood was really fresh! The sea urchins was still moving when it was served. It was so sweet and buttery. No sauce needed! We got there at 10:30 and waited about 1 hour and 10 but It was worth it. Just do not go there when you are hungry. Folks who passed by mention that the normal wait time is about 2 hours.
author: May L.

description: Brought baby cousin from NYC here once and this is one of her only request when coming back to visit. Everything is so fresh, the environment friendly. Not sure when they officially put the crab back on the menu wall, but it was great trying hhat along with having many of the usual faves. Kumamotos, crab salad, clam chowder, clams, crab backs. So good!
author: Tina S.

description:
Idk, is this place needs another review but here are my thoughts. Great place, usually there is a line out the door. They have great fresh seafood selection, be aware, most of it is raw, there are few smoked items. They servers are ok, I feel they could be more pleasant & friendly.
Just remember, cash only & it's not cheap..
author: Mark Z.

description:
Came here with my friends for breakfast on Saturday. We knew beforehand that there are only a few seats available, so we arrived 30 minutes before it opened, and there was already a line forming. We waited over an hour, and finally got seated (though some of us had to stand).

We ordered a few things to share:
- Oysters on the shell: fresh, but taste was mediocre
- Seafood salad: basically lettuce, dressing, and a bits of cooked seafood (shrimps, crab meat); dressing was superb, but it was pretty expensive given what it was
- Smoked salmon: amazing - melts right in your mouth
- Sashimi: very fresh fish (salmon and tuna were great)
- Calamari salad: squid was tasty, small portion.

Great place to try, if you love fresh seafood and willing to either get their really early, or wait in a long line.
author: Alvin W.

description:
I had high expectations for this place, especially after an almost 1 hour wait, but after all that, it not only met all of my expectations but definitely exceeded them in  every way.

The food here was absolutely delicious, but probably more importantly the service was impeccable. I was extremely satisfied with everything about the service, almost to the point that I forgot that I had waited in a line for an hour to eat here. Service like this, both friendly and knowledgeable, is absolutely imperative to a restaurant like Swan Oyster Depot.

The food itself was all beyond amazing. From the different types of oysters offered to the half crab shell and the combination seafood cocktail, I would definitely say that you have to try everything at least once, and I don't regret anything.

Price wise, it is a little pricey for what you are getting, but these are definitely quality oysters and other seafoods, not really what you would find at a happy hour oyster bar.

Like everywhere else in the city, I think finding parking will be a little challenging, but no more than anywhere else in the city.
author: Andrew T.

description: What could I say I didn't like about this place? probably nothing other than it's cramped and you'll probably wait when you first get there. Old school spot with tons of yummy seafood. Oysters and clams right out of the ocean doesn't get anymore fresh than this. This was the first stop on my San Francisco vacation and what a great first stop. Me and my wife ordered something of everything practically. Oysters, clams, two different kinds of each. Clam chowder, and a crab salad, had to get myself two pints of the local beer on tap too, bread served on the side. Everything was very delicious didn't have 1 bad thing here, everything was so fresh you could taste the ocean in everything we ate it was awesome! Service was fast and efficient these guys have been working here forever so they get the line stretching outside moving fast. Me and my wife ate everything too that's how much we loved it. If your a foodie and love seafood go here especially if you've never been to the West coast, your going to love this place.
author: Thomas R.

description:
OMG! This place needs to care more about food handling safety. It's so dirty! I'm surprised this place never got shut down by public health inspectors. Like what many other reviewers have said, they scoop the food with their bare hands, and handling cash without washing their hands. I even saw one of the waiters sneeze into his hands and didn't use soap to wash his hands. 

I gave it two stars because I like their concept ideas. I like how it has an old school feel to it and character but at the same time it's time for some remodeling. I like how they make their sashimi plate like an Italian style using olive oil, chopped onions and capers. The oysters were pretty good. The clam chowder was alright. 

I think they had overcharged me but correct me if I'm wrong. 

We ordered:
Sashimi plate -$18
Clam chowder cup -2.75
Clam chowder bowl- 5
Coke-2.50
Half dozen oysters- 15
Bread and butter - 1
Total:44.25

We we're charged: 59.65 WTF  $15 OVER
Please note we never got a receipt to look over before paying they just tell you how much you're supposed to pay.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Fanomonal take out. Arrived at 1015. Waited just a couple minutes. Total lucked out.

Asked for a salad to eat at a park. Shrimp two ways, crab two ways, lettuce and lemons with sourdough bread and dressing. Carefully wrapped goodness. 

A bit expensive but totally worth the splurge.
author: Ian S.

description:
The food here is fresh, of course. Got there around 945 on a Monday and was able to get in the first seating at 1030 opening. The menu is scattered on the wall, which is a bit annoying. I could not find clear pricing on market price for oysters and clams. I wish they had a combo platter priced for a mix of oysters and clams on the half shell. The bread could be better if served warm. The crab back would have been especially better if served warm. I guess all their food is served cold and fresh partly to keep the line moving and get guests seated. I ordered two crab backs (one to go to warm at home), 3 little neck clams, 3 other kind of clams, 2 oysters from BC, 2 oysters from WA, bread/butter, and a glass of Chardonnay for $50 after tax. 

Overall, this place is a bit overhyped. The seafood salads looked very good and appropriately sized for their price. The food is very fresh so there's that. One of the older gentlemen working there had some pretty poor service. He didn't offer us starting silverware, or ask us if we have any questions about the menu, or tell us anything at all. Literally all the other servers were helpful to the others, and thankfully approached us as well (multiple can serve you as long as you don't have something being prepared already). 3.5 stars.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/eI0DpD2Xx8hFlk7eAdFCqQ?select=WUND61yJIvepfKKEJk6Jgw&utm_source=ishare
author: Anton S.

description: The salmon and tuna sashimi is good, the oyster is ok. The clam chowder is very fresh. The line is too long, waited for about an hour and 10 minutes for it.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: Awesome as always with the freshest and friendliest people. Always stop in for a bite to eat.
author: Brad B.

description:
First stop on my trip to sf! Arrived at around 9 and there was already a small line. They were doing a photo shoot in there so they ended up letting people in at around 10! Yay! The place is super small and you sit at a counter. The guys and girls behind the counter are all really cool and you can ask any of them for your food. They try to send things one at a time to make more space. 
We started with a clam chowder. It was really good. There was so much clam flavor and the soup reminded me of a broken clam chowder because it wasn't thick at all. But still, it was super delicious.
Then we ordered half dozen cherry stone clams. Those were by far the best thing I had here. I really like anything with geoduck texture so to me it was like heaven. They came on the half shell already separated so you can just slurp it up. 
Next we got fresh uni. The texture was wow. Way different than just buying the ones in the market and it comes in the shell. We asked if we could take the shell home and they washed and bagged it for us. 
Then we got the sashimi plate, which isn't on the menu but everyone gets it there. It comes with capers, red onions, and olive oil. I could've done without all the side stuff but the fish was so fresh. It's an assortment of salmon, tuna, yellowtail, scallop, and....I forgot the last one. 
We also got half a crab. That was also good. 
They give u lemon water to wash your hands in after. 
This place is super awesome and everything is really good. Will come back once a year looks like!
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
We came here on our mission to follow Anthony Bourdain everywhere he goes. This place normally has line all the way to the end of the block, but luckily we went on a rainy morning 30 minutes after they opened and were first in line after the first batch of customers had been seated. Waited for about 50 minutes.

We are a party of two but ordered the hell of out this small place. In brief, if you're a savvy seafood eater, then this place is just alright. The seafood is fresh but lacks the natural sweetness that I can find in seafood in Asia. No fancy cooking methods. Mostly just the quality that makes the taste.

Uni: huge! Super fresh but lacks the creaminess that smaller uni has. 4/5.

Crab fat: looks delicious but tastes very meh. Where is the crab roe where is fatty taste? *crying* 2/5

Smoked salmon: the highlight of the meal! So so so delicious. Must try! 5/5

Louie Salad: just another salad, but topped with yummy shrimp and huge chunks of crabs. Louie dressing is bomb though! 4/5

Oysters: My first impression when eating oysters is about how clean they are, and this place cleaned their oysters well. Fresh and creamy as the way I like it. 5/5.

Crab cocktails: fresh crabs. Huge chunks. I mean, what else can I say? It's the feature of this restaurant: fresh, and huge portion.

I had a good experience but would not come back. Most people (including us) take our time when we eat, and plus the place is so tiny so wait time is just not worth it.
author: Mandy D.

description:
Ah, the legendary oyster restaurant in San Francisco (opened since 1912).

Came here around 3 PM and our group still had to wait about 75 minutes in line. Swan Oyster Depot stops accepting dine-in customers around 4:45 PM, but you can still get take-out orders. 

Salmon sashimi with olive oil ($16): Not on the menu. Other than somewhat thick cut, EACH sashimi order was freshly prepared (our server basically took out a giant fish and began to slice each piece). It was one of the freshest and most tender sashimi I've had ... the overall fish quality surpassed most (but not all) of Japanese sushi restaurants that I've tried so far.

Combination salad (prawns, shrimp, and crab - $21): The louie salad dressing tasted like a weaker version of the In-N-Out spread. Fresh seafood, but $21 was a bit too much.

Half a dozen oysters (Miyagi, Blue Point, Kumamotos - $15): I liked Kumamotos the best. They were really good!

5-stars on their fresh seafood, but I will have to take one star away due to their expensive price tags and extremely long (and slow moving) waiting line.

P.S. - Yeah some servers probably didn't wash their hands after handling the money, but I wouldn't still be writing this positive review if something happens to me right?
author: Luke L.

description: Freshest seafood ever!!!  A long wait but well worth it; have a beer or glass of wine while you wait.  The service is excellent every time!
author: Amanda M.

description:
Nothing about the service nor the food of this place is anything to rave about. God I can't believe this place hasn't been shut down by the Public Health Department. Eating off of a public restroom floor would be cleaner than eating at this establishment.

We waited 30 minutes in the rain and finally got seated at the very back of the restaurant. Afterwards we proceeded to wait another 15 minutes before anyone else even acknowledged us to take our order or give us water. When we were finally able to flag someone down to take our order we were met with a very rude demeanor from an older server when we politely declined the bread and he raised is eyebrows saying "oh really?". I came here to eat seafood not bread. *facepalm*

I ended up getting the large combo Sicilian sashimi plate and was throughly disappointed. There's no standard cut size or anything at this restaurant. They literally cut however much they feel like it and plate it tossing the plate on the counter. The party next to us order the same dish but got twice as much fish as we did!  A kindergartener with a play set kitchen knife could probably do a better job than these guys. Disappointed, I asked for the check being met with a "oh that's it?" from the same server and ended up having to wait another 20 minutes for my check.

While waiting, I noticed the servers/chefs using their hands to touch everything from the phone to the fish, bread, glasses, utensils, etc without washing their hands. So the same hand that just touched raw fish would be used to touch the money/credit cards, utensils, food, etc without any sanitation in-between. The bottom of the barrel for me was when one of them grabbed a scallop that fell on the floor and put it back in the case! It's one thing not to wash your hands but don't place raw fish that you've dropped on the floor back into the display case. Makes you wonder if the staff here even washes their hands after using the restroom.

Fresh seafood or not, this place lacks the health practices to serve anything nonetheless raw fish. This is the first and last time I will eating at this establishment.
author: Chris V.

description:
I don't do many reviews but when I do, it speaks volumes..

Came here with a friend and ordered: 
Uni was the only thing memorable. $18 
Chowder tasted like crap. $2.75
Sashimi was bland. $24 for 'Medium'
Little necks were good $14 for half dozen. 
Oysters were good but still ain't worth over an hour for. 3 different kinds of oysters, half dozen for $15
* They were out of cherry stone clams.... 

Service was terrible. This young dude was pretty rude. Minus another star!

I am a foodie and I like trying places that's hyped but it's NOT worth waiting over an hour for..
#SKIP 

Total was about $88.50
author: Luwina Z.

description:
I visit SWAN first time in 2007 Oct.
It's very good seafood restaurant.
I visit every year from Japan.
I want ti visit again to much!!
Few people make line anytime.
You can buy any food easy and soon for take-out.
I ate convination salada and cocktail sause I can enjoy two taste.
You must order clam chowder before last order!
author: Vail V.

description: I already started eating but this is the crab cocktail, for take-out, $16. It's delicious & awesome just like all the reviews. The take-out line is to the left and the sit-down line to the right. I came on a Saturday a little before noon & gave up on the sit-down line after waiting for an hour... joined the take-out line and there was one person ahead of me.
author: Dee C.

description: Excellent service, the sea urchin is over priced $28 for a tiny 5 pieces, oyster is very fresh
author: Sisi F.

description: So I ordered sea urchin, a small plate with 2 clams + 2 oysters, and a small order of sashimi (6 fish, 1 piece each). They taste good although the best sea urchin I had was still the one I had in Tokyo. The total came out of $68 before tips. That's little surprise to me unless they calculated it wrong.. I'm not sure I will come back again..
author: J C.

description: Yeah, you can't mess up raw oysters, but everything else is "meh" and slightly overpriced.  The chowder is terrible - it's watery and barely has any taste.  I couldn't finish it.  Not worth the wait in line - go to Leo's.
author: Allie G.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying this place since there's always a line in front starting around 430pm everyday. 

This place was a solid disappointment. We were there after lunch hours to avoid the crowd. Had the clam chowder and a crab salad. The clam chowder had been boiling way too long, as the cream broke and was overly salty. The crab salad was bland. While there was quite a decent amount of crab meat, it wasn't sweet at all. Considering that it was $29 for the salad, it wasn't worth it. 

What really ruined the experience was the portion of the counter we ate at had no leg space and there was a sliced up smoke salmon right in front of me with the flap of skin and salmon scraps all over the place. It looked like a half chomped up salmon eaten by a bear that you see on the streets of Alaska. Moreover the cleanliness of this place was the least desirable. I can't understand why the lines in front of this place. Oh well...
author: Peter T.

description:
This place is not only my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, it is one of my favorite restaurants period! 

Swan Oyster Depot is located around Nob Hill and is set up as an old school establishment. Everything is old school from the layout, the bar/seating area, to the old school cashier machine. Make sure to bring cash because they don't take credit cards, debit cards, or apple pay (hence the old school cashier machine). 

This place is truly heaven for those of you who enjoy fresh seafood. They have everything from fresh cherry stone clams, fresh oysters, fresh uni (which they break open in front of you), delicious crab fat, to clam chowder. 

NOTE: drenching the bread in the delicious crab fat = heaven.

I could literally eat here all day if I could!

Make sure to come early if you want to avoid the long lines, otherwise expect to wait at least an hour or so during peak hours. This is due to very limited seating inside. 

I also read that Anthony Bourdain comes here every time he visits San Francisco, which is pretty cool to know.

To sum things up, this place is fresh seafood prepared at its finest. End of story.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Pros: 
Awesome old timey vibe.
Fresh seafood.
Very friendly servers.

Cons: 
Stools are super uncomfortable to sit on. 
Waiting and waiting. 

The clam chowder had good flavor, however, it was "broken" (the dairy separated into little chunks) I would skip this next time. 

The combination salad with prawns, baby shrimp, and crab was tasty. How can you go wrong with fresh seafood, lettuce, and a delicious Louie dressing? Simple, but good because of the quality seafood. The prawns were especially delicious! Next time I would get a prawn cocktail and the sashimi plate.  

I recommended giving it a try if there isn't a line and you are especially fond of seafood and old timey atmosphere.
author: Jen B.

description:
The wait was about 45 minutes on a weekday in the rain.. once inside the staff was friendly, helpful, and all around you could tell they like their jobs there.

The Sicilian Sashimi & the Little Neck Clams were the the highlight for me. Both were quite good. 

Disappointing were the Combo Salad, and surprisingly the oysters.. Our salad had visibly less crab on it than all the other salads we saw go out, which kinda made the price a bit much for alot of lettuce. The oysters were very watery and with not much flavor this was the most surprising.. 

Overall we did have a good time and enjoyed the other dshes we had and would go back for those.
author: Raphael P.

description:
This is one of my mom's favorite spots - she would queue up in line for crab salad. For many years, I lived just a few blocks from Swan Oyster Depot but never tried it because of the daunting line. 

I went by on a Tuesday afternoon around 12:45 and found a relatively short line - only about 3 people in front of us (our party of two). We waited about 15 minutes to get a stool at the bar (there are only seats at the bar). The menu is limited - seafood cocktail (shrimp, prawn or crab), salad (same seafood options), clam chowder soup and various other items.  

We shared the crab cocktail and the prawn cocktail, and I had the clam chowder soup. Unfortunately, I didn't particularly like any of the dishes - the clam chowder was thin and oily while the seafood cocktails were okay but nothing to write home about. $60 for those three dishes seemed pricey, and I think you're better off getting seafood at a variety of other spots in SF.
author: Wendy L.

description: Live a few blocks away in Pacific Heights and come here often for a late lunch during the week when working from home. Consistently great quality and down-to-earth staff make this place great. A half dozen oysters, half dozen eggs (sliced raw scallops with a spicy dollop), and bowl of chowder make for a power lunch. Don't bother trying to dine in on weekends... you're better off skipping the line and ordering take-out.
author: Chad S.

description: Go for that crab salad, raw scallops and fresh oysters. It can definitely add up very quickly, so be prepared for a costly meal.
author: Jacqueline Y.

description: Must return next time!!   The people are friendly and the seafood is fresh!  The ambiance is intimate...small so definitely have to wait to be seated.  But it's all worth it!  The sashimi was with capers and olive oil and diced red onions.  The Boston clam chowder was sooo good.
author: tammy l.

description:
i mean, i came here thanks to Anthony Bourdain. BUT i left very satisfy because the chefs were warm and very sociable. They gave me great recommendations on the platter and the oysters.

line can be long but since i went on a weekday lunch, it was doable.
author: Jack L.

description: Insane line. I thought it was gonna be the best restaurant ever. I waited 1:30 in line. The service is good, friendly Italians. The place is small. The food is ok. You can just pay in cash and in my opinion it's a really expensive restaurant. The portions are pretty small for the price. I think you pay for the experience... I was still hungry when I left...
author: Bruna B.

description:
I feel like everyone living in SF needs to experience Swan Oyster Depot. It's truly a one-of-a-kind experience and anyone who walks on Polk Street is sure to see the half-a-block line coming out of the door.

The seafood is super fresh. I definitely recommend ordering oysters and the shrimp salad. 

Service here is great. The servers love talking and will start up conversations with everyone. You can tell it's a close knit, family run business.

Expect to wait in line for at least 30-45 minutes. Although the servers are quick to grab your order and bring you your food, there is very limited seating (~20 seats at the bar only).

This restaurant is a bit on the pricier side. I was hoping to pay less before I came, but it was worth the experience.
author: Emmy Q.

description:
Followed Anthony bourdain's footsteps, finally I got to try Swan Depot. Let's just say that I had The most fresh oysters that I have ever had! So yummy! 

I would definitely recommend this place!!! For sure!

Hmmm... But one of the server was a bit rude. Otherwise I would give this restaurant a 5 star
author: Jie C.

description: If you like seafood, this place is the Holy grail. Please make sure you come early due to the long line. But trust me, it's worth the wait.
author: Nidhin U.

description: I ordered a cracked crab for takeout, and it was fantastic. They were very friendly, and the takeout was very quick, unlike the wait times many have experienced.
author: Zachary H.

description:
We came around 2:30 on a Tuesday and grabbed the last seats at the counter. The seafood is absolutely fresh and the guys behind the counter know their stuff.

fYI they don't always have uni so call ahead if you're coming for that otherwise I loved their trout salad with this amazing dressing they use, the sashimi platter (though it's amazingly fresh it's pretty overpriced for the small amount), and the cherry stones are the largest clams I've ever had!  The anchor steam draft washes it all down perfectly! 

The raw scallops were creamy and heavenly! 

Cash only and be prepared to spend! I think everyone came in with at least a $100 bill but you won't get anything fresher!!
author: Jenny K. L.

description:
I stopped by Swan Oyster Deport during my visit in SF and the experience was phenomenal. I arrived on a Thursday around 10:20 and there were only 3 seats left but no line. Awesome!

There were a lot of seafood items but I was shooting (no pun intended) for oysters from the depot so my heart was set. I got limited information from the menu on the wall, so I asked if they could recommend some Oysters for me (a dozen) and I got six pairs of oysters for $32, plus an Anchor Steam from the tap ($7). The oysters were meaty and extremely fresh, though I wish I got the names of the oyster but I only remember Kumamoto (there were some weird names among them I was trying to look them up here - http://www.oysterguide.com/oyster-finder.)

The owner was extremely friendly and provided me all the sauces I needed to enjoy those meaty creatures.

Oysters are never cheap especially the good (and safe) ones. You really don't want to try any raw oysters from restaurants you don't know about. Love the old fashioned decor, and definitely better than most (if not all) of the joints at Fisherman's Wharf. Make sure you bring a lot of cash since they don't take credit card.
author: Kevin M.

description: Please make sure to ask for a check! The food is good but I was overcharged by $20. Considering the long wait and uncomfortable seating, the inflated prices just aren't worth it. You can have fresh seafood at $80 a person at plenty of other places around the Bay Area. I should've known when I was seated between two tourist groups, total tourist trap! Should have checked help before coming here.
author: J S.

description: My roommate and I came here the day before Thanksgiving. Apparently they don't seat the day before any holiday, so we got orders to go. They had a limited selection available that day, but we ordered a mixed dozen of oysters, crab cocktail, and clam chowder. The oysters were some of the best I've ever had. They were clean, tasty, and fresh. No grit - key. The crab cocktail was very good as well and contained a good portion of crab. I didn't like the clam chowder. It was too watery and contained too much potato. I could barely tell if there was any clam in it.
author: Annie L.

description:
The lady next to me is from Chicago, and I guess she's speaking to me because I look crazy sitting by myself at the bar ordering all this seafood and taking photographs.

She thought I was a tourist too, which didn't surprise me, because like a tourist I was snap, snap, snapping away at everything.

Bottom line: Fresh seafood at reasonable prices.

Their clam chowder was a little watery, and not as creamy as other places, but it was filled with clams and potatoes.

The sashimi platter was mangled, presentation wasn't their strong point, but hey it tasted great.

I bought the last live uni, and watched them dismantle it like a bomb. It tasted like the sea, delicious.

The mixed seafood cocktail was tangy and had a whole oyster, a good amount of fresh crab meat, and a good number of prawns in it.

The dozen oysters were yummy and sweet.

Now I know why this place is so popular.

Just be prepared to wait an hour to be seated. Though they do take to-go orders.
author: Jack R.

description: There's a wait. The prices are very high ($100 for a meal) and its entirely justified. Quality is just out of control good. The best seafood I have ever had outside of Martha Vineyard and Seattle, WA.
author: Eli B.

description: Waited online for around an hour to get in. The food is definitely fresh but I'm not sure if it lives up to the hype. We got New England clam chowder, shrimp (which is baby shrimp) and crab meat. Overall it was good but nothing extraordinary. Would definitely not wait on line for this again. If lines weren't involved would probably come back but it wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Sarah E.

description:
OH WOW! Literally the best oysters I've had in awhile. Make sure you eat the oysters without any sauce to really get the full taste of the oysters. This can also can help you differentiate the different types of oysters they give you. 

One star off because the line to get in is RIDICULOUS and the sashimi was ok ! I waited around 30 mins and the line barely moved. Eventually I skipped that line and ordered to go instead. 

I highly recommend getting a little bit of everything because you can taste the different things they have. The clam chowder is really fresh and actually taste like theres clam in there unlike many place (fisherman's wharf).

The sashimi was ok, personally not my fav just because there was so much extra sauces on it. The olive oil was too much and covered up the sweet and savory taste of the different fishes. Their fish is incredibly fresh tho!

GET THE OYSTERS!!!!!
author: Karen T.

description:
Sorry Swan Oyster Depot, you do not hit the spot for me. 

Swan Oyster Depot has been one of my bookmarks since forever. Luckily, my girlfriend and I were in the neighborhood and we saw that the line was super short so we took the opportunity to try it! 

*Note - the line was short because it was near to the closing time also it was on a weekday. Last seating/dining in is at 4:45 pm (no excuses, you will be turned away) and take out ends at 5:15 pm.

 - Clam chowder in a cup was watery and tasted extremely salty. It was like eating the ocean. I prefer my clam chowder to be dense and smooth. That's just me. 

- Dozen of oysters were fresh. Some of the oysters was a hit or miss with me. 

- Uni was decently fresh. I'm not a fan of Uni, but my girlfriend loves it! And the uni was not up to her standards. 

Cash only! Head down the block to the Chase ATM. 

I feel as if Swan Oyster Depot is overrated and a touristy restaurant. However, it is always good to go try the place at least once. And once is enough for me.
author: Kathleen U.

description: The waiting was a pain but it was worthy. I will definitely go back for the combination salad and great service.
author: Elle H.

description:
I gave it this rating, although it deserves a five. I wanted to catch peoples' notice that there is a filthy drunk man who harasses you relentlessly while you wait in line for 45 minutes to an hour. He hates everything and preaches against everyone. He's real "in-your-face."
An urban terror. Horrific experience.
The owner comes out and tries to chase him away, but he won't go. He comes up with some excuse each time.
He can really ruin your day. I don't know why they allow this. It's inexcusable.
The meal? Yes the prawn and crab Louie is amazing.
author: Raymond R.

description: This disgusting restaurant deserves negative 5 stars if negative 5 is the lowest it can go. Best food you will find there will be a glass of wine from a bottle. This was the worst customer service that I have ever experienced. The clams were so fishy that I had to stick my fingers in my throat in order to try throw up. There is no indication in the restaurant that they only accepted cash. This is 21st century so at least have some decency to have a sign that you do not take a plastic credit card from Visa or Masters. I mean I would understand it if they did not take Amex or something. Come on, take Chase Visa at least. If not, get the fuck out forever. Worst watery clam chowder that I have tasted. They should take out the word "Boston" from the menu for the word "Boston" is being abused. Your restaurant need to be bankrupted and be vanished forever. Worst customer service that made me go crazy and swear over and over again. This ruined my day. This is the worst place in sf that I have been to. This place made me really upset for their customer service is worse than their fishy disgusting sickfood. They should be called "SickFood". I dont usually write Yelp reviews but I have the obligation to report this to Yelp911SosHelpMegetridofthisrestaurant.
author: Harang K.

description:
I live 3 blocks away and I have a rule, that if I walk by and there less than 5 people in line, I eat. By far one of the best experiences with food you will have in the area. Nothing fancy, just great service, fresh quality food and a "I've been there" to add to your cool places belt. 

I like to go a little off the menu so my perfect meal at Sawn is a hunk of sourdough, cup of chowder and an ice cold Anchor Steam to start. If you're felling frisky order a crab back as well (dunk some bread in that, what I like to call sweet sea butter and you won't regret it). Then I'll order a half dozen mixed oyster which are some of the freshest and most tasty you will find. Followed by, one of my favorite two things; either some Italian sashimi (fresh raw scallops, drizzled with evoo, capers, lemon, cracked pepper) or ask for the CRABanthemum (just a solid plate of fresh sweet crab leg meat). Also don't forget your next Anchor if you haven't ordered it yet. I usually stop there but I could go on. If I'm feeling dangerous I'll order one of the other great things like the calamari salad, crab/prawn cocktail, or a crab salad with the special Louie/crab fat/heaven dressing (only on request). You honestly can't go wrong, so just ask what's fresh or recommended and they will take care of you. 

Lastly, take in the characters behind the bar. Everyone has their own amazing personality and are all great. Sit and enjoy a third and final beer while you watch these guys have fun while doing something they truly enjoy.
author: Kyle L.

description: Long wait but well worth it! Friendly service and most importantly FRESH SEAFOOD! I had the mixed cocktail!
author: Brooke V.

description: Hands down the best seafood I've ever had. Not fancy, but SOOOO worth the wait in line. The people who work there are friendly and fun to talk to, no one is yelling or running around, just amazing food with great service.
author: Alysicia L.

description: Lines are long and the seating is tight and on the counter. I saw it on Anthony Bourdain show so had to try it. It's an old fashion fish store with raw seafood in the window. And a row of seats on the counter. The staff was friendly and nice. I didn't notice until I was served, they don't use gloves to prepare the seafood cocktail or any of the raw seafood. Plus there were flies in the window were the raw seafood was.. I was a bit grossed out about that but I thought to myself " it had to be better than it looked".  The seafood was ok if you discount the no gloves and flies. Nothing to WOW about.  I tried it. I doubt I will go back.
author: William V.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for years but never had the opportunity until this recent trip to the bay. I went here on a Tuesday afternoon around 2PM with 2 other people. The wait was't too bad, about 30 minutes. (There is about 20 seats so go on an off time if you don't want to wait too long.)

When I went here, I had the sashimi plate (it had onions, capers, and olive oil), crab cocktail, crab back, and oysters. The oysters were sooo amazing. We asked our server for a variety so we got to try 4 different ones. The house sauce is so damn good. UGH, I'm salivating as I type this. Seriously, Swan, bottle your oyster sauce up!!! The other seafood items were also amazing and fresh. I really loved the crab back. YUMMO!

I enjoyed dining here so much. Our server was hilarious and slightly sarcastic, which made everything extremely fun. The restaurant has an old school feel. I mean, just look at their register!!! Also, don't even think about bringing out your credit card to pay for your meals because they won't accept it. Don't fret thugh, there is a Chase atm across the street! Whew.
author: Anna K.

description:
FRESH FRESH SEAFOOD!

Had a quick lunch here because it was right across from my work.  There was no line at around 3:30pm on a Thursday afternoon, however there was one last spot at the counter for me.  It was destiny.  I was greeted by the enthusiastic staff and a cheery gentleman who suggested 2 items for me:

Clam chowder
- quite flavorful but I'm not too sure how I feel about the texture, but it's definitely worth a try though. Rather than a creamy base is like lipid globules individually suspended in little gritty beads. Once I got over that part, it was great, especially with the oyster crackers

Combination cocktail
- wow, clearly this is the freshest combination of crab, shrimp, prawn, and oyster I have ever had, everything was the right temperature and texture and it didn't taste super fishy at all.  The cocktail sauce was excellent, but they also had a red onion relish and horse radish on the side which were equally flavorful and great delicious additions to the fresh seafood

Important tip: this place is CASH ONLY (thanks for letting me run back to work to get some cash!)

Clearly this place is worth a try at the very least for their seafood cocktail.  The atmosphere is1960's-sailor-esque, and all the people here are so friendly, you'll feel right at home.
author: Tina A.

description: I waited on line starting around 10 minutes before opening time. I was probably the second to last person in for first seating. The guy who took care of me felt like a rough around the edge guy stereotypical older man from boston. Took a while for him to collect our order, but got right to cracking. I ordered 2 things before he cut me off and said lets do a few things at a time, which is totally fine. We got mixed oysters and clam chowder. They were fresh and delicious, especially with their bread. Then came the sea urchins. He accidentally threw out a piece, picked it up, from the trash where all the shells and juices go, washed it off in water and put it on the plate while cursing to himself. Kind of gross but I get it since each urchin was $28. We moved on to the sashimi. I prefer slices to be thinner, but overall it was fresh. I don't think I'd go back if I had to wait in line, but I dont regret the experience. Not sure if it was worth the money, but it was definitely fresh seafood.
author: Jenny P.

description:
If you want FRESH and CLEAN seafood, quality is right here at this doorstep! Also a huge tourist attraction spot. But most importantly, all the men that work in there are SO FRIENDLY and cordial and nice! They enjoy their job and seeing their customers leave happy!

There will always be a guarantee long line. At the front of the restaurant, there is a huge assortment of fresh seafood beyond the glass mirrors that is so amusing to inspect and look at while you wait for your seats. It is just a long narrow hallway with a bar table and uncomfortable seats. Everyone goes in and out quick. Go in, order, eat, and leave. Not much of a place for socializing and long talks. But fresh seafood. Quality is definitely there! All the worker men are so nice and amiable. 

Decor is more old school and traditional and gives off an antique feel. But you get the old fashion sailor feel while you eat! 

There are always a lot of tourists that come here and they try almost everything on the menu! However, the regulars that live here love to order the traditional oysters, fresh sea urchin, and salad?! The seafood salad with heaping loads of fresh real crab on top is crazy! I want to try next time! 

1/2 dozen raw oysters (Blue Point, Olympia, Eastern oysters) and 1/2 dozen raw clams (Little Necks, Cherry Stone, Boston clams) - these were amazingly good. each one was so fresh, so clean, and chilled to the perfect temperature. all of them just melt in your mouth like delicious chilled butter! texture is amazing! for those of you that love raw oysters, you'll also love raw clams!

Combination Seafood Cocktail (oysters, clams, crab, and shrimp) - yummy! the cocktail looks small, but it's very misleading. it deceptively holds a lot of seafood in it! everything is cleaned very well (no dirt or stones). the crab is so fresh and peeled off for you perfectly from the shells so that they are still in their "whole" pieces; cocktail sauce is perfect! loveeee it!  

Half Cracked Crab (served with bread & butter, choice of cocktail sauce, louie sauce or mayonnaise) - so good! not the big snow crab legs but actual big crabs! you can watch them crack it for you. it makes it so much easier to open up and eat the delicious meat that is in the inside!! very refreshing! all sauces are good but i personally like the cocktail sauce!

Smoked Trout (served with salad, bread, and butter) - a bit disappointing! the smoked trout is a bit tough and hard to chew on. the smoked salmon is perfect! it was so amusing to watch them slice thin slices of smoked salmon in front of us! I wouldn't order the trout again 

Pros:
-very good, attentive, friendly service!
-all seating is at a bar with you facing them. it is so fun and amusing to watch them shuck oysters or prepare a seafood cocktail while you wait for yours! 
-wine and beers available to enjoy your seafood with
-all seafood is AMAZINGLY FRESH and the oysters are OH SO CLEAN 
-since people eat fast, line moves reasonably fast

Cons: 
-small and cramped
-little seating.. i want to say about 10-12 seats in there.. 
-expensive BUT you get what you pay for! good money going into good quality fresh seafood is always worth it to me :)
author: Cuc N.

description: Amazing and absolutely worth the wait! The staff was fantastic and it was a great experience over all.  The crab was out of this world. I will most definitely be returning when I'm back in San Francisco!
author: Sarah T.

description:
Came here for an early birthday brunch last year. I was lucky. I took a Friday off of work and got to Swan Oyster Depot at 10:30am. Found free parking across the street and no line! Yay! Two birthday gifts and I hadn't even had lunch yet! I do think we got there just in time as a line started forming right after we sat down. We ordered:

Cup of clam chowder - The chowder appeared broken and was runny. I had a couple spoons of it and the roommate finished the rest. Have had better chowder elsewhere. 

1/2 dozen Clams & 1/2 dozen Oysters - Yum! My favorite dish! The shellfish was amazingly fresh. Bright, sweet and briny. Came with a nice assortment of sauces as well.

Combination seafood cocktail - Came with oysters, clams, shrimp, prawns, etc. I probably should have gotten just the shrimp or prawn cocktail since we already had the clams and oysters. It was a little too much raw shellfish for the morning. But I enjoyed the shrimp and prawns.

Uni - I love live uni and this didn't disappoint. Fresh and huge! So much uni goodness! 

So given how good most of the food was, why only 3 stars?! Swan Oyster Depot is a good place to get fresh seafood, but it's like a dive bar. Dirty! So dirty, I was kinda uncomfortable sitting there eating. Plus with all the flies circling around, I didn't have a pleasant dining experience. (I'm scared of flies, but that's a different story.)

I do want to give it another go, as I really wanted crab and their crab back! Who doesn't love a juicy crab head?! Plus with the bread they give you, I can only imagine how good it'll be! Next time!
author: Elena N.

description:
I'm in full support of free speech, but anyone that's giving Swan Oyster less than a 4 star review should be booted off Yelp and sent over to UrbanSpoon.

One of the top 5 seafood experiences of my life. It was so euphoric that I think I partially blacked out. The staff is hilarious and they take care of you so much that you don't even realize the tab you are racking up. If you can't handle a 90 minute wait, go down to fisherman's wharf or something.

Don't miss: 
* Sashimi plate - a gem of 5 different fishes, if you're lucky they'll have the best scallop you've ever tasted
* In-shell crab - this boiled crab tastes better than any other crab you've ever had, and it's no accident, the quality is off the rails.
* Crab back - high cholesterol? Do it... just this once.
* Oyster sampler plate - great oysters and a superb variety... 
* Smoked salmon - you can get a 1/2 order, and it's worth it. Slight smoky flavor, and on point.
author: Billy D.

description:
Review from a health Inspector!! Don't eat here!! Trust me Anthony Bourdain doesnt know anything about food safety or food science. This place should be closed down by SF health department. People, please don't follow celebrities!!

Where to start? Staff is friendly, that's about the only thing this place has going for it.

This place is filthy. The staff literally uses their bare hands to scoop the seafood salad into bowls. I am a health inspector as an occupation, so when I saw this I kept watching. They continually used their bare hands to scoop up seafood, wiped their hands on their soiled aprons and then handled the cash register, plates, glasses etc never once washing their hands in the hour we were sitting there. S

Food such as bread was left lying on the same counter that moments before had raw seafood, not in a plate or anything just right on the counter. I won't go on and on, suffice it to say this place was very dirty and unsanitary, blatant health code violations and obvious ones. Seriously handling raw and or ready to eat seafood with bare hands and not washing hands once.

As for the food, the only thing I felt comfortable ordering after seeing how the food was being served, was oysters. The guy shucked them holding them sideways so all the liquor dropped out, the best part. It may have been intentional tho because I ordered 4 different types and all 4 were pretty bad. Maybe I'm spoiled from living in the northeast, but they were less than fresh and I've had better west coast oysters on the east coast. Finally the cocktail sauce they serve with the oysters was, literally, watered down ketchup. I'm not kidding.

Not worth the cost or wait, and if u got diarrhea or any other food-borne illnesses after eating here now u know why... DONT EAT here. And trust me the San Francisco Health Department is going to get a nice complain and pictures from me. I Think this place should be closed down until they are educated.
author: Darling B.

description: What can you say about a century old establishment that haven't been said? Amazing, superb, splendid, delicious, great service, kind amosphere, best seafood I've had in the United States. What an amazing place. Hope to go back again, again and again
author: Jason M.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot - you were everything I dreamed of AND MORE.
I've been meaning to try his place for forever... but the line has always intimidated me, so I finally decided to come on a weekday for a solo lunch. Best decision I made all day.

Came at 11:50 on a weekday and was seated immediately (a small line started to form after 12).

Got:
1. Cup of clam chowder - this cup is SMALL but DELICIOUS. Get the butter and bread to soak up the chowder, then devour. The chowder is a little less creamy with a little more umami. YUM.
2. Medium sashimi platter - this was MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE. The sashimi, olive oil, and capers went SO well together. The best thing was the scallop sashimi. So delicate, creamy, and just perfection.
3. Crab fat - by this time I was just getting greedy. I was absolutely stuffed, but was eyeing the crab fat (the dangers of sitting by the window)

You can also pick up food to go. I'll probably do that the next time I want my seafood fix but don't want to wait in line!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I'm in love with the sashimi. 

I wanted to wake up early and get in line so I didn't have to wait as long but being the procrastinator I didn't end up showing up until around 11:30. That is about one of the worst times to show up. Don't do it people. Especially on a Saturday. I waited for about 2 hours and then was finally in the door and able to eat. I ordered the crab louie as that's what was suggested by the list. It was good but it wasn't anything amazing. However the sashimi plate (Sicilian style) was definitely one of the best things there. 

Pro tip: get there early and get that sashimi plate. You won't regret it.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Worth every minute and every penny... 
First of all this is a seafood market, eat in counter with its century old stools, beautiful marble counter and anchor steam on tap is secondary. 
We ordered the combination salad, sashimi and a dozen oysters- everything was incredibly fresh and delicious. 
Sincerely some of the best service I've ever received - these guys move fast , they're funny and ensured that we had a great experience. Can't wait to go back.

p.s. Closes at 5:30 but get there no later 3:30 for eating in, be prepared to wait, and there is NO official website
author: Erin L.

description: My afternoon couldn't not have been better spent if I did not come to swans oyster today. Today I found one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. This is an old joint, dating back to the late 1800s, and you can tell the restaurant hasnt changed much since it first opened. The atmosphere of the front is no bullshit. You sit at the counter, the waiters tell you stories about their lives, and u converse with your fellow diners by your side. Moreover, the food is amazing, sweet and delicious fresh seafood of any kind. The family who owns the place goes to the market every morning. This place is the real deal, and I hope you indulge in the wonder as I have.
author: GianCarlo L.

description:
The seafood is great, and there are a gazillion other yelp reviews telling you how delicious and fresh everything is. I agree!

I really love the atmosphere and vibe of this place. It's super old school, friendly staff shucking /slicing things to order. It really does feel like you stepped back in time and stumbled into a super friendly, small town shop. 

Also, the owners really want you to know there is no web site. If you see one it's fake. 

Cash only. If street parking sucks, there's a public lot with reasonable prices on Polk and Bush.
author: Angella A.

description: The oysters are the highest quality I've ever had.  And the staff was unexpectedly social and charming.  The establishment is uniquely eclectic full of old school charm.  If ya go and meet Eric, you're in good hands for sure.  We will absolutely be back for our next oyster fix.  Thanks guys!
author: Nikki B.

description: amazing! We arrived at 9:50 and there was a line of about 20 people ahead of us. Luckily they opened their doors early so we got sat around 11ish. Totally worth the wait, it was one of the best meals we've had! We would defiantly come back again but arrive a little earlier. The sashimi is a must try
author: Giannina L.

description:
Forget the Fancy Dan places that has abounded in the City. For a quintessential "Good Old San Francisco" dining experience, this is the place to go. With the demise of Odella's, this is the only really good option for really fresh shellfish and such at reasonable prices. ( Mayes is still good for oysters, but they should have Dante's famous line, "Lasciate ogne speranza, voi ch'intrate", above the entrance, for the rude service and even ruder customers. )

The interior is, well, spartan, and the crowds are immense. Still, this is a place that anyone should try at least once while they are in the City, along with The Codmother, Phat Philly, Zanze's Cheesecake, Bi-Rite Creamery, Tommy's Joynt, La Traviata, Caffe Sport, Tony's Pizza, et al. )

The smoked salmon is only equaled by Santa Rosa Seafood up north.
author: George T.

description:
This place is the best place in SF. The guys that run it are awesome, and each and every time I go I remember why it's the best.

Here's what you get:
Prawn Cocktail
Crab Cocktail
Sashimi Combo
Oyster Combo
Smoked Fish Combo
Beers

You'll be happy. I promise.
author: Jane F.
Madeleine E.

description:
Immediately when you walk in, you can tell this is a family run restaurant. There's chemistry between all the workers that makes you feel like you're about to eat recipes that have been passed down from generation to generation.  I gave one extra star because they seem really passionate about their business. 
The actual food though was nothing extraordinary though. Judging only based on taste, I would give 3 stars. We got a dozen oysters and a sashimi plate which wasn't on the menu. IT WAS EXPENSIVE (~$60). I really don't know why it's only two dollar signs on Yelp. Also, it was cash only, which is a slight inconvenience. There is an ATM located across the street though.
author: Melissa G.

description: It was a two and half hour wait but so happy I was able to enjoy their famous Claim Chowder. I also order combination seafood salad. At first I was shocked how tiny it was but it so delicious and I did get full. Definitely would go back.
author: Mandy M.

description:
After our 2 hour wait, I was left confused as to why we went in the first place...

The positives: the staff is really amazing - these guys are attentive and funny. They make you forget the fact you waited 2 hours for unseasoned food. 

Negatives: the wait and price - I normally don't mind waiting for things worth it, but the food was ordinary. They aren't cooking anything, there isn't seasoning, just simple seafood which I don't mind, but don't charge me $22 for half a crab (look at the pictures, it's pitiful). That amounts to a few legs. They oysters were almost $3 each and the sashimi (more like carpaccio) was $18.

I get that it's a "SF" hot spot because of he history and Anthony Bourdain, but I'd save the wait and money and just head to the end of Fisherman's Wharf for an actual whole crab with spices for the same price and 15 min wait.
author: Jelly J.

description:
Worst place I have eaten in a long time, and completely overpriced on top of it. The chowder was watery with a couple of potato pieces floating around, the crab back was just plain awful, the Sashimi was OK, but probably twice the price you pay at Nobu for the same amount.

Worst of all, the guys behind the counter alternate touching food and money without washing their hands or using gloves. Just gross. 

Walking in this place, one wants to love. And I used to. But now it was not good at all.
author: Oliver G.

description:
Not worth the wait!!! We waited a longgg time (1.5 hours?) even though we got there at 10 a.m. on a Saturday morning. My advice: get there EARLY. The line will move very slow after the first round of seats. I think we were about 3 stores away. 

We got the combination salad (we requested 1/2 of the portion and they said they do 3/4), the sashimi plate, and fresh oysters. Yes, the seafood here is super fresh. The oysters were fantastic and so were the giant lumps of crabmeat and shrimp (I didn't care for the baby shrimp at all). However, the rest of the salad and the flavor of the sashimi was a major disappointment. It was basically Thousand Island dressing, and the sashimi was super bland (even with the capers, pepper, and olive oil). 

Our bill came out to be around $80. We weren't full. I would come back for oysters but save the other $ and go get real sashimi in a Japanese restaurant.
author: Allison S.

description:
I am proud to say I have finally gone here (as my past visits to SF ended up not even being in the vicinity of this place). Bourdain and just word of mouth from fellow food friends, this has been one of the places I've always wanted to dine at.

Plan of attack was get in line prior to them opening up (as this place gets insanely PACKED) and the place being as tiny as it is doesn't help, but hey, I would say this place is an institution. If it's not broke, why "fix it", right? It's basically a long, thin bar with bar stools to enjoy your fresh, delicious seafood.

Parking, just like anywhere in the city, is a challenge, but isn't non-existent. With that being said, I shall share on my experience on when I had to feed the meter as the wait was close to about 2 hours (worth every minute to be honest with you), as the food, was mind blowing. It makes me wish this place was in L.A., but then again, it's in S.F. In "enemy" Giants territory. The place not only has a display of a Giants flag in their window, but I would say the entire staff back their team. Hey, I can respect that. I can also respect the friendly "banter" from said staff. 

As my GF, my cousin (both S.F. locals), got closer to the door, one of the fine gentlemen who's serving the patrons glared at me, then said, "You have some nerve wearing that stuff around here" - (my Dodger cap and Dodger greats shirt that have Garvey, Lopes, Russell, Cey, and Yeager on it).  Which got a chuckle from my cousin and giggle from the Mrs. Ha!

I already knew it was going to be an interesting experience here. The thing is, I know it's friendly banter and not once did it ever get out of hand with him. The guy actually did talk to me (as HE served us) about baseball and was actually cordial. So, obviously, even though he's a fan of that team, I had a great conversation with him about our respective teams as well as him serving us greatly that I tipped the man above the usual 18%. Of course the staff exchanged friendly banter with me as well as I sat there, but I was amused and so were my cohorts, so, I took no offense to it at all.

This place is CASH ONLY, so be prepared (there's a Chase ATM across the street and a Wells Fargo just down the block as well), so if you're a BofA person and didn't come prepared, bend over and pay the "fee" for using either ATM.

I do like the fact that the stuff that's on full view in the window (which looks too good to be real) is actually the stuff they use to make your salads and other seafood dishes and being VERY generous with the seafood. That gained brownie points from me automatically.

The only hot things served here is the clam chowder, with everything else being cooked already and chilled or raw.

The Mrs. and I started things off sharing a bowl of their clam chowder, my cousin ordered a cup as well. All I have to say about it, WOW. It has ruined clam chowder from any place going forward. The first thing you taste, is the clams! It's a thin soup which was perfectly fine for all of us as you can tell it's not masked by too much flour or filling like must places and the abundance of clams.

Then I realized, oh, time to feed the meter. So I walk out towards the car which is just about a block or so from the restaurant. As I walk, I noticed a car stopped at the light honk at me with the man inside yell, "Hey!". To which I obviously look, he then proceeds to point at his head (basically my cap) and does the Dikembe Mutombo finger wag at me. Of course, I laugh, because, really? You'll honk, yell, then finger wag. I was just waiting to actually hear him like Dikembe and say, no, no, no. I digress.

We then ordered the Oysters sample which consisted of Bluepoint, Kumomoto, Drake's (local) and Miyagi oysters. I do remember that our favorite was Drake's and on our next visit (yes, already planning it), we're going to get a dozen of just that. Nice, light taste of the ocean, with a touch of sweet, nice flesh/texture. Superb.

We finished things off with "sashimi"  which consisted of Tuna, Salmon, and scallops topped with a squeeze of lemon juice, onions, pepper, and extra virgin olive oil.
