The dang dish was so amazing I could have easily eaten two more by itself, but I couldn't be a brute with the Mrs. and my cousin in tow. Will easily order this again on my next visit.

So after all was said and done, lunch (decently full) for 3, less than $65. Which was well worth it.

As we walk out of the restaurant, towards the car, a man (with his wife and young kids) comes up to me and says, "Excuse me, let me take care of you". I was shocked of course because I didn't expect him to say anything to me as he's with his family..and proceeds to say, "Let me buy you some Giants gear" which only made the Mrs. and my cousin just erupt in laughter. Goodness. So I tell them about the situation earlier as well and again, nothing but laughter. S.F., gotta love it. I'll be back and GO DODGERS!
author: Wes S.

description:
Since moving to the City (Herb Caen!) this has been a go-to, one of those places that is the heart of SF. Whatever is fresh is what you want, and it's all fresh!
There can be a line but those are folks like you, so hang in. Your reward is smack dabbery the best!
author: William M.

description:
Pretty dang good! The line is definitely a thing here, so I'd simply come 15 minutes before it opens and be one of the first to get in. 

Get the crab with the open-back !! An unforgettable taste and so much fun to eat with the bread. The seafood is incredibly fresh, but what I like best about these sorts of places are the huge personalities that serve you. They walk around briskly, do all the math in their head and handwrite your check with pencil, are both gruff and friendly towards each other. 

The staff also know seafood *very* well, and someone next to ordered a "sashimi platter" which is nowhere on the menu but they obliged and gave him a huge circle of different fish to sample. My boyfriend and I got crab and tried a bunch of different fishes, and the clam chowder. I've never had fresher seafood in my life. 

Even though the place looks hectic with everyone running around, it's a great place to enjoy a lively date without feeling flustered.
author: Nancy H.

description: Must eat in SanFran but learned last order is 4:45 to dine. I was still able to order carry out though. I stood in the rain with a massive smile eating my combination salad!
author: Marti H.

description:
Okay, I get it. Old school place with a classic old school cash register, cool. If it's your style, you'll like it...

UPSIDE:
-Very friendly staff 

DOWNSIDE:
-Very dirty place. 
-Food plated with gloveless hands (possibilities of cash and food handling with unwashed gloveless hands)
-Tip to owners: ***Please consider wearing gloves***

OVERALL:
-overrated 
-over hyped
-not worth the price 

Thanks.
author: Sophia V.

description:
It was the experience I was looking for.

If you are someone who thrives on tradition, experience, seeing something in real life you've only ever seen in pictures - Swan Oyster is for you.  I was SO excited to go there.  My partner was SO not excited.  So this is a tale of two people who experienced completely different lunches.

I woke up at 915 am because I wanted to get there by 10 am.  That's just how I'd do it.  Since my internal clock was three hours ahead, as I'm from Toronto, it didn't seem odd to be to want to chow down on shrimp and crab at 1030 - since I'd be lunch time in my soul.  My day didn't play out like that.  I waited while the man got ready, because I'd rather eat said shrimp with him than without him.  And so I actually arrived at Swan (tired) at 11 am.

There were people in line.  For some reason, Mother Nature thought it'd be funny to actually make San Fran hot that day.  There's no shade in line, so if you are on that rare, almost nonexistent hot San Fran day, wear sunscreen or a hat.  There's a Walgreens across the street for water if you need.  Line moves fairly fast.  We had about 20-something people ahead of us, and it took an hour. 

The interesting thing for me was that they don't shove you in there, or rush you.  You still get a good experience.  My man doesn't sit on backless seats, so he stood.  No one cared.  The people next to us had a baby in stroller taking up some space that could have been seated.  No one cared.  Each few stools gets a different server, so you get personalized attention - this meant we saw other people with a different server getting free samples, which was a bit annoying, since we got nada.  No one cared....

Bathroom is far back.  Far, far, keep going, not there, there you go.  

Food is fresh as hell, they don't cook anything, it's literally just seafood on a plate.  Prawn cocktail was SO GOOD.  But the highlight for both of us was the combination salad.  YUM TIMES A MILLION.  You're in and out in less than an hour, as nothing is cooked and it's just -- here's your fresh seafood! k, bye!

I'd line up again, if it meant getting to eat shrimp with my guy :)
author: Amelia J.

description:
You don't need my review to figure out that you need to come here, but you will have a much more delightful experience, if you approach it like my gf and I did. We have lived in the city for 2.5 years now and hadn't made this stop, until walking down Polk street on a Thursday at ~4pm. There were just two people waiting at the door, so we decided to go for it. 
To put it simply, its a great experience that you need to check off, whether you're a long time local, a tourist, or anywhere in between. 

We shared the half crab and a bowl of chowder with Bread/butter on the side.

Half Crab - make sure you ask to pick this yourself (I grew up eating Maryland blue crabs, so this was a breeze to break apart :))

Chowder - this was rich and delicious. Leave the spoon aside and go to town on that sourdough

Definitely need to try the horseradish, its pretty amazing. The DIY Tartar made for a killer dipping sauce that we could power up a bit as we felt necessary ( we went big! haha)
author: Jarrett H.

description: Note: They do not seat the day before any holiday. These days are only for pick-up and to-go items which work out pretty well for those who do not want to wait in the massive line on a regular day. The to-go items were just as fresh and delicious!
author: Lynn T.

description:
I had no idea that I never reviewed Swan Oyster Depot. I've been enjoying the best and freshest oysters, crab cocktails, salmon, NE Clam chowder, and the occasional sashimi. Get in line early and patiently wait your turn. Try not to think of the ice cold beers and the fresh seafood that awaits you inside.

The family run restaurant also delivers to your house or office. The guys behind the counter are very easy going and will assist you on your journey.
author: Greg O.

description:
Actually, should be 5 stars for food quality, and one star for ambience/comfort.

We used to dine here regularly, whenever the oyster urge overcame us.  But now we can't get in at any civilized hour---30-60 minute wait in line in mid-afternoon (!)  Pity---we loved this joint.
(And it is definitely a joint.)
author: R.C. O.

description: The sashimi place is omg good!! The scallop was melt in your mouth yummy! Along with the tuna, salmon and yellowtail. It was so good we ordered a second plate. Clam chowder and smoke salmon is also an hit. The restaurant is pretty small and only have seats at a bar area. We stood in line for about 45-50min until we got seated. It was worth it. The ambience is fast pace while the guys behind the bars are working to make sure we were full and served. I wish I was able to order some of the smoke salmon and take it home. Lol. It would be so good on a bagel. (Visiting San Fran)
author: Sandy S.

description:
Some men don't believe in marriage.
Some men don't believe in beef ribs.
Some men don't believe in Priuses.

Me?

I don't believe in more than $1 per oyster.
(http://www.yelp.com/list/13-peso-oysters-san-francisco)

But I make an exception for this place.
Order anything & everything - can't go wrong.

6 Cherry Stone Clams $12 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swan-oyster-depot-san-francisco?select=B9MNlITh8r8wagdD9N_LHA)
Watched to see if butter was added. It wasn't - these clams sport a natural buttery decadence. Heaven. My favorite item of the meal.

Uni / Sea Urchin $? (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swan-oyster-depot-san-francisco?select=jpqMrCseszOkssR9LHK-Aw)
Think of the uni from your absolute fave sushi place. Now imagine another level. That's what this is. And it's moving.

Squid Cocktail(?) $? (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swan-oyster-depot-san-francisco?select=OCfuD5eKED-iUEfJJmEWAg)
Unnamed, not on the menu - I ordered it by vaguely describing it. So I don't know what it was, other than good.

Mixed Dozen Oysters $30 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swan-oyster-depot-san-francisco?select=M_VIGFN6sbBdtcO1qBB_YA)
Freshness makes it worth a try, even for diehard dollar oystbros. My tray contained 5 or 6 kinds of oysters.

Iced Tea $2.50 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/swan-oyster-depot-san-francisco?select=bySwWYP9okFwgaut7PEfyw)
Not optional.

I don't know all the prices or item names because tabs and billing happen verbally. When you're done eating, you recite your meal to a person who walks away then returns to tell you the total cost. Plus, not everything's listed on the menu.
author: Dan B.

description:
Serving 7 stars seafood for a whole century!!!

And here are 7 reasons why you should love this place.

People- Ambiance- Food- Service- Experience and above all, the taste of fresh ingredients!!! 

I'm a die hard seafood fan. My diet consists of 80% seafood. I love shellfish! And this place has almost all my favorite kinds of shellfish. Talk about a happy eating!!

The journey/process- Dining here is no chopped liver. There will always be lines ( unless you come at 4 pm). You will always have to wait to sit on those bar stools ( been there since 1900!) for a good hour plus. You will be sharing your space with strangers who are also going for the same things you are getting. But you will love every minute of it.

The place- it is a simple fish market style place with all the seafood out front in the glass case. They have beer on tap. A lady in the back taking all the crab meat out so she can bring them out in bulk every half hour or so. Owner and his sons + your very fun waiters running around behind that counter working effortlessly all the while getting you a great service. It's casual, comfortable, fun and all about food.

Food-
It's all about seafood. Shellfish on ice mostly. The only thing that serves hot in this place is their chowder. Everything else comes on ice or on a bed of lettuce.

Things to get:
1. Crab Salad!!!!!! They have mixed seafood salad too but the Crab salad is an absolute must. So much of that fresh cooked crab on a bed of lettuce. Serve with your choice of dressing. If you get the balsamic /oil dressing- hold on to your seat!!
Olive oil mixed with crab fat! It's like magic with fireworks in your mouth. Uh-mazing!!!!

2. Little neck clams- a must get!! If you are not keen on clam, try half a dozen first. But make sure you use their special homemade hot sauce. It is made just for these little clams and boy do they go together. 

3. Smoked Salmon - just wow. You can get a half order of this thing and watch your server beautifully slice that smoke salmon. Serve on a bruschetta with a jar of capers!

4. Oysters- you can't come here and not get oysters! Kumamoto and Miyagi are what I usually get. You can get them on half shells or in a cocktail form. I was seated right in front of a massive bowl of oysters!! All swimming and pretty...Had to control myself so I don't put my face in it!

5. Chowder - pipping hot and oh so good. I always get this!

6. Crab cocktail - yea I love crab and every time I'm here, I can't help but have more crab. Lettuce fills me up too fast at time so I get my fill of crab with this. All the tasty lump piled high in a cocktail glass. Tasttyyyyyy!

7. Last but not least- Uni!!!!!!!!!!! Their sea urchin is simply mind blowing. I was disappointed that I didn't get to eat any Uni on my last visit last week. They said they haven't had it in a month due of bad weather and waves. (It's impossible to dive down and grab them). But if you can, try this!


Service- no matter who you get at this place, it is sure to be fun and entertaining. One of the brothers that owned this was our server and we got to learn a lot about the place while we chowed down on everything seafood. Hmmm so good. I've been having seafood cravings since I came back from this last week. When the ingredient is good, you don't need to add anything on it. That's exactly what they do here. A ton of fresh seafood with minimal fixings. They also send you home with a post card and a sponge business card. What else can you ask for? Well except to go back and get more food.

Oh and if you are short on time, do a take out. Go straight to the front of the line and they will help you quicker than you can say crab salad with crab fat dressing!  7 stars all the way!!

And it's CASH ONLY!!!!!!! Please bring enough to try everything and to tip your awesome server!! The place only seat about 15-20 people. But it's well worth the wait!
author: Latifa S.

description:
I was determined to eat at Swan Oyster after numerous attempts having given up because of huge lines, so this time I ordered to go (still takes awhile). The service is super friendly, perhaps Swan Oyster might become my regular seafood shop if I lived closer. Ignoring the ridiculous hype, I found the food to be quite standard. Certain items were very fresh, but the food is very overpriced for the quality, and you could get better seafood elsewhere.

* ITALIAN CRUDO ($29) - 2 STARS:
Italian version of a sashimi omakase, topped generously with olive oil and capers. This was a somewhat small portion given the price, and oily even though I asked for light oil. The fish itself ranged in quality, the scallops were amazing, the tuna was hard like an unripe mango, and the yellow tail was good. Go to Basa if you're looking for consistently high quality raw fish.

* DOZEN OYSTERS ($30) - 3.5 STARS:
Already overpriced, and they gave me only 11 oysters! So sad. These were fresh and delicious, but I can name a few places that have incredibly fresh oysters. Mission Oyster has $1 oyster happy hours and they are just as fresh.

* COMBINATION SEAFOOD SALAD ($20) - 1 STAR:
Combination of small and large shrimp on iceberg lettuce. Tasteless, and the shrimp didn't taste fresh.

Mostly mediocre, very expensive, extremely overhyped.
author: Jess C.

description:
This place was one of a kind. 
Had the freshest seafood and at reasonable price.
(Bring cash, this is cash-only joint) 

Though we only tried here once as a tourist, I highly recommend the following:
  Fresh sea urchin (usually available on Wednesday)
  Cherry stone clams 
  Crab fat 

Do realize it opens at 10:30AM, especially on weekdays when it is not busy.
We got there super early thinking it opens at 10AM since many reviews mentioned this time that we had to wait extra 30 minutes to indulge.

If you happen to get there too early, try out Bob's donut, which were fantastic and just down the street.
author: Helen K.

description:
Overpriced, mediocre food, crowded and kind of unfriendly. 

Got a dozen oysters (mixed varieties, one tasted really really weird), the crab salad (lots of fresh crab on a bed of iceberg lettuce with something like thousand island dressing) , the smoked salmon (5 small pieces on thinly sliced bread for $24.50), and a bowl of clam chowder (thin and it looked like it was separating? Or curdling? Ok flavor, though). Nothing was terrible, but nothing was great. 

Service was not very good. The person who sat down after us had his counter space cleaned and order taken before we did. The guy who cleaned our counter and took our order was curt at best. And at one point 2 servers (fishmongers?) were complaining about us right in front of us and dropping f-bombs all over the place, because they thought we had made a mess that we hadn't. 

Overall, not a pleasant way to spend $120 (incl tip, a house white and an adorable half pint of anchor steam) and almost 2 hours.
author: Angeline T.

description:
I am a HUGE seafood person; There are times when I've eaten it so much over a good number of days that I get tiny water bubbles into between my fingers telling me I've eaten too much lol. TMI - I know, but that's how much I LOVE seafood!!

SWAN OYSTER DEPOT IS SEAFOOD BLISS! And if you're a lover like me, where crab meat tickles your fancy more than lobster, and you can consume raw oysters like chocolate chips cookies --  this place is THEE place to go in San Francisco. The line cover storefronts - plural, S - past 12noon and the locals also go here for their seafood too, pre-ordered and to-go of course. 

I did my research for this place and they all said one thing: Arrive early. So my boyfriend has set out to eat at SOD at opening: 10:30AM when Yelp said they would open. We get to their store front at 10:10am, and the place was already open with first seating full!!!! We ended up waiting in line for about 25 minutes before getting seats at the bar.

A family of four leaves the bar and we're set next to be seated. My boyfriend and I had started off with cups of chowder. I think the perks of getting the chowder is that the oyster crackers are on the counter for you in this big fat bowl for you to scoop at your leisure. **thumbs up** Following the chowder was got a mixed platter of raw oysters. The oysters were fresh to death! A varietal east coast and west coast mix.

We weren't going to get full on oysters so we also bought a Combination Salad for $22.00. It seemed pretty steep for a salad, but having actually ordered it, the seafood ratio out beat the lettuce! Big shrimp, tiny pink shrimp everywhere a shrimp shrimp!! And the crab meat? Sweet, just like I like it. The fact we were in San Francisco and sourdough bread and butter were free with the salad, just wrapped it up for me! 

Touristy? Yes.
Worth the hype? Yes.
Good value? Absolutely. 
Downside: Cash Only.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Finally, after 20+ years in SF, I decide to be like a tourist and give this place a try.  Little did I know, totally underestimated the wait.  They open at 10:30a, got there a little before opening and line was almost to the corner of the street, in front of the liquor store.  Ok, I get in line... Line does not move... 30 mins, moved a few inches, an hour.. Committed too much to leave... An hour 30 mins... Moving a little, still can't leave! 
My wait, for 1, was a little about 2 hours 10 mins!! I don't think I've ever waited this long for food before! 
This place is tiny and tight, about 18 stools people have counted.  Basically see people leave and go grab a seat.  
Got the crab salad and Sicilian sashimi.
-crab salad with limp crab meat on top of shredded iceberg lettuce and side of Louie sauce.  Crab was meaty, lettuce crispy and refreshing.  With the Louie sauce, it was a perfect bite.  Although the icebergs don't have much nutritional value, it works.
-Sicilian sashimi with a variety of fish including tuna, salmon, yellowtail, scallops, topped with a good amount of olive oil, capers and red onion.  It was not drenched in oil, but had a good amount.  Capers added the pop and saltiness.  Fresh and yum.
Salad comes with bread and butter, and the bread was rustic and delicious! Makes a good sponge to soak up items like clam chowder and crab fat on their menu!
Got some smoked salmon to-go, which was sliced thinly and was smoked nicely.  
There's 2 lines: one for take out and one for dine in.  Service was friendly, although sometimes can take a little wait.
Worth a visit, at least once.  But not worth waiting 2 hours for! It was delicious and fresh.  Bottom line, if you want to eat here (and do the dine in experience), come earrrrrrly!!! They also sell out, when they sell out.
author: Linda T.

description:
I have to say that if you're in the mood for some fresh seafood, this is the place to be.  I've been spoiled with some of the best fresh fish/oysters from the source...I get the hype about this place but I guess I can say I've had better...and less expensive.  

There is a small number of seating mostly at the counter for you to devour your choices.  They have choices of crab, oysters, uni, etc.  we had also picked up a Louie salad.  It's definitely on the expensive side but worth the freshness if you don't have access to Oceanside deliciousness.  Perfect for tourists and a staple in SF...
author: Jen W.

description:
Attempted to go 3 mornings straight, finally got there with no crazy line around 10am. 
Everything was delicious / fresh, my favorite was the shashmi.
author: Kevin N.

description:
If I could eat here daily, I would.  This restaurant only takes CASH, seats maybe 20 people, usually has a line, and has divine, fresh seafood. 

We tried the...

sashimi scallop/tuna/salmon/hamachi italian style (olive oil/capers/red onion)
dozen mixed oysters
chardonnay 

Worth the wait and the excursion.  Please refer to photos, if you're not convinced.
author: Lydia L.

description: Ok, this review may be a bit biased, but that is because I ate here and then spent the next day with projectile vomiting and explosive diarrhea, often at the same time! I thought I've had food poisoning before... I have NEVER experienced food poisoning like I got here. I live near Swans and never went in because the line was always too long, but this last Saturday I resolved to finally go see what the hype was all about. After waiting for two hours (two!!), I was seated and right away was a bit concerned about the state of hygiene of the place and how the food was handled, but hell I just waited two hours and everyone raves about this place... so I stayed... a dozen oysters (they were good, but they are the same and half the price at a much cleaner sushi bar just up the road). Then a combo cocktail, meh. Sauces, meh. Then a half cracked crab, meh. Sashimi, meh. At this cash only place, this mediocre experience cost $100. Again, much better (cleaner, more comfortable seating, cheaper, fresher) sushi just up a block or two. My suspicions are on the crab for getting me sick, but who knows. All I know is I eat raw seafood all the time, but this was the first time at this famed San Francisco establishment. It was also my last.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Finally our chance to visit this famous eatery and it did not disappoint. We parked at the garage on Sacramento street; a short walk over to find the line not too long at 2:30 pm on a Monday afternoon. There were 7 people ahead of us, we sat down around 3:10,  a 40 minutes wait was very acceptable after hearing 2 hours average wait time on weekends. Part of the reason for the lengthy wait time is due to their casual / relaxed serving style, at no time you feel rushed and everyone behind the counter assembled the dishes at a leisurely pace between friendly chats with customers. 

We came hungry ready for some good raw seafood, between the 2 of us we had 
a bowl of clam chowder - (3) probably the weakest of all dishes imho
half order of smoke salmon- (4.5) creamy, slightly smoke not too salty, wish we ordered a full order
one doz assorted oysters - (4) very fresh, excellent
half doz raw clams - (4.5) slightly salty savory crunchy goodness, loved it
Crab cocktail - (4) very fresh Dungeness crab meat, yummy
Sashime (4) we actually liked the olive oil / capers / red onion Sicilian style dressing  so the freshness of the fish really stood out
3 glasses of wine, bread and butter

The total bill came to $145 before tips somewhat  in line with what we expected. Swan is very smart in their business model, very little cooking involved at the premise; the freshness of the seafood speaks for itself and the friendly family oriented atmosphere added to it's attractiveness.
author: Julie W.

description:
Ah, so sad. This was one of the first bookmarks I had made since moving to SF. After 10 months, we finally made it with high hopes and expectations. Yay, short wait and the counter seats about 15-20 people so we got lucky because the line started getting longer after us. Also, it's 130 pm on a random Tuesday. 

We waited patiently because we were at the end of the counter and the guys behind the counter looked super busy. After 10 mins of drooling over other people's food and trying to catch anyone behind the counters eye so we can get some service, we were finally served our water. I know service isn't a testament to the food and everyone was generally friendly but I was uncontrollably turned off but it's ok.

We ordered a bowl of clam chowder (do not get, it was watery and had no... Clams... In it), famous crab salad (ours was smaller than the rest and what was shown on the pics on yelp, don't be tricked!), and a sashimi (tuna, salmon, sardines, scallops.) the couple next to us had this colorful 4 types of sashimi and we asked if that was the standard, the guy said 'I dunno we will see' he didn't even try to look for the sardines that was missing from the original plate we got. Being the yelp brat that I was, I asked someone who looked nice. He proceeded to find the last fish for me and added it on (our sashimi at the time looked so small compared to the couple next to us). Then I asked about the size of the crab salad and showed him the yelp pic, he said it was inaccurate... Okay fine whatever.

Overall, the whole meal was 45 dollars, cash only. I was not only underwhelmed but disappointed. The guys behind the counter are pleasant and cheery but I still wouldn't recommend this place to my friends, sorry. 

Also, no one had gloves on and moving stuff everywhere and cutting fish and handling raw food and serving it as is. It's a not a fancy place but it is local so if that's what you want, then yes, come here.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Waited almost two hours to get inside. Great atmosphere, seems like a family owned joint. The food was good but I don't think it was worth the wait.
author: Jenny X.

description:
Came here because one of my family friends recommended this place and we were in the area as well. We came in the afternoon for a late lunch and there was a very short wait for us to be seated. It's a very old school, classic sit at the counter type of restaurant. I didn't mind the seating at all. However, my mom and I came here and we literally sat at the counter as we watched the employees eye is down as walk away not even taking our order or getting drinks started for us. They seemed to be very focused on their regulars that came in and were already eating or buying some seafood to go.

After about 5-10 minutes of sitting there I finally called over an employee and they took our order and what not. My mom and I ended up getting bread and butter ($1), 3 bowls of clam chowder ($5each, one was to go), the combination seafood cocktail ($14.50), and a combination of oysters (about $30?). Our total came out to $64. 

The clam chowder was much thinner in consistency than expected, but it had a delicious clam flavor. However, the amount of clams in the chowder seems to be inconsistent as my mom only had 4 pieces and I had far more than 4. Not a huge issue, but consistency in a restaurant is key. The seafood cocktail had one oyster, 2 large shrimps, and several small shrimps. It was definitely fresh, but not worth the price. Rather pay for the combination salad as it's almost the same price with more seafood! The oysters came with four different types and the pieces were average to small sized, but they were all very sweet, fresh, and fantastic. 

Throughout our dining experience we had two servers helping us. The second one who ended up taking over explained the different types of oysters to us and really made sure we were taken care of and had everything that we wanted. Although the seafood was really fresh and delicious, the price for some of the items are quite pricey for what we received. The service differs for each customer as I could see them paying much more attention to their regulars, but a bit disappointed that we weren't acknowledged to be served for the beginning. 

Overall 4 stars almost 5 for the food quality, but 3 for the experience and service.
author: Germain L.

description: It is a small shop. I had half a crab. The food was good but I was expected something more amazing. From my opinion, it was just boiled or steamed seafood with sauce. The service was very nice though.
author: Zhong Z.

description:
Awesome seafood found here. Imported every morning, all the fish and seafood here is super fresh! I would suggest coming on a weekday if you can get a day off from work, and getting there exactly when it opens (10:30am). This is what my bf and I did - I didn't start work until 2, and he was in between jobs. Perfect timing for a meal at Swan Oyster Depot. Otherwise, you'll have to wait crazy lines (or so I've heard!)

We were seated right away. It just so happened that they had Sea Urchin that day (not sure if that was a special, or on the regular menu?) but they served it right out of the tough, pointy, purple skin. Pretty awesome. Think of a fancy ice cream bowl...but instead of the bowl, the outside of the sea urchin, with the orange inside....YUM!

Combo Louie salad (crab, jumbo shrimps and small shrimps over lettuce) was SO GOOD. It really hit the spot...basically your favorite seafood, yummy mayonnaise sauce, over salad. Can't get any better than that since it was so fresh! You can also get Crab Louie (only, versus the combo) salad, or shrimp only too. But Combo is awesome if you want to try a little bit of everything if you know what I mean!

Oysters were awesome too. For 2 people, we shared 12.  I can't remember where they were from, but just that the smaller ones were sweeter, and more tasty. I think one was from somewhere in Washington.

Smoked salmon over french bread was awesome too. The slabs of salmon they give you is very plentiful, just very simple and good. I would also recommend the clam chowder bowl to start of with. Super yummy and a great appetizer while you're waiting for them to prepare the rest of your meal!

The only thing, the meal was all protein. Even though we were full, the lack of carbs still left us hungry in a different way. Just something to keep in mind.

Staff here is hilarious. They are super friendly, native San Franciscans who have been here since the restaurant opened. It's family owned. They all get along great with each other, and are great entertainment. They talk about sports and joke around all the time. Hope nothing changes over time! Probably won't since they've been around over 100 years.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Very good seafood. 

I will say the guys are great but it feels a bit frantic. Do I seat myself? Do I shout out my order? Well I just sat down and waited. One of the men got to me and took my order. He was friendly enough. I got a medium sashimi plate and it was very fresh. I might have ordered more but I want asked until it was too late (already feeling full). 

I would go again and try something different, not because I didn't like mine but because there are so many good choices.
author: Irving W.

description: Found this cute little gem while out in the city with my bestie. After a day at the Museum of Ice Cream, we were ready for a savory little bite before we went out for dinner. This place felt like a true oyster/seafood bar with only about 20 seats at the counter and a knowledgeable staff. My bestie and I started off with a beer, which our server was kind enough to split for us because we didn't really feel like drinking a whole pint. We got a cup of Boston chowder each and then a dozen oysters to share. Our server brought us 3 varieties of oysters all of which were probably the freshest I have ever had. They have ample sauces and lemon on the counter up for grabs. At the end of the meal, they even provided a hot water and lemon bowl so I could clean off my hands. As I sat there finishing my beer, I watch the servers really cater to the customers and strive to find something that would satisfy the customers palette while also encouraging them to try other seafoods that they may not have before. Truly a seafood experience here! I will definitely make the trip out to the city just to eat here for lunch because they're only open from 10a-5p. So be prepared to wait for a spot.
author: Mariah D.

description: Wooooowwww sooooo expensive 67 $$$ for a dozen oysters and a dry crab salad.   So much great seafood in town this is not worth it
author: Josh M.

description: There's usually a long wait, so if you walk by and only see a few people in line, take that as a sign that you should stop in. The seafood is all incredibly fresh, and part of the reason for the line is that everyone there is friendly, helpful, and not trying to rush you out to seat more people. It's also a little pricey, but worth it for the quality of food and service.
author: Alex W.

description:
I've heard so many people rave about this place but they overhyped it for me. By the time I arrived at 9:45 AM, there was already a line out the door. I'm pretty sure they open earlier than indicated on Yelp. The line took about an hour and since we had a group of three, it took a little longer. 

Come in pairs!!! You'll thank yourself once you get seated before the groups of three, four and five. I can't imagine how long a large group would have to wait.  

The food:
- Crab cocktail: Yes, fresh but I'd be fine if I didn't try this
- Mix of a dozen oysters: a mix of miyagi, bluepoint and kumamoto oysters. They provide a bowl of lemon at the front, tobasco, some type of chili sauce, and horseradish. 
- Cherry stone clams: Like anywhere else
- Sashimi: Hamachi, Tuna, Salmon, Scallops + olive oil and capers (this lacked flavor)
- Smoked Salmon: A couple slices with bread 
- Clam Chowder: Murky and distinct, very clammy flavor that I've never had in a clam chowder before

Best thing to get here? The oysters and smoked salmon! As everyone else says, everything is fresh but the way it's prepared, the toppings, and the lack of flavor were anti-climatic.  I think I overdid it. A couple oysters would have been fine but I didn't feel so well after eating 12. 

We spent about $70 each because seeing the line, we know we needed to order everything in one-go. I would have to say that people's opinions vary largely here so you need to try Swan Oyster Depot for yourself because maybe you might love the place.
author: Ingrid C.

description: I have been fortunate enough to eat here 3 times. I won't tell you what times those are at....because that could ruin it for me. Try to eat here, anytime your in the city, even if it doesn't work-try again :)
author: Angelina G.

description: I always came here when I lived on Polk in Nob Hill, 13+ years ago. Crowded then, crowded now - I guess it's a mix of locals and tourists, but one thing for sure, the freshest seafood and OYSTERS. There are only 20 bar stools here and a line out the door, so better expect to wait, weekdays by 2-4:00, expect to wait 20+ minutes. This is definitely a hole in the wall with old...I mean OLD 49niner posters, Montana and Young jerseys, pictures and memorabilia. Laminated countertop, circa 1950's and decor to match; please don't expect "Farrallon, Nopa or Gary Danko" environment or decor, expect the freshest oysters, seafood salads, smoked fish and chowder. Came here with friends, I waited 45 minutes on a Tuesday afternoon (3:00) not bad!  Had two dozen oysters (miyagi, Kumamoto) fresh half shell clams and crab salad - all fresh and delish.  I've had their smoked salmon and whitefish, very nice.  Their clam chowder is good, it looks separated by 3:00 (sitting in warmer too long).  I've pretty much had everything on their menu, except the crab backs, will have to come back for that. Place us always busy and high every,nice counterhelp, owner is always engaged with us on the counter. Lots of noise in the back from dishwashing and plates clanking - but ur not here for that, you are here for the seafood! They have beer on tap (Stella and Anchor Steam) and wine as well.  Parking, hey it's Nob Hill, so street parking all the way baby.  So get down here and get ur oysters!
author: Rhondi S.

description:
ChauTime Season 2:  Episode 11 Heaven or San Francisco? I'd Rather Be Living Life With My Heart Invested In S.F.  Than Be An Angel, All Day, All Day.

San Francisco is my wanderlust, nirvana, my heaven on earth. A place where you can be you, with no one there to judge you. Just like a place where Nemo and sea creatures come from.

Seeing The Golden Gate Bridge for me every time is like seeing the sunlight for the first time, the feeling I get from it is like sun rays kissing my body, and the sight of it is more jaw dropping than the excitement at a burlesque show.

Life is beautiful but ever so changing by the second. Most people don't realize we are not the same person we were a month ago, a week ago, or  even 5 minutes ago.  Different variables play a role among us affecting our mood in the heat of the moment such as: the temperature of weather,  the weight over our shoulders of organizing tasks in life,  or current status of your body, mind, and soul whether it is healthy or overworked and stressed. Oysters and fish are like us, they absorb the essence of their surroundings depending on their inlet and Terroir which is what give them their character, depth of flavor profile, and brininess.

Love I have for sea creatures goes as deep as the deepest ocean, The Pacific Ocean. I'm invested in the Pacific like The Love Locks in Paris, and my Love Anchor is  going down 35,837 ft.  Most of the sea creatures that are served at Swan Oyster Depot come from this Terroir.  

"Fish are friends not food." -Finding Nemo

Living life is a precious gift but I totally think this quote is shellfish  because The World Is My Oyster and Everything It including all the Squishy Squishy Nemo & Friends too.  No matter how Super Cute they are looking, they are  Super Fantastic and Butter in my Jelly Belly Udon Even Know Lemme Shoyu Under The Sea and what 2Spend Your Nori On!!!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Food:

Cherry Stone Clams- Super Cute X Super Fantastic!!! Just like the Lil Twurtle Squirt, Crush's son from Finding Nemo.

Uni- Rich, buttery, and creamy never ending deliciousness. A Sin add to my insatiable uni Sinsation.  Sea X Urchin puts two lines down the letter S which makes it one of my most precious bites the world.

Oysters-  Like French Kissing The Little Mermaid.  My favorite 3 sum of fun on the half shell in the ChauTime Diaries that don't exist are: shigoku, kushi, and kumamoto.  Here I would recommend  getting a variety at least a dozen but make sure to get the kumamoto cause they are Super Kawaii, Sweet with a Honeydew after taste, and small but packs flavor.

Italian Style Sashimi- Raw Sushi X Wetter than a Tsunami. Godfather Pt.1  shit right here salmon, scallops, hamachi,  and tuna. 

Smoked Salmon- From Russia With Love I have been influenced by Vobla, Moyva, Semega, and Smoked Salmon goes great with vodka the saltier the better. To put the cherry on top wish they had vanilla Coke X Sturgeon Caviar.

Lobster- Like a Mobster, iLike Lobster!!!  Down on the West Coast,  this is the best I ever had. Get the Maine lobster, it's  best I ever had, Young Money Cash Money, bring it cause its cash only establishment. 

Crab- Crab Butter to me is the Poor Mans Truffle Butter, all it's missing is Nicki Minaji's Anaconda.  The crab was sweet and good, served chilled, but I had better in my city coming from the two o 6side.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*Like a San Francisco Super Model, Have Faith Like You Rockin "Christian" (Sup Jesus)  you don't even need Dior for the optics when you are ordering off the Swan Oyster Depot Menu!!!  

**Only thing that could make this Dining Experience Take Me Up Higher Than A House Of Balloons  is Being on a Hammock Anywhere X.  marks the spot, on the Golden Gate Bridge  Poppin O. ysters With Cloud Dreams!!!

***Every time You See Me In A Picture And I'm Smilin, I'm Dreaming of the Middle Section of the Golden Gate Bridge, Where The Ropes Connect The Towers Forming The Same Shape as My Lips, or I'm Fadded... Like I'm On a Cloud!!!  The Golden Gate Bridge is A Big Math Equation as it is Flexin, Swayin, and Swoonin up to 16ft Depending on Environment Around It and  Adapting With Emotion To Keep It Feelin Fine.  The Only Part of the Equation After Canceling X is, Why Am I Not On That SkyLine ...  

-ChauTime!!!
author: Peter C.

description:
This place is crazy. With only 10-15 seats total in the whole place, coming here on the weekend at 10:30am wasn't the best idea because we ended up having to wait 2 hours! Everyone else in line seemed to have been there before and told the bf and I that the wait was worth it.

After finally getting seated, the guys behind the bar took turns serving everyone, so the attention to serving customers was a bit sporadic.

WHAT WE GOT:
1) clam chowder: yum! I love clam chowder and the fresh clams in this soup was a perfect start--not fishy at all either.
2) Dozen oysters: we had varieties of oysters, and not just 1 dozen (I think we probably had 2 1/2 dozen??)-- very good and fresh as well.
3) Half dozen clams: I always forget how much I love eating raw clams and this reminded me just why! All were very sweet (also came in a variety of 3 different types) and juicy--so good!
4) crab: just the meat, shell off with some cocktail sauce...I think it would be worth it if more meat was part of the order...I would just buy a crab myself from 99 ranch and cook/eat it.

Overall, it was a LOT of seafood and the bf and I were sick to our stomachs (we are huge seafood fans but realized we overdid it an hour or two later) and took a long nap afterward. Service could be better, I felt like they treated some customers better than others...just what I observed and what I experienced. Overall, I'd probably come back only if I had the urge to splurge on eating just seafood for brunch...lol, and if I had the patience to wait in line for so long!
author: Shannon N.

description:
I think I would want my last meal to be here. And I don't want anymore people coming here. The line is long enough. I've been here I think 4 times total already. I love the guys that work here. Darren and the rest of the guys (I forgot their names forgive me) but they are all awesome and made us feel like family. 

Now to the food. Get whatever you want but this is what we always get and what I suggest you try:

Sicilian sashimi- raw tuna, scallops and salmon with lemon, olive oil, onions and capers. Served with sourdough bread. Get it or you will be sorry. 

Drakes bay oysters (or whatever oysters they have but drakes bay were our favorite)

Live sea urchin- I love uni so when I can get it live it's a real treat. IF, they have it, it sells out fast. 

Crab fat back- not sure if it's on the menu but they made it for us and it's a true delicacy. 

Shrimp cocktail- those shrimp are so flavorful. I dream about them! Their cocktail sauce is on point too. 

They open at 10:30. Get there well before then if you don't want to wait in a long line. The counter only sits like 12+ people if I remember correctly and that's the only seating in the place. We are going back there next month and can't wait to see the guys, eat amazing food and claim my steak at the counter!!
author: Mary S.

description:
Got here 10 mins before 10am, was 3rd in line. Awesome!

The uni was UBER fresh, but just remember to ask for soy sauce and wasabi (it's not on the counter). 

My favorite though, surprisingly weren't the uni or the sicilian scallops, both good, but were the clams! So sweet! And really, let's be honest. The clams were just vessels for their homemade thai chili mignonette. SO GOOD!
author: Lily L.

description: The incredibly long wait and "meh" (but fresh) seafood have prevented me from trying this spot before but I wandered in today to take a peek. When some patrons finished up and told us we could take their seats as we were perusing the menu on the wall, an incredibly rude older gentleman working behind the counter told us "you're not sitting here." Okay, Regina George. Instead of simply telling us that they were no longer seating any new customers, he insisted on being an asshole and telling us that the other two women could sit down but we could not. 1. We were not informed. 2. Next time, you can share this detail with some fucking manners.
author: Gloria L.

description: I will be visiting this spot every time I come back to SF in the future. My friends and I all had the clam chowder and fresh oysters. The clam chowder was pretty good and was definitely better than the clam chowder at other places I have been to in the SF area in the past. The oysters were amazing. They served 4 different types of oysters when we were there, and all were delicious. The people working here are awesome. Very friendly and helpful. If you are into fresh seafood and want a more intimate setting where you are at a counter with approx 14 other people and the workers are directly in front of you, you need to visit Swan Oyster Depot.
author: Shawn V.

description: Waited about an hour and change on a Friday lunch time. However, I've been here during the week and didn't wait. If you have the time, it's worth the wait. Freshest seafood I've ever had. Very laid back atmosphere, and even when there's a long line they won't rush you and take their time preparing your food.
author: Christopher M.

description:
THE HYPE IS FUCKING REAL!

Got here around 2:30 on a Friday not expecting to wait (hahah.......)...but we waited, about an hour in the cold. Just like almost everyone who left the place explained though, it was well worth the wait!

Despite what one may think due to the prices; This is not your fancy seafood restaurant at all..defiantly more of a dive with barely any elbow room. 

My boyfriend and I wanted to try everything so we thought it'd be safe to order the smaller portions - HUGE mistake. 

We got the Sicilian Styled Sashimi..he asked what size and we asked the difference. He named the prices instead and we just decided to get the small. WHYYYYYYYY?!?!  The serving size for the small comes on the same plate as the bread they give you, this is most definitely not enough. It's honestly more worth it to get at least a medium since it's not that much more....but just get the large because it is fucking delicious.

For that day their sashimi consisted of salmon, hamachi, scallops and tuna. All of it just simply melted in your mouth. Despite the fact that I dislike scallops I surprisingly loved them raw! Good job! :D

Boyfriend also ordered a half dozen of the mixed raw oysters. I've only had oysters fried and didn't like it then so we weren't sure if I was going to like it raw...but I think almost every type of meat is delicious when it's not cooked. I loved the raw oysters! Very good and super fresh. Boyfriend said they were the best oysters he's had. 

Tip: They have a variety of hot sauces behind the counter, so if you want something that's not in front of you just ask.

We did get lucky and got the last of the crab fat. Perfect with the bread and butter .. and yes, we ate both butter and crab fat on our bread and as terrible as it is for you it's delicious and for a special occasion! Just wish it was warm but it was still worth it.

The last thing we got was a combo salad with louie which was also very good. All the seafood is extremely fresh tasting but that crab meat though...... I think that was my favorite on my salad. Extremely plump, will have to order the cocktail next time.

If you're not in the mood to wait in line or knock elbows with your neighbor every so often you can always order to go! This place is well worth the visit for any seafood lover...or someone who is just wanting to try it out.

Also...yes they deal with the food bare handed (like every chef does if you go into any kitchen)...and they sanitize by rubbing lemon on their hands. It's subtle but it works. 

PS... CASH ONLY CASH ONLY CASH ONLY ... three people had to leave the line to go to an atm
author: Melissa C.

description: Seafood is fresh and oh so delicious. Service is great and the decor is old and shabby. Seating is limited and the line was pretty long. Pretty pricey but well worth it. Just a touch of SF. A must if ur in the City!
author: Steven S.

description:
We came on a weekday just after opening and the line was already forming. It wasn't long, but people take awhile and the bar seating is so limited that it's hard to seat more than 2 people together, so we had to split up. And then they wouldn't let us sit together when seats immediately opened up, because someone was already serving them? Because water is so hard to bring over? Whatever.

We got a combo seafood salad, which was pretty big and it really is just different seafood on a pile of shredded lettuce. It was yummy though. The clam chowder was very clammy and not too creamy and very nice. The uni was the reason I wanted to come, and it was a little off-color, I felt. And the bread took effing forever bc our server didn't really know what was going on.

"No frills" is more frills than Swan Oyster Depot. There is hardly any room for our plates in front of us. Our waitress never checked on us and took forever to flag down and still wouldn't bring us bread. And she quoted us the wrong price on the uni. And the check (done by hand on a napkin and calculated in someone's head) was still wrong. REALLY? But at that point we were just like ok whatever we're not gonna teach you math right now and paid the check and left.

All in all, a nice lunch food-wise but I could have gone to a lot of other places and been more satisfied. Crossed that off my to-do list.
author: Vivian H.

description: Food was great and nice service. Queues was 2 hours at noon but glad we went anyway. Crab legs and oysters were yummy
author: Roadtrip T.

description:
Love this place. Will recommend to come early. Long wait as the seats are limited. Lots of travelers come here. 

Very fresh oysters! Definitely the best in San Francisco. Will recommend a warm day to eat all the fresh and cold seafood. 

Loved it!
author: Tick J.

description:
There are Oyster bars and the there are Oyster Bars with character.  I am not a fan of lining up and waiting for a meal, but my 60 minute wait was worth it.  The restaurant has only 18 bar stools and a wait that is typically 90-120 minutes, so we were lucky.

Once in we went for the Oysters. Since we are from the East Coast, they made a point of serving us West Coast Oysters. My wife then focused on Crab Louis, in her words it was fantastic.  I focused on the Sicilian Sashimi --imagine Sashimi tuna and salmon drenched in olive oil and capers. Excellent spin on the old sushi habit.

What goes best with a meal like this? A fresh pint of the Steam of course (Anchor Steam).

Highly recommend.  Bring a good book for your wait in line and pray to the Oyster gods for good weather.
author: Robert D.

description:
We didn't wait too long to go inside!!

We ordered crab back, oysters, cherry stone clams, clam chowder, and bread. The waiter recommended us to dip the bread with the juice in the crab back. It was very delicious. The oysters and clams were also fresh and delicious!!!! The clam chowder is watery and strong clam taste, but I still like it. Will def. go again before I leave SF!!!!!
author: Melody C.

description:
How can this oyster bar taste so much better - I dunno... But it does. 

FRESH FRESH FRESH! and cold. 

Crab salad is VERY simple which makes it outstanding. Iceberg with fresh dungeones crab. From the shell to the salad and no where in between to get old. Amazing. 

The oysters are so delicious, but the Sicilian Sashimi is to die for. 

Cash only and bring a lot of it. Show up at 11:15 or plan on waiting a couple hours in line. It's still worth it.
author: Frankie G.

description: Mongo no see swans. Mongo see fish. Lots and lots of fish. Mongo wait in long line. But Mongo no care. Mongo say wait for clam chowder was worth it! Yummy! Yummy! YUUUMMMYYYY!! And one beer! And two beer! And everybody nice to Mongo!
author: Mongo I.

description:
FOOD AND SERVICE
================
Seafood tasted fresh like it was just caught, and the service was friendly. For food freshness this is really top notch. The crab especially was extremely satisfying. No need for extra spices, the natural flavors of the seafood was more than enough. If you must have more flavoring, be sure to get their Louie sauce. 

While the clam chowder was good - it seemed a bit subpar to other places I've been. There are little bits of clam pieces so that left a lot to be desired, and the soup overall came out greasy. 

PRICE
=====
A bit expensive for what it is. I'm used to cheap, fresh seafood from good ole Louisiana. Our total bill came out to around $80 for: clam chowder, sea urchin, small smoked salmon, and combo salad. They have limited counter space so perhaps the higher price is to offset the lines going out the door and almost to the other block. 

OTHER
======
Line is outta this world! Be prepared to wait a while.
author: Fred W.

description:
Hands down the best seafood I've had ANYwhere. The raw scallops were divine, alongside the hamachi, tuna and salmon. Simply beautiful. & the oysters...well, I imagine it goes without saying: just incredible. 

The clam chowder wasn't my favorite, but on a cold day, you should get it. 

Prepare to wait 30 plus minutes for a seat at the bar. 

Also, CASH ONLY. I bet Chase Bank across the street gets a few frantic Swan customers. ;)
author: Emily Y.

description: Always no-frills and simple. Menu is on the wall. There may be a line...wait! You will be elbow-to-elbow with fellow diners...part of the experience. Clam chowder is buttery goodness full of potatoes and clams...great to dip your bread into. I love it here. The place needs no explanation and for that it truly speaks for itself. Staff are also funny how they interact with each other...what a great vibe!
author: Aaron T.

description:
I'm mad at myself because I just went here for the first time after nearly 15 years of visits to San Francisco. All those years I spent eating overpriced, so/so seafood at Fisherman's Wharf when I could've been chowing down on the real deal here! D'oh! Better late than never, I say. 

Swan Oyster Depot must be experienced! Get there early and be prepared to wait no matter what time of day. You'll be in a long line with mostly locals and a few "in the know" tourists, so strike up a conversation to pass the time. We were sandwiched between a crotchety old lady and a hipster couple who both lived in the area. Great conversations, let me tell you! Parking is super difficult here. You have to park on a busy street (good luck finding a meter). 

The restaurant is nothing fancy with a very small counter and stools with extremely limited seating. The seafood is fresh and delicious. This is an unpretentious, true divey experience. I love dives but even the cleanliness standards here concerned me a bit. 

There was no soap in the bathroom (it's not really even a real bathroom, sort of like a closet with a toilet in it), and I noticed on several occasions the guy behind the counter take cash money out of the register and lick his fingers to separate the bills, then go RIGHT BACK to serving up seafood with his bare hands -- he didn't wash them. Touching dirty money and licking his fingers, then taking his bare hands and scooping out handfuls of shrimp to serve in people's shrimp cocktails. No tongs, no gloves, using his bare hands as "spoons." Ewwww. This happened about 4 times and it sort of made me feel sick to my stomach (minus one star for that). I'd deduct even more stars but this place has such a great atmosphere and such good and fresh seafood that it outweighs the gross factor. 

Prices are high but I can't complain because it's the freshest seafood ever. Very good and tasty. If you are the least bit squeamish, don't watch the guys preparing your food!
author: Louisa M.

description:
I've lived here for 4 years and traveled here often for many years prior to that and haven't ever taken the time to wait in line despite what I had heard. Finally took the dive, and honestly it wasn't that bad, and I was happy I did. Luckily was the first "group" in... I'd say about 20 seats?? roughly. You get your own guy that serves you. Service is very very friendly and fun. CASH ONLY, fyi, and don't come with a party, 2-4 people is all you'd want with you. 
The food is amazing and fresh and it's everything everybody, including Bourdain, says about it. I mean there's not much more I can add to all the hype... it lives up to the hype. Sit down, chat, eat, and drink an Anchor Steam. 
Amazing place. Can't wait to go back.
author: Chuck R.

description:
Long wait in the heat.

Worth it. 

Crab backs. 

Oysters. 

The end.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Very rarely do I give out 5-stars, but this place was just amazing. Everything about it - the food, atmosphere, people,...

I'm pretty sure if you went into this place having a bad day, your mood would quickly turn around. The people behind the counter are all family, and just treat everyone that comes in with great service! There's only about 20 or so stools, so everyone sits close and enjoys the experience together. It's hard not to talk to the person sitting next to you, and probably end up ordering what they got!

The food... Amazing. Tried the crab fat (after seeing it on The Travel Channel). It was good, maybe not as good as it seemed on TV, but everything else made up for it. The clam chowder, crab cocktail, oysters - all amazing!

So far, my favorite place to eat in San Francisco.
author: Derrick S.

description:
I ve heard that this place is always packed, luckily, the day I went wasn't that busy, so I got seated really quick.

Ordered oyster for sure, clams and the shrimp cocktail.
They tasted really fresh, good enough without any sauces.
author: Natasha L.

description:
The lines can be outrageous and I think seafood places can be incredibly stinky sometimes, but I love this place. I remember seeing it on Rachel Ray way back when (like 10 years--does she still even have a show?) and before I moved to SF. It is definitely a mission to get in, as you have to wait forever, but the employees are spot on and the seafood (I only ever get oysters, I'll admit) is fresh, delish and oh-so-crave-making. Polk Street's not the most enticing part of the City, so just be aware of that. 

Oh, now I just want a dozen oysters!!!
author: Elle N M.

description:
Best crab salad around. Incredibly fresh (crab, oysters, shrimps).  Great combo salad (crab and shrimp).  They don't skimp on shell fish portions. Ask for fresh horseradish in cocktail sauce. 
Be sure to order clam chowder too. 
Expect to wait in long lines for to-go orders, and even longer if you want to get a table.
author: Kc E.

description: A true SF institution, serving some of the best oysters in town.  Classics like the Crab Louis won't disappoint.  I'd give it four stars, but Swan has become a tourist trap.  Lines extend down the block for the 20 or so stools at the no frills oyster bar.  I used to love this place, but with waits over an hour during the high season, it's just not worth it.
author: Ronald C.

description: Came here on a Wed around noon and waited in line for about 30 min.  I've always heard of this place but never got to try as I always find myself in the city on a Sun when they're not open!  I got a cup of clam chowder, combination salad with added smoked salmon, and a small Sicilian sashimi.  The combination salad was delectable with tons of crab meat and shrimp.  The Sicilian sashimi and smoked salmon were great as well.  It was around $50 for the two of us including a beer.  We enjoyed the meal and the portions were sufficiently sized!
author: Christina C.

description: I went on my birthday, solo, on a Friday, when the line was the longest. They gave me a beer in line, and funnily enough, I filed my taxes (thanks TurboTax mobile app.)  After about a two-hour wait--yes Friday afternoon is indeed a bad time to go--I got a seat snuggly between an already drunk Aussie on my left and a conservative yet highly funny couple on my right. The Aussie insisted I try the Santa Barbara uni, which I did, and the couple on my right shrieked when they saw the sea urchin's spines were still moving on my plate. This didn't deter my experience with the freshest uni I have ever had. The texture was way less dense than the Hokkaido counterpart, and was almost light as air, strangely enough. Another beautiful dish I got was the off-menu Sicilian sashimi, lightly sprinkled with olive oil, capers and a tad of red onion. Thanks Ben for the great suggestion. My last dish was the superb bottle neck clams. These were so fresh and I could probably live on these. I was comped several sauvignon blanc wines-- the only wine to have with these dishes-- and boy, it was one happy birthday. Ironically, I never tried an oyster. My bill exceeded the cash in my wallet, but they directly me to a nearby ATM and placed me on the honor system to return with cash. What awesome folks. Can't wait to return. Thanks!
author: Brian J.

description: We stood in line for over an hour on Wednesday. I'd like to say it was worth the wait but it wasn't. Not even remotely. My wife and I've been traveling the world for close to 15 years and we've visited many places and restaurants that Anthony Bourdain has visited in this time this was the first that was a complete and total let down. This place is a total dive and not in a good way. It's run down, very dirty inside and I wonder what their health rating is from the state. Some of the staff had so much grime on their "white" smocks I wonder if they'd been wearing the same one for days. This can't be sanitary. The food was a complete disappointment as well.  The smoked fish was not good at all, the "salad" was thousand island dressing on tiny shrimp and iceberg lettuce. I honestly don't feel like describing the rest of what we ate as I feel sick just describing the food and thinking about the complete lack of cleanliness of this place.
author: Heath P.

description:
Seafood lover's haven!  

They have oysters, shrimps, lobsters, crabs, scallops, salmon, calamari and more on window display and to dwell on to look at, while you wait in the scrutinized line!  

There is a line to this seafood depot because it is a hole in the wall seafood bar.  You sit along the bar and they should really think about expanding to next door since next door is up for lease!  The restaurants' hours are limited as well - closed on Sundays and stays open till 5:30pm!

One of the more important things while dining is smiling when serving your customers.  It is THE etiquette.  Period.  Our waiter was unhappy that day and his face showed it, clearly.  I felt like whenever I put an order here and there, he took the order as if he couldn't wait for us to finish and get out.  Other than that unpleasant vibe, the seafood was freshly above par.

The raw oysters tasted the best!  You can really taste the freshness and flavor of the sea oysters!  Yum!

Their sashimi scallops and salmon was okay.  The sashimi was drenched in olive oil and decorated with capers and chopped onions.  The fresh, sea flavor from the sashimi was taken away from, when the additional ingredients were used.  As for their shrimp cocktail, I have had better.  It was simple.

I know this place is trying to keep it old school by having the menu only on the board, cash solely for tab, keeping this a hole-in-the-wall seafood bar and setting the ambiance as if it was back in the days, but they should really reconsider on expanding and making the hours more convenient!  It will move the line!  

For me, I had an unpleasant host/server and the seafood was generally alright.  I would only wait in line again, to order up their raw oysters!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Super fresh + high turnover make this place worth the wait. I stick with oysters, clam chowder and crab cocktail.
author: E E.

description:
Update:

I revisited Swan Oyster Depot three more times since my last visit. And can officially say that I have been converted to loving Swan Oyster Depot.

I made the mistake last year of coming too late, ordering the wrong things to go. Swan Oyster Depot it really meant to be a seafood bar, where you sit, drink, slurp on some bivalves and talk to your neighbors. The seafood here is indeed very fresh, and quite a deal compared to other places in the area.

I highly recommend getting their blue point oysters, kumamotos (these are smaller but quite meaty and flavorful), littleneck clams (these are huge!) and cherry stone clams. Apart from that, their crab meat is also delicious on its own. Don't get the salad or shrimp, there's nothing that special there. On a good day, they will also have fresh caught sea urchin. Sea urchin gonads- uni is a delicious delicacy of the sea. It's even better when it is fresh. Lastly, I like the Sicilian style sashimi with capers, lemon juice and olive oil. The scallop, salmon and hamachi are all equally delicious. I can't rave enough of how sweet and tender fresh scallop is. So good!

The wait can be long, but you'll get in if you line up 2 hours before closing (weekday) and 3 hours before closing (weekend)
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Waited for over an hour. 
Finally we got a chair to sit down, but I have to squeeze into the space. 
I was still very excited to try since was my first time there. 
However, we got the worst service. Food take a long time to come.
Clam chowder was so watery, only clam juice and milk.
Also Keep having small broken shell inside the oysters.
After that don't feel like to order anything anymore.
Super disappointed.
author: J C.

description: No. Don't do it... Don't fall for the hype! We were visiting and a gf of mine has been wanting to try this place so we made the stop. We arrived 20 min after they opened and there was a line as we were part of the 2nd wave of folks to be seated. Absolutely not worth the wait - food is really mediocre and nothing memorable. I am a huge seafood lover and this place just did not satisfy nor impress. Cash only establishment so come prepared or there's a Chase bank across the street.
author: Hungry H.

description:
The 2 stars is for the 2 hours wait time and mediocre seafood.  As a local I would never visit here but "luckily" some friends were visiting from out of town so fortunately I also got a chance to have my verdict. 

To be fair below is the breakdown of what we had:
1) Clam chowder: the best dish out of everything we've tried. However 100% not worth the wait. 
2) Oyster plate: Miyagi is tasty as always but if you can get the fresh ones from somewhere else that's definitely preferable.
3)  Sashimi Plate: this is not on the menu displayed on their wall but we saw other people have ordered so decided to try it. This turned out to a miss since all we know about sashimi is the japanese style without much of garnish and sauce, which is everything but for this dish. 

Verdit:
SF locals: please never waste your time here as there are so many places that offer Happy Hour oysters for $1-$2 each. Go there! Or please rent a car and drive up to Tamales Bay to bring home a bag of 50 oysters for $50 from Tomales Bay Oyster Company (unfortunately they had to remove the picnic tables starting Dec 2015 due to some Marin County codes so no more BBQ). 

Tourists: please plan your trip wisely. It's totally fine to take a picture in front of the restaurant made famous by your beloved Anthony Bourdain but it's not okay to waste 3 hours of your precious time in the beautiful San Francisco (don't get me wrong, I absolutely LOVE his style and personality. But food is a very personal experience and I don't always agree with his opinions for the SF restaurants he's dined at on his shows)  If you want to have clam chowder, go to any of the stands on Taylor Street at Fisherman's Wharf that cook fresh seafoods on the spot. Or just try to be a local and go for the Happy Hour $1/$2 oysters on a weekday.
author: Nina T.

description: After having a really poor experience over at WaterBar, we decided to drive over to Swan for a late lunch. We waited about 30-45min for 2 of us. The wait went by very fast and the staff at Swan was very fun to watch. The seafood itself is what deserves the 5 stars though. Everything was very tasty and was extremely fresh.
author: Tony I.

description:
I really enjoyed this place! The service was great and the food is even better. We came here at around 10:15am on a Sunday and there was already a line out the door. Luckily for us, we got in! We ordered a sample of a dozen oyster, crab cake, clam chowder, small sashimi, and a crab back for 3 girls. 

Oyster: The oyster were fresh and they have a lot of varieties. Made to order.

Crab Cake: This was definitely my favorite. The Asian side of me like this dipped with salt, pepper, and some lemon. 

Clam Chowder: Nothing special about this dish however, we devoured it anyways. 

Sashimi: They were so fresh and the presentation looks nice! The Yellow tail literally melts in my mouth. 

Crab back: The fattest part of the crab but yet the yummiest.
author: Diana S.

description: Great food, nd authentic old-fashioned feel to the place. It's a find.
author: Left C.

description:
When you see a photo on the wall of the staff back when it first opened, then realize that it's the same crew working today, you know it's the real deal. 

The service for this dive oyster bar was so friendly. The seafood was so fresh, the oysters were great. But the crab fat was the best I ordered it with some bread and soaked it up.
author: Thomas R.

description:
Thank goodness we were the second to last group before the cutoff. 

There's always going to be a long line, as they only have counter seating for about...15, 20 people at a time? 

Their choice of seafood is amazing, fresh, and available for everyone to see. I saw people coming in to buy seafood by the pound also, but anyway, on to the...

Oysters! We split a small plate of half-dozen oysters. There were three kinds, each with their distinct texture and smell, and for the life of me I can't remember which ones they offered...but the important thing is that they were fresh! Actually, wait a minute...ah, my favorites were definitely the kumamoto ones. Not sure why, but the briney-ness made it much more appealing to me. They offer hot sauce, some house sauce made with horse radish, and your quintessential lemon wedges to complement the oysters. 

A little pricy, but it's well worth it imo. Cash only though, so beware.

Note: Next time I'm coming back her to try the sashimi!
author: Viet N.

description:
A must-try for visitors to SF!  Will definitely return here on future trips to SF!  

Read about Swan Oyster Depot in a magazine article and mentally bookmarked here.  Then a couple of friends raved about SOD.  Alrighty, let's try here, then!  Thank you, Ramfis, for the strong recommendation!

If you do your research, you know that you are in store for a wait.  We were in line for approx. 1.5 hours.  Stand in line for 1.5 hours?  What?!?!  Was it worth it?  Hell yes!  Definitely worth the wait!

Why the long wait?  Limited seating.  Basically a long counter and it is usually packed with patrons...

What makes here sooo gooood?!  Fresh seafood... raw, uncooked, and pure!

The goodies we tried.... 

Crab cocktail - loaded with crab chunks!  Of the seafood cocktails they offer, i think the crab one is the best.  We also tried the mixed seafood cocktail but pure crab was much better!

Crab guts - ultimate crab flavor!

Oyster sampler - Blue Point, Kumamoto, Miyagi.  I preferred the Kumamoto and Miyagi varieties--seemed sweeter.

Clam chowder - not as creamy as other establishments.  I would pass on this.

Clam platter - What's not to love?

Alas, on this day, they were out of fresh uni.  The prize catch for me was missing!  Darn!!  Some days they have uni, some days they don't.  My buddies went the very next day and got uni!

Will try the seafood salad next trip!

Remember what you purchased because they don't run a tab and ask you afterwards what you had ordered.  Honor system breeds honesty!

Couple of weeks removed from SF and I keep thinking of this place!  100% garanteed to return here on my next trip to SF!
author: Mark H.

description:
Extremely worth the 2 hour wait.
Definitely recommend getting there before opening time.

The Oysters are amazing (both west cost and east coast), and the Combination seafood salad is well worth the cost. 
Also would highly recommend getting their signature dish (off menu) the Crab Fat. Tastes absolutely heavenly dipped in buttered bread.
The smoked salmon plate was also good, but is quite a steep cost for the amount of Salmon you get. Still good though!
author: Annie C.

description:
Came here the other day about 30 mins before opening, line already had about 20 something people and I was the 25th one.  I waited roughly 45 mins before I was able to order.

Not sure how to feel about this place.  I came for the crab back/crab mustard and it was ok, it's cold and you just eat it with bread.  Not too bad.  Also had 6 oysters and 6 clams, nice and fresh.  Also had crab cocktail and clam chowder.  The crab was not as sweet as I was expecting, and the chowder didn't have much substance, seems watery.  

To me, it's not really anything special, everything is pretty much served up raw except for the crab and chowder.  I guess this is the place to go with you want to wait a long time just to eat some raw seafood.  The thing I might have to question is their cleanliness, they use their hands to grab whatever... crab, lettuce or whatever else and put it in a plate for you after that they handle other stuff, like dirty money.

I probably wouldn't come back to be honest, the wait and for what it is is just not worth it for me.  But don't let that stop you from getting your seafood on.
author: I Will A.

description: Went here at 11:30 a.m. on a Saturday and the line was already out the door. A two hour wait, but worth it. Ordered the clam chowder and it was so delicious on such a cold day. The oysters were so fresh that it felt as though they literally just came from the ocean. All the staff are really nice and very accommodating. The place is definitely a hole in the wall/dinner style seating with 19 seats. First timers to this place should come here for the the food and the ambiance. Tip: If you don't want to deal with the crowds and the long wait, order the food to go. Also, the place only takes cash. Make sure you bring at least $50/person since you won't leave the place below that amount.
author: Lanai L.

description:
Person: Hey! Cool you went to Swan Depot?! How was the cracked crab? It was delicious wasn't it eh? I mean with all that gooey crab roe paste...  

Me: I didn't' f#%king have the crab... It wasn't available... The earliest catch wouldn't be until Saturday (today was Wednesday)... Neither was there any uni... FAIL

After Mr. Bourdain's visit on Layover, all we wanted to do was wait in line for hours and copy cat his order. Lucky for us there was only a 5 minute wait. 

There is Elvis and classic rock playing in the background. A row of bar seats greeted us inside with marble counters. 

A bowl of clam chowder to share. The consistency isn't very thick but has a tasty ocean scent with morsels of calms. Abundant oyster crackers are in a bowl on the counter for your pleasure. 

Next up we ordered a combination salad of prawns, shirmp, smoked salmon and trout over a bed of lettuce. Almost everyone had ordered this and it would only be smart to follow suit. It was very fresh and homemade thousand island dressing on the side. 

Salmon sashimi served with olive oil, diced raw red onions, lots of capers and lemon juice. Almost like a ceviche cross carpaccio, the freshness was brightened by capers. 

This was an excellent afternoon snack over Stella! Plus, these guys can do math quicker than you can whip out your credit card! Oh wait! Swan Depot only takes cash or cheque.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Wonderful Oysters and Clams served by people who seem to genuinely love what they do.  The Dungeness Crab cocktail is a marvel of engineering.  A massive portion of fresh cooked crab leg pieces.  Next time I will order the cocktail sauce on the side, as it tends to overpower the crab.   We started with a cooked and chilled crab head, which is arguably the best part of the crab.  It's a crime that most people throw it away! 
Really good bread, and good, cold local beer on tap  It's an expensive splurge to be sure, but when you think about the cost of a really good sushi meal, it's kind of on par.   You are advised to get there as close to opening as possible so as to avoid the lineups that can snake out the door down the block.   This is a real San Francisco gem.   If you like seafood, you'll love this place!
author: Robert B.

description:
-- ) stars..

By Far a tourist Trap!

Long time to wait to be seated in a stuffed restaurant where employees use there hands to handle money then your next meal. 

I have lived in the neighborhood for years and this is the second and last time I will ever go. The salads use cheap lettuce, no choice of dressing but a Mayonnaise in house dressing that was not very good. The worst part is that employees us there hands to cut, sort,serve your food and the worst part was that the older man who was prepping a salmon plate had fungus in his nails, no gloves. I was actually disgusted. The food is over priced. Yes, it soo recommended by many but for me it was an over priced disgusting dirty little old restaurant. NEVER AGAIN!

Everyone talks about this place being so living up to the hype, Oh my what HYPE?? Perhaps I have had too much good food everywhere else that this place to me and my husband is the worst..
author: Alejandra P.

description: Finally made it to Swan Oyster Depot and here are my tips: it's at least a 2 hour wait, no matter which way you slice it. Show up 2 hours before opening if you want to be seated when they open. Order the crab cocktail instead of the crab legs - about the same amount of crab and less work. I would skip the crab back - it's not my thing. Get the bread and smoked salmon - omg! Their smoked salmon may be the best I've had. The chowder is a little more watery than my taste but it was still good.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Even for a weekday this place is busy!

There are only 20 seats at the counter, so expect a wait. We went on a Monday morning, and we waited 45 mins to grab a couple seats.

Tried the following:
-Cups of clam chowder: I didn't care of the clam chowder. I felt it was too watery. Definitely tasted like clam.
-Dozen oysters (4 kinds-Miyaga, Kumamoto, Blue Point and ): The highlight and the most expensive. Expect to pay $$$ for oysters on a half shell. 
-Shrimp cocktail: Mounds of shrimp! Delicious!!!

The guys who work there are down to earth. Good service for the most part. It's cash only so be prepared to spend some serious cash on yummy seafood.
author: Maria C.

description:
