Oysters were on point, dungeness crab back was amazing, sashimi platter was bomb and the combo salad didn't disappoint. I just wished they had uni today, but I will definitely be back for more.
author: Aaron N.

description:
Yes. This place is as good as it gets!  The store may look old and shabby because it's been around for so many years, but the seafood here is so darn fresh and good!!  The dining area is really small (prolly 20-25 customers max. occupancy) and therefore, the line of hungry seafood lovers waiting outside the store is long....i mean, REALLY LONG!!!  

One afternoon my boyfriend and I went over there for lunch and waited about 1 HOUR 15 MINS just to be seated; thank God for the cool, breezy weather *phew*  We finally got inside the store and ordered:

- Cup of Clam Chowder: hmmm....Just meh.....too watery.....sorta bland in flavor.

- Sour dough bread & butter: Complimentary? You Wish!! You have an extra dollar?

- Half a dozen of Cherrystone clams on the half shell: I loved 'em but boyfriend thought they tasted a tad too fishy?!?!?!  oh well he's just weird sometimes hahaa~ i enjoyed those fresh clams a lot!

- Half a dozen of oysters (2 of each of the 3 different kinds available in-store): both Boyfriend and I loved and enjoyed 'em! Fresh and creamy.

- Combination Seafood Salad: O.M.G. it is beyond words!! Seriously, the Louie dressing was really really good, and all the seafood was fresh and scrumptious!!  I loved the itty-bitty shrimp that were amazingly soft and sweet!  This salad was worth my FIVE STARS!!  You MUST get the salad with Louie dressing, ok?!

Sorta Pricey, but the freshness of the seafood was totally worth it.  Service was prompt and friendly.  

In brief, Swan Oyster Depot is worth your time and your money!
author: Ada L.

description:
CELEBRATING 100 YEARS!!!

The Swan was our first stop on our day in The Bay. Its been a good while since we've been back, and figured we were long overdue for a return.
Yes, its an institution, landmark, and a must if you're in the city and if you're seeking some of the best seafood around.

The line out the door may be the reason some never dine here,(we waited about 30-45 minutes) but if you know what you're in for, you won't mind the wait time at all. Yes, you can get an order to go, but there's nothing like sitting up at the counter, soaking in the atmosphere, and chatting with the staff about the history and culture of SOD/SanFrancisco while suckin' down some rocks and Anchor Steam on tap? Simply the best!

Did you know that some of the stools (The ones with the wood top and steel frame)
that the diners sit on were bought secondhand after the great earthquake of 1906?
Just some of the little tidbits you'll findout after "talking story" with the guys.
Sourdough bread is delivered to you while the guys are filling your order as well. We started with a couple of Clam Chowders and ordered their mixed selection of oysters which included Blue Points, Kumamotos, and Miyagis, and Ice Cold Anchor Steam to go with our meal.

The chowder had pretty good flavor, but had a separated, broken appearance probably because the soup warmer was too hot-its better at Boudin...The mixed oysters were the best part and you could dress'em up any way you wanted- as is, lemon, cocktail, Tabasco, or their mignonette. Totally worth the wait. As you leave, they give you a Swan Oyster Depot sponge, business card, and a post card, and invite you back in the future...what service! Bring some green, because they don't take plastic...ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(250/365) "Rocks and Suds at the Swan"
author: Nelson Q.

description: The service is wonderful. It feels like family in here and the crab is unbelievable.
author: Elise S.

description: line makes no sense for the quality of food you can get with a reservation or a walk in at another Sf restaurant not having to wait for hours. The food is not bad any means, but the line doesn't merit the food that awaits.
author: michael m.

description: Solid place, great food, fun times, quick and easy. Get the crab fat with a cold Anchor. Cannot go wrong.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
90 minutes in line but worth it for the chowder, oysters and crab salad. Everything was super fresh   Crab salad was decent value considering how much lump crab got piled on the plate. I got their vinaigrette with the crab juice added to it as well as the Louis dressing. Service was professional, friendly and quick. 

Not sure that long of a wait makes sense for my next visit to SF. I think the locals have the formula right by calling in their order and picking up. That's what I wld do next time
author: Carol L.

description: We went here with our son and daughter in law and we absolutely loved the experience. The food was amazing and the atmosphere made it fun and different. We would all go back! Don't miss the opportunity to experience this SF landmark!
author: Kimberlee P.

description:
45 min wait on a Thursday around 1. But definitely worth the wait. The entire staff is super friendly and the food is amazing.

I got the smoked salmon and a small plate of the Sicilian style sashimi. Everything was amazing. Pricey, but amazing.
author: Michelle B.

description: Well worth the 2 hour wait. The staff was really cool and the food is just amazing. You have to try the crab back. Waiting in line also makes you meet cool people.
author: Robert R.

description: We hate the wait but are always thrilled once we get out seats. The oysters are amazing. Fresh briney and served perfectly. The half crab is easy to eat and or so sweet. The chowder is lovely and not thick and gooey. The best Patti's after the long wait no on rushes you out. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I agree the wait is long but in the end it is worth it
author: nancy s.

description: The wait was long. They close at 5:00 so hurry. Very small but the food is so fresh . We ordered everything! From oyster to sea urgent- my fave! The smoked Salmon is to die for! The crabs are the best here , better then any place I've had before. People would order to go because the stop the line 1 hour before closing. Order quick and enjoy!
author: Trinh N.

description:
My friend and I went to Swan Oyster Depot on a very rainy Friday afternoon around 2:30 pm thinking there would be no line. Wrong. There was a line out the door; however, we were informed we could take out and have our food right away. Therefore, we placed a takeout order and ate it at home. BEST. DECISION. EVER. The professionally wrap everything to go and include all the topics, bread, sauces etc. 

They were incredible nice and despite the hectic line everyone there was positive, relaxed, and helpful.

the order:
mixed seafood salad - 5 (huge amount of food, best dressing especially to dunk bread in)
Sashimi - 5 (loved the read to eat preparation with olive oil, salt, and pepper
author: Jodi R.

description: Extremely overhyped!!! My friend and I stood in line for two hours and having lived in Boston for a long time we are no strangers to seafood. We were not impressed. I ordered the smoked salmon and the had run out of capers. The food was nothing to write home about.
author: Tahseen J.

description: i loved it here... i know many tourists also visit, but its a bit away from the downtown. We queued and it was worth the wait... and then started drinking at 10am... did i mention we here early... so beer and fish in the early morning it was a great start to the day. seating at the counter means you can watch everything going on... great atmos and worth the visit... I will be going back
author: Reg B.

description:
Meh. This place is all hype. There is nothing special or unique about this establishment. The workers don't wear gloves so they handle the food with their bare hands. Talk about unsanitary! For obvious health reasons, please wear sanitary gloves! 
Only menu is on the wall and honestly they can charge you whatever price they want without you knowing. We ordered a dozen oysters, bowl of clam chowder and the trio of sashimi Sicilian style...total came to $60.  I felt like they overcharged us for something but sucked it up and gave them our money. Please do not wait more than half an hour for this place because you will be disappointed!
author: Lisa Z.

description:
I have wited for 2 hours
I saw them use hand for everything. They pick up the food and money by same hand
author: Minh D.

description:
The service here is pretty inviting despite how cramped the space is. I ordered a 1/2 doz of the cherrystone clams and blue point oysters and then the uni. I thought the uni was extremely fresh - it was still moving as the waiter placed it in front of me. The clams and oysters were also shucked right in front of me - as fresh as you can get! 

Come on a weekday at 10:30am sharp. Otherwise expect a wait!
author: Kevin M.

description:
I would definitely recommend this place!!!Some of the BEST Oysters I've had In my life!!
The locals in the area must be quite upset after Anthony Bourdain leaked this spot to the world.

What we had - clam chowder, dozen mixed oyster, tuna and salmon sashimi plate, prawn cocktail and about 6 beers!
Can't fault anything. Was 100%.

The staff are so friendly and good to have a laugh with.

We got here at 10am to make sure we got a seat for when it opens up at 10.30am
By 10.30am there was a 30 person line behind us so make sure you turn up early.
Well worth it!!!

Thanks guys!!
author: Glen C.

description:
I'm definitely a fan. Came in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon--30-minute wait. Fortunately, the weather was fabulous so we didn't mind the line out the door. The entire restaurant is a single bar lined up with stools on a first come first serve basis. Not a place you want to come with more than 2 people. It might get a little hairy trying to find a seat.

We went with a half dozen of mixed variety oysters (Kumamoto, Blue Point, Miyagi). The Blue Points were my favorite but they were all uber fresh. You can dress them up to your personal preference. They have the usual hot + cocktail sauce but they have these housemade relish like sauces on the bar--reach for the jalapeno one! SO GOOD.

We also ordered a mixed salad. Although everyone on Yelp suggested the crab, why limit yourself to 1 meat when you can have 4--or was it 5? From what I could remember, the mixed salad had 2 types of crab and 2 types of shrimp (sml + lrg) piled atop a bed of shredded iceberg lettuce. Again, all at the peak of freshness. This came with a tarter sauce which we asked for on the side. I highly recommend you get it on the side. It was far too heavy to drench the salad in. Fortunately we had all the other sauce options to eat it with.

No frills place to get some legit seafood. Enjoy!
author: Yuhi K.

description:
I'm from Seattle, and used to really good seafood.  This past weekend during my foodie trip to San Fran, one of my stops was SOD.  There was no disapointment here, only pleasure!  My sister, cousin, her hubby and I showed up at 10:15am to wait in the line.  There were enough people ahead of us (restau opens at 10:30) that we were the last to make 1st sitting (we were #12-15), there was only one barstool left after we sat.

I soon found out why seafood lovers make their pilgrimage here-- the focus was on incredibly FRESH seafood.  My sister and I shared a 1/2 dozen combo of hama hama clams and oysters.  I asked for whatever was local/ not Washington state since a lot of what they had were sourced from MY home state.  My cousin's hubby was intrigued enough to try his first raw oyster... and fell in love, naturellement! :)

I also tried the smoked salmon on rye, but my favorite by far was the raw scallops.  Sliced thinly and served in a mixture of olive oil, salt, pepper, and sprinkled with capers and red onion, this was truly heaven on a plate!  My sister got the mixed raw plate-- ahi tuna, scallops, and salmon and was just as blissed out as I was.  It was so good (and healthy and fresh) that I didn't even feel guilty about the glass of crisp white wine (ahem.. or two) I ordered at 10:30am!!

Oh yeah, and the flirty counter "boys" didn't hurt, at least on our end of the counter! ;)
I am totally in agreement of SOD making BA's list of 20 Most Important Restaurants in America, just think they should have been higher up the list than No. 20!
author: Arti N.

description: What a wonderful experience: try to seat where the owner, Tom is helping--especially pleasant and nice person. If not Tom, ask for Andrew. But everyone is great. Superb crab salad. I liked the combination salad even better. The sashimi does not seem to be on menu, but if you ask they serve several beautiful fish. Oysters and clams are really fresh.Bread super. If have choice try to come weekdays and preferably before they even  open.  All Cash only.
author: Ed P.

description:
I LOVE Swan Oyster Depot. It's my neighborhood go-to spot and I wish i could go there all the time. The oysters are great although I'm pretty new to oysters. The combination salad is my favorite. It's hearty and meaty - and great for people who like seafood, but can't do the uni or other questionable things. I've also had the sashimi - an off the menu item that's so fresh. I didn't love how much olive oil they put on it, but it was still great. The sashimi doesn't even need anything on it. Chowder is good, but I prefer creamier chowders. Lastly, we had the crab back - a little aggressive for me, but my boyfriend absolutely loved it. 

The staff is so great there. They're always joking around. If you like sports, they'll talk your ear off.
author: Tessa C.

description:
We got here at about 11 and ended up waiting 2 hours. Definitely a long wait but this place was everything I had imagined and more!

First things first, this place is CASH ONLY. So make sure you come correct! There is a chase bank across the street if you need some $$$. Secondly, with a line as long as there usually is at Swan's they will sell you beers you can drink in line (I guess SFPD just turns a blind eye to it) so feel free to walk up to the front ask for some brews. They will give you them in red solo cups to enjoy. Makes the wait a bit more bearable.

We were super juiced once we got to our seats and couldn't wait to dig in. Here is the run down of everything we devoured:
1. Crab Cocktail - Basically huge chunks of crab in a dish with cocktail sauce on the side. How could you not love it?
2. Claim Chowder - It looked watery and as if the cream had broken when we got it which wasn't appetizing, but I got to say it tasted great. Awesome flavor and chalk full of clams and potatos
3. Bread & Butter - Nice crusty bread to go with the raw seafood
4. Oysters - We had a dozen of them and they were gerat. Big and plump. The thai chili sauce they have is freaking amazing!
5. Clams - I had never had raw clams before and wasnt sure which ones to go with. So the kind man behind the counter brought out a sampler for me one of each so I can try them. Such awesome service. I picked which kind I wanted and noticed he had thrown in a few extra clams. Sweet!
6. Sashimi (Hamachi, Tuna, Salmon, Halibut & Scallops) - They have 3 sizes, small, medium and large. We go tthe medium and it was plenty. 4 slices of each kind of seafood adn it was so good. Capers, olive oil and a little lemon is all you need. We devoured this.
7. Beer - $5 for some stella is a deal! After we tipped them out my husband still had a quarter of beer left in his glass. THe guy grabbed it and before we could say Hey he was already filling it up - you know just to "refresh the bubbles" Grade A service!

I don't think I could recommend this place enoug. Yeah its gotten tourisy, yeah its a long line but its totally worth it. Fresh seafood, great price and stellar service!
author: Lucy F.

description:
Pretty good seafood. I recommend the crab cocktail which is served with their homemade tartar sauce which is pretty good. We got the crab head with it which has the guts which I think is the best part. 

The oysters were fresh. They have 3 different kinds so we got a mixed dozen which consists of Miyagis,  Kumamotos, and Blue Points. 

The clam chowder is the watery kind which I am not really a fan of. 

The raw clams were delicious as well. 
Didn't leave full or anything. 
Had two teas and all this for 76$.
author: Heejin L.

description: Delicious, fresh seafood! The price is reasonable for the quality. But be prepared, the line is LONG! Tuesday lunch hour wait was about an hour and fifteen minutes.
author: Sally K.

description:
Huge hype around this place, and I'd say it's well-founded. Get there early (there was a line out the door before it even opened). It's first come, first served at the bar. It's a very small space, so not many can eat at a time. 

I was lucky enough to be part of the first batch seated on a Friday morning, and man was that a great breakfast! They unfortunately didn't have the half-cracked crab I really wanted, but the rest of the meal was fantastic anyway.

Clam Chowder: On the thinner side, but definitely packed with clam flavor. Delish!

Dozen Oysters: SO worth the price. It's amazing to see the subtle flavor differences between different types of oysters. Get it! Eat it with the mignonette they serve at the bar.

Combination Seafood Cocktail: I love the raw oyster and raw clam, along with the crab meat and jumbo shrimp. I wasn't much a fan of the smaller shrimp at the bottom of the cup -- they were tiny (like the shrimp you get it a Cup of Noodles) and didn't have much texture or flavor, just filler. But the rest of the seafood was so worth the price.

Uni: They had fresh sea urchin when I was there. If you like sea urchin, this is the place for you. It was perfectly custardy and creamy with a slight floral taste to it. It was so fresh! I've never had uni this fresh.

Add some bread and butter to the meal and you're all set. All this was enough to feed two people. I love how you can see them working and preparing the fresh seafood right in front of you.
author: Angelica K.

description: It's tasty but not worth one hour line. It's hard to tell what's the difference of oysters between here and others. It's really fresh. I like shrimp cocktail. Don't recommend smoke fish. Sea urchin is okay. $100 per person is not worthy. Won't come back
author: Sylvanas W.

description:
Not sure what all the hype is about. Friendly staff, but the place looks like it hasn't been cleaned in a year and like a previous reviewer stated they use their bare hands to scoop up and serve seafood salad.

The food was nothing special and the oysters were not good left a bad aftertaste in my mouth. Not worth the hour wait!
author: Peter C.

description:
Wow!! What can I say. Food was great, customer service was exceptional, ambiance was what to expect! 
Was a group of four and one actually is allergic to shell fish. Our server made her feel a part of the group. Offered her cereal (lol) other types of fish and anything else he could think of. Awesome!! He could've said "sorry" let someone else have the seat. But no!! She did enjoy the champagne tho. 
What a great experience!!!
author: Russ B.

description:
Four of us came here on a Friday around 2pm. We'd thought there won't be much of a crowd since it's a weekday at a some-what off hour. We couldn't be more wrong! The line for a seat was out the door and spanned two store fronts. It took us 1.5 hours to get in the door and at that point, we didn't want to wait any longer so we didn't even sit together! 

We split up into two's and two of us ordered a bowl of clam chowder ($5), dozen of mixed oysters ($26), sashimi plate ($18), and an Anchorsteam ($4). I didn't have the chowder, but I heard it was really good. It's not super creamy and filling, and it had a big chunks of clams. The mixed oysters had three varieties: Mi Yagi, Blue Point and Kumamoto. They were really fresh and excellent! It tasted great just by itself with a  splash of lemon. The sashimi was SUPERB! There was salmon, tuna and scallops. Everything was extremely fresh, succulent, and sweet (the natural kind of sweetness). It was drizzled with olive oil, lemon juice, capers, and raw red onions. I pushed the onions to the side because it overpowered the fresh fish. This was one of the best sashimi plates I've had!

The other two of our party ordered at least twice as much: clams, oysters, chowder, crab, wine, bread, etc etc.... and their total was less than ours! It was because they had some sort of connection with UC Berkeley. He asked what they ordered and after, basically said, "Uhh, just give me $40." Haha!

Anyways, Swan Oyster Depot offers really fresh seafood, but I would not wait 1.5 hours next time. It might have been that it was a holiday that there was more people than normal.
author: Leslie P.

description: Very fresh and delicious seafood! We were lucky that we didn't have to wait a bit today but there is usually a long eating line. The business seems to be family owned, maintaining its old way fo managing the business, no reservation, no website nor self-promoted social media sites, and it's cash only!
author: Yawen H.

description:
Cozy Nob Hill institution...everyone knows and respects Swan Oyster Depot.

Love everything offered- Shrimp Cocktail, Clam Chowder, Oysters, Crab - all delicious.

Come with just one companion..or order to-go. It's just a bar table-top so you'll be cozy with neighbors. For the price, I prefer to take it to-go and eat it in a more relaxed ambiance.
author: Veronica S.

description:
Food? Eh. Or meh. Or whatevs.
Best thing I can say about this place:
Really *great* service.
It seems though that other patrons weren't as lucky. The older gents are waaaaay nicer it seems. (Pray you aren't served by the 1 or two 20something Cali hipsters & their 'young' smartypants attitudes)....I digress....
After a long wait (got in line @ 3pm on a Wed, seated @ 430pm) we ordered.
Again, *our* service was great.

Crab/Lobster salad: was 80% lettuce. The few bits of crab and lobster seemed like they'd be good had there been enough to taste...they do have all kinds of hot sauces available & plenty of lemons out for the grabbing (awesome cuz I hate having to beg for lemon everywhere else!!!)
Clam chowder: you should know for $2.75 a cup that it's gonna be crap. We did, ordered it anyway to warm up after the long cold/windy 2 hour wait outside. Yeah its weak, but again, it's just a warm up (like tea).
Supposedly no Uni/urchin available...lanky hipster moustache young guy behind counter claims not til September (i think he's full of sh¡t, since you can get it at ANY Japanese spot year round..this is SF, wtf??) I feel like he just didnt want to get stuck w serving it as they were nearing closing time. Maybe im being judgemental. Maybe I just didn't like his face. Or his corny tatoos.
Clam cocktail-small and meh. Again you can dress it how you like but its still too small to really matter.
Best tasting items were the too-tough-to-comfortably-chew complimentary bread, & the side of Louie our server gave us to eat w it.
We ordered a crab back (to dunk the bread in, since the bread was the best thing going for this spot), it too was 'just okay' after doctoring w lemon & hot sauce & pepper & more lemon & salt- you get it, bland.
Actually, everything we had was, well bland. Mostly small portions of actual seafood, which is a bummer. 
This food is waaay overpriced. The experience is waaaaay overated. You will be hungry an hour later. Being lucky enough to score the attendant w the best service attitude of the bunch is why im bumping up from 2 to three stars. Even if I was ridiculously rich, like gentrification, tech-nerd rich, I STILL wouldn't come back.
Do it *once*, write the $100+ expenditure off as a 1 time thing, & join me in realizing that anyplace Bourdain visits on his TV show is an overpriced, no-flavor tourist trap. At this point its pretty obvious he's just helping out his restaurant-owner homies worldwide.
F- you Anthony. You have played us for the LAST time.
(Drops mic & walks to Little Saigon for a real, actual filling meal @ 1/20th the cost)
author: G D.

description:
This is one of those places like a small diner in my home town that you admire for it's pure simplicity and dedication to great food.  The concept here is nothing but San Francisco's freshest seafood cooked to perfection, or not cooked in the case of sashimi.   The only seating is along a bar on stools which are well worn and not the most comfortable.  The food is wonderful if you are in the mood for seafood.

The sour dough bread we were served was the best sour dough I have ever eaten.  With the pure butter, I could have easily made a meal on that alone.  We tried several dishes.  The crab meat cocktail was very good, very visually appealing presentation as was everything.  The West coast crab we don't find quite as flavorful as Eastern blue crab but nonetheless was very good.  My son tried the Sicilian style Sashimi and found it outstanding.  The scallops were his personal favorite.  The clam chowder was very good, rich and with a nice clam flavor.    I had a crab Louie salad which I would describe as a "naked" crab Louie because it was stripped to the essentials- lettuce, generous serving of crab and a rich, creamy Louie dressing.  Everything went together perfectly.   We tried a crab back with the awesome bread and found it very good.  We think we would have enjoyed it more if served warm, rather than cold.  Service was very fast, the staff extremely friendly and accommodating, and no sense of rush or hurry once you were seated.

We got here around 11 on a Tuesday morning and only had about a 45 minute wait.  Be prepared for a very rough time watching all the seafood being served before your eyes as you stand with your salivary glands getting overstimulated.  We noticed several people avoiding the line and ordering seafood for carryout.  If you had no time for waiting and had a nearby place to enjoy it, this might be a welcome tip.
author: Milton S.

description:
Literally one of the coolest places ever! Got there an hour early 2nd in line!
Crab was amazing and anchor on tap!
author: Jared B.

description: Freshest & best seafood I've ever had. The wait was more than worth it. The staff is super friendly & social with customers. If you want to experience San Francisco this is the place. This one place makes me want to move to California.
author: Derrick S.

description: My favorite is the cracked crab and oysters on the half shell and wash it down with a glass of beer.
author: Gina P.

description: Go here early but its worth the wait.  Came here on a Saturday morning July 1st during the long July 4th weekend. Got there around 9:45ish and was the 2nd wave of couples to grab a seat (like a hour later) We ended up sitting all the way to the back where they cut up the good stuff. (Which is a cool spot to people watch at Swan's) Don't expect to be served right away..just hang out and they'll get to you. They're always swamped. This place is an institution. Got get an Anchor Steam and wait til they get to you. So we started off with Beer, Water, Calm chowder, crab back..sourdough bread & butter.. Take your time here. You already waited more than a hour so why the hell would you wanna rush out? The seafood here is fresh..you can taste the quality and all the sauces that are on the counter top? use them. After some more beers, the nephew came back and asked if we wanted anything else.. We got the Sicilian Sashimi, Mixed plate of oysters and live sea urchin. All fresh, splash the sauce on there too trust me. The sea urchin was so fresh is was still moving. This is a pretty cool place to eat at. Youre just gonna have to wait to get in and when you do just hangout and they'll get to you.  Paying the bill was a smooth transition for us..don't know why some reviews said they got jipped? Told the nephew its a wrap and then he started to write down what we had..We didn't really have to mention anything, the dude just knew. We paid our way (Cash Rules) and left. Hey Swan family enjoy youre time off!  PS. They don't reopen til July 10th.  They're on vacation.
author: Ceasar S.

description:
Seafood heaven! This place is amazing! My boyfriend and I shared a combo salad that had crab, prawns, and shrimp on a bed of lettuce with a Louis dressing. This was very delicious and can be very filling! We also had the assortment of dozen oysters. There were all delicious as well. They also gave us complimentary bread as we sat down. 

This place is amazing. I would love to come back! It is freshness and quality at a great price! The only cons about this place is that it has very limited seating. Probably between 15-20 people. With that being said, the line to go in is long. We waited about an hour. I don't suggest going with large parties because seating is at a bar and you basically sit wherever someone leaves. Also, parking can be difficult but I always manage to find great parking spots where I go!
author: Cathie N.

description: I'd just flown in so I literally dropped my bags off and jumped in an Uber and got there at around 11:10 and the line was already pretty long and wait time at around 1.5- 2hrs.  I waited around 30 min and got nervous that I wouldn't make it back in time for me to get to work, so I placed my order to go.  I made sure to take a few pics of the counter and atmosphere for social media for sure, but I'm glad I was able to have an amazing bday lunch all in the comfort of my own hotel room.  I got the clam chowder served with I kid you not, nit a slice but a loaf of crusty bread (or maybe the cute guy taking my order took a liking to me...nah I must have just looked really hungry).  I also got fresh oysters on the shell and half a cracked crab.  The freshest, tastiest seafood I've had in a long time!  Salty, Briney, sea tasty goodness!  I accidentally ordered the cracked chilled crab when I really wanted to try the crab back. So next time I will know to order accordingly!  Delicious!!
author: Claudia V.

description:
It's good. But worth the wait? My personal opinion (which obviously differs from many others) is no. Still though - good food.

The seafood is fresh and everything we got was very pure and tasty. Nothing was overly sauced or prepared. Quite the opposite in fact. Given the raw ingredients, you could have prepared everything at home. But that's the point... you don't have access to this quality of ingredients and they do. 

We had the combination platter (shrimp/prawn/crab + louie dressing), mixed dozen of oysters,  sashimi plate, and clam chowder. The chowder was very unique and tasty with a broth that had an ocean water taste ... in a good way. The sashimi plate also had a phenomenal sample of scallops, though the rest was pretty mediocre in terms of sushi quality. The rest? Exactly as it sounds. Don't expect to be overly impressed and you won't be disappointed. Just good, quality seafood. 

Price? Very very fair, especially with the hype. $75 for 2 people, 2 beers (and 2 free while waiting outside) ... and we were very full.

Customer service? Also very good, though I am at odds here. They do in fact treat you like locals and don't rush anyone... though if they did, they could theoretically reduced the wait, right?

The wait... this is the reason for not getting that 5th star. The simple question I asked myself and my wife is, "would I wait 1.75 hours again?" Clear no. Too many good options in SF, and this food actually lends itself really good to takeout anyway.

Overall, not mad that I waited, but wouldn't do it again.
author: Jake D.

description: the sashimi is not that good. but the oyster is insane good. keep in mind you might need to wait for 2hr in weekend.
author: Bolun Q.

description: I have been forever ruined. I cannot never have seafood again. I have to come here for it every time. I'm not even gonna tell you what's good. Go get your butt in line and find out.
author: Jesi D.

description:
I wanted to try this place since watching Anthony Bourdain come here.  Expect to wait in line out the door and my wait was about 30 minutes.  Theres just stools and you sit shoulder to shoulder and get to know people and chat since your so close.  Closer than economy on United Air Lines. You'll be on a first name basis by the time you leave.

The staff here is friendly and you get personal treatment from the get go.  Your never rushed even though there's a line out the door.  I just live in the moment and enjoy the food.

Now for the food.  The beer was cold, oysters fresh and will put you back $28.50 or so for a dozen of the mixed Oysters: They had Kumamoto, Blue Point and Miyagi Oysters.  I had a cup of the clam chowder and it seemed to be watered down and not thick and creamy as I prefer; although good.  They provide some bread, butter, crackers for the chowder and some tasty horseradish for the oysters.  

I'm glad I checked it out, but next time will look for a place a bit more spread out where I can relax.  They should expand into the open lease next door and get some booths and I'd definitely be back.

Note they are cash only.
author: Gary W.

description: Excellent  staff and simple, fresh, flavorful seafood. Get there just before they open but more importantly, get there!
author: Brendan C.

description:
Oysters- 5 stars
Clam Chowder-2 stars
Crab Cocktail- 5 stars

The wait can be incredibly long even when you get there at 10 am. I believe we had to wait about a hour and some. I think the smartest thing to do is get it to go and go somewhere else to eat it. Swan Oyster Depot is definitely a very busy place! Don't expect this place to be spotless when you go in...we were seated and there was still cocktail sauce on the bar from the previous customers. The horseradish is a communal thing so I couldn't use it. 

We decided to order the variety of oysters, blue point, kunimoto and the best miyagi oysters! The oysters were delicious and after waiting for so long I thought to myself this might have been worth it to wait for. The crab cocktail has tons of crab and big pieces of it too. The clam chowder was a huge disappointment for me. I am a huge lover of clam chowder and when you are in SF that is what you are supposed to get. The chowder was very watery with not very much flavor and not too many clams or anything really. 

Service was attentive when we sat down. CASH only like everyone else has said. Is it worth it to spend over $60 bucks on lunch that doesn't really fill you up? Probably not, but I say go for the oysters, the seafood cocktails and salads and just try it once in your life or order to go!
author: Brenda L.

description:
Food safety nightmare?
Food looked good. Long line waiting to get in. Got to the door... Then I watched as all the servers (with bare hands / no gloves / no washing hands) scoop up fresh peeled seafood by the hand, put it on s plate, then handled the till and money, used dishes and glassware. YUK!!!
I left after waiting 30 mins in line when I saw that.
author: Nick W.

description: Went on the Friday of Fleet week. Had to wait about 40 minutes in line but well worth it! Had a mixed oyster plate and a half sashimi plate. My taste buds and tummy have never been happier. The staff was gregarious, knowledgeable, and were a huge part of what was a fantastic overall experience.  Would 100% recommend.
author: Chau P.

description: I went this morning and had a crab cocktail ($18 total but prices vary) along with the small sicilian sashimi ($16).  Both were flavorful and delicious.  I enjoyed the capers on the sashimi a lot, and the crab was great with the louie dressing.  I've definitely had sweeter crab, but that's usually more during the peak crab season (which it is not right now).  Service was excellent.  I did have to wait about an hour on a Monday morning (arrived around 10:40am).  That was probably my mistake, though, as I had to wait for not just the first seating to be over but subsequent ones.  Oh well.  This was a delicious treat albeit a very pricey one.
author: Melinda C.

description:
I'm not sure why - the people were perfectly friendly here - but I felt like I was in the presence of "soup-Nazi" type people.  It's definitely my own insecurities ... I totally psyched myself out on our visit to this temple of seafood lore.  Hubby said I was so meek and unlike my usual bossy self.

Our flight was delayed an hour so that meant we got to SOD right smack dab in the middle of lunch.  Boo!  Fortunately, it wasn't super chilly and we only ended up waiting about an hour and change.  We were seated closer to the end where there wasn't legroom in front so we ended basically "squatting" on our stools.

We perused our options and ended up getting the following:

Whole Dungeness Crab:  Very fresh, very well steamed, served cold.  When I ordered, I made sure to confirm that I wanted the crab butter twice.  He confirmed, I confirmed.  No crab butter.  
Hot smoked salmon platter:  Very well smoked, delicious and fresh.  Apparently, we could have went without the shrimp salad on the side and gotten more salmon.  
Mixed dozen oysters:  All very fresh, came with 5 or 6 varieties.  Their toppings were excellent.  I loved their thai chili sauce with their mignonette.  
Clam chowder:  I'm not sure this was very good.  It wasn't super salty so that's a plus but the soup was curdled.  Meh.
Sicilian sashimi:  Not revolutionary but the fish was very fresh and tasty.  He put scallops, hamachi, salmon and tuna on there, drizzled with olive oil, sprinkled with capers and red onions.  I embellished with some salt and lemon juice.  Delicious.

If you get the cold smoked salmon, be aware that some of the guys there are more generous than others.  We sat right in front of that carving station and realized had I ordered some and got the chintzier portions, I would be extremely upset to realize how much more generous the portions can be.  Old guys = more generous cuts, younger guys = paper thin cuts.

Not a cheap meal by any stretch of the imagination but it's some place you want to check out at least once.
author: Tammy L.

description:
I came here with my friend on a Friday around lunch time at 11:30 or so. Surprisingly, there wasn't a huge line-up (yet). There were probably only 3 people in front of us. We waited approximately 15 minutes or so, and we got our seats.

The guys behind the counter were absolutely nice. Best service ever. I can't complain. 

My friend and I ordered a smoked salmon plate, clam chowder, and oysters. I have to say -- everything was delicious. The smoked salmon plate was super fresh. However, my favorite was the clam chowder. It may be one of the best clam chowders I've ever had in the city. Definite recommend!
author: Joanne W.

description: I got here on a Monday at around 2 pm. Waited for like 30-45 minutes in a very short line. They had everything I wanted to try except for the Uni. I got a crab back, a large Sicilian style sashimi, and the crab salad. The crab salad is great if you want a lot of crab meat without the work of picking it out of the shell. The sashimi was an interesting but absolutely delicious experience. I liked the scallops the most and would probably get a plate of just scallops next time. The crab back and uni was why I went here in the first place. I loved the crab back. It's a great value for what you get and is one of the most delicious things I've eaten. (Thanks for the tip Tony Bourdain!). They didn't have uni so I didn't get to try it but there's always next time.
author: Waz S.

description: This is a small hole-in-the-wall type of place with some of the best, freshest seafood we've ever had. The wait time was long (about an hour, the line was out the door) but once they seat you at one of the barstools by the counter you feel like you're in heaven, the food is amazing. My favorite are the oysters and the crab cocktail. Their sauces are to die for - I thought the cocktail sauce and homemade Russian dressing were almost as good as the seafood.
author: Y G.

description:
Food is delicious but a little on the expensive side, and the lines are atrocious. If you live nearby, call in your order for pick up and enjoy at home - with the added bonus of everyone in line glaring as you slide past to pick up your sweet, sweet seafood. Can't knock the quality, but there's no way I'm waiting an hour in line to pay for a $25 salad on a regular basis.

For what it's worth, the clam chowder is delicious, but it is much thinner and less filling than what you probably have in mind when you think of ordering clam chowder in San Francisco.
author: Taylor B.

description:
Finally got to try Swan Oyster Depot and it was totally worth the wait. We were the second last group to get in before close so if you want to sit at the counters, I'd make sure to get there by 4pm (4:15pm at the latest). They turned down more than a dozen people while we waited patiently for a spot to open up for us.  Worse case scenario, you can get take out right up until they close. Very cool to see all the locals coming in to buy fresh seafood for dinner - they all know each other's names and are on very friendly terms.

The place is on the cool side so make sure to bring a coat to wear (otherwise, you might freeze. The lady that was behind us, who had the last spot, ended up leaving. Was quite strange as she waited in line the whole time, sat down and then left because it was too cold for her). Too bad for her, she missed out!

Anyways, we sat near the back and tried a couple of things:
- Dozen mixed oysters ($30) - you get four different kinds (three of each) so we each got to try. It was my mom's first time ever having fresh oysters (crazy I know). Anyways, each one had a different taste/sweetness to it but all of them were so good. Definitely would order more oysters next time! So fresh. Wow.
- Combination salad ($20) - so delicious. We got the dressing on the side. You get several huge pieces of shrimp, tiny shrimps and pieces of crab. Crab was off the charts good.
- West coast little necks ($12) - you get half a dozen. These clams weren't as good as the oysters. 
- Bowl of clam chowder ($5) - very different from other chowders that we have had. This one was light, soupy and you could really taste the seafood flavour. Great for sopping up with the sourdough bread.

Worth the wait! My rec - come early or come late otherwise you'll be camping out for much, much longer. Fresh, fresh, fresh.
author: Jonny M.

description: Bad joke - long lines completely spoil whatever the experience is supposed to be. Place badly needs to get its act together.
author: William C.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot was so small that the BF and I decided to order our meal to-go instead of waiting in the long line that was out the door. This place is the smallest I've ever seen. I couldn't even go inside because it was packed with people sitting at the bar, people ordering to-go, and others waiting in line.

We ordered a small clam chowder, the salmon plate, and the seafood cocktail. All this came out to be $60-ish. Trust me, it was worth it! Cash only.

The salmon plate had fresh salmon slices topped with capers on top of thin, fresh, crunchy bread with a side of baby shrimps. We squeezed a little bit of lemon on top and it was amazing. I could eat 20 of these. The seafood cocktail was a bunch of seafood in this spicy (we asked for it to be spicy) and very flavorful cocktail sauce. The shrimp, oysters, crab, etc was so dang good and so fresh. I savored each and every bite. The clam chowder was just ok. I like my chowders thick and I thought this one was a little runny.
Service was quick and the guys were very nice and helpful. The wait looked to be very brutal but it judging by what I ate there, it's worth the wait if you're craving seafood. Check this yummy place out!
author: Latda V.

description:
Well-known seafood place in SF.  It's fun to visit, especially if you love fresh crab, oysters, bay shrimp.  The line is typically quite long, so get there early and bring cash.

Pro tip: if you're up for taking your food to go you can avoid the long line!
author: Mary L.

description: If there is something I love it is fresh oysters. They serve on the half shell and I think I gorged myself way too much this last time. The server was very nice to us but seemed like everything took a really really long time. Costs a lot but it was so worth it both times I went no regrets for seafood. Too much for clam chowder I dont come here for that. I come for clams oysters and crab. Get down to the knitty gritty. If they didnt take so long I would likely come more but no thank you for the long wait.
author: Julia R.

description:
Went around 1pm on a Monday, waited line for maybe 20 minutes, service was exceptionally quick once I got in

I had the smoked salmon, clam chowder, combination cocktail and a glass of wine. Everything was great, I especially liked the salmon!! Great vibe all around
author: Devin M.

description: We arrived 1.5 hours after they opened to make sure they weren't going to run out of the food we wanted. We then waited almost 3 hours outside to be seated. The seafood was OK, the staff was great. Maybe it's because I'm from the coastal area of Oregon but I didn't feel this was really worth the hype. If you are dying to have some, call in your order and pick it up, don't waste a day in line.
author: Morgan S.

description:
If I could give Swan Oyster 100 stars I would.  This is my happy place.  This is where I go when it has been a week and I need a reset.   I am happy to wait two hours in line; I bring a book and sip a glass of wine while meeting the other seafood enthusiasts.  

The seafood is fresh, fresh, fresh.  If when you die and go to heaven and it is a restaurant it would be Swan Oyster.  The crab salad and scallop sashimi are my standard fare although I have tried and enjoyed everything on the menu.  The oysters are to die for and I love to take some salmon home with me.  

The stools are uncomfortable and the seating is cramped but I love that it is the same experience I would have had if I were here 100 years ago.  I love the memorabilia and the family atmosphere.  The guys are not overly friendly but they are lovely and consistently awesome in service provided.  I always look forward to seeing them in action when I come.

I just love it here and if I ever move away from SF and come back to visit, this would be the first restaurant on my list.

But please don't come, and definitely don't come and be an overly sensitive brat, I will give you the stink eye if I am in line behind you and hear you complaining about the wait.  Cash only and bring plenty because after two hours in line you are going to want to sample everything.  I usually spend about $55 - 80 / pp on lunch.  Worth every penny and food is very reasonably prices (even under priced for the exceptional quality).
author: Kate R.

description:
SOD = fresh seafood = countertop that can fit ~20 guests = long line = 1 hour 15 min wait on a Sat afternoon = totally worth it!

Everything was fresh + amazing!! You could literally taste the juices from the clams in the clam chowder. The combo seafood salad with dungenous crab, large & small shrimps with the simple, yet tasty louie dressing was deeeelish! The sicilian style (olive oil, capers, onions, & pepper) sashimi with hamachi, salmon, & scallops were delectable. The scallops were my fav - so sweet! And the various oysters on the half shell were melt-in-yo-mouth!

Unfortunately they didn't have live uni when I went due to the windy SF weather. I guess that means I'll be back!

(Side note: they do phone-in / take-out orders = faster than waiting in line)
author: Alysha K.

description:
Mom and pop shop, everyone stop,
If you like seafood a lot, then you about to get rocked,
Oysters and uni don't flop, Swan Oyster gets the props, 
Dont' forget the chowder, no free parking on the lot,
Look at your watch, you might wait a lot,
Seafood iced out, half cracked crab hits the spot,
Sashimi so hot, it can't be topped,
Make you drop down like Michael Jackson socks,
Got the flavor locked, and the service rocks
Cash only, isn't that a shock?
Very few seats so you better run, don't walk,

I came here specifically for the half cracked crab from watching an episode of Anthony Bourdain's Layover San Francisco. I love crab fat and never had it served the way they do it here. Soaking it all up with sourdough bread was a heavenly experience. 

The sashimi plate I actually enjoyed because of the olive oil and capers. Don't expect true Japanese style with this dish. It might be best to order it with less oil. The crab salad came with chunks of crab. Refreshing, crabby, and the dressing was good. 

But the true winner here is the oysters. I can actually taste the difference in flavors from the different types of oysters. So fresh and tasty. The oysters and the ambience is something worth experiencing at least once in your life. For me, that's not enough so I can't wait to go back. 

BTW, come before noon. There was no line when I went.
author: Theo M.

description:
I heard so many great things about this place and decided to make my way up here on a Tuesday so I wouldn't have to deal with the rush.

I had a selection of oysters, live clams, a crab salad and a glass of wine. I'm not sure what was so special about this place for people to wait so long to get in.

I was expecting a great selection of oysters and clams like the raw bars I've been to in Boston or Seattle.  They didn't seem to carry anything special here that warrants the long wait.

Maybe I'm missing something... What should I have ordered? And the service wasn't the greatest either, which made it even more disappointing.
author: Joey N.

description:
I was craving clam chowder and not only was this one of the first places to open, but they also had great Yelp reviews. It also came highly recommended by my cousin. We arrived around 11am and luckily, there wasn't a line, but we did get the last two seats at the bar. I love, love, love the atmosphere and the service was amazing. There really isn't a menu (just options listed on the wall) but they were great about explaining everything to us. The clam chowder was phenomenal as were the oysters (the ones from Washington were our favorite). In addition, the oysters were nice and meaty! We will definitely be back again on our next trip. 

Just a tip that they only accept cash.
author: A R.

description:
I am conflicted. Part of me wants to say this place sucks just so fewer people line up. Part of me wants to tell the truth and say this place is where cold seafood heaven is. Apparently there is a really, really long line to get into heaven. 

Next time I'm just gonna get cold seafood heaven takeout.
author: Kyle S.

description: Love this place, even with the line.  Next time I'm going solo.
author: B J.

description:
What does it take to have an incredible seafood bar?  Apparently, these guys got it right.  Fresh fish and crustaceans, a brightly lite interior, bar seating, and lines out the door.

One of the places on my must go list upon my last visit to San Francisco.  Little did I know that Anthony Bourdain was there, it just looked like a not so small hole in the wall that serves up delicious food.

Ordered a dozen miyagis to start (half were local, half from washington state), crab cocktail, and got convinced into trying a clam chowder.  No complaints, I've never had such thick claim chowder and I don't mean thickened by corn starch kind of thick.  The flavor was also very rich.

Miyagis were local to the area.  I'm from the east coast, so I really wanted to try stuff that is harder to get when I'm at home.  If I'm not mistake the Washington state miyagis were more plump.  Both were delicious once I added some mignonette and cocktail sauce.

Crab cocktail was a win.  

Tried the famed "Italian Style Sashimi"  it was good, but I didn't appreciate the way that pieces came almost diced in the small order.  Our neighbor ordered a medium or a large and it was cut nicer.  The Scallop was the only one that stood out for me here.  The Tuna and Yellowtail were fresh but nothing spectacular.  They also claimed to have sadine, but someone it got squeezed out of the small order, since our neighbor got it.

Finished off with half a dozen Blue Point Clams.  Generally, I love oysters so much more than clams that I don't pay attention to the clams, but these guys looked so plump and orange that I really wanted to try them.  A bit fishy as expected, but I concocted a perfect combination with lemon juice, mignonette and tartar sauce.

Oh, how I wish there was a place like this in New York.  Had to wait a bit, but nothing too bad, since we got there shortly after 12 and the bar area appears to have just filled up.
author: Tina Y.

description: The wait in line sucks. Be sure to bring friends so you can pass the time and plenty of money to feed the meter. The seafood is very good though. Love the crab, the fresh oysters, clams, "sashimi", but their clam chowder you can prob pass on (not the best I've had). Bring lots of cash because they don't take credit cards.
author: Roger P.

description: Expecting great things, found it to be average. The wait was not bad at lunch time on a weekday, about ten minutes. The servers at the bar were friendly and attentive. The food? It's alright. I had the clams, which were too big and chewey, the cerviche/sushi platter, which was okay but not on par with a good sushi restaurant sashimi, and the crab cocktail, which looked better than it tasted. It was pretty expensive, too. Maybe I just don't appreciate raw bar food, but I found it underwhelming, if not bad.
author: Marc P.

description: Old school - great service and dependable quality. Good shit.
author: Sasha H.

description: Awesome food crab back, oysters, clam chowder everything was good.  Place too small they kept it simple and original.  Love it.  Long wait but worth it.  Love all the guys there too.
author: Warunee G.

description:
I live in San Francisco and have been to this restaurant many times in the past. The last time I was there was about 7 years ago. Today's meal was very sub par and extremely disappointing and very expensive
I see this now as a tourist trap and they a reaping the benefits from this.
author: Jonothan B.

description: Break out the champagne and condoms cause it's time to celebrate! This is probably the best seafood I've had ever had. You've seen it on TV you've read about it in magazines and yes everything that they say is true. The line is long but if you can't wait I will gladly take your place in line. Everything here is fantastic: from the crab-back to oysters to the seafood salad this place is top notch. The staff here are super super Duper friendly and like to interact with the clientele.  They open I think at 11 so I recommend getting there a little early. It is cash only and they only have about 12 stools to sit on. Order as much as you can and definitely get the seafood salad. The beauty about the salad is that everyone there makes it there on the way and I think every way that they can make a salad is the best damn seafood salad you will ever have. When you get here please do me a favor and order me something to.
author: Marcus S.

description:
THE RUMORS ARE TRUE! 
NOW GRAB YOUR DOLLA DOLLA BILLS YA'LL AND PULL UP A STOOL.

San Francisco has it's own brand of sights and smells that are vastly different than anywhere else. Conquering the hill on Polk from the Trolley, already fully aware of where we were going, I smelt it. That briny, sweet and savory. That smell that makes standing in an hour long line all totally worth it.

While you stand in line, take turns with your dining companion gazing into the window at their store front. You will see what another yelper has called "THE FRESHEST/BEST SEAFOOD IN SAN FRANCISCO". They had varying shades of fish,sea urchin as big as my face 

and hold the got'dang phone

CRAB

I was told at another well known oyster shack that crab season ended early this year. Nope, nope and double nope. Their half cracked crab was some of the sweetest I've had. No sauce needed.

We wanted to try a little bit of everything so we did the clam chowder, half cracked crab, Italian mix sashimi (off menu but I strongly recommend) and a half doz oysters (all Pacific Coast because you can't get them live anywhere else. Also, note that they are trying to add restrictions on fishing for Drake Bay oysters so get your fill before they're gone). 2 Anchor Steams and we were out the door, but not before chatting with one of the sons. While the conversation took place he filleted a fish with the most precision I've ever seen, these guys know what's up.

A MUST for anyone in the bay city.
author: Rachel B.

description:
We have to come here when we are in The City.
The Oysters, the combo salad, the smoked salmon all served in a raucous environment. 
Expect to wait an hour at the door. Anything less you got lucky.
Go do it.
author: Mark L.

description: So I was derping in SF on a Thursday and I decided to go to this place since it would be hard otherwise. It closes at 5:30 so after Dolores Park I drove on over. There is plenty of parking around on a weekday and meters end at 6pm over there. So I arrived at 4:43 and he said he couldnt serve me but I could do to-go. I asked when they stop serving and he said 4:45 and I thought....hmmm you can defs still serve me. Two people left and I asked again if I could so he let me. It is a bar setting and they make that shiz in front of you. I got the combo cocktail that had crab, shrimp, litto shrimp, and an oyster on top. That has all the goodies I wanted in there in that sauce too. Yumm. It was fresh and I gobbled that up with my tiny fork. It cost $15 for that little guy and it is cash only so you best remember. There is an ATM across the street that you can go to. So remember, they stop serving at 4:45 but you can to go until 5:30pm.
author: Amy H.

description:
This place is the real deal. I knew of the hype and it lived up to it.

My wife and I went on a recent Saturday and got in line around 9:30. There were only four people ahead of us, which was probably due to the light rain SF was receiving. We were promptly let in at 10:30 and received great service from several of the staff members. All were willing to answer questions for novices and Tom gave us a few good stories when we asked about the football jerseys on the wall.

The food was phenomenal. We started with their crusty sourdough and butter, along with some hearty clam chowder. I had to try the crab back, and am glad I did. It was a unique taste and texture and went great with the bread. We also had the smoked salmon, 6 Blue point oysters and a half cracked crab. All was incredibly fresh and served quickly. Washed down with some Anchor Steam, this was a great early lunch and we can't wait to come back. 

Be sure to get there early and bring cash!
author: Brad M.

description:
The only thing that sucks about this place is the wait for a counter seat (the only seating they have) and the uncomfortable stools.  But other than that...the food is de-li-cious!

The clam chowder is creamy.  The shrimp cocktail is tasty.  The crab was cooked perfectly - you can really taste the clean and pureness of the crab.  My favorite was the kumamoto oysters.  Those tiny things hold so much flavor.  Loved them!

You can really tell that the people who work there really enjoy being there.
author: Rose A.

description:
Awesome awesome seafood
Clam chowder was yummy, thinner broth and small bits of onion and celery. The potatoes don't overwhelm the Clams. 

Local oysters were yummy sweet with a hint of salty brine.

Oysters from Vancouver were amazing and sweet tasting. They were fat little oysters with deep cups I ordered extra!

Shrimp cocktail, you only have two choices, super small or really large. I wasn't very clear and ended up ordering the small ones skip that and go for the big ones

The seating is not very comfortable and they can make it impossible to get to the bathroom by adding more seats to the bar.
They have smoked salmon that they slice fresh in front of you, it looked and smelled amazing
author: Isabel Z.

description: It is NOT worth the wait but overall the food is ok. The seafood is not that fresh and delicious as so many reviews rave about. I do give 3 stars for customer service and the friendly atmosphere. Because it rained today so we just waited 1 hour!
author: Jenny N.

description:
All too infrequently am l treated to outstanding food prepared by people who have a palpable, evident spirit of excellence and joy for the place in which they work...this is most evident at Swan's. Great friendly staff, outstanding food, simple menu. This is a restaurant worthy of being a destination.
Oysters, cracked crab, smoked salmon...etc.etc., all  beautifully, served by joyous, skilled staff.
author: Leonard M.

description: Passing by so many times (that line is scary sometimes) finally got there. Those guys are making atmosphere of the place. This is obviously not the place to chill with a glass of  champagne and bunch of ousters. We were drinking beer and sharing all that sea food. Nice spot for tourism.
author: George L.

description:
Yep, amazing lining up, amazing cost of food, amazing taste of food.
The freshest seafood place restaurant in the city I would say.
I love their cherry stone clams, so fresh and sweet. All of their oysters are great testing.
The home made clam chowder soup must not skip. Love their combination seafood salad as well as the sashimi. Try all you can and eat all you can when get there. Better bring lots of cash with you too!  Minus 1 STAR for the damn long line.
author: Judy T.

description: Love this place, service is great, drink a few in line while you wait and there's always a wait, minimum an hour, even on a weekday. Counter style seating in and out. My favs the combination cocktail, sourdough bread, oysters and clam chowder, this is a very creamy, thin chowder and I love it.
author: Sarah T.

description: Most stupid restaurant ever. I arrived at 3: 50pm. The line wasn't long , but the person in front of me told me they are the last one will be served today.  Lazy and rude, just wast of my time.
author: Danny C.

description: This is an S.F. staple and institution, which is why my husband and go, always trying for a time when there's not so much of a line. We've concluded that there's always a line . . . a loooong line. So we must go only when we're not hungry, which defeats the purpose :-) Still, it's worth going, if only once to experience sitting at the counter, the hustle and bustle of old-timers, the incredibly moving ease and familiarity with all things of the sea. It's somehow humbling for me, and the seafood is as fresh as you can imagine. We had prawn cocktail (horseradishey tomato sauce), clam chowder, bread to dip in it,  sashimi and crab with melted butter. It was plain and old school, yet dazzling in the sincerity and purity of it. I can't put it into words, the beauty of them not trying too hard, zero pretense, and the love for what they do shines through every bite into our mouth. You gotta love S.F. :-)!
author: Ranjan P.

description:
By far, the best meal the wife and I had in San Francisco.  Bourdain's review certainly only increased wait times, but once you're in, you never feel rushed at all.

we had the followin:
Crab/shrimp salad--hands down, the best salad i've ever had. 
dozen mixed oysters--
clam chowder with artisan bread
Sicilian sashimi combo

Tip--while standing in line, the regulars would go to the front of the line to the side and order carry out.  If you're an out of towner, I would recommend at least getting a crab/shrimp salad!
author: Eric L.

description: I expected great food, now I'll come to expect great and friendly service, their smiles rub off on you real quick!
author: Isaac D.

description:
Foods nothing special (but certainly not bad). The problem is you stand in line for at least an hour to get a seat (they only have about 15 seats at a counter) and the place is PACKED with tourists.

Better alternative is to just shortcut the line and order to go. Or, just go somewhere else. Personally, we enjoyed it but it was not worth the wait. Won't go back (unless we order to go).
author: Chris S.

description: This was our second visit to Swan's...we had been there a few years ago and were very happy. We were driving to Napa Valley from San Diego and went through San Francisco specifically to visit Swan's. Unfortunately this was a completely different experience. After waiting outside for the customary 30 minutes or so, we crammed onto the customarily uncomfortable bar stool with the eager expectation of what was to come...unfortunately instead of the owner waiting on us, we got his son. He left us waiting 15 minutes while he dealt with carry out orders while the people seated at the same time next to us were working through their chowder, seafood salad and beer. Once we got the owners sons attention, we wanted to order everything at once. This included full orders of Sicilian sashimi and a "dozen eggs" (sushi style scallops with ponzu). The last time at Swans the father steered us to these items and gave us beautiful and generous portions of both. The son told us we didn't need this much and we should get half portions. We went with his recommendations and were very surprised to see that the "eggs" amounted to one scallop sliced into six portions and the Sicilian sashimi was a tiny saucer plate of about nine uber thin slices of mini sashimi. Meanwhile the ponzu on the scallops dish had a fizzy taste and had clearly been left out and was fermenting. The condiments for the oysters are also left sitting out on the counter without lids and seemed sketchy and not sanitary. Additionally we noticed them plating seafood with their bare hands, then handling people's cash (the dirtiest thing you can touch), then go back to plating seafood without washing their hands. Overall it just seemed dirty and unsanitary. Then when it comes to paying the bill, it seemed like the owners son just made up the prices, they don't show you a bill, (which is supposed to be charming), and we ended up paying $143 for an extremely overpriced lunch (from which we left hungry), in a dirty seafood shop sitting on cramped stools with a tiny area to eat the food. We will not be returning and would not recommend Swan's.
author: Susan K.

description:
An excellent seafood place.

This is a very good seafood bar/store. You can just buy some seafood or can get the prepared food.

Went there at around 12.30 pm on Saturday and had to wait for about and hour in the cold just to get in. Inside they only have a bar seating and it is very small. They leave the door open so seating next to the exit can get cold too.

Waiting for so long I was really hungry so I tried a bunch of different things.
Clam chowder, wasn't actually that good. Not very creamy and not enough bits of clams in there, but I was too cold and I had to get it.
Crab salad was excellent and came with lettuce and very delicious mayo type sauce.
Got 6 oysters and they gave me 3 different types, they were sweet and very fresh. I think they go best with their cocktail sauce.
Got SF style sashimi and it had pieces of raw tuna, scallop and salmon, with some spice and olive oil. I liked tuna the best and the spices really compliment the fish and don't overpower.
Finally the best part was the sea urchin. It came in a half shell with about six stripes of sea urchin meat. It had an incredibly strong sea flavor and was very fresh as well.

I want to come back here again, but probably in the summer because waiting in the cold sucks.
author: Maxim S.

description: Great oysters place and have delicious crab back and clam chowder. Best time to go there is the noon time in weekdays to avoid long lines.
author: Alexander L.

description: We came by around 10:40 on a Wednesday and waited about 20 minutes to get in. It was totally worth it. Service was amazing (we chatted with the owner about his interactions with Anthony Bourdain), we loved sitting at the counter watching them prepare the seafood, and food was great (get the crab back!!). Great experience, we will be back!
author: Shabnam E.

description: Got here at 10:35 am.  Started eating around 12:45 pm.  Worth the wait? Not really.  Price is good and food is fresh. Friendly staff.  If you have nothing to do, try it.  It's a better idea just get to-go.
author: Yoyo Z.

description: Incredibly over rated. Well meaning service could not compensate for the rudest barman/shucker alive. I'm ashamed that I didn't walkout after he cussed me out for asking for a menu after sitting at the counter for 15 min without service and despite my countermates receiving service. The foodies good, but not world better than other local seafood restaurants. I felt sucked in by the hype, not the food...and certainly by the (one) sh!tty server.
author: phoenix t.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot has been on my bucket list and I'm happy that we made it.  A platter of oysters, sashimi Sicilian Style (lemon, capers, olive oil..that's what they called it there), chowder, Crab salad, more oysters... plus beers and bubbles!  

Excellent service and a fun experience.  Looking forward to going back!
author: Roxanne T.

description:
Come for their fresh seafood and you won't be disappointed! 

Probably the best oysters I've ever had. Sweet and savory! 

Bread and clam chowder just go so well together.

Crab + cocktail sauce = delicious 

The wait was brutal. It took about an hour and 40 mins to finally get seats, and it was the most uncomfortable chairs ever. If you're tall and lengthy, good luck trying to get comfortable. Ladies, they have hooks to hang your belongings. The place is very tiny. You might not get to sit with your friends if you come in a huge group. But who cares? Eat first, see them later. 

I wish the servers would wear gloves, but they don't. You'll see them handling your food with their bare hands. I was too hangry to care. 

I think they stop serving at 430pm. If you're not seated by then, come back another time because they won't serve you.
author: Yelper Y.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot reminded me why I love seafood.  

The reason I love seafood is because simple preparation is all that is necessary to make it delicious.  It takes no seasoning, no mango tomato fancy schmancy sauces, no nothing to make seafood good.  All that has to be done is that the seafood is fresh.  And no one does it quite like Swan Oyster Depot.  

I ordered the Crab and Shrimp cocktails, half dozen oysters, and an order of Smoked Salmon.  Just fresh and simply prepared.  I got three words for you:  FA-BU-LOUS.  And here's another three words for emphasis: DEE-LE-CIOUS.

The men working here are salt of the earth kind of guys.  People who you can just tell enjoy their job.  Friendly, attentive, and great personalities,  the triple threat of good service.  

A place like Swan Oyster Depot is my reason.  My reason I love seafood.
author: Michael L.

description:
Heard about this place through the television show Anthony Bourdain's No Reservation and decided to give it a try since i was out in SF for a football game.

I had checked the reviews ahead of time and knew the line was going to be long so i planned accordingly and arrived about 10:20...10 mins prior to them opening.  To my surprise, a decent line had already formed and it took almost about 1.5hrs before me and my friends were able to sit down.  For this reason i would suggest finding a flat rate parking lot to park in as oppose to street or ull end up running to your meter quite a bit.

Decor:  Swan Oyster is very small.  There are no tables except for the bar and about 20 barstools for people to sit on and eat.  The line to be seated is more of a first come first serve basis where if there is an open seat you take it.  Hence why it takes so long to be seated.

Service (Must read):  The service here was spot on in regard to speed and accuracy of your order.  However, please be aware that you should not expect 5 start fine dining service or a "do whatever it takes to make your customer happy" type attitude spot.  This place has more of a rough and dirty (kind of like Dick's last resort in las vegas where you sign a waiver saying you wont take what they say to heart cuz theyll give u crap..instead here you dont sign a waiver) feel to it.  The workers here have a straight up, ask a stupid question, get a stupid response type attitude.  They will joke around with you, mess with you and give you crap...so dont take it to heart.

Food:  Since this was my first time here and i dont come out to SF that often i decided to try as much as i could.  Some of the seafood was reasonably priced while others were kind of on the high side.  So order according to your budget.  For me I got the following:

Clam Chowder- The clam chowder was delicious and there were alot of clams.  The only thing that i didnt like was the fact that it was a little too watery for me.  I like my clam chowder thick.

Crab fat:  The crab fat was delicious.  My only gripe was that i wish they had prepared it hot like most places.  Instead the crab fat was actually served cold which was a little weird but still good.

Scallop and salmon sashimi platter- The scallops, salmon and sashimi was almost like a little sampler since it essentially had a little of each of their favorite items.  It was fresh and they thinly slice them and plate them right in front of you.

1/2 dozen Oysters- Due to the fact that i could not decide which oysters to get, i decided to get their sampler which consisted of 6 oysters (Blue Points, Miyagis, and Kumamotos).  Blue points were my favorite as it had more of a stronger and cleaner oyster taste.

Sea urchin- Last but not least i got the Sea Urchin also known as Uni.  It was served as fresh as you can get them.  It was not prepared ahead of time...instead  they literally cut it open right in front of you, clean it and serve it to you in its shell right then and there.
author: Derrick C.

description: Look, there is going to be a cadre of people who love this place and will defend it to the death.  I get that but look at it from my point of view.  Every time we pass by this place there is a line out the door.  Yet, when we think oysters we have a favorite spot ( not going to say where, I don't want it ruined).  Finally the big day, we stood in line, finally got a seat and the first thing I noticed, only one type of oyster.  Further, they were not even on display.  We started with a bowel of clam chowder.  It was oily and if that was cream it was separated.  I think they used Coffee Mate.  There were a few lumps of potato and for sure, no visible clams.  The shrimp salad looked like chopped lettuce and a mound of bay shrimp.  That was it.  I can get that at Costco and it has more ingredients.  We started looking at the other dishes being served and said enough was enough.  This place is playing on the fact that it has been there forever and not on how great the food is now.  The oyster bar that all others should be compared against is Felix's in the French Quarter.  Swan has a long way to go.
author: craig u.

description: Kept it simple.  Ordered some miyagi, Kumamoto, and blue point oysters and cup of clam chowder.  Food was enjoyable but I don't think there was anything that made this place stand out other than the fish market look.  Food was fresh and good but there are other options in San Francisco that are on par with the food quality.
author: Steven U.

description: One of my favorite places on earth. Yes: you will wait for a seat. Yes: it will be a tad pricey. Yes: it is cash only. Yes: it is worth it. I've been several times and loved everything I've ever had. Sourdough with crab fat. Oysters from everywhere. Ceviche. Crab salad. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and never rush you, despite the line circling around the block.
author: Sean C.

description: Amazing service from the staff and super friendly.  Came early before the rush and well worth it.  Clams n oysters delish.  My favorite the combination seafood salad.  By the way their two sauces are lovely .
author: Soojin B.

Here are the must orders here at Swan Oyster Depot:

author: Ramfis B.

description: Hm... I just can't justify the wait. Service is great and the food is ok, but nothing blows me out of the water and prices are a bit steep. This is a definite must try for your first time in the city but beyond that we don't find ourselves here very often. And of course don't forget that it's cash only. Oh and the clam chowder is not creamy and thick so just a warning before you get shocked haha.
author: Guisela L.

description: I was expecting very good quality oysters and crab here. I've had better experiences in LA and Seattle for the same price. Sloppily shucked oysters from my server (bits of shell and dirt), but other diners had them done better. And the cocktail sauce wasn't anything special. Fairly disappointed more than mad. Luckily I didn't have to wait in line very long on a weekday. If I waited 1+ hour to eat here, this would be a 2 star review. Fly to Seattle and go to Walrus & Carpenter instead.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Highlight of our San Francisco trip
Great seafood, amazing staff..Jimmy was great
The oyster combo platter is a must to try.
author: Cyd P.

description:
I'll keep this short and sweet:

I know this is an SF institution, but maybe it's better if some institutions die. Arrived at 11:30, waited till 1:30 to get in. Then sat at the bar until 2:00 before being served by a rude waiter.

The place is a health standard's nightmare, with barely mopped up counters, and dirty dishes, and no gloves used or hands being washed.

When I ordered a dozen mixed oysters, but I did not get to choose them (even thought I wanted to). The waiter just gruffly prepared them after I said "What kind of oysters do you have?" Not that I could tell what I was ordering since the menu is so confusing and terribly haphazard.

The wait is intolerable for what I found to be only decent fish. And this place is expensive to boot! This place is cash only, but there are some things off the menu that you won't be told how much they are.

To sum up:

1. Wait is not worth it.
2. The food is decent, but not worth the price.
3. The environment and service is dismal.

Sorry SOD, thumbs down. Hopefully someone will see my review and not make the same mistake I did and spend an entire day trying to get an overpriced dozen oysters and a butcher's shop quality seafood salad.
author: Andy D.

description:
All touristy hype and bitching about the long lines aside, this is still some of the best seafood (and customer service) you're gonna get in SF, period. 

Skip on the seafood cocktails (prawn, shrimp, crab, whatever). No better or worse than any typical seafood joint. Clam chowder is pretty good, though. It's made in a style that's less creamy and chunky than Boudin, but still good and worth getting a bowl. Dip your sourdough in it. 

Can't-miss items, in no particular order:
1 - Oysters, obviously. Get a dozen. 
2 - Dungeness crab salad. 
3 - Live sea urchin. Insanely fresh, and so, so rich.
4 - Mixed sashimi plate. Drizzled with oil and garnished with capers. Delicious.

Wash it down with a couple of beers. Perfect.
author: Andre Y.

description:
The only reason why I'm giving Swan Oyster Depot a less than 4/5 rating is because of the guy who took my check.
