Unless you get take-out, I think there is no way around the line.  On a cold, Thursday afternoon around 3 p.m., we waited about an hour and forty-five minutes to eat at the counter.

But, once you get there, the service is warm and friendly, and the seafood is very fresh.  We had four different types of oysters on the half shell.  All of them were sweet and fresh.  Typically, Kumamoto oysters are my favorite, but we found some of them to be smaller than Kumamotos we've had elsewhere.  So, we instead ordered more Fanny Bays, which were nice and plump.  We also tried the clams on the half shell - again, very fresh.  They serve the oysters and clams on the half shell with cocktail sauce and horseradish, but also pickled red onions and a habanero/cilantro/lime topping.  The habanero topping is fantastic.

The clam chowder is tasty.  Thinner and less chunky than your typical clam chowder, with strong clam flavor.  The smoked salmon is outstanding.  Not too salty, not too fatty, excellent flavor.  With the capers and onions, it pairs nicely with bread.  We also tried the crab cocktail.  It is a cup full of fresh, cold, cooked crab, served with cocktail sauce (cooked well, but less special if you regularly have crab at home).

I just saw in another review that they have live uni, and sashimi it off the half shell.  I will definitely look to get that next time!
author: Connie T.

description:
Our trip to California was driven by Anthony Bourdain's recommendations.  Swan Oyster was our top pick of them all.  If you want exceptionally fresh seafood...COME HERE!  To be honest, this place is simple...just really fresh seafood, they have a great raw bar selection.  Tip:  Remember to bring CASH and expect a long wait or you can do it like us and take it to go.

We didn't make it here on our first day of arrival because they close at 5:30pm but because they are always so packed and they do plan on leaving on time, they start kicking people out with a complimentary tall glass of beer at around 5pm.  You have to understand this restaurant is literally a narrow alley, there are only around 10 stool seats inside.  But...we actually really loved our plan because we got to have 2 great people join us for our feast...I am talking our last meal, breakfast, which was a fantastic seafood feast, picnic style!  The warm hospitality, friendly people, and the happy faces you see at Swan Oyster Depot is unmistakable.  We were greeted with a complimentary freshly cracked crab claw...MmMmMmMm =)  You can truly feel they LOVE their job, which makes you feel really good as a customer to know that they love serving you and they adore what they are doing.  

We ordered 3 different type of raw oysters (super plump and juicy), shucked sweet crab meat (very convenient when you are eating picnic style and we watched them shuck them), and a scrumptious seafood salad packed with crab meat and shrimp.  

Our star and what we truly came for was this crab head filled with crab brains...OMG drool!  It has a very rich, buttery, and ocean saltiness to it that is unmistakable and irreplaceable.  When you dip your sourdough bread into this pool of golden goodness...seriously you will be speechless.  We all were!

Overall this place was mouthwatering.  The freshness and quality of the seafood was fantastic, the price was reasonable, and the hospitality was welcoming.  Other than the wait and their odd hours of operation, we really didn't find anything to complain about.  We would give this place a 9/10 and we would definitely come here again if we go to San Francisco.  This place is truly a foodie landmark, in a city full of foodie landmarks.

Come here for the full review
http://food-snobs.blogspot.com/2012/08/swan-oyster-depot-casual-no-frills.html
author: Jenny H.

description:
Good things are sometimes worth the wait.  This popular spot is family run and revels in the positive reviews that I read before Maria and I went.  Mon morning at 11 am and the line is already long.  It's a small spot with spaces for about 20 seats.  In a nice sunny afternoon, best be prepared for a half hour to 45 min wait (hat and water).  They are nice enough to make sure if your online by the doorway, you can start refreshing yourself with beer.

Once inside, you see the history of the family running this seafood market and eatery and on the board the menu.  Specials incl a bud light beer with a shrimp cocktail.  Soup by the cup, bowl or bread bowl.  Then the rest of the specialties, various seafood items including various types of oysters by the dozen.  Pricing is standard for seafood (not cheap but not the most expensive).

We ordered a cup of clam chowder each and aforementioned Special of shrimp cocktail and beer.  And finally we ordered a dozen oysters (3 each of various types).    The chowder was amazing and fresh.  Very nice on a warm or cold day.  If I only ate the clam chowder, I would recommend this place.  The shrimp cocktail was too much for one person, it could have fed three because its basically shrimp and cocktail sauce.

The best of everything was the oysters, having four types makes you see which is best for you if you want to order here or elsewhere in the future.  I of course don't take notes or pics when I eat with someone so I leave Maria to name the various types.  We enjoyed two types but all four went smoothly.  Best of all, the freshness of these oysters can be judged by how you feel later...(jk).

Overall recommended if you have the time and patience, its not far from Union Sq if you are staying there.  And it's a corner from the California St Cable Car line.
author: Melanio F.

description:
When I write reviews on Yelp, I usually skim previous reviews to dispel any 1 star reviews or bad reviews in general. The common hits were cleanliness/space, customer service, and the long wait.

Cleanliness/Space-I really loved the feel of Swan, in that its straight up with it's food and it's presentation. Sure there might be flies flying around here and there but deal with it. If you want to have a fine dining experience go to a fine dining establishment and complain there. As far as the limited seating goes, I think the layout is f**king fantastic. It makes you interact with people. I think Americans have forgotten how to have human interaction because we're afraid to reach out to people. I sat down with my Dad and walked out with San Francisco friends.

Customer Service-My Dad and I arrived 10 minutes before opening and there was already a line but luckily the line was just the size of the seats available. We walked right in when it opened and like an assembly line. The staff came down the line and started pouring drinks and taking food orders. I told our guy that I had no clue what I was ordering and if he could help. He started giving me options and I was just like "I leave it to you, man" 80 dollars later I was in complete bliss. The staff is down to earth and is just real. Oh and many mention it's a tourist trap, well I'm from Los Angeles, and we have tourist traps. Some you don't go to because they suck but some you go to because it's home and they maintain their charm I.E Roscoes Chicken and Waffles.

Long wait-If you don't want to wait then don't come, it's simple as that. People waiting in line behind us were drinking beer and just waiting out their time for some awesome seafood.

Tips:
Get there early and avoid the line.
If you're caught in the line drink a beer and chill out.
Make friends with your neighbors you might just end up sharing food. You know human interaction.
author: Edwin M.

description:
I finally had the chance to check this place out.
I ordered the oysters and calamari salad. Not a big fan of the oysters - I prefer them to be smaller rather then the colossal size (but this isn't necessary a bad thing). The calamari salad wasn't the best I have come across - The Warf definitely has better calamari salad. I have to say this though- it really is fresh, they chuck the oysters, clams, etc to order. Definitely worth a bite. And I should also mention they are a CASH only establishment, which was a bit of an annoyance. 
Overall though pretty good.
author: Allie P.

description: Came in there knowing there was limited seating... now how limited is limited? way more limited than I anticipated... Waited a while outside in the cold. But the food and service is so amazing and worth the wait. Never have I ever heard of scallop sashimi... but lemmmmme tell you, put that shit on your bucket list. I loved my experience here.
author: Jessica V.

description:
How have I not been here before?!?!?!
I had family visiting and so I decided to take them here as it is supposed to be a San Francisco classic and I must say it really is a must go to.
We got there half and hour before they opened and I'm glad we did because the line formed almost immidiately after we got there.
The food was FANTASTIC and fresh.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
the service here is very friendly and kind. however, there is nothing cooked here (except the chowder) so i really cant rate the restaurant as having amazing food. it's fresh seafood, yes, but nothing different than your normal raw oyster. and certainly not worth more than a 40 minute wait.

there was no uni on the saturday we went. there were scallops in the window, but not on the menu. they charge for bread and butter. and lastly, they forgot to bring my raw clams. 

my suggestion to the restaurant is to add a "cash only' sign to the front because it can only help. it's so annoying to finish your meal and have to run embarrassingly to the nearest ATM for cash.
author: Vivian L.

description:
As a tourist to the Bay area, I was very excited to try out the fresh oysters available. My cousins and I decided to try out Swan's because we had heard a lot of good things about them. While there are plenty of things I found quaintly fantastic about Swan's, only one thing determined that I will not come back: customer service. 

My cousins and I - total of 4 people - arrived around 11 am and ended up waiting about 45 minutes to be seated. They have counter seating, so as space opens up, you go ahead and pop a squat. I found that generally it was easier to seat groups of 2, so as we had 4, we settled for 3 stool opening and 1 person stood. On top of that, we had to wait an additional 25 minutes to even get water; we heard "we'll get to you in a minute ladies" about five times, and coming from a jolly, happy man can get really frustrating. Don't try to jolly me when I'm grumpy from waiting, sore from standing, and really hungry. 

We ordered 2 dozen mixed variety oysters, 2 scallops sashimi-ed, 1 small bowl of clam chowder, and raw clams. The food was pretty good and fresh, but I feel you can get the same thing in many places in the same area. The clam chowder was mediocre... it looked like the cream was curdled. I was expecting the variety (3 types available at the time) of oysters to be explained to us but they just dropped them off and walked away. 

This is probably the worst customer service that I have ever received. It's like they are so comfortable with their reputation and the fact that a large crowd will come anyway that they can walk really slow, be rude, and ignore customers. My cousin kept asking for cocktail sauce and at one point one of the men looked at her like she was asking for the throne from Game of Thrones and just walked away. RUDE. Service is really slow - our server was one of the daughters so she was quite pleasant, but their system was so bad, she had to shuck all our stuff. You'd figure that they'd have one person shucking constantly or something to speed things up, but nope, each server shucks his guests orders. 

Overall we were there for about 2 hours. 

I would give 4 stars for food and environment, but I gave 2 stars for service. 

Try going somewhere else if you can. But if you want to appreciate other places' service more, go ahead and come to Swan's.
author: Michelle L.

description:
If you are craving great, fresh seafood with excellent service, Swan oyster depot is the place!  It's a really down to earth restaurant, with very limited seating, but all the staff is really friendly and the food is so fresh.

Our group of 3 waited around an hour and a half for seats at the bar, but it was definitely worth the wait.  We started off with a Mixed Dozen, which gives you a good sampling of three different kinds of oysters...highly recommended if you are unaware of the variety of oysters.  Next up, we got the combination seafood salad, which was also very delicious (with crab, small shrimp, and 3 jumbo shrimp).  Next time, I would just go with the straight up crab salad, since you'll get more of the crab itself.


The clam chowder is boston-style, so less creamy and still very delicious.  You really taste the clam and it's not overloaded with heavy cream.  Doesn't need any hot sauce or extra pepper.

The beer is also a pretty good deal at $4 a pint with choices from Stella, Anchor Steam, and Bud Light.

Definitely worth checking out, but make sure to come relatively early and hungry, since they close promptly at 5:30 pm.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Pros:  
Fresh seafood (if available)

Cons:  
Menu items are not always in "stock"
Cash only
Long wait
Clam chowder is basically clam broth (gross)
Service is painfully slow because they do not have a system for dividing up the customers!

They may close at 530, BUT their last seating is at 445!!!!  Why is this information NOT on their website.  I learned this the hard way.

I also planned my visit for the fresh sea urchin and half crack crab.  NEITHER were available.  

I ended up getting the chowder and crab salad ($27) to get my crab fill.  Totally not worth it.

Skip this place unless what you want is in-season!

I was there by myself and it took 2 hours to get out of there because the service was so bad.  The guy was friendly enough, but come on.  Pay more attention.
author: Stefan L.

description:
(Sea)t at the counter:
Chowder. Oysters. Sashimi! 
Come with just one guest.
author: Nish N.

description:
Astonishing, terrific, spectacular, phenomenal and breathtaking only begin to describe how uber-cool this place is!

We did our research before going. Sure you wait to get in, sometimes for an hour or more, but that didn't stop us. (Heck we got there an hour early and were the first one's in the door so we showed them - ha ha). 

 In all seriousness how many 100+ year old restaurants are there in San Fran and of those how many have lines out the door for over an hour to get in? Think about it people!! The reason Swan Oyster Depot is amazing is because they do something no one else does. They do the freshest, most amazing seafood right in front of you on a counter that is less than a foot deep. Not only are you in the kitchen but you're actually at the counter where the magic happens. Who does that?!? No one. No one does it! That's why you need to try this awesome place. 

I really feel bad for the people who wrote the bad reviews! Maybe instead of being sourpusses, they should've opened their eyes and appreciated what was going on in front of them. No love lost. I'll be back and will be the first in line again. 

I'm an oyster-phile, so is my gorgeous wife and my brother who I'll call LowBro. We ate at Swan on Saturday, Nov 1st. The oysters were from Tomales Bay and Washington. They were fabulous, succulent and down right delicious! I can say that because the three of us have eaten oysters everywhere including Tomales Bay and Washington and these were the best. We had 2 dozen as a warm up. Then LowBro suggested we do the clams. Yeah they're raw, meaty, fleshy and juicy but they were AMAZING! Have you ever had raw clams? I hadn't. Personally I liked the Littlenecks but the Cherry Stones had great flavor as well. 

Gorgeous Wife took it one step further and ordered the sea urchin (Uni) as the next course. BEST THING EVER!!!! Where have you ever had the freshest Uni and when was it prepared right in front of you??!?? If you can answer that question then I applaud you however if you cannot then git off you butt and go to Swan, wait in line, belly up to the bar and order it. Heavenly, mouthwatering and luscious only scratch the surface. I was about to order another one when they ran out. Did I mention we were the first in line? Gorgeous Wife and LowBro were bummed so we ordered more food. 

Marinated calamari was ridiculously good as well. 

We were still hungry so LowBro ordered the sashimi which was salmon, tuna and raw scallops. It was over the top! Scallop sashimi. Who does that? No one, that's why you need to check this place out.  

The only thing I can add to this lengthy review is I cannot wait to go back. Every single employee was over the top and the food was stellar. That's why I give them 5 stars. 

The fact that we sat next to Master Chef Mario Batali only made the experience that much more special!! Thank you Chef for posing for a pic w/ me and Gorgeous Wife.
author: Cabernet Jay S.

description: The oyster here is really fresh!! But what's even better than the food is the warm service. Definitely worth a wait!!
author: Jun T.

description:
Fresh. Amazing. Seafood.

Had read some great reviews about it. (Shout out to Alison A. for an awesome recap of her visit.) We heeded the advice of getting there at 10:20am, and even being 10 minutes before the doors even opened, there was already a line! Because there are only about 15 stools in the whole place, being 23rd in line meant we had to wait to be seated...was it worth it? YES

You might say we went a little overboard for lunch. We left STUFFED!
- dozen mixed oysters (super refreshing and all so distinct)
- salad combo (shredded iceberg lettuce topped w/ a mix of seafood of the day; we had mini shrimp, giant shrimp, smoked salmon...all in this delicious dressing)
- bowl of clam chowder w/ artisan bread
- sashimi cuts of sea scallops and halibut

We actually got the owner as our server with a great can-do attitude. It's a neat place that's family owned and ran. The owner's father is the one who started the place. It has a fun decor, educational picture charts of sea life, and even a really old-timey cash register (which if you haven't seen in other reviews, it's CASH only).

I can't say enough about this place! Really enjoyed it.
author: Kim-Anh P.

description:
Let's be honest with ourselves.  Is there any reason to wait in line for hours, or eat seafood at 10:30AM, if it's not the absolute greatest seafood you can find in the area?  I don't suppose so.  But this place has a reputation, and I knew the line would be long, so I showed up at 10AM in order to get seated at its 10:30 opening.

Once inside, I took my place all the way down by the end of the bar, where there was some sort of stray food material on the counter in need of cleaning, despite the fact that I was the first to eat there.  It was never cleaned up.  A simple 30 second wipedown of the counter before opening would be nice, no?

I decide to get, of course, oysters.  At $28/dozen, these were not actually cheap oysters.  They're cheaper at home in Arizona, believe it or not.  They had six varieties, and I got two of each for my first dozen.  They have mignonette on the counter and a habanero lime sauce for the oysters - I stuck with the mignonette because I like how oysters taste, and didn't want to overpower them.

They did have live sea urchin, which is really nice.  It was actually priced much more reasonably than the oysters.

Really, this isn't a bad place, but it's really not worth the wait when you can get seafood just as good in the city at a lower cost without having to wait.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Maybe it just wasn't my day or maybe I just didn't order the right stuff, but it wasn't that great in my opinion. 

One of my girlfriends and I came here right when they were cutting off the line to be seated (04:45pm). Keep in mind that they really turn down people who come in after the cutoff, unless you are a single sweet old lady - pretty sure an elderly woman came in at 5pm or so and was served her chowder. 

Anyway, we ordered a cup of chowder (watered down and mostly taste of sea salt), dozen oysters (some seawater salty, some delicious, some in between), uni (not the best I've had and definitely wasn't that fresh despite being cut open there), and a glass of wine (tiny glass). The service was relatively slow, but staff is friendly. 

I would be willing to give the place another try just to see if it was an off day or whatever, but I'm not dying to go back. 

Oh, it's a cash only place, so go to the ATM first.
author: Christina L.

description:
BEWARE!

Swans is a tourist trap and I fell hook line and sinker.

I arrived at 11:15 and waited in line for a little over an hour. It would've been longer except I was lucky to bypass five people in line b/c I was a single and a single spot opened up at the counter.

A dozen SMALL oysters($30), half cracked crab($20), bowl of thin and seperated chowder($5) and a beer($5) plus tax and tip came to $75 bucks. The food was average, the chowder was terrible, the place felt dirty and I left hungry.

Look at my other reviews. Most are positive. As a business owner too, I hate giving another business negative reviews unless it's warranted and in Swans' case it's more than warranted.

So would I return after waiting in line over an hour, paying a hell of a lot for lunch and leaving hungry? Not a chance!
author: J G.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot was the place that I was most looking forward to eating at during our stay in SF. We made sure to get there around 10AM.. We circled around the block a few times and found parking. Sure enough, there was already a party waiting in line and then shortly after we arrived another party joined the line. They opened the doors for us at about 10:20.. woop woop! I love how the lemons and sauces are all laid out for you on the bar but I would imagine the lemon bowl gets a bit germy after multiple people pick their lemons from it.. The service was prompt and so friendly. The guys are all really funny too and even played a prank when we were using the restroom in the back. 
Everything that we tried was so FRESH and delicious. I love how they serve my favorite, crab backs/fat for only $5 each. UGH I wish I could go back right now!!!! The only reason why they don't get 5 stars is that they are bit on the pricey side and seating is limited ;/

At the end of the meal your server tallies up your bill on the back of a napkin.. awesome! Shoutout to Marino who was so sweet and kind :]

HOT TIP: ask for a cool sponge souvenir thing! Cash only.
author: Julie K.

description:
You know what? I don't get it. I'm not sure what the big deal is; to me it's not worth waiting outside like I'm in a Weimar Republic-era bread line. If the food was up to it, and was more comfortable inside, I wouldn't mind as much, but this was waiting for some pretty dull food. This place has exploded in popularity because Anthony Bourdain likes it? Well, I've seen some of the places he likes, and rarely have I been impressed.

My dining companions disliked the clam chowder, which was odd, because that was the only thing I liked about the place. It wasn't all that creamy, had almost a raspy mouthfeel that I appreciated, and really showcased the clam. It was good, and well-priced. Can't say the same for the rest of the menu in terms of the latter, as everything else seemed to be several dollars above what would be a proper price point, especially considering that this is really just a dive-y lunch counter. 

Granted and point conceded - the seafood is fresh. I'm not doubting that. It just tends to come unseasoned and dull..or if it comes with a sauce, it's some uninspired creamy sauce. Not my thing. Also, salad consisted of a bed of iceberg lettuce strips. Truth be told, I expect much more than this from San Francisco dining, even if the joint in question is just a little lunch counter. 

I probably would have stopped at three stars, but this place is also so brutally uncomfortable, I have to dock it an additional point. Even if you weren't crammed in there like a sardine in a can, the stools are simply awful. They don't offer any means of resting your legs, which means your legs are going to dangle, almost coaxing you off the stool itself. Horrible. And then, I was attempting to perch on the stool closest to the door, which added to the sense of discomfort with way too much bustle from all the takeout orders. It was so crowded, I didn't have a choice. 

Service was fine, but on the balance, I can't overlook the uninspired preparations, and pervasive discomfort of sitting in there.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Went to this place again in March, again in June.

I went way too late in March (around 4pm) and the shop already closed its dine-in line so my only choices was to go and my favorite blue point oysters were sold out :(  I think it does taste better when you dine in (maybe I am biased).

However, I went in very early in June...wait about an hour..finally had my oysters.  

I only go by myself so I can only have so much

1) 1 dozen of oysters (6 blue points, 2 local miyagi, 2 east coast miyagi, and 2 Kumamoto oysters).  1 cherry stone clam.
2) 1 Crab salad with louie dressing.
3) Sourdough bread from boudin bakery.

I have to say...Swan has not let me down once.  All the foods were fresh and delicious.  The texture of their oysters are the best I have ever had.  Mouthful of flavors.  Friendly servers too.  Felt like you are eating at your neighborhood restaurant.

Cash Only, However :P
author: Ken H.

description: We stopped in a a snack and a beer. The food looked amazing and the place was packed. I would come back for a full meal as this place, although small seemed to have a local flavor and clients. Be prepared to wait. The line is down the block at times
author: Laurie I.

description:
NOTHING CHANGED FROM THE FIRST VISIT!  OYSTERS AND CRAB SALAD with Louie dressing!  And the biggest surprise was the octopus salad.  Perfect chunks of the tentacles dressed ever so slightly.  

Coming back over and over and over and over.  

No rain this time made it that much easier for the wait.  

GO HERE FREQUENTLY!  Don't bitch about the wait.
author: Caesar R.

description: I'm not a big fan of waiting in line for two hours, yet I will say, it was the most entertaining two hours with the most enthusiastic and loyal patrons I have ever met. Inside was a squeeze and if you're wanting a quiet relaxing meal this is not your place, the guys working behind the counter must have to drink twenty Red Bulls per shift just to keep up with the pace. The food was good, the fish was fresh and I will say it was an experience.
author: Life W.

description: We came on a weekday around lunch time and still waited about 30 minutes. The atmosphere is relaxed with 50's music. Jimmy was our server/chef and was wonderful & attentive. We tried the oyster combo and the sashimi platter, both of which are very fresh. The quality of the food is great with focus on freshness & quality.
author: Char Y.

description:
mmmmm, came here cuz of all the hype. and the boss loves this place. and he knows his stuff, so it must be stellar right?

mehhhh. came here on a saturday and we were DETERMINED to get some effing oysters, chowder, and other eats. stood in line for about an hour, which actually goes by really fast because you can chat with people who are also really hungry for some oysters.  we were at last seated at the end of the bar, and began ordering. the oysters were fresh, yes, but the chowder was kinda bland...therefore we covered it in hot sauce and kinda ruined it.  oops!

we got shrimp cocktail and something else, but neither was that memorable. a pretty disappointing experience overall since everyone raves about the place. and oh yea, cash only! the two of us spent almost $100 and had to go through allll our pockets for the cash. sigh!
author: Christina L.

description:
Waited in line for 2 hours+ and so had high expectations..

The customer service was pretty awful, the place is filthy and I'm pretty sure the old men working there don't wash their hands.. 

The food was average.

Don't understand the hype and won't be going back.
author: Steph A.

description:
I live nearby and would go every week if I had the time.

I aways get oysters and the combo cocktail.  The seafood is very fresh.

The staff is patient, helpful, accommodating and very friendly.

It is a little expensive, but SO worth it.  

I've shown up to no line (rarely) and felt like I've won the lottery or a long line and been happy to wait.

This is one of my favorite places!
author: Juliana L.

description:
Got here at 930 am and there was a line already. Not a long one, about 7 people ahead of us, but still... this place opens at 1030am. 

Saw inside and was surprised that this place is only a bar like seating. Very very limited. So please expect to wait quite a while if you weren't one of the firsts in line. 

We were able to get a seat with just two of us and we went all out! We ordered, beers, a dozen assorted oysters, half cracked crab, crab fat, prawn cocktail, a cup of chowder, and fresh cut scallops. Everything was DELICIOUS! Our waiters told us where each of our seafood was from, gave me a hand washing bowl after eating my crab, and were so nice and accomodating. 

Now the reason why I didn't give it a full 5 stars; they're CASH only! I mean, it's a good thing, but at the same time, it's not. 

But otherwise, everything thing that we ordered was so FREAKING DELICIOUS! 

Hint; if you're waiting in line to get in, you can come in and get a few beers for you and your party and they will just add it to your tab once you sit down! 

Overall; AMAZING EATS! I would recommened going there right before they open and waiting in line, bc the line will definitely get  longer!
author: Aloha D.

description:
I love when people say they are never going back! Please don't come back to this amazing place! The less of a line the better! The clam chowder is great and YES its not as thick as the cream stew shit people seem to like. I like the soup cause I am not trying to fill up on thick ass soup. But honestly if you stand in line for an hour for soup you are retarded. Go to the wharf and get your tourist bread bowl of bullshit. 

Onward and upward to the sashimi plate which is so freakin goood! May fav is the scallops! We usually get 2 or 3 plates of this.

When in season the bowl of crab legs meat only with fresh rue dipping sauce is unreal. Ahh but you wouldn't know about that cause you not in with the cool kids!

Smoked salmon with fresh sourdough epic! Smoked trout excellent. Oysters YES YES YES! And a few glasses of Chardonnay to wash it all down fantastic! As I leave I feel the gout creeping in.
author: Ethan S.

description: The best part of this place is its reputation. Yes, the fish is fresh. Mmmh what else? Uncomfortable seating, fast service, huge line, super simple dishes. I'd rather go there only to buy fish and cook it at home.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Popped my Swan Oyster cherry today (5/15/2012)!  Yay!  I lived on Pine & Mason (a couple blocks away) for a year and was a moron never to have sucked it up to wait in the line.  Today's wasn't bad... I'd say 40 minutes or so and the wait was worth every minute.  Tom took great care of us and we devoured the Combo Seafood Salad with shrimp, prawn and crab for $20 served with a killer Louis Dressing, 3 Miyagi Oysters, 3 Blue Points, a glass of Muscadet and a glass of Reisling, sourdough bread and butter and they even brought me Gluten Free bread!!!  Couldn't have asked for a better experience.  Look forward to going back!

Side note:  I think the stools are uncomfortable for a reason - they want to get customers in and out as soon as possible.  Brilliant if you ask me!
author: Shiho F.

description:
We stood in line for a little over an hour after a particularly rainy Wednesday afternoon. Yes, seriously. People just can't stay away from this place!

Was it worth it? Yes.

What did you get? 
+Crab cocktail
+Smoked salmon plate
+A dozen assorted oysters
+A glass of white wine
+A glass of beer

Anything else?
Oh, a cup of the clam chowder

Damage? About $75.

Would you do it again? In a heartbeat. That seafood is so fresh, and so simple. Plus, the service was super friendly and not at all rushed or hurried. I totally get why people stand in line for as long as they do.
author: Adena B.

description: Great crab salad, mediocre clam chowder and crab back. I think it's overrated and not worth the wait.
author: T L.

description:
I'm terribly sad. I've been hearing about this place since forever, but the wait has always deterred me from trying it. After visiting for Bay to Breakers and taking Monday off as a recovery day, I figured it was the best time to check it out!

I called in when we were already on the way, and the guy said there was NO WAIT! Upon getting there, there is a line out the door and we ended up waiting about 30 minutes. I'm not sure as to why he felt the need to lie about it because even when I got there and confronted him about the line, he said something along the lines of "there's practically no wait, people are getting up." Oh well, I'm not going to let this deter my (hopefully) awesome food experience.

Upon getting seated we find that there is no crab! Oh noo, the season just ended. My friends from San Diego recommended the seafood salad, but I didn't want to order it without the crab, especially after seeing that it's some misc seafood (small shrimp/big shrimp, etc.) over iceberg lettuce.  We asked if there was anything off the menu and decided on the sashimi platter, oyster sampler, and bowl of chowder.

-The sashimi was fresh, yes, but not very tasty. The scallops were surprisingly yummy though! Sweet and interesting texture. 
-Chowder was extremely runny and had NO SOLIDS except some potato chunks and super measly clam bits. What a surprise.
-I've had better oysters. They had good variety but they tasted more on the frozen side. Maybe they kept them too cold that day which you can really tell with the texture.


Given the hype and reputation, I would probably rate this bar lower, but with all that aside.. it's only "A-OK".
author: Jessalyn C.

description:
10 years ago this was a sure bet. Now prices are fairly insane and it has more of a touristy feel to it.

To avoid lines, go on a rainy day. If you love pain, go on a sunny Saturday.

The bowl of chowder and excellent bread is still a good deal.
author: George S.

description:
The people who think this place has THE BEST clam chowder must also be virgins who think JILL and Palmela are the most fabulous screws they've ever had. 

Not me.

Yes, I did think the chowder had fantastic flavor but the consistency was too thin and watery for my liking; I prefer heartier chowder floating with abundant clam strips and potato cubes. It's like comparing lackluster missionary to aggressive doggy-style. The chunkier the soup, the more thrilling it is.

Contrary to my last unsavory oyster experience, I actually enjoyed most of the varieties in the Oyster Sampler. This was a relief to me since I'm straight and would rather not eat things that taste like rotting vaginas twice. The Crab Salad was also a hit - the plate was composed of 75-percent fresh, sweet crab meat and 25-percent lettuce. However, as we shoveled the salad into our pieholes, we couldn't help but eye-rape our neighbor's amazing-looking Combination Salad piled high with crab, prawns and bay shrimp. 

Guess who had double samples of the buttery smoked salmon? ;)
author: Suany W.

description: Worth the wait in line! Oysters are fresh and flavorful, clam chowder is the bomb. The staff was friendly and engaging. Great spot, will be back for sure.
author: Allison M.

description: Get there early! If you aren't seated by 4:45 you won't be served. Fresh oysters, clams and fish every day! Rare to get scallops or crab, but if it's good weather sometimes they are in luck! Great snack place. Not for a meal.
author: Tara C.

description: I have seen better seafood places in SF.... Avery average place all the way around. Friendly people, though.
author: Stan S.

description: Great seafood and location. Had oysters, shrimp, dungeness crab, chowder and a few Anchor Steam drafts.
author: Dick F.

description: The old men are drunks, but its pretty hilarious. Go and ask for Darin. He's not only the fastest, but he'll give you the best service. Cool dude who's been on many different food shows, and is a friend of Anthony Bordain. Crab fat is garbage, but if you want to pay $8 for it go right ahead. Everything there is amazing.. except crab fat...
author: Kat M.

description: If you have the patience for a one hour line and you don't care about paying double the usual price for seafood then you will love this restaurant. There is one long bar and it is difficult to get a seat. This place is been around almost a century so it is definitely worth trying and the seafood cannot be fresher.  Take out may be a better option.
author: M S.

description:
Solid fresh seafood spot.

Ah, the legendary Swan. Always so many people, always so many stories. But if you know where to get fresh seafood, this restaurant is just meh.

First of all, this store is very inconvenient to first timers. No waiters, no help, you do it your own way. If you are a brave person who does not care about talking or asking to strangers you'll be fine, but if you are shy you'll have a lot of trouble getting use to this place.

So it goes like this - you stand in line, wait about 40 mins, once you get inside you find your own seat, and SHOUT TO THE BUSY WORKERS. Wave, and say CAN I MAKE AN ORDER PLEASE?

If you just seat there and wait for someone's kind greetings, good luck with that. You'll have to wait another 30 minutes to get their attention lol.

Their seafood is indeed fresh. They have lots of options in oysters and all, also sauces. Don't get the clam chowder though. Not that it's bad but you did NOT come here to get chowder man! Go to pier 39! Don't be a pussy and boldly order expensive seafoods. Yeh you read other reviews - you should have brought at least $50~60.

It is very busy and somewhat dirty inside. But I don't care. I only care about food when I go to a restaurant. And Swan does the food right.

Well enough talk.

1. Fresh seafood. You get what you came for.

2. Be bold. Don't hesitate to stop the workers and ask for service. Or you'll have to wait another few ten minutes. You've waited enough in line.

3. Cash only and you'll need a lot. I had a dozen of oysters and it was already like $30. Bread and butter are free so if you are not rich eat a lot of bread. Nobody's gonna care.

4. Beer's there. So yeah.

5. Salads are good but I suggest get seafood by itself. That's what you came for. Right?

I brought some cash I scraped from the bottom of my table and spend all in here. Which means it was pretty worth it. Still, expensive. Not an everyday place.

Solid 4 stars. It's good to see a hard working family business with good foods.
author: Brandon K.

description: Fantastic real seafood!  Not a french fry or potatoe place just hard core seafood.  Worth the wait.
author: Oinked P.

description: Great food (fresh seafood), great customer service especially from Daren he was very attentive and satisfies all of our needs. Definitely would come back.
author: Justin L.

description:
Clearly a family owned, beloved, well-known stop, I found out about Swan Oyster Depot from several guidebooks as I prepared for my 4th visit to SF.  This place is a seafood lover's haven.  Be prepared to wait, and use the line out the door for counter seating as a landmark if you're on the street looking for the place.

Be prepared to wait at least 25-30 minutes.  When inside, take your time, because no one is rushing you out.  You earned it.  

Chowda is okay.
Clams are great, oysters are great.

The couple next to me loved their crab salad.  It looked delicious.

If you still feel hungry after, pop in next door to Nara for genuine, good, cheap sushi.

CASH ONLY here at Swan.
author: Stephen H.

description: What a San Francisco institution!!!  The things to order are:  Crab Backs (spreading over sourdough), seafood salad and clam chowder.
author: Forrest G.

description:
All the comments about the waits aren't kidding. Came around 11 and didn't get in till 12-12:30 on a Friday. 
Even with the long wait I was impressed. The seafood served was so fresh. Had the crab cocktail which I recommend to ask for the sauce on the side. The uni out of the shell, and the sashimi plate. 
All very delicious and fresh!
author: Derwei C.

description: Mainly went for the sea urchin and crab fat but was told they're not going to have the sea urchin until late August/September ended ordering oysters, little neck clams, clam chowder and the crab fat. Mmm tbh I think the restaurant was hyped up.. the crab fat was honestly whatever's, the oysters were nothing special and the clam chowder was super runny. Wasn't worth the hour and a half wait but friendly the staff was super friendly!
author: Esther L.

description:
If you come here, you must try their clams, raw on the half shell......awesome

We had the scallops, freshly sliced with capers and onions.....

I would skip the clam chowdah, way too watery.......

Oysters were ok, we had all but they were out of one.....

Something about the bread, very good but I think they charge for it......

Our bill was 150+, and they only take cash.....
author: Leslie Y.

description:
Solid. 

Yes, the wait sucks.

Yes, you'll probably drown in a mob of tourists.

But hot damn - this seafood is so good.

We split the crab salad, half a dozen oysters, halibut sashimi and clam chowder. All were great.

We arrived right at 10:30 on a Friday so the wait wasn't terrible.
author: Caroline M.

description:
On a Saturday afternoon, finally, I was able to get in to this place.  With all the hype and  good reviews, I was determined to get in somehow..

The big question is, was it worth the wait????????? I would say .....
NO, its not worth the 1 or 2 hour wait. I have had better oysters somewhere else.
It was definitely overpriced for the oysters which you can get fresh  from HOG ISLAND or even better, go to Tomales BAY!

Service was good. Fun and friendly crew , however I was very disappointed that this place had nothing special to offer. No signature dishes, except for Fresh oysters and crab and other seafood . I have had better oysters in Lousiana, and Vancouver Canada.

I am big fan of Anthony Bourdain, but this is one place he recommended that I wouldn't wanna go back again  or recommend to go to..
author: Claudine V.

description: Wait was too long. Too expensive. Clam chowder was not even memorable. Uni, crab and oysters were just okay. I grew up with great fresh seafood. Overrated. Not going back.
author: C M.

description:
CASH ONLY PLACE and THEY STOP SEATING AT 4:45 ON THE DOT!

After 4:45pm, you can order food to-go.  There were empty seats at the bar and we could have had our bowls of clam chowder while we waited for the oysters but they were very strict about their seating rule. 

Didn't mind so much that their clam chowder was watery but there were hardly any clams and potatoes in the soup!  So not worth $5!

Also, I did not like how they handled the cash and food without washing hands in between.  Or using bare hands without a glove to handle the seafood and the lemon wedges - GROSS!

The oysters on the half shell were poorly cleaned - ours still had pieces of broken shell on the oyster meat. Since we only had the option to order it to go I asked if they can provide us some wet naps and they said no.  They were not willing to wet some paper towels for us - not nice.

Don't understand the hype.
author: Shirley K.

description:
Go EARLY! Waited over 30 minutes and got the second round of seating. Delicious crab cocktail and crab salad.

Too bad I missed the uni season, but I definitely will be back to eat uni out of the shell!
author: Joey N.

description:
With all their rave reviews, they don't need my 2 cents worth, but I'm giving it anyway.

I have never actually sat at the bar and eaten because the line is always too long. But we love to order crabs for take-out. These are the freshest, the most perfectly cooked, the tastiest crabs ever. And the folks at Swan really know how to expertly crack and clean them. They are the basis for many a fabulous dinner party -- easy-peasy, fun and festive, always delicious. 

One of these days we're going to time it right and eat at the bar. Seafood heaven.
author: E. G.

description:
I arrived in San Fransisco last Wednesday. As I would do anywhere I started exploring, since I'm staying in Nob Hill naturally Nob Hill it would be. I'm here for two weeks so I need some good places to eat great local food. I walked past Swan and noticed every seat in the house was taken. Usually a good sign, and there was a line out the door. I took it as a sign and took my place in line.

While I waited I checked out Yelp. I mean why not, i had some time to kill. Reviews seemed good but also some bad ones saying the place was all hype. I started to get the feeling that this place might be a local haunt or renowned. A view recent reviews said the place was dirty, servers didn't wash their hands, it was disgusting. This bothered me but I dared to stay in line. Figured how bad could it be but cringing for the worst. My hungry eyes and belly wouldn't let me budge anyway. I was lost in Swan's gravitational pull. Turns out those posts were full of hogwash, yes they use their hands which I saw the guys wash frequently. No need to fear the hypochondriac's reviews. 


The food is outstanding and the crew does wash their hands. Been here three times already and it's not scary at all. In fact the servers are awesome and the food is a fish lovers dream come true. I've had the clam chowder, of course, by the bowl. Really well done chowder, coupled with that sour dough bread I mean it's unstoppable. Then came the cracked crab with the Louie sauce, (really good sauce, ask for it if they don't serve it) which put me into fish ecstasy. I went back today had some more chowder (it's delicious) and the crab cocktail with the combination salad. I also had the oysters from around the world, wow, just wow.

Try this place at least once! As much as I loved this place though Sotto Mare is a tad better and not nearly as pretentious.
author: Paul B.

description:
After a sensual and foodgasmic encounter here, my friend and I both got crabs from this place...to go.

Let me cover our whole experience at Swan's from start to finish. 

Got to the front of the restaurant at about 3:15 PM and there was about 10 people ahead of us. Some guy in front of us started talking to us about his fishing stories from Hawaii that we did not care about because all we were focused on was the wonderful display of fresh seafood behind the glass window. He was rambling on and on about fresh seafood when all my friend and I could do was stare at the crabs while trying to wipe the drool that was running down the side of our mouths.

Finally got seated at about 3:45, hungry and fickle about what to order, we decided to try everything (good thing I ran to the ATM and withdrew enough cash to cover my appetite since this place is cash only).

First up, clam chowder. I guess this is more of the San Francisco style? Watery but with really fresh clams and though it was really juicy, I do want more thickness in my chowduhhhh. However, I was kind of glad after because it didn't fill me up so I had more room to try other things on the menu!

Second, the combination oyster platter of kumamoto, miyagi, blue point, and a fourth kind I can't remember. Holy smokes, the smaller oysters were out of this world sweet and honestly, I egged on my friend to order another round but she said to wait for the other courses first. So I listened and moved on to the next item on my list.

Third, combination seafood cocktail consisting of clams, oysters, shrimp, prawns, & crab. This little glass consisting of the some of the sweetest seafood made my taste buds light up with glee and did the Fresh Prince "Jump On It Dance".

Fourth, scallop sashimi, good but nothing I care to cover in great detail since it was just meh compared to the other dishes.

Fifth, Crab Louie Sandwich, OH MAH GAWD~!!! Word of advice, smother it in that sauce (pronounced SAWWWSSEE) and PUT IT IN YOUR MOUTH. By far the best thing I had at Swan's and I wish I had crabs...like that. Alas, we were satisfied and although we planned on sitting there the whole time 'til closing so to make the others waiting outside having to wait even longer (yes we're evil like that) we decided on leaving. I tried my best to egg my friend on to order another round of the oysters but she threw in the flag, a sad panda I was. Oh well, 'til next time.

Anthony Bourdain, you did not let me down sir. The hype was met and I am a Belieber in the splendid seafood emporium that is known as Swan Oyster Depot. Also, the staff is very laid back here, I believe most of the staff are all within the family. At times they were funny, at times they were not. Our server kept cautioning me when I was trying to order all the items, even though we ordered everything one by one after finishing each dish. It's like dude, did you just not see me scarf that dish down with a single breath? I can handle my seafood damn it! I'm a fat man! But besides that, good overall experience.
author: Edison T.

description:
A hundred years ago Swan Oyster Depot was prolly the best kept secret in the city. Clearly those days are long gone. The service is friendly and chatty, almost to a fault. They riff off each other and customers at the bar, so be prepared for a talkative bunch. 

The seafood is fresh, and some of the best items can look a little intimidating to the uninitiated. First off is the Crab Fat. For some, the name can be a turn-off, and serving it in the crab's carapace may scare off the rest. Maybe re-brand it Crab Butter, or Avocado of the Sea. But with a squeeze of lemon and a hunk of bread, this is the best. The only thing better was the Sea Urchin. Don't let the still-quivering spines scare you, this is a must-try. Served incredibly fresh, it was easily the sweetest I have ever had, and I would return solely for this. 

We also tried a mix of oysters: Kumamoto, Miyagi, and Blue Point; as well as Cherry Stone clams. The Miyagis were the stand-out, and if you are into clams, the Cherry Stones won't disappoint. The cracked crab was good, but a little underwhelming compared to the rest. Maybe it needed a sauce, but no good seafood should need anything extra added. 

The usual issues are of course the limited seating, long waits, and cash-only policy. But if you come during off-peak hours with cash in hand, this is a great place to try out.
author: Christopher M.

description: Hands down the best seafood I've ever had. Fresh is an understatement, I'm blown away at the quality of the food. Will definitely be back. Service was okay, not the best, but the place was really crowded for the number of people working. Prawn salad is delicious, and the best oysters I've ever had. CASH ONLY, also make sure you add a lot of time to your meter, you will wait awhile but it's worth it. Go alone or with a small group, the less the better, or you'll be waiting a long long time.
author: Erhan A.

description: Well of course this is the jammy jam! Plus my homeboy's work here, or have worked here! The smoked salmon platter, a glass of white vino and some clam chowder. Elbow to elbow with your folks and strangers talking shit! What can be better?! Oh yeah! More vino homeboy!
author: Miguelito C.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  I love seafood.  And this place was highly recommended by others as being one of the best in the Bay Area.  And I'm even cool with a cash only policy.

But I'm still surprised that someone has not gotten sick yet with their hygiene practices.  Not only do they not wear gloves, the same hands are the ones that handle the cash and wipe off the counters.  But that was simply what I saw, let me tell you what I firsthand experienced from a server named I think Derek.

I ordered a half dozen bluepoint oysters and a combination seafood cocktail.  On the cocktail comes an oyster on top.  When my server was setting it down on the counter, the oyster fell off.  I don't blame the mistake, but see for yourself what the next steps were.  The server then places the oyster in front of me and says eat it, which I thought was a joke.  But it wasn't, and only after many times of simply refusing to touch it and other patrons talking in sympathy about what happened, they finally did what any normal restaurant especially one dealing with seafood should have in the first place: set a clean oyster down.

So sadly, one star for this place for their sanitation practices.  As much as I like seafood, food safety is simply too important to me particularly for seafood to recommend this to others.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
I arrived at SFO, boarded the Bart, dropped my luggage in Union Square, and hoofed it to Swan at 10:30 am!  Coming from Houston my legs we not accustomed to the hills. 

A beautiful day, full of sunshine and a line of only 10 people or so waiting outside the door....couldn't wait staring at all the goodness in the window.  I was like a kid in a candy store watching the staff prepare everything I was going to devour.

Started with the clam chowder, great, nice and light...delicious.
An Anchor Steam... ++++++
Combination oysters....good, but I love gulf oysters.
Crab cocktail with sauce as served...mmmmmm.
Crab fat and sourdough bread....heaven...could be better if a little warm.
Italian sashimi with salmon, scallop, and hamachi....sent me off into orbit! Scallop was my favorite.

It was all so good we did it again.....ordered more of everything from the beer down.

The staff is amazing!  Everyone was so friendly and made you feel like you were in their home. Never felt rushed even with a line building out the door. They made the experience all the better.

Delicious seafood and friendly atmosphere...can't get any better.
author: Lynn P.

description: Excellent fresh and delicious food.  The service is fun and attentive.  Great fast pace ambiance, but we did not feel rushed at all.  Wonderful experience and so worth the wait.
author: Aurora F.

description: Best oysters ever. Outstanding fresh seafood. Great service too.
author: Alex M.

description:
I have been going to the oyster depot for over 35 years. Quality place with family generational staff. I just wish so many people didn't know about Swans now it's super hard to get a seat. But if you are in line Guy or Jimmy will grab you a beer. Louis combo salad (Prawns crab bay shrimp), Clam chowder, oysters and some smoked salmon.
*If they like you, you might get a shot of their private stock tequila.
author: B G.

description: Okay so you see the stars you see the reviews if you like seafood this is the real deal. Very fresh seafood probably fresher than you'll ever get anywhere else ever.One of my friends commented that it was so fresh it taste like it came out of the water minutes before we ate it. The crab was probably the best thing I had there. Highly recommend.
author: Robert G.

description: SF classic. Worth the wait. Every time. Freshest bestest raw bar in The City. Line up on the sidewalk and get you some good old classic seafood SF style! DO IT!
author: Jeff W.

description: I LOVE THIS LOCAL SPOT! Depending in the day, you may be in line for 30 minutes but it's worth the wait!
author: Chloé E.

description:
I love this place and try to visit each time I'm in S.F.  It's like going to a time capsule.  I first slurped when I lived in Mountain View.  The guys have great stories.  Some about their "poor" cousins who they used to feel sorry for down in Silicon Valley, now all wealthy from the land, and now they are the "poor" folk.

The oysters have gotten pricier.  I love getting the sea urchin which they serve in the giant shell.  I took a photo once, tweeted it, and people were asking me WTF?  It was so funny.

Expect crowds, long lines.  Cheek by jowl means don't say anything you don't want to share, you'll hear other people's stories and knock knees.
author: Lucy W. H.

description: This place is no longer a secret since Anthony Bourdain paid it a couple of visits and the line to get into this place is a reflection of that. They don't take reservations and there is no waiting list but the wait in line is so worth it. The best oysters in the Bay so far. The best chowder I've had since my grandmother's. The freshest crab ever. Keep in mind this place is old and only takes cash. There are no tables, only a very old bar. They don't even have a real website. You aren't coming here for the ambience, you are coming here for the incredibly fresh seafood and great service and the feeling of stepping back in time a few decades. Come here early or you risk them running out of crab!
author: Court M.

description: The food is decent, but their service is sh!ts. I was trying to order to go and these people that were working were rude as $hit. Not coming back here. F this place.
author: Q W.

description: I had the best time at Swan Oyster Depot. I love food and I've been in the restaurant industry for half my life, so I have standards. It was unbelievable watching employees and owners all doing the same food prep, counter service, and cleaning. The product was classic, delicious, and impressively well-priced. I felt like family from the moment I walked in the door and I had a blast. I have wanted to go for many years and I can't wait to go back.
author: Lizzy R.

description:
Dressed in black, we passed through the doorway and sat among the locals at the bar.  Unlike the smell of SFO that we just left, we walked somet hing comforting being wharfy and clean.  We stared at the board: oysters, crabs, shrimp, smoked salmon, etc.  Wowed by the history of it all and how small and simple the joint was from the counter tops to the cash register (cash only) to  the long row of seats at the bar and the guys schucking oysters.  A few bad jokes.  Smiles.  The traffic past the strorefront.  We were in SF. 

This joint has been around since the turn of the other century, not 2000, to be specific.  It's got over a gazillion reviews, so we'd been warned that there are at times a line down the street.  Lady luck's oyster opened up and would have us walk right in on that Tuesday afternoon.    

The crew that works there is friendly and hilarious.  Among the noise, some strong voices yelled about how the 49ers could've done this or that or how they're gonna rebuild for 2012.  I can relate; we Boltheads.  They noticed that weren't local, by the way we stared at the board. HA

Later, a dozen mixed oysters later of kumamotos and miyagis and another that I don't remember.  A bowl of clam chowder to share, which wasn't as creamy as one always see it, but still tasty. I think this is how its supposed to be made? I'm not arguing.   Some smoked salmon sliced, on french bread, with capers and olive oil to close.  Mind you, beers and wine to boot.

We had two crabbacks since they were lined up on the counter.  We were told Bourdain's recent visit had catalyzed patrons to ask for them?? How so?? We explained we grew up with crab backs.  Apparently, ordering crab meant being served just the legs and claws.  The body was used elsewhere.  Crabs were not just limited to their claws and legs; you ate the whole thing.  Nothing goes to waste.  My biggest childhood memory was eating crab fat mixed with fried rice or dropping rice into the shell and using the shell as a bowl.   How funny..

Seafood isn't cheap.  You get what you pay for.  Good times and fat bellies.
author: Jay D.

description:
Swan doesn't really need another review, so I'll keep it short & sweet.

Bring cash.
Prepare to wait.
Wait some more.
Sit your butt at the first open spot you see.
Get down on that ridic fresh chowder/oysters/fish/crab/etc until you can't move.
Take a walk around the block after you've stuffed yourself.
Avoid the homeless person peeing by the mailbox.
Go home, enjoy your fish coma.
Repeat.
author: Karen C.

description:
This place was OVER RATED!
The food is not special, and it is quite nasty! The employers don't wash hands after cleaning ur table, handling cash and making your meal by bare hands crabbing those seafood. We have been waited for over an hour, and the service is really bad.... They ignored you since they were so busy in taking Togo orders around 4:30pm... Anyway, you can get something better by paying less somewhere else. Don't come here unless you want to spend some time waiting in the line....
author: Alyse L.

description: This has always been one of my favorite spots in San Francisco - even before I moved to the city. The location is off the beaten path on Polk Street and you would never guess from the outside how delicious the food is. There are only about 10 or 15  seats all at the bar in the whole restaurant and there's pretty much always a line out the door. You can't make reservations so be prepared for a wait, but trust me it's worth every minute. The shellfish there is unbelievable! Everything from their raw oysters to the fresh crab and shrimp is absolutely delish! Their menu is small and they have a couple brands of followed beer and wine by the glass. You can also get fresh seafood to take home. If you're a seafood junkie like me this is a mandatory stop in SF
author: Karina N.

description:
Worth the wait. The seafood was very fresh. I ordered the chowder, combination seafood cocktail and some oysters. All were great. My friend ordered the half cracked crab which was probably the best out of everything! Sold out of their famous uni which was a bummer!

Service is slow, but just gotta go there with the expectation that you'll be there for a while.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Please tell me what is it that you get here that you won't get elsewhere?  
I find this joint exists because of a mad hype that I wont even understand why? 
To sit- min. 1 hr+ if you are lucky.
When you sit to eat finally, you are literally elbowing your neighbor and by that time if you are not disoriented enough, you are lucky he is not accusing you of eating off his plate. 
Then you have the long queue of peeps waiting for their turn to sit and hence if they are not literally on top of you, they make sure they definitely give you that tough look all that time you have occupied that chair. 
Now enjoy your delicious meal in this restaurant. Life suddenly seems extremely tough!
author: strfrm y.

description:
I'm not sure why, but  I always come here around Christmas.  Maybe it's the open crab season.  Maybe it's seeing Santa in the mall.  Likely its the idea of getting gifts for myself. 

So you know by now you can get the freshest fresh here.  Last time, I got the sea urchin.  They basically kill it, cut it open, clean it out and serve it in the shell.  It's amazingly fantastic.  Of course, the fascination of the tourists next to me was incredible.  They start asking questions about it...and I'm not about to share it, not that they asked.  They ordered one for the three of them.  Ya - they hated it but were gracious about it.  I felt bad...mostly because they didn't finish it.
author: David S.

description:
As Yogi Berra once said, "Nobody goes there any more, it's too crowded."  Show up when they open and get something to go.  Show up at lunch time and get in a very long line.

The chowder is very fine.  The seafood is very fresh.  

The staff are real friendly and they radiate an Old School San Francisco family seafood vibe.
author: vox m.

description: Amazing place.  Gets very busy, with a line to get in, but once you are seated you are never rushed and you get the staffs full attention.  Large variety of fresh fish and other seafood.  We tries the Crab back ($7) and dipped the crack crab in it.  Oh Boy!  Delicious.
author: John B.

description:
This place closes at 3pm, but when we went at 2pm, there was still a long line out the door!!!

However, it was definitely worth the 30 minutes wait! It's a very tiny place with limited seating, but the food is not only fresh, they also give you crab fat for free if you want to try it. Also you can ask for beer while you wait in line

I got the mixed cocktail for 10.99, and a cup of chowder! The chowder was very tasty, though it did not have enough substance that I usually like in my chowder. The cocktail was very small, but surprising it was filling!!!

I would definitely come back and try other things on the menu. *Note, do not get off at civic center bart station and attempt to walk there because you seriously will walk a few hills before you reach destination, and by the time you reach the place, you'll be sweaty, but IT WAS WORTH IT for us!
author: Josie H.

description:
Warning, parking here is metered and waiting in line can be about 1 hour+. Also, CASH ONLY!

Went here yesterday for brunch. We waited for about an hour. There is very limited seating. Maybe seats about 15-20 people, and it is bar style. My girlfriend, sister and her boyfriend and I shared a dozen mixed oysters, which were fresh and very delicious. Probably one of the best oysters I have had in a long time. My girlfriend and I shared a combo salad, which has shrimp, prawns, and crab meat on a bed of lettuce with a louis sauce. I had the dressing on the side so that we can try it. It was pretty good. I felt that the salad was missing a little bit of flavor so I added a squirt of lemon.  It was perfect after that. We also shared a crab cocktail. The crab was fresh here and tasted great with the cocktail sauce. 

Great service here. And they focus on you. Making sure your happy with everything. 5 stars for quality of service, freshness of seafood. Pricing is high but, for the freshness and quality and amount of food, I wouldn't mind paying for it.

Must try? YES! PLEASE DO IF YOU LIKE SEAFOOD.
Try again? YES! I WILL.
author: Thomas N.

description: Lots of history!!! 3 stars because you can find the quality seafood in many places, therefore there prices are not justified. I get that its been on TV and Anthony Bourdain and Andrew ZImmerman and all that. So maybe you want to come here once to sit at the same counter that oh so many have beefore. But still just for the food, not my first or second or third place to come for fresh seafood.
author: Andrey P.

description: Hands down best fresh seafood I've ever had. Had the delicious sashimi (not in menu, have to ask for it), crab back with bread, oysters platter and clam chowder.  Everything was so fresh and delicious. Worth the 20 minute wait in line. Also the service was great. Highly recommend.
author: Melania R.

description:
What is there to say about Swan Oyster Depot that people haven't said before?  Yes, there's usually a long wait, yes it's cash only, yes the place is tiny.  

However, they do one thing and do it pretty well.  Seafood.  I ended up going with my co-worker friend on a saturday afternoon (in our effort to do a bunch of touristy things while it was 80 degrees in the City).  After a promise of a cable car ride after lunch, I dutifully waited in line for Swan Oyster Depot for half an hour (which actually wasn't as long as i thought).

Once inside, we had a dozen oysters, a half dozen clams, a crab cocktail, a prawn cocktail, and 2 cups of chowder.

The chowder isn't the usual chowder.  It's more of a clam soup and is really thin.  However, I didn't mind it because it was super thick clam chowder I think i would have suffocated in the unreasonably warm 80 degree whether of the City.

The cocktail sauce was awesome.  It almost is a cross between ketchup, clam juice, and...something else.  It goes with almost everything - it went really well on the crab cocktail, on the prawn cocktail, on the hunk of bread that is given when you first sit down...it was AWESOME.

Service was spotty at best, however I think it depended on who you got as your initial server.  We got the old guy (I think he was the grandfather of the owner) and he was slow.  Like, painfully slow.  However, the younger guys were really quick so it really just depends on who you flag down.

Definitely worth it to say that I've gone, but since I don't live anywhere near Swan Oyster, I don't think it's a place I'll go out of my way to stop by again.
author: Meg T.

description: Go hungry!  Not inexpensive, but worth it. Cash only
author: A H.

description:
DISAPPOINTMENT.

The wait was terrible. The service was quick. 

The food... was such a disappointment. (Alert- casual racism:) White people don't know what good seafood food is. /shakeshead.

Seriously, though. I came expecting some sort of mindblowingly amazing seafood. 

....

1. Clam chowder- it was different from the normal clam chowder. I liked it enough, but it tasted a little like there were chunks of baking soda/flour is floating in the soup. Mehhhh.

2. Dozen oysters - okay, raw oysters. A few were very briney. I like uni and raw fish, but these oysters did not impress me. I prefer mine a little chewier and savory.

3. Cracked crab - this tastes like any crab from any Chinese restaurant. :/. I wasn't wow'd. Their sauce was pretty good, but didn't seem extraordinary. 

4. Wine - the wine was fine. I got a nice light white, nothing to complain about there.

5. Sashimi platter - okay, again, the sashimi was not well prepared. I know sashimi. Our sashimi still had some of the white string-y stuff in it-- I'm not sure what it is exactly, but really good sushi does not have that. It is taken out, or that low-quality grade cut is not used for really good sashimi. The fish itself wouldn't have made you sick, but I can get that quality of fish at any Japanese supermarket. It's not amazing. 


For over $100 for two people, what the hell :/. I was expecting SF to have AMAZING, mind-blowing seafood, but if this is what "good" seafood is-- y'all have got to come down to LA.
author: Justina C.

description:
No problem finding metered parking right in front.  Only a handful of people waiting in line at 2 pm on a Monday afternoon.  I walked past them into the restaurant to take a look at the menu.  The older man acknowledged me and said they'd be right with me after I asked to place an order to-go.  So far, so good.

A few minutes had passed when another man came over and asked "watcha want?" rather than "hello, what can I get for you?" which is what service people normally say or are expected to say to a customer.  

All the while I placed my order in a respectful manner as a normal customer would, "I would like a crab salad and 1/2 dozen oysters, please" and responded to his questions with "yes" and "please."  

He then went about his business preparing my order...shucking the oysters, grabbing the shredded iceberg lettuce with his bare hands to put on the plate, then with the same bare hands grabbed the crab meat to put on top of the lettuce.  While waiting for my order to complete, I overheard a couple in line remarking on the way the food is prepared with a concerned look.  So I wasn't the only one.

I had my cash ready to hand to the server as soon as he finished wrapping up my order.  His attitude suddenly shifted after he realized I tipped the full amount as a sit-in diner.  He smiled, thanked me, and wished me a good day.  Now, why couldn't he have behaved like that from the start instead of waiting for money to be the motivator?  The other servers seemed normal and friendly to their customers.  One rotten apple could spoil the barrel.

As for the food, the oysters were as fresh as can be.  I wouldn't order them to-go again though.  The juice was all soaked up by the parchment paper covering the plate.  There weren't any condiments such as mignonette or cocktail sauce included except for some lemon wedges.  The crab salad was not short on crab meat.  I especially enjoyed the bigger pieces from the claws  when dipped into the Louie sauce.  The non-claw meat did have some shells that I had to spit out.  So be careful!

I would go again and sit at the bar for the full experience and hope I don't get the same rotten apple.

Bon appetit!
author: Ms K.

description: Just went here again last week (its been years) and its still fantastic! My only complaint is that more people have discovered this awesome restaurant and there are HUGE lines.  Best time to go  is in the morning, right when they open. Also, I didnt realize either that the staff is all family? Very cool! My girlfriend and I ordered two bowls of clam chowder and shrimp salad. It was incredible and all so fresh! The waiters were also really knowledgable about their produce, and able to answer all of m my girlfriends questions. Anyway, if  you like a casual atmosphere, incredible seafood,  and a very old school San Francisco vibe,  this is the place. NOTE: Get here early though. There are always lines!
author: Matt L.

description:
long wait, be warned, if you want to pay for overpriced but fresh seafood, come here, if you have the entire afternoon or at least a 3hour block of free time spent waiting in line, come here, if you have a fiery passion burning in your loins for seafood then come here. Otherwise, skip!

My party and I got the sashimi style salmon drizzled with olive oil and some olives on top. It was so fresh and tender I thought I was eating veal or something. It was about 26-ish bucks for a "large" portion which is about the size of both of my palms put together.

P.S. The crew here handles money then goes about and proceed with handling fish and the sort without washing hands in between. Maybe it's just a LA thing but I'm more use to places that washes hands in between handling dirty money ya know
author: Ji T.

description:
I went here on a lunch date and the line was out the door. This place is really small. I would say about 10-15 seats. It's kind of dirty and messy inside and you can see the chef makes the sashimi and opens the oysters right infront of you. 
All the food here are fresh. I've had the crab salad (which was ok for me nothing special but they didnt go cheap on the crab meat which was sweet and fresh.) You have to get their oysters. The clam chowder was ok as well. In general, all their food was decent, not worth the wait though.
author: Jenny H.

description:
OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!  ok very limited seating.  Everyone sits at the seafood bar. This place is always busy and there is always a line.  The trick is to go on a weekday early morning around 9:45am.  Door opens at 10AM.  We got the last seat and I think about 20 folks can fit at the bar. 

Super old diner, smell of fresh seafood and staff full of Monday morning loving people.

What we ate:
-half cracked crab (on 7x7 list and the meat was so fresh and sweet!)
-bowl of clam chowder (not bad. nice texture)
-crab salad (huge chunks of crab meat on iceberg lettuce with thousand island dressing) This was the best salad ever! Generous portions.  I placed the dressing on the side. Great salad!  I wish I could have this everyday!!!

Complete the meal with a nice cold beer and pay the check with cash.  This place is Cash only. 

This place is worth every penny and every calorie!  Wish I could come here more often.
author: Ying F.

description: This place is the BEST!  Only complaint (not their fault!) is the long line!  That's because they're so great!  Everytime I go here (which is usually after I go to Brownies Hardware on the same block!), I am glad I did!  Best fresh seafood in town!
author: Marilyn B.

description:
You can get the oysters somewhere very easily.  Nothing special.  

Wait a second.  There is something special about this place.  I am very picky about raw food that it has to be clean. 

If you happen to be there, pay attention to this.   They clean your table, prepare your food and collect your money with their bare hands. And they NEVER washed them    so gross.
author: Perry L.

description:
There are not many places I'm willing to wait for, and by not many, I mean maybe 3 - Swan Oyster Depot is one. Classic American, super fresh seafood. I see a lot of complaints on here about the wait, so here's a few tips to make your trip successful:
1. Expect a wait. If its raining or cold, consider if you want to be waiting outside, maybe you should come back another day. If the line is gigantic, again, realize what you're getting into - maybe you should come another day.
2. Don't come with a large group. Seating is very limited and you're sitting at a bar. You'll be sat WAY faster if you just bring 1 friend. Its also easier to talk to just 1 or 2 people when you're sitting at a bar as opposed to sitting across from each other at table. 
3. Check out the menu and come for the seafood. Places that are hyped up often get a lot of flack for not blowing the pants off everyone that walks in the door often because patrons are expecting something different. Enjoy what they are great at making. If you're not excited by the menu, I'm sure you can find another place in San Francisco you will love instead. 
4. Be friendly! The staff here has a great dynamic and are very hospitable. You'll be eating at the bar while they are preparing dishes right across from you. You'll also be sitting at the bar, close to other customers. 
5. Its pricy. Fresh seafood usually is.
6. If you like Crab/Seafood Louie Salad, look no further.
author: Asia H.

description:
Being a seafood lover, I had high expectations of this place after hearing the raves on Yelp, and of course Bourdain. I also promised myself I wouldn't join the club of people that can't stand the hour wait and take it out on the food. 
So, armed with a random novel bought off the Russian bookstore on Polk, I placed myself in queue at around 12:30. 

Service
Around 2:00, I was greeted by the really friendly staff at the bar. That is actually a really nice thing about this place, is their staff. Being a small joint, every customer gets equal and regular attention. 

Crab back (fat)
Anchor Steam in hand, bread and butter as accompaniment, I dove into the crab fat as my starter. This was actually amazing. The flavor was buttery and the texture like melted butter. Very good. This would be heaven if it were slightly warmer.

Oysters
Got the mixed dozen, which included Shigoku, Kumamoto and Tomales Bay. These were OK, and I have definitely had better. 

Cracked Crab:
Really meh. The meat was served cold, which accompanied with the blandness made this really lackluster. So much so, that I had to dip every single crab piece I harvested in their cocktail sauce. Get the crab cocktail at $15 instead. Better value for money, since you have to dip the crab in it anyway.

Clam chowder: 
This was way, way better than New England clam chowder. Its much thinner and creamier,and you can really taste the seafood goodness. 

All in all, I would give this place a 3.5, which yelp does not allow, so I will give them the benefit of doubt and swing to 4, since its definitely not a 3.
author: Dhruv L.

description: Awesome place!!! First come first serve kind of place. Everything you eat is prepare before your eyes. Oysters so sweet and delicate. Sitting at the bar only and ladies there are hooks under the bar for your purses. Great environment with friendly service.  We ordered the oysters a mixed dozen and a bread bowl of chowder. Stick with the oysters and the beer and you can't go wrong.  Eat like a local go to Swan's!!
