I know this place has been here for a while and how many people can be ignorant about some peoples dietary decisions and restrictions such as vegan, and this place was all seafood and we both knew it did not have vegan friendly options for food. When one of the older gents came to take our orders I got half cracked crab, two oysters, and clam chowder which I recommend greatly its like 5 bucks or less for a cup of it so its definitely worth a try! Now this gent is asking my friend what she'd like, and at this time theres a line out the door, seating is filled and she's getting nervous because she ain't here for the seafood, so she asks in a whisper if they have anything vegan, at this point I'm pretty nervous as well, I was scared they might tell her to leave or be rude about her question. He didn't quit understand what vegan was, but was nice as hell about it, so she explained and accommodated her the best he could, they had fresh berries in the fridge that he offered her and some of their sourdough toast without butter  and black coffee. I know this place would be good but the end result of that situation just made it better.
author: Angela B.

description: Inviting atmosphere. Had a few trays of mixed dozen oysters, half shell crab, combination cocktail, Sicilian style sashimi and chowder. We missed the urchin, looking forward to getting it on the next trip in, also missed the octopus calamari salad. This is fresh so early May be better than later in the day.
author: Dove N.

description:
I want to like this place. I have been twice, but every time I go I find myself saying "I just don't get the hype" Staff is nice. Food is just Ok. Clam Chowder needs cream. I like the atmosphere but the wait is STUPID, and you can't go with more than 2 people.

Try in once. 

$$$
author: Jeanne R.

description:
Excellent chowder + fresh oysters of many kind. 
Century old spot that still has its groove & marbles. 

Go early. Always a wait there.
author: H H.

description:
I'm totally crushin' on San Francisco...

..And I left my heart at Swan Oyster Bar. 
(I had to stop myself before my already high cholesterol levels rocketed through the roof of this charming little place).

I love that I can order JUST crab backs. I grew up eating whatever was leftover after cracking open and de-shelling food for my younger cousins; which, included crab backs and shrimp heads. I was LOVIN' it! I wanted to make another stop there before we came back to SD but didn't quite make it. 

/tear.
author: Amy Y.

description:
I first heard about this place on Anthony Bourdain's Layover episode of San Francisco. It was a firm HELL YEAH I'm coming here if I ever went to SF.

After taking my MCATs, my girlfriend and I decided to take a weekend. This was stop number 1 of our itinerary. You want to get here early. The place opens at 10:30a for seating, but you want to get there around 10am. When we got there around 10a, there was already a line.

The people in here are really friendly. The crowd is a mix of tourists and locals. The seafood is extremely fresh. They have one of the best raw oysters I have ever tasted on the west coast.

We got the:
- Half dozen raw oysters
- Seafood cocktail
- Beer
- Half a crab

The crab was super delicious! I love the fact that it's counter seating and there's no pretentious vibe!
author: Bryan Y.

description: I love this place! They're quick, friendly and ready to refill your plate.  Thanks guys keep up the great service!
author: Patricia C.

description:
All is right with world; this place was perfect - for most people. Great food, helpful, even entertaining staff, but if you are OCD about neatness/organization, you should move on (and it will reduce the line). Also, cash only. 

It was dark and stormy, cold and late (well, relative to 5:30), and there was no wait! Filled up within 20 mins, but poor weather might help...

Mmm... Crab Cocktail with Anchor Steam, yatta, yatta
author: Mark 8.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot seems to be a San Francisco "must try" institution-like spot...

so i went...

and wasnt impressed, at all.

got there right around 11:20 am and there were like 10 people already in line...so i waited, and waited, and waited...finally we get in...bar seating only. squeezed in tight so your shoulder to shoulder with the people next to you...this i didnt mind so much...so far, so good...

the energy was great inside...all the guys working do everything from server, chef, to cashier...definitely a nice "flow" of things going on, and even if youve never been there before, you know immediately what to order, how to order, and when to pay.  like i said...service was definitely good...

one thing tho... i dont like eating in dirty ass places.  this place is a DIRTY ASS restaurant...as soon as i sat down, one of the guys comes over and starts cleaning the marble/granite counter were sitting at...hes wiping off all the leftover food that the people before us left, and he dumps the leftover drinks on the floor beneath him...as hes cleaning up the eating area, i can smell and see how grimy the towel was that he was using...to dry off the dirty towel moisture, he uses some paper napkins...when he serves me my drink, the rim of the glass already tastes like raw oysters...oyster flavored iced tea. hella not good.

i decide to put my tiara away and just see how the food is...there arent any menus...just whats on the wall...different seafood cocktails...crabs...oysters...clams...clam chowder...bread and butter...and some other random stuff...btw...if you dont like your food cold, youre not gonna enjoy this place...everything here is cold...except the clam chowder...

so....

we get a bowl of boston clam chowder.  its not great...very buttery...very watery...would never order again.

we get the clams...these arent bad...very fresh...huge clams...and he gives us a couple smaller ones to try...very sweet and pretty solid...not to mention they have 2 house "sauces" other than the tartar sauce and cocktail sauce that are pretty good as well...

we get the scallops...served either "japanese" style or "sicilian" style...we opt for the sicilian style...thinly sliced VERY fresh scallops served on a plate, drizzled with olive oil, capers, black pepper...pretty good but not great...

i think we ordered a couple other things...cant remember really...just remember feeling gross the whole time...oh, we ordered the "crab fat"...u know, the guts and juice thats in the shell of the body...ive always had this warm/hot...but they gave it to us cold...wasnt good.

im sure this business rakes in a crap load of money...have one guy/gal do all the cleaning, and have another guy/gal do the drinks...just a thought.
author: Kyu L.

description:
After seeing all the buzz about this place, I definitely had to try. We came at about 4:30 on a Friday, so we had just enough time to eat before they closed and didn't have to wait too long considering how popular this place is. I love that this place is not on the wharf where the seafood tends to be pretty mediocre. Yes, this place was kind of expensive, but hello people, it's seafood! I'm willing to pay more for quality seafood. 

I ordered the clam chowder and the seafood combo salad. The chowder was more brothy than creamy which I enjoyed--not that goopy junk you get on the wharf! The combo salad was a little pricey, but they gave me so much seafood that I had to take some of it home with me, so that's a pretty good value in my book. Yea, the lettuce is junk, but the louie dressing was delicious. I always avoided it since I had a really bad louie dressing once, but I'm glad I gave this one a chance! The crab and lobster were really tasty, shrimp was pretty standard. My friends enjoyed their oysters, but I can't speak for those because I'm not a fan.

Is this the best seafood in the world? I'm gonna say probably not, but I enjoyed the food and the experience. I wanted good seafood in SF and that's what I got. I liked the dingy vibe, the cramped quarters, and the staff was friendly & efficient--no frills, no gimmicks. 

Would recommend to seafood lovers visiting SF! Not sure if it will make it on my must-eat list next time I'm in town since there are so many other places to go.
author: Holland K.

description:
Yes, it is worth the wait!

It is pretty much not possible to go on the weekend and not have to wait in line.  Like a few people said, once you get to the front of the door you can start ordering some beers which makes the wait not as bad!  I would disagree with those who said it is not worth the price.  The seafood is all fresh and for what you get the seafood the prices seem pretty reasonable.

The people could not have been more friendly.  The fact that it seems like everyone working there was having a good time makes the meal a lot of fun. They understand that everyone has waiting in line for a while and do not rush you when you are eating.   In fact, there are no issues with ordering more food as you go.

Oysters and clams are must orders.  So fresh and tasty I think they are the best ones I've had in SF.  The only issue with this place is that it really is just a long bar and no other seating.  There is not a lot of room and its not the most comfortable place to sit.  I have no idea if they even serve water to people because we didn't even get offered any.
author: Fay M.

description:
This review is SOLELY based on the friendliness and service from the counter guy closest to the door because I never got to taste the food.

Waited on line for 20 minutes (not bad) and then grabbed my stool. Then ....... Nothing !!!  Sat there for 15 minutes with not so much as anyone coming to clean the last patrons' trash. No "I'll be right there", " Coming" or " Will be a minute or so". No eye contact , no acknowledgement .....  NO SALE !!!!!!  Bye bye
author: Irwin B.

description: Food looks great. Unfortunately the wait was way too long so I left after 45 mins without eating :(
author: Reza Z.

description:
Yelpers once again give an accurate portrayal of this quaint but bustling seafood joint.  At two in the afternoon on an obscure Friday in August, we were met with a 'short' 45 minute wait....which I'll gladly take after reading about two hour waits from other yelpers.  

Once we got within drooling distance from the entrance, a barkeep came to offer us refreshments while we wait.

Once seated inside, me and the girlfriend had a mixed dozen oysters, which were graced with blue point and miyagis (two of my favorite).  They were absolutely fresh and delicious, very little sauce required.

Next was a combination seafood cocktail, which looked small feeble from the line standing outside, but was quite substantial when it made its way to our alter.  

Lastly, we kept our eyes peeled for a third selection and found the perfect dish in the hands of our neighbor: thin slices of fresh fish and scallops deizzled in olive oil, lemons, and capers.  We ordered 'what she's having' and our waiter quickly obliged.

The total bill was around $67, which did not seem unreasonable due to the fresh ingredients involved.  The wait staff was incredibly attentive even with the chaotic orchestrated atmosphere of the place....our delicious anchor beers never saw the bottom and appetites never had an intermission.  With that said, my friend who was with us commented how the wait staff did not once rush us, even when there was a sea of sardines outside waiting.
author: Meson W.

description:
After 2 hours of waiting, we were pretty disappointed by the food. 

While the seafood was fresh and the customer service was great (the guys in there are really friendly) it definitely wasn't worth the price or wait. 

Definitely over rated. I won't come back again.
author: Preety K.

description:
SWAN OYSTER DEPOT whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat!?!?!?!

1 hour line.. no problem. But after getting in... I can see why it takes an hour to get into the place... cuz it takes forever to get everything done once your inside. 

I digress.... perhaps it was their off day... perhaps it was a bad combination of staff members and timing or just my poor luck.... 

BUT whatever the case, when everyone around me gets served promptly, gets the same food I ordered first after being seated after me, not to mention leaves before i do after getting seated after me while ordering much more than I did... 
well damn it all to heck, I expect more for my $100! 

I mean, it was great seafood and the staff seemed like a very fun bunch... but at the expense of my time and patience and hunger... come on! After hearing all the stories of this or that from the renown Swan Oyster Depot... I was hoping to see flying sea monkeys coming out of the staff's buttock's raining golden oysters into my open mouth. 
Sadly that was not the case. 

What I did get worthy of note beyond what everyone else had already said...
crab backs...  basically the top shell of the crab with all the cold juicy coagulated crab "butter" you can shake a piece of sourdough at! AND it was probably about $5... the cheapest thing I ordered

and that's about it. I know I will probably end up being flamed for this review... 
BUT i've had comparable if not cheaper seafood fare elsewhere. 
-hidesheadunderrock-
-_-
author: John-Michael C.

description: Ordered 2 dozen oysters of 5 different varieties, seafood salad, prawn cocktail, dungeness crab and main lobster (my favorite). Next time we plan to order the uni and sashimi platter. Awesome family establishment. Kevin and the staff were fantastic.
author: Nicole K.

description:
I came alone. I had heard tales about how glorious this place was and I have to say that my hype bubble was not destroyed. I heard about this place first from friends and again from Anthony Bourdain's The Layover. I was ready.

Arrived here as part of my first trip ever to San Francisco. Look for a small storefront, most distinguishable not by its blue sign, but the line out the door. On this particular Friday at about 1:45pm, the line was about 20 people long. My wait? 1 hour 15 minutes. Worth it?

YES.

No frills, no glitz, no glamour, besides the very funny, entertaining and friendly dialogue and banter of the guys behind the counter. As a teaser, the one solitary window you see is filled with the freshest looking crabs, shrimp, clams, oysters in the window. When you walk in, it's one long narrow hall, pretty much, of barstools and the most satisfied and happy looking people chowin' down. All of the guys behind the counter were very patient and informative about all the seafood they had to offer and mixing up special sauce concoctions to go along with your treasures.

Armed with my Anchor Steam beer (go San Francisco!), here's what I ordered on this day. And in this particular order:

+ Clam chowder - there was no skimping on the bits of clam in my chowder cup. It wasn't overly watery and not too creamy, and extremely flavorful and warm. This went along lovely with my fresh sourdough bread and butter!
+ Half dozen oysters - these are NOT your oysters from the Gulf of Mexico people, thank goodness! These went far and beyond expectations! I can't remember where they were all from, but included Blue Bay Oysters, some from Japan, Washington...very fresh, creamy, and flavorful with some lemon squeezed on. Deeeeeelicious!
+ Crab cocktail - for $12, I got a very good portion of the meatiest, tastiest crab meat. Eating it alone or with some lemon, cocktail sauce, or mayo, you'll be golden.

Some pointers:
*Cash only
*get there EARLY like when they open. Otherwise, count on an hour or longer wait
*the wait is substantially shorter if even a wait at all if you order to go. But I can imagine if you want the whole experience, you'll have to wait in line.

I would have been equipped to anhiliate this place if I had my significant other and foodie partner in crime to help me out! It'll cost you a pretty penny, but it's worth it!

I'll come better equipped next time. It's hard to try more when you don't have your eating partner.
author: Alison A.

description:
We were recently in SF for the day and decided to recreate Anthony Bourdain's Layover San Francisco. We tried to hit every location in that episode including Swan Oyster Depot in one day. Unfortunately, we got there mid afternoon and the line was out of sight.....

So, we tried a couple of months later and got there early. We lined up around 10:00 and the place opens at 10:30. To our surprise we were still only able to get in around 11:00. There are only around 10 bar stools and they are full quickly. I would not recommend coming here with a group. Single or couple at the most.

The oysters and clams were very good as was the chowder. I love the simply ingredients vs the traditional chowders elsewhere. The bread is probably the best sourdough in SF.

If I was a local I would probably eat here all time. But as a visitor to SF I gotta say until the layover effect is over I would wait. There are many other Oyster spots in SF to try. Or, you can always call and do takeout if you are in the area.

Hint: Bring Plenty of Cash no credit cards.
author: Stewart B.

description:
Obviously Swan does not need my review good or bad, I am just posting to rub it into all my friends faces. In your faces!  

The word authentic gets thrown around more than a Chicago Bears quarterback these days, but in this case it is accurate. As a kid I imagined all the piers in SF, I imagined getting Shanghied (sic?) most of all I imagined a gritty working class city with dirt under its finger nails and a bunch of hippy's on the other side of town.  Well there are still a good number of real hippy's and Swan.

Get there early because the wait can drive the uninitiated to madness. We scoped the joint out arount9:30 and grabbed a great coffee up the street. Worked our way back about 10:15. 

From amazing Miyagi and Kumomoto oysters to the best smoked salmon I have had.  There was a crudo plate that is not on the menu but is fantastic.  Combination cocktail was sweet and delicious, this is everything I ever wanted in a seafood place. 

Swan is more about culture and history than about what you end up ordering and the staff  works their asses off so you can have that experience.

If I ever come back to San Francisco it won't be the hippy's dragging me back it will be the sound of crabs being pulled apart, and an ice cold Anchor Steam sitting in a pile of fish parts.
author: Bob D.

description:
Freshest seafood I've ever had.

*The clam chowder was the best ever.  Lots of fresh seafood flavor and very hearty with their complimentary french bread.

*The crab salad is to die for.  BIG chunks of fresh dungeness crab over lettuce.

*Their oysters are delicious and fresh.  There is always someone behind the counters chucking them.

Wish we could have eaten more, but we were so full from their big portions!
author: Chai S.

description:
Oh man, this place is good. I came on a Saturday afternoon (around 1pm) and thankfully, I stood in line with a cup of Philz because there is no way I would have been a happy camper without something to temporarily satiate my hunger for that hour long wait. I live about a block away from this place and I have never not seen a line out the door. But as the reviews say, it's worth it (at least once, for the experience).

Good things
- Combination salad: Baby shrimp, large shrimp, crab meat; a plethora of deliciously fresh, fresh seafood. The guy that served us recommended we get the Louie dressing, which pretty much tasted like thousand island. I'd ask for less of the sauce next time, as it took away from the taste of the seafood, but overall this dish is a must-order. It's filling too, which is nice when it costs like $20. WORTH IT.
- Half cracked crab: I don't know how great of a critic I am, since the only time I've had crab meat even remotely close to this style is in Chinese food (so really, not fresh at all and mostly just oily and fried). It was easy to peel here (because it comes cracked) and it's really good with the cocktail sauce, but even better with just a tiny squirt of the provided lemon wedges. 
- Sourdough bread: San Francisco knows good bread. Swan Oyster Depot has good bread. Keep asking for this; they staff will cut more and more for you.
- Awesome experience: This is mainly why you have to wait in that long line at least once. You get in and grab a seat on the marble countertop and wait until one of the super awesome staff comes to ask what you want. They are attentive, provide meaningful recommendations, and demonstrate excellent service (i.e. the guy saw me eyeing their smoked salmon as he was slicing it, and gave us a sample. It's really great btw).

We ordered the salad, the crab, and two oysters along with bread. The total came out to be $58 without tax. The price isn't thaaaat terrible, considering how we were actually pretty full when we left. While standing in line, I also learned that you can get anything to go or call in for pick up ahead of time, so I'll definitely check out those options next time!
author: Shira C.

description:
Swan's website indicates the place is open at 8am(Mon-Sat).  We were visiting SF for two days.  There are so many restaurants we wanted to visit, but we decided to use one of our precious meal slots at Swan (yes, we saw Boudain's "layover").  

We get there just before 10 am on a Sat.  The place was almost empty, with a few folks at the back of the restaurant (not sure if they were eating or not).  One of the servers tells us that they only serve take outs from 8 to 11am, and we should return at 11 to get seated.  We figured those people in there were just friends or special patrons.  My husband and I had an hour to kill, so we hung out  a local coffee shop for 30 minutes and returned to Swan thinking we'll just wait outside for another 30.  When we came back at exactly 10:30 am, the restaurant was fully packed with customers and we were behind 20+ people standing in line!  Since the restaurant can only seat ~16-18 people at a time, I knew it was going to be a long wait.  I was pretty pissed off at this point and wanted to leave, but my husband talked me into staying.

As it happens, people waiting in front of us were told the same thing, "come back at 11 am." I also heard another couple passing by, cursing.  I can only guess they were also told the same.  The line was quite long by 10:45...maybe around 50 folks at one point, but some of them ended up just leaving or ordering take-out.  

1 hour and 45 minute later, we get seated.  Here is my verdict.

Oyster mix dozen - very fresh, but you can find comparables elsewhere.
Cherry stone clams - very fresh and sweet. good. 
Sashimi plate, Italian style - again, very fresh, but nothing special..just olive oil and capers.
Clam Chowder - clam flavor was more intense, and unlike for other reviewers, I didn't get much clams in my bowl.  I personally didn't care for it too much.  My husband liked it.

I would have given it 4 stars for the food alone.  I am taking away 1 star for wasting our precious vacation time, and another star for the insanely insanitary conditions in which the guys handle/serve food.  I kept watch, and I didn't see anyone wash or clean their hands after scratching their faces, shaking hands with customers, handling cash, shucking oysters, grabbing crab meats, greens, dunking bare hands into a large caper jar (that probably won't be used up for a week or so).  They just grab everything with their bare hands and never wash them digits.  Remember, these are the same hands that touch each oyster and sashimi pieces you'll consume.

I am not a squeamish type, but in this case, I will not come back regardless of how fresh their seafood is.  There are other oyster joints that serve equally good, if not better quality, oysters.  Just my two cents.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Was first in line on a Tuesday morning -- got there at around 10 AM. Pretty much everyone who got there before opening, except for one couple, was able to grab a seat.

Maybe it was the fact that there was essentially zero crowd, but service was GREAT. I never felt ignored like other reviewers have stated, and I was always able to get someone's attention if needed. As far as attention to the customer, the service was on par with five star, fine dining restaurants.

I had the sashimi, crab fat, and half cracked dungeness. For sashimi, you could probably do better by going to a nice sushi joint, and the crab fat was watery and not as rich as I was expecting. 

The half cracked crab was awesome though -- fresh and very meaty. In hindsight, I should have just gotten three orders of that (or maybe some oysters). Also, make sure to get the Louis sauce. 

Stick with shellfish, and you'll have a great meal!
author: Shawn K.

description:
My God.  All I have to say.  

Highly, highly recommend the combination seafood salad.  Also, if you like fresh raw oysters, these are hard to beat within the city limits.  The only thing I'd skip is the clam chowder, which I found a bit watery compared to truly authentic New England Clam Chowder.   Also, realize that this is, basically, a raw bar- so very few fancily-prepared or heavily sauced hot items on the menu- which is fine by me.  If you're going and paying for high-quality, fresh-off-the-boat seafood, it should be as simply prepared as possible to let the natural flavor shine through IMHO.

The waitstaff is gruff but lovable.  Efficient, no-nonsense, but will crack an occasional joke with you, cheer on the Giants if a game is on, and know their seafood inside and out.

I also recommend getting there early.  We were there about ten minutes before they opened (at 10:20am), and were in the first group to be seated.  However, if you can't make it there early and you don't feel like waiting in line,  you can have a meal packed up for take-out- which I didn't realize.

All and all, a great experience in a no-frills bastion of incredibly fresh seafood.
author: Derek C.

description:
All I can say is their crab salad was so fresh and so sweet it totally lived up to the hype. 

Having arrived in SF for a 4 day vacation the wife was set on going here first and I would recommend against going in the middle of the day on a Sat since the line was seriously 50 people deep with only about 22 seats on the bar available but like any husband with a prego wife, I wanted her to have what she craved. I think we could have ordered to go and been plenty happy. 

Service was super friendly, very fun listening to the crew banter back and forth to each other while they prepare your food. We also had the clam chowder which was just amazingly fresh. When you get a clam chowder that is super fresh and all you can taste is the light freshness and it is not just buried in cream then you are at Swan Oyster Depot. 

I had just 3 oysters and I am not a super big fan of oysters in general so I can't give my opinion on them without bias. 

Highlights for me the chowder and crab salad (I bet the crab cocktail would be great too). 

Skip the line if it is more than 10 people deep, try a weekday or off hour if you can.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Came here at 11:30 am on a Tuesday and there was already a short line. This is a small little seafood place with bar seating only. The customer service was excellent despite the place being full. 

We tried the oyster sampler with a dozen oysters... It was very fresh and yummy! My favorites are the Kumamoto oysters, but the Miyagi oysters were also tasty. Their horseradish is yummy and homemade. They also have cocktail, red onion mignonette, and thai green chili sauces for the oysters.
author: Jen S.

description: Deliciously fresh seafood, well prepared, good & knowledgable service. Must tries are oysters, combination cocktail, and crab.
author: Gabbo I.

description: Great service, great people,  the best smoked salmon in the bay area...Clam chowder..not potato soup...in a great broth.....I come here every week..Prices on the high side BUT. you get what you pay for.
author: david h.

description:
i was really excited about the crab until the guy got a cup and drove his unwashed hands into a tray of crab then into my cup im like "no gloves"? i just saw him with a dirty wash rag in his hand they need to re-evaluate there bare hand policy just imagine if they did that at every restaurant scrambled eggs put on your plate with bare hands or a salad or jello, just sayin.

and be prepared to spend$$$$ small cup of crab $15 just crab no side no bread no salad nothing just a scoop of hand touched crab lol
author: Kharey R.

description: This is a go to place for a fresh, simple and light meal. I ordered Half cracked crabs,  combination cocktail and fresh oysters. And out of the 3, combination cocktail was the best. The cocktail of shrimps and oysters with ketchup and horse raddish was perfection! The half cracked crabs was a bit too bland for me. Although there really is nothing wrong with bland as I figured out that this restaurant does not play around much with the flavor so as to emphasize on the original taste of the fresh seafood. Waiting in line wasn't that bad as the service was really fast.  The servers were very efficient and friendly. I think I might have met the owner and he mentioned that this place has been in the business for 65 years. My overall dining experience was pleasant. I would definitely come back again for their cocktail and probably try out another one of their dishes.  Any recommendations?
author: Katherine Y.

description: Fantastic place... fresh seafood without West-Coast douche-baggery.  Run by a family of New Englanders, it's one of my favorite haunts.  I love the diner feel, sitting at the bar with all the comotion.  Crab dip, oysters, and anything else really --- but not a fan of the slightly watery clam chowder (but that is being picky).
author: Dallas N.

description:
OK so, I get there at 10am on a Friday, ready to wait 30 minutes until it opens at 10:30, and hopefully be seated immediately. I came alone, which was super intimidating but I had to try it and all of my friends were at work. So i wait 30 minutes and only 3 more people have arrived. I'm thinking this is outrageous, Yelp, you guys are such liars about the "line out the door" as early as 10am. By 10:30, someone asks when we can be seated, and one of the workers says "Oh maybe another hour?"... What? I'm sorry but you open for seating at 10:30. I was super bummed because also it was raining I didn't want to stand out there for another hour for seafood. So instead I went inside and asked for a half dozen oysters to go. It was weird but I wouldn't be back anytime soon so decided to just go for it. I wanted to try more like the crab back  but.... that would be even weirder to take to go. Especially since I ended up eating it all in my car.....

Anyway, the oysters were good but they were definitely too expensive to get again and they didn't blow my mind. I was just in Seattle eating a ton of oysters at half the price and twice the mind-blowing flavor. It's fine. I guess I'm still a little upset with the opening time change at the last minute. I will get over it. Someday...
author: Jessie M.

description:
I came for the Crab Louie and left loving the Clam Chowder - Not a thick New England clam chowder but more of a broth. BEST flavor clam chowder I have ever had... the clam flavor came through fresh with a hint of brine yet smooth and full of flavor... WOW - I also have to mention they do an excellent job shucking oysters... They have a great selection and do it right and do it fast ... I would not normally mention this but I have had some not so good experiences with restaurants screwing up fresh raw oysters... I never knew you could screw them up but some places have... These guys are pros They Do it Right..

Popular Place - get ready to wait and don't expect to be coddled.. Order eat and get out
author: Jeff D.

description:
Came here on a random Tuesday with the bf, and immediately got seats :) 

Ordered their clam chowder, a dozen of mix oysters and of course the yummy crab salad with their famous Louie sauce! I would recommend the crab salad...its a must get because they give you a lot of big crab leg pieces!!  The oysters were very very fresh and delicious! 

I can't wait to go back again on a random weekday again because they tend to get very busy and packed.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Love everything about this place. love the line out the door, love the counter only seating.. Love the feeling i get standing in line knowing I'm in for a real treat. 
I give this place the credit for my constant search for hole in the wall places to eat.

I love oysters because of SOD..  Think of the freshest seafood you've ever had. That cool bite. That right off the boat taste... Okay, FRESHER then that!! 

Blue point & local miyagi oysters are GREAT... If you're not into oysters, the cherrystone clams are delish.. 

Seafood cocktail topped w/ lobster claw, doesn't get any better... 

Grab a bowl of clam chowder,  soak it up with your sourdough...  

Enter with this phrase in mind.. "Bring it on!"
author: Lucy R.

description: If you live in San Francisco, order to go. There is no point in waiting in that long line.
author: Anthony T.

description: Fresh food, friendly service but never again will I wait an hour and a half for this place. If I were the area when it opens then I'd go again, but I think that the Fisherman's Wharf has a lot of the same stuff and you don't have to wait too long. Note to self...if we do end up waiting, you can get beers while waiting in line.
author: Dianne L.

description:
I get a quizzical look when I tell "foodies" that I don't love oysters. I never understood why people would go ape shit for the $1 oyster happy hour at Hog Island, or why everyone raved about oyster shucking in Tomales Bay. However, after two visits to Swan Oyster within the last three weeks, I find myself warming up to those slippery little suckers. 

The mixed dozen for $25.00 is a pretty good deal considering the quality of the oysters you get. Anything with crab is dee-frickin'-licious - crab cocktail, crab in the shell, crab salad, combination salad. In fact, my favorite thing to do is slather a piece of bread with butter, crab louie dressing, and cocktail sauce and put a big chunk of crab (with lettuce so that I don't feel like a total scumbag) to make an impromptu crostini. The only thing I wasn't wowed by was the clam chowder, as I prefer the thicker variety. 

Service is great, and you can sense the camaraderie behind the counter. I also love the communal aspect to the dining experience. Waiting in line can be a pain, but when you sit your fanny in one of those stools, you easily forget the time you spent waiting.
author: Lael A.

description:
The oyster / clam are pretty good. The clam chowder is fairly mediocre as well. 
But given how crowded the place is, how long the line is...I don't really understand why this place is so hyped. 

Their thai sauce is really good though..wish they sell them in bottles.
author: Barry W.

description:
I love this place. Swan Oyster depot is a must if you're in SF. Squeeze it into your schedule you dont' want to miss out of this flavor fest!

Make sure you're not in a hurry and plan to wait. The counter style is very quaint and if you come with a group of friends don't be surprised if you don't sit together. We were a group of four and sat in pairs. 

The Clam chowder was bomb!, it was very light and tasty with plenty of clams..(not the traditional thick creamy Constancy).  We shared a Combination Seafood salad, a smoked salmon appetizer, Fresh Oysters and we each had a cup of clam chowder.  The salad was loaded with chunks of crab,jumbo shrimp, and louie shrimp. I loved it with a splash of lemon, the Smoked salmon was thin slices of salmon on sour dough with lemon,capers and red onion. Soo good.

Oh my just talking about it makes me hungry!!

Don't forget ladies wear comfy shoes incase you end up waiting, standing line only and totally Worth da Wait!

*************CASH ONLY************ enjoy!
author: Mitch - Allaboutdafood R.

description:
Am I missing something? Swan Oyster Depot is definitely worth going to if not just for the experience of it all. I love going to institutions and being part of it for a little moment. 

The food though...? Shit is pricey as hell. Hands down, the best deal is the bread and butter for $1. This made the meal. Just was not enough food for the price. Is clam chowder supposed to be that brothy and oily? I mean, I love the taste, but is that how it's really supposed to be? Not a rhetoric question - seriously don't know.

$20 for a salad? No way...Never seen a salad even come close to costing that much. Silly pants.

Service was good, though. 

Go, once.
author: Ramin R.

description:
I don't know why I feel bad about saying this - but I'm not sure it's worth the wait or cost.  The food (oysters, smoked salmon and clam chowder) were all good, but were they mind blowing?  No, I don't think so.  And the cost seemed kindof high.  

I think it's worth a visit to say you went and try it out (e.g., when you have visitors in town), but I don't know if I'd make a special trip.  

PS - The guys behind the counter were definitely friendly and helpful.
author: Larry L.

description:
Highly recommended. A must in San Francisco. But long wait (on a Wednesday, arriving at 11:30, it was an hour) and cash only.

Everything is fresh and perfect: crab and oyster are the items to order. The clam  chowder is good but not great. Be warned: the most powerful horseradish I've ever had. The uni is fresh but not necessarily the most generous in quantity for the price.

All in all, a classic Bay Area establishment. Cannot go wrong.
author: Frank W.

description:
I should be ashamed that I grew up in San Francisco and have never been here.  Ok, maybe because back in the day, I used to go get my own crab at the pier.  But I'm too lazy to do that now.  

This is the best time of year to go - early crab season.  Not just any crab.  The lovely pacific dungeness crabs.  And Swan's is the place to get it.  I can't begin to explain my excitement of getting my first crab cocktail here.  A glass cup overflowing with lump meat and a few nicely shaped leg meat.  Then you see a tray of freshly cracked crab walk by and are amazed at the wholeness of the crab leg meat all lined up.  I could have an eating frenzy of crab here, if I was rich that is.

I'm not an oyster person, but you can see the different varieties they have in the back.  This is not a place for large crowds.  One straight counter and you are eating seafood shoulder to shoulder with about 20 other people.  Hate crowds?  Then get your grub to go.  

I love people watching here, from the local and tourist patrons to the lively interaction of the staff (must be family - the way they talk to each other and call each other out).  

My M.O.:  Start with the clam chowder, though a little thin in consistency but good flavor, and go right for the crab cocktail.  I prefer mine with louie dressing instead of cocktail sauce.  They even have ponzu and soy sauce, along with vinegars, hot sauce, horseradish, lemons, etc.  If you want your veggies - get the crab louie.  

I'm sure the shrimp, fish and oysters are good.  These guys know their seafood.  Ask them anything about it.

Enjoy!
author: Maria S.

description:
4.25 stars.  Swan Oyster Depot is legitimately amazing.  However, with a line with stretch ability that makes Nadia Comaneci seem incorrigibly rigid by comparison, I would strongly suggest going with someone who lives in Russian Hill so that you can just order your meal to go.  You are missing exactly nothing by dining inside the restaurant from an atmosphere perspective although the guys that work here legitimately seem to enjoy their craft.  I think they might be the friendliest seafood people I have ever met.  

In any event, regardless of how pleasant the people are that work here, the real reason that you are coming here should be for the oysters.  Having said that, Swan actually does a fine job with the rest of their seafood as well.  We enjoyed fresh prawns with a flavorful cocktail sauce, the crab Louie salad, and Littleneck clams before we attacked the various oysters at our disposal.  All of the items we ordered had the clean, fresh finish that I desire in seafood.  

While you can order a number of oysters from Swan, if they happen to be heavily stocked in Kumamoto oysters, you should probably go for them.  Blue Point oysters are generally available as well, but the Kumamoto oysters are magnificent.  While you might initially be turned off by their smallish size, please remember that those small shells are actually quite deep and the oyster you find inside has a firm crisp texture with the slightest hint of brine.  There is a reason that many people consider them them the finest of all oysters.  The Mignonette pairs perfectly with these bivalves and would be my suggested course of action for a dipping sauce.  

While you have many options for seafood in San Francisco, there is a reason this place has been reviewed 900+ times and still averages 4.5 stars on Yelp even when you factor in the idiots that damn a place for stupid reasons like 1) the wait is soooo long or 2) everyone else likes it, so I'm going to hate it.  The bottom line is that universal acceptance is difficult to achieve and this place probably would get a higher Yelp rating than Jesus.  This is one of those instances where even the majority can't get it wrong.  Swan Oyster Bar is worth your time.
author: Yelper N.

description: Get ready to spend some money and stand in line but it's worth it (occasionally)! Start with the clam chowder. It's more brothy than your usual chowder but that's what made it good. The prawn or combo cocktails were really good and fresh tasting. The smoked salmon was good. Calamari salad was really good--it had octopus, celery, calamari (obviously) and some light dressing.
author: Jeanette V.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot might be the most San Franciscan place out there. Incredible seafood, the best sourdough in town (they get a special bake from Boudin), the servers are friendly and will bust your balls if you come in with a Dodgers hat on, and somehow they have the best tasting Anchor Steam in town. 

The fact that they don't take reservations, and you just have to wait patiently in line for a spot at their counter only adds to the charm.
author: Alex O.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot is a cool institution, I really respect that it 
- has been in business for so many years
- has built such a loyal customer base
- is friendly and welcoming to new and old customers
- has been featured on the travel channel
- uses VERY fresh seafood
- has a queue round the block everyday of the week
- is no fuss, no nonsense

However, it was just not my bag, I prefer seafood in dishes, rather then as the whole dish. If you like straight up, simple seafood dishes then this is your place.
author: Chris M.

description:
Super laid-back, casual seafood joint with the friendliest staff EVER! 

Sit at the bar and enjoy fresh raw seafood.  Chat with the knowledgeable and cheery workers, or just chow down!  I don't know what was better - the mixed dozen oysters that my friend and I split, or the clams that they threw in!  My favorite was the "little neck" clams, served raw.  

I also ordered the clam chowder and to be honest, it was good but not great.  Next time I'll pass on the chowder so I can save my appetite for more clams!!!

5 stars, for sure.  Great service and great food.
author: Cora L.

description:
A touristy day in SF would not be complete without visiting Swan Oyster Depot. We got here at 2pm on a Saturday and still waited for an hour. If it was slightly cheaper, the wait would have been almost worth it. 

Food: Overall very fresh and delicious. Esp yummy when washed down with a glass of draft Stella. ;)
-Blue point oysters - Squeeze some lemon, drizzle some cocktail sauce, add a few dashes of hot sauce, and slurp! The oysters are as fresh as they can be shucked right in front of you. 
-Combination seafood salad - If you want a taste of it all without paying an arm and a leg, this is the best way to go. Sweet crab, shrimp and prawn meat over a bed of iceberg lettuce. Thousand island dressing on the side. 
-Shrimp cocktail - Their cocktail sauce is amazing. I could drink it on its own. Maybe.
-Bread & butter - How can you go wrong with fresh baked bread?

Atmosphere: Super casual, borderline divey, bar seating with view of "open kitchen". Charming local feel, except that everyone dining there has a travel book open next to them. I would not suggest coming with a large group if you want to sit together.

Service: Surprisingly attentive given the somewhat chaotic atmosphere. The servers had a great sense of humor and seemed to really enjoy their jobs.
author: Connie C.

description:
Yep ! This is a great place for oysters come here eat one time an enjoy. The oysters are great everything is happy the guys are friendly and knowledgeable. 
Only come one time and return to your own turf the line is too long
author: Stef M.

description: Very small place, only place to sit is at the counter. Had to waited an hour. Good food, had sashimi plate W that wasn't listed. Basically had one guy making all your dishes. The uni wasn't clean properly, had to pick out dirt. The fresh scollap was delirious. I think the food/service might vary depending on who is your server.
author: Mona L.

description:
I don't think any food is worth waiting so long on a line. At least I can keep my dignity by saying I waited on line like this for oysters, instead of some cronut abomination.

I knew what we were getting into and we chatted politely with other insane people in line and were happy once we got in. The service was really friendly and attentive. The clam chowder was delicious and so were the oysters and the smoked salmon and the crab cocktail. A combo seafood salad on top of that was too much. Price wasn't terrible, all said, but I'd think next time I'd be happy to get oysters somewhere else, in a more happening area of the city. It felt like a dead zone to me.

By the time we were done waiting and eating, the beautiful day had turned foggy n' cold. Oh, San Fran weather in July. You give me a sad. It wasn't worth losing some sunshine to eat here. You can get the same oysters pretty much anywhere else.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Utterly disgusted by Swan. The place is filthy. Everything is crusty with grime... The fellas behind the counter serve you with their bare hands. Yes, the same hands they use to collect your cash with. Ugh. I don't even want to imagine where else the waiters' hands have been.

Seafood salad- extremely salty. Didn't even taste that fresh. Generous portion of meat, but really nothing special.

Clam chowder- an absolute disappointment. Watereed down with a layer of grease floating and glistening on the top. No clams. No flavor. Hell, I'd take Campbell's over this crap on any day. 

Didn't get to try the oysters after a whole one hour of waiting because my companions didn't want any. 

Maybe I'll give Swan another shot in the future, but do I really want submit myself to shit-laden, bacteria-infested food again?
author: Colleen W.

description: In town for a wedding and was in the mood for seafood. The 45 minute wait on a sunny day was definitely worth it. We had the crab salad, clam chowder and oysters. Delicious! We had to park a couple of blocks away but you are in SF. Cash only.
author: Thea F.

description:
Long lines...Why? Because the server talks to you and makes your experience more enjoyable and so you can enjoy your food! The oysters were super fresh and CLEAN. 

I like the Kumamoto because it's a little sweeter than the others and buttery, not too saline as the Miyagis in my opinion. 

The Cherrystones Clam here are good but might be a little to fishy for some people.

I also had the Combination Seafood salad and that was full of seafood and was pretty light and filling to end the meal. 

The main thing about this place is that they're able to obtain extremely fresh seafood and prepare it very well. If you can't obtain fresh and clean oysters and clams they won't be good when they're raw! Because they're just shucking it and serving so it's all about the prep work.

BTW. I HATE THE PARKING METERS HERE, had to reload my meter a few times cause of the wait in line.
author: Chris T.

description:
So I've been dying to check out Swan Oyster Depot for ages, esp given that I am a huge oyster fan, but this place is more than oysters - it is seafood heaven!  

My co workers and I decided to finally go to this classic SF establishment and see if it lived to the hype.

For starters, do come here early. One of us came @ 11:40am on a Thursday and got seated around 12:20pm, but by that time, the line was very long for those behind us...

We ordered the following:

* Clam Chowder - pretty good stuff.  Of course, all I ever knew was progresso soup and the occasional wharf chowder in a bread bowl.  This may be the best I've had so far because it wasn't super rich and heavy, but lightly creamy with fresh tasting clams.  5 stars.

* Half a dozen oysters - these were good but not amazing.  The waiter gave us three types of oysters which were very fresh and what I liked was that there were so many different condiments available ~ mignonette, Tabasco, lemon, etc.  I give them only 4 stars since they didn't have my fave kumamotos.

*Seafood Combo Salad - very nice light salad.  We opted to have dressing on the side.  The waiter gave us this creamy thousand dressing but then he made to order a Dijon vinaigrette which won us over.  Once again, very fresh and delish.  The salad comprised a bed of iceberg and romaine topped by varied seafood such as baby shrimp, tiger shrimp and crab.  4 stars.  Deducted a point since I'm not a super big fan of iceberg.

* 1/2 Crab - super super fresh crab!  5 stars, nuff said.

* Smoked Salmon on french bread - this was hands down my favorite dish.  The salmon had the perfect smokiness and the waiter gave us diced red onions and capers.  Super simple but just amazing.  5 stars.

Overall, the service was quick and everyone was so friendly.  Really liked the laid back ambiance.  This place is a throwback to SF of the 60's//70's with vintage pieces and classic photos in a no frills setting.  I would go here again for my fresh seafood fix but also to bring any out of town friends and family.  Loved it!
author: Van Anh N.

description: Learn how to expand your restaurant. empty lot right next door, and im sure nobody at this establishment made an offer. we waited right at the door for 1 hour!!! dont be a follower or a peasant and wait in that line!!
author: `Maxwell B.

description:
The hour wait was worth it!!!

Best smoked salmon I've ever had!!! Melts in your mouth. The restaurant has a 50's feel to it, the atmosphere was fun, and the customer service was great. I can't wait to go back!
author: Dina Z.

description:
got there around 11am small line, waited 15 mins which was not bad at all. 

was hoping for the sea urchin but too bad they did not have it that day. we had a sample plate of oysters, cherry stone clams, chowder, combo seafood cocktail, also a small plate of sashimi.

start with the chowder, if you love seafood, you will love the chowder. is different from most the chowders you had before. not as creamy, and milky. you can taste the sea! of course only if you like it. so if you like the seafood taste in your chowder you will love it. 

oysters, are great and fresh as they get. a few of them are very creamy taste and forgot their name but personally did not like it. but most of them is fantastic. 

cherry stone clams are now my favorite shellfish. i can say its better than the oysters!!! its so sweet, fresh, and chewy. doesn't have the slimy taste like oyster, but still gives the sweetness and watery feel. next time ill get a dozen of it. 

sashimi scallops taste a little mushy, but still good. not as what i was expecting. i will give that a okay rating. worth a try though. 

overall food is great, service is quick, of course is little bit on the expensive side. 2 people we spend $93 before tips. so all of the above with 2 beer. but i was full and very very statisfed with my shellfish craving.
author: Stephen S.

description: If there's no line, you gotta stop and eat what's fresh...this is the type of thing that makes SF unique, stay true to yourselves!
author: Trent S.

description: We waited for 45 minutes and met great people. The line was an experience in itself...most people having several drinks.  The food was very good.  For the price point, we would probably try something different next time, but very glad we were able to experience Swan.
author: Landon S.

description:
It became pretty clear to me when I saw the long line outside the restaurant that this place is going to be "da BOMB." My hubby always wanted to try this place, especially the oysters and seafood salad. So we waited about 30 minutes on a weekday afternoon (around 2pm). It was a small place where you can only sit at bar tables. The waiters were friendly and up to service. We ordered the seafood combo salad, half a dozen oysters, and a cup of clam chowder. 

I didn't try the oysters, but my hubby said it was freaking delicious and fresh. It was good with there sauce. The seafood combo salad was awesome too, it has fresh crab meat, shrimp and baby shrimp with lettuce. They give you two sauce: Louie sauce and the cocktail sauce. Both sauces were fantastic. Though I prefer the cocktail sauce, I think it was homemade.

Overall, it was well worth the wait to try this place. I would definitely come again (maybe in the mornings to avoid long lines). Ten thumbs up!!!
author: Elaine C.

description: Ordered a dozen mixed oysters. Very different taste from each one. The smaller oyster tasted the best. Boston clam chowder wasn't bad. Prawn cocktail tasted like you could make it yourself. Bread was good. The place also opened half an hour late also. Don't believe the hype. It's an okay place but I'm sure it's not the best. Would've gave it a better rating but it didn't blow me away. Nothing made it truly stand out besides the fact that it's been there over 100 years.
author: Davong X.

description:
If you like fresh seafood and don't mind to wait in line, this is your place!
Me and my family got there around 3:30 and got a seat around 4pm. It's a small place but man is it good. All of the seafood is extremely fresh. They serve almost only cold dishes, other than the Clam Chowder which is home-made and awesome! The Anchor Steam beer is great and cheap ($4/glass). We had everything from oysters to shrimp salads and the smoked salmon is fantastic! 

I have nothing but good things to say about the food and I haven't even started with the staff. You can tell that these family members love what they do because EVERYONE that walks by you asks you how you are doing and seem genuinely happy when you tell them how great the food is. I have rarely been treated better at any place I have ever eaten.

Bottom LINE - enjoy the wait in line, make new friends, and enjoy your meal, you won't regret it!
author: Pablo R.

description:
Wife and I stopped by the Swan Oyster Depot on 6/14/12 for lunch and lucked out that there was only 2 people in front of us.  I turned around 2 minutes later and there were about 10 people behind us.  After a 5 to 10 minute wait at most, we sat down at the counter to order.  Now we had just arrived in town and we were both hungry, so please don't judge.  We ordered a crab salad, smoked salmon, smoked trout, a prawn cocktail, a crab cocktail and some drinks.  Everything was very fresh and tasted great. I would highly recommend anyone, who loves seafood, to try Swan Oyster Depot.

There are drawbacks if you don't want to wait in line, or sit at a cramp counter with little or no room to move around on a stool that is pre world war 2.  Service was great especially since they were slammed with a steady flow of sit down and take out customers.

Next time, I will try to sit further inside the restaurant and avoid the first 2 seats inside the door, as there was a lot of traffic right at the door with the line of people and the take out orders.
author: Andre B.

description:
Wonderful!  The last real traditional oyster bar in San Francisco, combined with a retail fish market, just like the old days.  A true neighborhood treasure, the family-owned, Swan makes you feel like family the moment you arrive.  The food is great, provided that you accept the slightly limited menu for what is is.  Don't expect a trendy seafood grotto here.  Just an old-fashioned, down-home oyster bar!

Lines are very long at mid-day and into the afternoon.  But Swan, a real fish market, opens at 8 AM.  When I lived in the neighborhood I'd go down there for a late breakfast/early lunch.  Never a line before 11 AM, in my experience.  Also, Swan delivers!  Just ask!

It's cash only, just like the old days.  An ATM is across the street.
author: Paul S.

description:
I give a 3 star because of the following:

Food - 4.5
Service - 4
Value - 1

$70 including tip for one East Coaster's lunch.  Admittedly hungry when I got there all was great (except the soup...kind of thin, but tasty)...but $60 + tip?  Not again.
author: Don M.

description: Ok so came to sf with the wife and she said we must come here...so we came. Now if you're into fresh seafood. This place is a must. We started off with crab fat in a shell with bread. Super delicious. You will end up finishing your bread with the quickness dipping into the shell that you have to ask for more bread.then we got a clam chowder and a crab cocktail. The wife got the oysters. She said the oysters were great. As for the crab cocktail it was amazing. A cup filled with crab meat is always welcomed. The clam chowder on the other hand was just ok. A little too watery and not much clams in it. I would say skip the chowder if you can and get more cocktails.
author: Arthur L.

description:
Oh my god this place is filthy.

It is absolutely dirty, dirty, DIRTY. My fiance was shocked that the vintage phone in the front was caked in grim. The glass of the fish displays have corners that are greasy and disgusting.

If you walk into the back room to use the washroom you would drop dead to see the grungyness of their back kitchen.

I ran my finger against the top of their fish display in the back and it was covered in grime.

Dear Jesus, what the hell? 

If you're okay with the conditions I just described then it's definitely worth a trip to Swan's Oyster Depot because the fish and oysters are magnificent. We've never had a sardine fresh and they flayed it for us right there--- it tasted buttery and beautiful, Japanese sushi chef be damned. 

We had the mixed oyster platter and it was extremely good. You MUST get it when you're here.

The meal sailed along beautifully and was topped off by gorgeous and melt-in-your-mouth smoked salmon. It was on par with Russ and Daughters in the Lower East Side of NYC-- and perhaps even more buttery!

It took forever to get the check and the people next to us had trouble as well. So anticipate that the service people are a bit harried at this busy joint.

We absolutely loved the food, it was like eating seafood in technicolor--- we've never had it so fresh!

However, the dirtiness of this place really, really turned us off and we won't be coming back. Call us pansies but we like our restaurants so clean that you can eat off the floor. But if you are not a pansy and can stomach some "realness," get in there! The seafood is really unbelievably delicious. 

CASH ONLY
author: Lisa Q.

description:
First time we went there the line was 2.5 hrs long 
So we decided no thanks 
Went to a place close to there had a great time and food.  
Locals there told us in ten years of them living there they had never eatin there cause its a tourist trap over priced and to crowded.  That all the people outside are waiting for the few people inside to leave and staring into the window waiting  and that your so bunched together that your not comfortable. 
When we was leaving the place that was not packed and not over priced I noticed that swans line was empty.  
I went and stood in line as I really wanted some chowder.  Some girls jumped in front of me after a few min and said they had take out.  Then I got up in there to be like no more people getting in line and the dude that worked there was a total jerk and was like we closed our doors 2 hours ago 
IT WAS 5:30 he was rude and the place looked like a disgusting dump 
I'm so glad I didn't eat there and saved a lot of money!! 
It really looked  dirty and smelled very bad!
Should have listened to the locals!!!  
 
I will be back to San Fran 
I will not go back to this place
author: Chris H.

description:
So many experiences and restaurants are overrated, but when you find one that matches up with all expectations it is worth writing about.  Not to overdo it here, but I make a pilgrimage to Swan on every trip to SF and have to tell you it is in my top 5 in the world.  

Arrive early, hungry, and be prepared for a line.  Today was a beautiful day, drove right up Polk St. and found a parking space right outside Swan. Stars were aligned.  At 11:30 there were only 4 people in line which moves fast (enough).  Sat down 15 minutes later.  

Ordered 2 bottles of Anchor Steam @$4/per.  My wife ordered the smoked seafood plate, with very appropriate portions of smoked salmon (two kinds, hot smoked and cold smoked), and smoked trout, over a small bed of lettuce. I had the cup of chowder--always delicious.  Then the crab fat in half shell for dipping the delicious sourdough bread-- I will admit that I have never had this before but did on this trip because I saw Bourdain swooning over it on one of his recent Layover episodes.  I will second his review.  But, if this is your first time, I would suggest the Crab Louie-- no one, and I mean no one, does it better than Swan.  Oysters today looked beautiful: kumamoto, miyagi, and bluepoints, I'll have to return for those (tomorrow possibly?)

The guys behind the counter are all friendly and engaging-- excellent hosts.  Service is fast.   Uncompromising fresh-ness.  The 20 or so seats at the marble counter add to the friendly we-are-in-this-together and casual atmosphere.  

Yes, the prices are high, but definitely worth it when you consider what you are getting.
author: Michael B.

description: What's not to love? Fresh seafood. Attentive service. Unique atmosphere. Great wine. And a plate of iceberg lettuce is just what you want with a heap of crab meat on the top.
author: Olive E.

description:
After moving to the city for almost 2 years now, I finally had the occasion to visit this classic San Francisco seafood landmark and it did not disappoint. First things first, holy cow the wait was long. It was easily a 2-hours-plus wait for us on a Saturday afternoon.

The space inside is tiny and is bar-seating only, and it can only seat around 20 max at a time. You would think that in itself would ward everyone waiting outside away, but it doesn't, and that's just a testament to how immensely popular this place is.

Most importantly, the food here is amazing. Oysters, clam chowder, lobster, smoked salmon. It's pure seafood heaven here. In addition, the guys behind the counter are really friendly and happily help you as you stumble through all the various selections that you see before your eyes. You really can't help but feel like a kid in a candy store here.

I will definitely be back. I dream about that smoked salmon too much to not be back. I'll just have to remember bring a Gameboy or something next time to help me endure that line lol.
author: Tom P.

description: Hai guys.... I really liked this place but I was there with my husband who is a vegetarian and hoped there was like one teeny tiny little menu item for him as well. I hope the business sees this and offers something for vegetarian partners!!!!
author: Sumitha P.

description:
Not much to say that hasn't already been said. Down to earth, small family owned restaurant. These guys take great care of you and offer the absolute best seafood around. There's a constant line, so get there early
(They open at 10:30).  All of the oysters are great, so is the shrimp cocktail. I didn't think the chowder was as good as everyone says, but still pretty good. I came in expecting to be wowed. I ALMOST was, but I think this place is more of a nostalgic experience than anything else.
author: Jake O.

description:
VERY FRIENDLY staff! Yes, once you got in... Before that, you gotta prepare for a long wait. (it's really long). We went there Sat afternoon 2:30pm... waited 2 hrs and got in at 4pm. The place closed at 5:30. I saw the line still queuing up after us. 
Food was very fresh. Must ORDER oyster plates and crab cocktails!!! Even though everyone raves about the combination salad. I would recommend go for crab cocktail instead. For my 2 hrs wait, I did my homeworking by observing the portion of seafood they put on salad vs. cocktail cups. Trust me. the cocktail is better choice for your wallet.

Oyster plates gave 12 services (3 different choices of oysters). We also got the clam chowder. Perhaps I preferred a heavier cream and thicker texture, the chowder was ok for me. We ordered 2 crab cocktails + bowl of clam chowder + oyster +smoke salmon, it costs $130. BRING CASH!!!

And.... did i mention the super friendly staff? guess what, we got 2 cups of Chardonnay on the house! who cares the 2 hrs wait?! I will go back just for the chat ;)
author: Jayla Z.

description:
My sister and I had heard about this place, and both of us loves seafood, so why not. 
We came for lunch, and waited about 15 minutes for a free table. 
Got the best seafood and amazing service ever. 

Would love to visit this restaurant again!
author: Emilie L.

description: What a fantastic experience! we were intimidated at first but the staff was friendly and helpful.  great seafood and fresh octopus salad YUM!  a must for anyone visiting San Francisco but go early line apps are huge but its worth the wait
author: Mark T.

description: Oysters were salty, crab was sweet, bread was sour, staff was entertaining. All in all pretty decent albeit not the best crustaceans I've had in the city
author: Mina A.

description:
Two and half hours waiting is acceptable for high quality food, but it is not worth it.  They make the salad, get the raw food, clean up the table, COLLECT MONEY, serve customers, pick up phones, wipe their noses and mouth, etc without any gloves or washing hands in between.  It really made me feel uncomfortable.  

Tips: They have "to go line".  People only wait about 15 minutes to get their food.  "Dine in" line is more than two hours.
author: Wendy L.

description:
My best friend & I decided to go to Swan Oyster Depot for lunch after we arrived on an August Friday afternoon. We knew it'd be a long wait (and it was...at least an hour if not more) but didn't have a lot planned on the first day and it was beautiful. 

I enjoyed watching customers swing by to for take out and watching the staff fill takeout containers of squid salad or fresh fish and debating if I should try what they got. The guys are very friendly and make sure to offer you a drink once you get to the door (where they can serve) so it made it feel like you were getting served something before sitting. 

Seafood is definitely fresh and prepared the way I like. Sure, it's touristy and we decided to take part and I honestly enjoyed the vibe and just hanging. 

I wouldn't say that the wait is worthwhile so going at off-peak times is really best if you can swing it.
author: Nicole D.

description:
How do you review a San Francisco classic?  

I'll warn you-- this isn't a restaurant. It's a raw bar serving fresh fish from this supplier. They make most their money from being the largest (and best) seafood supplier for SF restaurants and keep the bar open in the afternoon almost just to please us locals.

As long as you're not expected a warm, home-cooked meal -- you'll enjoy the high-energy, vintage-style raw bar.
author: Zuzzi E.

description: Love this place! It's a San Francisco must. I got crazy lucky with no line as I decided to go first thing & on a day when it was overcast. The chowder is yummy & oysters perfect & the vibe is super cool. Great to know a place can keep at it for over 100 years!
author: Flavia C.

description:
Had my first oyster here!  As my friend said "popped my oyster cherry" .   

Not much to add to everyone else's review.   Quick summary:
- Delicious oysters 
- If you're not into oysters, the crab salad is delicious !  
- Only one row of seats, so the line can get long but the wait wasn't too bad
- service made us feel like we have been regulars for years.  

Side note:  when we left our server said "guys get this and girls get this!"  and handed my friend and I, what seemed like a small yellow business card, while my friend's husband got a postcard.     Turned out we got a sponge -_____-  hahahah how sexist but funny at the same time....
author: Bianca P.

description:
Fantastic!  It's everything Anthony Bourdain said it would be and more!  I first heard about this place on the Travel Channel's No Reservations and they were right.  The seafood is about as fresh as you're going to get.  

Get there early!  The line for Swan forms at 10:00AM!  That's right, 10:00AM!  One might ask, who eats seafood that early but once you get there you'll see why.  There's only bar seating available and there are only about 15 seats.  If you get there at 10:30 like I did, expect at least a 45 minute wait but once you get inside, let's the good times begin!  The oysters were super fresh and the crab salad is pretty amazing.  In my opinion I like the clam chowder at Hog island a little bit better but this one is pretty darn good too.  

Remember to BRING CASH or you'll be washing dishes for a month to pay off your 1 hour meal.  Luckily there's a Chase Bank across the street.  

I ordered:  1x Crab Salad, 1x cup of clam chowder, and 6pcs Oysters and my bill was $47 including tax.  Yes it's expensive, there's no question.  Is it worth it?  I think so.
author: Dave L.

description:
Food alone was more than perfect.  We had the dungeoness crab salad with the crab-goo dressing, a dozen of mixed oysters, a bowl of clam chowder and a glass of beer. I suggest the oyster lovers to order Stellar Bay oysters.  They are plump, sweet, and tasty.  My favorite oysters by far.  All of the seafood here is fresh, you can taste it! Price is what you pay for fresh seafood.. i think our bill for those items came out to be around $60-70, not including tips. eeekk!!!! 

A very important tip, though...I came here during winter and it was a big mistake.  We waited outside for about an hour + and it was freeeeezing cold.  Not only that but it was so uncomfortable to eat because it's a pretty compacted place.  Bar top seating, elbow rubbing and as I mentioned, it was FREEEZING in there. We couldn't feel our toes after and had to blast the heater in the car. I would go back, but definitely not during cold season!
author: Beck S.

description:
This place isn't perfect. ITs cash only, there is always a line, and some dishes can be hit or miss. But I'll tell you one thing, what is hit, is a HIIIT. The oysters are by far the best I've ever had anywhere. The prices are super reasonable, espcailly for san francisco. The crab is to die for if you like those flavors, super creamy and savory. But the wiiner, was the Sea Urchin. I managed to pick a MONSTER sea urchin that had so much meat inside the man behind the counter was wow'd. Absolutely delicious and one of the few places that serves urchin like this. A lot of place i've been to open the urhcin and then weigh the meat and then put it back in shell as a presentation gimmick. But this place opens up the sea urchin and puts it straight on your table. 

Clam showder is solid, although not the best. Salmon plate is also amazing. Get the scallops if they have them. 

PRO TIP: it says they open at 11 but get there at like 10:40 and they might let you in.
author: Alex P.

description: Used to come here with a bartender friend a few years ago. It's a San Francisco legend. Excellent, quality seafood. Not cheap, and notorious lines, but worth the wait. I always liked to go around 2:30, after the lunch rush.
author: Richard P.

description:
Great old school, bare bones, hole-in-the-wall fishmongers joint!
I happened across Swan Oyster Depot after a 25 year or so hiatus. 
Apparently my parents had been going to Swans since 1965!!

My mom insisted that we stop here as soon as we hit town. We luckily scored two barstools and we were on our way to oyster and prawn heaven!

I ha a dozen assorted oysters which were fresh and delicious with no sauce save a tiny squeeze of lemon. My ma had the prawn cocktail and kept saying it was as good as she'd remembered. 

This ain't no fancy joint-come here for the good, fresh fish and the colorful old school staff. Oh yes, CASH ONLY.
author: Shelley V.

description:
What insight can I possibly have to offer that 850+ other Yelpers haven't already noted...

TOTALLY WORTH THE WAIT if you are a seafoodhead.   No, really.

Try to get there at an odd time (earlier the better, but sometimes TOO early is still filled).  Unless you're gonna be cool like the people behind us, please don't stare at me and my slow ways just because I'm the last seat closest to the door.  It's not gonna make me go any faster.

Hung over (like I was)?  Have them make you a Bloody beer.  They make it with Bud Light (boo) but put toooons of their yummy homemade cocktail sauce in it (yaaay).

Cute guy, younger, facial hair, went to Cal Poly SLO and brewed.  Most likely married, but swooning and laughing at his every joke like he's freaking Tosh.0 doesn't hurt.

Don't rush (either them or yourself).  Chill.  Enjoy.  Get the oyster variety platter.  An arm and a leg, but completely worth it.

The salads and cocktails ARE ALL SO VERY GOOD.  Fresh, full of seafood, put together right on the spot.  Horseradish is available, cocktail sauce, mignonette, etc. etc. -- all right there for you.

Don't get the clam chowder unless you REALLLLLY like the taste of clams.  It's not as thick or creamy (or even clammy) as you might think, so just be aware of this.  I LOVED IT.  Perfect with the bread.

Lastly,  HOLY SH*T SMOKED SALMON.  If you're a lover like me, you have to get this.  SO GOOD with the shrimp side salad provided :)

I love you Swan.  I also love you Anthony Bourdain, but whatevers.
author: Monica D.

description: So delicious! The uni was so fresh, it was moving. We got there pretty early and only waited in line for about 10 minutes or so. The sashimi platter's salmon made my friend wriggle with glee. My SF friend made me get the clam chowder ... to prove to me that I wouldn't like it. She was right, I didn't.
author: Mimi W.

description: Love this neighborhood and city gem.  Delicious fresh seafood, I usually get the crab louie salad, crab backs (use sourdough to dip with) and their oysters.  Lines are silly so go at odd hours or if you're local like me just call in a take out order.
author: Jay H.

description:
The wait in line sucks.

The counters are filthy.

The food is pricy but delicious.

The same guy who shucks your oysters uses the same gloves to handle the cash.
author: Evan W.

description:
That was on the list for our trip to SF, but it was extremely disappointing. It's dirty, the taste and the services were terrible. Also the Price was very rip off too. We ordered a small salmon sashimi which was about the size of my palm ( 8cmx7cm) and 0.3cm thick. We got charged for $16!
Will NOT recommend it to anyone. TERRIBLE place. I would have put a ZERO start if the option is available.
author: Jessie L.

description:
As soon as your plane lands at SFO, some people think out their master plan.  My wife and I on the other hand were trying to figure out the quickest way to Swans so we could cure our appetite for some fresh shellfish.

We got to a line about 9 deep not too bad for a Friday around 11:30.  We soon realized after us there were about 15 people waiting.  So remember to get there early so you don't have to wait too long for your seafood. 

Ok here's what we ordered.  2 cups of chowder.  1 dozen miyagi, 1 dozen kumamotos, 1 dungeness crab salad with Louie sauce, and a bottle of Lewis chard.  Bill came to $150, so not bad considering the chard was 60 a bottle.  

Btw I gotta say the chowder was really impressive like the base was seawater and then the brininess of the sea came through!  Really impressed with this product. 

You really can't complain about the quality of the product there.  My only gripe was that they ran out of sea urchin at 11:45am.  Disappointed because we saw the last 2 going out for a carry out and it looked so good I would have cut off a finger to have a couple(really kidding about that).  Regardless there are many things that the locals get that are definitely off menu so ask your server to hook you up.  They had some sashimi that looked absolutely to die for, remember ask your server to give you the lowdown.  

Would repeat in a New York minute, but it's a little far from dc to commit.  Regardless cheers and happy eats.  Definitely a place to get bang for your buck as well.
author: Kevin K.

description:
They have such amazing fresh seafood. I crave seafood sometimes yet have a hard time going in for Sushi. Then I remember SWAN's.
The portions are generous and you won't get anything any fresher. Invariably  almost always go in by myself, leaving it to the people behind the counter to recommend what and size I should get. They have LARGE portions. I always leave full and can't believe what a deal it is!

Fresh shucked oysters without all the pretense. Down to earth, funny staff. Always a pleasure.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I was thinking of giving this place 3 stars because I was really let down by the clam chowder and cherrystone clams that started and ended my meal.

Then I thought about everything that was great about my early lunch at Swan Oyster Depot.

First, the crab head is given away for free and it tasted delicous!

Second, the Blue Point and Kumamoto oysters were fresh, flavorful and tasty!

Third, the sashimi platter, which consisted of salmon, scallop and albacore was a bargain for $11. 

Fourth, the casual family atmosphere at Swan can not be beat.

Four stars because I will definitely be back.
author: Sam T.

description:
I just had meal there yesterday with my in law coming from out of state.We loved it..Expensive for sure but good expensive. Worth every dime we spent. Big line, small place...Just the experience we
 wanted to live..To be highly recommended.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Huge. Huge Line. Always.
And for good reason too!

It's really small, just a counter of seats so I recommend taking it to-go. My friends and I felt like bums eating it on the sidewalk. Classy bums though, mind you.  The guy that helped us was really nice and helpful. Went out of his way to wrap it up all nice. And they have the cutest tiny bottle of Tabasco sauce. We got oysters only. So fresh!! So worth it. He said get gave us 3 different kinds but I couldn't tell the difference. They all tasted like heaven. Yum now I want more!
author: Tammy N.

description:
This place was top of the list for places to eat in San Francisco and they did not let us down.
