Showed up at 10:00 am on a wed and they weren't ready for sit down service yet, we went up the road for a cup of coffee came back at 10:25 and got 3 of the last 4 seat on the bar.  Yeah, there that popular.  The three of us shared everything.  Boston clam chowder, it was good, maybe not the best chowder I have had, but enjoyed it.  Seafood salad, it doesn't get much better then this.  Fresh and clean with a little Louie sauce, that plate makes me happy just thinking about it now =)   Then was the oysters, even if your not into oysters, get some here.  You won't ever find fresher, cleaner oysters again. The miyagi oysters were our favorites.

Come early and eat all you can.
author: Steven H.

description:
Believe it or not, I came here for breakfast, yes breakfast. I knew this place gets packed close to lunch time and I didn't want to be caught in a long line waiting to get in. So my friend and I decided to get there around 10:30am and share some oysters. It was already pretty packed in the place, but we found 2 seats right near the door at the bar so we snatched 'em up. 

We ordered a dozen oysters and told them to just mix it up a bit and give us a bunch of different types. I was pretty disappointed when 2 of the oysters he gave us were super tiny (they are supposed to be like that, but we were hoping for 12 good sized oysters). It was totally fine though, we could have always ordered more if we wanted, and I understand he was just allowing us to try something we may have never had before. The guy gave us a bunch of different sauce options to try with our oysters. My favorite was the cocktail sauce. Just enough spiciness and super delicious with the oysters. We ordered a bowl of clam chowder after finishing our oysters and that was also really good. VERY buttery and creamy, and full of clams and potatoes. It was excellent. The total meal cost $40 plus tip. 

The guys behind the counter were lively, enthusiastic, and you could tell they very much enjoyed what they did. They also sell fresh seafood to take home with you, and I'd definitely recommend these guys. They know their stuff and can help you out big time.
author: Ashley D.

description: "THEY DONT SUPPORT YELP" So get this... on 4/12 Saturday 4:15 pm this all went down. Well I have heard many times that this is the place to go for seafood.  Thats what we wanted so this is where we wanted to go. Checked Yelp and they said they were open until 5:30 pm...yea not the case apparently. So we arrived 1 1/4 hrs before closing and waited for some time but as we got closer to the front they informed us that we could only order to go....yea eating seafood outside while exhaust streams past our face seems appetizing to some but that was not what we wanted. We had plenty of time to make it in and dine I thought. I informed the manager that on Yelp it said they were open until 5:30pm. His response "WE DONT SUPPORT YELP" He must have been kidding...but no he wasnt. You dont support Yelp???? WOW ok??? Yelp in San Francisco is like the bible for restaurants. The end result...we left with no food and the simple idea that this guy (worker who probably makes minimum wage) decided that instead of going above and beyond for their customers put his own ego ahead. I will not be going here moving forward. Heard many great things about the restaurant but the simple fact that they don't support Yelp means that they dont really care about what their customers think. More importantly it makes no sense when they have the rating they have and the amount of reviews as well. Dont support Yelp? Well I will go somewhere else in San Francisco and I encourage others as well.
author: Kim A.

description:
10 Stars for EXCELLENT Seafood.

Tourists, Locals, everyone should come here once a week. I would if I could.

for 2 people, stuffed w/ Oysters and Salad, can't ever go wrong w/ this place.

10 Stars for EXCELLENT Seafood.
10 Stars for EXCELLENT Seafood.
10 Stars for EXCELLENT Seafood.
author: Lee L.

description:
This place had 
- Wonderful fresh oysters
- Great boisterous men behind the counter
- Stupendous service

I came with my girlfriend after we had a craving for oysters. Yelp lead us to this little gem. I think we waited outside for less than 5 mins and were seated. My only complaint is how terribly cramped the oyster bar is. It is like a large walk-in closet. They really should expand into another location. I could imagine how long the wait would have been, if my party was more than 2. Other than that minor complaint, I had a marvelous time and cannot wait to return.
author: Tess R.

description: Perfect oyster bar with other fresh shellfish options. Closes at 5pm. Cash Only.
author: Deborah C.

description: Neighborhood Gem! Top 10 place to eat at according to a zillion lists...
author: Madhusudhan R.

description:
I love this spot for the staff, smoked salmon, and sea urchin (uni).  They also have pretty reasonable prices.  The real excellence is in these items and not the oysters.  While I did enjoy the oysters here, so many other establishments exceed theirs, like Aquagrill in New York.  


Drawbacks: Cash only, wait certain days of the week, closes at 5pm
author: Geoffrey Y.

description: It's actually been many years since I was at Swan Oyster Depot, but it stands out as a great memory.  It's very casual, but the oysters were great!  When we visited, there wasn't a wait.  As I say, it's been many years.
author: Sue N.

description:
Swan is a small joint that consists of only a bar, some stools, and coat hooks. Because of it's popularity, the place gets packed quick so come early if you don't want to have to hover behind people and watch them eat while you wait. Although doing so allows you to gauge how much you want, what looks good, etc. Their menu isn't very big, but if you're a seafood lover this is an exciting place to be. 

We had the assortment of raw oysters, combination seafood salad, and clam chowder. Their chowder was a boston style chowder and on the watery side. I'm use to the thicker stuff so I can't say I was a fan. The oysters were fresh and super tasty, but the combination seafood salad had to to be hands down my favorite here. Frankly, the greens consists of only lettuce, but the crunch from the iceburg worked so well with the soft bits of crab and shrimp in the salad. It comes without a dressing so my party literally threw everything in it and it tasted phenomenal.

It's clearly a case where the quality of the seafood compensates for less exceptional parts of the dish.
author: Alesia T.

description: I went here yesterday with my sister and ordered two oysters, cup of clam chowder, prawn cocktail, and an ice cold Stella.  THe oysters were fresh, cold, and delicious!!!! Especially the miyage and kumamoto's.  It instantly reminded me of Seattle and the fresh oysters I had there.  If you love oysters it is one of the best and freshest place to go...if you are in the city YOU MUST go! The guys working there are also great.
author: Kathy S.

description: I believe it is the hype. If you want to dine in, be prepared for one to one and half wait. I was told every San Franciscans has to come here at least once in lifetime. I did take out. I ordered a dozen of assorted raw oysters, for $30. Hmm, not all of them are great. I am not sure the quality is superior to my other favorite oyster places. And certainly it is expensive here. The service here is very friendly. They wrote the names of oysters on the plate beneath the oysters for me.
author: Emmy P.

description: There is NO other place like Swans anywhere. Bar none the best seafood and iconic San Francisco dining experience.
author: Patricia S.

description:
My gf and I waited a whole HOUR to get into this place. We arrived at 11am, thinking we'd "beat the rush", but to no avail.  We ordered
the seafood salad plates (combos) and she go the clam chowder.
She loved the seafood and chowder, but to me, I couldn't really taste anything, because it was all served cold (except the chowder).  I felt like a seal barking for fish on those stools. And when I asked for more bread (they only gave us one dish), they gave me a little attitude.  Now I read that they handle the seafood with the same hands they handle money with? If my germophobic gf knew that, she'd have made us walk out immediately!  Oh, and with 2 combo salads (which were nothing but cold prawns/shrimp plopped on a bed of lettuce) + 1 "cup" (not even a bowl) of clam chowder, and water to drink, set us back $50 for lunch. NO THANK YOU ever again.
author: Greg M.

description:
2.5 hour wait in the freezing cold. Worth it? 

Yes. I read my friend's reviews about it being lackluster. I saw excited faces in line mumbling about how some of them had tourist friends here, some living here for 7 years and never trying Swan Depot, etc. I was wondering to myself is it worth standing in line for almost 3 hours waiting to eat seafood? Is it that much more amazing to have seafood at a place with stools that seat only 12 a time? 

But - well the clam chowder was pretty darn good. It wasn't too thick - It had just the right amount of seafood, fresh clam taste. Just wish it were slightly hotter - being the Asian grandma I am with soup temperature.

We asked for Scallops prepared in whatever way they served - this came from my eyeing the huge slabs of fresh scallop in the window. It was so fresh, so buttery, so good - well worth it - prepared with olive oil - capers, and black pepper. 

Had the crab cocktail - mmm. so much more worth it than a seafood salad in my opinion. The prawn cocktail was pretty good too. So glad I didn't get the half crab- our next door eaters commented to me that it wasn't all too great. 

Now comes the story of the oysters and clams. Raw clams - never had them- but oh were they so fresh! Oysters- I love oysters had 3 of them - needed to have more - had another 3. So pleased with lunch - happy belly full of oysters, prawns, crab, clams, chowder, bread, scallops. So when I first started waiting in line my question was Should I wait? 4 hours later my answer was I'm so glad I waited...
author: Jamie T.

description:
An iconic tradition and institution - check.

A fun atmosphere - check.  Even the line wait wasn't bad.

Fresh seafood - almost a check. wife had oyster sampler, as good as they get.  her crab was good but not great.  my smoked salmon was inspirational, and the shrimp salad was very good but no revelation.

Service - depends who's helping you.  some of the guys are more on it than others. but overally, very good.

Long wait - check.  Hour and a half for us at 10:30am Saturday

Ambience - OUCH.  Dirty, no, filthy, actually pretty disgusting. Flies on the seafood. No gloves on the preparers hands. The "dishwasher" just rinses stuff and puts it back.  Someone else also noted no handwashing even after handling cash.  Uck.  Some of the seafood not refrigerated... scary.  Seating - beyond uncomfortable... I actually would have preferred to just stand up and scarf it down... but that would be a pricey scarf.

If you're not queasy about unsanitary conditions, go once.  I'm glad I went but I won't be going back.  You might.  That's the beauty of a free market.
author: Bob K.

description:
Finally made it over to this SF institution. We scored a spot without a wait to boot on Saturday morning.

The clam chowder was nice to start, it wet my appetite for the excellent seafood to come.

Mixed oysters were really really good and fresh, perfect temperature and brininess. 

The smoked salmon on toast was delicious mixed with diced red onions and capers. A touch of olive oil melds everything together.

The raw sliced scallops were recommended served with a yuzu sriracha combo. I actually combined yuzu, red onion, and horeseradish and the scallops were fantastic dipped in the sauce.

Service here is the best, everyone helps out, and it feels like they all love working here.

I might make this a Saturday morning routine, especially during crab season.
author: Derrick V.

description: I went to this place for the first time last week while visiting San Fran. This place is very unique and the first thing I noticed was the huge crowd around the door! Well turns out there is only a bar with about 20 seats so expect to wait awhile! We had oysters which were amazing, shrimp cocktail and the Italian sashimi. I've never had Italian sashimi... It was different and good but I prefer regular sashimi sushi. Also know that they only accept cash and if you have Chase there is a ATM conveniently located across the street!
author: Christi D.

description:
I only went once to swans, but the service and food were excellent. We got there late since they close at 5 which seems odd, but I guess they sell out that early.  

When we got there they told us they were closed, but then saw we had made a trek to get there and said they would take a to go order.  There were a few people still eating but overall the chairs were up so I really was appreciative of this.  

The place itself is tiny just a small rectangular area like a bar. It actually made the place have a more authentic feel.

We got the sampler and they all tasted fresh, delicious, and nostalgic. 

I would definitely recommend trying this place if you are in the area.
author: James S.

description:
Came here on a Monday early enough for lunch about 11 AM. Yes, expect a line but yes it was worth it.  The seafoods were really fresh. We were going to order the crab salad BUT when we saw from the window they were handling the salads without gloves on --- No way we were going to eat that!!!  And so, we ordered the half-cracked crab with a side of louie sauce (yum!!!), Italian style sashimi with capers (oh yeah, way yummy!!!), and clam chowder (that was disappointing).  

The place is small and everyone seats on a bar stool cramped side by side.  The staff was friendly and looks like they know most of their customers really well.  They were quite accommodating.  If you don't want to wait in line, their take out service has no wait.

I would recommend this place to family and friends, but really is not a place to take little kids...
author: Eva D.

description: This place screams authentic SF to me.  I came here with my parents earlier today on a very rainy SF day, thinking the line I usually see wrapping around the block would be avoided.  With maybe 15 stools max in the whole place, we still had a short wait outside before being able to get seated.  I ordered the clam chowder (it was surprisingly a bit watery -- not as much clams/potatoes as I would have liked, but still good), and oysters on the half shell.  That was delicious.  The whole experience feels like what you're really paying for: a place that I think has been around since 1912, and the feel of Swan Oyster Depot certainly feels like that's the case.  Definitely worth checking out.
author: Mel G.

description:
After overhearing the majority of people in line, I noticed that 90% of them were tourists. This was in the afternoon on a Friday. I think that's why there's always a line for this place. I'm glad I finally got to try it but for a $70 lunch it was just okay. 

For 2 we had: 

- mixed dozen oysters ($26)
- bowl of soup ($5?)
- mixed seafood cocktail ($11)
- mixed seafood salad ($20)

Their cocktail sauce and salad dressing are REALLY good. It compliments the fresh seafood very well. They offer free bread w/ your food. I considered ordering the crab back ($5) but I don't like eating cold crab. The atmosphere is very friendly - you can tell the guys who work here enjoy what they do. They encourage you to sit, relax and enjoy the food (much to the dismay of everyone in line). We waited 45 minutes to be seated. Overall I'm glad I came as I think it's worth trying at least once. However if it's just 2 of you, do not order as much as we did as the salad was more than enough to satisfy our craving (the cocktail was overkill).
author: Leily P.

description: This place is incredible! I grew up in Boston and currently live in SoCal so I constantly chase a good chowder...this place killed it! Not to mention the amazing oysters and fresh fish carpaccio! Steve an the rest of the family are incredible! Highly recommended, can't wait to come back!
author: Brian C.

description: Fresh seafood rocks. A great selection of oysters and Uni!! Charming location keeps you going back. Guy is a legend. When I go my family is soooo jealous cuz I am there and they are not. Quality is excellent. Selection is big enough and service is professional bar style.
author: Don T.

description: Ok so I did not want my first review to be Negative, but I couldn't let this one pass!! So I got here at 1:37pm and its 2:55pm and I'm just leaving.  At first, there was a long line to eat in!!! so someOne that works here told me to wait on the side because I was ordering to go, then he starts cooking a salad!!! 20 min later I asked some1 else can you please take my order and he answered with a bad attitude (Haven't you heard about us) and I said NO... So he said we are always busy::::: and he walked away  I kept waiting because the order was not for me it was for my Boss!!! Way after that happened I think the boss or owner start flirting with two lady's that were sitting close to were I was standing and completely ignored that I was waiting there... So this older man that went to the bank and came back took my order and I felt like it took forever for him to clean 10 California shrimp medium size that I was waiting for and a slice of smoked salmon... So I give 1 star because there is not a negative 10.... So when I was trying to pay with my bosses credit card he says oh nooooo we just take cash!!!!!  I wouldn't go eat there even if some1 else was paying!!!!!
author: Cinthia G.

description:
Even though the chowder recipe didn't blow me away, I still loved this place.

I was by myself so getting a lunchtime seat in this little hallway joint didn't take long, and I was enjoying an assortment of the most delicious local oysters before I knew it.

So, so, so darn good. I'll be back, I tell ya!
author: Alexander M.

description:
Honestly, I didn't think seafood needed anything except that it needs to be fresh, needs to be fresh, and needs to be fresh. But not only does the seafood at Swan taste fresh off the boat fobby, they've figured out ways to make it taste even better. Like they whipped up a mustard tartar sauce for us on the spot that was amazing with dungeness crab. Or the satisfyingly spicy green sauce they have for clams. Or just some red onion and capers to go with the most delicious smoked salmon ever. Seriously, best smoked salmon I've ever had. Oysters were delicious as well, though I wouldn't come here just for those since they're available at many other seafood joints.

A lot of other people were getting things like the chowder, seafood salad, and shrimp cocktail. I will most certainly have to try everything else next time I come back.

Some tips: Show up early (before 11:30am on weekdays, earlier on weekends) to avoid the crazy line of soon-to-be starving patrons. I'm not saying it wouldn't be worth it though, because it will be. Don't bring more than one or two people because it's counter seating only and there's not a lot of room to groove (meaning there also is no room to put your stuff either - some coat hangers on the wall but that's pretty much it).
author: Claire C.

description:
1. Part tourist experience, part culinary experience.
2. The first time I ate here, I was sat next to a cable car driver enjoying a breakfast of shrimp and oysters. Clearly not just a tourist joint. 
3. The seafood is as delicious and fresh as everyone describes. 
4. You will wish that you lived in a city where you can pop into a diner at 10:00 in the morning and eat a delicious breakfast of chowder, oysters, and italian sashimi before even starting your day.
5. Why can't there be a place like Swan Oyster Depot in every town?
author: Elle R.

description:
Fancy-pants food bloggers all over the nation right now are declaring, "oysters are the new sushi."  I'm obviously riding this trend till the end.  I've eaten so many oysters in the last month I'm surprised I dont have salt water and pearls coming out my ears. 

Lunch at Swan Oyster Depot has been on my list of "Things to do Whilst Unemployed in SF" for a while now, and 11 am on a Wednesday proved to be the perfect time slot.  The small, counter-only seafood bar was full, but only a few minutes wait.  The space itself is decorated with history, as this old school establishment has withstood nearly 100 years on Polk.

We ordered cups of the clam chowder, 1 dozen mixed variety oysters, the crab salad and the combination seafood salad.  This has to be the freshest seafood available in the city.  The oysters couldnt have had a cleaner taste, the dipping sauces were unique and packed some punch...the salads were MASSIVE.

These oysters are hard to beat.  I'm glad I tried it out and anyone who considers themself a "real" San Franciscan should eat here once....but not on the regular.  $75+ without drinks is just a little hard to justify for lunch.
author: Kerry D.

description:
I feel bad for having to point something out.

Firstly, I want to say that everything I ate here was just delicious. It really couldn't be more fresh and good quality.

Secondly, the service and the ambiance were both very, very good. All the gentlemen who worked here were friendly, polite, and skilled. Everyone who sat next to us seemed to be a regular and everyone knew each other by name.

But, the way they handle the food with their bare hands is just disgusting!! They dip their hands into the shrimp, wipe their hands on their dirty apron briefly, then dip their hands in the crab.. yyyuuuuuck! Can't you guys use serving spoons?

One of the men working here has a, I don't know, fungal problem? There's a brown mess where his fingernail should be. He wasn't even wearing a finger condom.

Normally, these things would actually lead to a score of 1 star. But, I had such a great time other than that. Like I said, the food and service were amazing. Just please update your sanitary practices...
author: Rachel H.

description: Fresh raw sea food! Probably one of the few raw bars with such variety.  Simply prepared seafood for the seafood purists.  Clam chowder was unusually/surprisingly  bad for a famous seafood place. Rest of the seafood was great and of course  Acme bread was delicious as well.  A bit overpriced, but a good place to go if you are craving raw seafood and are willing to spend some money.
author: Grace C.

description:
You can't be serious - DO NOT EAT HERE. 

I ordered the shrimp salad. What I got was a bed of lettuce with some baby shrimp on it and some thousand island dressing. $16. There you go. 

There is no way this place passes any health inspections legally. Their food handling technique is atrocious. I'm waiting for the food poisoning to kick in as I type this.

Will never return. 

I have no idea what is nostalgic about this place. It should be condemned.
author: Randy S.

description:
Came around noon for lunch, and waited in line about 20 minutes. The guys working here knew about half the customers by name. Lots of regulars. That could sound a little intimidating but they're pretty darn friendly to everyone.

I had a cup of clam chowder to start off. The soup was separated (not emulsified, I don't know what to call it), which makes it look weird, but the flavor was good. I also had a combination seafood salad, which was pretty huge. The crab is the highlight and they give you plenty. You can choose louie sauce or oil and vinegar. I went with the louie and it was delicious.

As I ate and watched, the special thing about this place started to sink in. Each of the guys serving you from behind the bar does it all: Shuck oysters, crack crabs, put together salads, make dressings one bowl at a time, and serve it up to you. They do it so naturally and easily that it feels like you're just hanging out with a bunch of guys who love seafood. Which, you are.

Lunch was $25 with tax and felt like a good value.
author: Ben C.

description: Closes early and there's just a small counter to sit down at. So get there early or get it to go.  The extra bit of planning is well worth it!
author: Ryan F.

description: After seeing this place on Anthony Boundain "Layover" I knew I wanted to try it. So one Saturday I decided to go check it out. I waited about 45 minutes. There is a always line because there is about 20 bar stools in the restaurant. While I was waiting in line inside you can order beer or wine. Once I got seated I ordered a couple oyster cocktails and a clam chowder. It was the best seafood I had a in while. It was so fresh and well worth the wait.
author: Brian B.

description:
Service: poor

Their service is so bad! We waited in a line for 45 min and then was told the counter was closed.... If u are closing the counter u should at least tell us ahead of time! 

Okay, so we order to go. Then out of no where, one of the server called out a girl who was just passing by the store and told her that she and her group of friends are welcome to sit at the counter but he can "only" serve them "drinks". I was like, fine~ 

When I was about to take my order, I looked at her and her group of friends, and guess what, they were being served oyster, soup and carb!!!!  I am not a white blonde like her, but I am still a customer!!! And I waited for 45 standing outside of the store!! And she wasn't even ganna visit your store!!! 

So next time if u want to make an exception, make sure u said white blonde only!! I will NOT go back again!!!!
author: Vivian F.

description: If you have too much time to wait in line and too much money to spend, this is the place to go. This place is really over-rated. Even the seat is not stable to sit. Only good for to go people I think.
author: Chih-Ho Y.

description: We waited 2 hours, and after finally getting a seat were told that they don't have uni until may and their last order of crab back was gone. The crab cocktail was ok but the calm chowder was thin and oily.  We ordered a dozen oysters but they weren't that fresh and there bits of shell in each one.  We didnt want to finish them. Worst oysters ever.  The oysters at Hog Island Oyster co. were so much fresher and tastier.  Not worth the wait. I WON'T GO THERE again.
author: Su Jung P.

description: Had to wait in line, but my god was it worth it. No nonsense counter dining and the freshest seafood I've ever tasted. I'd recommend the crab roe carapace and Miyagi oysters any day of the week. They even let you bring your own booze in too. Long live Swan Oyster Depot!
author: Ben H.

description:
When I first came here, I got such great service, that I told everyone, including my wife whenever traveling in Frisco, they have to stop by the oyster depot.

Sadly, the second time I made a pilgrimage here, the tides had turned.
First order, and beers,  right on time! then, it all started to sink.
The guy who had been helping us, started to help  a favorite customer, which left us in the lurch. 30 minutes passed as we waited nicely for this guy to get done, yet finally had to ask someone else for a hand. I mean, we wanted to order, yet could not!
so, one of the Kids comes over to help  us, and we ask for two half plates , not full, Which, at the end of the meal we were charged full price, no matter how many times we explained what happened.

If the older employees at Swan Oyster Depot are getting tired behind the bar, then give the reigns to someone else.

The first time I came her, Top notch service. If the glass was empty, I was asked If I wanted a refill. I was checked on and asked how my food was, I was rechecked on and asked Did I want to get anything else?

The second time, Service was Miserable. I mean, I probably wont go back, or recommend this place, miserable.

Just say No. to Swan Oyster Depot.
I hope someday they Clean the place up, and return to the glory they once were.
author: MaJ C.

description: The line was long so we knew it would be good, we went to Yelp to check the menu so we would be prepared, we were redirected to another website which was Not the menu. Once we got our seats, we were blow away by the quality of seafood, the simple but amazingly delicious food and most of all the family owned service. If we could give it 10 stars we would!!
author: Nina O.

description:
I loved the friendly staff and the selection of seafood. It's a very small place and they only have bar seating available. Very casual atmosphere.

Came here for a light meal before the ball game. We just ordered a dozen mixed oysters, dungeness crab salad, and a few glasses of wine. The salad was pretty simple, yet very good. They were really generous with the amount of crab meat. The oysters came with a variety of sauces and were very fresh. You definitely get what you pay for.

The wait is pretty long and they don't take reservations. However, me and my bf took turns waiting in line with the group behind us. We left to have some bloody mary's at the Italian place 2 doors down so the wait didn't seem so bad.
author: Angelica P.

description: One of our absolute favorite restaurants in the city. Essentially 100% seafood oriented, one small bar of about 15 seats, and a long line. The freshest tastiest seafood you'll find, cash only, and not cheap. But you get what you pay for. Family owned for a long, long time. Heaps of oysters along with crab, clams, chowder, smoked salmon, smoked trout, and most any other seafood delight you can dream up. They catered my bar mitzvah serving oysters on the half shell in our back yard. We go early and usually end up ordering the Louis combo salad, chowder, and maybe some bonus crab cocktail or somesuch.
author: earle s.

description:
I visited this place as soon as I came into SF on a road trip. I made my way here because of seafood withdrawals [I don't get much in the Desert] and because of the rating here on yelp. -- THIS.PLACE.IS.FANTASTIC.-- I had a seafood overdose for about a day where I couldn't think about the idea of consuming crab or shrimp. **just don't eat as much as I did and you should be fine. 


- Food - 

This place has extremely fresh seafood. The main negative for most people is the expense. Who cares about the expense when the fish you are eating clearly just came from the water. I got the clam chowder which is a thin broth. It isn't the thick new england most of our society knows about ,however, I like this even more because it was lighter and the clam flavor was amazing. I then got a combination seafood salad with shrimp and crab. It was so simple but at the same time flavory complex. The intricate flavor combination of their louie sauce,crab, and shrimp as well as the crunchy texture of lettuce was tremendous. 

*****for new timers*****

Next to us several people ordered some sort of sashimi platter,however, we didn't see it on the menu. We got ahi tuna,albacore, and halibut. When the halibut entered my mouth  i just japdnpfnapidhfpiuagdhfkjadbnpfiuhaidnfdnfipahdpiofnpidhf the white delicate meat melted before it even hit your taste buds. Some of the best sashimi I've ever had.

- Service-

These guys are really nice and know what they have. They don't want to steer you wrong and generally feel you must have a good time at their restaurant. This place has been their for decades so it has developed a certain character present in both the service and atmosphere. I ordered the crab salad - which was great- when i received it the guy said he only had about 90% enough crab so he gave me extra prawns on top - 5 min went by and he found an extra container of freshly cracked crab and rushed over to give it to me -  apologizing for not having it before.

- Atmosphere-

It has that small historic atmosphere that you can feel the moment you walk in. It's a kind of place where you know generations have grown up in and it's amazing to feel that. With that said, watch out for a wait. It's small which is great for accompanying someone that you want to talk to endlessly.

**Note for people waiting** - I have been in these small places before where you have to wait on people to give up their seats. DON'T STARE you make feel uncomfortable and many will ignore your persistence and troll you on purpose. If you are waiting you can do a number of things 

a. Stare at their fresh fish in the front - act like a kid at disneyland - OH CRAP THATS A WHOLE FISH ! 

b. Stare at their menu - even if decide what you want quickly - you can always pretend to not know english and develop a sense of in depth analysis on their menu - most of their menu has pictures so you can stare at the drawings to keep you occupied.

c. pull out your phone - even if you don't have some stupid capitalistic app to play with - flip through your home pages - that ability might help the people with the attention span of a mouse.

d. just stare at the floor - count the amount of little square tiles around your feet

Otherwise the counter is really close together so you might strike up a conversation with a person you've never met before. DONT BE SCARED - as much as nancy grace tries to scare you about evil people - meet new people because I know Facebook and other social networking systems have deprived you from human interaction.
author: Harry G.

description: What's the fuss?  Yes it seems fresh.  But not worth $50 for a salad and bowl of chowder after 1 hour wait in line.  Would be nice if they told you " to go" could come order
author: Davey J.

description:
LOVES IT! 

Yes, there is always a line (the place is just a front window and long bar with stools). Yes, It looks like a hole in the wall. And yes, it is AMAZING!!

Smoked salmon with onion and capers, oysters, a seafood combination cocktail and a beer= A PERFECT MEAL! Hands down my favorite seafood spot in SF! A must!

They are still family owned open Mon. thru Sat but only until 5:30. WARNING- They don't take cash and they are pricey
author: Caro S.

description:
Went there on a Saturday afternoon and we waited almost 3 hours before we got seated.  I usually never wait anywhere more than an hour, but this was our 2nd attempted visit on a Saturday and we were determined to finish it through..  The verdict?

The seafood was definitely super fresh.  We  had:


Crab back: This made my day.  The crab back was the meatiest, gutsiest, juiciest, yummiest most delectable piece of gut goodness.

A dozen mixed oysters: Good, but again - you can get the same quality at Hog Island.   

Crab cocktail: juicy, delicious, and full of meat.

Clam Chowder: Good and full of flavor, but... I've had better.


Overall - great place, but not worth the 3 hr wait.   I'd order to go and find some quiet corner to eat next time.
author: SHOU LIN C.

description: On first site I wouldn't have stepped foot in here buy came on a friend's recommendation and so glad I did...this place is old but the seafood is good! No uni on the day I came so I got the crab and prawns salad....they don't go heavy on the dressing which is great for me...tons of lump crabmeat. ..also had the clams chowder which was creamy and buttery!
author: Aliyia P.

description:
Delicious.  Fresh.  Worth the wait and price.
Tiny 'hole in the wall'-type restaurant. 
Skinny counter seating 18-20ish.  Not good for groups of more than 2-3.

Dressing/sauce choices: horseradish, cocktail, red onion mignonette, & thai green chili sauces

Things we ordered:

[[ Oyster Platter ]] - A dozen of 4 different types of oysters.  All so tasty and fresh. 

[[ Crab Salad ]] - Huge chunks of fresh crab on top of some shredded iceberg lettuce.  We got the dressing on the side, which was a good thing, because it was a Thousand Island dressing, which I wasn't feeling up for.  (I think all of the salads come with this dressing.)  I ended up using the red onion mignonette on it, which worked out well.
http://s3yelp2-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/jrCVPdFApCrhJR06Ai_VHg/l.jpg

[[ Sashimi Platter (Sicilian-style) ]] - salmon, scallop, albacore, etc with capers, red onions, and olive oil.  ZOMG - the SCALLOPS WERE AWESOME.  If I go back, I am getting a platter of only scallop sashimi.
http://s3yelp4-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/wAoBELuZsjAdaCu4bK1DtQ/l.jpg

[[ Bread and Butter ]] - just a dollar, make your meal go a little further :)
author: Jeanne L.

description:
This is the best seafood place in town! The food is great! for some people might not be all that, because of the atmosphere and the usually long wait to be seated. 
This is a very low key place, you usually have to wait about 20 min to be seated and the sitting area is like a long bar, so you basically are sitting at a bar to eat. The seafood is great and fresh! I definitely recommend this place for down to earth people. O and remember Cash only!
author: Arash H.

description:
I visited san francisco and saw so many wonderful things, but this place was numero uno on the list. 

8am.
1.5 dozen oysters (blue points, miyagi, shigoku, kumamoto)
Crab salad.
A glass of stella artois.
1.5 year old daughter.
Wife.
Heaven.

Food is the freshest of fresh freshness!

Service is hectic but this team of burly dudes somehow gets it done.  They are as attentive as they can be, and surprisingly kid-friendly!  The guy helping us was nice enough to bring my daughter several rubber ducky toys to occupy her time while we ate.  A really nice gesture by someone who was doing double duty shucking oysters and serving customers.

Note: Get there early because even at 8am there was a little bit of a line.
author: Don T.

description:
Fanny Bay, crab joints and urchin gonads.

All in all, an amazing experience at the Swan Oyster Depot. Perfectly timed at 10:45am and properly dosed with Chandon splits, the Swan impressed me with its service, selection and history.

A beautiful spread of fresh catch in the window greets passersby. Out of a selection of tasty oysters, my favorite was the Fanny Bay. Tart, buttery and salt-infused. Cracked crab legs yielded surprising meat finds. The Louie Sauce was delectable and tart; we found it irresistable with the sourdough. Fresh smoked salmon with capers scooped out of a massive, Costco sized jar with a fork, means good eats with a focus on quality food. The sea urchin finale was almost too much but I found out that the buttery, tangy meat inside of its spikey exterior is its gonads. Disturbing? Yes, but tasty with a little fresh lemon. 

The Swan Oyster Depot is a lovely find in a world of great places to eat in San Francisco. When you notice antique photos on the walls and see those same stools supporting your backside, you wonder who else has enjoyed a similar meal in Swan. Its history and commitment to quality food is impressive. I'm grateful for wonderful friends that introduce me to the hidden gems of this city. Yum.
author: Corey F.

description:
Something smells a little fishy.  I guess I'm one of the very few voices of dissent here.

I'm a big fan of smoked salmon so when I read in SF Weekly that Swan Oyster Depot was given the award (by SF Weekly) for the best smoked salmon sandwich in SF in 2008, I had to try it. 

The smoked salmon portion of the smoked salmon sandwich is good, but also quite pricey ($17.50) for what is five thin slices of smoked salmon on five pieces of sourdough bread. I also ordered a cup of the clam chowder seeing as many people liked it from here. What a letdown! The clam chowder here is not good at all, unless of course you like your clam chowder extremely watery, with a ring of oil at the top and with hardly any clams. No thank you. 

I might come back to try some of the oysters and seafood salad that I've heard good things about, but I'm staying away from their clam chowder for sure.
author: Erich D.

description: Great Oysters , Fresh crab , Fun place over all, I think the Clam Chowder is a little watery, the Oysters were amazing, I actually made it with 20 min before they closed on New Years Eve , so they were almost out of everything and not allowing you to sit at the counter, but they were so helpful and nice , i will go back for sure next time I am in town.
author: Michael S.

description:
Hand-made vinaigrette sauce (on request), and fresh horse radish (on the bar) for shellfish is the way to go.  Come early so as not to wait.  I come here straight from the airport with my bags in the rental every time....
p.s. Anchor Steam on draught (like Luger's Brooklyn Lager, it tastes better here...)
author: Casey T.

description:
Is it worth the long wait? YES!
Prices are on the expensive side, but is it worth it? YES!

Fresh seafood, great atmosphere, friendly servers. Can't ask for anything more.
author: Scotty I.

description: OMG! FRESH UNI AND FRESH SEAFOOD.. but the wait was long. Cash only place but the service was great and the people were super friendly.
author: Ngoc C.

description:
I feel bad that I am finally reviewing this place when I actually ate here over a year ago in January....of 2011. Whoops...
This was the only place I cared or thought about before and during my trip to San Francisco and unfortunately the anticipation, hype, and sense of giddy was damaged by my experience here.
Recalling on the things I got:

Oysters: I enjoy oysters but damn did I get some off-putting tasting ones. Every oyster I had, had an overbearing fishy taste that is delicious and fine in most oysters if it's extremely mild, but I wanted to eat something else to get rid of that awful taste. I prefer Hog Island's as of now, but I definitely want to come back here for another shot. 

Smoked salmon: I'm probably being picky, but this stuff needs to go on a bagel with cream cheese for me...as opposed to chewy, cold, limp sourdough bread. It was a slightly smoky, not to soft, and overall tasty smoked salmon though.
 
Crab: Wow, I'm not sure whether I'm an idiot for thinking "Half Cracked Crab" meant it was a half cracked crab, meaning cracked enough to get to the meat. Nope. It actually meant HALF OF A CRAB....cracked. For 21+ dollars, that's a premium for what was some chilled precooked crab and nothing more. I also asked for the guts or crab butter which they were happy to serve me. They gave me a very generous portion that filled an entire dungeness crab, too bad it was super cold :(. 

Clam chowder: Good, but not wow or memorable. I do remember there were not that many clams in ours and even more sad not that many potatoes. The broth was thin but it didn't matter if it was thick or thin, it tasted good.

Bah, sucks when you want to love a place and it doesn't deliver. I'm coming back for you Swan and I'm expecting some real love this time.
author: Theo N.

description:
Gotta go early to get a spot at the counter!  But, you will not be disappointed. I seriously love this place. I had the oysters, crab salad, clam chowder and a cold anchor steam. So fresh! 

Nb: Cash only.
author: Brooke S.

description: Been coming here since my son was a little shrimp. Not the biggest fan of the salads as they seem to date from the 1950s (dressings, presentations, etc). BUT, the oysters, clam chowder, and fresh fish, even the tiny stools and knocking your knees on the marble counter, even the wait, all add up to a rather pleasant, if a bit kitchy, experience.
author: Stephanie P.

description: Must have Crab Fat & Bread, Crab thighs in butter/garlic sauce
author: David B.

description: Over-rated and overpriced !! Close to $3 an oyster, for this price, you have many choices. Prices for Seafood cocktail are relatively high for the food and setting you get. Can't sit comfortably.
author: bill c.

description: Above and beyond the call of duty! I was in there for some lunch and very pretty girl sat down next to me. We flirted a bit and I was into her. Instead of giving me the check, as I was clearly done, and my fair lady was only beginning, the boys bought me some time. They gave me some more beer and crab scraps on the house, just enough time to piss off the everyone in line, and let me to get her number. As soon as I got the digits, my tab was slapped down, I paid and walked down the street with one hell of smile.
author: Leo K.

description:
If this place is good enough for Anthony Bourdain, its certainly good enough for me. i recently saw it on his new show the " the layover"

seafood is super fresh, you can see from the outside window. the customer service is really amazing, they are very helpful for first timers like myself. i got the seafood salad which was OK, lots of crab plus small and large shrimp covered in thousand island sauce. But once i got to the oysters and sea urchin that's what earns this place the 4 stars. i got the sample platter of oysters just to try everything. they say the smaller ones are better because they are more sweet. Once you try the platter you can tell which one is your favorite mine is the "kumamoto" small and sweet. the sea urchin was HUGE! fresh and great tasting. A must visit if you're in San Francisco

cons: lost a star
- came here at 11am waited 2 hours to get seated. very small place. so don't come hungry. they should really expand
- they don't really wash their hands here they just grab the food with their bare hands and wipe it on their shirts
author: James L.

description:
Pros: 
-really fresh seafood!!!!  super tasty clam chowder.  some of the best smoked salmon i've ever had.  

Cons:
-small place; don't go with more than 2 or 3 people
-long wait time
-never saw staff wash their hands as they handled raw seafood, cleaned counters, or take cash
-cash only
author: Vio H.

description:
Lunch date with my GF and she suggested Oyster Depot. Right of the bat, I replied YES! I've been wanting to check out this spot, but it rare that I am in the city plus I heard the wait was out the door. As I was still on the Bay bridge, she suggested I meet her there since she's literally around the corner. Sounds perfect because I figured by the time I get there the wait wouldn't be too bad. The wait came out to be about 45 minutes, but its totally worth it. 

I ordered the combo cocktail, a cup of clam chowder and 1/2 dozen combo oysters on the half shell.

I wasn't too much of a fan for the clam chowder because it was way to soupy for my liking and tasted like claim broth. I prefer the super thick clam chowder where you can dip your bread into. Thats my preference. But, the combo cocktail was hands down the best. Big chunks of crab, bay shrimp, prawns and a oyster to top it off. Delicious! Oysters on the half shell was good too! Overall, it was a perfect lunch experience and I can't wait to come back.
author: Vy N.

description:
BEST SEAFOOD! IT IS FRESH! 

I ordered:
Combination seafood salad - Small shrimp, Prawns, Smoke Salmon/Crab! $20 

I'm very satisfied just to eat the salad and the combination seafood without dressing!

TIP: Prepare for the long line if you come during lunch
author: Fenny G.

description:
Love this place, unique atmosphere, super fresh food, amazing smoked salmon. When you get there - you want to try everything, if you can just trust guys behind the counter - they will take care of you. 

Go there and enjoy!
author: Dmitry D.

description:
Yummm I was a fan before I even stepped foot in this place. These guys are the best at what they do.
























4 words.....














SOME DAMN GOOD OYSTERS!!
author: Joanna H.

description:
It gets one star for having yummy local oysters and tasty clam chowder.
I really really don't care about the supposed "rustic" factor. Not worth the wait. Locals go somewhere else - this place proves being around a long time doesn't mean anything except you can make a lot of money on tourists rather than repeat local business.

Negatives:
- Dirty. For raw seafood this is a deal breaker. Servers using unwashed hands to handle seafood in front window. There are serving tongs hanging on each seafood bucket. They didn't use them. Saw bucket of mayo sitting out. other grossness.
- Waiter forgot one of our orders and it took forever to get his attention;
- Too expensive. The Ferry Building, Whole Foods, Molly Stone's all carry local oysters.
- Waiting for a seat, and not told there were some in the back. How hard is it to yell, two seats right here?
- For a place that only takes cash, prices should be lower.
author: Catarina K.

description:
Make sure you come here when you're 75% hungry, then prepare to wait until you're 100% hungry, because there is a very looong line.  I don't like waiting for food, but I will let people know what's worth waiting, THIS PLACE is worth waiting for!!

Ambiance- this is not a date place unless you know your date won't mind gettin down and dirty.  It's bar style with stools and you're sitting very close to everyone else. So dont' bring expensive purses, heels or anything that you're afraid of getting dirty- the restaurant is not dirty, but it's not like you have half a booth to hold your belongings.

I don't mind standing in the SF chill staring at the crab meat sitting out on the window, because I know I will get to chow down once its my turn :D The oysters here are so fresh and delicious, the crabmeat salad- no words except for DELICIOUS.  This is not a salad where you have hunt for crab meat, it's just a big handful sitting on top of the salad- to clarify- "handful" = ALOT. Clam chowder- no matter how full you are, you HAVE to get a bowl. Well you'll probably have to, something warm finally after standing out in the cold.

I love this place, the guys are all so friendly and cool. Its worth the wait and its a must go everytime I visit up North!
author: Kanaki K.

description:
We came on a Wednesday afternoon around 12:30 and surprisingly, only waited 20 minutes in line. 

We sat down and the bar was a little bit cramped. This guy next to us was sitting with his legs wide open, taking up more space than he should, from my friend who is already a healthy size if you catch my drift.

The place has a really nice atmosphere and feel to it, really relaxed and everyone chumming it up, guests and employees alike. We ordered a combo seafood salad to share and each got a bowl of clam chowder. 

The clam chowder was pretty good but a little bit too oily. There was an abundance of clam and potato but it got a little bit hard to swallow at the end with so much oil. 

The seafood combo salad had some small shrimp, large shrimp and crab. The dressing they use is basically a thousand island sauce which I didn't especially enjoy with the seafood and lettuce. 

All in all, I enjoyed the atmosphere because it was just like somewhere I'd eat at in Hong Kong. However, the food was not as good as advertised and I was slightly disappointed.
author: Wilson T.

description: I hate waiting in line, but it was worth it here. The oysters are the best and the service was excellent!
author: Amy C.

description:
Finally got a chance to visit Swan Oyster Depot. Decided to come in between appointments around 5PM and luckily there was no line! I got a crab sandwich and a quart of chowder to-go (total was $36.50). The crab sandwich was filled with crab, lettuce and tarter sauce on sourdough bread- expensive but good! The chowder? Ehhh not so much.

Service was beyond excellent!
author: M W.

description:
Waited an hour and a half based on all the hype. When we were in line a few locals looked at us unsuspecting newbies and told us it wasn't really that good, but we didn't listen. 
The clam chowder was watered down with separated cream floating in it, mostly potatoes and maybe a few clams but I didn't find any. The combination seafood cocktail was very small with watered down tomatoe sauce and clam juice for cocktail sauce. I have no idea what all the hype is all about and will never go back nor recommend it to anyone, not even for the "experience"!
It is CASH  only and there is not a sign anywhere that warns you of this. 
It a good thing we had enough cash on hand that day as it was nearly $50 for two bowls of soup, one small combo cocktail, bread and two drinks. 

It's much like the the story about the emperor's clothes where no one wants to tell him he has no clothes on. Here, no one seems to want to be the one to say that it really isn't that good!!
author: Celeste S.

description: Short of echoing what practically every other review has already said, try to get a seat inside the restaurant.  Yes, it is a wait, maybe an hour or so on a busy day.  But the staff is just amazing!  Warm and funny, personal and professional, you'd be hard pressed to find a better all around staff anywhere.  Don't sleep on the smoked salmon or the raw scallops!  I'd never tried raw scallops before--what a treat! Chowder, oysters and my all time favorite there, the crab!  Not always in season, I've been at Swan and not had the crab.  Not to worry though, it's all good there!  And there's just something inherently comforting in knowing that they'll only stock the crab when they can get it local and get it fresh!
author: Jayme C.

description:
On vacation from coastal Rhode Island so i know good seafood.We arrived at 10am on a rainy day and were the first in line(line grew quickly after us) 30 minutes later we sat down and was immediately helped by a very friendly staff.First we started with the mixed dozen oysters..uninspiring unfortunately as the oysters weren't cold enough and were somewhat muddy.The oysters we get back home blow these away!Next we split the crab fat which was given to us for free and may be the best seafood item i have ever eaten.The asian couple next to us were quite surprised we had ordered it and said we were the first non-asians he ever saw eating it...it was fantastic!Lastly we had the Crab salad with Louie sauce..also absolutely incredible!So fresh and delicious.The staff here were very helpful and i look forward to coming back...

CASH ONLY!
author: Jon M.

description:
Fresh seafood, but limited and cramped seating.

Got here around noon and had to wait for two seats for about 20 minutes.  Expect to be nudging elbows when you come here.  Also, this is not a place to bring little kids.  There's no room for your stroller and they don't have high chairs.  

We got the following: 1) clam chowder - tasted good and the broth tasted very clammy; 2) combination salad - iceberg lettuce, shrimp, prawns, dungeness crab, and your choice of either oil/vinegar or their louie sauce, the seafood tasted really fresh and the plate I would say is good enough for yourself or to share; 3) half cracked dungeness crab - tasted very fresh.

My bf and I are not oyster lovers, but we'll be back to try out more of their other foods.

Service is friendly and nice.  You can order to go if you don't want to wait in line and they also deliver.
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
Swan Oyster is the first place we always hit after landing at SFO. In previous years, we've waited in the line (sometimes well over an hour) to grab counter seats. This time around, we got our food to go. It still took some time to get our food, but it was much faster, and we actually had room to maneuver! We did call ahead with our order, but the gentleman who helped us made it straight in front of our eyes, so we could tell him exactly how we wanted everything.

By far, our favorites are the salads. The combination salad has generous portions of crab, shrimp and prawns. Next time around, we may go for the straight-up crab.

The oyster selection is always fresh, and you can mix and match some of your favorites. I saw some people taking oysters to go, though that seems like a slippery proposition to me! Rounding things out, you can't go wrong with the clam chowder, or the crab cocktail. 

Swan Oyster Depot isn't a quick or cheap lunch, but it's worthwhile, especially if you're willing to skip the dine-in line and go straight to the counter. Despite the mobs, the staff is always friendly and attentive, which we always appreciate.
author: Safford B.

description: I love coming here when wanting some oysters. They're always fresh and their dipping sauce are amazing. Must try.
author: Krystal S.

description: I'd wait a week in line (as long as I can get Tony's delivered) to have that seafood again. Ordered the combo salad and a cup of chowda. Add on the oyster crackers and bread, heaven at a counter top.
author: Anthony T.

description:
My cousin mentioned Swan Oyster  to me a couple years back and ever since then I have been dying to come here.  Each year that passes I hear more and more people talk about Swan's and my expectations steadily increases every month that passed. Those people were dead on!!. Swan oyster Depot is THE place in San Francisco to knock back a oyster or clams. The seafood is so fresh, you can taste a bit of the ocean water. 

After coming from Ike's Sandwiches and Bob's Donuts, we were ready to eat some oysters and clams on the half shell, but the only thing stopping us was a 50min line out the door. I heard this line could be as long as 2 hours, so we considered ourselves very lucky. After being seated, we ordered 6 blue point oysters, 6 clams (forgot the name), 3 Miyagi oysters and a bowl of clam chowder.

Everything was fresh and delicious. The clams were much bigger than expected, so that was a high plus. The servers recommended this homemade Asian style spicy pepper sauce to go with our clams. There was some kick to the sauce to give the clam extra flavor. The clam chowder was very creamy and had a lot of clams and clam flavor. 

I will definitely be back to Swan Oyster Depot to try the other different oysters and seafood. This place competes with my #1 seafood place in Boston - Neptune's Oyster (review coming soon).
author: Marcus L.

description:
Can't say enough good things about this place. Terrific, fresh seafood served up by an incredibly friendly staff! Got on line at 10:15AM on a Friday and was lucky enough to be part of the first seating.

You sit at a narrow bar on stools, very close to the other parties. There is a large number working behind the bar so you're helped quickly. Everyone working there is so friendly and attentive, cracking jokes and clearly having a good time--it's infectious.

I had a dozen mixed oysters, a cup of chowder and a smoked fish plate with hot smoked salmon, cold smoked salmon and a shrimp salad. Everything was delicious, unpretentious, simple, just wonderful. The chowder was creamy and flavorful with plenty of clams and chunks of tender potatoes. The oysters were beautiful, the smoked fish was perfect. Great sourdough: soft on the inside, crunchy on the outside. Unfortunately they were out of crab, but that just means I'll have to go back sometime. I'd also like to try the raw scallops, raw sardines and smoked trout.

The place is cash only--there's a Chase ATM across the street, but it charges $3 to use it if you're not a Chase account holder. They have beer and wine, all of which is relatively inexpensive. I totally recommend it and think it's definitely worth waiting for if there is a line.
author: Colin S.

description:
Fresh delicious food. Must try oysters with the Thai chili!! seafood salad and clam chowder were pretty good also. 

I went for lunch around 1130, which was perfect. By the time we left the line was very long.  small place, bar sitting only.

Not sure how clean they are... But its one of those hole in the wall places that you just can't think about cleanliness. The guys working there were really nice, although I think they secretly hate being nice all day.
author: Kim H.

description: This place gets 5 stars from me because of the combination of the multiple unique things in presents. Long marble bar, no tables at all, hilariously uncomfortable little metal stools, the friendly guys who work there, the great sour dough bread, the fact you frequently will have to wait in line outside to get in, for me the wonderful combination salad with Louie dressing, the fact they only take cash but are patient when you don't have enough and let you run down to an ATM to get some, and especially the fact that this place has been in business for over 100 years. It's a living breathing San Francisco history museum. It feels like a connection to the City's past as well as it's present. I'll always go back just for the unique experience of going there.
author: Jim M.

description:
You can expect a line as others have said, but for good reason. This place is legit. A pretty unique dining experience and some of the freshest, no-nonsense seafood you are bound to find without hopping on a boat. The menu is simple and sweet, and it ain't necessarily cheap, but damn that crab was tasty.

  If you live here, at some point do it.  I'm not sure I'd want to wait in line for an hour every time I want some seafood, but it's tempting.
author: Sean H.

description:
get the sashimi platter: halibut, scallops, ahi tuna, salmon in olive oil, capers, and pepper. SCALLOPS!
Lobster was OK. 
my friends loved the oysters, but personally never been crazy about it so i couldn't say. 

Our server was super attentive!
author: Mikey B.

description:
As a San Francisco native, this is one of those places I've been hearing about most of my life. they have been in the same location since 1912! I've ordered take-away a few times, but have never actually eaten there cuz it's such a zoo.  

All that changed today.  It was an odd time (3pm), I was in the area finishing an errand, and somehow got shot in the head with this crazy idea:  swans!  Go to swans it said.  Go.  it won't be a zoo.  You know you want it.  

I knew it was fate when they had a half-dozen fresh whole Sea Urchins in the window.  Ever since my addiction to Uni, I have desperately longed to have them fresh, like hella fresh right from the animal, but where?  Where indeed, my friend:  Swans, that's where.  Sure enough, no line.  Seated in 5 minutes.  

We got a couple chowders (lots of butter in there I think), a dozen oysters (3 different types), and the Uni.  

The chowder was good.  Not the best I've ever had, but solid and tasty.  

The oysters were excellent, no surprises there.  Highly, highly recommend with the house-made hot sauce.  

And then... the pointy prickly star of the show...  cracked right there for me Uni (delivered that day from Monterey)!  First surprise was how much Uni is in there! There were about 6-7 Nigiri sized pieces.  Second related surprise was that Sea Urchin is big, the inside alone is the size of a medium sized bowl.  Taste?  Not quite what I was expecting, but delicious.  Def. Uni, but with something different, something a bit smokey or musky that I hadn't tasted in sushi uni before.  But still that same fresh burst of the sea and indescribable texture  that I associate with the very best uni.   I had a bit of soy sauce and horseradish on the side which made a tasty quick dip.  And at $16, not a bad deal at all for that much Uni (one order of 2 nigiri runs what, 6-8$?)

I was chatting with Jimmy afterward (everyone that works there is so nice and knowledgeable), and he informed me that much of the Uni from Japan comes from...  California!  That is so wrong on so many levels.  But he also said that the way they prepare them in Japan is to rinse them in detergent (?!?!).  Of course they don't do that at Swans, and he said their fresh Uni is popular with some of SF's sushi chefs for that reason.  I mean, they come to Swans to chow down.  

Full bill for a glass of wine, uni, 2 cups chowder, dozen oysters, and 1/3lb of smoked salmon was about $70.  Not cheap but for the quality of the food, atmosphere, history, and quality of service I think it's well worth it.

Swans is def. a San Francisco institution.
author: Goolie G.

description:
I've lived nearby for years but only recently started going. Seemingly every time I've walked past this place there's been a line. That's got to be well over a hundred times by this point. Part of that I think is that there isn't a lot of seating--just a counter--but the other part is that the place is good.

They've been around for about 100 years with much of the furnishings being from around that time as well. Not many places can say they've been around that long, especially in this city. Once upon a time, they used to own their own boats and fish themselves. They're a knowledgeable and nice crew with many of them doing this for a very long time. They have regulars with whom they've got a great rapport. Family business? I don't recall, but I wouldn't be surprised. 

That's fine and all, but what about the food? I wasn't sure what to get the first time I went. The guy helping me insisted on a mixed half-dozen oysters, bowl of clam chowder, and seafood cocktail. All good suggestions. I love that they've got olive oil out on the counter--I like putting it on oysters rather than hot sauce. I've also gotten the crab Louis on another occasion. It's a healthy portion of crab and filling when paired with their bread and butter and a beer.

NB: bring a gangster wad of cash! They don't take cards. I sat next to a group of tourists that kept ordering rounds of oysters. They were eating before I got there and still there after I left. They must have spent several hundred dollars and most people don't carry around that kind of cash. There are three major banks within two blocks you can hit up on your way there, but I just wish they would take cards and make things easier for their guests. I also wish their menu was posted on their website.

Don't feel like waiting? Skip the line and get your food to go.
author: Diana O.

description:
I'm not much of a seafood eater but my bf is and it was his b-day so I decided to take him here. I read the reviews and knew there would be a line. We waited about half hour, they offered us drinks while we were waiting which was nice. The atmosphere is great, they obviously have been doing this awhile, 100 years to be exact!
We ordered:
-Crab salad
-Cup of clam chowder
-dozen oysters
-Crab cocktail
Everything was fresh and great! We got the mixed dozen oysters and I can't remember what types exactly but the guy next to us was over the moon about a certain kind. So I think they had a good variety, I tried some and it's not my thing but the bf really enjoyed them. Crab and chowder were great. Not much else to say, highly recommend it.
author: Brandi H.

description:
you know how you've met a san francisco native?  they ask you what school you went to.
you know how you prove you're a san francisco native?  you answer with your high school (no matter what college/university you attended).  i dunno why it's that way, it just is.

and when this group of jovial, sometimes brusque, always loud group of native San Francisco brothers and relatives and friends asks you what you want to eat, you gotta answer with at least the following 2 things:
1) crab louie salad
2) sicilian "sashimi" (crudo)

the crudo is just fresh, raw fish, drizzled with olive oil, sliced red onions, cracked black pepper and finished with capers.  they'll tell you what's on point for that day, but if the scallops are good, make sure you get that for some buttery, cloud-like yumminess.

so now you'll get to eat like a SF local, even if you're not.  this spot is the one of the true San Francisco experiences and we're *all* lucky to have them.

they're still a traditional seafood shop too, so if you want to take something home to cook, or even try making the Sicilian sashimi yourself, just cut the line and go to the counter and order it there.
author: Brian T.

description:
Dear Swan Oyster Depot, 

I love everything about you, from the crazy lineup to the prawn cocktail to the crab salad I never knew I needed until now.  You even remembered my fiance who used to live in SF years ago, and regaled us with stories and shared a laugh. 

For the uninitiated, I can easily say the freshness is unbeatable! If you are a fan of anything from the sea, this is the place to get it in San Francisco.  It's the first place I'm going to head to when I touch down next time!!
author: Sam E.

description:
We ordered a lot, including the mixed oyster platter, the seafood cocktail, and some other delicious stuff that I can't remember. I do remember that they serve one of the best oysters I have ever had. 

I took a star off not because of the long wait, but because we had to change our seats a few times to accommodate other guests who arrived after us... Moving four people's worth of plates is not an easy feat. Also, after leaving the restaurant, we realized that they miscalculated our bill...
author: Maximilian S.

description: Not worth the long wait, the oysters that we wanted to try were all out BOO!! Not that memorable either. The guys behind the bar were pretty entertaining and talkative. The place is pretty cramped where you are bumping elbows. Will I return? Not any time soon.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
I am not a girl who likes to wait in line, but I WILL wait in line for 2 hours to eat here. Maybe it's because the line it an actual line! You don't sign in and then stand around in huge crowds on the sidewalk. You see the line form out the door and you get in it. This is one of those times when seeing a line and standing in it actually pays off! 

But enough about the line. I'm pretty sure the food is delivered fresh daily from Neptune himself (or Poseidon if you prefer the Greeks). Obviously you can't go wrong with oysters here. The crab salad is also fantastic and yet so simple - shredded iceberg lettuce topped with huge pieces of crab and Louie sauce. Oh, and the smoked salmon is to die for. Immediately after we ordered we were already planning on what we'd get next time we came. Which will be very very soon...
author: Emily C.

description:
This place is the BOMB!  After waiting in line for 1 1/2 hour to eat lunch I was not disappointed.  I had a dozen oysters on the half shell.  The best were the Kumamotos!  I also had a fish cocktail that was good. 

This restaurant only takes cash so come prepared and wear comfortable shoes so you can stand in line.
author: Liz C.

description: This place is hard to get to and parking is tricky. Better off taking the muni instead. The shellfish are fresh and tasty. The dipping sauces and lemon go well with the oysters. This depot serves great sashimi that is healthy and high in protein. good place for lunch, if you don't mind the wait.
author: Tish A.

description:
I came here after craving some seafood and being a little down that my bf's flight got cancelled and rescheduled for the next day due to a blizzard on the east coast hoping to drown my sorrows in some good food and alcohol.

I got here around 3ish on a Wednesday and it was not crowded yet, I was a bit worried after reading the reviews but pulled up my bar stool and the first thing one of the guys behind the counter asked me is if he could take my purse. Being from NYC I gave him the stink eye and asked what he meant, and he said well you dont want to drip on your pretty bag...I pondered this for a moment and then asked where would it go and he said well on top of that stack of paper plates behind me...I gave one more attempt at not giving up my purse by saying what if I forget? And he just smirked and said I doubt you will, so I reluctantly gave the bag up with the consolation that I saw it in plain view. 

Two ladies came and sat down next to me and had the same experience so I didnt feel as bad....anyways on to the food. 

After my 6 hour flight with only some pretzels in me I was starving and ordered way more than I needed but everything looked so fresh! I got a half dozen blue point oysters and half dozen west coast little neck clams. They were both great but I liked the clams better since they were smaller and there is only so much raw gelatinous mollusk I can handle. 

After that the ladies next to me were eating the clam chowder so I had to try a cup of that, it was quite watery for a chowder but it was very flavorful and went great with the oyster crackers they leave in front of you. 

Another lady came and sat next to me and got the crab cocktail, I had food envy so I had to order the mixed seafood cocktail...it was pretty good. You got a nice variety including crab meat, small shrimps, prawns and an oyster if I remember correctly. At that point I was pretty stuffed but that probably was in part due to the 2 pints of Anchorsteam I had, I am a fan! 

After all of that my bill only came up to about $43 which wasnt bad considering how fresh everything was and how great and attentive the service was as well (and it wasn't just the ladies they were as great with the guys). 

You can't leave without getting their souvenir magic sponge, I also got a free shot of tequila for the road and some great tips from a chatty cabby that came and sat next to me who ordered a little great looking shrimp salad (at that point I was way to full to even attempt to order anything else but it looked really really good) and CASH only as one of the guys said behind the counter it keeps things simpler.
author: Angela M.

description:
My wife loves it more than I.  The guys behind the counter rock.  The food is great.  The atmosphere is fun.  The smoke salmon is the best I've ever eaten.  I LOVE it.  

Why four starts?  The stools suck.  I really wish they'd replace them.  It doesnt matter that they are original since they opened.  I sometimes walk out the door with my butt near numb.  I wish they had better beer.  I wish they took credit cards.  

There's only a few places on our eat-out list.  Oyster Depot is near the top.  

Enjoy!!
author: C O.

description: YUM- Fresh crab, oysters and smoked fish plate.  Best horseradish I ever had.   It is true that Neptune and Poseidon deliver the fish to this place daily.  Fresh and tasty, and a SF Landmark.
author: Lisa M.

description: I was in San Fran years ago and a local recommend this place. Parking was tough and when we got close to swan we saw the long line down the street. I never waited in a long line for lunch but we did. I am not huge into sea food so I went for the smoke salmon and my friend had the crab. The salmon was great and my friend thought the crab was so good that a second crab was ordered. This place feels very old with a lot of history. This has got to be the narrowest place I have ate at. It's like eating in a long hall. I though the place was great. As far as price goes every thing I ate in San Fran was more expensive compared to where I live. You are paying for great experience and a memory. For all who say it is over priced remember it's a vacation and you can eat burger king for three dollars any day so enjoy.
author: Steven T.

description: We come here everytime we visit San Francisco, because Swan has some of the finest, freshest seafood to be found in the city. Wait in line outside for a bit, make it in the door, sit at the same white marble lunch counter that's been there since 1912, and one of the family (or other longtime helpers) takes care of you from behind the counter. Bring a good amount of cash, as credit cards don't fly and the best seafood isn't dirt cheap. This visit, we enjoyed a bowl of their famous clam chowder, a dozen mixed oysters, a crab cocktail, and finished with sliced smoked salmon on sourdough, all of which was fantastic.
author: Carly M.

description:
Went here with a couple friends on a Saturday and got here a little before 5PM. The three of us waited in line as it's a pretty small place (just one long bar). There was one lone guy behind us so when two seats opened up, instead of finding a 3rd bar stool (which is what they use), they gave it to the guy behind us so we waited even longer. 

Three of our other friends were meeting us there right after we eat but got there before we were seated. One of the guys working behind the bar saw us talking to them and yelled, "we're not serving them!" to his coworker, in front of EVERYONE. First of all, we told them it was only for three, secondly, they could have politely told us they were closing soon and re-confirmed our seat number, or thirdly, they could have just asked if our friends were planning to eat or not. But nope, the hot-headed young man (who I later learned wasn't even part of the family who owns the place, but just a friend of the nephew) felt like being an ass. I seriously didn't even care whether we ate there or not. It's not like they grow their own seafood that it's so special you can't get anything like it at another nice seafood bar.

Anyway, I was put off by the young man's attitude so I wanted to leave, but my two friends wanted to stay, so when we were finally seated, I asked the young man what's the hurry, and he self-importantly told me that they were closing up soon because they were going to the Beer fest right after. Well, isn't he special? We were feeling a little hurried so we got a plate of oysters and it was pretty good, not that it was any better than some of the other oyster bars I've been too. Might I mention that most of the other seats were still filled by the time we finished. Service was most important to me and I think this place has gotten its head a little too high in the clouds. My friends and I are never coming back to this place again, unless it's the last oyster bar open.
author: Jenny Y.

description:
The best place in the city to get fresh oysters in my opinion.
They also have very decent wines to accompany seafood.
The main issue, of course, is the very limited seating and the long wait because of this.
I would recommend going with a group no larger than 3 people and outside of peak hours for the best experience possible.
If you like oysters, you HAVE to go!
author: Vithiet L.

description:
The best, sweetest, freshest dungeness in the whole galaxy comes from here.

Their other stuff is great (not the chowder though, leave that to the Bostonians please), but I don't screw around with such silliness.  Whole cracked crab, chilled.  Unbeatable.

If you are a local, get a to-go order.  Leave the insanity of lines to the tourists.
author: Jen H.

description:
Got a reccomendation from a bartender to stop into this place since we are not from the area.

Thank you bartender!  I forgot your name, but thank you!

First impression, Dive-y and small!  There is maybe 10 bar seats in the entire place.  I felt like we were very lucky to walk in  and grab a seat just as a couple were leaving.  This place is no joke, you can tell within a few minutes of how they opperate and the commradery between the staff and the people that they've been doing this for a long time and there is nothing fake about it.  They shuck the oysters right in front of you as you order it, wash the floors by dumping a big bucket of water on it, and they write your order down on a napkin only after you remind them of what you got.

Right off the bat we ordered clam chowder.  Insanely good, and it actually tastes like oysters and no cream soup.  The combination cocktail with crab, shrimp and oysters served in an ice cream glass was great.  The oysters were fresh and amazing, of course.  Blue Point Oysters are redick.
author: Hubert L.

description:
This depot will make you feel like a swan the second you put an oyster in your mouth.

Set in the smallest hole on Polk Street, Swan Oyster Depot attracts a long line of hungry ostraphiles.  Bar seating can get a little cramped and messy, so don't come to this oyster joint thinking fine dining.  The workers there are really nice and extremely knowledgeable about seafood.

The environment will conflict with the food you taste.  These are high-end oysters you're putting in your mouth.  I got the twelve-oyster sampler, which featured portions of Kumamoto, Blue Point, and Miyagi oysters.  My favorite of the three was the clean taste of the Blue Point oyster.
