description: The cooked items are good and fresh.  But, I am not sure that it's worth to wait for a half hour.  Oysters and clams on half shells are as good and fresh as it gets.  The cherry stone clams were outstanding.  It's a great spot for tourists.
author: K I.

description: Excellent place to go while in San Fran.  I ate so much I had a hard time getting out of there.  Ate oysters, clam chowder (good but might not order again), crab, smoked salmon, shrimp cocktail, uni (sea urchin), and of course drank enough beer.  All was great, if any complaint, the line was long, but I am willing to wait for this line for over an hour.
author: Travis M.

description: Mecca... Get there early, bring lots of cash, eat everything! It's well worth the wait. Beer and oysters, sourdough bread, chowder, crab, sashimi with capers, red onion, olive oil and lemon! Now that's a good breakfast!!
author: D K.

description: The food here is great and fresh! Plenty of raw oyster options and the crab is delicious.  The wait is ridiculous though.  Prepare for at least a 2 hour wait if arriving at noon or after..even on a weekday.
author: Allen T.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here to lunch one sunny afternoon. I heard usually theres a long ass line so we tried to get there early. We got there at 12noon but there was no line! We got seated very quickly. 2 minutes later, there was a line, haha.

We ordered and shared the Seafood Salad Combo, Oyster Sampler, and Clam Chowder.

The Seafood Salad Combo was huge! They pile on so much shrimp and crab! Can I get a side of salad with that shrimp and crab? Haha

The Oyster Sampler was deeeeelicious! They were so fresh and not fishy at all. We even asked for a different mixture of sauces and the server was very accommodating. He even made our sauce in front of us.

The Clam Chowder was pretty good too. I had wish it was a little thicker, but it was still delicious!

The place is small and all the seatings are at the long table so it feels personal. If you love seafood, its definitely worth the wait. :)
author: Jean T.

description:
I don't get it. Yeah it has great history and my oysters were delicious, but the place is very sloppy and dirty. It was gross. There are so many amazing places to get fresh seafood in SF. Pop in, take some pictures and go somewhere else for your food, like Bar Crudo.

- really obvious lipstick on the wine glass.
- Saw an oyster shell in the ice for a glass of soda a server was getting for a customer. How can you not notice that?
- dirty sediment at the bottom of my glass.
- wiped down the counter with a dirty rag before we sat down.

I swear I'm no germ freak, but we decided to leave because we didn't understand the appeal of paying $30 for a dozen oysters in that type of environment.
author: Sarah G.

description: Fresh seafood...  Good service and great atmosphere. Come early as the place is very small and there is ALWAYS a line. We enjoyed the sashimi plate, oysters and clams. The crabs were not in season yet. Clam chowder was also pretty good and you can tell it was fresh!
author: T. N.

description:
We have been to Swan Oyster Depot several times and always have it on our list of meals to enjoy whilst in the city. It has always been a little edgy in the cleanliness department but we have previously been able to "live" with it.

The last time was, I'm afraid, beyond our tolerances. This is a real shame because the food, as always, was excellent and the staff their usual friendly selves and quite entertaining. 

The glass refrigerated cabinets on the counter in front of us have actual black mold growing in the corners now! I won't mention the floos in the kitchen which one has to pass through to get to the facilities, both of which need attention.

We're not prudish about hole in the wall eateries but come on guys! Get some bleach in there on a more regular basis. We know you work hard and that the work must be a joy to get away from at the end of the day but Swans pulls in a sizable revenue. Enough to afford a cleaning crew. Go to any decent sushi bar and see how they clean up.
author: Michael W.

description:
Every time Vicky comes into town I feel like we are on a Mission to eat as much seafood as possible :)   Anthony Bourdain thank you for the local layover, I should be more fluent in a local hot spot.  

After reading a couple of reviews I was more aware to expect, the old school San Francisco dining setting, long bar that probably fits maybe 14, a happy family of probably ten guys ranging from wise to college bound.  They were each very attentive, friendly and we felt like it was a family party serving delicious seafood.

We ordered the half cracked crab w/the head (cold), a dozen oysters Kimomotos and locals, sashimi (halibut, tuna, and salmon) over olive oil and onion mmmmm, and a cup of the chowder. 

I stayed away from the salads felt like it would have been a waste of stomach space, and I could eat a head of lettuce at home if i desired which i didn't.

I'm probably going to crave their sashimi plate for a long time.  Definitely will revisit as much as possible.
author: Grace T.

description: I'm not a tourist so I've been here many times. It's good but overpriced. I get the whole vibe but the food handling is not very sanitary nonetheless. But hey, I'm only saying that because they prepare food right in front of me. Who knows what other restaurants are doing behind my back.
author: S. P.

description: Super fresh oysters, and great clam chowder. Cash only. You will have a long wait and the place is small and very crowded. The staff was very friendly. I prefer the oysters served in New Orleans. The Swan Oyster Depot oysters were very fresh and tasty, and worth the try.
author: His D.

description: This place is legit. One of my favorite place in the city. They are also not too overpriced. Worth the trip. Always a line. Closes early when food runs out. I love it. They are awesome.
author: J C.

description: There is a ton of hype about this place but the food speaks for itself. Go here every time I'm in San Francisco without skipping a beat. I've actually flown in earlier in the day for work trips to be certain I make it before they close.  You really can't go wrong with anything, try their sea urchin if they have it in!
author: Bryan G.

description:
We loved this place so much we came back twice. While visiting San Fran this past weekend my husband researched some great seafood places to go to and this was one of them. The place is small with very down to earth friendly employees. We thought we might be stuck in a long line but we lucked out and beat the lunch crowd. We ordered the Boston Clam Chowder which was different but oh sooo yummy! It is not thick and creamy like what you're used to but it's more of a fish broth base. We also got some sourdough bread which I found out came from the famous Boudin bakery but this bread was made especially for restaurants. We also got Oysters, Clams, and a combination cup with shrimp and crab. 

The guys who work here are super nice and helpful. Try and beat the rush and get there around 11 if you want to go for lunch, otherwise there is a long line. I wish we had a place like this back home!
author: Vanessa T.

description: By far my favorite goto spot in sf. The food is excellent and the service is even better. Great comfortable and relaxed feeling  when you dine here.  Had a 3 night trip to sf and had lunch here (right off the plane and before leaving) twice.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Ed L.

description:
A great place to be for oysters abd seafood! This place has been around fir years and family owned. Prepare for Long lines on certain days and times but worth the wait for fresh oysters if you're craving for some in the area!

Don't expect this to be a resturant, all the seatings are all over the counter and it's first come first serve bases. Very fresh! And delicious salads. Worth it!
author: Linh D.

description: Extremely fresh seafood let down by singular slow service. Counter cook disinterested and really seemed cannot be bothered. Shellfish well prepared but crevice fish badly cut and was sinewy. There are better places to get fresh shellfish. Pints of beer reasonably priced.
author: Henry L.

description:
Don't judge a book by its cover!!!! This place may not look appealing on the outside, but everything is so good!!!

Came here on a Tuesday and it was pretty packed for a weekday. We came here at around 4:30 thinking that it will be pretty empty. But the wait was not that bad, we waited for about 20 mins. The place is pretty small with a bar and stool setup. No tables! Came here with my sister and we ordered one dozen oysters and half a dozen of clams. All of the oysters were really yummy. The oysters came in a variety and all of them very very good! I am not so sure about the raw clams though. I've never had them raw so it tasted a little funny to me. The staffs were all very funny and nice. 

Pros: Very yummy variety of oysters. 
Cons: Only open til 5:30 

I will definitely go back to try their clam chowder, cocktails and salad. Definitely some more oysters!!!!
author: Christina K.

description: Neat place with lots of character! Enjoyed the selection of oysters and the clam chowder with the side of bread was tasty, but a little disappointed they didn't have a bowl made of bread. The gentlemen behind the bar were very pleasant and even offered us drinks as we stood out the door waiting in line, can't wait to come back and try the crab!
author: Melissa B.

description:
What a great little place.  We were up in Frisco (I love saying that, especially around the locals...) for a few days just hanging out last week, and a friend recommended Swan.  We walked over from our hotel and saw there was a pretty good line, but we decided to wait anyway.  It was worth it - our "late lunch" became an early dinner, but that was fine with us.  

The food is terrific and the staff are very cool.  We got 2 seats at the end of the counter and that was great.  I had the 6-oyster sampler and a bowl of chowder.  My wife had the smoked salmon plate.  They also have Anchor Steam on tap, which is great.  The bread is perfect - very fresh and crusty sourdough.

Everything was delicious and the people there are totally cool.  I was afraid with Bourdain featuring them on his show they would have this "hurry up and eat so we can get more people through here" attitude, but there was none of that.  They didn't rush us at all and were really friendly.  I just wish they had the octopus (they had run out), but maybe I'll get that next time.
author: Pete B.

description:
as Tina Turner said it, simply the best!

some of the hardest working and happiest sob's are inside that always create for saddlin up to the stool to settle in w/oysters from wellfleet, tomales or those tasty kumos

then its time for cup o chowda, sourdough and combo 

man...wish i could afford to eat here more often, as it's hard to be matched
author: Clark G.

description:
Not a fan. Clearly they survive on tourist business. 

Why I did not like it:
- Unsanitary conditions. Staff handling money then food right away. Not standards of a good raw/seafood bar.
- Despite line out front no staff person called out when seat was available and left people at front of line just standing there. Customer at back of line had to tell guys at front "hey seat just opened up"...
- Can get fresher, cleaner food & better service elsewhere is the city or bay area. 
- Prices were high for what you get.
author: Lee M.

description:
mehhh... i've been on a clam chowder quest and i'm sorry.. I am disappointed 

maybe next time, and maybe something else. the clam chowder just didn't impress me much.
author: Susy C.

description:
Seafood aside, this family run place is a little piece of San Francisco history... If anyone calls this place a tourist trap, they are clueless. 
 I have been coming here since I was a baby. My parents and grandparents have also been dining here since they were kids... The quality has never changed.
 The seafood is the best around. Everything is shucked, shelled, and sliced first thing in the morning. Crab Louie, Combination Cocktail, or a Dozen Oysters... It is as fresh as you can get. 
A couple tips: wear comfortable shoes, you will be waiting in line for a bar seat. Second: bring a wad of cash, this place is not budget food.
author: Llama G.

description: Outstanding every time. Keep it simply and the quality will follow. These guys have it down.  You have to love a place that greets you with a firm genuine handshake and a fresh draft beer while you wait to indulge yourself in the freshest seafood in SF.
author: Cawan S.

description:
This is a real fun place to eat.  Dropped in here at a bit of an odd time (between lunch and dinner) and got lucky - no line.  Though almost every seat was taken, we did get two seats at the end of the bar where we got to enjoy watching the guys behind the counter cutting up the fish and shucking oysters.

Tried the crab cocktail which was fresh and tasty, and a dozen mixed oysters.  Was quite fond of the kumamoto and miyagi oysters and the guys explained my tastes are for sweeter oysters grown in cold waters.  They were very knowledgeable and friendly and the information they gave me will come in handy selecting oysters in the future!
author: Janelle C.

description: Despite all the reviews of this place I thought it was just decent. Waited in line for about 20 minutes for a tiny place with all the seafood in the window.  Looked kind of gross actually. As a fisherman I take the utmost care of my catch to ensure freshness and having a whole albacore tuna sitting against the window facing the street kinda grossed me out. We has some oysters, crab cocktail, and chowder. The chowder says Boston style which I apparently haven't had. It was watery and I heard they don't use flour. I much prefer the new England style. The oysters were fresh however. Just seemed a bit dirty in there and cleanliness is important when dealing with raw seafood.
author: Kyle M.

description: Not much to say, other than. If you are a seafood lover ... You will absolutely love this place! This place gets its total rating from me, based purely on the quality of seafood. Its not a big place. It is not particularly appealing to the eye. But, i cant wait to eat there again!
author: Digital A.

description: Swans is literally one of the main reasons we travel across the country to sf for my birthday every year.  Family run business you feel like part of the family.  The food is perfect.  I miss it for 360 days per year.  The best.
author: Matt G.

description: What else can I add that hasn't been said already?  After a surprisingly modest wait, my friend and I grabbed our stools and shared the Combination Seafood Salad (with Louie sauce) and the Mixed Dozen Oysters.  The salad was just heaven- super fresh, sweet crab meat, lots of bay shrimp, and a handful of prawns, over a heaping bed of finely sliced iceberg lettuce.  That Louie sauce was simple, creamy goodness.  The oysters we had included a couple of my favorite, Kumamoto, some yummy Miyagi's, and sveral others.  I loved that the counter is covered with all the condiments and accoutrements you could want for your various seafoods: rice wine mignonette, jalapeno-serrano sauce, horseradish, lemon wedges, Tabasco, oyster crackers, and a big hunk of sourdough bread (yes!).  They serve the cocktail sauce to you individually, in pretty little bowls.  Get the oysters and experiment with different combinations of toppings like I did, then slurp away!  Service was excellent, as the main guy taking care of us checked in frequently, and they all moved with amazing efficiency in such a tiny space.  We were quite full by the end, but I felt I had to try some of the clam chowder so I got a cup to go (the guy was nice enough to throw in another huge chunk of bread plus a couple bags of oyster crackers).  Sadly, I thought it was just meh.  The soup was very thin, with an oily slick and I really wanted more clam pieces.  Despite the lacklauster soup performance, I had such a good experience here that I couldn't give it less than 5 stars!
author: Tara C.

description:
this place is my favorite to get fresh oysters and really good clam chowder!

I went there with my brother in law and we got the oyster sampler platter and 2 bowls of clam chowder

the platter featured 12 oysters, 2 samples of 6 different kinds of oysters that they serve. needless to say, all the oysters were delicious

the clam chowder was perfect and loaded with clams. they also have bread to compliment the soup if you like.

one thing we noticed is that a few people were eating crab heads, so my brother asked about them, since they were not on the menu. Our server informed us that they are FREE.

so if you ever decided to go there and want some crab head, just for funsies, its free! so you should try it! dip some bread in it and it tastes pretty epic
author: Steven C.

description:
came here after reading all the great reviews for this place. 
came before 11am and still had to wait 45min-1hr for a seat. 
my friend and i shared the oyster pick (12 half shells). awesome service, it felt like i was sitting in a friend's kitchen :) 
the major drawback is cash only: with prices like they have...very rarely do i carry that much cash with me. the wait is kind of a bummer, but it is worth it!
author: Carol C.

description: Came in on a Thursday afternoon and there was no wait! Food was delicious and everyone is so friendly!
author: Monalisa H.

description:
Easily the best oysters that I have ever had, and one of my favorite dining experiences.  I've been there a couple times now, and every time is better than the last.  The guys behind the counter make you smarter.  They really know what they are talking about, know their product and know their sauces.  I really appreciated the fact that they have gluten free bread and that is really good too.  Anytime I'm in SF I make it a point to swing by.

It fills up fast because it is that good.
author: Alton H.

description: This place is amazing! Not a lot of seating so it's a long wait but it is most defiantly worth it. The clam chowder is amazing and so is the crab salad. Overall this place is worth it! Plus the staff is so nice!
author: Emily C.

description: I would say this place is good, but not what I expected it to be, especially considering the long line outside. When I was in San Francisco, I was dyingggg to have some awesome clam chowder, and although it was tasty, it just wasn't what I was looking for - cream based. The customer service was great!! We ordered to-go and it was ready in no time. This place does have limited seating, hence the long line and wait. I would definitely check this place out again to try their other food that people rave about, but probably won't be having the clam chowder again. I really wish I had tried some of their other food 'cause it looked  delicious!! All of the food is superrrr fresh!
author: Mandi C.

description: Best place for seafood ever!!! It is quite small but the people working there know what they are selling and their service is impeccable: I was served different oysters and learned a lot about the origin of what was in my plate. As far as the food is concerned, I have to say it is so fresh that it brings my taste buds in a state of ecstasy. I was amazed! I highly recommend Swan Oyster Depot for all seafood lovers and whoever wants to be initiated to seafood in the best possible way.
author: tiger M.

description:
Definitely can have a long line, but the seafood is so fresh its worth it.  My girlfriend and I don't like it when things have that fishy taste and the food here is so fresh we gulped it all down.  You can even have fresh oysters from New Zealand that were in the ocean less than 48 hours ago.

The service is awesome and eating in is part of the experience.  They also have Stella on tap.
author: Eric R.

description:
Best in fresh oyster and seafood. There is a reason the line is always long!!!

The staff is fantastic and so friendly and they are really generous with their portions of seafood.
author: Simmone G.

description:
We got here 11am ish and there was already a line out the door - well with only 18 stools at a bar inside and being so popular, it wasn't so surprising.  

We had half dozen oysters on the half shell, half dozen raw clams, and a crab salad.  SO much yummy meaty crab!  Fresh clams!!!  Fresh oysters!!!

We then realized that this place IS CASH ONLY.  Luckily we had enough cash on hand.....haha......but make sure to check their calculations.  They assumed we got chowder and we didn't.  and the guy actually tried to argue with us.  So we had to calculate things with him.

 I know it's a busy place but let's use old fashioned paper and pencil to write it down?  Then I wouldn't have to ding a star for trying to over-charge us and arguing about it later.
author: Molly U.

description: Seafood seems fresh but hygiene is quite terrible. Someone ordered a shrimp salad and I saw the "chef" pick up a hand full of cooked shrimp with his bare hands and place it on the counter next to the cash register (there was no cutting board, we're talking counter only). He proceeded to dice the shrimp and again used his bare hands to sprinkle the shrimp over the greens to serve. Now I consider myself a person with a near iron stomach, but I did not dare order anything but freshly shucked oysters on the half shell from this place.
author: Ricky L.

description: The Oyster Depot was too adorable. Also a bunch of the workers are CalPoly Alumni! Represent! The place is tiny and the only place to sit is on a long bar. It seems like an enjoyable experience...if you're willing to wait 30mins or more to sit (The lines are LONG!) After waiting in line, we decided it would be impractical to eat there because we had quite a large group of us and we would take up most of the bar. So we just opted for take out. Take out was much better! We went to the front of the line, ordered our food and were able to get out of there in 15 minutes or so. All the while some of the guys struck up conversation and they were so friendly and geninue. My boyfriend of course fell in love with the place because there were niners stuff all over the wall and fishing stuff. He could not stop gushing about it. Anywho, the food does not disappoint! It is the freshest of the fresh! Get there early because when they're sold out, they're done. they're closed. Early bird get the worm! We got a bunch of oysters, their clam chowder, shrimp cocktail, and sashimi. Everything was on point. clam chowder was thinner than what I'm used to but it was still super flavorful and fresh. My favorite was definitely the oysters. I'd definitely come back, probably just with my boyfriend and get their oysters again!
author: Sam L.

description:
The #1 best place to go in San Francisco. We used to live around the corner and would go there at least twice a week. Now we visit every chance we get. It's old San Francisco, the food is amazing, the family that owns it is awesome and really is THE place to eat. The seafood is super fresh. 

Look in the window to see what they have special for the day and order it. We ordered sea urchin last week and it was crazy fresh and so good. You have to wait in line but it is worth the wait.
author: Holly N.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat on the planet. The line can be long but the fresh seafood is incredible and the employees are hilarious. I go out of my way to eat here every time I visit family in San Francisco.
author: Carson K.

description: Delicious. First time to sf and was in search for amazing seafood. This place is it!!! Delicious oysters, crab louie and clam chowder. Must go to swan if you love seafood!!
author: Rachel C.

description: ....If you like waiting in line an hour to be seated on crowded diner stool an be hosed as if your in a good restaurant try this one...very expensive for what you get, but a must do on the newbi list...Oh almost forgot...last time I was there really turned off by workers using dirty hands to scoop up shrimp etc...reported to SF health who said that was just fine...not in my book
author: jim b.

description: Way overrated, overpriced, and it takes forever. $15 for 6 oysters after waiting for 1 hour? I can get better & fresher ones for $1 each. If you want good fresh seafood go somewhere else...like New Orleans!
author: Lily C.

description:
Went here when my little brother when he was visiting San Francisco. There's a lot of hype built up around this place!

We ordered two cups of chowder and some oysters. The chowder was ok, nothing to write home about, which was a little disappointing.

We asked for a mixed dozen of oysters, which tasted like they came out of the ocean 10 minutes prior to shucking. They were delicious.

The three stars comes from the seating... There basically isn't any. Bro and I sat on rickety, uncomfortable stools at a counter that was too low (or the chairs were too high) to actually fit comfortably. Not to mention, it was freezing. We were so uncomfortable, we decided to forgo the shrimp cocktail we'd ordered.

Next time? I'm ordering to go!
author: Lauren F.

description:
Not sure why I never reviewed this place, but I went here with my bf and basically tried a little bit of everything.  The great thing about this place is how friendly the guys behind the counter are.

We were virtually oyster noobs, and my bf had never even tried oysters before this.  I'm glad that the first time I introduced him to oysters was Swan's because everything was so ridiculously fresh and delicious.  

Clam chowder was a little pricey for what it was, but definitely get a dozen oysters and the crab louie salad.  YUM.

I'm thinking about going here again since I can finally drink beer to go with the delicious oysters!
author: Anna T.

description: Disappointed, Tony Bourdain. Let me offer up my opinions on this tiny little seafood bar. How'd you sucker my wife and I into this dump not to mention standing in a line for about 46 minutes? We had oysters and chowder and beer and paid dearly, cash only, for what we both agree was nothing special whatsoever. I'd like to note that the bowls of oyster crackers were quite stale from sitting out I guess and the dishes of sliced lemon looked like they needed some serious refrigeration to recover from wilting. We could have had equal if not better seafood most places in San Francisco, no question, but due to our following Tony Bourdain and his interesting CNN shows we trusted him on this place. I don't enjoy being critical of restaurants and workers because of how hard they work, but this place is pretty bad on food quality ( it is fresh ) and being clean. Hands on the seafood some of which is displayed in the front window, and then hands on the cash and on and on. Not a reassuring feeling for the health conscious. We sampled some of the other dishes from our adjacent diners. Very mediocre, indeed. Also, no credit cards here. All cash in those hands of the waiters behind the counter, that then dip into the salad shrimp and scallops and mix greens without washing those hands in between. Geez Louise, how many of us Americans are this nuts to keep a line outside to get in? As for the cocktail sauce? What? You mean ketchup with a dash of lemon added? Yeap. Pretty bad stuff but at least its red. Won't be doing the Swan Oyster Depot ever again and won't trust Tony nearly as much anymore. He's sold out somewhere along the line, and from looking back on the hundreds of places he's been in on his TV Show I now see what's going on .... third world conditions that in his mind are perfectly fine. Except this is the United States, I hope. I have no interest in third world cleanliness standards although the food might be just fine. Lastly, the staff was very knowledgeable and polite and patient and did a good job, but the beat up marble counter and the beaten up bar stools without backs (they look like CocaCola chairs without backs) to lean back against and all the walls covered with menu signs and pictures need a restructure of the highest order. Fisherman's Wharf offers any number of places that top Swan in each category as does the rest of this great city in my humble opinion. Of the entire week of vacation this place was our one disappointment and we wish it hadn't been as we looked so forward to going there. But as usual, lessons get learned the hard way. Long lines, expensive prices, food quality less than anticipated, but a good staff  with big hearts and energy who like to please.
author: Frank S.

description:
Be prepared to wait in line for at least an hour. But its a solid place to get oysters. Probably not worth ALL the hype...but worth at least a good amount. 

We ordered the combination salad, clam chowder, and a dozen mixed oysters. 

A great experience and a nice place to learn about oysters. I still have a long way to go, but they helped me understand that I have a preference for more delicate oysters. The more you know!

Awesome clam chowder. Really pure and clean...not thick with artificial white goop. You won't regret getting a bowl of it. 

Because of its price...it would be more of a "special occasion" lunch for me. (100 bucks for 2...and I cant really think of a way to have a filling lunch without spending at least 25 bucks a head). But you can't expect to be charged much less than that for quality seafood right? I would go back...but not TOO often.
author: Rondeep C.

description: Great service. Very fresh seafoods. Decent price. A must go if you're in SF. Would go there weekly if I lived in the City. Don't be afraid of the line to get in. It moves fairly quickly.
author: Toan D.

description:
One of the best places to get seafood in the city.  There is usually a line out the door on Saturdays and it is totally worth the wait.  My usual order includes the seafood salad, the shrimp cocktail, and clam chowder, which never disappoints.  The service is wonderful, and the prices a bit high, but worth it.

It is best to arrive early!!!
author: Miranda m.

description:
Definitely overrated - after one and a half hour waiting in the street I got inside and they were out of crab...note that the crab Louie salad is the big draw on the menu...
So I had it with shrimp, prawns and smoked salmon - sea food was fresh, so was the lettuce and tartar sauce was good, not goods food but good; the guys serving at the counter know to say a story and entertain, I guess this is also part of the ambiance and the selling and is good!
Prices are reasonable - so it is worth the money but not worth the waiting time!
author: VIORICA C.

description:
Yes, there is a bit of a wait, but one of the counter guys made it more tolerable by offering us Stellas while we waited.  Once in, we tried the dozen oyster sampler, and everything was very fresh and really high quality.  The Thai mignonette is to die for - I'm not so sure I can ever eat oysters without it again!

Granted, we're from Chicago, so pretty much anything we had was going to be an improvement on what we can get here, but we very much enjoyed the whole experience.
author: Emily S.

description:
I used to work a couple blocks up from Swan years ago and have been here once.  Came here again on Aug.28th.  The quality of the seafood is very fresh, however I just can't jump on the "WooHOO" 5 Star band wagon.

WE ordered the blue points, prawn salad and a seafood salad combo which consisted of crab, bay shrimp and prawns.  I had the prawn salad- it was ok, wife had the combo- she loved it. 

Pros-
Fresh seafood
Good oysters- (tried only the blue points)
Friendly service

Cons-
Long waits to get in- (waited 1hr 10mins)
Only bar seating of about less than 20 (give or take a couple seats)       
Cash only- no receipt
Tourist destination
I've had better over seas
author: Rpm R.

description: Vince was amazing!!! We arrived early, got a seat right away. Ordered oodles of oysters, sashimi, crab salad with louis dressing, everything was amazing!  Especially the breakfast wine. Honestly never wanted to leave. And Vince really was a gem...best time ever.
author: Gretchen H.

description:
Went here twice and both were SUPER!  I had two and half dozen oysters, crab salad and their clam chowder soup. Total was 65 for two including tips. NOT BAD AT ALL! The crab was super sweet  tender and juicy! Omg I want some NOW!!! *drooling*
Their oyster are super fresh! I personally prefer kumamoto because I think it has the best flavor. However they are small compares to other variety. But the server was so nice he gave me extra oyster because they were so small!! I love being a girl!!!!!!!!!! hahahaah yeah we get away with a lot of things *wink* 
As for the soup.... humm it taste great ..but it doesn't look very nice. Maybe the soup was new or something because I saw a little bit of oil on top of my soup floating. I guess they forgot the stir it before they serve it. Still good though.. with their good sourdough crusted bread and butter... I will go back in a jiffy!
author: Aylee G.

description: Fresh Seafood. Always get the Combo Salad. It comes with crab, baby shrimp and prawns. ITs soo overflowing with seafood that you can't even see the lettuce. The louie dressing is really good as well. Make sure you get there early the line is always out the door. I always phone in my order and take it to go.
author: Ayana K.

description:
Raw scallops! Try them, you won't regret it. You know you love that tingly sensation raw scallops give you. 

This place is worth the wait!!!

Their raw clams, seafood salad, oysters...all so good.

The clam chowder is alright. Their chowder style is more watery. Compared the all the fresh seafood goodies you can get, the chowder would be not at the top of my list. Wash it all down with a cold beer, and man o man, what a great meal!
author: Saejin L.

description: Omg My wife and I we had a combination salad, oysters, Combination sushi, And the clam chowder. Everything was perfect and perfectly served I love this place. The restaurant is extremely small and they handle the crowd control very well and everybody is so friendly you really get the feeling that they're happy to work there and that makes you feel better about the food that they're serving you
author: Giancarlo F.

description: My family calls these the Happy Salads. After eating one, you are indeed happy. I like the salad with just crab. My family gets the one with shrimp and crab. Their dressing is delicious also. Mind you, I'm allergic to shell fish. So it's worth risking my life for.
author: Bethtina W.

description:
This place was really good! I loved the ambience: a small, cramped counter with an almost 1:1 ratio of servers to customers. My friend and I shared a half-shell of oysters (two kumamotos, two miyagis, and 2 blue points), a couple cups of clam chowder, and a crab louie salad. The clam chowder was a little thinner than I'd like it, but it was packed with flavor nonetheless. It was served at just the right temperature for consumption.

The oysters were excellent, though if you don't like oysters, this won't change your mind. They are fresh and you can tell they were recently caught. My friend, whose tongue isn't quite so discerning with seafood, couldn't tell the difference between the three varieties of oyster. The kumamotos were definitely the smallest and they had the creamiest (but weakest) taste, while the miyagi and blue point oysters were a bit stronger and definitely larger.

The crab louie, however, was definitely the highlight of meal. The crab is fresh and there's a lot of it. The louie dressing is absolutely to die for, like thousand island but better. Enough said. Just get it.
author: Brian L.

description:
I waited 2 hours to get a seat at the bar with my bf and out of town guest and I'm happily giving it 5 stars. I hope that means something to you.

The oysters are my favorite I've had in the city so far, and the crab chowder is really what they should be named for. Served with crusty SF sourdough and a pat of butter. The bar is a landmark and it still has the same bar since when it opened in the 1920s. The guys who work there are all in the family and the same family has owned it for 40 years. They obviously love their job.

Cash-only (this will seem obvious once you see the place) and prepare yourself and your guests for a wait. They aren't open on Sundays and they close at 5:30pm so make sure you're in line by 3pm or you're SOL. If you have out of towners who love seafood and you can go on a weekday, I would say this place is a must.
author: L C.

description:
was in SF 2 weeks ago and swan oysters depot was on the top of my list to try.  i knew it was my lucky day, when i didn't see anyone waiting at the door, we were the first in line!!!  it was a thursday afternoon around 1pm.  we got seated in about 5 mins, no complains at all.

I order a 1/2 dozen combination oysters and my server gave me 8 hhaha!!  they were all goodnessly fresh!!!  felt like i was in seafood heaven already.  i also got the smoke salmon that i wasn't planning to order, cuz i figure smoke salmon is smoke salmon, how good can it gets?  but i decided to get it after seeing everyone in the rst ordered it, and WOWWWWWWWW was i glad! I then understand what the other guy wrote, that the smoke salmon is like butter, it really was like BUTTER melt in ur mouth!!!!

i enjoyed the clam chowder, too...even tho it was a bit runny but still got good flavor.  and i needed smth warm after all the cold eats so that came perfect. Ahhh i was happy.
author: sunmoon O.

description: Hands down the best no frills Oyster bar I've been to. There is however "Blue Water Seafood" in San Diego, but for purely Oysters Swan beats it by a nose. Wait 30mins in line, saddle up to tight seating and throw on your sea legs, this place is just like dining in a sea beaten trawlers galley!
author: Bongiorno M.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place ever since I saw it on one of the travel programs.  Finally made it to San Fran for a business trip and had some time before my flight.  
?  Ok been here and done it.  Waited for about an hour to get in - what is the hype about this place???  I have no idea.  Maybe coming from NYC I've had the same and better than Swan?   I have to say that I didn't try too many things on the menu as I was alone and just had In n Out Burger for lunch., but I thought I just had to try Swan since I was in the area.  I didn't want to order anything raw or any salads and I'll tell you why in a minute.  So I had the clam chowder which was too watery for me with not much substance and the overpriced cold half crab which was no big deal.  I could have had a whole crab at the wharf for the same price.  I went into the restaurant with the intention of trying the sashimi platters as the photos from fellow yelpers posted looked so good.  However, the place does not look clean at all.  I know the place has been around for a long time but I still feel that you should maintain the cleanliness of where the raw seafood is sitting.  I saw the already cut up pieces of fish and didn't think I wanted to eat raw fish or shellfish from here before my 5 1/2 hr flight.  You can get the same type of seafood from a reputable restaurant or sushi bar.  But If you have to dine like a tv show chef, wait 45 mins to an hour on line, sit on an old  metal bar stool and pay for overpriced seafood then this is a must visit when you are in San Fran.  Oh the worse part of it was that the servers DO NOT where gloves when they are getting the food.  If you order say a shrimp, crab or mixed seafood salad,  they just grab your salad, the crabmeat, the shrimp, etc. with there bare hands and put it on the plate.  I saw this one server that blew his nose with a tissue, looked into and wash his hands WITHOUT any soap!  That totally disgusted me
I know am going against the grain on this.  It seems like everyone loves this place and I'm not understanding why - is it all they hype on the travel channels or is that the seafood is that much fresher than other seafood places ?- I don't think so.
author: Jim L.

description: I love this place it was the second time here and both times were amazing!!!!  Everything was perfect, including the service they were all friendly!!! Oysters, crab cocktail, and the Clam chowder (is the bees knees!) were all so tasty!!!!!
author: Ash D.

description:
I know it's rather pricey, but this is the ultimate "pamper yourself" treat that's served up in a very workaday environment.

Don't expect plush surroundings, you'll be smooshed up against the marble counter with people squished in around you while you perch on a rickety old stool with some legs missing.

Do expect the freshest and best seafood. Oysters (West Coast and East Coast), crab, lobster, shrimp, salmon and a few times I've even had some amazingly fresh sea urchin. 

They do it right by keeping it clean and simple.
author: Claire M.

description:
It's all about the crab.  I usually stick to my guns and order what I know I like and that's crab.  Crab over shrimp any day of the week.  The oysters were pretty good too.  Tasted a bunch of stuff ...

Combo cocktail - Can never get too much of this if it's fresh.
Crab salad - Loaded with crab!
Clam chowder - My favorite is still Barbara's Fish Trap in Half Moon Bay so this was so so.
Variet of oysters - Shucking was a little sub par as I got a few shells in my teeth that didn't come out until the day after (serious), but they were pretty fresh.
Anchor Steam - Can't beat a brew with seafood for lunch.

The line was long, but it was worth the wait.  I think next time I'll grab a crab salad and some cocktail to go and eat it at the beach.  Definitely a must have if you like seafod.  If not ... stay away and don't review because ... you don't like seafood.
author: James F.

description:
Mmmm mmmm good...  

My best friend and I started off with the clam chowder. Definitely not your average clam chowder. It was super fresh and had a very distinct taste from any other clam chowder I've ever had. Then comes the oyster sampler. To be honest neither of us could tell the difference of any of the oysters, but each one was delicious! Okay then we ordered the combination salad, this was theeee best. If you ever decide to eat here you've got to order this salad. It was theeeee bomb.com!!!!  That's not all we ordered...we also ordered the clam sampler. In my opinion this was better than the oysters. Squeeze a bit of lemon and pour some Tabasco on it :) 

We kinda splurge for lunch, but it was well worth that hard earned dollar...HOLLAR...

at oyster depot one time :)

For our dessert we got an it's-it at the convenient store across the street!!!!  Yummmmm
author: Alicia A.

description:
What made me want to try this place out? Here...

"Oh ... and I'd like to mention that though Swan Oyster Depot does not appear in the show (because we shot a segment there for the previous series), I ate there almost every day while shooting in town. Mopping fat and roe out of those Dungeness crab backs with sourdough bread and washing it down with a cold beer? Perfect happiness."  - Excerpt from Anthony Bourdain's Blog

I'm not one to follow blindly with everything Bourdain says but when this guy and his crew decides to go to a place everyday while filming... it does say something about the establishment. My take? Swan Oyster Depot exceeded the hype that surrounds it. This place is good. REALLY good. 

We ordered 12 oyster sampler and my goodness... how does this place get their oysters shipped to them? It's the freshest oysters I've ever had. the water in the oysters tasted like sea water and not oyster juice. That with the combination of the succulent oyster meat... eye opening. They also gave us a crab head filled with crab roe for free (you have to ask for it) and it was awesome! Packed with roe and it was perfect with the complimentary sourdough bread. I would have asked for another one if I wasn't so in a hurry. And it's free! Another man's trash is another man's gold, and this crab was filled with gelatinous gold goodness. If that wasn't enough, they were shucking raw clams in front of me and I mentioned how I'd never tried them before so the guy just hands me one! 

Welcome to one of the best places in San Francisco.
author: Victor H.

description: I really don't get how this place is so popular. The seafood was OK but nothing special to separate it from anywhere else. It wasn't like the crab salad or oysters really stood out. The reviews really threw me because I thought everybody was eating something ridiculously good here. But the menu was just very standard. Cold crab, shrimp, oyster and clam chowder. I don't get it.
author: Steve C.

description:
Que onda amigos?

Here's another review I've had sitting in the pending file for quite some time.  How could I have NOT knocked this one out earlier?  Such a no-brainer - forgive my tardiness on the delivery here.

Well, here's the skinny.  I like to kick it old school.  Rotary dial phone.  Low-top sneakers.  Standard-to-loose fitting jeans.  Standing arcade games.  Sitting at a counter to eat.  That sort of thing.  Swan Oyster Depot ("SOD") rocks it old school.  I love it...and so does everyone else who goes there, apparently.

I cannot think of a time when I've gone to this fine establishment where I didn't have to wait in line to get a seat - even first thing in the morning!  That's says plenty about the integrity of the place and the quality of its offerings.  

SOD is a fairly small - a narrow counter that can accomodate about a dozen or so people.  It's a no-nonsense type of place.  No fancy-pants, foo-foo (sp?) drinks.  Cold beers (wine, too, if memory serves) and fresh seafood.  If you like seafood - real, fresh seafood (including raw bar) - this is THE place to be.  The only other place I've been in recent years that holds a candle to this place is Santa Monica Seafood (see previous review).  Menu is simple and straight-forward.  Ask for a recommendation, you get it.  Food comes shortly thereafter.  Done.

To borrow from Lu T.'s review, this place offers up "a cornucopia of the sea" - soups/chowders, salads (like Louies), raw bar, sashimi...the list goes on and on.  I wish there were more places like this around L.A.  The crusty sourdough bread is off the chain as well!

Get there early...even if you do, chances are pretty good that you'll end up waiting a bit.  Don't despair, mijos...well worth the wait.  Save some skrimps for me please!

Good eating to you!
author: Matty D.

description:
If it were possible, I'd give this place zero stars.  

The clam chowder was horrible, and mostly made of water. This place is an overpriced bar. I'm amazed they stay as busy as they do. I'd rather go to Red Lobster.... (Horrible food) At least they have decent service.. Lastly, they were VERY rude to my wife.. Never again...
author: Eric S.

description:
Wow. I can really just say WOW. I took the advice of Yelp and went here for lunch while on vacation in SF. Best advice ever Yelpers! 

My boyfriend and I split a few things. We started with a clam chowder, delicious, and kept going with some oysters. They were the best I've ever had. Buttery and fresh. We moved on to the combo salad with their louie dressing. Dressing was great, the salad was perfect. The guy behind the counter even gave us a sample of their smoked salmon, and it was like melted butter.  Pair all of that with a few Anchor Steams, and it is a great experience.  

Sure, there were times where I questioned the hygiene of it all, and the long line daunted me, but I didn't get sick from the food and the line moved pretty quickly. 

Definitely on my San Francisco bucket list for every time I go!
author: Candice R.

description: A don't-miss SF experience. I dare you to find a better SF seafood experience. And amazing homemade horseradish!
author: Kate C.

description:
FINALLY!! I got to try this much-hyped about place. I've been wanting to try it ever since I knew there were oyster bars in SF.

For the record, this place is only open from 8am to 530pm so DON'T show up afterward because they WILL NOT SEAT YOU. Also, be prepared to wait a long time (unless you go during non-peak times which are weekdays and early mornings). We arrived at 3:45pm and sat down right at 4:45pm. There's only 20 seats inside, hence the long wait. Let me just say, as a huge oyster lover, the wait was definitely worth it AND, it lived up to the hype of all these 5 star reviews it got.

We ordered 2.5 dozen oysters, the prawn cocktail and clam chowder. For the oysters, Blue Pointe was definitely my favorite (this ended up being the majority of the oysters we ordered). It's super creamy, smooth and very flavorful. The prawn cocktail was good as well but nothing super awesome. The clam chowder was pretty good; it was runny but still had lots of flavor to it.

The service is great. They aren't the friendliest waiters that chat you up but they definitely make sure you get what you want.

Overall, our bill came out to $80 for two people; not bad considering the 2.5 dozen oysters. 

There's no doubt in my mind, I am definitely coming back again.
author: Diana Y.

description:
My sister LOVES oysters, so we decided to give Swan Oyster Depot a try after reading all the reviews on YELP. We went on a Thursday at around 3PM, so there was no wait. The service was friendly and warm. The place itself is small, but the turnover is not bad. 

We had oysters, clams, crab, and clam chowder! I would say the price is reasonable and the food was fresh and yummy. The bill came out to $65 and it was cash only!  Luckily, there is a ATM right across the street...  =P
author: Maggie L.

description: Mmmmm love everything here. Everything is so fresh and tasty. My favorite lunch date spot with my hubby.
author: Tina F.

description:
Wow.

I can't believe this place averages less than 5 stars.  But with over 500 reviews, I guess there are enough 1-timers who didn't like where their napkin was placed to screw the pooch.  Such is Yelp.

I've been eating here for 25+ years, and it's the first place I take visitors if I can.  It is SOOO San Francisco, which is to say it's impecably fresh seafood from local waters served up perfectly in a totally casual place where you will be shoulder to shoulder with complete strangers of all walks of life united and equalized by the simple act of eating great tasty food.  

I make fun of the yuppies standing in line on weekends at the hot brunch places to eat eggs.  I don't stand in lines, generally.  There are too many options in our city to justify that.

I have happily waited in line for Swan's, and will do so again because I am waiting for a unique and superlative experience.  This ain't eggs and hash.

There are 3 places in the city I know of that serve an excellent New England clam chowder.  Swan's, Anchor in the Castro, and Woodhouse Fish Co. on Market.  Good chowder tastes of cream and clams, not flour.  It is not important or desirable to be able to stand up your spoon in it.  It's silky texture derives from more slow cooking and less flour.  As a native east-coaster, I feel these 3 places get that and serve a great chowder.  Swan's seems the very freshest and creamiest.

There's also something to be said for the seafood cocktails and salads.  If you are inexperienced with fresh, perfectly prepared seafood, you might be conditioned to expect less when you order a shrimp cocktail or a seafood salad.  The seafood is generally prepared in advance , shredded, or whatever, and held in a walk-in.  Not here.  The seafood in your cocktail or salad is every bit as fresh your just shucked oyster.  

Check this place out, if you haven't already, and stand in line if you have to.  

It's family owned, and they believe in a tradition that understands quality and service might lead to profit.  Support that and get a great meal here.
author: Gary N.

description:
What do they serve here: FISH, SHELLFISH, and CLAM CHOWDER.

They don't make any fancy dishes or sauces. They don't suggest wine pairings with your oysters on the half shell. They don't serve vegetables or pasta with your fish. But what they do here is personal and attentive barside service with the most straightforward, freshest, luscious, and the most perfectly cooked seafood you might ever find - the lumpiest, sweetest and the most delicious crab claw meat; nutty, perfect prawns, and fantastic smoked salmon, briney, fresh oysters and clams on the half shell, etc.... help yourself liberally to the lemon wedges and the fresh horseradish sauce. Don't expect much in terms of accompaniment. Come here to eat SEAFOOD and nothing else. Oh, and the clam chowder is, like, amazing.

Be prepared to wait up to 2 hours during rush; and beware that if you sit at the right end of the bar it will smell like the seafood isle of Safeway.

And note the $1 Draft anchor steam... this place lives up to ALL of the hype, and more. (Secret trick = if you don't mind takeaway, you don't have to wait in line)
author: Y K.

description:
My shrimp salad was nothing but boring--zero flavor on iceberg lettuce with cheap diner dressing. As a bonus, all of our seafood was fondled from the deli case to our plate by the same bare hands that shook a customer's hand and grabbed dollar bills. If the food wasn't price so highly, I'd be more accepting--chalking it up to a what-else-can-you-expect experience, but sorry: 1 star + an extra one because the folks are friendly.

Next time, I'll spend the money on one of the many better seafood joints in the city, and avoid that crazy line and rushed dining experience (crazy long line outside).
author: Savannah L.

description: LOOOOVE!! I miss this place so much! I use to work right up the block from here and was able to call in my order and avoid the lines. the guys here are sweet and awesome and already knew who I was when I picked up my food. why? because my order ALWAYS consisted of the clam chowder and mixed seafood salad. I must say, the seafood can't get any fresher than this!
author: Ann T.

description:
Losers, closed early. Got there at 345 and sent packing.
Got to be a better placed than those losers. Maybe they need an IRS audit, cash business??
author: Mike R.

description: fresh seafoods. very friendly.  waiting can be very long due to small place and popularity. if you lucky, they may have live sea urchin and several kind of raw oysters available. not an affordable place, but a very good local  and family experience overall to enjoy fresh seafoods.
author: Truc N.

description:
This is where the best and freshest seafood go to die and where I get my fix of shellfish heaven. I've been spoiled my entire life, having grown up in Hawaii with amazing fish and went to school on the Eastern Seaboard with phenomenal lobster and clam. But SF has Swan, and Swan has the most incredible oysters and crab by far.

The bluepoint oysters are plump and creamy, and the kumamotos sweet and succulent. There are always several kinds of oysters for those who don't know what they like or don't like what they know. If you want good oysters at $1 a pop, go to the happy hour at Hyde Street Seafood House and Raw Bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/hyde-street-seafood-house-and-raw-bar-san-francisco), but if you can afford to shell out more for unforgettable oysters, go to Swan.

The combination salad is also worth mentioning. At $17.25, it's a bit pricey but panty-dropping good. Plus, the guys give so much crabmeat, shrimp, and prawns, you can't even see the lettuce or understand why it's called a salad. I love the crab louie dressing and smother my salad with it. Oh yeeaaahhhh. 

I can't say that I'm a big fan of the clam chowder or the smoked salmon. The chowder is watery and not as flavorful as the chowdah I was spoiled with each week in Boston for many years. The salmon is just too fatty that it overshadows the fish taste. Thanks to the guy that gave me free sample of the salmon, though, because I was staring it to death. Haha.

I've been here five times in the last nine months, and I would come here even more often if my bank account could withstand the beating. I'm hooked!
author: Liz T.

description:
The Swan Oyster Depot was recommended by a friend before my most recent trip to San Francisco. He thought I would love the atmosphere and the style of the place and he was right. We arrived just before noon on a Friday and waited about 45 minutes to sit down. By the time you get to your seat you've had plenty of time to watch the guys assemble several items on the menu from the front window and the whole menu is up on a huge wall, so there is really no reason you shouldn't know what you want by the time you get seated, except everything looks great. So we took a couple of suggestions by the fella waiting on us with regards to which oysters to order and lunch. 

We had the clam chowder, a mixed array of oysters, a mixed salad (crab and two types of shrimp) and a half a cracked crab, which I washed down with two cold Stellas. If I could have eaten one more bite I would have gone for the octopus salad, maybe I will have that next time (there will be a next time). Our tab after all of this was about $80 before the tip. The guys next to me had a bill of $200 for two, but from the looks of their (handwritten on a napkin) check, they each had one of everything on the menu. The couple on the other side of me had a couple chowders, six oysters, one beer and a salad and they were out for around $40 before tip. 

The guys do handle everything with their bare hands, but there was also a sink right behind the counter I saw most of them use at least once during my hour long visit. This place has been around for nearly 100 years, and I'm guessing if people had died from eating there it wouldn't have made it through the sue-happy 80's and 90's. If you want to feel like you've had a relaxing lunch at these prices, you'd best find somewhere else to eat. It was expensive, there was a long wait, and it was the most uncomfortable seating I've experienced, but it was all worth it.
author: Heather D.

description: They have this place down to a science. Freshest seafood ever. Be sure to ask what's not on the menu today. Sea urchin was our fresh for the day. The line to get in was an hour, but when you have locals waiting this long too means your at the right place. I'm told you can skip the line by ordering take out, but the counter was worth the wait. Not rushed once inside. Bring cash its the only way to pay. Must experience.
author: Chad L.

description: Arrived early and there was already a line. We were lucky to get in for the first seating. Clam chowder was one of the best I've ever had. Mixed dozen and a cold beer was heaven. Salmon and scallops with olive oil and capers was delicious. Shrimp Louis was great as well. Fun atmosphere and fantastic wait staff behind the counter made for one of the best experiences in San Francisco. This place is worth the wait, if you can't get there early!
author: John S.

description:
I keep seeing Swan Oyster Depot described as "touristy," but it didn't feel that way to me.  I'm sure a lot of the diners are out-of-towners, like myself, but Swan felt like a joint for locals.

We walked straight in at about 3:00 in the afternoon (perhaps the unpopular dining hour we chose affected our experience) and there were two seats at the counter waiting for us.  There are no tables at swan, just a long lunch counter with stools and communal bowls of oyster crackers, lemons, horseradish, etc.  I think I counted around 6 staff members behind the counter.  Several were using the afternoon lull to prep, but most helping/chatting with customers.

We came for oysters.  It was our last day in San Francisco, and I had yet to have a single oyster...despite beginning to dream about them on the flight in five days earlier.  We thought we might try something else, but we were there almost exclusively for oysters and perhaps another small item, as we had a dinner at 6:00.

The young man behind the counter was fantastic.  He saw our eyes goggle at the menu board on the wall (no menus), and correctly guessed that this was our first time.  He was prepared to walk us through our experience, and modified his plans when he learned that we were only snacking.  He started up with a combination oyster tray (2 each of 6 different oysters), named and indicated the area of origin for each, and let us find out what we liked.  It was amazing.  Very fresh, and each oyster was unexpectedly unique, often in appearance as well as flavor.

I requested some crab gut and bread to dip, which he gathered and brought gladly, only infomring me as we were settling up that he wasn't charging us for it as they were going to throw it away anyhow.  I wish it had been heated, but I won't complain about free crab butter.

I'm not from San Francisco, and I didn't eat seafood anywhere else in the city.  As a result, I can't really compare Swan's prices to anyone else.  From a tourist's point of view, it seemed expensive, though worth it.  Get some cash out (I didn't see a credit card terminal -- however there is an ATM just across the street), and give it a shot.  I doubt it will disappoint.
author: Matt M.

description: Terrific fresh seafood served up by locals in a classic old world way. This is a destination spot for any foodie who loves seafood and especially shellfish like crab and shrimp.
author: Seth B.

description: We had a late lunch thinking the wait should not be so bad, this place is a hot spot.  We waited 30 mins to get a seat.  The restaurant is very small, literally it's just a bar top that can seat maybe 30 ppl at a time.  IT WAS WORTH THE WAIT!  The guys who work the bar top are funny as hell and the service was on top of it.  Everything we ordered was fresh and very appealing to the eye and taste buds.  It's definitely a must try! We met people who were visitors, locals, and visitors who come every year to get their annual fix.  We had the combination salad, which included crab, bay shrimp, prawns, a house dressing and salad.  We also shared sashimi uni (sea urchins), cracked crab, clam chowder, and half dozen combo oysters.  If you have not tried it put it on your list to try!  It's not a fancy place, simple and to the point!  Very satisfied!
author: Kourtney I.

description:
Let me first say that I am fanatically picky about seafood. It has to be fresh, smell like the sea and be perfectly cooked. I'm delighted to say that Swan Oyster Depot delivered the goods! I had a combo salad with salad shrimp, prawns and crab. The prawns were perfectly cooked and tender, the crab was sweet and succulent. 

I loved being served at a counter, the warm service and fantastic food. The waiter even remembered my dining companion's father from his visits there 20 years ago. 

What a delight! I'll be back for sure.
author: Sophie C.

description:
I've seen this place on a lot of TV shows on the food network so decided to give it a try.

Don't be surprised if you have to wait at least 30+ minutes for a seat, since there's only about 10 stools in the entire place. The people who work here are all super friendly and attentive. The seafood  is extraordinarily fresh, that's for sure! I'm not the biggest seafood fan which is probably why I didn't like the food as much. Maybe I had expected too much because to me it wasn't really worth the price. I had the clam chowder, which was okay, and the seafood salad, not so great. It was just a soggy bed of iceberg lettuce with puny shrimp and a bit of crab meat on it with Louie dressing. The portion was pretty small for $20. My boyfriend had the clam chowder as well as some blue point oysters. We agreed that they both were better at Hog Island.

This place is really good for some simple, fresh seafood with a fun atmosphere, but don't expect the best seafood you've ever eaten.
author: Melissa K.

description:
Cons: place is small, cramped and stuffy. Not only do you have to wait an hour in line before you get seated, when you do finally get seated, you'll be touching elbows with the person right next to you.


Pros: everything else. =)
author: Dave H.

description: This is the best place for raw oysters on the West Coast.  Haters can get out because, it means a shorter line for me when I decide to indulge :)
author: Nathan D.

description: This is definitely an institution. They are fresh and can speak to everything they serve. I'm not a fan of their sashimi but I do to understand that this is not a Japanese restaurant. I'm a fan of everything else!
author: Catalina C.

description:
Wait was really long. Arg.  Finally sat the 3 of us in a space for 2 people.  One person had to sit behind the other two and so only 2 of us had access to the bar top. 

Everything looked really fresh and the oysters were delish but something I ate gave me HORRIBLE food poisoning.  Maybe it was the rancid clam chowder which tasted sour.  It was obvious that me and my companions didn't like it but the staff did nothing about it.  Soooooo overpriced. Will never go back. I don't know what all the fuss is about. Bleck!!!! In addition, they only take cash-so inconvenient.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
If you don't mind to wait in long line, this is the right place for you. But trust me, you will get the freshest, highest quality  cold seafood here. The portion size was a bit too big for me though, when I did order combo seafood salad I couldn't finish it. The clam chowder was thinner than most but still rich and creamy. 

There are menu on the wall, Except Oysters prices so ask the price before ordering. I had a kind of hate and like sampling of oysters, i liked the freshest of oysters but i did hate the grit, was so annoying when i ate.

Overall, It's a good place for cold seafood, ONLY CASH, friendly service, Not cheap, long line.
author: Sasitorn O.

description: My all time favorite restaurant - love the atmosphere, love the people, service is always fantastic, and the food is wonderful.  Yes, you wait in line but hey, it's part of the experience.  Don't miss the clam chowder, and also, though it's not on the menu, they are more than happy to make up a plate of the freshest fish ever.  BTW - cash only!
author: Amelia T.

description:
I've been a fan of Swan for ages.  The very freshest seafood prepared in the most simple way - a crab salad with louie dressing, shrimp cocktail, home smoked salmon served with classic sourdough bread and an Anchor Steam.  What more could a girl want?  Oh, I know - a wonderfully light clam chowder with oyster crackers.  

This is the perfect place for a solo lunch.
author: Monica L.

description:
Every time I pass by this place there is always a huge line out the door, and for good reason.  This place has AMAZING seafood.  I took my mom here the other day and we split a bowl of clam chowder, crab salad, and an assortment of clams and oysters on the half shell.  Everything was super fresh and delicious!

If you're willing to wait, you won't be disappointed.
author: Chris Y.

description:
this place is tiny, busy, and expensive! but the staffs are friendly and funny.

Came here for an afternoon snack and ordered:

- Bread-  typical. used this to dip in soup. 
- Half dozen raw oysters (Miyagi & Kumamoto): petite sized but meaty and had a burst of freshness to each bite. 
- Crab: Served with homemade cocktail sauce that complimented the crab well. 
- Clam chowder: Though the texture is what I like (broth-y and simple), there just wasn't  enough or (any?) clams to call this a clam chowder! Maybe they ran out... So, I would skip this next time. 

AND i LOVED the freshly made horseradish. I dipped it in everything (except the clam chowder)! 

p.s. the restrooms are actually quite clean and located all the way in the back. oh and cash only~
author: Anna H.

description: I've waited in the 90+ minute line twice now...and will do it again. This place is amazing. Not only is the food delicious but the owners are welcoming and inviting. They strike up excellent conversation in a calm and cool atmosphere. The clam chowder, oysters, and their smoked salmon/trout platters are to die for. They advertise the salmon and trout platters as two separate dishes, but if you ask them, they will make you a combo platter for the price of one. The combo includes cold and hot smoked salmon and smoked trout. YUM. Also, the bread and Anchorsteam on tap are the perfect pairing. Love this place.
author: Katie L.

description:
Fantastic mixed seafood salad, and every oyster I had was perfect.

The wait, however, was almost too much. Waited 35 minutes for two seats at 12:45pm in the middle of the week. I would love to go back, but that's a commitment!
author: Ross A.

description:
My girlfriend brought me here this weekend for my first visit to Swan's, and I loved this place. Everything about it said to me, "You want to be a regular!" Lesla (my g-friend) had been there many times, going way back, and she filled me in on the family history associated with Swan's.

The place has that unique feel to it, of a family-run spot: that usually engenders two basic realities: pride in the fare, and rapport with the clientele. They came up aces on both counts, and the seafood was divinely fresh.

I haven't read the other reviews here, but I imagine that everyone who has tasted the clam chowder almost certainly agrees that it is the absolute best available anywhere. The funny thing is: almost all places use the same basic ingredients, so how do these people manage to transcend the quality level of all the others?

Well, that beats me. Lesla suggested they probably add some fresh clam juice to the mix, but could that be the sole cause? I don't know. But then, I also don't care, because the result is almost unimaginatively perfect.

I had a cup of the chowder, followed by a Combination Louie salad. The salad, consisting of fresh iceberg lettuce as a bed for "caught-today"-fresh seafood was delightful. A little spray of lemon, and it was good-to-go.

Lesla had the chowder, also, ( a bowl, though ... smart) and a crab cocktail. I tried her cocktail and it was on par with everything else, including the fresh bread and butter we had on the side.

The servers delivered a few beers and wines to others waiting in line, and although I mentioned "don't know" or "No" in the "Wheelchair Accessible" area, I'd bet anything that if you were in line in a wheelchair that they would bring you any, and every, thing you desired, without hesitation. It's that kind of place.

If we move back across the Bay, into the City, the place will be looking at yet-another pair of "regulars."

Moderately priced, excluding booze.
author: Brian S.

description: The seafood is fresh so if you like seafood this a must do.  If you are a semi seafood fan then don't waste your time.  Because more than likely you will focus on the negative aspects such as long wait, lack of service (it seems the younger the server was the worst the service was), crammed eating spaces, etc.
author: Mister T.

description: My only complaint is the long lines, but if oysters is what you're looking for, this is the right place
author: Anna N.

description:
I had the clam chowder, sashimi plate (shared), uni, mix of oysters (6), beer = $65

Clam chowder: at first glance, it doesn't look that great.  The broth and the cream separated so it didn't seem very appetizing, but it tasted fine.  It had a good seafood flavor but it didn't have a lot of actual seafood in the soup.  If you don't want to spend $60+ just to feel full, the bread and chowder would be a good filler.

Sashimi plate: This was pretty good.  You get a nice sample of various kinds of fish (unfortunately my mackerel had bones in it).  Second best thing I ate here.

Uni: I was pretty disappointed.  I've had uni before and it's usually sweet, buttery and salty like the sea.  The uni here was served fresh but mine was incredibly bitter.  I tried my friend's uni and hers was slightly less bitter but neither of us really enjoyed it. 
Quick tip: I learned afterwards that adding lemon can help with the bitterness.

Oysters: my favorite part of the meal.  The kumamoto oysters were my favorite out of the 6 varieties they had.   

I know this place is renown for their freshness, but I honestly couldn't tell based on the food that I ate. I think there are other seafood restaurants in san francisco that are just as fresh, tastier, and less expensive.  Food is fine, not good, not great.  They didn't do anything wrong.  There's just nothing that I would care to have again at that restaurant.
author: Dede Y.

description:
Wow...the seafood here was amazing!  Haven't had fresh seafood in a while.  Ordered the clam chowder and bread...and boy, was it fresh that you can taste the clams.  Our second order was a dozen fresh oysters and boy, were they slurpable.  Drizzle them with some shrimp cocktail and slurp away.  Last, we ordered the crab salad....literally chunks of whole crab meat in the salad.  Mix it with the Crab Louie and you are in heaven.

The staff here are excellent...they are pretty efficient and friendly.  Luckily, we came on a day where there was no line...just a little wait time (less than 10 minutes) for seating at the bar.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Mike waited on us and he is the best!!!  He was friendly, always smiling and very polite.  It was our first time there and everything he suggest was fantastic. 

We had Oysters, Clam Chowder (the best I ever had by the way), Combo Seafood Cocktail, Prawn Cocktail and the Smoked Salmon with beer and wine.  The seafood tasted incredibly fresh. Love it!!!
author: Sarah V.

description:
I dont know why places like this got such a high reviews on yelp but, I gave a star because the clam chowder was okay, and I'm saying OKAY; I'm not saying best I ever had.We came early because I was craving some clam chowder and boyfriend took me here. We seated right away,there was no line.Ordered two bowl of chowder, I especially noted to the waiter that I wanted the biggest size they had. The waiter  brought the chowders and spilled my boyfriend's soup (not the whole bowl of soup just 3/4 of it ) cuz he almost threw it away. He apologized some how but didn't offer to fill it up or bring new one. We came here just to have some hot bowl of chowder,we already stopped at Sally or Salty's fishwich to grab fish sandwich so basically we was full. So two big people ordering only bowls of soup probably pissed him off some how. He kept asking my boyfriend what else we want cause I was on my phone busy with my Yelp And I ordered calamari salad just so I wouldn't  tic him off or piss him off.  
Calamari salad came and it was a total laugh off. Few pieces of unthoughtful servings of calamari in small glass and it costs $8.95?! I mean believe me it was so tiny, and so little? And a bowl of chowder $5... Too small to be charged $5! 
Looks like every HOLE in the WALLS are famous on Yelp!
Oh plus their chair wasn't comfortable at all!
author: Namuna B.

description: Food was amazingly fresh, service was prompt and friendly, beer was cold and tasted amazing.  Perfect place to get some no nonsense seafood.  Best for lunch.  We had to wait in line, but the restaurant does their best to move people in quickly.   The half crab was amazing and they even gave us extra oysters for free.  I wouldn't waste stomach space on the chowder if you are a huge seafood buff.   There are many more adventurous items on the menu.
author: Craig O.

description: Another great meal at the Depot.  We love the guys working, love the food, and love the vibe.  Spent too much money, but what the hell, you only live once.  I was drunk from food afterwards and couldn't have been happier.
author: Jeanine K.

description: Believe me, I wish this place was amazing. I live right down the street and I love seafood. However, I think its just a tourist trap. The lines are always crazy so expect to wait at least an hour. We took our food to go. My cocktail had literally 2 shrimp. My husbands salad was not that good. Extremely expensive. For the price of what we paid, we could of gotten a pound of shrimp at Whole Foods. Nothing special here, just a bunch of tourists.
author: Dulce F.

description: Just passed by this place and surprisingly found no line outside at 12:50pm.  The $17 sea urchin is super fresh.
author: David L.

description: great crab...great service
author: Kevin F.

description: The 4.5 star rating here on Yelp is highly overstated.  You will wait about an hour, for one of there 20 seats and in return you will get average seafood for an exorbitant price.  There are much better places in the City to enjoy fresh seafood.
author: Gary J.

description: We thought we were going to beat the line and crowd by coming super early but we were wrong!  We got here at 1045am and there was already a line for  3 parties ahead of us.  It was cold and raining and people didn't even care!  We were seated about 30 minutes later and started off with a warm bowl of chowder and a combination seafood salad.  Both were definitely yummy!  After we devoured that we moved on to oysters and cherrystone clams.  The cherrystone clams were what I came for and they were definitely worth it.  Fresh and sweet and amazing.    Everything was super fresh and they gave us a good variety of oysters too.  They even threw in a couple of the smaller clams for us to try.   We were watching all the oysters being shucked and they do it so fast and without hesitation. The service is pretty efficient and everyone there is so friendly.  By the time we were done eating the line was about 12 parties deep just peeping through the window waiting to eat.
author: Kymberli C.

description: I'm a big fan of oysters and so are my girlfriends.  The three of us shared two plates of a dozen each oysters. Over kill? Yes.  The kumamotos were too good!
author: Lisa C.

description:
OMG, this place rocks. My father and I have been waiting to try it out as we both love food and fresh seafood, especially. The service was great and very helpful when it came to answering questions and accomodating any requests. They also had great suggestions and even gave us some samples of other fish while we sat at the seafood bar (the new smoked trout, the smoked salmon- which we wound up ordering a full order of).

We shared a bowl of Boston Clam chowder which was excellent. Not your standard Boudin-style chowder, a little thinner but tasted nice and fresh.

Also had half a dozen oysters and I think I can honestly say these are the best oysters I've ever had. They gave us a few different sauces, one of which was one of their newer spicy sauces which had 3 different type of peppers, one of them habanero. This sauce was excellent on the oysters.

We also shared a crab cocktail which was some of the freshest, tastiest crab ever. The cocktail sauce was yummy and I proceeded to add a TON of fresh horseradish (probably too much, as I kept chocking after every horseradish filled bite).

The guys next to us, who appeared to be regulars got smoked salmon spread on fresh sourdough topped with red onion, capers and lemon inspired us to try the same exact deal. This too was awesome! 

We were glad to have finally tried this spot, will DEFINITELY be back soon and I highly reccomend making the time to try it out and be prepared to wait and know that the wait is worth it.
author: Sarah A.

description:
I don't think it is a bad place, we might go back for the smoked salmon but I think there is too much hype there.
