We got there around 1:30pm and there was already a little line. The staff was extremely nice--they offered us drinks while we waited. The wait was about 15 minutes and we had immediate service. 

I ordered a dozen Kumamoto oysters ($24) and a bowl of clam chowder ($2.50) as I was told we HAD to try it out. The food was great and the service was excellent (we scored free sashimi and clam chowder--it def. helps to be a girl :])

Our bill came out to be about $75--not ideal but def. worth it!
author: Heidi K.

description:
I came for lunch on a Thursday and waited 30 min at most. I read reviews and knew that I had to try the clam chowder and oysters. The clam chowder was so good! It's not thick like clam chowders we're used to having, it's more like a soup. It tasted like there was real seafood in it and it tasted fresh. We also had oysters but I can't remember which one. They were very good as well. 

The best dish I had was the scallops sashimi. The scallops tasted nothing like I expected. The texture was completely different (in a good way) from the cooked scallops that I'm used to having.

The people who work here are all very friendly. The next time I'm in San Francisco, this place will definitely be on the list of places to eat.
author: Tina M.

description:
This place has been on my list for a long time.  And I know why - AWESOME.

Perhaps the freshest seafood I've ever been served.  Clam chowder was very good.  The Seafood Salad Louie included - shrimp - large and small, crab (dungeonous of course), and smoked salmon with Louie on the side.  The crab was great, but I think I'm having flashbacks over the salmon.  The kumamoto oysters were super sweet and super fresh.

The family has been running the place for decades.  The focus and result is fresh seafood perfection.

Plus its on Polk which is one of the more outstanding streets in SF.
author: J T.

description:
I have been living in the SF Bay area my entire life and decided to finally make it out to Swan Oyster Depot. A couple things had always kept me from this line: the line and the parking. We got there around 11:30 on a Sat morning and had to wait about 30 min. Parking was not as bad as I thought it would be, but remember to add money to your meters because DPT is whizzing by every 5 min. It's pretty insane!
The food is delish and the service is really great. The entire staff makes you feel at home. Love the seafood salad and fresh oysters. The clam chowder is a bit watery for me, but still very yummy. People complain about the prices, but honestly, you get super fresh seafood at a decent price. I will be back!
author: Vanessa W.

description:
All my long and lucky life I've been a guest at this tiny, family operated fish counter that has the best crab, shrimp and prawns available in this seafood port.  They have just about any other fresh fish you might want and will order what they don't normally carry.  It's a family operation with brothers, cousins and other kin manning all stations for the five or six hours they're open Monday through Saturday.  The only time one can avoid standing in line seems to be a rainy weekday around 11:00 AM and otherwise there is always a line, sometimes as long as the cable car lines at Powell Street or Fisherman's Wharf.

 They serve beer and wine, and soda over crushed ice like what they lay all their fresh seafood on in the window facing Polk Street at California.  There are usually about seven guys behind the counter and they talk with themselves and all their guests from here and points all over the globe.  They start you off with sliced sourdough made by Boudin for them and chucks of cold butter and that's addictive in itself and there's no limit.  

They have their famous chowder, seafood saladsof every kind, the delicious sourdough and a couple other items that require no cooking.  This place is loved by San Franciscans and it seems like every tourist to our city makes a pilgrimage to this charming marble counter.  A must visit.
author: Stu S.

description:
Went here because we were craving Oysters. It was a Friday around 4pm. The place was packed. We waited about 30 min. The staff was friendly, and when we got close to the door, they served us our drinks. It seemed almost impossible to get a group of 4 to sit together because of the bar seating, so our group had to separate into two. 

The servers are very sarcastic and to the point. Once you get past the initial awkward thought of "is he being serious?" they are very nice. 

The food was great. Me and my boyfriend enjoyed the Miyagi Oysters best. He had a Shrimp Cocktail which he loved. I had an OK cup of clam chowder.. Not the best, but pretty decent. We also had their raw salmon and albacore tuna. Definitely Sashimi grade. We were very happy with everything here. 

Only down side was the long wait... Otherwise I'd go here again. 

PS. CASH ONLY but there is a Chase ATM across the street.
author: Rosalyn D.

description:
Got the clam chowder, a dozen assorted oysters, and a dozen clams. Everything was great, minus a rotten clam i received. UGHHHH. Had me feeling sick for the rest of the day! :(

next time i'm going back, passing on the raw clams.
author: Tony L.

description: Waaay long wait. Clam chowder is a bit watery.. but maybe some people like that because it does have flavor. The clams were delicious. The crab cocktail was absolutely divine. 4 stars is just to be weary that the place is small and the wait is really really long.
author: Vicki K.

description:
best. ever.

this place is amazing. it's a small place with fresh ingredients and a intimidating but friendly wait staff. these guys know their product and how to make it. the vintage signs add to the history of the food. order anything, and you will be happy, i promise! i was mad that i had waited in line in the rain to sit in this cramped little place .. but after the first bite i forgot about everything.
author: Camille I.

description:
If you're visiting San Fran and you happen to be on a diet, the seafood diet that is, this is the place you need to come to. It's an informal bar with stools and with the freshest seafood in town. We got two dozen oysters, the mixed seafood cocktail and of course the clam chowder. Did I mention we were two girls? 

And yes the service is impeccable. Fast, friendly and you really feel like they pulled it out of the sea 5 minutes ago.
author: Angela K.

description: I used to love eating here!  But each time I visit the experience gets progressively worse.  The food is stellar and the prices are reasonable considering the freshness and quality of the food.  But friends, this place is no longer worth the significant wait.  The place is just nasty!  I don't think they've cleaned since the last time I was here four months ago.  Everything was sticky and greasy/dirty looking.  And the service SUCKS.  It took forever to get the server's attention for things we needed.  Finally I just walked into the kitchen to get him.  This place is popular and I think the staff figures that they don't need to worry about customer service since they'll always have plenty of folks willing to line up to eat there.  The first time I ate here ten years ago, I woulda given this place 5stars.  Now I'm afraid I've eaten there for the last time.
author: Josie O.

description: I Guess Restaurant Health Department Inspections Are Non Existent In San Francisco. Before You Decide To Wait An Hour In Line, First Walk In The Restroom - Filthy! Then Watch The Men Behind The Counter Prepaing Sashimi Plates Never Wash Their Hands, Handle Money And Use The Register. Portions Are Tiny, Food Is Expensive For What You Get. Clam Chowder Was Watery And Oily - One Of The Worst I've Ever Had. Crab Meet Was Delicious! Sashimi Plate Was A Joke. There Are So Many Amazing Restaurants In San Francisco. Don't Waste Your Money And Time Here. Give Your Money To Chefs & Restaurant Owners That Respect And Love The Art Of Food.
author: Sunshine Y.

description:
This was an awful experience..my friend and I waited an hour and a half for the most unsanitary, over-priced seafood that was just marginal!  We were so disappointed but more than anything hope we don't end up catching some sort of stomach bug!  The bathroom was disgusting and you have to walk through a filthy, wet kitchen area...they were washing off the counters and we kept thinking we were going to get splashed by the dirty water...no one wore gloves and they were handling money, food and dirty dishes without washing their hands - wish we got up and left but were hoping to be pleasantly surprised by amazing food - we were sorely wrong!  There was salmon on the counter in front of us with flies landing on it and if we coughed, it would have gotten all over it...
Plain crab that was overpriced - nothing but lobster and the watery clam chowder were heated...you could only choose mayo or cocktail sauce - again watery and extreme disappointing!  Don't waste your time or money at this restaurant!
author: Tisha J.

description:
I just came here this past Saturday and was happily introduced to some of the best seafood in the bay. My friend was in town from Wisconsin and had come to this place with his father every time he came to visit. His father recently passed away so he wanted to come to this place before he took off again. The wait was just over 25 minutes but I have to say that it was (indeed) worth it. I started out with a cup of the clam chowder. As others have mentioned, their clam chowder resembles more of a soup because the base is not thick at all. The milk/creme does appear to be separated from the rest of the soup but the taste is still quite good. One of the waiters had suggested I try some Tabasco sauce and I obliged. It was pretty darn good for dipping the sour dough in.

My wife and I then moved on to the combination Louie salad which had copious amounts of crab, shrimp, and prawns. Their thousand island dressing was nothing special but still good.

Next we moved on to a Crab Cocktail. Which was very sweet and delicious. The great thing about Crab Cocktails is that they are so simple and yet so good.

Next my friends ordered a dozen mixed oysters. There are two sauces you can place on your oysters. One was a vinegar inion mixture that was very good, but the other was far better. I'm not exactly sure what was in it but it was a greenish color and it was spicy. Loved it.

I didn't get a chance to try their Smoked Salmon but I will next time.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Just had lunch there and I got to say I love this place.
The seafood could not be any fresher and the service is always so personalized and special.
The clam chowder was delicious! I could have had a second bowl.
So happy to see an institution like this continue to carry the tradition forward.  Keep it up!!!
author: Emi C.

description: I love Swans and try to sneak in when there isn't a line wrapped around the block.  Unfortunately it's been taken over by the tourists but it's still good.
author: Suz L.

description:
Food: 4 stars
Overall: 3.5 stars

We were drawn here by the reviews and then learned that it was also visited by Anthony Bourdain on his show The Layover. That would explain the 1.5 hour wait out the door, but as we got closer and were able to take a look inside the restaurant, we realized that the entire restaurant is only able to accommodate around 20 diners. It's basically a seafood bar. Anyway, we order a dozen mixed oysters ($26) which consisted of Miyagi, Blue Point, and some other one I can't remember, combination cocktail (crab, boiled shrimp, one raw oyster, and one raw clam), a bowl of clam chowder, and smoked salmon on toasted bread with capers and onions. We weren't looking to get full here since the price just doesn't justify it, but we did get to eat everything that we wanted to here for $58 + tip. Everything was delicious and it was the best clam chowder that I've ever had. It's much less creamy, which I have decided is the better way to eat a clam chowder, but didn't lack in taste. Every spoonful had pieces of clam and potato. The oysters weren't worth the $26, I'll just stick to my $6/dozen gulf oysters at Captain Tom's here in Houston. 

The cons: The seating situation. Not only are the seats super uncomfortable, your neighbor is practically sitting on your lap. You're not only rubbing elbows, but thighs and knees. 

The waitstaff is not only handling your food with their bare hands, they're also handling money, dirty dishes, and probably scratching their heads and asses as well without washing. What didn't make me walk out before ordering was the wait that I just had stood through. I'm a total germ-a-phobe. Oh, they were all really nice though!
author: Victoria T.

description:
I get to this hole-in-the-wall place and there is a long-ass line! I expected there to be somewhat of a wait for a highly recommended place...good thing I brought a couple of wine glasses and 2 bottles of Champagne :) Met and shared it with the peeps around us in line.

Once we made it inside, the service was great! We were greeted by a gentleman with a couple of cold beers waiting for us...amazing. The clam chowder was deeeelish! Don't even get me started on the combo seafood salad, anything I say about it would not come close to doing it justice. The oysters looked so fresh and tasty they made me poop a little with excitement when they brought them to us.

Can't wait to go back and experience the seafood awesomeness of this place again.
author: Alex P.

description:
Not sure if I need to give this restaurant another 5-star rating since clearly it doesn't need it.  But I just have to say that this place is out-of-your-mind: the best seafood restaurant that you will ever been to.  I came here twice, in the same week.  I tried almost everything on the menu, their little neck & cherry clams, the 4 (can't remember the names) types of their oyster, the sardine & scallop sashimi (in sicilian way), the half-craked crab and the famous clam chowder.  Except for the chower, which I think is a little too runny and not exactly as spectacula as everyone described....everything else is so amazingly delicious and fresh.  But what I love most about this place is their exceptional service.  Seems like a family owned business.  Everyone was so down to earth, fun and friendly and very attentive.  

Can't express enough how much I love this place.
author: elle n.

description: One of my absolute favorite place to go for seafood...everything here is delicious! I highly recommend this place.
author: Sophia P.

description: The wife is a sucker for oysters. Naturally, we found ourselves here. Luckily, we were early enough to be only the fifth party in line for lunch when we arrived, and only had to wait about 15-20 min to be seated. They didn't have uni, but I found everything I ate to be pretty good! Watch out for the horseradish. It's very fresh, and much more powerful than what you normally get, so apply with caution. I loved the crab cocktail, and the oysters. Fresh and full of the flavor of the sea. Clams were good but not totally my thing though. The fish sauce that they recommend with the clams needs more acid, I put in some mignonette as well and it worked well. The clam chowder was very rich in clam flavor, rather than thick with thickeners, and I really liked that. I tried the Italian syle sashimi, but wasn't too blown away. It was good, but not as delicious as the crab cocktail. Also, they were going on about how the sardine was good today, but I didn't get any sardine in my sashimi. I did get some scallops, and they were very sweet and fresh. A win. Another thing to note- it's easy to spend some serious cash here! But raw food! But the line out the door tells you what you need to know. So why not five stars? The bar needs an upgrade, my seat had no space for my legs. They kept taking away my mignonette, I kept having to take it back. Well, not big deals, compared to the food, but it was imperfect enough for me to say, okay, go ahead and laugh all the way to the bank, I guess I'll be back, but I just wish you wouldn't take advantage of seafood addicts like me. The only thing I can do is take away a star.
author: Ken W.

description:
I've been trying to go to this place FOREVER!  It has just been difficult because of my insane school and practice schedules.  I finally got fed up and just dropped by today on my way home from an interview.  

Had to do a solo run.  Sad.  
Worth it?  Yes.

I came at around 4pm on a Friday afternoon and there was about 5-7 people ahead of me.  I was the last person in line for a while.  I was seated in about 10 minutes.  Not too bad.  I hear the line is usually a lot worse though.  Actually as I was leaving, there was probably another 7 people waiting.  Service was awesome.  Staff is super friendly.

I started with a cup of Clam Chowder.  Slightly disappointing.  It was very watery.  I, along with many of the previous yelpers, also enjoy a thicker calm chowder.  I would probably not be getting this again.

The oysters hit the mark however.  The Blue Point Oysters were big and plump.  I usually enjoy my oysters with a little bit of lemon and cocktail sauce.  I tried their mignonette sauce and it added a nice twist to an already good thing (fresh oysters)

The Combination Salad was delicious.  It came with prawns, shrimp, and crab.  I probably would just opt for the Crab Salad next time.  It really is the crab that makes it so damn good.  The crab comes in HUGE chunks and is very fresh.  The Combo salad comes in at about $16-17

Next time I'm back, I must have another seafood (crab or combo) salad, some oysters, and a nice cold glass of anchor steam.  

OH yeah, one of the coolest things is there old school register.  Pay attention. 

Cup of Clam Chowder: $2.50
6 Blue Point Oysters: $12
Combo Salad: $16.75
Anchor Steam: $4
TOTAL BILL: $35.25.

A bit pricey for one person, but its FRESH SEAFOOD!
author: Bert N.

description: Delicious! Extremely fresh and definitely worth the wait! Had the combination cocktail just to try a little of everything and had the oysters. I'm still thinking about them haha
author: Brittany L.

description:
So, I got c-blocked at the 5pm mark that they setup there.  So I ended up opting for take out.  
- Crab miso (butter/innards...) - Awesome!  Buttery, milky, strong sea flavor.  Dipped in their french bread and scooped.  
- Custom cocktail - Dungeoness crab meat, cherrystone clams, horseradish - Should've had the crab meat sans the cocktail sauce, maybe with just lemon.  Clams were so good.  More minerally and softer flavor than most oyster variety.  

I would've had some oysters, but didn't think it would be as special as take out.  Still great first experience.  Next time I need to make it before the 5pm cutoff. :(
author: Steve M.

description: If you want oyster on the half shell for cheap this is the place for you. It's always packed with locals and tourists but if you can wait you won't be disappointed. Their clam chowder is also excellent!
author: Christina S.

description:
Having also been to hog island at the ferry market building, the two places couldn't contrast more in style. whereas hog island has the bay views and the drooling yuppies that come with being in ferry market, swan oyster has tradition, the sea-salty, fishy (in a good way) smell, and grittiness- a place where fishermen and sailors with big tattoos might eat. also, i love bar table seating at restaurants because you get the see the kitchen and all the craziness that goes on into making your dish, and this is the only type of seating they have here. 

We got there at around 4 so the wait was only about 10 minutes. seafood was just as fresh but there was a lot more variety to choose from.  our shucker/server was really friendly and patient with us as me and the g/f dooked it out to get what we wanted on the menu on the wall. we looked to our right and left and saw single diners eating mounds of seafood by themselves. it was a good sign.

We went with: 6 oysters (a mix of kumamoto and another local type) served on a bed of ice with the usual trimmings: all really good and particularly the kumamotos new england clam chowder: as some of the other yelpers have posted, it's more of a soup than a chowder, and it's not as thick and rich as others I'm used to on the east coast, but it does have plenty of clam flavor in it; and scallop sashimi, japanese style with wasabi and ginger: it was as fresh and buttery as any I've eaten at a sushi restaurant. 

They had run out of the famed crab salad, which I hope to try the next time i'm back in sf. overall, this place deserves its hype: the seafood is diverse and fresh, the shucker/servers are helpful, and the bar seating gets you closer to all the work that goes into your food
author: Eric K.

description:
FRESH seafood.  

So fresh that the crab meat is sweet and juicy and tender; order the seafood salad.  

So fresh that the oysters are fat and milky; get oysters on the half shell.

Clam chowder is that the usual thick, milky texture, but once again, focus is on the freshness of the oysters.

Love this place, and I love the straight-forward and simple decor.  It's more like a fish market, actually.
author: Ashley S.

description: I had the smoked salmon on toast and it was fantastic, Clam chowder was watery but, hey don't buy it. Prawn Shrimp was excellent. I would definitely come back; great service and we had beer as we waited.
author: Traveler 9.

description: The line was a bit ridiculous, we waited 2 hours in a fairly short one. But the fish was very fresh and tasty.  I would definitely return if there was a shorter line.
author: Mike M.

description: very fresh food and the staff there were very very nice!! the place is a little small though, and it's pretty pricey......its good to visit when you're in town, but if i live there i probably wouldnt go back too often haah
author: Ru C.

description: The staff are super friendly! That being said, the line is ridiculous! I work nearby and every time i pass by, the line is out the door! I only got a taste of Swan Oyster because it was raining that day and I dont think anyone wanted to wait. It was a full house though... I ordered a Clam chowder and a crab salad. The crab salad was simple but there was plenty of crab, actually so much I couldn't finish it. The clam chowder, at first wasn't so great but then again, I'm used to thick clam chowder. I only liked it because they did give a lot of clams and the chowder was very clammy! I dont know if thats a good thing, but i enjoyed it. Total for my clam chowder and cran salad was a little over  $30. Not bad for plenty of crab but i wont be spending that much on lunch everyday.
author: Vi V.

description: One of the most famous places for fresh seafood.  Come prepared to wait in line to get in here because the secret is out.  It has a New England type charm and the people working there seem to be true fishermen.  As authentic as it gets...
author: Lisa V.

description: Rating based on the insanely OVERRATED chowder....as others say this is more like a broth with no clams....no flavor....gross!!!! So disappointed and definitely NOT worth the wait
author: Ting C.

description:
Service is below par, catering to out-of-town tourists. Probably knows that they will shell out the big bucks for overpriced fresh seafood.

$40 for 3 oysters, a cup of runny chowder, and sea urchin is not worth it in my book. I could have went to a nice restaurant with sanitary standards. I think I'll do that from now on. Will not be back, even though they have decently fresh seafood. The price and experience is just not worth it!
author: W C.

description: It is not just the great chowder. It is the genuine quality service that makes you feel at home..  The wait can be long, but it is well worth it.
author: Meredith A.

description: Ok seafood but not close to NYC joints.  Ran out of Uni in 10 minutes, asked why said they had less than 5 of them.  Not worth the wait...
author: Frederick Y.

description: Fun staff but this place is overrated.  This place is not worth waiting in line for 30 minutes let alone 2 hours.  I came around 8am on a Saturday and by the time I sat down 20 minutes later there was already  a line out the door at 830.  Crazy.  Its also crazy to drink and eat cold seafood at 8am.  Sucks to be fat.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Ever since I've moved into the neighborhood, I wanted to try Swan Oyster Depot.  The long lines I saw everyday of the week kept me away until now. This place has some of the freshest seafood in the city.  Their clam chowder, combination salad (shrimp, prawns, crab), and smoked salmon were excellent.  I didn't get to order the oysters, but the women next to me ordered the sampler, and I overheard the server explain where each of the oysters came from.  

The servers are mostly men with kick ass personalities, so you'll see a lot of friendly flirting going on to keep the female customers happy.  A reverse Hooters minus the buffalo wings.
author: Naomi N.

description: Been going here since the mid 70's even though I moved back then from the bay area to Chico....we go 3 or 4 times a year when in the city........an absolutely wonderful experience with the freshest seafood & chowder...very old school in a great way, no frills, just great food and a friendly family atmosphere.......I am a 64 yr old retired caterer and going to Swans regularly is in my top 100 experiences of my life......they always recognize us and greet us warmly...I love Swans and want to thank them and their father for decades of culinary trueness and dedication.
author: David G.

description:
Thought we'd beat the lunch crowd and reached there at 11.20am. Surprised, there already was a wait of about 6 people outside, and had to wait around half an hour, since they have very limited seating.
Had the clam chowder. One bowl for $4.75. DEFINITELY worth it, and the best I've had in SF. Over our holiday of 5D/4N, think we've had about 7 bowls of clam chowder all over..and Swan Oyster Depot really does have the best one!
Also had the prawn salad. There was a decent serving of prawns (very fresh!) served over a bed of iceberg lettuce. Their "Louiseville" sauce, which is sorta a blend of Thousand Island sauce is to die for. But considering it was $14ish, it was a tad bit steep.
But management was more than friendly, and just for that I'd return.
Cash only!
author: Kimberley O.

description: If you know seafood, do not go here. Anyone who likes,supports,or gives Swan oyster depot a 4 or 5 star rating does not know seafood. lets start with the chowder. I had a bowl, which was a generous amount of food, had almost zero clams or anything in it, i would call it a watery bisque and not a chowder. Next we'll move a long to the dozen oysters of mixed variety. Out of the 4 varieties, 3 were from my home state, so i had to ask myself... when i go get oysters from the ocean and shuck them on the beach, they have to be at least 3 days old by the time Swan gets them. After trying them, i would say more like 5 days. The "house made" cocktail sauce is ketchup based with no added flavor or tanginess, its just horrible sauce.It gives cocktail sauce and ketchup a bad name. The salads are shaved lettuce with seafood on top, that's it. Cant really mess that up, but there is massive amounts of room for improvement. All in all, i waited 1 1/2 hours in line for something i can get 3 minutes away from my house in my home state. Only i would get to pay with a debit card and my tab wouldnt be $120 for 2 people.
author: Mike P.

description:
Must have waited an hour to get a seat, truly worth it!  Clam chowder, oysters, sashimi - all tasted so fresh.

Looking forward to another trip to San Fran and will definitely visit this place
author: Rebekah L.

description: Awesome! That about sums up this place! Everything they serve is so yummy and what better service could you get! If I could only eat here every day.
author: Deb B.

description: Fresh lump crap was so good! The bay shrimp cocktail was also really fresh. I usually don't eat bay shrimp, but it was so good here at Swans!
author: Janelle R.

description:
Love this place!!! Five super stars! I miss Swans so much my heart craves for this place. 

I was sad when the Golden Spike closed, but I still got Swans. It's like saying goodbye forever to the love of your life, but you will always have Paris. 

Love the crusty sourbread and the seafood Louis. Even the butter is special about this place. The guys who work here are mellow. Neat atmosphere. The only place I have been to that is on the same level is Neptune Oyster in Boston, which is also unbelievable. I like Swans more because I am from the Bay Area and I got local pride.
author: reefgirl n.

description:
Remarkable. I had some smoked salmon and they tossed in a slice of trout-both were amazing. Taste, texture, every bit of it was fantastic.

Yes, the service isn't best, it's crowded, a little slow, and expensive. But the food is so good that Swan Oyster is on the top of my list of places to eat in San Francisco.
author: Satvik B.

description: I visited this place in 2006 and have yet to re-visit as I live in Portland, OR. But my S.O. and I compare all other oyster places relative to Swan Oyster Depot. We had the best experience and do plan on coming back soon!
author: Angie Q.

description:
Oh, how I wanted to like this place. It sounded like a classic and we were so in the mood for good bowl of clam chowder. We even went early  so as not to have to wait in line, and to get  the freshest made chowder. completely disappointing. Virtually no clams--only a very few specks of clam pieces, really--the milk liquid had curdled badly and the potatoes were discolored. Flavor? Fishy (in the bad sense of that word).  Do note that the bread was excellent. The oyster crackers were inedibly stale.

I was so so disappointed.
author: Terese A.

description: The clam chowder is really good but the place need an over haul if I was a health inspector  I would probably shut this place down for not being clean
author: Wes R.

description: Awesome! Went yesterday for a late lunch! Had the mixed dozen of oysters on the half shell, cup of clam chowder and shashimi plate! We love it! Fresh, tasty and well priced! Cafe not much to look at but has been around since 1912! Laid back and counter seating only. A little wait but so worth it!
author: Mary B.

description: We had the combination salad. This is a family run business. These guys love serving there customers great food. There was a line out the door and down the street. No rush to the customers dining. They all strive to make sure you enjoy your meal. This food was fabulous. I had a cup of chowder that was excellent. The oysters are prepared so well. They are plump and delicious.
author: Gaetan H.

description:
The seafood is fresh and fantastic. The oysters are nice and briney; perfect with just a squeeze of lemon. Get the Combination Salad, it has a ton of fresh crab (they were cracking them at the counter!), prawns, and baby shrimp. Perfect with an Anchor Steam for breakfast.

The counter is ALWAYS busy. There are a ton of regulars that a lot of the guys know by name. We went on a Tuesday morning (10 am) in January and the counter was almost full. So come early or be prepared to wait.

If you don't have a lot of time try to get take out, you'll have to miss out of the beer though.

Cash only!
author: Tiffany T.

description: Damn that Anthony Bourdain!!! Yes, they've always been popular but we've always managed to get in without a line. Well those days are over. And after an hour wait standing up out in the cold only to sit on a hard stool in an unheated 100+ year old oyster bar had lost it's appeal. Yes, the seafood is fresh. Yes it's delicious. But there are other places in The City where you can get delicious, fresh seafood and not wait out in the cold and then sit in the cold to eat cold food.  Brrrrr.  From now on I'll have a little comfort and atmosphere to go with my $90 lunch. Oh! and for those of you who saw the program, my husband and I tried the crab fat only to find out to our dismay that it was icy cold. Really guys? You couldn't heat it up in a pot like the clam chowder?
author: Jorri N.

description: This the best seafood in San Francisco! Expect an over 1hr wait!
author: Jonathan W.

description: Girlfriend and I love seafood and this place has been on our list of places to eat at. We decided to treat ourselves after a hard workout and we thought why not try this place out. After about an hour of waiting and our mouths watering, we finally got a table. It was amazing. We ordered the seafood salad. This was probably the best seafood salad I have ever had in my entire life. Didn't get a chance to try the oysters because they only take cash, and I didn't have much on me because I only had a card, so REMEMBER TO BRING CASH! Otherwise this place is on the top of my list, any time of day is a great time for seafood!
author: Michael N.

description: Swan Oyster Depot is a nice small little shop that seats only about 15 total along a bar.  I went there on a sunny friday afternoon and there was a long line outside.  The staff was friendly, although they were very busy.  My friend and I ordered a mix of oysters (from the E & W coast), some clam chowder, and 2 seafood cocktails with oysters, shrimp, prawns, and crab meat.  The horseradish there is top notch...definitely sinus clearing! The chowder wasn't as creamy as expected & didn't have enough clams. I guess because it's fresh seafood, expect to spend a fair bit of cash for the amount of food, but prices aren't unreasonable.
author: Chinh T.

description:
I had one of the best San Francisco afternoons at this place.  It was a random Wednesday around 11am.  I was going to Brownies to pick up some hardware.  I looked into restaurant and for once there wasn't a line out the door.  I was curious....

I timidly walked in and was a bit intimidated by the old school charm, everyone chatting and laughing as if they have known each other all their lives.  I saw a seat open and was figuring out the next thing to do.  The guy behind the marble counter came over and did the "how you duin"?  He sensed that I was confused and a bit shy.  He walked me through step by step on how the menu on the wall works and gave me a moment while he got my water.  I ordered the clam chowder, it was the best I have ever had.  Although watery, but I preferred it that way.  You can taste all the components in the chowder.  I have had my share of New England clam chowder during my college years.  Great with the buttery bread.

Now I feel a bit bolder, since the guy made me feel like his buddy.  I ordered 1/2 dozen of oysters, his pick.  He went away and came back with the most beautifully chucked oysters I have ever seen.  He explained each and everyone of them to me and I slurp those suckers down with cocktail and horseradish.  On my last one, I got his attention and he knew I wanted 6 more.

So this place really made my afternoon.  I love places where you go with a hint of resistance but come out feeling like a million bucks!  I say try this place out.
author: germaine n.

description: way overpriced for a mediocre seafood bar. Never understand why it's so popular - better money spent at hog island or Ame, for a fancy version
author: Ti W.

description:
This day is considered one of the best days of my life...

I rode my bike with a friend on a warm Saturday afternoon to Swan Oyster Depot. The line wasn't too bad- I think we waited 30 minutes or so. By the time we were able to step foot into "heaven" a very friendly man I later came to know as Jimmy asked if we'd like a beer or glass of wine.  

Shortly after I started drinking my glass of Sauv Blanc we were seated. I was so excited I could barely stand it! We started with 2 cups of Clam Chowder- yummy! More broth-like than chunky. We then had a shrimp cocktail and then the combination cocktail (shrimp, lobster etc). I love that they let you add your own horseradish in!

Following we had 2 dozen oysters. The Metard Bay were by far my favorite. Time after time someone would come over to ask how we were doing or if we needed anything. Talk about 5 start service! Everyone there is so polite and helpful and they make you feel like you are part of the family! I even asked if I could be adopted!

Although the seating is tight, it doesn't even cross your mind because you are so busy sliding oysters down your throat!

I'm planning to come back once a month to enjoy the fabulous food and fabulous people.

Remember this is Cash only and you will probably spend about $100 for 2 people including beer/wine.

Enjoy!
author: Jen S.

description:
Amazing little place.
Sooo many amazing things to say I don't know where to start. Great, great, great service. The guys that work there are so friendly and helpful. The food was so yummy and fresh. The location has been here forever and is like a step back in time.
The only issue with this meal was when it came to an end and we realized that it was cash only....5 minutes later and a chocolate bar and pez dispenser later our meal was paid for and we went home happy.
author: Kathleen E.

description:
The first time I visited Swan it was raining. Horizontally. 

If you haven't been, the space is small (12 seats) and you will spend some good time outside in the elements before even huddling in the warmth of the doorway. The gentleman in front of me insisted it was worth the wait (the hour and a half wait)....And you know what...he was right.

I've since returned, standing less time in that line, always leaving completely satisfied that I endured the wait for that reward of savoring every single bite.

The oysters are fresh (and cheap), the clam chowder is not clumpy (in the best way) and the Anchorsteam perfectly chilled. Feel free to order off the menu....the smoked salmon and variety of sashimi is worth the asking.  I highly suggest the raw scallops.

Perhaps best of all is the entertainment behind the fish bar -  family members working side by side poking jokes, recapping sports drafts, hanging up on lost tourist's phone calls and razzing the customers.

If you're lucky enough you might even get a complimentary house aged tequila straight out of the wooden barrel....and if not, you'll always leave completely satisfied with a Swan sponge to clean your kitchen with.
author: Kristin G.

description: This place is the best, just the best. You could not find fresher seafood unless you caught it yourself!
author: Jim B.

description: I've been patronizing seafood restaurants in S.F. for the last 40 years. Swans Seafood on Polk is the most solid, dependable of fresh seafood in S.F., that is why you see regular citizens, standing next to the wealthy citizens of S.F....everyone gets the same treatment, and the same ultra fresh,fan food!
author: John H.

description: We arrived at 11 on a Tuesday and already a line of course. We waited about 40 minutes. We got in and got seated (really tight squeeze.) it took them about 15 minutes just to clean from people before us so they are in no rush at all. Which was ok., we weren't either. We ordered our beers and the man at first was kind of rude , but then he got a little nicer . We got the clam chowder and oh my, the wait was worth it just for that. It was delicious and dipping the bread in it was just so good. We also got the combination seafood cocktail. Oh so yummy, tons of crab meat which I loved . It was pretty cool to watch them prepare everything in front of you too. Cool atmosphere here. Not sure I would wait in line again but you should come here once for sure .
author: Kelly P.

description:
Look, I'm not going to say that the Chowder is the best for my particular tastes but there is no denying that it was good. I prefer mine a little thicker but they did deliver on fresh chunks of clams. I also had oysters on the half. They gave me one of each type of oyster they had coming in from the world over. It was interesting to be able to take that tour and enlighten myself as to the type of oysters I like better. The education alone was helpful.

Everyone inside was extremely helpful and accommodating.
author: Don L.

description:
Oh heeeeell yes!! Now this is where I'll be going the next time I am in the area looking for good seafood. They know how to make it proper at Swan's. From the freshly shucked oysters to the prawn cocktail to some bangin' chowdah, this place has it goin' on!! On top of that, they give ya some delicious sourdough bread on the side and a tall glass of ice cold beer. What more could you want?! 

Yeah, the wait is incredible, the prices aren't exactly inexpensive (no credit cards!) and the personal space is non-existent.  But what you get in return is some great eating ambiance, a really knowledgeable staff, some of the friendliest clientele you'd come across in the city and above all FANTASTIC seafood.  The people who come here are seafood lovers and it really shows.  

If you want outstanding seafood, forget the tourist trap up at the Wharf and hop on a cable car and head down to Swan's!!  You can thank me later.
author: Jim D.

description:
the bf wanted to come by since he hadn't eaten here in a long time, but this was my first trip to seafood haven. 

i couldn't decided which salad i wanted because what did like more? crab? shrimp? i like it all. so we ordered 2 combination salads and a bowl of clam chowder to share. and we devoured, with love, every bite. 

definitely want to try to the oysters on our next visit!
author: Maria B.

description: You gotta go here during a weekday, before 11AM or after 4PM. That's the only way to avoid the line. Once inside, you'll never find a more friendly or talkative staff. Absolutely incredible, fresh fish, shrimp and the best clam chowder I've ever had - this is simply my favorite place in the world to eat seafood.
author: Trevor H.

description: I love this place. Whenever my friends visit we spend our afternoons here. Drink beers in line and laugh at the crazed hobo drama going down on Polk Street. We inch our way up to the entrance and start to formulate a plan. Why are people in San Francisco ok with waiting in a crazy line for amazing food? Maybe because it gives us a chance to really get hungry? Who knows. I overeat here, even if I'm not hungry. Smoked salmon on sourdough, big n little oysters, crab salad, chowder, a million little spoons for the sauces, tasty beer on tap, aged tequila (if your lucky), I'm in heaven here. Plus the guys behind the bar are hilarious and ridiculously fun to shoot the shit with. Mike is super cute too. Man I still can't believe I missed Anthony Bourdain! He was so close, in my neighborhood! I guess I'll have to get a little more adventurous and have a crab back... to be continued :)
author: Amy W.

description: San Francisco classic. Must visit when in town.
author: Ting Hin C.

description: Everything is over the top delicious!!! be prepared to stand in line but its well worth the wait, I would here everyday of I could. Talk to the staff and let them know what you like and you will be pleasantly surprised by what they will serve you! Enjoy!
author: Kajal P.

description: To avoid waiting for ages, avoid it on Saturday and try to get there by 11am. Didn't have to wait too long at all. It was here that I tried my very first raw oyster. Something that I was happy to avoid up until that point. We enjoyed the freshness and quality of the food so much that we came back twice during our San Francisco visit.
author: Kemi T.

description:
really cool spot, its been on every show on the food chanel.  the guys at the counter are really cool....the clam chowder was ok, but I've had better in Seattle and Boston....it was a little thinner...

had an amazing sliced raw fish dish with sardines, salmon, albacore and scallops...swimming in olive oil with onions and capers....seriously, some of the best shit ever.  Prices are high but who cares, do you really want discount seafood?
author: Eric t.

description:
Chyea!! What a place!  Stick through the long lines, they tend to go by somewhat fast and it's well worth it.  Great fresh seafood, how can you go wrong with that?  Real good and friendly service too.  The only disappointing part of the meal is the clam chowder- i like my chowda thicker than what they serve, and i like it to actually have clams in it. 

"I believe that slavery is the single most upsetting part of our great nation's history."
-Michael Richards
author: John B R.

description:
This place is quintessential San Francisco.  Its really small and has an incredibly limited menu but everything is oh so good.  The line can get beyond ridiculous, so if you are hungry, this may not be the place to wait.  

Keep an eye out, cause even some local stars will eat here too.
author: Mark K.

description: Nice place. Very friendly staff. Smoked Salmon was to die for, moist & tender. Clam chowder is watery, so I drank it from the cup, it was still good. I don't recommend any of the seafood salads very expensive and the letuce wasn't  that great.. I had the combo(crab& shrimp) and only ate the meat not the letuce which I thought sucked. For half the price your better off going with the seafood cocktail that has just meat for half the price of the salad. Met some people sitting at the bar. Everyone was in good spirits and very friendly. There was a certain atmosphere about the place. I really enjoyed it. Make sure you bring plenty of Cash. Also, they don't cook anything. So all the fish, clams and oysters are all raw. Only thing cooked is the Smoked Salmon.
author: Joe A.

description:
Last day in the city while on Holiday and came in here for an early lunch as it was right around the corner from my hotel. Perfect atmosphere on a cold and cloudy morning. Had their clam chowder, which was good, and the combination seafood salad with Louie dressing, which was awesome.

Not the typical seafood joint, it's more like a tiny fish market you'd find on a pier somewhere.
author: Chris G.

description: Finally had to check this place out given all the hype.  Was in the neighborhood getting my car serviced and noticed there were only a couple of people in line.  The oysters were very good.  The chowder was pretty average.  Crab was fresh.  Service was nothing to rave about.  Seems more like a tourist trap than anything else.  There's really no skill involved in any of their dishes.  It's just seafood - albeit fresh.
author: Eric C.

description:
Mmm....Mmm... I likes me a seafood salad that's (way) more seafood than salad.  They also have the best chowder in town.

Bring something to entertain yourself while you wait in line for a counter spot.  You will be happily rewarded for your patience.
author: .caroline. ..

description:
Date/Time:  Saturday - 4pm
Occasion:  Late lunch
Party of:  Two
Location:  TINY TINY TINY. Fits about a handful of people, which explains the ridiculously long line. Gives you the feel like you're crammed on a boat.
Ordered: Two dozen oysters: miyagi, blue point, and kumamoto mix, crab and shrimp louie salad,  clam chowder, and complimentary crab head
Total incl gratuity: ~$75

After three trips back and forth to the parking meter, which totaled about a two hour wait, we were finally seated in what must have been one of the smallest, most crammed restaurants ever.  All I was thinking was: this place better be worth it.  Well, I am happy to report that I was rather satisfied.  The oysters were very fresh.  They better be...after all, they are shucked right in front of you. My favorite still remains the kumamoto. Small yet jam-packed with flavor. They offered a couple of different kinds of sauces.  Try them all, especially the habenero vinagarette!  Great with the oysters.  The crab and shrimp louie salad was definitely a good choice; it comprised of a generous heaping of freshly shredded dungeness crab. The clam chowder was different.  You could certainly taste the clams.  It wasn't the thick chowder I'm accustomed to - more of a flavorful thin clammy goodness.  The last thing I got, which I thought was the best, turned out to be free.  If you ask them for the crab head, they give it to you complimentary.  I know it sounds gross and so full in cholesterol, but you have got to try it.  If I could have, I would have asked for two more and bagged them to take home. If you dip it in some bread, it is really scrumptious.

The service is fun and they move quickly to get you in and out as the line out the door never seems to shorten.  It is quite pricey for a lunch but for experience and the fresh seafood, I would recommend at least checking them out once.
author: Jess C.

description:
The oysters served here are as fresh as they could get.  The cocktail sauce adds a nice touch of acidity to these wonderfully tasty sea creatures.

Despite their name, they serve much much more than just oysters.  Definitely try their scallop sashimi.  Your waiter/chef will most likely slice the raw scallops in front of you and chat away gregariously, they really remind me of Japanese itamaes.  They serve two styles of sashimi -- Eastern and Western.  The Western sashimi pieces are drizzled with olive oil and topped with capers; Eastern style involves a drop of Sriracha sauce with some ponzu shouyu sauce on the side.  I personally prefer the Eastern style much more.

They also serve free kani-miso (kani = crab, miso indicates the texture/appearance of miso paste) -- top half of a crab.  It's essentially a mixture of brains and eggs served in its original shell, or... if you prefer, a cholesterol bomb in a shell.  It's amazingly delicious, but many people find them disturbingly disgusting (it's okay, they are wrong).

Expect to wait about one hour in line, depending on your group's size.  It's definitely worth the wait!
author: Bill T.

description: ***BE WARNED***** You will wait for a long time to get in here. We honestly waited 3 hours. I thought it would be like 45 minutes :(. But once I got in it was a seafood lovers dream. I went with my wife and we got a lot of food. Here's the low down. the clam chowder was amazing, the Oysters were to die for (use the green sauce), The smoked salmon melted like butter in my mouth and the Crab cocktail was dreamy. I'd eat here every day if possible.  Food is 5 stars at about $50 a person and the wait is 0 stars. The guys that work their are pretty cool as well. It sounds cheesy but after I survived the line I felt like I wanted a t-shirt or something.
author: Charlie D.

description: Really great place and worth the wait. The combination seafood cocktail is awesome; you get to try a bit of everything. The oysters are fantastic and extremely fresh, I could sit there and indulge all day. The crab fat for dipping fresh sourdough is also something rare and delicious and the clam chowder is light and extremely flavorful.
author: Marat P.

description: This place is awesome. You have to wait in the queue but totally worth it. if you are alone you might get a chance to jump ahead in the line. you sit a the bar and a waiter brings you the fresh seafood you ask for. Tested the Half Cracked Crab and the oysters. I'll totally go again
author: Joel B.

description: OMG!! Delicious and freshness!!!!! We drove all the way from Vegas to here. This is the best lunch we had for those days. The clam chowder was SO fresh. The clam was swimming in my mouth LOLL!!  The chowder is small cup, dont worry, you can stuff more after it. The salad is a shrimp salad is good for appetite. They make everything fresh in front of you in the small bar where they serve foods. Everything is worth a try. This price is insanely cheap. I wish i can have the same potion and same price in NYC. Obviously, you can find it in the city, but once you are in SF, dont miss out here. A must come spot!!!!!!! I love Swan oyster depot!!! Oh, and there's limited seat in this tiny place, plan ahead the time and standing for few minutes to get the delicious and freshness seafood, worth it!
author: Hannah x.

description: Not worth the wait. The place is small and cramped as well as pricey. I ordered the bowl of clam chowder. It was nothing special and a bit watered-down. The place seemed dirty too. I have no idea why people wait so long just to sit down and eat here. Good luck.
author: Tt M.

description: Freshest seafood you can find. Expect a wait but it's well worth it. Staff is very friendly as well.  Cash only and bring a lot because you pay for this quality!
author: Ryan J.

description: not sure what all the hype is for about this place. the staff is friendly but the place is dirty! we ordered 2 bowls of clam chowder and a shrimp coctail and it was $28...WAY overpriced!! i am a huge clam chowder lover and their clam chowder was not good at all!! very dissapointed! the shrimp coctail was good, but it was smothered in sauce, which was way overpowering! i would have liked to have tried a few more items but they are so expensive i just couldnt! their seafood did seem to be fresh and while sitting at the food bar, i almost felt like i was on a boat in the ocean because the place was that stinky and dirty. all in all, i am glad i came here to experience what everyone raves about this place, but i would not go back!!
author: Trina S.

description: Great place to come for oysters. If you want to get food here, come early or you will have to wait. The staff who work here are nice and courteous.
author: Anthony V.

description:
Really freaking good. 

Had: clam chowder, a half dozen oysters, and a crab cocktail.  Each better than the last.  

Oysters were amazingly fresh.  Super friendly staff as well.  

"As good as it gets."  Luv this place!
author: Alex J.

description: For seafood it gets a 5.  Service is a 5.  Wait for a seat at a bar that is cramped and perhaps a bit hurried with the line looking at you and knowing that you were just in that line for a long time- I have to dilute to a 4.  Worth the wait.  excellent seafood.  Great place to try new things - or even old things that previously didn't go well.  If you don't like it here- you don't like it.  Yes, I would (definitely) go again but will be more prepared to wait.
author: Mrs A J.

description:
A very old-school place with lots of fresh seafood and a few good beers on tap.  You're served directly at the bar.

Remember also - if you want to big shrimp, you got to order the prawns.  I guess I am too used to getting giant steroid shrimp with my shrimpy cocktails.

Oysters were $2 each.  Prices are generally pretty reasonable.  The only thing is that this place is small and you will be waiting a bit.

Clam chowder is pretty damn good.  It's more runny than creamy and I really liked that about it.
author: J K.

description:
Watching burly dudes do dainty stuff is always good times. You know: a buffed out leather-clad dude planting flowers in the Castro Community Garden, Mr. T painting faberge eggs, Rocco Siffredi finger painting a birthday card for his grandmother. 

At Swan Oyster Depot, the food is not exceptional. Besides the smoked salmon, trout, or whitefish, it's all seafood: seafood in cocktail sauce, seafood on a salad, or raw seafood served on a plate full of ice. There are no seasonings to speak of, and no cooking methods besides smoking or boiling.

But that hardly matters. You come here for the experience. There's something very unique -- something very San Franciscan -- about shelling out $40 for a 400-calorie meal prepared and served by polite, cheerful dudes who could probably eat an entire minivan full of Combos (pepperoni pizza flavor, most likely). Watching one of the "chefs" prepare a half order of smoked salmon -- slicing off two small tissue-paper-thin slices and placing them on a plate -- was nearly as entertaining as watching Russel Crowe perform the Rite of Spring. Watching them prepare a pint-sized crab cocktail was as wondrous as watching The Rock pluck his unibrow.

Thank you, chefs and servers at Swan Oyster Depot, for filling my spirit if not my stomach. I hope that as you watched me eat -- my chiseled form balancing on a barstool while I daintily plucked bits of crab out of a tiny cocktail glass with a tiny, tiny fork, all the while politely chatting with my mother -- you felt at least a slight echo of the joy you gave to me.
author: Ben P.

description: I admit that I only came here cuz of the Bourdain Layover show. But i'm glad I did. The crabs were oh...so sweet. And we dipped our soudough bread in the crab eggs just like Bourdain and he's right...'it's how god intended us to eat"..
author: K T Y.

description: This place was recommend to my husband by a friend who recently was in SF. We were in the area for a wedding so decided to give it a try. Yes, there was a line, and you had to wait. But it was definately worth it! We had a clam chowder which was different than the usual thick clam chowder but very good. We shared a combination salad (shrimp, crab), quick tasty , especially with the dressing. And finally had a combination platter of oysters, WOW. The freshest, tastiest oysters I have ever had. I'm not usually a beer drinker but their Stella (draft) absolutely was cherry on top. Loved the atmosphere, and got some other tips to other places from other customers.
author: Millie M.

description:
I LOVE, LOVE THE OYSTERS AND THE CRAB SALAD! It's AMAZING. The crab salad comes in a huge portions of crab. The sauce is yummy too!

They have at least 6 diff kinds of oysters and my fav is the Blue Point. Very fishy and slurpy. 

The only reason I gave it a 4-star is because if you come at the wrong time, you could be waiting outside for hours. They only have a bar seating that probably fits up to 20 people. 

One time I had to wait for almost an hour! Wish they have more space.
author: Miss C.

description: One of the best restaurant experiences of my life. The crab cocktail was delicious. Clam chowder was amazing.
author: Chandra W.

description:
A man once told me oysters are an aphrodisiac.  And then he took me to Swans.  Subtle.

We had delicious chowder (sounds SEXY!), Crab Louie (HOT HOT HOT) and of course, Oysters.

Now, let's examine the supposed sexual healing that happens in the midst of oyster intake:

Is it the sensual way they glisten as you pick them up?  Is it the way you open wide and they fill your mouth with salty, briny liquid?  Is it the way they slip down your throat effortlessly?  Is it the way you look deep into your dining companions eyes, knowing that you both just want more?

Ummmm....

No.  It is not one of those things.  The aphrodisiac is the alcohol you ingest whilst sucking down shellfish.  An oyster connoisseur who has 4 beers by 1pm?  Pretty much equals an alcohol problem OR an open invitation to bone down.

As for me?  After SOD, I could have taken or left the hot seafood sex. What I really wanted was more oysters.
author: Rachel G.

description: I love this place, and I have happily waited in line for years to enjoy the best quality shellfish and crab louie . Clam chowder is great, smoked salmon to die for. The family that owns this place are super cool and always friendly. I am a life long customer!
author: Curtis H.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for so long but was deterred because of the stories about long lines.

I came at about 3. We were able to get a seat right away. I ordered my 12 kumomos,  12 miyagis and half a cracked crab. The crab was very pricy ( $16.50 for half a crab) but they practically do all the work for you. It wasn't just cracked, they took the time to remove half of the shell from all the legs so all you had to do was pick up the meat off the shell.   Yes, I am a lazy one, and I would gladly pay the extra money for someone to do all the work for me!

The staff was always very mindful. As I was eating my crab.. they kept cleaning my mess up for me and also brought me a wash bowl. 

When the oysters came out, about half of the Miyagi's were bigger than what I'd prefer. I told the waiter "ewe, I'm scared of big ones" and he took all the big ones back and replaced them with the smaller ones. THAT was awesome! the quality of the seafood was outstanding.

The decor of the place was very cute. They had a very old cash register. I was amazed that it still worked. All the decorations looked like it could have been as old as the resturaunt itself. It added a lot of character to the place. A lot of things were done old-school. Like the butter for my crab was melted using the coffee maker. 

In the front of the store, they had endless mounts of crab, calamari and other types of seafood. It looked amazing. The only thing that they could do better is making sure they handled the food properly. I did notice that the guys made the salads, took money and then wiped of counters w/o washing hands in between.... it made me glad I only ordered things that had shells so they weren't touching the meat.
author: Anna T.

description:
So, it's my 100th review here on Yelp.  A life milestone I believe.  I wanted to make this one a special place, but I have a tendency to review only places I like, and thus most of my favorite places I have already reviewed.  

BUT, when I realized I had not yet reviewed Swan, I was elated.  Easily on my top 5 list of places to eat in San Francisco, Swan is a true gem of our fine city.  For those of us who love fresh seafood and hate (for the most part, as sometimes it can be fun) pretension, Swan is true find.  

Because Swan is VERY small (the number of seats numbers in the teens) and well known and a local institution, let me give you some tips on how to maximize your time here.  
1.  Arrive early.  If you arrive after 11:45, you will have to wait--sometimes for a LONG time.  
2.  If you don't arrive early, don't sweat it.  Everyone in line is friendly, and you all make it through your hunger pains together (though staring at the food in the window is pure torture).  
3.  Once you are seated, don't bitch about being uncomfortable or cramped.  No one cares.  
4.  The guys who work there know how to take care of you, so just let them.  If they suggest you try something, do it.  
5.  Don't leave without having the smoked salmon.  It is the best I have ever had.  
6.  Have a beer or a glass of wine.  Trust me.  
7.  Ask for one of their business cards/sponges.  Just cause.  

That's about it.  Swan is one of those neighborhood businesses where, if by some stroke of terrible luck they were going under, I would join the campaign and donate money to keep them afloat.  The city would not be as rich of a place without Swan.
author: Blake W.

description:
Too long a line to wait, so we ordered to go.

Ordered a dozen oyster samplers, crab leg meat, jumbo prawns, and clam chowder soup to go.  We asked for the regular and spicy cocktail sauces.  The spicy cocktail sauce definitely has a great kick.  

Now the jalapeno, garlic, lime concoction was a definite thumbs up!  Goes great with oysters and seafood.

Brought our take-out and enjoyed it as part of our picnic at Marina Park overseeing the bay view during a nice day made the experience a memorable one.  

Next time, we'll probably stomach the long line and enjoy the meal over the bar in old San Franciscan style.
author: Eddie T.

description:
A great San Francisco treasure - the highlight for me of a fun Bay Area food trip. 

The wait was long for this cozy little bar - nearly an hour, but so worth it. Everything we had was just amazingly fresh and well prepared, whether raw or cooked. The servers are all American, but to my mind they are comparable in their own way to the Japanese trained chefs at any fine sushi restaurant. 

The highlights of our meal were the great chowder, super fresh and briny oysters, and the amazing raw platter of scallop and yellowtail, prepared with olive oil, capers and red onion. Pure heaven. Also amazing was the cooked crab and shrimp - so fresh. 

Another Bay Area treasure I wish we could replicate here in LA.
author: Walt L.

description:
Swan Oyster Depot was my first experience with oysters, which is kind of like being kissed by Adonis, but with more seafood-y flavor. 

LOVED the shrimp salad I had and the vinagrette our server mixed up for me. They make their own vinegar, did you know that? They do. Service was warm and very attentive. 

So worth the wait.
author: Kit S.

description: i recommend getting this place to-go if you don't want to wait in the huge lines. i got a dozen mixed oysters for $30. didn't try anything else because we were one of the few customers left in line, so we had to order to-go. they cut-off inside seating around 430. the guys are nice, but their food handling is a bit questionable...
author: Brian N.

description:
I love oysters as much as the next person. I've been kicking myself in the arse for not taking of advantage of this place when I used to live in the City. 

The space is limited with stools and a long counter.

All of their seafood items are really fresh. I'd rather come here than beating tourists off with a stick at the Ferry Building's Hog Island Oyster Bar.
author: Mika D.

description: I went there for oyster take out, my experience is not good at all.  I wait at the scale for a few minutes and no one bother to serve me.  I had to ask a server for order to go, but he said "Do you see that I am busy, and I should find some one who is not busy to serve."  So I waited another few minutes for him to come back to serve me for 2 dozen of oyster to go.  After I got home,  there was 1 empty oyster out of 24, and 2 were somewhat dried.  How can this be fresh oyster??  I will not come back.  I have tasted better oysters elsewhere.  BTW, they only accept cash.  How can an American restaurant not accepting credit card in this modern world?
author: Charles C.

description:
Awesome food! Awesome staff! 
We showed up a few minutes after they stopped seating, but my sis lives in Jersey and was very excited to try the place so they let us in anyway. The seafood was very fresh, the staf was friendly and we got simply great service (stress on the simple, no frills, always genuine). I will definitely be back!
author: Mandy C.

description: This was so awesome...the 50 minute wait was well worth it...bring cash cause they do not take credit cards...Thank you all behind the counter for making my visit just a food bliss...
author: Nina I.

description:
I don't mean to pile on, but this place is amazing. 

As others have said, the real strength is that their seafood is incredibly fresh. The oysters, squid salad, etc., are close to if not the best I've ever had. The non-fresh dishes (clam chowder, smoked salmon, etc.) are very good as well, but not as amazing as the raw seafood. 

Got here at 10:20 on a Friday and there was already a bit of a line, though I still got in on the first seating. By the time I left around 11, there was quite a line forming down the block. So get here early unless you're prepared to wait.
author: Alessandro P.

description:
You know a place in the bay area is good when:

1) there is a line out the door much longer than most clubs
2) it's PACKED more than most clubs
3) it has a rating of 4+ after 300 or more reviews on yelp

So, to make things quick and easy, why should you wait in line?  First of all, because this place has fresh, FRESH seafood, a few cute waiters and friendly waiters, and a very down to earth feel.

If you're an oyster fanatic like me, you'll love the blue point oysters which are as big as half of your face, perfectly paired with horseradish and cocktail sauce.  If you're dining with a companion, top it off with a seafood cocktail and the clam chowder soup - oh, and a draft beer.

You'll thank me, and the other 355 or so people who agree.
author: Shay F.

description:
This is my jam peoples. I absolutely love Swan Oyster Depot. I would be broke as a joke diggin for change in my couch to get down to Swan for the Mal Pecs, Kumamotos and Blue Points! Dammit! I thought that was the tip of the ice burg but then a fellow Swan addict  informed me about their Clam selection. That was it. Sold. I am now officially hooked. No turning back now. Thanks a lot Swan. And to top it off all the guys  that work there are super efing nice!!!! Suuuuuper nice!

5 Stars and
Two thumbs way way up!
author: Latashia G.

description:
So, I have returned to Swan many times since my first review, and have found their service to be consistently pleasant.  

Love: the crab cocktail, the small washington oysters (name?), soup, bread, butter, etc... 

One of my faves...
author: Laura K.

description: Delicious seafood and great service! Planned on getting there early. They open at 10:30a, I arrived at 10:05 and I was the second person in line. By the time I left the line had grown considerably. The food is so fresh and delicious and the people are so friendly! I'm planning on coming back before I leave sf
author: lydia d.

description:
A fantastic experience, as always.

We were a group of four, which is the maximum amount of people I would attempt to go there with. There are only about 15 seats (an estimate) and the wait can be up to an hour, although its always worth it.

We got there just after noon on a Thursday and were surprised that there wasn't a line. We ordered our standard Honig and Anchor Steam while we waited and sat down before we finished them, our shortest wait ever.

The seafood at Swan is always incredibly fresh, the oysters are terrific, a plate of "carpaccio" included a variety of raw fish and scallops topped with olive oil, capers, and onions. I don't think it's on the menu, be sure to ask for it. I had a combination Louie Salad with bay shrimp, large shrimp, and crab meat topped with their thousand island dressing, so delicious. The clam chowder is always tasty. It's what I would call traditional, no thickeners, however it's always broken, a fact that I think adds to the charm.

This is one of those unique hole in the wall discoveries that really lives up to the hype, the owners are a blast to talk to and watch, the food is simple yet delicious, and the atmosphere is one of a kind. 

By the way I have seen some comments about it being overpriced, that's garbage. My wife and I typically will have three glasses of beer or wine each and our own louie salads, a cup of chowder, carpaccio, a dozen oysters and it is always under a hundred bucks, a bargain in my estimation.
author: jim S.

description:
Tear.  Another instance of SF Yelp hype!
2.5 stars, really.  Poor value, somewhat above average seafood, unhygienic.

Yes, this place was on my SF bucket list in part of the hype.  When it was on Anthony Bourdain's SF layover, the decision to go was cemented.

Pros:
- Family-run
- Hole-in-the-wall - gets points for 'authenticity', whatever that means
- Service was friendly but surprisingly slow for a place with a long line

Cons:
- Long line - 25 mins even at 1:30 on Monday.
- NO gloves, serving tools, and minimal hand washing.  They only take cash so the guys handle money, grab food out of the seafood bins to make the salads and cocktails with bare hands, shuck oysters, and wipe down the counters with no hand washing breaks in between.  Uuuggh.  I tried to overlook this given that I wanted to judge the hype for myself, but I found it disgusting.
- Clam chowder - okay.  Watery.  But I am spoiled -- was recently at Splash Cafe in Pismo Beach.  But that's another review for another day.
- Combo cocktail - just okay.  Cold, not seasoned.  Just a cup of steamed seafood topped with gritty raw oysters and cocktail sauce on the side.
- Oysters: average. Had Miyagis, Kunamotos, and Blue Points.  Shells were jagged and broken so hard to slurp.  Luckily did not cut myself.
- Sicilian style sashimi - best thing we had but not listed on the menu.  Tuna, salmon and scallops with capers, onion and olive oil. Vastly improved with our additions of salt and lemon.

VERDICT: Save your time and money.  Okay overall but doesn't live up to the hype!  I was most excited about the oysters but would rather pay the extra $0.50-$0.75 per oyster elsewhere to 1) not have to wait in line, 2) not squirm with disgust at unwashed hands and 3) not have broken shells and grit in my oysters!
author: Coco L.

description: The top notch seafood and exceptional, friendly service have been discussed at length, and I agree 100%.  I would give 5 stars based on those two things alone, but  I have to withhold one star because of the numerous health violations I witnessed this year (we go to SF every year and always make a trip to Swan's).  The most offensive was watching the guys handle cash and then immediately use their bare hands to manhandle the lettuce, bread, crab and shrimp.  Eww.   I really wish they'd use some gloves or get some tongs!  If you can look past that, the Crab Louie, seafood cocktail clam chowder and oysters are always phenomenal.  Always love seeing Gino and Jim - solid guys!!!
author: Kim D.

description:
Come here for the great prices, friendly staff, and immaculate hygiene... or not.

There are *plenty* of great raw bars in SF, this one just aint one of them, despite the hype.
author: David S.

description:
I heart Swan's and I heart Dean.  After reading all of the fantastic reviews on Yelp, Michael and I decided to hit up Swan's.  We went on a Saturday afternoon at 4:30 pm, so there wasn't much of a line.  We were behind two groups and sat after about 25 minutes of waiting.  We sat, got a little confused in regards to how to order, figured it out and got us a bowl o' chowder and two dozen mixed oysters.  

Chowder was kinda amazing...a little watery, but the clams were so fresh it really did taste like they came right out of the water (which they did - $4.50).  We shared it with bread and butter ($1) and watched as Dean shucked our oysters.  Oh man...those oysters...

...were so damn good!  We had a combination of different oysters and my favorite were the local ones.  So flavorful and so fresh...I-want-more!  Dean was so wonderful - he definitely made the experience awesome.  He shucked...he smiled...he took pictures of us Asians...he is the amazing DEAN.  Ask for him, he's so nice.  

Then...someone behind the bar was making a plate of SCALLOPS, olive oil and CAPERS - oh, dear lord!  Did heaven descend on us?  Seriously?  We ordered a small plate (Dean got it for us for a little cheaper than $16.50) and DAMN I have never had raw scallops and WOW they were so buttery and so good, I want them now!  

I will never forget my experience at Swan's.  They only take cash and they are mad cool.  I almost cannot refer you to a better oyster/raw food bar than Swan's.  Definitely all family - I talked to another guy behind the bar and asked him who was "family" and it was like, 95% of the people behind the bar.  We ended up splurging and spent a straight up 71 bucks at the bar - but including tip, a good ole' 95.  Trust me, they'll appreciate it and hook you up.  I sampled some of their Smoked Salmon and it was the best ever!  If you're in the area, stop by and ask for Dean.
author: Tida A.

description:
If you want the freshest seafood in town, look no further.  I'm especially a fan of the combination salad where they pile on rock shrimp, prawns and crab.  Also, the oysters (Wash, Oregon, Japanese and local) are great too.  I've had the clam chowder too which is by far, way better than the bread bowl stuff you get down in Fisherman's Wharf.

Be sure to block out a good amount of time because the wait can be brutal.  There are approximately 16 diner seats available which allows for intimate seating - think MUNI - next to other seafood hounds, but this makes the interaction with the all knowing servers priceless.  

I especially like that they serve Stella Artois on tap.  It goes extremely well with the delicacies of the sea.  If you're not a fan of Stella, you can opt for Anchor Steam, a brew made locally in the Potrero Hill neighborhood of San Francisco.

As far as pricing goes, two of us spent $75 and walked out satisfied and full.  Granted I could have gone back that evening if they were open!  Only lunches here folks!
author: Josh M.

description:
Even if the clam chowder had been atrocious* and even if the  crab salad had been unpalatable**, I would give Swan 5 stars for the absolutely stunning sea urchin alone. They cut up this beautiful thing right on the counter in front of you, and slice the sea urchin up into little spears. With a little lemon, it bursts into ocean splendor in your mouth. I've eaten a lot of sea urchin, but none have rivaled this.

I felt like I was a regular - they treat everyone, even tourists, like regulars. (I didn't waste time in telling them that I lived two blocks away though.)

*actually really delicious, especially when dipped with hunks of sourdough bread
**actually super yummy - big hunks of crab - but go with the sauce on the side

P.S. Of course the oysters were really good too - my favorite are the blue point
author: Sahra H.

description:
Over my lengthy, storied history of dining (I've been known to have had something to eat almost every single day, for my entire life), one constant I've found at places that are "any good" is a line of people waiting to get in. This is not to suggest that a good place *has* to have someone waiting in line to get in. However, if an establishment has 10-12 schmucks standing on the sidewalk every time you walk by, that sneaking suspicion that they know something you don't is probably correct.

Founded in the early 20th century, Swan's has basically had a line of people waiting to get in for 100 years. Thankfully, Id recently moved into the neighborhood and happened by at an opportune time. On an ordinary Wednesday around 2pm, we only had to wait behind four people for about twenty minutes. As I shook my head, thinking to myself that I really don't even like oysters that much, I learned that Swan's is deceivingly named an Oyster Depot, yet serves such other seafood delicacies as shrimp and crab cocktail, "Boston" clam chowder (more later), fresh fish and, obviously, oysters. 

Having grown up in Boston, I suffer from a common New England fixation with sampling any clam chowder advertised as "Boston/New England/Cape Cod", typically so I can shake my head disdainfully and explain to someone who is not a "chowderhead" that this is not, in fact, chowder from New England. While Swan's does put forward a tasty bowl and at least got the crackers right, the broth is too clear and not nearly damaging enough to my arteries to qualify as legit. But then again, it's not called Swan's Chowder Depot, is it?

We sampled six different oysters - mostly from the Bay, Washington and Canada and they were all pretty good. A chowder connoisseur I may be, but f*ck if I know a thing about oysters!! Irregahdless, there was only one - a rather large myagi - that was a little too slimy, not enough salty for me. I think we knocked them all back in about four minutes and were quite pleased. 

High props went to the crab cocktail, which we also sampled during the appetizer course. With a nod perhaps to the equally venerable and touristy Ghiradelli's, they serve up the fresh crab dripped in a housemade cocktail sauce and damn if it doesn't look just like or taste just as good as a hot fudge sundae.

All in all, Swan's is worth the four person wait. Knowing what I know now, I would probably stretch to six or seven people, but not chance more than 20 minutes in line.
