They have the best clam chowder and crab louie salad!  Fresh seafood, servers are very friendly and helpful.  If you want GOOD seafood, come here!
author: Jacquelyn M.

description:
I would like people that can discern good food to save their time and money. Spaniards don't even get close to this place, this is not seafood.
 
The pros:
oSeafood is fresh
oThey have uncommon varieties of seafood (ie: sea urchin)

The cons:
oWaiting in line for 45 min (line starts at ~11:15 am until 1:45)
oThe oysters (Kumamoto) were watery and tasteless. (In front of me there was a huge bowl with ~100 pre-shucked oysters immersed in cold water, how could they taste like anything?)
oOver priced seafood (tiny cup of seafood cocktail: $17)
oMediocre smoked salmon (not as bad as the buffets in Vegas, but close)
oOverwhelming cocktail sauce (did the seafood taste like anything?, no not really)
oHorrible salad (bitter, thick iceberg lettuce). Which 'decent' restaurant uses iceberg lettuce?
oIf you go on a large group (3-4 people) you might not be able to sit together (we were split in 3 groups for a while)
oThere is so much people waiting in line you feel rushed (actually, you will be rushed)
author: Hello W.

description: Looks fresh, smells fresh, tastes fresh. If you are planning to visit, do come before 11am. this place fills up REALLY fast. they don't accept any cards so bring cash. Once you are seated they give you like a minute to decide what you want. I didn't like the feeling of being rushed but after that the service isn't bad. I ordered a bowl of clam chowder and shared a plate of the combo salad with my friend. everything tasted fresh. they had condiments out on the bar so you can get what you need. we both were obsessing over their louie dressing. This place is something that you have to try at least once especially if you live in sf. They even give you a dry sponge business card as a souvenir (don't forget to but it in water and watch it plump up).
author: Lynn P.

description: So worth the long wait.  This is classic San Francisco.  Sit at a simple, cold bar and eat.  Great oyster selection served with mignonette.  The shrimp and crab cocktails are fantastic.  They make an awesome cocktail sauce too.  I love that it's super healthy, just straightforward seafood, fresh catch and not all dressed up.
author: Danielle B.

description: This is the spot. All the boys work there, generations of em' and if you're really cool they'll hook you up with their own distilled tequila. Everytime I wake up and have a killer hangover, I amble down to Swan, suck down like 18 oysters, a live scallop with Wasabi and Soy, and ladies and gentleman, I am back in the ball game. Pure seratonin suckas! If you're feeling adventurous, try the Crab butter.
author: Sam S.

description: I didn't try their clam chowder until yesterday and wow , it's great !! It's not watery and canned like a lot of clam chowders out there . It's creamy but not too thick . I'm holding back on five stars because I feel like I can't really give a fair rating until I've tried their seafood .
author: Eileen L.

description: I showed up with my friend around 2pm expecting a long wait, but we were quickly seated.  We sat at the end of the bar and enjoyed their fresh Blue point oysters and clams on a half shell along with a couple of glasses of Chardonnay.  The service was excellent and everyone who worked their was real friendly.  You could tell this restaurant was all about the family feel.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Lauren F.

description:
3.5 stars

between the two of us, we ordered one crab salad, prawn cocktail, crab cocktail, 1 dozen oysters, a sampling of the fresh salmon and some bread.  let's just say we had to be rolled out of the store.  

my favorite dish was the crab.  it's nice not to have to shuck it yourself.  the prices are reasonable b/c they give you quite a lot for the price you pay.  

we would go again only if we didnt have to wait in line.   we got super lucky and got seated immediately.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Love this place but tonight I stopped by and bought 24 cherry stone clams for dinner.  I steamed them and 7 didn't open.  I'd like to think the sea food was fresher.
author: Cheta P.

description:
** I have returned to Swan now- many times over the last few months- and i encourage others to do the same (or visit for the first time) 
my only piece of advice is to be wary of the take out vs the seated lines- it can be confusing - and a bit intimidating 
jr

Having returned three times since my not-so-good experience i am happy to admit that time was the anomaly 

although hectic - they do have great food- 
joel
author: Joel R.

description: I will go months dreaming of the combination seafood salad with Louise dressing. When I finally get the guts to wait in line I am always fulfilled. The oysters are great, and I'm not even a huge oyster person. The service is really friendly. One of those few places that is just worth the hype.
author: Ish H.

description: OK This place has some charm.  It is a family-run business with some history.  Eating fresh seafood on a rainy day  while listening to the staff's stories is pretty entertaining.  If you intend on trying this place out, I recommend going during off-peak hours since there is limited seating and they do not take reservations.  Happy eating...I like wiiiiiiiiiiiine.
author: Jo W.

description: Yes, you'll find both tourists and locals in the often very long line to get a seat in the place, but I wouldn't call this place a tourist trap at all (if you're looking for that, head to Fisherman's Wharf!). Completely old school and no frills, it lives up to its reputation of incredibly fresh seafood and uber friendly employees. I find the best time to go is around 3 in the afternoon....after the lunch rush and before they close.
author: Suepattra M.

description: Unfortunately I haven't had the oysters yet but the other stuff was great. It's just  fun experience to sit at the counter and drink beers and chat with the staff.
author: L C.

description: Go there for the congenial atmosphere, the experience and the crab but skip the clam chowder.  I recently took a friend there after having a wonderful experience two years back.  At that time, the chowder and beer combo blew my socks off.  This time, neither of us could get past the consistency of the soup which kept separating as if it had been left on the burner for too long.  I'd still go back (interesting conversations with the other chilled and wind-swept patrons), but would definitely order the crab instead of the chowder.
author: Grave Y.

description: It's a diner for pete's sake! Ya gotta love oysters any which way. I haven't been back here in many years, but the fact that it still exists must be a tribute. I think we came here for lunch during work when I was still with the City and County. I still have a sponge with their name on it, so I can never forget I've been here. I'd go back in a pinch.
author: Janet P.

description: Fresh seafood, cold Anchor Steam, entertaining countermen. What's not to love? Our favorites are crab cocktail, crab Louie (seafood Louie's good, too, but why waste time on shrimp when there's crab to be had), Kumamoto oysters, and smoked salmon (yeah capers!) We come here on a Saturday and stop at Bob's Donuts down the street to pick up Sunday morning sweets.  Bring cash--they don't take cards--there's an ATM across the street if you need it. Great experience every time!
author: Jo M.

description: sigh. for one last attempt before moving out of the neighborhood, the wife and I went back one morning when the place was empty.  had oysters, clams, raw scallops and a beer (at 9 AM no less, don't tell mom).  It is a completely different experience when the place isn't crowded. Can't speak to my complaints about the crab salad since I avoided it this time.  Raw stuff is good and the guys are great to talk to when there aren't people standing directly behind you.  I'll only go here when I know it is going to be empty! (i.e. FIRST THING on a weekday or saturday)
author: Tristan S.

description: The freshest cracked crab and fantastic smoked fish. Call ahead and get your order to go to avoid the lines. Yeah, the counter seats suck, but the cracked crab makes it worth it. If you're looking for something fancy or surprising, this isn't the place But if you're looking for the best cracked crab in the city, you'll find it here.
author: Pamela B.

description:
GREAT PLACE. *Note to self: Don't check my cholesterol level for at least two months. The Staff is REALLY WELCOMING and very attentive to you. The reason for the four stars is ONLY for the seating. The stools really suck. (No, I'm not old) Kumamoto Oysters would by my favorite choice, but not for "Rookie" eaters. Many people rave about the Clam Chowder, but I'd say "The Old Clam house" is still my favorite for that. Here we go.

-Parking.........Good luck
-LUCKY ME. My Wife and I waited for only 5 Minutes.  Otherwise, you'd wait up to 45 minutes or so.
-The Crab and Shrimp salad is really served well and not shy when they lay down the meats by ANY stretch of the imagination.
-Cracked crab is awesome.
-The "Dozen Combo" of oysters is what helped me settle on my favorite.
-The prices are Market rate and worth it for the Great "Family" service they'll give you. CASH ONLY.
-It be a great place to buy and take out. Maybe at least 2 hours before you and that special someone start to burn calories together that night.
-I wouldn't try to show up with your whole "Crew" unless you guys want to stand around for a REAL long time.
-Dining area is pretty tight and it's pretty loud, but for a good reason. You'll kinda' feel like your eating at a Fisherman Pier or Docking area.
-STAFF IS SUPERB *A Reason for me to return. *B It's ran by Family, who are my fellow Native San Franciscans.  So by Native law, I have to support them from now on.
-Restroom....Well, it's an OLD building...So, keep an "open mind". It would also help if you're "Buzzin".
author: Jubei K.

description: Great seafood!  I loved the casual feel of this SF establishment.  It felt very old-San Francisco to me or at least what I imagine old-SF to be like.  The oysters were some of the best I've ever eaten, very fresh and delicious with a variety of condiments to add to them.  The bread is fresh and tangy, as sourdough goes.  The clam chowder was nice and my daughter had fun adding unlimited supplies of oyster crackers to it.  The smoked salmon was delicious and they offered us free samples as we ate which was generous.  I look forward to returning, with friends, to try their various seafood salads and Louis and to re-taste the oysters.
author: Meranda B.

description: We visit Swan Oyster on 4/25/09 during lunch hours. Waited for about 1/2 hr before I was seated. Basically good experience, I personally like the cherry stone claims over the oyster. In my opinion the oysters was little too cold. I would recommand this to anyone who likes oysters.
author: Don C.

description: Perfection! From the moment you walk in you feel like you are part of their family. A warm welcome, tons of knowledge of all the fish in house. I could sit at the counter for a year and never get bored, not only because of all the food, but because the atmosphere is just fun. Why it took me 2 years to get in here(other than lines) I have no idea. But eminent return is a given
author: Rich B.

description: I had to join Yelp just to counter the less-than-5 star reviews of Swan. Clueless. If you love oysters, this place has the freshest available ANYWHERE, only pulling them from the sea itself with your own hand compares. I've eaten oysters across the whole country. Swan has yet to be topped. It has no equal. The freshest seafood in SF. Yeah the line is bad, its uncomfortable, but who cares? you're communing with the gods here people. My ashes will be sprinkled here. Oh the brine.
author: Nicosh A.

description: First read about Swan on the flight in from Detroit.  Had planned on other oyster joints, but because of the great things said, decided to stop in first.  I have eaten oysters in S.Korea, England, Thailand (the Oriental brings em in from all over), and of course, San Francisco.  What we had here were marvelous.  We ate and ate more.  Clean, crisp oysters right from the bay and the Pacific.  Ate clam chowder unlike anything we'd had before.  I'd go to swan every day.  Good folk serving great food.  How can you argue with 100 yrs
author: Jim G.

description: Fresh seafood is the key here.  So you'll have to go early on the weekends to beat the well informed tourists.
author: Francisco S.

description: the oysters were SO fresh and so clean, i am still thinking/dreaming about them since i've had them on monday. no line around 2pm monday :). the bread was very good and same for the clam chowder. i cannot wait to go back. the staff was really friendly as well and i guess because there weren't too many people, they offered to take our handbags and put them next to the cash register so we wouldn't have to hold them while we eat. it's only bar seating and they didn't have hooks underneath. so.. suggestion, mebbe they should add hooks there.  but hot damn, their oysters are sooo good.
author: Sasa S.

description: We've been here a couple of times.  Our experience has been wonderful each time.  The servers are incredibly attentive and the seafood is always fresh and delicious.
author: Delilah B.

description: I have given this place 5 stars because it was the winner in my quest for the best clam chowder and shrimp cocktail in SF. The line is worth the wait. Everything is fresh and super tasty.
author: Spoke K.

description: Believe the hype, this place is amazing, the oysters are fresh as can be, the staff have encyclopedic knowledge of what your getting, and the vibe is fantastic. I went there for lunch and had a sampler of a dozen oysters, a couple of anchor steam beers, a clam chowder and some wonderful bread. I'm afraid they lose a star because the clam chowder seemed to have separated and wasn't up to the standard of everything else there.
author: Karl L.

description: Get there early (like about 10:30 a.m.) as this place is small and popular and absolutely delicious!  We've tried just about everything on the menu and everything is just so so wonderful and fresh.  The family who owns and staffs Swan is extremely friendly and personable and makes you feel like you're a guest and not a customer.  I wasn't surprised to see Anthony Bourdain visit Swan Oyster Depot in his "No Reservations" series.  He loved it too of course!  (The other place featured on the same show was the "French Laundry."  I'm not sure which is better!)
author: Nancy C.

description: This place is pricey. I do love the crab salad, huge portion of crab. Everything is really fresh. Not to crazy about the clam chowder, too liquidy for my taste.
author: Dave C.

description:
the guys behind the counter seem to be from New York.  oh yeah, they will talk to you.  

remember, a friendly face gets you "perks"! but you knew that.....

clam chowder, crab louis, oysters, anchor steam on tap.....is it love?
author: mick d.

description: The clam chowder was so-so, but I almost busted my wallet eating raw oysters. These are literally the best oysters I've ever had, and each oyster was PERFECTLY shucked.
author: Darren M.

description: I do enjoy the atmosphere here -- the service is great and the staff is always super friendly.  The clam chowder is really good, and I try to order the crab cocktail whenever I can.  Can get pretty pricey (seafood always is) and soon you realize that you've just ate a $50 lunch.  The $17 crab salad is your best bet if you're tight on cash and want something filling.
author: Lisa C.

description: 5 stars for being super-old school family establishment with quality seafood.  3 stars for being so expensive and crowded.  Good treat every once in awhile if you can sneak in on a weekday.
author: Cully W.

description: Combo salad + a dozen little necks + a few pints of beer = heaven on earth.
author: Patrick L.

description: A co-worker recommended this restaurant to me and I went up for a girls' road trip to check it out in my favorite city, San Francisco!  It wasn't that difficult to get to by public transit.  We had to wait outside awhile, because the only seats are along a long bar, and it was worth the wait!  If you're claustrophobic, you'll need to take your meds, because it's verrrry cozy in here!  I recommend ordering any of the salads, because they're big enough to share between 2 people.  My friend and I shared a salad with shrimp and crab, and also had a couple Stellas - excellent!
author: Jay J.

description: So much fun.  Best Swan Oyster Depot memory: taking my mom here on one of her visits and making her try an oyster (she's from the Midwest).  It wasn't her favorite but I give her props for even trying one!  I love taking people here because it's such a great San Francisco experience.
author: Alyssa W.

description: these boys have taken care of us for years ! way worth the the wait . super san francisco experience , lived here all my my life and this place never gets old.
author: Chris L.

description: We were on Polk and Pine trying for Breakfast at The Grubsteak, but they don't open until 5pm on Weekdays.  So we wen't around the corner to Swan since it was before noon on a weekday they were wide open for seating which is rare.  We had Clam Chowder and a half cracked crab, The crab was hours old maybe and tasted fabulous, they provide any condiment you could ever want from Loui dressing to lemons, to horseradish what have you.  The Boston Clam Chowder was tasty and very traditional, not thick like the west coast version of New England Clam Chowder.  The soup seemed to have less fresh clams than the Boston counterpart, but all the seafood in this place is completely fresh and all the people behind the counter are like a throwback to another era.  Just watching the knife skills of these guys as they thinly slice smoked salmon or fillet tiny sand dabs this place oozes seafood and freshness.  We had to buy some fresh Bay Shrimp on our way out to take home because you simply won't find fresher fish anywhere in the country than their front window.  It's not cheap, and it can be extremely crowded at times, it isn't fancy, it's very small, but if you want to be transported back in time to a true fresh fish counter with fast and friendly service this is the place for you.  I love the atmosphere in this place, but I wouldn't dare go during peak hours for the simple fact that it's a tiny hole in the wall and it is extremely popular.
author: Isaiah F.

description: This is a great place for seafood and especially oyster lovers.  I went a bit late so there were only 2 kinds of oysters to choose from.  But it was damn good!  I also recommend any of the seafood salads..and that's coming from someone who's allergic to veges!
author: Vanessa C.

description: Some of the freshest seafood I've ever had. Also probably the best chowder I've had outside of Massachusettes. The Combination salad is very simple which is the beauty of it, because it allows you to taste the freshness of the seafood (crab, bay shrimp, prawns). The oysters are obviously perfect in every way and even the sea urchin was tasty (even if it did taste like eating a small bottle of perfume). Everyone that works there is extremely friendly and they'll even describe each oyster for you in detail, which gives yet another reason to return again and again...
author: Nicolas H.

description: damn. I LOVE Swan Oyster Depot. I moved four blocks away recently, and am so thrilled that I can walk there on a Saturday morning. I even like waiting in line there. We get a couple of Anchor's and chat with everyone around us, letting the anticipation mount. and then. olympia oysters are heavenly. The clam chowder, even though it uses Campbells, is delightufl-the bread is delightful. The mounds of shellfish on the combo salad make my eyes roll back in my head. The best part, by far, is sitting at the bar in this old school SF joint, drinking beer, and shooting the shit with the people next to us and the family guys who run it. The whole experience rocks.
author: Chaka K.

description: Ghetto-good... go there for good food, not for the "ohm-bee-onse". Fresh stuff, friendly staff..... try to get there early so you can get a seat within an hour.
author: Eric K.

description: Waiting in line is part of the appeal. I love this place. It reminds me of living in New York. The waiting is the hardest part, but the food is sooo good. Outstanding crab, oysters, clams, chowder,  combined with ice cold Anchor Steams. Truly heaven on earth for the raw bar enthusiast.
author: Sean Q.

description: A little hole in the wall that leave a huge impression. Great place. Went there for the first time this past week after watching Rachel Ray visit this place and reading all the reviews here. The oysters were fantastic and the combination seafood salad was great. The shrimp in it were huge and the chunks of crab meat were great also. I regret not just using oil and vinegar as my dressing to really taste the seafood, but it was great. 30 minute way on a saturday afternoon, wasn't that bad. The only setback is if you drive there, having to feed the meter again wasn't that bad though. Definitely 5 star worthy.
author: Calvin L.

description: Woah. This place is awesome. Lunch today was amazing. My husband and I shared clam chowder, oysters, and the crab cocktail. I was a little annoyed with the line, I'm impatient by nature. However, once we were almost inside, a friendly guy behind the counter offered us a beer. Within a few minutes we were sitting down. The same guy cleaned off the counter for us and took our order. We asked him for suggestions and he couldn't have been nicer. The seafood was extremely high quality, some of the best I've ever had. Overall, a great experience.
author: Jenny R.

description: Only minus a star b/c the wait can be an hour.  Otherwise this is a SF must try for all seafood lovers.  It can't get fresher, or more authentically New England.  My staples are the clam chowdah, and the combo shrimp/crab Louis.  The oysters are great too.  Wash it all down with a Stella and you're golden.  If it is cold avoid sitting by the register/front door cuz you don't want the draft or all those hunger people in line staring at you.
author: Vinh N.

description: Freshest shell fish, best prices, eat in or take out.  Fantastic if you are alone or just a party of 2 since there is not much seating.  Staff makes you feel like family.  They will even pack you oysters on the half to go!  Tip - grab a plastic cup of draft beer from inside to take out and wait in line for a seat if it's really busy.  If you are ordering to take out, cut to the front of the line straight to the register.  This place is a piece of New England in SF.
author: Wendy N.

description: Amazing, fresh seafood and yummy chowder. I love this place. From the beverage service to the cash register, this place is so old school. I am not a fan of waiting in line, but if you go around 10:45 you can slip in and out.
author: James S.

description: This place came from a recommendation from a good friend. I have to say that I'm not so quick to give out a 5 Stars but this place takes the cake. The long line was well worth the wait. When we got seated we ordered the crab cocktail, and 1 dozen mixed oysters. They were Outstanding!!! We were just getting started so we ordered another dozen oysters, this time only Kumamoto oysters(These are very small oysters but pack a lot of flavor and sweetness). These  are my favorite but try them all. We received Fantastic service from the entire Team at Swan Oyster Depot!!!!!
author: Rod C.

description: if you're even thinking about it, just go. its a true SF gem. i now have a rough time finding any scallop ceviche edible after having theirs.
author: Esperanza A.

description: I eat lunch here every time I am in the city!  There is nothing fancy about this place, just good, FRESH seafood!
author: Jeff W.

description: Everything in here is extremely fresh and delicious - from the crabs, lobster, shrimp, and fish, everything looked awesome.  I had the combo seafood on a salad, which was filling and ridiculously good with the vinagrette that they make in front of you.  We waited in line for a while, but it was well worth it.  Casual, lunch counter seating - not expensive, but not cheap.  The staff is attentive and so nice.
author: Christina S.

description: One of the most difficult places to actually eat, parking, lines, lack of tables, cramped bar stools.  But this is a real old school San Francisco institution.  If you live near by, it makes for a good take out place.  At any rate, you need to try it at least once.  The food is great.
author: Brent H.

description:
the hours are inconvenient, you *always* have to spend an eternity waiting in a long, slow-moving line, and sitting with your knees jammed up against the counter, hunched over on a stool isn't the most comfortable way to enjoy a meal.  but goddamn, is the seafood ever fresh and delicious.  everything is simple, fresh, and totally unpretentious.  it's a bit on the expensive side, but portions are huge and the quality of the seafood is unassailable.  order a crab salad or cocktail, a bowl of chowder, half a dozen fresh oysters, and an anchor steam, and you'll leave happy.

edit: i just read my own review, and i'm knocking them down to four stars.  i mean, look at the way the review starts.  inconvenient hours, long lines, uncomfortable seating... five stars!  the food is still delicious and i'll be back many times, but i had to knock it down to four stars, just because i think five stars should only be given for a perfect experience.
author: Jeff W.

description: I spotted this place in the neighborhood of my hotel, and couldn't miss the long line of people outside. This is a place for seafood purists, the kind of people who think a hole in the ground and a bunch of seaweed is the best way to cook a Maine lobster. Don't bring a big group; don't dress up; don't make your whiny kid wait in the long line in front of me.  But do go.
author: Lynne D.

description: Best oysters in the city, with the best clam chowder on the West Coast.  Yum!!!!  There were days when I used to visit Swan's once a week.  Now, I'm relegated to visiting once or twice a year.  But I am always greeted with friendly smiles, and a glass of wine while I wait for a stool.  This is far from a fancy spot, but the seafood is simply superb.  Besides the oysters and the chowder, I love the soft-shell crab, when in season, the crab salad, the smoked trout, and the wine.  Due to the wine, my bill is never a small one.  But for the price, I don't think you can find better seafood anywhere.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Fresh, right out of the shell seafood, without having to do any of the work - who wouldn't love that?!!!  Eating at little barstools is not so bad - they have little hooks to hang up for jackets, purses, etc.  And waiting in line isn't that horrible since they offer you drinks while you're waiting.  And the service is friendly, easygoing, with a twinge of Italian accent.  If you're nice, and you appear to be a new customer, they'll give you a free souvenir "sponge."  Have never tried their lobster, but I suspect that if/when I do, I'll bump this up to 5 stars.  The seafood is just that good.
author: Jeanne J.

description: I had been dying to try this place for ages....but since they are only open during the day, I am always at work...so on Dec 26 we finally went. Soooo good, fresh yummy seafood. Great service and great place all around. I can hardly wait until my next day off.
author: Adrienne G.

description: I love this place.  They have the best oysters and clams and it's so fresh.  The service is also excellent.  Be prepared to wait in line though.
author: Mary L.

description: Oh man, what a fantastic diner style oyster and crab joint to hook up with an Anchor Steam and excellent crab salad. Always fresh, quality, delicious seafood.
author: Kurt B.

description: If you like seafood and cramped spaces, this is the place to go.  It's always packed and always good.  It isn't cheap, though.  If you get only an entree and nothing else, you might get out for around $20 per person, but $30 - $40 is much more likely.
author: Kevin M.

description: Great experience.  It's a bit more expensive.  But good food. It's cool that we get to talk to the people.  Clam chowder was tasty.  But I wish it had more clams in it.  The broth is great.  I ordered oysters (most fresh oysters I've ever had) and combination seafood salad (I am still thinking about that.)  Minus one star because it's small.  But I absolutely love that place.
author: Rick H.

description: I have never had chowder before going to Swan's, so I am probably a bit biased. It is amazing, delicious chowder. My boyfriend, who adores chowder, said that this was the best he had ever had. We went on a Tuesday at 11AM and there was no crowd. Usually, the place is packed.
author: Desiree V.

description: Always a line out to the streets at Swan's. I recommend the seafood salad, clam chowder, and fresh oysters. Only thing i would change is the decor. I think they need to remodel the entire inside of the restaurant, everything looks old and dirty.
author: HUNG L.

description: Very touristy but I can't blame them for that. Rachael Rey might've made it harder to eat there but they deserve it..... excellent.
author: Eugene G.

description: Great oysters. Good service.  Tasty beer- what more do you need?  The place is cramped but the amazingly fresh seafood is well worth the slight discomfort.  Try the combination cocktail salad which has a little of everything- crab, shrimp, clams, prawns.  And be sure to let the guys chose your oyster selection.  The will lead you in the right direction.  Just remember they are cash only and close early- and on Sundays too.
author: Nina W.

description: A friend brought me to Swan for an early bday present.  I'm the luckiest girl in the world.  I've heard about this joint for years, and love all things oyster/seafood related, so I was really excited to go.  The wait was lame because I am impatient, but they let us drink while we waited in line, in the middle of the day, so I was ok with the wait, even in the rain.  Loved the chowdah and oysters.  I love the guys behind the counter too.  If I had to work a crowd like that all day, I would be pissy and mean, and would probably sabotage the bill or whatever, but they were so nice.  I have developed a small crush on all of them.
author: Shannon H.

description:
One word, FRESH.  More importantly, they have clams on half shelf.  So far I only found 2 places serving raw clams in San Francisco.  If anyone knows other places, please do send me a message so I can go try them out.

Every time I go there (even if I go alone), a dozen clams is a must, and then maybe a half to one dozen of oysters depending on who I'm going with.  $8 for half dozen and you can mix and match however you want, it's a total steal.

Their other seafood items are all very good, and their pink sauce adds a nice touch to the seafood.  I like that sauce way better than the cocktail sauce.

Keep in mind that even though they close at 5:30pm, try to go before 5pm because they may run out on the popular items.  That happened to me once.  I was told that I could have called ahead to reserve some clams next time though.
author: E H.

description: This is one of the best places to eat in San Francisco.  Not only are the owner's nice and helpful, the food is extremely fresh and delicious!   The crab louie salad, clam chowder, and fresh oysters are a must if you eat here.  There are a couple of drawbacks, they only take cash, sometimes long lines, and a stool for a seat.  I guess that makes it all the more unique, elbow to elbow with the person next to you chowing down on fresh seafood.  You must try!
author: Frank N.

description:
I really wanted to love this place because I love anything seafood and I thought the counter seating was sooooo cool.  They prepped the food right in front of us.  We sat inches from the smoked salmon.  It was too cute!  I didn't dig the bowl of oyster crackers though.  Reminded me of a bar where a lot of hands must've dug into.  

I ordered the combo salad and my husband had the clam chowder.  They had *just* ran out of crab and it was only 12:20pm on a Monday afternoon.  Our server offered me smoked salmon and whitefish instead.  The amount of those were a bit skimpy.  The salmon was good but not special.  The whitefish was different and tasty but also nothing special.  The Louie dressing was also average.

The chowder was tasty but I do prefer it thicker.  My husband liked it a lot though.  He thought it tasted really yummy with the bread.  If you let it sit a bit, you can watch the cream separate which is a little creepy *shiver*.

Overall, I really wanted to like it.  I will try it again but since I'm not a raw oyster person, I don't know how much better it will be for me.  It's a neat place though!!
author: Angie C.

description: Yes, the seafood was fresh and tasty. Yes, the novelty of sitting in a traditional setting was enjoyable for a "been there, done that" checklist. But seriously, why would anyone pay this much money to wait for 45 minutes for food that is not even gourmet? If you're going to charge this much for food, the seating should be comfortable (you shouldn't have to balance your ass on a stool with your belongings on your lap), the ambiance should be warm and cozy (I love the whole Manhattan-deli feel, but I don't want to pay $50 for it), there should be a chef concocting unusual sauces and side dishes (not a cocktail sauce that's 95% ketchup and a salad of iceberg lettuce) and you should be able to make a reservation. I guess I just don't love seafood enough to understand why this place is so popular.
author: Leah F.

description:
if you've prepared yourself already for the long line even on weekdays, then you'll have an amazing lunch. well, if you like seafood, that is. if you don't like seafood, why are you here?? amazing clam chowder - just slightly creamy with lots of clams, so it doesn't look like it came out of a chunky soup can. seafood salads are served with loads of prawns and crab meat. complement your lunch with raw oysters and clams, with tiny dabs of their horseradish paste - don't say i didn't warn you! the staff is friendly, chatty, and fun to talk with and listen to. however, remember that you're still eating top-quality seafood even though the atmosphere is completely casual, so it'll be on the expensive side. 

fyi, if you're having a party or a very bad day, you can order a whole bushel of oysters (about 120 count) for about $90-$100 (depending on the variety you pick and current market price) to shuck in the privacy of your own home.
author: Angi C.

description: I haven't been there to eat yet because of the long wait, but I have called in advance, placed an order to go and ate at work. No wait, no hassle. SOOO GOOD! I had a combination salad; its incredibly fresh and tasty. There is so much seafood on the plate yet I managed to eat every bite because it was that good!
author: Zuhra S.

description: Just gotta add my two cents to all the awesomeness of this place! I don't think there are enough stars for Swan's. We went here like 3 years ago or more, and still dreamily talk about how delicious and fun it was. THere are only like 10 seats or bar stools and there is always a line out the door so get there early. THey make their vinegar for the mignonette there, and their chowder is the best in the city. A must see and stop in San Fran!!
author: Joe M.

description: Swan Depot has been around since 1912.  The lines are almost always long since there are about 20 counter seats, but believe me, it is seriously worth the wait! This family owned seafood joint has wonderful service and the casual feel makes you feel like you are right at home.  They offer a great raw oyster selection, selection of raw clams, even fresh uni right out of its shell!  the combination seafood salad, clam chowder and the smoked salmon are really good too. If you are going to wait in line for that long, you might as well try everything!
author: Eva L.

description: I went so I could say I went. The seafood was very fresh and delicious but loses stars for being too expensive. There's comparable seafood around the city with half the wait at half the price.
author: Andy L.

description: The salads are amazing! I love seafood but man they make a good meal.  They have a variety of oysters which makes the meal even better. If you beat the lines then you are in for a treat.
author: Nancy W.

description: great place, great food, good quality, good service. Only reason for 4 star is because they donot follow the required health dept. code of direct contact of food with bare unsanitized hands.I have been observing this for ages.
author: Jon B.

description: A great place to go if you would like to try some great seafood. I would recommend the clam chowder, crab cocktail, and any type of oysters they have available. A lot of people usually settle for a salad which I haven't tried yet. If you go early you won't have to wait in line to sit down on the oyster bar. The oyster come with a variety of sauces and the bread they provide is also delicious! I highly recommend this place. Can't wait to get the clam chowder again....
author: Dave Y.

description: The wait is well worth it!  I have been here twice, and the longest I waited was about 20 minutes.  All of the servers are great, very friendly and helpful with any questions you might have.  The oysters and chowder are awesome.  But I really love the smoked salmon; it almost melts in your mouth.  Also, if you like sashimi, ask for it here; really fresh and tasty.  The prices are kinda high and it is cash only, but it is well worth it.
author: Keith M.

description: ssh please stop telling people about Swan's, let it be our little secret, nuff said
author: Roxanne M.

description: Great selection of fresh oysters (and other seafood) and the cocktail sauce and horse radish are perfect.
author: Ryan C.

description: Absolutely the worst place for customer service I have ever experienced in San Francisco. I ordered a to-go clam chowder, which turned out to be curdled milk with a half inch skim of oil on the top and minute pieces of potato and clam. I took one small sip and realized it was as disgusting as it looked, the absolute worst chowder I have ever seen, so clearly poorly made and tasteless it was surprising coming from a seafood place. I went to return it for my money back and was told by some guy named Tom that he couldn't refund my money because "California law doesn't allow it." When I countered that I hadn't eaten it all and didn't want a freebee, he proceeded to argue that I was wrong about the quality and that customers aren't right. He was aggressive and rude and I am still stunned he would be so greedy and ignorant of customer service. I wouldn't be surprised with this attitude that he loses customers left and right--and Oyster Depot should!
author: Chris C.

description: oysters oysters oysters. I love oysters! Swans has such a variety it's hard to choose what to eat! Swans has so much more to offer Aside from their oyster bar... Fresh clams, half cracked crabs, lobsters, shrimp, calamari, smoked salmon... I'm drooling just thinking about it! I also love the fact that it has stayed true to itself and didn't expand or become a chain. I do wish it would be open later. It's safe to say swans is a true San Francisco gem.
author: Rebecca Q.

description:
Get your seafood fix on here. It's a dive, the service if friendly and efficient and the seafood is damn fresh.

We came on a rainy monday and waited in line. After 15 minutes we got a coveted seat at the counter and were promtly greeted. The men behind the counter were truely gems. They ALL were super friendly and sincere.

Water, bread & butter, a stella, and an anchor steam. Let's get this party started!

Next we ordered a cup of their New England Clam Chowder. The soup itself was broken (the fat/cream seperates from the broth), but the flavors were still right on. Plump and juicy pieces of little neck and cherry stone clams, cubed firm potaoes and just the right amount of pepper.

Our second course was a mixed dozen of oysters. Washington miyagi, California miyagi, olympia from washington & the East Coast Blue Points. All Spectacular! My favs were the Olympia from Washington State because of the creamy texture and the briney salty finish.

Next we had the Combination salad. Lump Dungeness crabmeat, prawns & shimp on top of shredded iceberg lettuce smothered in louie dressing. Yum Yum. The shellfish were perfectly poached and were so delicate once in your mouth they might as well have discinigrated. The dressing rich and creamy, with a slight acidity to balance the sweetness of the fish. 

I think I died and went to heaven. We left full bellied and cheek to cheek with a smile!

I can't wait to go back!
author: t f.

description: A San Francisco Institution.  If you love oysters, this is your spot.  Be prepared to wait in line.  It's worth it.
author: Chris D.

description: Fantastic place to eat oysters in the city.
author: Scott F.

description: Great stuff. Clean, and fresh oysters & clams, good ol' hardy boys service. cant complain about here. good location , nice vibes, real old school. my pal had the clam chowder, me and another japanese fella had some oysters. root ! i like the help too- real clean guys. good stuff. no horsing around. small place and reasonable prices no less.
author: A N.

description: This place is tiny... but totally worth it to stand in line for an hour... my favorite thing here was the shrimp louie... err i think that's what it was called... the shrimp were the little baby bay shrimps but so good and fresh! The lox, very fresh and delicious and oh so fatty. Oysters were great too. I'm definitely a seafood person so I've been here twice... however since I don't live in the city and I don't think they're open at night or on weekends I dont get a chance to go very often. The people are really friendly and know their stuff. I think they go out and catch their own seafood every morning or something. Must try the oysters, chowder, smoked salmon
author: K T.

description: This is a great neighborhood place, and See's Candy is next door.
author: Zaula D.

description: I have been frequenting Swan's since before I could see over the counter and they have never disappointed me. If you are looking for a unpretentious, neighborhood oyster bar with a fantastic crew and some of the freshest seafood you will ever taste, Swan's is your place.  All of their oysters are amazing and the Combo seafood salad with their delicious Louis dressing is a must. If I didn't feel sorry for the long line of hungry customers outside I would spend entire days at the counter in Swan's.  Always worth the wait but if you really can't stand waiting get some take out (although you'll miss out on fantastic conversations with some of the most legit San Franciscans you will ever meet).  Swan's is a San Francisco landmark and it better stay that way forever.
author: Erin C.

description: Swan Oyster Depot makes me happy.  They have fresh, delicious oysters that are at least a grade above any other.  You can watch the enthusiastic and attentive staff shuck the oysters off to the side of the bar while you enjoy a cup of New England and some of San Francisco's best sourdough.  Skip the cocktail sauce and try your half shells with the mignonette and a touch of horseradish.  Pair with the white wine of your choice, and you too can experience at least seven flavors all at the same time.  The experience is euphoric.
author: Ty C.

description:
eating here makes any day just plain better.  good food.  great service.
the long lines are a drag when you are drooly-hungry, but you know this keeps the seafood fresh.

ten stars to swans.
author: annabanana m.

description: Don't know how I can even complain about this SF staple that I had been meaning to go for longer than I would like to admit. Not for everyone...the line out the door will intimidate some, but who cares. Talking with the people waiting in line is half the fun. Plain and simple, straightforward great fresh rawbar at reasonable prices. Smoked Salmon was killer (and I'm not even a big salmon fan), oysters were fresh and the crab was....well you know when it's crab season, it's great! For two people, we downed some Anchors, crab, dozen mixed oysters, crab salad, and some chowder and the bill came out to $60. Not bad for the biggest grin I've had on my face in awhile....you quite simply have to go if you like no frills great Crab and Oysters.
author: mike b.

description: Just went in for the first time yesterday for a pick up order.  Shrimp salad.   Delicious.  A bit pricey though.  I can't wait to come back and sit at the counter for a full meal.  Seems like a great atmosphere.
author: Jayson J.

description: Best oysters ever.  No other restaurant has better oysters than Swan. Clam Chowder and smoked salmon are amazing too!  Go on a weekday morning and there won't be as long of a line.
author: C P.

description: perfect san francisco lunch. i love their clam chowder - is the thinner kind, not the super-gloppy kind, which i dont like as much. perfect size lunch for two IMHO: 2 bowls of chowder plus one combo salad to split, with louis, of course. and we didnt even have to wait! if i worked closer, i'd eat here once a week. sigh.
author: Erica W.

description: Actually we didn't expect this place was great. People were nice. Good atmosphere. Boston clam chowder was tastey even it wasn't thick and rich soup. Just one thing it wasn't good is salad. It was small and few shrimp, then $ 17.85!!
author: Daiki M.

description: After a million reviews, I'll just say this- they now carry Yebisu beer from Japan, which goes perfectly with their seafood.  Anchor and Sierra are both good, but it seems as though their intense flavors  were designed to be drank on its own, and little thought was given to food matching.  Yebisu, on the other hand, has had many no holds barred matches with seafood back in the homegrounds of Japan, so it blends in with Swan's oysters and crab and salmon like the sweetest music on earth.
author: Passdatanqueray M.

description: I Called Swan to make sure their hours for July 4th weekend since my friends are going to be in town. Unfortunately, they are not open on 7/4/08 til 7/14/08 due to family vacation. They said they did that every year. How nice?!
author: E L.

description: Waited 45 minutes for seats on a Wednesday around 1PM. But definitely worth the wait. Two of my girlfriends and I ordered a dozen oysters, clam chowder, and a mixed seafood salad. Oysters were so meaty and fresh. Taste like the ocean...in a good way. Clam chowder had lots of clams in it and very creamy. It was a pretty big bowl as it fed 3 of us. Seafood salad was huge. Tons of shrimp and crab meat on the salad. They gave us complimentary bread and butter. Bread was warm and soft. And the service...wonderful. Super friendly and warm. With your bill they give you a Swan Oyster Depot sponge as a memento. Looking forward to eating here again.
author: Mel C.

description: Obviously this place doesn't need my seal of approval.  Waited in line for an hour at 11 AM on a sunny Friday afternoon.  Fresh seafood glistening in the window and an authentic atmosphere that has not changed since 1918.  Love this kind of place!!!!  A SF treasure.  It's about the quality of the seafood here and the chowder and crab salad were outstanding.  A real fun experience too if you don't mind waiting and sitting at a very, very casual marble counter on ancient stools.  A trip to the bathroom is an experience in itself past a small intent woman covered in plastic chopping up crab, dishwasher, etc.  Our waiter was a character--charming and funny.  I will return.
author: J B.

description: Came here because my friend visiting SF wanted to try this place. We went there at around 3 on Monday and waited 40 minutes to be seated. Love their wide selection of oysters, and their seafood are super fresh. But their clam chowder are a little too watery for my liking. I think this place is not bad but its a little bit too touristy and pricey for me.
author: Lynn S.

description:
This place...I can't say enough. Don't come here expecting a fancy meal-- just sidle up to the deli-style bar and help yourself to the absolute freshest seafood in the city. Hands down.  Get a cold beer to wash down your lunch, and you're good to go. Their salmon is so good, I don't order it from anywhere else.

p.s. -- get there on the early side for lunch- the line will start forming out the door quite quickly.
author: j a.

description: delicious! loved how the clam chowder was thinner although would love it more if they put some big clams in it like at hog island or something. the oysters were divine, but was not a huge fan of the mignon sauce here or the cocktail sauce (too sweet). The horseradish rocks though.
author: Nicole H.

description:
if i could give swan 3.5 stars, i would. but i'm feeling nice today so i'll round up.

there were four in our party. we got to the joint at about 3pm on a monday, so we only waited for about 5mins. we each got a bowl of clam chowder, which was not bad, but wasn't good either. it was watery as other reviews will mention, but it was chock-full of clams and not greasy at all. we were also given two loaves of bread without question - but as we got our tab together we learned we were charged for it.

we ordered the oysters on a half-shell, seafood cocktail, shrimp cocktail, salmon platter and the calamari salad. the oysters were terrific, the calamari salad good but everything else was drowned in cocktail sauce.

service was friendly albeit slow. the counter seats about 15 folks and if you come in with a purse or jacket you really don't have a place to set your things.
author: Leesee A.

description:
so, explain to me, what and why the hype? i can see why hogs is something to go crazy about ... i mean, shoot, at LEAST HOGS is super yummy and superliciously fresh. you would think that having to be in sf, every seafood you come across is super fresh, but not necessarily...whether it be a monday or a saturday, or whether it be a holiday where tourists take up 3/4 of their long ass line or what not, this place is just an ordinary place to be, and not as GREAT as you might think...

first of all, i wasn't thrilled how they TRICKED me in getting bread and butter. i say this because, they just give it to you. you would think, if it's handed to you, it's just on the house, and it's just simply complimentary bread and butter. key word: complimentary... WRONG!

little do you know, you skim the receipt and see that you are charged $0.75 extra... i just DONT APPRECIATE THE FACT HOW I WAS CHEATED!

FYI: it's not the $, it's the principle.

their clam chowder was beyond watery, no flavor whatsoever. tabasco didn't even help. clam chowda? off to boudin i go. i like my new england chowda all thick and creamy.. YUM. (cup: $2.50, bowl $4.75)

we couldn't decide what type of oysters to get, but ended up getting a combination of miyagis, kumamotos, olympias and blue points... my favorite was the blue point which was super huge -- and because it was super huge, and juicy and fresh, and if i DO plan on coming back, this is SO what i'm going to get next time around, that is, if i plan on coming back. their cherry stone clams for $6 were just okay, i've tried better... 

hmmm... what to do, or what to say.

*shrugs*

you think this place rocks? hm, makes me wonder if you really know how to appreciate and eat seafood..
author: Jennifer S.

description: It's not like my review will be the least bit objective -- my father was taking me into Swan when I was a tiny little girl. I have vague memories of one of the big dudes behind the counter giving me a prawn to gnaw on. Anyway, I can't imagine a reason you'd ever go anywhere else for cracked crab. Oh my God, cracked crab from Swan. Yes.
author: Ell B.

description: I want to like this place because the prawn, crab, shrimp salads rock, the clam chowder is really yummy and the oysters are the bomb.  BUT, this last time my leg and foot fell asleep on the crummy little metal stool and we actually had to sit sideways with one arm toward the side of the restaurant because they cram too many darn stools in at the counter.  The guys behind the counter are friendly and adorable and the bread is incredible.  But, it's going to be purely takeout from now because eating there is torture.  If the seating was more comfortable, I'd give them a 4+.
author: scruz y.

description: The atmosphere at this place is unbelievable. The tiny shop, good service, the atmosphere, and most importantly the oysters, indescribable.  My friends took me here my first week in the city when I moved here a few years ago knowing that i would miss the east coast seafood. My grandparents are from Boston and shellfish is in my blood. I come back every chance I get and I like to watch them shuck at the speed of light.
author: J P.

description: Had to wait in a line of a dozen of  people. But we got in within 20 to 30 minutes. The food is fresh and yummy. However, I didn't enjoy all the dishes. For instance, the clam chowder was too rich. But I liked the seafood cocktail, made up of all sorts of fresh seafood, such as clam, shrimp, crab, etc. The staff were all very friendly, which made the visit even more enjoyable.
author: SF B.

description: great place to eat if you like fresh seafood.  The usually is a line that builds out the door but it is well worth the wait.   The service is very friendly and i highly recommend this place to any of my friends.
author: Art N.

description:
good food but i dunno if i'd return..... hurts the wallet.

this tiny hole-in-the-wall consists of a narrow room with one very long bar.  you sit at the bar and wait for someone to serve you.  it smells like the ocean and has a fish market feel to it.  unique.  on the counter are crackers for your chowder and lemons for your oysters.  i went with two friends and we each had the clam chowder and the combo oyster platter, and then split the seafood salad.  it came to a total of about $100, including tip.

the breakdown:

bread & butter:  as i was starving by the time i got here.... i was stuffing myself with bread.  it was cold and not great.... but i ate it anyways.  i think the first one was free and they charge for subsequent orders  =\

clam chowder:  very very FLAVORFUL! however, it's basically a broth.  but it was good, clammy broth.  it was bursting with clam taste and had quite a few clams in it.  i've never had such tasty clam chowder before!  just don't expect it to fill you up at all...

combo oyster platter:  great way to try them all!  the oysters were very very good!  the server weirdly enough forgot to give me Blue Points.  i pointed it out and they gave them to me... i got 15 oysters for the price of 12!  that made me happy.  but i think the dude giving me the extra was irritated....

seafood salad:  excellent!  and they were not stingy with the seafood!!!!  the plate had a little lettuce and was just piled with prawn, shrimp, and crab!!!!  the shrimp were very very sweet!  i loved them!  the crab was mmmm crabby!  very good!  but the prawns were very chewy, not a fan of those...

service:  i must say this area could use improvement.  how long does it take to ladle some clam chowder from the big pot they have in the back into a bowl?  and to slap some raw oysters onto a plate?  or to throw some shrimp and lettuce together?  considering the time it took for them to serve us, i can safely assume they were actually raising the shellfish in the back for each individual order.....

4.5 stars for the food, minus 1 for the service, and minus .5 for the price...... but take caution, i'm extraordinarily cheap.  i mean, there are so many other places that have oyster happy hours... i'd rather go to those places if i'm craving oysters.
author: Christina L.

description: One of my favorites.  Hands down, the FRESHEST and BEST seafood salad I've ever had.  Its pricey, but the salad is giant.  The line isn't all that bad once you get used to it and is worth the wait.  Friendly guys behind the counter as well!   Its small with little room, but its very San Francisco and takes you back to a more simpler time (or so I'm told).
author: Andrew S.

description:
For years my wife and I have seen the lines on Polk Street and have always said that we'd like to check the Swan Oyster Bar out.  Last week we did. Don't be too put off by the line because if you can spare 25 minutes on a weekend, you'll get to experiance what the hoopla is all about. There are perhaps 20 or so chairs at a counter - that's it.  My wife and I had a dozen oysters and I had the Crab Louie and she had the Shrimp Louie. No problem...we also feasted on the sour dough bread and Anchor Steam Beer. The counter folks were friendly and the clam chowder was also superb. We were loving it.

There was a problem though. Most folks miss it as nobody has mentioned it in any of the rave reviews. The guys behind the counter grab the fish, shrimp, scallops, crab meat..out of the display in the front window and either wrap it up for to go orders or to serrve it to the hungry people that line the counter - with their bare hands.  These same hands also take the money.  Sit there some time and you'll see.  They never use gloves and didn't wash between each serving.  They handle the fish and  then they handle the cash, then they serve the fish. This might have not been a problem when the Italian immigrant family that opened Swan and still operate it - first started many years ago, but today this is simply unacceptable.  On the way out my wife had to wait to use the one restroom that they had there.  After 5 minutes one of the counter people came out and was obviosly in there smoking.  If the owners of Swan are reading this you know what I'm talking about.  You're lucky we didn't call the Health Dept!  

Skip this place.
author: Nick C.

description: You know when a business has been around for nearly a century, it must be good.  I had the clam chowder and sampled all of the oysers.  Everything was perfect including the bread that they served with it and the perfectly cold beer that washed it all down.  I am totally in love with Swan Oyster Depot!
author: C M.

description: I don't know if there's such a term called "sheep effect"? You know when one reviewer sees everyone else giving a place a 5 star review you tend to give the same high score review in order to align with the other reviewers? I was probably expecting too much after I've seen all the great reviews of this place I said to myself I have to try this place during my 4 days vacation in San Francisco. Well now that I've tried it I can tell you don't believe everything you read in those 5 star reviews and instead look at the 3 stars and below reviews. First of all parking is non existing as with every other places in San Francisco. You'll have to find street parking around and expect to feed a lot of quarters to the meter as the line waiting to get in is LONG. Don't believe some of reviewers that say the line moves quick during lunch! I spent like 40 stupid minutes waiting to sit 3 of us. Now let's talk about the food....people seem to suggest the combination salad, oysters, and chowder so that's what I ordered. The salad is expensive for what you get and the chowder like many reviewers say they're watery. The half dozen oysters I ordered was not even worth it. The guy served me 3 different kinds of oysters (2 each) and supposedly they were from different parts so some are much smaller than the normal rare oysters you get at other places. So instead of getting 6 large oysters I got 2 large oysters and the rest were all small and tiny. I don't know how oysters are valued but I bet the small oysters cost a lot less compared to the big ones. At the end my total came to about $37 and other than the old San Francisco atmosphere of the store the food was not special and they were actually expensive for what you get. I think this place is a tourist trap and once is enough for me.
author: Wayne T.

description: Me being a big oyster fan went to this place with my hubby.Had to wait in line for 20 min which I dont mind.I gulped down 24 oysters by myself.The clam chowder was a little expensive for the quality.The staff are attentive.
author: Ann J.

description: excellent clam chowder (not rich, not very creamy). fresh, very fresh seafood. tried the smoked salmon and it melted onto my tongue. reasonable prices too. it gets crowded during the lunch hour rush, so go early or a bit late, or expect to wait in line. limited bar seating. great on a sunny day for two:) the service is fine...not sure how much you should expect when it's all pretty straightforward. friendly folks work there, if you ask me, and they get the job done no frills.
author: Jean H.

description: this is one of my favorite spots in the city.  i used to be a saturday morning regular but hadn't been there in several months.  went back on saturday and was amazed.  the combination of clam chowder, a shrimp cocktail, oysters, and a small anchor steam at 11am is unbeatable.  the familiar faces are always great to see.  highly recommended.  only complete botards would give this place 1 star.
author: schnarf-a-larf a.

description: Great service.  Awesome selection of oysters.  Only bummer is the wait, which can be long, but it's worth it.
author: Greg L.

description: Kind of a hole in the wall but the staff is skillful on opening the oyster shell and knowledgeble about oysters.  If you don't want to drive to Point Reyes but you have a craving for fresh and for all kinds of oysters, this is the place to go in the city.  Just be prepared to wait in line even on a weekday because seats are VERY limited.
author: Gabrielle L.

description: After driving by Swan's many times, I finally had the opportunity to visit! The oysters were great, clam chowder is amazing also. I docked a star because of the service that was provided to me and my friend the second time I visited Swans.. The first time was great! But i don't know what happened the second time around. Maybe it was just me.. I'm a little bothered that my friend and I requested for another dozen of oysters, where the gentlemen did not acknowledge our request- so we figured that he didn't hear us. Another gentlemen, kindly asked us if we would like anything else.. which duh- we then ordered our oysters! He acknowledged our request, and was sooo nicee, BUT the other older gentlemen brought the oysters out WITH the other gentlemen. I know there was a mix up. Hey! We didn't mind ordering another two dozen.. that was NOT the problem at all.. but what shook me up.. was the fact that the older gentlemen mumbled f**king "something" and thought I didn't hear.. that really bothers me.. especially because we were cool with having the two dozen oysters. Anyhow, everyone else is great.. however I just won't order with that older gentlemen anymore -=X
author: Monica C.

description:
when i ate here there was a wait, but when i stepped inside i understood why.  

staff knows their oysters and explained the diff b/t the types.  i didn't think i cld tell the difference - but i did.  

i'd come back here again if i have time and don't mind the wait.
author: rien d.

description: I was there last weekend to find that I was disappointed, I don't know where to start.. I found myself asking for two ice waters and one Pepsi to find the waiter bringing back the pitchers filled with ice, he proceeded to pour water into the glasses and I requested can you I please have some ice, he then proceeded to grab ice out of the pitcher with his bare hands, I just thought that was unbelievable.  I then requested for fresh glasses he then poured water into the pitcher he dug his hands in.  I wanted to walk out then.  I requested he start all over with new glasses and new pitchers. I have to say he wasn't at all happy.  That doesn't top it off, I requested mayo for my crab and our waiter proceeded to provide mayo, as thenwaitor puts it back on the self he co-worker asked that he leave it out..  Here is the best part his co-worker again dug into the mayo jar eith crab in his hands and dug into the mayo jar.  At this point I was more then just through I push my combination salad back mind you it had crab, salad shrimp and coloso shrimp it was amazing, now I only know this because I took one bite. I'm quite surprised to find they do a lot of things with there bare hands. I will never go back nor would I ever suggest this place.  It wasn't a good experience at all.
author: Jennel F.

description: so i think i knew what good/fresh is until i heard about this place thru a friend. i came here a few times and with little luck, it was closed by the time i got here. anyhow, me and my gf finally was able to make it here. this place got the freshest seafood i have ever tasted any where. if u r a food addict, this is the place to try. o yes, if u r not a local, bring some quarters for the meter. hope that help
author: Vi H.

description: oysters? yes please, but only from a place like this! the lunchtime queue may make you reconsider. This is one of those simple & uncomplicated sit at the bar eat, enjoy and take off type off places.
author: Helen J.

description: This is the best place in S.F. for fresh seafood. You sit at the counter and order things like frsh crab, shrimp, clams and oysters. It is very casual and you sit at the few seats at the bar. But it doesn't get any more real or fresh than this. I also love to take out and/or order ahead for bulk crabs, shrimp, etc. for dinner parties and events. Get the sourdough bread, clam chowder and an Anchor Steam and you'll feel like a local.
author: Timothy S.

description: freshest seafood, served by brothers... the sourdough bread is dark and amazing!
author: Philip G.

description: There's a reason this place is so well-known and always has a line.  Yes, it does attract tourists, but it's not like being in the Wharf.  I've always loved everything I've gotten there, and the seafood is always very fresh.  The Prawn Cocktail and Combination Salad with Louie Sauce are both fantastic.  I wish it was open in the evenings.
author: Luke P.

description: I've been here a couple times, exclusively for the blue point oysters and the chowder. They have a regular customers base here that they server  for years and they all call each other by first name bases. it's one of those places where if your a first timer you will find it pleasant to listen to conversations with the servers and the customers that you just might find yourself adding your two cents in their conversations. Friendly staff as well, price is just ok but it's the best deal I've seen for oysters and believe me I love my raw oysters! On the times that i've come it seems the weekdays are much slower and coming on odd times like 2pm-4pm is a better time no rushing and no lines. I raved about it by calling my dad and letting him know, I get the oyster tongue from him..he says to me "oh yeah...i've been going there many years ago, yeah they have the best tasting oysters in the bay area"..I agree as well, they are close to comparison with the juicy Hog Island ones as well hmmmm!
author: Ateh M.

description: Stopped by after work for some clam chowder and a beer. Have to say that it was pretty tasty and it wasn't as thick of a soup as I thought it would be.  I'll have to come back to try the oysters.
author: Jonathan M.

description: i wish there a place like this in SD. everything we ate was fresh and awesome. we started with the chowder. it was thinner than i had before but i liked it bc it allowed me to save room for more. we also dined on crab cocktail, smoked salmon with shrimp salad, and an oyster sampler. it doesn't have the best ambiance and the wait could be long but i enjoyed every morsel of my lunch. i also like that they have Stella on tap!
author: T S.

description: Great alternative to taking out of towners to Fisherman's Wharf for lunch (yes, it's only open for lunch).  Delicious crab, shrimp and oysters - just avert your eyes from your server who just put cash into the register and then put together your shrimp cocktail sans gloves.  Really...do yourself a favor and pretend it didn't happen b/c this seafood is delicious and not to mention CHEAP!
author: AngelaS F.

description: I've never even eaten here, but have always been curious what the hype is and why there is always a line coming out of the store.  Then I ventured inside to look at the menu but had to leave because the fishy smell was so overwhelming.  Prices were high and it smells in there.  I don't really have a desire to eat there anymore.
author: LT B.

description: i love love love this place. they have the very best and sweetest raw oysters. i love the seafood salad too. i love the raw cherrystone clams too. i could easily eat 80 bucks worth. its always packed and crowded so i usually get it to go. they pack it really nice and im usually already eatting them in the car when the fiance is pulling out. they only accept cash and its easy to loose track of how much you are spending. every time i go i spend about 180 for me and my fiancee. its kinda pricey but its worth it.
author: chloe w.

description: So good! Went for lunch again today and never disappoints.  The crab salad is a must, though a little more lettuce would be nice with all that crab meat! I hear the oysters are great, though I can't stomach the little guys... Everything is really fresh and the guys are really nice
author: Jaylene S.

description: Ate at the Swan Oyster Depot and have officially found a new favorite!  Yes the clam chowder is a little thin but I think it is a stylistic thing.  It's still full of flavor with lots of clams and don't forget the oyster crackers.  The conbination salad was to die for.  When I first saw it I was a little dissappointed because it was just seafood and iceberg lettuce but  then I realized that's all that was needed.  Three HUGE prawns, lots of bay shrimp and a really generous helping of fresh dungeness crab.  DELICIOUS!!!!  Plus the atmosphere is a ton of fun.  Not cheap but well worth it.  I will be going back soon.
author: Erin O.

description: So Monday was a poopy day in terms of the weather-perfect day for seafood and chowder! My roomie and I ran into a couple of our tranny friends who were more than happy to join us on our excursion (for you see even though it might have been just lunch to some people, a trip to Swan's for me is adventure for my taste buds). The wait wasn't too bad and one of the men working that afternoon was quite a comely fellow (plus once he realized that the three of us were talking about him and smiling he did a little strut around the counter so we got a meal and a show! that's right furry boy we noticed your cocky strut and loved it!) Oysters and salads and crab and shrimp cocktail are so tasty with an Anchor Steam to boot. However although I know that the counter is part of the "appeal" I will have to complain that I always always always end up either (a) getting the stool that wobbles slightly, (b) end up in that one area where you end up banging your knee cap on the tiles forcing you to sit in a faraway, awkward position or (c) sit next to a counter hog who starts invading my space and continues to glare at me while I try to squeeze my lunch into a space the size of a quarter. Despite this minor shortcoming I have to admit I always enjoy my meals here and always SWEAR I'll be back soon (but time passes by so quickly between visits although I have to admit furry boy's performance may have changed my mind....anyone want to do lunch soon?)
author: Veronica G.

description: i love that this place is family owned & run.. it feels nice to support local business.  the seafood there was wonderfully fresh. the clam chowder was bursting with clam flavor (but not "fishy" tasting), it's not thick and creamy like most places, but the clam flavor is really the highlight.  the smoked salmon was excellent.  the crab salad was also great, with generous portions of crab (at least more than i expected).  my only beef is that they use iceberg lettuce (personally i'm not a fan), otherwise it was great.  the prawn and crab cocktails weren't anything particularly special, but they were fresh.  be prepared to fork out the dough (seafood in general is not cheap).  we came late afternoon so we didn't need to wait for a seat which was great.
author: Waynele Y.

description: As original an eatery as any in the world.  Whenever my Dad comes into town we brave the wait and enjoy it every time.  Fresh mignonette on the oysters and a great crab louie make for a well deserved Anchor Steam.  Love this place.
author: daniel d.

description: come here for the fresh oysters and seafood and don't expect anything more.  great oysters and clam chowder.  be prepared to wait during peak times, as there are only 15 or so bar stools.
author: Vic A.

description: Come early cos the ravenous crowd swarms around this establishment rather quickly!!!! Great fresh seafood but relatively pricey but worth every cent u pay. It is no frills dining here and bar seating so that you can dig into the bowl of oyster crackers and addiitonal butter pats if u need to :). We had the clam chowder...ooo...powerful taste. I love how it is not a creamy overdose and it packs sooo much clam flavor that I am dreaming of it right now as I recall it. We had 1/2 dozen oysters and it was sooo sweet and fresh! And you must absolutely get the combination salad - with huge prawns, huge chunks of dungeness crab meat and sprinkled generously with baby bay shrimp YUM YUM YUM and dunk it into the cocktail sauce and enjoy it! The only thing that was a put off at this place were the stinky rags that they leave on the bar...but it is still not daunting enough to stop us from coming back!
author: Topazskye L.

description: i've been here, you've been here, its so small we've probably all been here together.  but in this weather there's nothing nicer than oysters and this is the only place worth having them.
author: Nora B.

description: Love, love, love seafood and this place is so awesome! The seafood is so fresh.. the oyster.. yummm! I have always had my oyster grilled and never had fresh oyster before because I thought that it was going to be gooey and yacky, but it was awesome with lemon and soy sauce or tabasco! Ahhh! can't get enough of it! I ordered 6 mixed of variety of oyster they have, and I must say that the local oysters... have my votes!. I also had half shell clams, clam chowder (ate it with their sourdough bread and butter... it was awesome!) , and combination salad of crab, shrimp, and prawn with louie's sauce (looks and tastes like thousand island dressing)... OMG!!! it is excellent!! It was our first time ever because each time we passed the place, there was always a long line. This time we went at noon, and of course! there was a line through the See's candy store, and we waited for 40 minutes in line, but it was worth the wait!!! Just don't come hungry. If could put 4 1/2 stars.. I would.. because the only thing I don't like about this place is that they don't take charge/ credit cards and that surprised us considering that seafood is never cheap!
author: Daisy S.

description: I came here three years ago, and I STILL smile at the mention of this restaurant. The staff are absolutely friendly - you feel like you're part of the family. They're also fast and efficient. The CRAB CAKE was delicious!!! And I don't eat oyster, but I remember my parents' gloating faces.
author: Judy L.

description: always a great experience. The wait's long, but hey, it's worth it. Ask them for what's fresh and they'll give you the works.
author: Dave M.

description: great "hole in the wall" oyster bar--fresh! i thought the chowder was too salty, but love the oysters. now if only they also carried kumamotos...
author: eriin w.

description:
i'm from chicago and everytime i visited my gf in SF, we'd make it a point to get out to the swan for oysters/salad/chowder...this place is so good!  the first time i went there, a friend of my gf took us there...when we got in, we had to pin ourselves against the wall to wait for a seat.  taking a look at the place, i didn't feel comfortable at all...ugly chairs, old counter...plus, the chill from outside didn't help.  however, once we finally found a spot to sit at and got our food, i was in heaven.  i coudln't believe how good everything was.  you can tell the guys behind the counter have a lot of pride with the place.  they take their time and have conversations with you...it's like teleporting back into time or into a norman rockwell painting.  a month later, my gf and i went back by ourselves...the guy behind the counter greeted me: "back from chicago eh?"  i couldn't believe he remembered.  awesome place...only sad thing is that my gf is moving to chicago and there's nothing that compares to this place here!

recommendations: round of oysters and their combination salad (ask for dressing on the side).
author: Michael B.

description: Small place, only accept cash !!! ( warning bring lot of cash) Freash & good seafood. the staffs is very nice and funny. Oysters is awesome..soooooooo fresh.. clam chowder is so tasty.. highly recommend. warning if you go there around noon, you have to wait long line, but worth it.
author: Grace C.

description: Yummy crab salad and chowder!!!  The place is definitely small (counter spaces only) but worth waiting in line for.  Friendly servers and good portions.
author: Ai M.

description: I saw the pictures and knew what I was getting myself into but I LOVE oysters and this had such great reviews I still went for it.  I will say that the oysters were just ok but the staff was very friendly.  I don't think I'm a snob but ugh, this went beyond a hole in the wall.  It was too packed for my taste and I'm 6'1 so the stool wasn't the most comfortable esp with my legs pinned against the counter so people could get by.  So far this is all forgivable, like I said I saw the pictures and knew what I was getting myself into.  What really killed it for me was the mignonette that was served with the oysters.  I knew it was going to be a problem when I was given a container that held about 2 cups of this swill.  I won't even try to describe how bad it was but it was enough to kill the entire experience.  I wouldn't describe myself as a good cook but I've made I've made a mignonette for oysters and its about as simple as you can get.  Skip it.
author: Aaron L.

description: good friendly service, fresh oysters, great soup!
author: A C.

description: i've been coming to swan oyster for years when i'm out in SF.  looks like a diner but definitely worth the wait.  love the oysters.  seafood is great.  skip the spots down by the pier and head here instead.
author: e s.

description: I had heard about Swan Oyster and wanted to go.  Recently my brother and his wife and my son and myself were visiting in San Francisco.
